hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Tiny everything here. Small rooms, no bathroom counter space, small walkways and very slow elevator service for 44 floors. Only 2. took the stairs a couple times from the 15th floor because I didn't have time to wait any longer. On site restaurant will cost you $30 per person for a breakfast buffet that's worth maybe $15. Location is good but I will not be back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was a very clean and cosy hotel we went in January when it was freezing cold ut the hotel was so warm and was located in the perfect spot on wall street, so close to all the iconic places within walking distance the 9/11 memorial, central park and just on the next street was a tube station

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I visit New York at least twice a year and I have to say I will be staying at this Doubletree from now on. I have to say I've had a great experience even with the fact that the elevators are a little slow. I have to applaud the front desk team. They are spectacular particularly Elijah and Marcus. They were so friendly and helpful when I checked in.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was my 14th hotel stay in 2020. I've been to various hotel chains based on the city/state and its proximity to my meetings. The service provided at this hotel was superior and unforgettable. Upon arrival, my business colleague was checked in by Tina and I was checked in by Davedena. Both ladies were rather personable and professional. Davedena addressed me by my name and thanked me for being a Hilton Honors member. These things make a difference. Additionally, I appreciated the offer of a cookie and two bottles of water after a plane ride and meetings.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is located in the business district and is a few steps away from great restaurants. The front desk staff were personable and attentive. I felt like a person rather than a number. As a business traveler, I see many front desk staff. This team was superior.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Staff gave me option to move to a different room, due to a delay in getting my room ready. I decided to just wait for my room to be ready, but I should have switched. I was not told there is an ice machine right in front of my room (other hotels have told me this before) which was utilized until late at night, and there was construction in the room above mine starting at 7am. It was a business trip and I was not able to get any rest nor was I able to prepare for work in my room before going into the office.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Loved it so far and I have no 55inches that is that I see a pic in my head ou just like my sister and u are so we are still opened today to the stores of the front office of vape and I will bring you some of the front

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Based on previous experiences at this hotel, we opted to return for a third time. However, the poor attitude and rudeness of certain reception staff was disappointing when they dealt with problems that arose during our stay. Such a shame!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was in a great location, price was great, parking rate was reasonable for NYC. It was located within walking distance to 3 subway stops. The room was clean. The elevator was a little slow but there are 44 floors.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The property is not much on atmosphere, but I have stayed here many times, but for value and location, it continues to be my number one downtown choice. The rooms are NYC-tiny, but well appointed and clean. The “on-site” restaurant offers a reasonably-priced range of options (and room service), and there is a small fitness center that gets very busy (though if you are there before 6 AM or after 8PM, there is usually equipment available). 4 subway lines and the Staten Island Ferry within a 5 minute walk.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Was in town for a business trip to a client site located in SoHo, the Double Tree was a little farther than where I originally wanted to stay, but the R & W Subway line was actually right across the street; so getting to the client site was a quick 15 to 20 minute subway ride. Another 15 to 20 minutes and you're in Midtown Manhattan.The Double Tree is also literally down the street from Battery Park where you can catch the ferry over to Liberty/Ellis Island and is in walking distance of the World Trade Center & 9/11 Memorial (or another short Subway ride on the R/W).As for the hotel stay, - The goodLoved the city view from my room.Warm Cookies available at the front desk - comfort food.All staff -- front desk, support, restaurant -- were courteous, attentive, and quick to respond to all requests; they made the Double Tree feel like home during a challenging business trip.Tip: Fastest responses to questions and requests were via the text message feature in the Hilton Honors AppDinner at Antica Ristorante next door was excellent - a bit pricey, but I really enjoyed my meal. Quite a few restaurants/eateries within walking distance, so you have options.- The acceptable The room was a bit on the smallish side, and I had to crank the thermostat at times to keep it comfortably warm during a cool to cold week, but hotel staff was quick to supply a blanket upon request and all was good.Bed was too soft for my taste as I have a preference for something firmer since an auto accident long ago, but that's just me.Elevators - Could be a tad bit slow at times. I was there for nearly a week, and two of the three elevators were always working with one elevator not available from time to time for one or two days. However, I was on the 35th floor (by choice), so I knew to pack a little patience during those "busy hotel" times.The breakfast buffet was good -- a bit pricey for the available options scrambled eggs, sausage/bacon, pancakes, oatmeal, fruit/cereal/breads (menu is also available). Dunkin Donuts and Starbucks are just around the corner, so additional options are within walking distance - The tad bit strangeAfter my reservation was made, I read a few reviews mentioning issues with bed bugs, and on an early day back from a client visit, there was a small gathering of people in front of the hotel dressed as...bed bugs? with signs -- Ok, I personally did not have any problems with bed bugs at this hotel, but - that happened.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I recently stayed at Double Tree that’s located in the New York Downtown area. To start, my stay at The Double Tree included excellent service. Staff was very welcoming and showed professionalism. But I do have a major complaint regarding my room, which was the bed bug that I found crawling on a pillow on the bed at 2am.  When I first seen the bug I mistook it for a possible roach, which isn’t good either. But after a closer inspection, I realized that it was in fact a bed bug. I took a few photos and videos. I checked and packed all my belonging and went to the front desk to complain. Although I planned to check out early this morning, I was still giving another room for night. But I am still not convinced that it’s not throughout the other rooms. Which is why I choose not to sleep on the bed. Don’t do it lol

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms are very small a matter of fact the tv is larger then the room and hard on the eyes to watch. And the elevators are very slow for 40plus story building this hotel is set up very strange the check in is on the second floor there’s no lobby to speak of you two cookies at check in and that’s it no extras

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Reception staff were friendly & helpful and the free cookie was appreciated.. The room was small but very clean. The hotel does not offer breakfast, but there are plenty of places nearby to get it. The hotel was very convenient to several metro stations ie Bowling Green, South Ferry etc & also close to the free ferry to Staten Island. The only complaint we had, was the 4 lifts to service the number of rooms in the hotel, but the staff did tell us that the lifts are about to be upgraded. We had never stayed in this area before, but thoroughly enjoyed it & would consider it again next time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed for a week in business in the financial area. Terrible service, unfriendly front desk staff when checking in after 10pm.Major construction project with a lot of noise and limited elevators which take forever to get.Room were terrible, either too hot or too cold. Water for shower was too cold.Terrible musty or smoker smell in the room. Thin windows could hear everything on the street below.Restaurant attached has the worst breakfast and very costly.Ashamed it is associated with the Hilton .

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Nice team in a quiet and clean hotel. Near staten island ferry, wall street and charging bull.Subway whitehall and bowling green at few meters to go up or downtown and Brooklyn.Discover Manhattan by boat with staten island ferry for free. Amazing pictures...

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The worst experience i have had in my 30 years of international traveler.If you are an international traveler do not stay at this hotel, they will not return your guarantee deposit.The attitude of receptionists is terrible.And the elevators are not sufficient for the number of rooms.If you are looking for a nice, reliable and functional stay, look for another option.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Tina and Dominique were amazing!!! Tina made sure we were well accommodated and they gave us amazing service! They went out of their way to make sure we were happy and we are thankful for that!! We would definitely come back and stay at this Double Tree by Hilton!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Second time at this hotel, visiting family in NYC. Very accommodating and staff very helpful. I would definitely stay here again. The location was extremely convenient for walking to restaurants etc. The room was just right for me.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Everything was good and nothing to complain. Was very close to my IELTS exam center. It took just 5 minutes for me to reach the exam center. I would suggest my friends as well to try out this Hilton. Great

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was in New York for work, spent two night here. Very easy, accommodating, great location, excellent value. The staff and other guests were friendly. Subway and good restaurants and coffee all nearby.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel prices for an average hotel in NYC can be as pricey as an upscale hotel in other areas of the U.S. The DoubleTree by Hilton downtown on Stone Street hits the mark with clean rooms, friendly staff and well-located in the finanical district with at 3 major subway lines in walking distance to the hotel, tons of shopping at WTC Brookfield and restaurants/bars. Be wary that the financial district is a ghosttown on the weekends - though, if you don't mind a little longer of a walk or taking a subway to other areas of the city, this is a great hotel for the budget-minded traveler. Be wary that the rooms are TINY as you would expect for NYC, river views exist on the higher floors but they are obstructed, the gym is clean but small and there is not bar, lounge, or any other amenities.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I found a great deal online. i was giving great customer service by the staff and the cookies were great. Thr hotel was clean and very spacious. The room was simple n clean which j liked very much i would recommended it to anyone for the price that i paid

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Arrived late afternoon after a long flight and check in was a breeze. The front desk personal was really kind and professional. I also got a cookie, which I was told was complementary and free throughout my stay (nice touch). I got the keys to my room which was located on the 30th floor, overall a nice room with all the amenities that you need and the most important thing, a comfy bed! View wasn't the best, nor the worst. One downside was the noise coming from the hallway, the door didn't seem to have good soundproofing at the bottom. Overall a great stay and I can really recommend this place!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Outstanding in every way. Staff was extremely friendly and quick. Even maintenance and housekeeping staff we met in the elevators were kind, happy, and welcoming. We were able to store our luggage securely until check in time as we arrived in the city many hours early.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We were booked to stay at this hotel for 5 nights over the new year period. The location of this hotel was perfect for us having previously stayed uptown on our last visit. Walking distance to the brooklyn bridge, battery park, 9/11 memorial and plenty of shops and restaurants.Walking distance to all subway lines and the hop on hop off buses station.Check in was quick and easy, they do put a hold of $250 on your card incase you incur a charge during your stay. Id read a lot about the lifts in this hotel and was dreading it a bit, on a short break I did not want to waste time waiting around for lifts however, the only time we had to wait a little longer than expected was on check in due to how busy it was. Not once for the rest of our stay did we wait more than a minute, we were on the 8th floor though so that might have helped.10/10 for the housekeepers, room serviced, cleaned and fresh towels everyday, very happy and impressed with this after reading some previous reviews!On to the room itself - quite small for two people, especially when the ironing board was out but we did not spend much time in there so not problem. Couple of drawers were hanging off and not useable but we only had a few bits as it was a short stay so we didnt mention it. TV was great, bed really comfortable and the shower was always hot, perfect. So why the 4*? Unfortunatly this is mainly down to inconsiderate guests. I think there is 10 rooms per floor, Therefore all rooms are near the lift and the door to use the stairs. We could hear the 3 lifts, we could hear talking, shouting, singing (fair enough at a reasonable time but im talking 3/4am). Paper thin walls. When a door was opened in any room on the floor the walls in our room shook as the door slammed shut, which was often. The door for the stairs was even worse and that was next to our room. So thats all that let it down for us, so pack some ear plugs!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Pros: Good location, friendly staff, free bottles of water. Cons: Room was small (as expected in downtown Manhattan), somewhat run down and had fruit flies/bugs in the bathroom. Unacceptable: Hotel restaurant where HH breakfast is served has a C Heath grade. Very rare to see such a low heath grade, unacceptable for a hotel restaurant.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good hotel close to the subway into the centre of manhatten,time square etc,food place accross the road,we used that a couple of times,we did find staying in nyc expensive,as we normally only do day there ,as we have family that we stay with in conneticut,there is a deli nearby which was good ,cant remember the name of it,drinks are expensive in the bars,$40 for a bottle of wine,we found a wine store nearby wine about $14 upwards depending what you want,if using the subway for more than 1day buy a ticket for more than that its cheaper.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel conveniently located next to the multiple subway lines and breakfast options. The hotel has apparently not been refurbished for a while and a couple of things in the room were broken but nothing you would really care about and acceptable given an attractive rate. The long delays with the lifts that some have mentioned did not materialise for us ... just once out of a dozen uses did we have to wait more than 2 minutes. My biggest criticism or suggestion for improvement would be the bedding ... we had a sheet on top of a naked duvet on top of another sheet which is just weird. It may be a bit slower for the room maids but a duvet should have a proper duvet cover.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed for a long weekend. The location is good, easy access to the metro and wasn't a problem reaching from JFK.Lots to see and do around the area.The rooms are huge, but it was extremely good value considering you are in Wall Street. Elevators can be a bit slow at peak times... might be worth considering a lower floor.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hilton Financial District NYC. Excellent Choice. Great location, friendly staff, clean and nicely furnished. Breakfast had many choices and was good way to start your day. Very quiet. Safe neighborhood and easy walk to Starbucks and subway.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: For clarity, the employees at the counter and ground floor were incredible. They were very courteous and professional. However, out of a 4 night stay, our room was only cleaned and serviced once. Despite our request to have someone clean the room on the 27th, no one came to clean the room. We had ordered Chinese food on the 26th and as such, we had food garbage which needed to be cleaned. We had to deal with 2 days of food garbage in the room. We also had no more space to use the garbage bins and we had no towels as a result of the lack of house keeping. It was the biggest disappointed coming to a hotel room with garbage which wasn't cleaned and the scent of food because no one took out the garbage, it was disgusting. Out of the years I have traveled and stayed in hotels, I have never had a hotel neglect their customers in this manner. Its poor hospitality with a clear disregard for their customers. When you book a hotel, especially in New York City, you are spending a tremendous amount of money. Within the price you pay, you are also paying for your room to be serviced (house keeping), so its reasonable to expect your room to be cleaned, to be provided with fresh towels and have your garbage cleared. None of which happened here. 4 nights and house keeping just came once. I always go out of my way to tidy the room before we leave in order to make it easier on the house keepers, mainly because I think its rude to keep a room a mess for house keeping. The most basic house keeping was non existent, what a disappointing stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed here at the beginning of December. The hotel was decorated nicely for the holidays. The room and bathroom were both very clean. The staff were very friendly. The hotel is in walking distance to restaurants, sites and the subway. No complaints here.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The 2 out of 3 slow, tiny elevators that were working were completely incapable of transporting people through 45 floors with 10 rooms per floor. We started our trip on the 29 floor, got tired of taking the stairs up and down 28 floors, and changed rooms to the 5th floor. We would wait at least 10 minutes for the elevator and if it came within that time frame it would be completely full every time since there were always people waiting for the elevator on every single floor. The AC Unit in our room on the 5th floor would not work and would automatically revert to cooling at 72 degrees after a few minutes of operating at whatever temperature was set. The engineer replaced the fan in our AC unit but was unable to fix the reverting issue and we resorting to sleeping with the window open- in NYC, you can imagine how loud it was.The 2 front desk staff were overwhelmed with the workload that was placed on them (granted, the stay was at what I am sure is a peak time in the tourism season), and the hotel was obviously under staffed.the interactions I had with them were unpleasant, but I completely understand why they would be predisposed to unpleasantness given their working conditions. The room amenities were very nice though. Tiny, but that is NYC.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Team was awesome! Friendly and went out of their way to make our special overnight in NYC special.. great location close to subway.. with quick access to uptown.. or southern Manhattan attractions! Signature cookie was a extra special treat!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Rooms are smaller, but not too small. I was happy with the size.The room was very clean. I did not score higher because the hot water takes some time to warm up in the shower, and the sliding bathroom door was very stubborn (they repaired the latter the morning after we reported). We lucked out and our room was on the top floor. Even if we had not had a room on the top floor, if you have a north-facing room, you will have nice views. (I am not certain about rooms facing other directions.)It is a short walk to a subway line to get up north to the tourist spots. The subway ride takes 20-30 minutes. I would stay here again. This was a simple and easy place to stay and was worth the price.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Room was small, but clean and nice. I assume almost all New York hotels rooms are small. Service was excellent, no issues. I would stay at this hotel again. Good location for easy access to subway, restaurants, and tourist things.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The Double Tree always provides great services. My boyfriend and I arrived an hour earlier than our check-in time but the staff already had our room ready! All staff members we ran into were nothing but friendly. The room was very clean and the noise level in the hotel was quiet. Even after check out they allowed us to keep our luggage in a secure place until we were ready to leave the city. I could not be more satisfied with our stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We come to NYC quite frequently, as well as travel and this was our worst hotel experience EVER.My young daughter had a big audition, and my father in law was nice enough to spend almost $1,000 between train and hotel for us to be able to get there and relax for her to do her best job.The train ride was wonderful, but I knew we were getting in early so I called the night before to inquire about early check-in. They told me to call in the next morning, which I tried to while on the train and they had me on hold for over 10 minutes...we were almost there, so I figured I'd just inquire once we got there.We booked the room on the Hilton app, and it required our payment information so my father in law gave me his card info. NOWHERE on the app, or the confirmation e-mail did it say that we needed to bring the card physically for payment. When we arrived, we were told that we had to have the card physically present, and of course since my father in law didn't come with us, we had to get him to drive 20 miles round trip into his work to print and complete an authorization form with copies of both his card and ID, front and back.The front desk person never got his e-mail reply, so had to call him back and got him to text the photos to me. The attendant said that wouldn't work. I asked her if I could print it on site, she said she couldn't guarantee it would suffice. Tried to connect to WiFi to print, but of course I didn't have a room yet, so I had to go back and ask for the password to print. FINALLY got it printed, she went away for 10 minutes then came back and said it needed to be provided 24 hours before check-in.At this point I am LIVID, so she said she would not charge us for the room that day, but rather the next to satisfy the 24 hour rule. I had to give a physical card for the incidentals though, which posed another issue. What should have been $50 held, on my bank account it showed SIX DoubleTree debits @ $50.00 each...so $300.00!!! Because of this, I was unable to use my debit card during our trip...thank GOD I had cash.Two hours later and almost missing the audition...the only reason why we were there, we got a key to a room. There's 44 floors and only 3 elevators so it took 20 minutes to finally get up to the room.We made it to the audition and coming back I was insistent on not eating at their restaurant (we paid $60 for lunch while waiting for the above to get figured out...one $13 house glass of wine and two appetizers) so we grabbed Chipotle. My own fault for not checking, but they didn't give us silverware, I ordered a burrito bowl. Realized it after waiting the 20+ minutes to get to our room, and I was not going to waste another hour going back down and up to get one.I called room service to see if they'd send a fork, and they said they could but would have to charge us the 10% room fee. Insanity! Called the front desk and they happily obliged. An HOUR later, I finally got my fork.After we showered and tucked in for the night, I received a phone call to my room. It was the front desk letting me know that for some reason, they tried to authorize my father in laws credit card and it declined. I called him, and he was unable to reach his credit card company to see what was going on. He told me to have the hotel call him and he would provide another card. The front desk said that was unacceptable and if another card was used, he would have to go through that whole process again with the authorization form and the copies. How do businesses pay for rooms for their employees?!Thankfully he was able to get in touch with the credit card company, and same as my debit card, the reason why it was declined was because there was a fraud alert since there were 4 debits from DoubleTree at $50, $100, $150 and $200. They did whatever was necessary to make the card be authorized, but WHAT A NIGHTMARE.Still livid, the next day I called Hilton to let them know of my experience and the person on the other line was a total idiot. He kept thinking I was not in my room yet and tried to connect me with the front desk, which of course at this point were the last folks I wanted to speak with. I then e-mailed my concerns and was basically told that was just their fraud policy and sorry about it. So much for their "Care" guarantee about doing whatever is necessary to make everything right! Nothing about this hotel visit went right.We didn't get much sleep as the room we had didn't have blackout curtains, just sheer ones and the bright city lights shined right on through. I didn't want to spend $14 on pancakes for my daughter for breakfast so we escaped that awful place and experience the second we woke up, and will NEVER go back again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The wife and I visited NYC for the first time, spent 5 great nights based out of the Double Tree, Stone St. Room provided was a Hilton Honours room, easily enough space for the two of us for the length of stay. Decor was to a reasonable standard, maybe in need of a refresh but nothing major and everything functioned as it should. We had room 707 which sadly gives you a view of the back of the hotel and the 'garbage truck' did disturb my wifes sleep during the first night. Room higher up with a better view would have been fantastic, but you can't have everythingI guess! Staff all very professional, polite and accomodating to any request made of them, maybe I should have asked for a change of room? We didn't eat in the on site restuarant as too many other places to eat in NYC. We used the 'air train' and subway to get from JFK to the hotel and this was very easy and if you get the right train the nearest subway station is a hundred yards from the hotel - be aware that it DOES NOT have elevator so you will have to carry any luggage up/down to the platform etc. If we visit again I would happily stay here again!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Street entrance too small upon arriving.Wait time for elevator is too long so took 3 flights of stairs with your luggage which wasn't cool. Cookies were great for my kids though. Wish street entrance was bigger

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Don’t believe me? SEE PIC BELOW. This is unacceptable and absolutely DISGUSTING . My gf HAS ZERO TOLERANCE to cockroaches and I made sure I booked what I thought was a 4 star hoteL TO AVOID THIS. Now I’m here consoling my gf who is unable to go to bed after seeing the cockroach next to her toothbrush. I paid extra money during a busy weekend in nyc for this place and I cannot believe that a hotel of this size is this FILTHY. This is on top of the fact that there’s a door that connects our room to the one next door and we can hear EVERYTHING! The elevators on top of that is a 10 minute wait during peak hours. Im so annoyed and embarrassed in front of my gf that something like this can happen at an upscale hotel. Avoid this place at all costs. PLEASE!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Arrival was a bit rough, since my room was not ready. Otherwise the staff has been friendly throughout and very helpful during my one night stay. The room had a decent size and the amenities where just right. All was clean and I was able to store my bags for a couple of hours - all-in-all I`ll be back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Maybe my standards are too high but the room i was in was not as clean as you would.expect for the price point. Be prepared to take the stairs or wait forever for an elevator in thee morning. Bring earplugs.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: the rates were perfect and the front desk person and other employees were great and always eager to help. had a great experience. would highly recommend and would reserve to stay at the same location again if need be

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: It is the first time that we stayed at this hotel and we will be very happy to stay there again soon. Helpful and attentive staff. Great breakfast variety. Please consider adding a mini fridge to the rooms to keep bottles of water given to HHonors members and prescriptions such as insulin at an adequate temperature. Thanks!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff were friendly and the beds were super comfortable but the pillows could be a little softer but the hotel is in the lower part of Manhattan which worked good for us because we spent most of our time in lower Manhattan

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: actually i hesitated to stay in this hotel because of 3,5 rating. I only stay here 3 nights. And i spent other 4 nights at other hotel which got 4 points of rating. Guess what? This hotel perform far better than the other hotel in NYC. This hotel return all of my deposit (50usd per night) unlike other NYC hotel. Very clean. Staff perform enough friendly. The only downside of this hotel was the lift. Lift actually perform quite fast, but since the hotel have so many floor, i think 3 lifts was not enough especially during check out time. But since im in no hurry because im in NYC for holiday, not for business purpose. Its not a very big deal for me. If this hotel receive higher rank, i definitely gonna stay here for a whole of my NYC trip. Come on guys. Give honest review!!!Pros-Good location, just 2 train line from JFK airport-Near 9/11 and lot of food, bar n cafe-hotel very clean and quite new and smell nice-bonus cookies was delicious-tap water quality okayMinus-lift not enough to accomodate 30++ floorsDefinitely stay here again for next NYC trip

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I can't say enough about how great my stay was this Fall!! The team was just awesome!! Quantaisha made us feel like we were at home!! The place was clean, the staff friendly and bent over backwards to help us out, the location was perfect and near all the subway stops we needed - I mean, you can walk three minutes and get on the line to Yankee Stadium- what could be better!! I already can't wait to stay here again!! But the staff take the cake. They know how to treat people and make them feel special!!! Nothing but love for them!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for a late party right near our office. The hotel is very conveniently located in the Financial District, Stone Street has some nice pubs / bars, but it is a bit quiet after hours and on weekends as this is not the tourist district at all. The hotel was quiet, each floor has 10 guest rooms, the rooms are typical NYC compact, but well appointed with nice linens, comfortable beds and towels. The front desk staff was very pleasant and overall a very nice place to stay. Close to Wall St, Delmonico's Steak House, the Freedom Tower, Battery Park, all are within 10 minutes walking from the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was initially very impressed with this hotel - the rooms were clean (although a little dated), beds were comfy and the check-in was good. The pleasant experience stopped there. Someone had used the ice machine in the middle of the night, and it proceeded to make a massive amount of noise for over an hour. After complaining to the hotel staff at 3am, I managed to negotiate a discount (after declining the initial offer for Hilton rewards points). The staff did handle this very well, which was much appreciated, but the lack of sleep completely ruined my stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location, very friendly staff at check in, very considerate of my requests. I couldn’t stop sneezing when I got into the room which was weird. It was nice and comfy - I would book again for sure. Thanks for the warm cookie

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I've stayed in a few DoubleTrees and unfortunately this one does not have the slightly nicer feel that many of them do - it's a very simple NYC hotel with no frills. The rooms are larger than average in the city and have very comfortable beds and everything you need for a good stay. In the winter the heating works very well but it is quite noisy.I would have the same complaints as some others here about the lifts - they take forever and are definitely not enough for a hotel of this size! Staff were pleasant and helpful. I didn't eat here so can't comment on the food. There is a Dunkin' around the corner for morning bagels and some other fast food chains nearby. Very close to 3 different subway lines which is convenient for getting uptown. Walking distance to the South Ferry/Battery Park tourist areas. Good option if you get a good deal on price and don't mind not being in the buzz of it all.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here over the weekend and really enjoyed my stay. The hotel is right in the heart of the financial district and also very close to two large subway stations. A few 100 metres from the famous charging bull. The room was nice and had everything needed and was very clean. No issues recommending this hotel and would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Dated and overpriced rooms and poor concierge service. Not what could be described as a prime location and very expensive for what you get. Paid 2 x price of similar hotel in Midtown. Also no concierge was there at busy departure time

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Location is in lower Manhatten near Wall Street and Ferry, 40 + stories of rooms, have 3 small elevators that are slow, I mean turtle like. Stairs are an option, I guess, for the super healthy. Rooms are small, bathrooms small, not great views.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: One of the worst hotel experiences in my lift (if not the worst). Had to wait almost 10 minutes all the time to get in to an elevator. day before our checking out the room was not even cleaned. and when i was in the bathroom a lady just came in to clean the room after i complained at 6pm!!!! The front desk was very rude specially the 2 ladies at the time of departure. I couldn't believe after charging more than 200 dollars per night and having the Hilton name the level of the hotel was unbelievably bad. I will think not twice but so many times before choosing another double tree.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is in a great location with restaurants and bars within a couple of minutes walk. Reception is on the second floor and we were greeted really warmly, rooms are a good size for NYC and nicely furnished including tea and coffee facilities and a safe. The two gripes we had were :- 1) the lifts are a nightmare as there are not enough for the hotel size. We waited 15 minutes and ended up going up to come down 2) the breakfast buffet is $30 per head an in our opinion not as good as what you’d get at a Garden Inn for half the price. We were taking a NCL cruise and the hotel is about a ten minute easy taxi ride from the cruise port.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good location close to Wall St., very few in-room amenities. Dated room that was a bit cramped, overall a satisfactory experience at best. Friendly hotel staff that accommodated a last-minute reservation.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was my second stay at this doubletree. I came last year and really enjoyed the location and staff. So when I booked a returning trip to New York, I fondly remembered this hotel and promptly booked two of my four nights here. We arrived at 7am after a redeye and had very little hope that we could check-in early. Obviously, they pretty much laughed at us and told us to come back at 4 for check-in. They did offer to text if our rooms were available sooner. I thought that was a really great gesture and excellent customer service. We return to the hotel at 330p because we had reservations we had to leave for by 4pm and were hoping to check in and change. We get to the front desk and were told that yes our rooms were ready an hour ago. We never received any texts or calls like we were promised. When I asked why, they apologized and said they must have forgot. Well gee thanks...After my last stay where I was on the 39th floor, I was grateful I was on the 9th this time. As I recalled, the elevators are really slow and I knew I wouldn't mind taking the stairs if I was on a lower floor. The room was nice but a little cramped, which is to be expected in New York. Honestly, this was a mediocre stay. Nothing bad and nothing great. I love the area and was able to get some great runs in because of where we were located. And the subway was easy to access. I was mostly happy after the rough check in up until the check out. We are waiting for the elevator at 10:50am so we can check out at the 11am check out time and move to our next hotel. There are three elevators but for some reason there is only one opening on our floor. And every time it opened it was jam packed full of people and luggage. We were patient because we knew everyone was checking out at this time. By 11:10am I am no longer patient while waiting for an elevator. My friend took the stairs since he only had a duffle bag and went to check us out of our rooms so we wouldn't be fined for a late check out. At 11:20am my other friend was sick of waiting and took his suitcase and pushed it down the stairs. I tried to wait it out and get an elevator because I had a large suitcase, duffle bag, umbrella and purse. At 11:30am I was fuming. I had wasted 40 minutes of my day waiting for a friggin elevator and could no longer sit in the hallway reading my book. I then started the trek down the 9 flights of stairs with all my luggage just as everyone else had. It took me forever as I had to keep moving out of the way of multiple other people doing the same thing. When I finally made it to the bottom, I was angry, covered in sweat and carrying a now broken umbrella because it got stuck in the stairwell. Not one employee apologized or offered to help. Just one comment when I finally made it to the bottom of "rough day huh?" I am still baffled by this experience. I made an exception the first time with the elevators but I now understand the old saying "fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me."I will not give this hotel a third try regardless of how much I love the location. The elevators are a joke and the lack of empathy from the employees is laughable. We had a much better experience at the next doubletree we checked into and only wished we had just stayed at that one the entire trip instead of subjecting ourselves to this nonsense.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is in a good location, the rooms are clean, there are not enough elevators, you need to wait a bit. Yves, the receptionist is very helpful, turn to him with any requests, he helps you. Subway is near to the hotel and you can find great restaurant nearby.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stay in Hilton? Make sure your confirmation spells out every little detail of what you paid for because otherwise they will not honor it. I stayed in this hotel the end of September 2019. It was a last minute trip and was because I wanted to go to an event on Governor’s Island. I noticed that the Hilton Hotels offered a “Stay Longer Sunday” on one of the Hilton websites it explained this meant you could stay until 6pm on Sunday. I selected a Hilton Hotel that offered this. I drove to NYC on a Friday evening. I arrived to the promised valet parking and found nobody around. Finally a man appeared downstairs and rudely told me I’d have to wait for the valets. He disappeared, finally a more mannerly individual appeared to help me, and the valets finally arrived. The room itself was ok. The bathroom is very badly designed – no shelves to put anything on so you end up having to pile everything on your suitcase outside the bathroom, the shower has a weather strip to stop the water getting out but it stops about 2 inches from the bottom of the shower so the floor was very wet. There is no bath and the shower is tiny. In the bedroom there was a drip from the AC unit – it was dripping onto the floor. All of that aside it wasn’t terrible – we got room service and the waiters were polite and the food was pretty good. The reason I wanted the stay longer Sunday was because I wanted to shower after the event on Sunday, before driving home – so on Sunday morning we went to our event and came back around noon, ate and showered. As I was showering the cleaning staff knocked on the door. My daughter answered and told them we had bought the stay longer package. I finished my shower, my daughter was showering when the downstairs staff called me – I told them I had bought the stay longer package – they told me they’d need to see that – and they’d need to see where it said until 6pm. Of course the confirmation only said “Stay Longer Sunday” (I paid more for this option) but didn’t say what time, so when I went down to show the confirmation the front desk woman she told me this didn’t prove that it was until 6pm and normally they’d charge someone an extra night for not leaving on time. At this point I needed to get back upstairs so I told her I needed to pack and this had caused myself and my daughter a terrible amount of stress. She didn’t miss a beat, was entirely unconcerned about what this did to us, the customer, she then questioned me for leaving my daughter in the room (my daughter is 12) unpleasant words followed and I returned upstairs to finish packing. Not a hint of an apology, embarrassment, No customer service concern – nothing! It was basically “Prove it” which, due to the confirmation that only stated “extended Stay Sunday” I was out of luck. Another supervisor / manager type called me shortly after I got back upstairs, she basically restated what they had already said – they had no intention of honoring what I purchased my receipt only said “Stay longer Sunday” but didn’t say until what time therefore I should have been out of there by 11am. I actually had no intention of staying until 6pm – I had a long drive back – but I was hunted out of the room. I am a middle aged, professional woman. I am quite sure I have never been hunted from anywhere before – it was a really awful experience. Not only did I not get any form of an apology – they stuck to their guns and let me know I could have been charged for the extra time. A few days after I got back I started a chat with their customer service – and was expecting based on this chat – that they would contact me and apologize. Nope! Not one hint of that. They had multiple opportunities to make this right and opted instead to not do that. I understand that it’s tough to get staff right now – but Hilton really needs to do better than that.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: One of the better value options in NYC for our dates. Great positio in financial district. Perfect for the ferry over to DUMBO for lovely dinner options. Hotel had limited lifts which could be a probelm for higher stores. Arranged a taxi for us to the airport. Rooms were clean and well maintained.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was a nice property. Rooms are pretty tiny. The Employees were all very nice and accomodating. We were there for a wedding in the area and not at all familiar with where we were. The employees were very helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great views, great location, but a bit pricey for a simple room. Had one issue where we asked for a crib and it wasn't there in the room, and when the brought it to the room they just left it there and didn't set it up or open it. Otherwise the front staff were excellent.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was fine, but needs renovation and care. It's in a good location but the elevator is VERY slow, the rooms are dated and worn out, and staff were only just ok. The heating and cooling didn't work properly in my room, waking me and keeping me awake more than once.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If you’re looking for a lovely hotel to stay in, this should absolutely be one of your top picks. The location to midtown/manhattan is quite a trip but if you’re going to enjoy the lower side of manhattan you’ll love it. It’s practical to get to the subways and the lovely flower shop on 44th as well! I do have to say the room was a lot smaller than what the photos entailed, the lobby was lovely and if you get a higher floor it’ll feel incredibly lovely. The walls are thin so be careful what you do! It felt like a very snug hotel overall. If you’re a Hilton Honors member use it to your advantage! They give you a warm delicious cookie at check in There are three elevators and I’m assuming we visited during the off season - but I can’t imagine what it’s like when it’s busier. You’ll have a bit of a wait if you’re on the higher floors to get an elevator but that’s not anything the staff can control. The front desk attendants at all times were lovely and checked in with you if anything was wrong. If you want to use the digital key option you won’t be able to - you mind as well just go straight to the front desk anyway.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Had a great stay, loved the location and staff was great. Anna and Marissa were very helpful with providing directions and recommendations. Quiet location which is great and easy access to subway and bus stops. Hotel isn't fancy but it will do especially since the prices here are very reasonable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hopton is an amazing Concierge! I know him for a long time, he always is very friendly and kind!!! The best guy ever!!Everytime when he is downstairs he helps all the people! He knows everything and he is the most helpful guy i ever met.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The room was very clean, we got a king sized bed but it definitely seemed more like a queen. My boyfriend is 6’3 and his feet were hanging off the bottom of the bed. There are some restaurants and bars in the area but a lot of the places to get food that weren’t sit down seemed to be closed on weekends and only open for the people who work in the area during the week. The staff was nice, getting an elevator to the room was a little tricky as there’s only three for the pretty large hotel, was much easier and quicker leaving your room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If you are looking for a place to in the center of the financial district, then this property would be absolutely fine. The rooms are apt for one or two people and are very comfortable to stay in. A number of people have talked about the lifts, but you can easily overlook that by taking a 5-10 minute buffer during peak hours. The staff is friendly and courteous. I would have expected more from the buffet but with the limited options available, the taste was absolutely fine.A decent option to stay in given the price range.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I got in and completed pre check in around 9am, got my room at 410pm. Mattress had a big depression, one guest slept on the floor with bedding provided from downstairs as rooms are sold out and no cost available. Faucet is broken and coming out the wall. I understand this is New York and space is limited, but two elevators for a hotel with 40+ floors is horrible. Not to mention trusting the brand and paying approximately $400/‘night. Would’ve been better off staying at a Hampton inn

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great experience overall. Two great friends traveling to NYC for fun and relaxation. We slept great, only issue was the hot water which took too long to warm up. However, the staff were great and attentive.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: When booking this hotel, I didn't expect greatness. I did a lot of research before coming to NYC; as I do on any vacation and I expected a small; unspectacular room. What we got was a very nice, well equipped room and a very comfortable bed. The view was great as well. Although I couldn't see the Statue of Liberty from our room, we did have a very good view of the Upper Bay of Manhattan. The service was top-notch. Everything is within walking distance. We used the Metro Line and Big Bus Tours to get around, and all stops were close by. Even without the bus/subway to get around, there's good selection of local restaurants and such if you don't want to see the usual New York attractions. The only drawback; which was minor, is that sometimes it took a little while for hot water to reach the shower and faucet. That's the only "complaint." I can say for a vacation in NYC with that being the only drawback, we lucked out big time! When we get around to wanting to come to NYC again, I'll definitely book again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I spent a night in the doubletree for a business meeting, the hotel is located in the heart of the financial district so it’s a good choice if you have business in the area but the hotel itself needs some serious upgrading. The bathrooms especially need to be updated. The cookies at check in are a nice touch and the staff was nice but definitely time for a revamp.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The Hilton DoubleTree in the Financial district is everything you would expect from a Hilton property. The staff is friendly and alert. Room was exactly as it should be, clean and we'll put together. Breakfast on first floor was well done.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great hotel with lovely views. Walking distance to Wall Street, the Freedom Tower and the Statue of Liberty. Elevators are a bit slow. A lot of floors, so if you are travelling business or have a tight schedule to keep - choose a lower floor. Also, be mindful that the front desk is on 2 while the entrance / exit are on floor G.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Special commendation to our bellman, Hopton, for helping us get a cab after a snafu with our ride share. Hopton went out of his way (2 blocks!) to hail us a cab and help us get out of Manhattan to catch our plane. Everyone I met at the hotel was pleasant and helpful. I hope to visit there again

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have read many reviews on this hotel but as far as I am concerned, I didn't have any problems or complaints at all ! Of all the times I have stayed in NYC, this has been the best hotel I have stayed in...Very clean rooms, toilet and lobby...People complained about the slow elevators but so what if you have to wait a minute or two....It was fine....Four of the front desk people I want to compliment and I hope Hilton rewards them and they are Venetta, Anna, Dominque and Armando...These employees could have not been nicer and more knowledgeable They made the check-in and check-out experience wonderful.....I give it 5stars and will book here next time i'm in NYC
user_location: Cape May Court House, New Jersey
user_name:
mgrossner
Cape May Court House, New Jersey

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: No significant concerns other than trashy street outside, which I'm not sure the hotel has any control over. Rooms were smaller than usual in my experience at this price point,and compared to other DoubleTrees I've stayed in.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for a week in mid-September. It was an excellent choice - close to all major transport routes.There are good places to eat all in walking distance.Special shout out to Hopton - the best bellhop there is! Thanks buddy.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Only two elevators for 44 floors so at one point I waited 10 minutes for an elevator, however room and bathroom are good. The room is bigger than most NYC hotels I would say. Staff is friendly and location is good.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is in a great location in the Financial District - you can easily walk to stores, restaurants, coffee shops, the subway station right around the corner, and some NYC tourist highlights (like the Charging Bull). We came to NYC for the weekend (2 nights) to visit with some friends, so access to the subway was key so we could easily meet up with others in our group who live all over the city.Other than a great location, the hotel is very clean and the rooms are pretty standard size for a city hotel. However, the bathroom was extremely small with absolutely no place to hang a towel, so even if you wanted to be eco-friendly and reuse your towel, you don't really have the option to do so. I couldn't do my hair/make up in the bathroom because of the small size, but luckily there's a large mirror in the bedroom. The closet had ample hanging space and included a safe. No fridge to keep though. Another drawback is that the air conditioner was very loud, and if it wasn't 90 degrees out I would have opted to turn it off, as the blowing woke me up every time it started up in the middle of the night.The gym is severely lacking but it does the job. Two treadmills and one elliptical, but one treadmill was broken so that was disappointing. You seriously need to leave your room at least 10 minutes before you need to be anywhere because the elevators are SO SLOW. Like painfully slow. Another weird thing is that the reception is on the second floor and there's no one to greet you on the first floor. I found this a little unsafe, especially late at night, as anyone could wonder in off the street and go to any floor without a keycard. Overall, very average hotel. If you're only going for a few nights it's okay, but any longer probably wouldn't be pleasant with the elevator issues, small bathrooms and possible safety concerns.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very very disappointed with the customer service at the front desk. I stayed there for 9 nights and they charged the entire amount from my FX card at the time of checking in. The day I was supposed to depart, I found a debit of $150 early morning. At the time of check-out, I was told the amount will be reversed shortly. I was leaving for London and the travel card was the only mean for me to load foreign currencies. To my surprise, my card declined to function in London the next day and while examining I found that an amount of $1971.96 has been charged to my card once again which has resulted in massive inconvenience (in addition to $150 which is still not returned)I wrote back to Hilton customer care the same night (8/29) and within minutes they replied stating that I shall get a response within 3 days. Just to let you know that now it is over 7 days and one has bothered to get back to me even after multiple follow ups. Although the amounts are pending with merchant for clearance, the frustration and inconvenience caused due to the irresponsible behaviour by Hilton staff is truly deplorable.Mistakes can happen, however this amounts to tormenting if you are travelling with family and kids…. Fortunately, not my case this time. I have been to few Hilton properties in the past (Berlin, Dead Sea, Zagreb, Cairo to name a few), all were almost flawless in their service and customer care. One more thing – they didn’t offer me the hot cookies which they usually do for customers while checking in. Not a big deal…….but Hilton missing something. I will think twice next time for sure!The 2 stars are for cleanliness and location. The room was well done, spotless and spacious. The property is very close to subway stations (Whitehall and South Ferry) which makes commuting to any part of Manhattan really easy.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The guy from check-in was misleading and confusing. He asked me to pay a deposit of 50USD by credit card. After I payed, although my transaction was approved, he said that my credit card was declined and asked me to pay again the deposit with a card of one of my friends. This was not nice and very annoying ,to charge me twice. In the end he talked with his colleagues and it was not necessary to charge me twice any more.The 50 USD deposit should be discontinued. Have more respect for your customers!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Not a bad location, the lifts (3 of them) are very slow because of the number of floors and the staff / maids us them too meaning this slows the whole process down. The air conditioning unit in the room was cold, but very old and leaked the floor was wet. I had a sore throat for a couple of days.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great hotel in great location for quitew good value. Rooms were clean, no noise from outside or others rooms. Staff was very helpfull and provided all needed info. very close to ferry if you would like to visist Statue of Liberty and Ella island. For other locations, metro just couple steps away

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Room was large 2 double beds bathroom with walk in shower the room was cleaned everyday and lots of fresh towels.Plenty of wardrobe space and a coffee machine The elevators were a bit slow in arriving but it wasn’t really a big problem .The hotel is near many subways and lots of eating places near the hotel.Staff were friendly quick checkin at the reception desk the hotel is downtown nice to escape the hustle of Times Square.The hotel is 5 mins away from Staten Island ferry and battery park

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Overall a great stay! I mean, you're visiting NYC, so the room is just a place where you're gonna lay your head.We drove into the city and parked at a garage nearby. 60 bucks to park...but its NYC and sort of expected. Check in process was smooth. We got to check in early too....yay! Warm cookies with the keys! Friendly staff at Registration Desk. Stayed on the 18th floor. Room was decent size for NYC. Clean too. Queen bed....soft and comfy. I would recommend. We didnt have the elevator issues as described in previous posts....I mean, we had to wait maybe a minute or two, but nothing bad. Room wasnt as shabby as other posts made it out....maybe I'm not as nit picky.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Over all a Nice place to stay . But er har to pay 100 usd more than the add on Booking.com Said. I dont know who fault it is but i felt i didnt want to argue becouse the people in the frontdesk didnt seem very friendly .

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Clean room with a comfortable bed.It was a little strange that check in and the service desk are not on the ground floor, but it didn't present a problem. There are 40 floors so the elevators can get pretty busy.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This place is a dump. No service elevator, you will literally just stay in a hot box of an elevator for 20 mins just to leave the building. Rooms are falling apart. On day 2 of a 4 night stay, house keeping just decided not to show up. Hotel staff don't even care. Apparently they are just use to have the place get crap reviews, so why try! Ps. I am Hilton gold through Amex platnium, but if you do book direct through Hilton.com, you get ZERO of the benefits which I paid for. Stay at any place else, PLEASE!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We thought everything was fabulous. The room was great and we found it to be plenty of space for 2 people. We were super nervous about the elevators after reading reviews, but we didn't find this to be an issue. We were on the 33rd floor and I'm happy we didn't request something lower because our view of the water was fabulous. The location was nice. We had quick access to several subway stations. Our bags were held for us and retrieved quickly on check in day when we were ready. Every staff member we encountered was helpful and nice.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I arrived last night joining my other half for a few nights in the city before heading to Montauk with family. What a disappointing start to vacation. I travel for work (which is in hospitality) and have stayed in about 100 hotels in the last 12 months. This is the worst. I understand worn rooms in need of upgrades. I understand small rooms in busy cities. What I can’t understand is dirty rooms which makes the tiny, dated room feel gross.I have never in my life written a negative review but please don’t stay here. There are too many great options in the city to waste your money.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Booked this hotel through a travel agency. Price was amazing for the area! Alonzo at the front desk was awesome! He did great checking me in and attentive to anything that I needed. Hotel room was super clean and temp was good. The only complaint I had which I have already seen on here is to service the entire building of 44 floors they have 2 elevators...
user_name:
bullet0987
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: When i first seen this hotel it looked like a standard Dbl Tree Hilton so I was expecting the amenities/ service / and Facility of a dbl Tree by Hilton. NOT. Everything except for the service at the restaraunt was amazing. 1>) Lets start with my number one problem #1 Elevators....... I thought it was strange that there was people in the lobby playing spades in the lobby while waiting for the elevator. YES its that bad. My mother who just turned 71 this year was forced to take 8 flights of stairs because we couldnt get a elevator to save my life .... Or hers for that matter. We missed to rides in our uber giving ourselves a 10 min window to make it downstairs... We had to take the stairs on our last trip and then after we made it down the stairs we STILL missed our ride.The rooms were small and dingy and dusty. The lobby was fairly nice but overall i would say to save your time and money and go to the hilton garden inn right down the streeet.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel always delivers great service and value. Staff is helpful, rooms are clean, the location is fantastic for business trips in Lower Manhattan. Also a great location for family trips and vacation stays.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Check In was around 15:00 and we reached around 11:00 and yet the front staff allotted a room to us immediately winning our support. Location: ExcellentWhitehall Station opposite hotel. Battery Station a few steps ahead takes you anywhere you want to go. Bus stops just behind the hotel. Siteseeing: ExcellentCharging Bull, Wall Street, 9/11 Memorial, World Trade Center and Statue of Liberty walkable distance.Restaurants: Excellent Chitpolte opposite hotel with cheap Tacos, Burritos, Marketplace offering takeaways, Dunkin Donuts, Potbelly and other great eateries around and even a great Bar/club in front of the hotel.Will recommend it 100% to all who want to visit either leisure or business.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have just spent 3 nights at the Doubletree by Hilton - Financial District and I have to say that I would never recommend it to anyone. The rooms are so small and you don't even have anywhere to put your toiletries in the bathroom. The AC unit was a nightmare. It was so noisy and antiquated that it barely cooled the room and I had to use ear plugs in order to sleep. The elevators are a nightmare....only 3 serving 44 floors! The layout of the hotel is also a nightmare. Reception is on floor 2 and it's a bun fight every day trying to get from the ground to the 2nd and elsewhere within the hotel. No amenities as such. Breakfast is hosted in the adjacent restaurant. Worst Hilton breakfast ever. Not only was the choices on offer extremely limited, but the scrambled eggs where so dried up they resembled yellow cow pats. The serving dish didn't close properly, which added to the problem of the eggs drying out. The chef certainly knew about it as he kept trying to push the lid down to close it. Interestingly enough they are awaiting a food hygiene standard rating....personally I know what I would award them! The tables weren't properly set with cutlery and teaspoons had to be requested. The melon wasn't ripe, the things that looked like a scone could be used as paving bricks. It all seriously yuk, apart from the bananas which had not been tampered with. On a positive note, the coffee was quite good. All in all it is a fairly rubbish hotel located in a good area. Best it's demolished and rebuilt. Would I recommend it to anyone....no, unless I really disliked them.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location of this hotel is great, with a station for the R and W trains on the same block, and access to the 1, 4/5/6, and Staten Island Ferry nearby. I also found the staff friendly and was pleased with the housekeeping service. However, the main room was tiny, with only a narrow passageway around the perimeter of the bed. And the bathroom was small as well, with no counter space to speak of - and I travel light. All of this could have been OK - it's NYC after all, there's no need to spend a lot of time in a hotel room. But I'm a very tall guy, so when I book a Cityview King Room - and the view of WTC was great from the 40th floor - I think it's reasonable to expect a Standard King mattress, not what I have determined to have been what is referred to as an "RV Short King" mattress. My 79" height belongs on a standard Queen or King mattress, with 80" in length, not the 75" RV short king. And I checked the Hilton website to be sure and, no, this non-standard mattress is not disclosed in the description of the King room. It says there's a 32" TV, but can't be bothered to be honest about the short bed. Although the mattress and pillows were comfortable, I woke up with sore feet that didn't get proper rest from walking the streets of Manhattan because they were hanging off the end. The fundamental purpose of this hotel room - rest - was defeated by this. Don't lie to people about the mattresses in your hotel rooms.Almost as frustrating is what it took to get out of the hotel every morning. The other reviews on this site - and I read them thinking, "It can't be that bad," - are not exaggerating about the amount of time it takes to get an elevator down, especially in the busy morning hours. There are only three elevators - and small ones at that - to service a 44-floor hotel with nine rooms on each floor. Many people end up getting on an up elevator and then taking it down as that's the only way to get out of the hotel in the morning, so no matter what floor you're on, you're taking a risk at getting down to the lobby. If someone is already on the elevator with luggage because they're checking out, not only does that mean there likely isn't room for you on the elevator, but even if you can squeeze on, it's going to definitely stop on the 2nd floor - where the reception area is - rather than going straight to the ground floor. Why is that extra annoying? Because if you squeezed on a full elevator on floor 40, it's still going to stop at almost every 2 to 3 floors for other people who are calling the elevator, and you're going to have to be rude and press "door closed" to try to make it move any faster at all. Again, this sounds like an exaggeration, but it's truly a nightmare. Especially in the heat and humidity of August - the A/C is minimal, if at all, in the elevator.A friend of mine in NYC says, "You get what you pay for in New York" and this hotel proves that adage very true. It was one of the cheapest hotels to book in the area through Hilton's website, and now I know why. I prepaid for the room to save even a few more bucks, but while my credit card was charged for the prepaid room at the time I booked, and I agreed for a $50/night deposit to be put on my card as a pending charge to cover incidentals - standard hotel business - what I didn't agree to was to have my card have a pending charge for the price of the room THAT I'D ALREADY PAID FOR. When I spoke with someone at reception about this, they acknowledged it was an error that shouldn't have happened, but that there was no way it could clear until I checked out after five nights. I didn't take a trip to NYC expecting not to spend money, but to have that much money tied up on one of my credit cards for my entire stay was ridiculous and rude.I have stayed at Hilton properties all over the country and while no hotel is perfect, I have generally been able to rely on consistency throughout the Hilton brands. This hotel was a big dent in my confidence.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff was very nice, friendly, and helpful. This included the maintenance staff as well as the cleaning services staff. I usually stay in midtown, however I was traveling with work and this was the hotel they had selected. Great location to Staten Island Ferry, Wall Street, Brooklyn Bridge, 9/11 museum. The subway is very close. At night this area is not as busy making for quiet rooms. I had a nice view of the Hudson River. Restaurants are in walking distance. Nice walk to East River piers where you can find good night life and food.
user_name:
Jaywee3
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel Centrally located in the Financial District. Subway station close by, Restaurants and very walkable. Warm chocolate chip cookie during check in which I found to be very sweet. Room was clean and comfortable. I would stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is in a great location in the financial district, subway; NYSE, tourist attractions. Rooms are small and not well maintained. Would not stay here again. Find a better newer hotel - there are plenty within close distance

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very great location easy to get food and transportationGreating only first day is all about money Hospital is not ok The breakfast is bed just the need more heart in .Pay for bag even we stay for 10 day No back

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel was very clean and the staff was nice. My complaints are about environmental issues. The first thing the desk staff does when you check in is hand you two plastic bottles of water! Plastic water bottles are quickly destroying the environment, AND NYC has delicious tap water, so there is absolutely no reason why this hotel should be handing out water bottles. There are cups in every room that could be used with the tap. Also, every morning after I showered, I hung up my towels, since the little card said that they wouldn't be replaced if they were hung up. Yet, every day, I came back to my room to find that the used towels were taken and new, clean towels were left in their place. After two days, I just left the Do Not Disturb sign on my door and refused the housekeeping. What a waste of water to wash all those towels after only one use, and what a shame to make your guests think you care about the environment, when you actually don't. I strongly encourage the management to reconsider its policy of handing out plastic water bottles to all guests, and to start implementing the laundry policy that is actually advertised.
user_name:
Amy A
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great price for the location. Easy access to the subway and walking distance to Battery Park. Clean rooms and very nice common areas. Easy check in/out process and loved that we were able to get an earlier check in on our arrival date. Baggage storage was also super helpful for our departure. The rooms are a little on the small size as many reviewers have mentioned but honestly, how much time are you spending in your room when you're in NYC!? Our room was plenty big enough for myself and my husband. The only complaint we had was the elevators. During peak times (check in/out, dinner hours) you could wait upwards of 30 minutes to get an elevator which can be really inconvenient if you're in a hurry. For future visits, we would definitely request a lower floor just so we can utilize the stairs instead. Overall it's a great property and I would definitely consider staying again for future visits!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Right by the subway, take one train right uptown. A block away from the water. Really a great location to try and get everywhere in one weekend. Room was tiny. Not enough elevators to serve the amount of floors they have- long elevator wait times.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Visited this month and found the hotel to be very comfortable. Room was good size with great bathroom, and very good A/C. Lifts do take a while but this was a minor issue. Hotel’s central location for buses, ferries and subway. Plenty of local restaurants with varying prices in close proximity.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location for a family but there is only 1 room with 2 full size beds on each floor. The elevators were not too much of a hassle until it came time to check out and they were all in use and full (think of a subway car during rush hours). Housekeeping would take away dirty towels but kept forgetting to replace them?! Staff were friendly when I called each night but I’m not sure why it kept happening. Television was not secured very well to the wall and the bathroom shelf was loose so it would not hold anything. Rooms are small but I guess that is expected in New York. Food in lobby is hella expensive. You would be better off going to the Duane Reade on the corner to get snacks and drinks but it closes early so plan accordingly. Room 3904 views from room added. 5 minute walk to Bull statue, stock exchange, Federal Hall and other historic landmarks. This area is much quieter than Times Square, especially at night :) Decent dining nearby but I would avoid Murphy’s Tavern next door (loud and the food is really not that good).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Average hotel. Do not go beyond the 5th or 6th floor as elevators are in high demand. We used the stairs. Fairly comfortable small rooms with extremely loud air conditiining units. But here's the deal. For New York, it is a decent hotel with a drcent price. Close to subway?, quite doable for seeing city.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was the perfect place to stay, close to Battery Park where you catch the cruise line to the Statue of Liberty, a short walk to the 9-11 Memorial. So much to do in this area. Would definitely stay here again on a return trip.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for a business trip, whilst the location was superb, and the bed very comfortable, the big issue was that a cleaner removed an expensive umbrella from my room, and when i reported this, the attitude of reception staff was very poor, and no responsibility taken to remedy the situation. I would not stay here again as i would be unable to trust the cleaning staff with my luggage items.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms are tight but hopefully you are not in NY to stay in your room. They have a smell to them that nothing made it better. We just go used to the smell. The staff was very nice and the room was clean. Not updated. Nice size tv. Check in is on the 2nd floor. Elevators are slow. The gym on 3rd floor has nice cold water. And the cookies are hot and tasty. No microwave nor fridge in room.. but plenty of places to eat and great location for walking everywhere. Overall, it’s okay for sleeping, reminds me of a cruise room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
