review_body: Our family came to New York almost every summer for few broadway shows and we usually stayed at Times Square. This year because we wanted to see Macy’s fireworks. That’s why I booked this hotel. However it seems nothing is right with this hotel. The receptionist was not friendly, there were birds drops on the window for days. We had to asked everything in the breakfast room. Ran out of food, milk, drinks, coffee silverwares. And every time we asked the staff looked as they were being bothered. We paid for breakfast included in our booking. The foods were very standard.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel, the location and the room was nice but there are only 3 very small elevators for a 44-story hotel with probably close to 400 rooms. The wait for the elevators was awful most of the time and several times we chose to just walk down from the 15th floor instead of waiting an average of 15 to 20 minutes for the elevators.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: A great staff but horrible maintenance with poor cleaning and broken elevators and toilets. We ended up walking up and down 5 floors because of elevator shortages. The room also had a cleanliness problem with hair left over from the previous guest as a bonus

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Need better communication regarding the parking. The sign says no stopping. No valet in sight. We circled the building and called the front desk. No issues after that was resolved. The room was clean the bed was comfy the view was great. There was a dirty food tray in the hall when we arrived. Still there 2 days later when we left. Overall great experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Room was very clean and very up to date. Extremely comfortable bed. Location is perfect for everything near the Statue of Liberty and World Trade Center. The staff was friendly and we really enjoyed being able to walk to the attractions. Parking was reasonable and very close the the hotel

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stay at Hilton's pretty much exclusively because of how amazing they are and how much they care about their guests. This one was no different. The location was perfect for fiancial district and the views from our room was breathtaking. My one and only complaint is the slow elevator. You will be waiting an eternity for those tiny elevators. Doesnt help that you have to wait on the ground for the elevator to take you to the second floor to check in and then wait again for it to take you to your room. But it's a small price to pay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location was good. It is close to our office, fun restaurants, the subway, battery park, stone street. The rooms were clean, however, very small. If you had two people in the room, it felt crowded. We had to wait for elevators 5-10 minutes each time. The breakfast service was terrible.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I thoroughly enjoyed my brief stay! Your hotel is beautiful and has the best customer service and wonderful amenities. I will stay here again both on business and personal travel. I will highly recommend your accommodations!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location, comfortable beds, friendly staff!! Near some attractions and good restaurants just steps away! I came for vacations but will be back for my business meeting. Thanks for the cookies, they are always great!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The room and hotel are nice. The problem was the elevators. We waited between 6-10 minutes for an elevator to even stop at our 21st floor, and 9 times out of 10 they were packed beyond capacity when they did stop. We finally used the 20 flights of stairs carrying all of our bags, to depart.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel is not up to the Hilton brand. Staff was friendly but lobby is small crowded. Rooms are small. Too small for two people. Restaurant was not terribly good. Tired decor. Hotel is in a rather ugly area. It is convenient and otherwise good value given high prices in NYC.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Rooms are small (it is NYC of course), but overall nice. Friendly, helpful staff. Restaurant was good (again tiny) and waitstaff was very attentive. Will stay again if in NYC for business (nice walk to the office)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel itself is nice, our room was clean and comfortable. There are issues which other people have mentioned such as everything being a little cramped (which is understandable in NYC), the lack of a fridge in the rooms and the limited number of elevators leading to long waits. However, the main problem for our stay was noise from outside. We had been up since 3am travelling and really needed an early night's sleep but an open air restaurant/dance bar opposite the hotel started playing music really loudly from 5pm until past midnight. Obviously you expect a bit more noise being in NYC but this was ridiculously loud. We complained to the front desk, unfortunately we couldn't be moved to a higher room (we were on floor 16 of 44), but they did provide us with ear plugs and said that they would send over someone to ask the bar to turn the music down. Unfortunately this didn't seem to have much effect and we finally fell asleep in the early hours of the morning. We were then awoken from our unplanned but very necessary lie-in early by people using the elevators which were just outside our door. At this point we decided we couldn't face another sleep deprived night and checked out a day early. The hotel is in a very useful location and it's not their fault but it was definitely too loud at night for us.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I booked this hotel to tour my friend in NYC. We travelled from Albany and arrived in the City after a 3 hr drive. We walked around and see some places then checked in to hotel around 4pm. Relaxed and my friend was tired so went to lay down sleep, after a few minutes rests we are getting ready to get dinner or walk to town when we saw a bug. I killed it with smashing it with tissue. Now we are pissed. We get ready to go down, packed all our stuffs back to our bags ( to make this short) we brought the bug to front desk and let them know what transpired, my friend left in the room to finish packing and checking out stuffs. The front desk offered to change our rooms, I didnt make a scene and asked them to simply make it right, instead we were given a room in 14th floor with access not working. Messed up room was hot, ac not working at all. I filed a complaint and they told me it will take 72hours to respond. Well I'm only here for one night. I complained about having a full bed when they know it's two people in the room. They said no two bed so no choice, everything was full. I said did u guys check? This has stressed me so much that I can't rest since we wont fit in a the mattress so I asked for them to make this right, hot room same bed size as before, they gave me a comforter and I use that to sleep in the room that I paid for 135 USA plus taxes about 140-150 for a four star? And not even four star. I asked in my complain for refund if I will be stuck in this room. Again they apologized and said no upgrade. We will see if they refund me since overall this place has bug. We will see. I am now reviewing hotels I will get in my travels. I will update you guys about this issue and case.
user_name:
Ravenatravels
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Worst hotel I've ever stayed at. Check in was fine and was excited about the free cookie and the high floor, but as soon as I entered the room it was all downhill. There was a smell to the room that i was trying to figure out. The tv was a wall mount that couldn't stay up. It kept falling down. I noticed that the AC was leaking water. I called the front desk and was put on hold for 5 minutes with no pick up. I hung up and went down to the front desk. I told them about then issue and they said they would contact and engineer to come fix it. I went out to enjoy the city and when I came back from being out I noticed that the AC was still leaking water into the room. The floor was soaked. And I mean soaked. (Now I know why there was a smell to the room when I came in). That whole night it was a rotation of sleep, dripping water, and clicking from the AC. I could not sleep all night. The next day I was a miserable person. Not the way I thought i would be spending my vacation. I called down again and told them of the issue. They sent someone up to fix it, but the room smelled and the carpet was soaked. I went down and told the from desk and they said at first they couldn't move me because they were booked. (45 floors with approx. 10 rooms on each floor.) I found that unliking, and of course they were able to put me into another room on the same floor. I would recommend that no one stay here. Horrible rooms and bad customer service. At the very least they should have moved me immediately without any questions and offered me a refund for my stay. Instead they lost me as a future customer and I hope others hear my warning. There is other options in the city.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We came to the city to take in some Hamilton history. This hotel is so close to the things we wanted to take in: Trinity Church, Wall Street, Fraunces Tavern and more. Hotel is located very close to subway for easy access uptown. Breakfast is served in restaurant next door and there is a connecting door so you don’t have to go outside. Rooms are clean and compact but nice. Hotel is also very close to ferry terminal. Staff is quite helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If you are looking for a great hotel close to the action with the best staff and comfortable rooms, then this hotel is for you. Near Wall Street it is a stone throw away from the boat to Liberty Island and multiple subways

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very happy overall with this hotel. We chose it due to location, being near where we needed to be. Cheaper than similar ones up in Midtown so it was a good option for us. Staff were friendly and room clean. Rooms a bit smaller than expected and the lift/elevator system was a bit overwhelmed around the checkout time (this is perhaps due to the reception being on level 2 so guests are constantly going from ground level to 2 and restricting the service to upper floors). View from upper rooms fairly decent and you get capsules of milk in the room unlike some other hotels in NY. There's a restaurant on the premises serving Italian food in evenings, quite decent. Would stay here again for a low-mid price option in Manhattan.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Everything was great and the value was awesome. I would definitely stay here again. Staff was very friendly and offered recommendations of local places to eat and directions for using the public transportation system.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Pros: service was prompt and courteous, snacks upon arrival were appreciated as were the breakfast vouchers for the room downgrade, room was clean, love the location - pub and pharmacy around the corner and short walk to Wall St bull and to the Pier at which there is a great view of the Statue of LibertyCons: very narrowly built, felt crammed, all double rooms were right in front of elevator door so we could hear foot traffic which was disruptive when sleeping, no mini fridge in room

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The water was turned off from 10 pm to 4 am. When I expressed my dissatisfaction with the front desk, I was given bottles of water. Did not know what to do with the water. Someone had to explain. Paid too much to have to replenish my own toilet water.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was a great little hotel right at the end of Manhattan. It is easily accessible via a number of subway stops and a short walk to the Staten Island ferry. It is a short walk to Wall street, Bowling Green and the Bronze Bull and within walking distance to the Freedom Tower and the 9/11 Memorial. There are awesome restaurants all around and really trendy bars. The hotel was decent with a comfy bed and all you would need for a short stay. The only thing that was really annoying during our stay was the elevators. Me and my partner were on the 19th floor and during busy times it took FOREVER to get an elevator. With only three lifts, it would be full by the time it reached our floor. We would often take the stairs in the morning.I would consider getting a room on a lower floor if I were to come back for another trip.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location is very good, but at the time of my visit, Stone street was very dirty due to a nearbye street festival.The hotel has no reception at the ground level,the reception is at the second floor. But the elevators were extremely busy and slow. So I had to wait a long time before being able to even go with my suitcase to the second floor. There is no refrigerator in the room, no water to drink. The hotel is an expensive dormitory.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Minuses:- poor breakfast- high price in comparison with other hotels of this net (in other cities)- not properly working air conditionerPluses:- personnel- easy to find, near the subway- good placement for sightseing- very clear rooms and bathrooms

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Loved our stay to bike the 5 Boro Ride. Excellent location for start and finish of ride. Hotel staff was super friendly and accommodating for all the cyclists staying there. Felt very welcomed! Would definitely stay again!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Staff was extremely professional, courteous and friendly. It was a very busy weekend and the Doubletree team did everything in their power to keep a full hotel happy and moving. Great job!!! I would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a great hotel if you're planning on doing the lower Manhattan tourist attractions. Less than 1 mile from Wall Street, World Trade 1 and ferry to Liberty and Ellis Islands. We were able to walk everywhere. Subway station 2 blocks away for a 10 minute ride to Times Sq. Only downside was extremely long elevator rides and noisy housekeepers.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel was packed for weekend. Checked in at 5 pm, and waited 20-25 mtes for an elevator. 3 small, slow elevators with barely enough room for people and their bags. Bellman couldn't find luggage being held for afternoon. Not impressed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Our stay in this hotel was great - all of our dealings with staff were very positive and they were always helpful and friendly. The location is perfect with many subway lines only a few minutes walk away. There's plenty of bars and places to eat nearby. Close walk to Brooklyn Bridge, Chinatown, Soho and more. We will definitely return and I would recommend to travellers who want to be away from the 'madness' of uptown Manhattan.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is in a prime location. Easy walk to restaurants and shops. Rooms were okay; very clean which is most important to me. Be advised that the back side of the hotel overlooks a cemetery. This is not a good option for someone who is terminally ill or has recently lost a loved one. I recommend that you ask for a different view.David at the front desk was incredibly helpful and accommodating. Honestly, David was one of the top employees that my family has ever had the pleasure of dealing with at a hotel. He was incredibly attentive to every person's needs. We spent several hours conversing with family in the lobby following a family wedding. All of us were very impressed by David's pleasant greeting of every guest who arrived in the hotel that evening.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Near Wall street and the Staten Island Ferry located near the Freedom Tower. Lots of great shopping and restaurants really close by. The people at the hotel are great guides and can help you find whatever you want. The rooms up in the tower have great views. Great place to stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel was great, at the top of the road is Whitehall street subway and less than a 5 minute walk away was south ferry station, so was really easy to get to places such as Times Square but out of the way of all the crowds!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is perfect for those that wish to walk around lower NYC and in the financial district. The rooms were clean, staff was always helpful and most importantly there is coffee in the room. You will not be disappointed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed April 4-6, 2019 with 2 adults and 2 girls for spring break vacation. Very convenient to Ellis Island ferry (5 min walk), subway (2 min walk) and financial district (5 min walk). Staff was very accommodating and helpful with how to get around in NY via the subway. Beds were very comfy. Rooms were small, but its NY so that was expected. Hotel, rooms/bathrooms all clean. Nice hotel and would definitely recommend. It was quiet and not a lot of room noise. We choose financial dist as it was cheaper than times square yet convenient to get down there via subway. not a party area so that was nice since we were on vacay with 7 & 11 yr old girls. a few restaurants within quick 5 min walk. walked to restaurant/market called Essen, which had fresh food buffet like whole foods does, which we really enjoyed twice: had one person who is on a plant based diet, and she had plenty of options to choose from as well. it was right around the corner from hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I took two grand kids to NYC to see the sights. I did not want to drag them from Midtown to get on a ferry for the Statue of Liberty & Ellis Island, so this was a good choice location-wise: literally 5 minutes to the ferry and a 20 minute walk to the 9-11 Museum & Memorial. Otherwise, the rooms are teeny, dark, and basic. Virtually no 'lobby' - Check-in is on the 2nd floor - very inconvenient. There are 3 elevators for a hotel with 45 floors. Expect long waits for the elevators, which are also used by staff for cleaning carts etc.The breakfast food is substandard (fruit and oatmeal tasted funny, even the coffee was pretty bad). All this for almost $400 a night. Again, NYC is expensive, there are not many family friendly hotel choices in the Financial District. Oh - and they have no concierge. Only time in my entire extensive traveling life where the person referred to as 'the concierge' could not name a single family friendly restaurant in the area. Just so you know: there are many, including a Mexican restaurant right across the street.
user_name:
Judy Z
Salt Lake City, Utah

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: On this trip to NYC I was chaperoning alone, 7 students aged 16-18 years old, in 4 rooms. I rang multiple times to check room accommodations, even the night before my stay. I paid in advance with the school credit card and completed the tax exempt form. While on the phone I wanted to make sure one of the rooms could accommodate 3 teenage boys. I was told only king size rooms were available. So to solve the problem I asked for a roll away bed. I was told over the phone- no problem. On arrival, I felt like my reservation was an inconvenience. It took a while to find my reservation and when I asked about the rollaway I was told that due to storage restrictions they do not have any at the hotel. The hotel was full and therefore they didn’t have any other rooms to accommodate the three boys. I asked to talk to a manager. I waited 20 minutes and then asked the manager to call me. She did call and I was told that a room maybe available late tonight if a cancellation comes in. We lucked out. A room did become available, for one night only. Now I had 5 rooms on five different floors. Yippee! Fun at curfew! After the first night we checked out of the room we were given. Later in the afternoon I talked to another person at reception about our situation and asked what was the plan for night two. He asked me to explain what had happened because there was nothing in the computer on our reservation. I explained and was told the same thing that I was told the previous night. Totally full hotel. No rooms available and no rollaways. This time I felt my situation was falling on deaf ears and when I asked for a managers name who was on call that night, no name was given until I asked which business card should I contact. I asked if I could have more comforters and pillows sent to my boys rooms so they could sleep on the floor for one night only. The receptionists said they will send some bedding up. I gave the room number and they questioned it. I told them to look at my reservation to confirm the room it’s needed for. I am so upset that a 17 year old kid that paid to go on their first trip to NYC has to sleep on the floor because of a lack of communication and blatant bad customer service from a hotel chain that we as a family are gold loyalty members of. The hotel is 44 stories tall, the elevators take forever so ask for a lower room so you can use the stairs. Don’t expect employees that actually can accommodate you because their hands are tied and because of a lack of accommodations in the financial district they really don’t care.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel has 3 elevators for 45 floors. We had to wait each time 20 min to get the elevator and to stand on the edge of the door just to get the chance to get to the ground floor. We also had a chewing gum on the wall next to the pillow.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel was fine, but the free breakfast was not included, even though I had the room rate with free breakfast. Staff could have cared less. Paid for breakfast and it tasted like the eggs were cooked in toilet water.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: As others have reviewed, this hotel is immaculate. We were on the 43rd floor and the view is stunning. Despite being so high up, we had no trouble heading to or from our room as there are 3 elevators. As mentioned by others, it takes a LONG time for the hot water to arrive, both at night and in the morning. Our concern was with check-in. We arrived late (after 8:00 p.m.) and there were two women working at the desk (Mar. 30th). Neither greeted us, and both wanted to hand us off to the other (one of them was obviously trying to leave at the end of her shift). There was no welcoming manner to either of them, no offer of the hospitality bag with complementary water, and I had to ask for the "warm cookies." Others in our group who arrived at various times throughout the afternoon/evening received no cookies and no water, and didn't know to ask. When leaving the next morning I asked for the welcome bag, and they were happy to accomodate. This staff couldn't have been nicer or more professional. When, minutes later, a HUGE busload of touritsts arrived en masse, I didn't know who to feel worse for, the TOURISTS or the single check-in person!?! Stressed staff should not be so obvious to the guests.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is in a great central location, walking distance from The Rockafella Centre, 5th Avenue, Times Square. We had a family room - 2 double beds. The room was large, beds were comfy, the bathroom was a bit on the small side. We were greeted with warm cookies on arrival which were amazing. The staff were very helpful and polite.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good location in the financial district. Short train trip to the Village for a night out and close enough for an inexpensive can ride back to the hotel. However, on the weekends, the businesses in that location are not open or open later due to the majority of people are only there to work Mon-Fri
user_name:
Culture28926145053
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We booked 3 rooms for 4 nights in March 2019.As this is a New York property, you need to expect the rooms will be small. They are however very clean and comfortable with great bedding and bathroom facilities. The hotel is in a great location with so much to do around the area and close to the subway.We unfortunately had some very negative concerns. 1) Check in:We arrived early and understood that we wouldn't be able to check in until the correct time, but we thought we could at least ask. We were greeted by a very terse check-in attendant named Venetta who was extremely rude to us. Practically yelling to us "That check in is not until 2pm." We kindly asked if there was a possibility to see if she could check to see if any rooms were ready. Again we were yelled at by her "Can't you see that Im very stressed out here! You need to wait and see when the manager arrives!" We asked if she could give us an indication as to when the manager might arrive. "I don't know!" She yelled, "Maybe in an hour - maybe in two hours?" We sadly backed away and took our bags to the bell desk to be looked after while we went and found some breakfast. After this, we went back to see if this manager had turned up. He was there and we asked if we could check in early and he made everything look so easy. He found us all rooms that were available and checked us in early. 2) Check out:We had other issues with the hot water, and this occurred at our final morning of checkout.We needed to check out at 5:00 for a 14 hour flight. Each of us set our alarms at 4:00 so we could shower and prepare to leave.My room had NO HOT WATER - it was freezingMy two other friends' rooms had ONLY HOT / BOILING WATER.None of us were able to take a shower before we departed to the airport.I was the first to the check out desk and made a small complaint. The check out attendant apologised and offered to add 1000 points on my Hilton Honour account. 2 weeks later and this hasn't happened.My friend checked out and made a small complaint and the checkout attendant apologised and offered to contact expedia (who we booked with) and provide a small refund as compensation. The same occurred with our friend in the third room.None of this has happened and I feel sad that we were lied to by the desk staff.So overall, a great hotel but we had a horrible start and finish to the experience. This is a great disappointment to the Hilton brand.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is located on Stone St, just a few hundred feet from a subway station, yet it’s a little difficult to find as the signage is simple and the entrance perpendicular to the building.Once inside the halls all feel very tight, and there are only 3 elevators for a very tall hotel. All that said, I loved this hotel. The staff of the Doubletree was very professional yet super accommodating. Once, I figured out where it was, the location was perfect. Lots of hustle and bustle by day and super quiet at night. I had two different rooms (I only expected to stay one night so checked out...only to check back in for a second evening), and each was very comfortable and super clean.I would recommend the Doubletree to anyone staying in Manhattan that doesn’t want to stay in the tourist centers!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a convenient, clean and friendly hotel. The wait for elevators can be considerable and the location of the hotel lobby on the second floor sometimes means doubling elevator trips. The staff is friendly and does its best to make you feel comfortable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Truly had a wonderful experience at the DoubleTree. The staff were awesome. The restaurant attached is really a gem. Not too pricey but the food was outstanding. Noise level in the room was well below most New York rooms. I did not hear any of the street noise. Could be the location or which way my room faced, but I'll take it in any case. Was great.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: the position is excellent: downtown Manhattan, close to the subway and in a zone which is undergoing new development (pedestrian area in Wall Street) and walking distance to 9/11 memorial and new areayou are immediately on the Broadway and close to Smithsonian National Museum of American Indian.The rooms are nice, with good bathroom facility, mine overlooking the streetThe welcome service at the check-in was professional and having water and cookies as Hilton Honor member was a treatthe lobby is at second floor and if you check-in in rush-hour time, especially on Friday, waiting queues at the elevator can be long

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I checked in on a Thursday afternoon (3p), and the 2nd floor lobby was busy. The impression I got was chaos. While I waited my turn in line I was witness to one of the attendants behind the desk speak to a guest in a very curt tone as the guest asked questions about their booking. The more questions that were asked, the more visibly frustrated the attendant got. These were my first impressions...I got our room assignment, found our way up, and walked in only to find that the confirmed and paid for double room that we had booked was a single. So I called the front desk and explained that I thought a mistake had been made. The response i got was that all the double had been booked, and there was nothing that could be done. I questioned the fact that I had a booking that was confirmed, and was told "I'm not sure what to tell you" and was offered an opportunity to come down to talk about it further, but there was nothing that could be done. Puzzled, I thought to myself then what was the point??I gave the stay a 2 rating because of the location. It was convenient to have the subway stations near by. I used the Moovit app to navigate my routes - highly recommended. The hallways were narrow, but quiet. This DoubleTree location's staff could benefit from some customer service training.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Convenient location, clean room, though interior is somewhat aged and needs make-over. Price is adequate for what you get. Entrance on ground level is not appealing, but then it gets better. Good Italian restaurant.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: After stating this was a honeymoon in the booking and also mentioning at the desk; we were not treated anymore than a number. The room itself was fine, they put us on the 42nd Floor. That said, this was a service doing the least necessary. I felt underwhelmed having been a honours member too.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We've stayed at almost 10 of the NYC Hilton Properties, and this Double Tree is our favorite so far. Great price, super clean, nice restaurant on property, and really friendly staff. Miss Venetta helped us during check-in and check-out, and made us feel at home!
user_name:
rlmiles77
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We were in a room with a king sized bed but the room was too small. My wife and I couldn't even walk past each other. The shower was also too small. The staff was very helpful. The bellman gave us an umbrella to use bcuz it was raining.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Arrived 4 hours before check in but no issues.. Big rooms for NYC.. U great location..4 subways within 3 minutes walk. Time Square and midtown 10 minutes by subway. 3 Duane Reade (convenience stores) within 2 minute walk. Plenty of takeaways and restaurants within 10 minute walk

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I had the pleasure of staying here this past weekend. The hotel was great and the staff and housekeeping team were pleasant. Vicki at the front desk was especially professional, accommodating, and attentive to our needs. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good service from the hotel staff they were very friendly and polite. They even help me getting a ride to the airport Room was very cozy and good view of the river, will definitely come back and stayed in this hotel

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My last visit to New York I stayed in Hilton garden inn near Central Park which was an absolutely wonderful stay thinking that I closed my eyes and booked Hilton double tree assuming the same quality. First surprise was definitely the entrance.. you enter and you would think is this what I paid for? Corridors on the room floors are too narrow to even drag your luggage Nevertheless the rooms were nice enough - happy with that but the housekeeping is not so great they only made my bed but didn’t clean the room which was quite weirdThe guy answering in room dining calls is quite rude and not helpful at all. Got sick during my stay and even after mentioning that he didn’t offer to help me with things that I needed. But I contacted Hilton through their online chat on the app and got a call back right away to cater to my request which was great! So plus point for that!Lastly got early check in and late check out so plus point for that too. Location wise if you’re visiting for tourism it’s definitely not somewhere you should be since the weekends and weekdays after 6 pm is very quiet.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Wanted to celebrate my 30th in NYC without waking up to the NYC noise and busyness. I slept like a baby at the hotel! The beds were comfortable and clean! The hotel being where it is was perfect, wasnt too busy for an early August weekend. Hallways were quiet. Im planning to book AGAIN for 31st birthday!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This Hotel was nothing short of disgusting. Rooms were outdated, dirty, no comfortable accommodations and when anyone showered, this really loud high pitched noise would start... you can imagine how much this happens at a Hotel... and they advertise that if you aren’t satisfied then let them know and they will make it right. Total lie. Please save yourself the aggravation and take your hard earned money elsewhere. I have stayed at many different areas at the Fairfield Inn and the Hampton Inn and they are always clean, comfortable and professional!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Convenient to both east and west side trains, plenty to do, an area I was previously not familiar with. Plenty of restaurants, and with Battery Park right there, we had a good view of Lady Liberty anytime we went to the park. If she is your goal, remember to make reservations well in advance.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location near the river and financial district, but please review your bill before leaving. Was changed two (2) daily valet parking charges on the same day and didn't have a car nor did I drive in NY.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Went on business and the location is excellent - right on the subway line, next to wall street, and near battery park and the ferry to the Statue of Liberty. The only critique I have is that I was on a higher floor and the elevators would sometimes run a little slow, get crowded, or stop at every floor to pick up more passengers although already at capacity.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: everything is excellent. Service is great, helpful and friendly staff. Clean room, perfect location. But the AC is too loud and hard to keep on a comfortable temperature. Leave it on, it soon gets too dry and warm even on a low temperature. Turn it off, it’s freezing in the sleep.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I did have a few concerns with this particular stay. This was a vacation trip for me and my wife. It was my first time ever coming to New York and seeing where my wife was born. So, with me being a Hilton rewards member I wanted to stay in the nicest location to which I believed Manhattan financial district to be an affluent safe area. However, our stay didn’t reflect what I thought one bit. After a few nights, we noticed our first room had an ant infestation in which I have video of. So, they moved us to a different room, but the door wouldn’t close shut on its own. I had to manually force it to close shut. Also, the shower was leaking water out on the floor and soaked the entire floor towel we had down and I almost slipped getting out the shower as well. Lastly, one of the main reasons my wife loves Double Tree is for the amazing soft warm chocolate chip cookies. But for some reason at this hotel the cookies were rock hard and we try getting new ones daily (3x) but yet the same results just over cooked and hard. Hopefully, something can be done about this major inconvenience because I didn’t feel as if I got the value for my money and this experience with Double Tree didn’t give me a great first impression on New York.I even extended my stay in New York one more day and stayed at a different hotel Holiday INN Downtown Brooklyn and that stay was 100x better.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The entire front desk staff and restaurant staff were very professional and accommodating. They were efficient and organized. Extremely impressed by the service. Literally down the street from the RW subway line (yellow) and convenient to the SI terminal. Room small but good temperature, liked the carpeting, huge TV screen, cookies on arrival. Water pressure excellent. Location of room was so good that room was quiet and slept incredibly well. Largest downside was more elevators need to run at all times and the wait time for the elevator was long. (44 floor building and a slow elevator system because building is older). Not like the fast elevators in large high rise offices in NYC.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I would not recommend this hotel. Rooms and bathrooms are tiny. Narrow hallways. Long elevator waits. On top of this no views which I thought you’d at least get on a higher floor. The bathroom in my room also has a broken electrical outlet right by the sink which seems unsafe. Won’t be returning.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Close to subway stations. Not on a busy main street. Convenient to some good eateries---Leo's Bagels, Justino's Pizza, and Murphy's Irish pub. Warm chocolate chip cookies are the best we've ever eaten. Great value!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Love the cookies and the pleasant staff to greet you. I stay here most of the time when in the City for business. close to many restaurants and the rooms are very clean. The only issue is when the hotel is full the elevators are extremely slow. I had to walk 26 flights down stairs. Warning if hotel is full, stay on a lower floor.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here last year as a couple wanting to enjoy a less tourist type holiday and see what New York has to offer as a local. The hotel is quite far from Times Square but easily reachable by subway - taxi rides ended up quite expensive. The hotel is a stones throw from the Hudson. However we enjoyed exploring the financial district but bars were expensive and busy due to the clientele being business users. As a base and as we did not mind taking the subway everywhere this was okay. Room quite small but all New York hotel rooms tend to be on the smaller side. Staff very helpful and friendly, room was clean and bed was comfortable but overall basic and dated - fine for a place to sleep, shower and head straight back out.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Perfect getaway with your partner. Location was excellent. Staff was excellent and helpful checking in and out. Lots to do close to transportation World Trade Center easy to get to grand central and 34th street

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel staff was amazingly courteous, and it is in a prime Manhattan location. However, the elevator wait and congestion was somewhat frustrating. In spite of the situation, my date and I were impressed with the hotel room.
user_name:
bigsaleem
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location was very close to the train station at Bowling Green. Also close to Staten Island Ferry and Battery Park.Room was clean and bed was exceptionally comfortable.Concierge were excellent and super helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I arrived late on a Friday night for a 3 night stay- I was Checked into a room me and my son went up to that room only to find that the door unlocked but the bolt was on because another guest had already been checked into this room. I come back downstairs and tell the woman at check in- she stands around saying I don’t understand this doesn’t make sense and I wait for about a half hour at midnight with my 6 year old for a room. I notice my check out date is the next day- she tells me somehow they split my reservation and I’d need to call - so I go upstairs I’m on hold for 40 minutes to ve told that my reservation Is fine and that there should be no issues. So I call down to the front desk and the woman informs me all is well and that I would need to do nothing else . The next day after working and being out most of the day we go back to the room only to find that the key does not work. I go back down to the front desk- let me note there are only 3 elevators for a building with over 40 Floors. We get there again we are waiting for an additional 16-20 minutes so they can figure it out and find out if my personal possessions are still there or had been moved ?? So then after all of that I am told I can go back to the same room my stuff wasn’t moved I just need to CHECK IN AGAIN. Literally the worst experience at a Hilton to date.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Went for vacation/ anniversary getaway. The hotel was quiet and had a great view of the city. The hotel staff was great. The front desk staff was very accommodating. Breakfast was classy the wait staff was very friendly and they had a great verity of foods offered.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: While the room was small, which was not unexpected, the promised "river view" was the neighboring building under remodeling construction. The bathroom was designed by someone who never used a bathroom, no place to hang cloths or towels or counter space to a toothbrush or toothpaste. Great location and staff was friendly.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel rooms in New York all look the same when you're asleep. It's getting to the room that matters. From the doorman to the desk staff, each person greeted me warmly and made me feel welcome. From finding a place for dinner to a smooth morning check-out, each person radiated joy in their job. Who wouldn't want to wake up to that?

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Perfect location for a business trip with an exceptional restaurant on the main floor. Within walking distance of the 9/11 memorial, along with other great NYC attractions & restaurants. The entire staff were very hospitable and always helpful when local recommendations were requested. The front door staff saved the day by hailing a last minute cab to catch a train during a snow squall! Next stay will definitely be a room with a view. Would highly recommend this location for business or pleasure!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was picked to be the guest of the day and my boyfriend and I got upgraded rooms as well a nice little gift which was unexpected. Everyone was extremely nice and we’re thinking about staying here again for Valentine’s Day,

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel has really good location and a subway stop is literally next to the hotel. Perfect you can walk to the World trade center. It is just 5 minutes by walk. The stuff was friendly what we appreciated because we had also another and worse experiences in NY.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is cheap and very well located for the subway. They give you a delicious cookie when you arrive and the beds are comfortable. The heating is noisy and the windows drafty. Do not order the room service breakfast. I've never seen anything quite as dreadful. Grey, uncooked toast for 20 bucks. My advice is to stay but go elsewhere for your breakfast!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is perfect for the financial district hotel. I had left another nearby property because of issues and Elizabeth was super nice and helped me and my family get an early Check in. The rooms are small but are very clean. The bathrooms are super nice and are well designed. The elevators are fast and I only waited maybe 2 minutes max. Breakfast was in the restaurant next door and was super nice as well! I can’t wait to come back here!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed several nights at this hotel during January 2019. We found staff helpful & were pleased with our room. Would return. Quiet part of NY but excellent access to various subways & plenty of restaurants at hand.
user_name:
Robyn C
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here in November with my boyfriend, our first time to New York, this hotel was pretty central, subway all around it, staff were great very helpful, and polite id definitely return again in a coupe of months.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We spent 5 nights at this Doubletree and generally things were as expected. The location is perfect in that it is footsteps from a subway station and walking distance from any building in the financial district. Check in was quick and the staff (Luis) was able to make a room change for us quickly and without any hassle. The rooms are small but this has to be expected for a downtown location in any city; however they were clean, contemporary and well furnished. There was some maintenance issues that were never fully resolved, the sink faucet has to be run while the shower is on to keep the water hot, the bathroom fan ran constantly and the solution was to disconnect it and there was a deep crack in the shower floor which could cause cuts if you were not careful and for that I took off half a star. The breakfast was a let down. While the staff were pleasant and attentive, Fernando was particularly good at this job, under cooked eggs to order were more a health hazard than a morning welcome and overcooked hot buffet food made the place feel like a cheap motel. even with free coupons for the week, my wife and I chose other local options such as the starbucks round the corner or one of the fantastic breakfast foot carts within eyesight of the front door. Again for this I took off l half star.A final note is to give praise to the door staff all of which were friendly and always had time for a quick chat. Hopton was especially helpful with his morning greetings and informed us of (and arranged for) the airport shuttle which we did not know about and this saved us time and stress.Doubletree is not a hotel that should be passed up and with a few minor updates and changes it could easily compete with other more expensive locations.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I came back to New York with my daughter cause my son is getting married. Chose this hotel for convenience and I did not make a mistake in choosing this hotel. It’s in the middle of everything. I am recommending this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very clean kept great greeters and really good house keepers I loved it loved it loved it loved it I will be back soon for my next business trip to nyc so double tree be prepared for me lol housekeepers and greeters keep up the good work

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Not there fault but the hotel was located in what seemed like a sketchy ally so don’t go there for the view. The staff was nice and accomadating. They always greeted me when I walked in. My shower water was cold...and it was like updated locating but kind of also dirty looking at the same time. It was just ok for a quick business trip

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: hotel reps overcharged me for the stay. it took me many-many emails to get my money refunded. 5 people were copied in the conversation, however only third or fourth email would get a reply. finally a rep offered some milage to me as a compensation for the mistake and trouble, a couple of months later, I'm yet to see the miles in my account. follow up emails are not getting any replies. again, with 5 (!) people copied. not sure if i'd like to remain a hilton gold member after this...

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good hotel!!! The location is excellent, about a block away from Battery Park and the ferry to Liberty Island and Ellis Island. As with many things New York, the arrangement is different from elsewhere in the world. When you enter on the ground floor you won’t find a check in desk—that will be on the second floor. Take the elevators up. Be patient they will come (44 floors). The staff were excellent. They greeted us with a smile and saw to all our needs. The lodging was New York standard. Narrow halls and smallish room. But given the space they have to work with...Tip: if you can’t turn off the light over your bed check out the switches on the wall behind the entrance door. They don’t look like normal, residential light switches, so there is a chance that you will miss them when getting ready for bed, after you are standing there naked calling the front desk asking them how to turn off the light and they are offering to send up the hotel engineer and you are asking if there is any other way because you are naked and then you see the switches that you overlooked because they don’t look like normal switches

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very nice hotel, excellent service. The staff is nice and helpful. When I got to the hotel front-desk staff was really nice and the check-in process was really fast and painless. The room was cleaned everyday and the towels changed. The check-out was also very fast and painless.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location and great price. Easy to get in and out of the city from lower Manhattan. Easy walk to the September 11 Museum. Love running over the Brooklyn Bridge. Easy to get to Tribeca and Greenwich Village. Taxi or Subway easily accessible to explore other parts of the city.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Location was very noisy, ice machine, other guests and street noise. Bathroom was tiny, no space at all near sink, very hard to use. Staff was great, food in restaurant was also good. Had breakfast buffet well stocked and warm, great selection and price, wait staff very attentive.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Just when we thought customer service was dead , my family and I had the most wonderful experience . Alan & Luis (at front desk) helped us out with any and everything we needed . We will be back ! Their energy and customer service were superb . These are the type of employees that make a GREAT business !

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed in this financial district hotel for two nights. Bed was comfortable and room was clean. It is NY so there was outside noise but the hotel itself was fairly quiet. The area is nice, close to the Charging Bill statue. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed at the Doubletree Financial District just before Christmas. The rooms were nice for NYC and the location was decent to see numerous points of interest in NYC.The check in was efficient and the staff friendly. We were quickly up in our room so we could go exploring Manhattan. We didn't have any meals at the hotel, but lots of restaurants close by for all meals. Also decent bar scene in the financial district, even on the weekend. Obviously a little more quiet in that are as opposed to Times Square, but that not all bad.Fairly good access to the subway to get uptown on both the west and east sides. Took the subway to Lexington to see Central Park and the department store windows. Also caught it to take in a Broadway show. Hit a couple restaurants and bars close by, and would recommend the bar at Delmonico's. Also Leo's bagels for breakfast. But also stopped at probably the worst Starbucks we have ever been to on Broad street.Hotel is also close enough to walk to Battery Park (to see Ms Liberty) and the 9/11 monuments/museum. A place of great sorrow, yet fascinating stories. The freedom tower views are amazing, but the experience is way too commercialized.End with the hotel, I would recommend as a good place to stay in NYC.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff was frienly and welcoming. The hotel was very clean from the lobby to the hallways and rooms. The location isn't the best but the subway is near and with the price, I would definitely come here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff were wonderful, friendly, courteous, helpful, but please Hilton give them something to work with!! There are 3 small elevators for a building with 40+ floors. You have to add at least 10 mins to your schedule to get in or out of hotel. Check in was slow and painful. I arrived at 2:00pm, which was an hour before check in so I understand that needs to be figured in. Still I did not get into my room until close to 3:30. Bathroom was cramped, toilet was stained, towel rack broke as soon as I took a towel, at 3:00am I discovered I could not shower unless I wanted 3rd degree burns. When I tried to adjust knob for water temperature the entire fixture turned around. The curtains did not close so that the lights from the office building next door (which were illuminated 24/7) were shining into room as I tried to sleep. I asked for a taxi to be arranged and all they would do is get me the Hilton limo which was going to be $35 to go 0.6 miles. Location is good, restaurants and shopping and pretty much anything you might need is within walking distance. Also they have a very nice gym.Overall a very disappointing experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is the 2nd Hilton that I stayed in in the NYC area and the 2nd time I was very disappointed. The room was super small, no hot water, etc. No one was at the front desk when I got there around 2pm I had a meeting to get to and no one was to be found. Turns out that she was finding some info for a guest, which I understand but to abandon the desk for a long period of time is unacceptable. The location was great for access to the ferry and there is a half way decent bar right next door. This Hilton is off my list as is the Embassy Suites in Times Square. These are both newer Hiltons so I'm wondering what is going on with the Hilton brand. I may resort to Marriott when I'm in NYC. Come on Hilton - get it together!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We intentionally stayed in the Financial District, as we didn't want to be in tourist-heavy parts of town. Also, we preferred to stay in a hotel which catered to business professionals, in the hope that we would have a nicer stay. I stayed at this hotel in 2009, and I expected to find the same experience. I was disappointed. Cons: Room size: I must have stayed in an upgraded room before, because, even though I had a King Size room, the room was extremely small in comparison to my previous room. Extra Amenities: There is nothing special, here. If I were traveling for a company, I would feel short-changed, as the only little extra here is the warm cookie, IF you go downstairs to ask for it. Surroundings: Unfortunately, there is construction near the hotel; so, that messed with the appearance of the street on which the hotel sits. Cons: Cleanliness: Housekeeping does a great job. My only complaint is that I saw the bowl full of some mushy substance sitting in a corner right outside my room for two whole days and nights. Even though I mentioned it to an employee at the desk, the bowl remained there all night and the next day. ...frustrating. Environment: It is very quiet, there. And, although the hallways are extremely narrow and almost every room seems near the elevator, I didn't hear any noise--either from the street or elevator--when I was in the room. Dining: It's pricey, but there are several places to eat, in the area. Be prepared to pay dearly for the best dining experiences in the area; however, there are some sandwich shops and coffee shops, in the area as well. Essentially, I do believe the hotel was well-priced, but I believe management needs to step things up. There are too many similarly-priced options--both in this area and others--for me to ever consider staying here, again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here over the Christmas holiday. As a former New Yorker, I understand that space is a premium in the city. If you are looking for a spacious room, this would not be the right kind of hotel for you. The staff was courteous and the rooms were clean. We had a problem with the bathroom and the staff took care of it right away. I needed to print something and the printer in the business center was not working.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The stay was good, with many tube station close by. Many attractions are at walking distance as well, which would make this a good stay for tourists. Cleanliness was good with very friendly and helpful staff.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I've stayed at this hotel for 1 night. This hotel is located at the south edge of Manhattan near the Battery park, Wall St. and the Bull. It's accessible by subway which is only 2 blocks away. Check in was fine and they give a cookie as a way of welcome. The room was clean and in a good shape. The bed and the sheets were comfortable. I had a nice sleep. It cost me around 175$ cad with taxes for one night which I found the value excellent for Manhattan. Overall this hotel is very good and I would probably return if I have a chance to return in New York.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If you are single person traveling to New York for a short time on business, this hotel would be a great choice. But if there are two of you traveling, be warned that this is a cramped hotel space, even by New York standards. The bathroom is so small they decided to install a vertical toilet paper dispenser. Horrible design choice. Very little counterspace in the bathroom. The location has great access to several different subway lines, making it easy to get to the theater district or Lincoln Center. The staff varied from incredibly friendly, especially those of the front door, to others who seem terribly bored with their work. Housekeeping did not replenish supplies for the coffee maker, and a call to the front desk to ask for them was met with indifference, and nothing was ever delivered—even after a day. Of course, the free cookies at check-in are a wonderful bonus. If the price is cheap, go for it. Otherwise, look farther uptown.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We took an impromptu trip to NYC based on a tempting hotel offer at this Doubletree. It was a great location with wonderful Doubletree warm cookies and an equally warm front desk staff. Everything else was below par: sagging mattress, short sheets (only covered 2/3s of the bed), no blankets, small small room withTINY Footprint, no towel racks, andand scratchy TP. The elevators were slow as molasses

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: First of all, I want to say that this bad experience started when after I receive the confirmation after I make the reservation , I send an email with a request to tracey.martinez@hilton.com but nobody answer.In the day of the C/I we arrived around to leave our luggage around 12 PM , we ask the Front Desk agent to point us to Brooklyn Bridge which was a little difficult for her. After a long and rainy day in the city , back to the hotel, the C/I process was unfriendly: no info about the property, no questions about the reason of the visit in NY ( even it was a special event for me which that's why I was sending the email !). And what was very important for me: no question about the method of payment !! They charge the cc on file in advance and with an impolite attitude the Front Desk agent told me that she can do nothing about that!In the room when we try to use the shower there was no hot water !! We call to the Reception and the lady told me that we must wait 10 min because the room is on the 43rd floor! We called again to ask how we can stop the heater because in the room was 75 F , but nobody answer on the phone and we figure it out ourselves hot to stop it from a button under the heater.Also, we wait 4o minutes for a toothbrush kit!The only positive thing was the view on the 43rd floor .All of this after I booked this reservation thru my Hilton member account.Next time pay attention when you put a big worldwide brand on a hotel in NY.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location, close to Wall Street, subway at the corner of the street, ferry to the Statue 5 minutes away. Great for turists that want to move around NY even for the first time. Good restaurants and 9/11 Memorials!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The nightly rate was too good to pass up. This is my third visit to this property and I have to say the staff were beyond friendly and helpful at this visit. The bellmen at the door are amazing...helpful, professional and make you feel like you are returning home each time you enter the door. The elevators are so very slow, but that was the only negative part of the stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We booked a suite - It bore no resemblance to any picture.The Net curtains were black and you could barley squeeze past the beds.We had booked the suite for use of the sofa bed - It was not made up on arrival (no pillows or duvet) - asked at reception at midnight and they said they would contact housekeeping - Nothing happened - no apology no phone call, my son just slept under a sheet and his coat.Sofa bed was very uncomfortable – Thin matressBreakfast - poor - no one is interested in you. Food was not always replenished - ran out of Bread, Jam, pastries, and limited fruit etc. If you wanted fresh coffee you had to go and find someone or if you wanted a cup of tea... that was difficult!Construction opposite was going on overnight outside our room (505) on two occasionsIf you like 1970's Brown, and no interaction from any staff - you will love this hotel, however for me it was poor.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location, super quiet, easy to check luggage before/after checking in, and Allen is the best!! We loved our stay and everyone working there. Not far from Newark airport if you are flying in/out of there!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Completely unimpressed for the price paid. The location is excellent when you need to stay downtown as multiple subway lines are super close and lots of great food too. Unfortunately, the hotel is nothing to write home about! Tiny rooms and bathrooms...and when I say tiny, imagine the toilet paper touching the side of the toilet and having it in the way when you sit down or pee! Imagine a closet that has a tiny door on one side of the bed but no place to put your clothes or luggage; think of stepping outside to change your mind since there is no place in the room to do so...except that the hallways are so narrow and tiny there isn't room there either! Breakfast was never stocked, bacon dripped in grease, fruit cut but not cut properly (pineapple with all the knobs not cut off). The staff want to help and are a really nice bunch, but they have a limitation of the disaster that is this property

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Recent trip to NYC, excellent staff, very nice room, great location, access to Subway, walkable to duane reades and many restaurants and bars including sports bars! Will definitely stay again, no problems experienced and of course the warm cookies are always great!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Suites are small, elevators are slow, parking is an adventure. No private lot available. Icon charges for each entry regardless of duration. No where to load or unload luggage, lobby on second floor, no help with bags or holding open door for those with luggage

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This place really needs a good renovation. In my shower, the ceiling was falling apart, and there were patches all around the room, patched badly. The carpet felt like I may catch a disease from it. Not much of a lobby, on the 2nd floor. The room was also really noisy. I expect noisy from NYC of course, but I've stayed many other places and this was quite loud.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Nice quiet part of town with nearby pubs and restaurants hotel clean, staff friendly. Elevators extremely slow/ frustrating. If you can time your travel around peak elevator time do so! Otherwise recommended.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel as one great thing going for it...LOCATION! It’s located in a great position in the financial District. Ideal for exploring this area. If your looking for a hotel where you can sit drinking at the bar then this hotel is not for you! The rooms are clean tidy and contain everything you need! Great Irish bar next door as a added bonus!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: After lloking at different hotel options uptown, we finaly chose this one, in Lower Manhattan.I was a bit worried to be far from everything but my doubts vanished straight away :- 3 metro stations around, with many main lines to uptown and Brooklyn (and JFK airport 50 minutes away with just 2 connections),- Liberty cruise pier, Wall Street, Charging Bull statue all about 5 minutes walk away. - The brooklyn Brigde, World Trade Center and City Hall are also not so far (you need to like walking in NYC anyway ;)). Room are not big but nicely equiped (far enough when you spend all your day out) : TV, fonctionnal bathroom. Bed are "smooth". Our room was clean.Breakfast buffet is simple but also this is very sufficient. Everyone can find something they like. The area is very quiet people-wise on week-ends. A few little restaurant around and a mini supermarket that is very convenient.My only minus points will be that the isolation is not very hard. We can hear the next room and outside. Also, there are changing all the towels everyday. This would be nice to be able to choose to keep them for a few days if we want, as some other hotels do, in a "environemental spirit". We will nevertheless come back to this hotel when we come back to NYC.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The first two days were ok, but then I spent other 8 days without wifi and I totally needed it for work as I was on business. Plus there was a problem with the lifts on the first day and one was broken. It normally took 20-25 minutes to get a lift, so sometimes I had to go downstairs through the stairs for 20 floors.They did not make up for any problems although I had no wifi and I could not work. I had to go to cafes around to go on working in a hotel like this which should be designed for business trips.Absolute chaos! I would not recommend it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Well, overall our experience was good, the location was perfect and the staff was friendly. The only two problems we encountered during our stay was the noise outside the room. We could clearly hear people talking and laughing during late hours. Also, the elevators were another issue. There aren't enough and therefore the waiting time is too long and it can get claustrophobic inside the elevators when there are a lot of people at once.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I booked a stay at this hotel, which was a good deal but like always, no change no cancel. Then I read some review and got scared by the elevator issue and other bad comments. But, when we actually got there, everything turned out to be quite good. The elevator waiting time can be a bit longer at peak hours, but no more than 5min, and they placed a tv in the elevator hall, and always someone there greeting guests. All the staff are very friendly and helpful. Plus the location is so convenient, near to different subway lines, makes daily sightseeing super easy. 不要被这家酒店的评论吓到，电梯问题没那么严重，最高峰时间也就等个五分钟。员工非常友好，位置超级便利，性价比超高，推荐给来纽约旅行的小伙伴。

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Was a bit worried after reading some of the reviews. But the hotel was absolutely fine. Clean, comfortable rooms and friendly staff. No waits for the lifts at all. In a great location. We enjoyed hot cookies each night on our return home after a long day out. The luggage staff were very friendly and helpful. Thanks for a great 4 night stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We had indicated we would arrive early. We did not expect our room to be ready by the time we arrived and left our luggage with the best front door person ever Allen. He should be called Director Of First Contact as he is really a great ambassador for the hotel.When we arrived back at the hotel at the agreed time the room would be ready, it was not. It only had . to be checked on cleanliness and such. The lady at the reception would come to us one that was done. It should not take more than 10-15 minutes according to her. Only the lady did not come to us. Even worse, she ended her shift and left without informing us at all. By this time we already waited for more than 30 minutes.By the minute my wife got more annoyed and I was not a happy person. After almost an hour I went up to the front desk. Nobody acted as if they were up to date with our situation. This despite the two gents behind the counter being there when we walked up almost an hour prior.This infuriated me and the front desk manager was called for. I explained to her the situation and she was apologetic and very unhappy with this treatment. She rectified it by upgrading us and providing us with breakfast and a dinner voucher.The room was nice; a bit dated though and soem things were loose or not properly fixed. We were already happy that we finally had a room.The next day we used our voucher in the Italian restaurant at the ground floor of the hotel. After dinner we paid with the voucher and left a cash tip. The latter despite very bad service from the waiter who had more eye for four girls sitting at a table near us. He was trying to impress them and we could overhear him fibbing. (you do not leave the great country of Albania to become a waiter in New York when you have this great life and make so much money in Albania).When we left the restaurant and were waiting for the elevator this same waiter came up and demanded more tip. When I told that I had given him enough for the great service not rendered he threatened us that he would take the full amount on the hold by the hotel and more. You can tell me anything. I am big boy, been in war situations so a guy like him does not make me feel uncomfortable. My wife though is another story. She is all for kindness, harmony and more. She felt so uncomfortable that she started hiding stuff in the room in case he really would access the room and take stuff. Also she did not want to go for breakfast anymore since that is in the same restaurant and she wanted to avoid a confrontation in case he would be working the breakfast shift too.We sent an email to hotel manager. He called us back as we requested. He implied he was not happy with the situation and would come back to us. The manager never came back. We went for breakfast elsewhere.Overall the hotel is reasonable. It is more three stars at most (service rendered by Allen are five stars).We probably would not go back. And do not count on the hotel manager as he will not follow through his promises.When you decide to stay in the hotel avoid the overpriced Italian place. Go next door to the Irish pub. They serve better food at more realistic prices. In the weekend Barry is on staff and he is a blast. (the owner Dennis is not bad either, he knows all about black and white movies)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location and concierge. I felt the hotel is benefiting from the Hilton name, without upholding standards. The room I was in had a fly problem. No matter how many we killed, they kept coming back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location in the Financial District, super value. Hallways and stairs are narrow, just a comment. Rooms are smaller, but not an issue. Super clean. Elevators can take a while, plan accordingly. Breakfast was great in hotel restaurant.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I booked this due to its location and decent price. I’ve stayed in Doubletree hotels before - hard to square the fact that this is in the same chain. Bellhop staff always very courteous and welcoming. Front desk polite enough but best they could offer for a late check out was noon on a holiday when it’s hard to imagine they were expecting lots of guests. Ho hum.It is a great location near the subway, shops and restaurants. Unfortunately it is quite a noisy location with hooting etc and poor sound proofing which meant I was disturbed at night. And the walls are paper thin which means you can hear the people in the room next to you even if they are not that loud. Small room, fine for me on my own though. Comfortable bed and decent housekeeping staff. Shower tiny - not enough room to swing a cat. Corridors the narrowest I have ever seen in a hotel. And lifts, yes, rubbish. Too slow.Don’t think I’d stay again. Shame as it’s a great location, but the hotel doesn’t live up to the brand, I’d expected better.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great hotel and very helpful staff. Plenty of subway options. Very close to South Ferry and Battery Park (for trip to Statue of Liberty). The only drawback is that the area shuts down at night. There are very few options for food after 8p. However, the hotel and staff were great!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I would not select this hotel again when traveling to New York. The layout of the hotel is inconvenient when traveling--you have to open a door to enter the hotel (this may be temporary in colder temperatures), then go up a floor to the lobby. This would not be a problem if you didn't have to wait and wait and wait for the elevators. Taking the stairs is not an option with bags and checking in/checking out. However, I have never seen so many hotel guests taking the stairs with me than at this hotel. Upon checkout it took > 10 minutes to get an elevator on a Sunday morning--I was concerned we would miss our flight, and by the time the elevator came to our floor, it was almost always full. We also experienced issues with the internet being out for a day during our day, which was inconvenient. The rooms are also very small, even for New York. It would be nice if the bathroom had any space to put items--just a very small shelf. Can hooks be added to hang clothes or towels? It's impossible to even put down the hairdryer in the bathroom--more storage in the bathroom would be helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel was in a good area. I felt safe walking to and from there. The room was small, but no smaller than other rooms in NYC. The bed was comfortable, and the bellman were the best in the city! Very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Had plans in the city during a work trip with some friends. It was actually a college class reunion trip. Plans called for us to end up at a bars in the financial district so a booked a room on my Hilton App for a nearby hotel and found the DoubleTree. It was a short stay. I found the hotel nice and a typical downtown hotel. The room itself was small but cozy. The king bed took up most of the room. There was a small desk, and a decent bathroom. The location was great for either work or staying for pleasure. Overall, I would recommend for staying in the area.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My husband and I chose this hotel for it's price and location. Multiple subway lines right outside the door. Easy to get around the entire city. Safe, quiet area. If you are a newcomer to NYC and unsure about the subway, don't overspend and stay in Midtown/TimesSquare! The subway is safe and will get you anywhere quickly. Here you will sleep in a much quieter (and nicer, and larger) room than most NYC accommodations! It's also a convenient 5-10 minute walk to the Wall Street Bull, Oculus, Freedom Tower, and Statue of Liberty ferry. We loved it and will return!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We had a great time, with very friendly staffs, excellent service and comfortable beds. There are some subway stations near this hotel. We could also walk to the Battery Park and see the Statue of Liberty.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
