review_body: Weekend stay and we enjoyed it very much! Very nice staff and a Starbucks around the corner. The hotel is clean, modern, rooms are medium size (good for New York) and right around corner from subway and loads of nice restaurants and bars in a very safe area. This is not Broadway, rather it is a Great location for taking ferry rides, seeing the lower Manhattan sites, heading to Staten Island etc,. Good launch spot for China town, Brooklyn and East side, Lower East Village, etc. This is not a big lobby grandiose hotel, but it’s a very good hotel, if you want big lobby and Times Square stuff then go uptown and spend a fortune. This is a comfortable place, warm and less stressful, with limited amenities. But, Hilton always does a nice job and you will be pleased for the value. Yes, Elevators are slow and can take a while. Many hotels in NY are like that and it’s frustrating. Just request a lower floor so you can use stairs if you want. Enjoy!
user_name:
realitytjek
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I had five problems requiring action by hotel staff in less than two hours after check-in. I subsequently had seven more issues, making it an even dozen over a three-night stay. These included broken flush mechanism on toilet, inability to get change at front desk for a $20, absent room service menu, incomplete room service menu, elevator buttons that don't light up to indicate they have been pressed, inability to access the WiFi, not being told how to access the WiFi at check-in or the $50 incidentals charge, room service nor answering the phone, front desk doing nothing about room service answering the phone, recommended private car arranged by hotel not showing up while two taxis were waved off, the bathroom door not staying open and the desk too small for a room service tray, and waiting 25 minutes for someone to talk to the party girls in the next room who were loud and causing beer fumes to come through the connecting door. The worst part was I booked it because of the low price for the holiday weekend not thinking about how much taxi fare was going to be going and coming to my conference in Columbus Circle and plays in the theater district. The front desk manager made amends on my bill but I'd much rather have had a problem-free stay than two nights comped. The only good things about the hotel are the bellmen, the shower and the bed.
user_location: East Greenbush, New York, United States
user_name:
Ruff B
East Greenbush, New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here a couple of times. The hotel is nice to stay for business, not sure if I would stay here with my family. The rooms are an ok size but during the winter it's getting cold in the room. Almost felt like the window was open. Maybe I was unlucky during the winter.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If someone wants to experience financial aspect of NewYork then this is the place to stay with Wall Street at a walking distance. Ferries which provides an awesome view of New York skyline can be boarded from a nearby sea port.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Close to multiple subway lines and Staten Island Ferry. Near many casual restaurants/bars during regular hours. Hotel is small with very slow elevators. Rooms are clean and average. Current location is under heavy reconstruction so traffic is congested and construction noisy. Room rates reflect. It looks like this construction will continue into mid-2019.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This property is in the Financial District, near the Staten Island Ferry and several subway lines. In that respect, convenient.Staff at lower elevator lobby were courteous -- always a welcome.Good breakfast in lobby restaurant for Honors members.I had booked my room six months in advance. I booked a high floor, river view, away from the elevators. (I am Hilton Gold, and my profile has for years said away from the elevators.)I got to my room. Arrived right on time -- no last minute check-in where rooms might have been limited. No river view. View of the cooling towers of a nearby building, plus the rest of the skyline. Right across from all three elevators.Room was very small. And then there was the smaller bathroom. Shower stall -- no exaggeration -- was only 24 inches wide. I am not a large person, but showering meant constantly bumping my elbows on the walls. A person of size would have a very difficult time fitting into that shower.Halls on guest room floors are so narrow that two adults cannot pass without turning sideways!Staff team leader William did, per policy, check with guests about their satisfaction, so I met with him in the lobby. He admitted that some rooms are very small. (Why would you put a Gold Member who booked six months in advance into one of those rooms?)He did follow up on the river view issue. His explanation was that, when you use the HILTON App to check in, it apparently overrides the booking instructions you made and just assigns you a room. I did not choose a room with the system -- just let the App assign the room. (Again, why would the hotel's App assign a Gold Member to one of the smallest rooms in the hotel?)Lesson: DO NOT use the App to check in!So, overall, I always hesitate to give a low rating to a property, and truth be told, the room and facility were clean and modern. And you might expect the small size, etc., in a Red Roof Inn or limited service hotel you booked at a bargain rate.But this is a DoubleTree (Hilton), and in that respect, via DoubleTree/Hilton standards, this property deserves a Poor rating.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Immediately upon arrival, the Bellmen(s) introduced themselves and offered a very warm greeting. Shame that staff at Reception didn't reciprocate the introduction and instead offered a much more casual approach. Room was average, shower door pulls out instead of sliding across so the water residue drips on the floor, the bed is too short for those taller than 5ft 6, the curtains do not pull across so there's little privacy and disturbance of light. Rooms are too close together so walls are not sound proofed, lifts are fast but can stop frequently, expect some construction noise near by. My room view over looked the river and faced office buildings. Also perhaps being picky, would have helped with a fridge and microwave but perhaps being in the financial district this is seldom used. Location wise, hotel is in a decent location, a subway is adjacent to the hotel

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I had to get my credit card company involved because they would not reimburse me. The manager was useless ans no one from the hotel would return my call. I would not suggest staying here - there are better options.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We try to come to New York once a year as it is one of our favorite places. We had a great stay at the Double Tree. Great staff, very comfortable room, comfortable bed, centrally located. We will be back again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Location of this hotel was fantastic for us; the view was lovely but we could get to the hustle and bustle of Times square within a few minutes by subway. The room was clean and a good size, and the beds were comfortable. Upon arrival we had a lovely warm cookie, I did find the entrance a bit strange though as you need to take a lift up to reception. Sometimes there was a wait for a lift, but never long enough to leave you annoyed. Overall I would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Ok my 3rd stay. Was bad 2asnt great I am learning a few things about the hotel. Stay on lower floors. Thaecwait for the elevator is as bad.Dont eat at the hotel Restaurant not even for Breakfast.Dont expect to feel like appreciated customer. This is NYC someone will need your room and the hotel knows it. Its location is good. And a great Pub next door so I will st stay here when required.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Have stayed here a few times for work because of location and this place is consistantly poor but expensive. I can never get a good nights sleep because there are always building works going on over night outside the hotel that are loud. The lift to the lobby takes ages to come so i have to allow 15 mins just to get out of the hotel in the morning. Having stayed in several hotels in nyc this is so overpriced for what you get. Avoid

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I had read some pretty horrific reviews about this hotels, specifically related to the elevators, but I didn't find anything unusually negative considering this was in NYC. The staff was friendly and the rooms were clean. It was also a quieter area of town and the bed was super comfy, so I got a great night's sleep. Yes, the elevators were smallish and slow, but I think that's typical based on other hotels I've stayed in while visiting New York. All in all it was a pretty typical experience with a typical price for the area.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: First impressions of this hotel are not good. You enter off the street into what looks like a basement corridor. There is no reception desk and indication of where to go until you get to the elevators at the end of the corridor where a sign directs you to the second floor. After a long wait for the elevator (an experience repeated daily), you ride to the reception area. It's a nice space. A little dark, but with plenty of comfortable-looking places to sit.My room about half-way up the building had a view only of a neighboring building undergoing renovation. Perhaps a higher floor would have a nicer view. The room itself was about as should be expected in a major city. It was not spacious, but had plenty of storage space and an armchair. The bed was quite comfortable. There is a coffee maker and safe, but no refrigerator or microwave oven. There are NO USB charging ports.If you eat in the hotel restaurant, be ware of the automatic 20% service charge.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is shoe-horned into a space in the financial district that makes it convenient to the subway (Whitehall stop on the R, W) and walking distance to Wall Street, but provides a cramped experience. The room is small, the hallways the narrowest I've ever seen, the elevators too few, slow, and small (people on lower floors going down with luggage have to wait for an elevator that isn't full). There's a small uninviting lobby and no food service. Overall, a place to stay in a clean room if you have to be in the financial district but not a place to hang out and relax.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I’ve never paid more for a hotel room and received LESS for my money. The bathroom was the size of a coat closet, with no place to put any toiletries. It took three requests and six days out of an eight-night stay to have a phone installed. No place to have breakfast, no place to buy toothpaste. BUT, the chocolate chip cookie was tasty.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: No real complaints about the hotel, other than the elevator being a long wait at times, the Internet only working the first day and the floor being constantly wet from the shower, so you'd have to put down a few extra towels.Other than that, Allen was always super friendly and Tony was a delight.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Convenient location in the financial district, small rooms but well equipped. The hotel staff is very efficient and the restaurant has a very good service. Close to the WTC and to the Brooklyn Bridge.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We had a fine stay here. This is a standard NYC hotel as far as size is concerned—(not typical for doubletree if that is your reason for booking). The room bathroom appears renovated with a nice appearance. The staff were nice and accommodating, especially the greeters downstairs. Yes the elevators were a bit slow but our experience wasn’t as overwhelming as other guests so we did not have an issue. As far as tourism, there’s a lot to see in lower Manhattan and the train station is a short walk from the hotel. Also, lots of healthy options to eat around the hotel which we appreciated. There is an Italian restaurant in the hotel but didn’t try it. The main downside was the cost. It was extremely pricey to stay here likely being that it was Columbus/Indigenous people weekend so you would’ve thought we were in SOHO on a typical weekend for the price. Unsure of the normal nightly rate but we would not normally pay so much for a weekend if we weren’t already planning on being in town. However, it was overall a good experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is well located in the center of the financial district and right on the metro station. Rooms are relatively ok, but it is visible that the hotel is older one. What was not good were breakfasts - quite "poor" breakfasts, not enough space and very unpleasant staff in the restaurant. Given the fact that the hotel was quite expensive it did not meet my expectations and I will search for another hotel next time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was a solid value in an expensive town. My room was small, but clean and comfortable, the staff was unfailingly polite and helpful. The location is excellent, near ferries and water taxis, the WTC is close by, as are several subway stations. There had been a problem with an elevator the week before I arrived, but it had been resolved before I checked in. My only complaint about the room was the bathroom. It was small, dimly lit and poorly designed - a large vessel sink took up most of the surface of the small vanity, leaving little space for personal items.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The only thing that saved this from being a disaster is that is it is a relatively new building. Two lights were out, hair around the bathroom, and the bathroom floor mat had rust. The iron shot out rusty water. The noise from garbage collection and construction was notable and did not stop until 11 PM. Staff said it would stop at 10 PM. General attitude: we are fully booked. Not rude (by New York standards), just seemingly bored with hearing the same old complaints. No empathy. No apologies.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Unlike recent reviews, I had a good experience. Bell staff greeted us warmly at the entrance. Front desk staff at 5pm was great at check in, but the overnight staff was less warm and somewhat uninterested in being helpful. Room was very clean and seemed to have been recently remodeled, yet small but typical of NYC. The elevators are slow so plan accordingly. It is a quiet neighborhood on the weekend but the river and subways are close by. A solid choice in lower Manhattan if you can a good room.
user_name:
Glob3trotterz
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Staff rude and unhelpful, bad customer service. Left standing while they continued their conversations no interaction whatsoever. Double charged for two rooms still awaiting refund & room deposits?Rooms in need of a good clean, vacuum & dusting!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This Hilton branded hotel is within walking distance of the financial district and the WTC, but it is a dirty, damp and smelly place. Our very small and cramped room was on the 6th floor. When we got off the elevators we were greeted by a heavy, pungent odor. Once in our room, the smell was worse. I asked the housekeeping attendant, who was in the hallway, if she would spray a deodorizer in the room. It worked temporarily. Within a couple hours, and once we had gotten into bed, the odor returned. It was in the carpets and drapes. The next morning we asked to be moved and we were accommodated. Our next room on the eighteenth floor was a bit larger, but the carpets ere so damp my socks got went. The bathroom towels looked clean, but there was a terrible smell to them.For the price, this is neither a value nor a pleasant experience. If Location matters more than cleanliness then you may be able to get over the other issues. Otherwise, stay away.Hilton should be ashamed to have their name on this venue.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Cramped dark roomsDamp carpets and showers leaked (dirty)Long wait for elevatorsOver-priced for what you getWebsite Pictures outdatedLocation is great - conveninet to several sightseeing highlights and subway stations

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is an embarrassment to the Hilton brand. Three lifts for 44 floors so you can wait for a very long time to get a lift. No restaurant for breakfast, unless you use the place next door. And, crowning glory, if you go to work at 7 am and.come back at 8pm, it's entirely possible that your room will not have been changed, as I found. No mini bar for cold drinks. What a joke of a place. Avoid at all costs.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here 6 nights and paid $293 per night purchased through Expedia. The location was perfect for what we wanted to see and do. The king room was small, with no view to speak of. Hallways were barely wide enough to get a large suitcase through. Our biggest complaint was with housekeeping. At various times we were missing toilet paper, wash clothes, coffee packets. Shampoo etc. was provided upon arrival and never refreshed the supply. The toilet seat was never lifted and cleaned. The sheets had several holes and several nights were not changed at all. Plastic water glasses and paper coffee cups were provided instead of glass. The mini fridge had some ripped up plastic stuck to the top. Furniture had gouges and chips out of it. Hanging around in the lobby were representatives bugging us to buy into their Hilton Time Share vacations places. The shower was fairly small but very hot and quite nice as was the very comfortable bed...two pluses. This place was definitely not worth almost $300 a night even it is was in NYC.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The pricing of this hotel is far too high when taking into consideration what it actually is. Firstly, only 2 elevators are available for over 40 stories that have to be reached, forcing us to go down the stairs 10 floors. In addition to that, they take forever and are the smallest I’ve ever seen. The halls are tiny, making it almost impossible to walk with luggage through them. Once we finally got to our room, it smelled like fast food, absolutely disgusting. Then, there’s also the fact that the breakfast that the hotel works with currently, is extremely poor. Lastly, the wifi is a disaster, it works from time to time and I needed to work, and couldn’t, due to the fact that it was so terrible. Overall, 400 dollars a night is just not worth it. A Marriott hotel near Manhattan is just fine, as opposed to this.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Tried 3 times to get someone to answer the phone to bring a replacement coffee maker that didn’t work. No one ever answered. The office chair in our room was worn and tattered beyond repair. The valet staff was ok. Way below expectations.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Never stay in this hotel. It's in the financial district but that's about the only good thing. No water/no mini bar/rooms are very dated/hallway is dirty/curtains don't close/it's very noisy/staff are rude & abrupt/lift didn't work so had to wait 20min or walk 10 flights if stairs (has 50 floors so could be worse)/air con was very loud/it was meant to be cheap but price went up (£240 per night) on arrival. Nothing good to say about it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: You should know by now that there is an ongoing problem with the elevators at this location. Honestly, give yourself an hour lead if you have to move your luggage by a certain time. Otherwise, it's what you should expect from an old hotel that doesn't seem interested in renovation. And of course, a lot of construction in the area is par for the course.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Finding a nice and affordable hotel in Manhattan was a mission. I was shocked to find the DoubleTree at the price I did. We arrived in New York on a Red Eye and were exhausted. Having plans to simply drop our luggage off, we were allowed to check in. In our first room, the heater seemed to be on despite the thermostat saying it was cooling. You could feel the heat from the hallway. The front desk was able to get us into a different room on a lower level. I was very grateful they got us into a lower level because the elevators were extremely slow and we took the stairs the majority of the time. The rooms were nice and modern, but very small from what we are used to. The hallways matched the compact size of the room but besides that, everything else was great. I would definitely stay here again due to the ability to easily get to Brooklyn, Midtown, and more.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This property is a big tricky to find. Stone street only runs for a block or two and the hotel lobby is on the second floor. The ground floor has a doorman on duty directing you to the elevator or steps. In our case it was steps because only two very small elevators worked and you often had a 15 min wait for the elevator. Rooms are small, updated bathrooms. Staff is great. I complained about the elevator service and my rate was adjusted. We were on the 8th floor and twice had to walk up because no elevator came. Usually walked down also. Location is great for any business in this end of Manhattan. Plenty of local bars and restaurants within walking distance. Near the bull and defiant girl. Alos native american museum is two blocks away free and interesting. They have a car service to the airports. $65 to JFK cash or credit. We used it and at the airport the driver said credit was $71 so somebody is messing up.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Elevators out of service, more than 20 minutes to get up or down with luggage, check in employees talking and not paying attention to guests coming in. Absolutely the worse experience in a Hilton property. None of this disclosed when booked recently. Will never stay here again. Call and check on construction, out of service challenges so you can make a more informed decision.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Ill start with my initial reaction: I felt the staff was pleasant and accommodating. Room was small but was clean and had a nice city view from 39th floor. Bed/pillows comfortable. Thought breakfast in the back room of the onsite Italian restaurant was unusual, tried it and never went back. There are plenty of other places to eat nearby. The hotel is under renovations so know the noise it can bring (wasnt bad). The elevator situation is the true negative. Everyone files in whether going up or down just to get inside. There are over 40 floors and only two working elevators when we were there. Positives: Location is close to subways, Starbucks and easy walk to WTC area. The desk staff was very friendly and Baggage area employees were helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Thers was an elevator down the whole time I stayed there. We had to wait 15-20 minutes for the elevator to arrive. It was very difficult because my room was on the 30th floor. Only Tony the bell man was there best part of the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good hotel, brilliant staff, nothing was too much trouble. Especially Kenya who was brilliant with our mobile problems, and the guys who look after the luggage were so helpful. Great location for subway and lots of good places to eat

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: When we checked in, the Reception staff clearly didn’t really want to be there and weren’t very welcoming. On our way to our room (we arrived about 6pm) the corridor was still littered with room service trays from the previous day. The room itself was well kept but the shower made a terrible noise when used. Additionally, like other guests have said when we had a fire alarm at 3am and needed evacuating, the staff didn’t really know what was going on and did little to put guests at ease considering the situation. Their handling of this was particularly bad and led to a lot of confusion and stress amongst guests, the staff didn’t seem bothered that most of the hotel were under the impression that they might burn to death in a high rise hotel fire at 3am given that some instructions were telling us to remain in our rooms, some were to go to the lobby, others were evacuating the building entirely. One of the most stressful experiences I have ever had, couldn’t wait to leave when we checked out.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We booked knowing the issue with the slow elevators so I won’t go into that. We stayed Saturday, Sept. 15 and Sunday the 16th. The room seemed clean, but there was no missing the musty mildew smell. Didn’t take long to figure out it was the wet carpet from the dripping air conditioner. We were only staying two nights and didn’t feel like dealing with a room change. Other guests said they had the same issue too. I sprayed perfume and hoped it went away. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The bathroom was very clean and updated. Water pressure and temperature in the shower were good. However, there’s no place for toiletries or much of anything. We were on the 31st floor and had a great water view. The hotel was okay but I expect more from a Doubletree. The same glasses sat outside our neighbors room the whole time we were there. Not their fault, I assume, but the fire alarm went off at 2:45am. Talk about being scarred on the 31st floor! Man on the speaker said it was an issue on the 12th floor. People on 11, 12 & 13 were to walk down to 9. The alarm kept going off and we were left to sit there and hope everything was okay. After a while they announced the FDNY cleared the floor and all was well. It was hard to get back to sleep! Side note . . . We recommend Broadstone Bar across the street for food and drinks. We had a few small plates and it was all delicious.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: For such a premium hotel it isn't reasonable for such a long delay to fix the lifts. A sign posted on the walls stated that there could be up to a 15-20minute wait - being on the 38th floor it's not easy to plan trips accordingly as suggested by the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms were clean, the hotel in general was nice and in a great place. The problem is that the elevators are small and slow so it will take you an extra 10-20 minutes to get either to or from your room. Even at 10:30 at night. It once took me over 30 minutes before I decided to walk down 29 flights of stairs.However, for the price you can not beat it. Every where else is 2x as much.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I struggle to find the words to describe how poor my experience has been. To begin, a 44 floor hotel only has two working elevators, one of which is periodically reserved for staff. As a result, when someone pulled the fire alarm at 3AM and the entire building had to go downstairs, there was a long queue for the elevator so I had to walk up 16 flights of stairs. Meanwhile the staff were unable to provide us with any information on what was going on.Add to that: a horrible smell in the room, a ringing sound in the ceiling due to water pressure issues, holes in the sheets and no coffee refills by housekeeping. I cannot stress enough how terrible this hotel is being run for the amount of money they charge. Hilton should be embarrassed that their standards have fallen so low, particularly in such a marquee location.Avoid, avoid, avoid.
user_name:
traveller201809506
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: New York City hotels are notoriously expensive, with rooms that are often the size of closets. The Doubletree Financial District offered really reasonable rates for Labor Day weekend, but I'm afraid I learned why after my first evening there.Having taken a redeye flight from the West Coast, I arrived at the hotel at about 8 AM on the Friday of Labor Day weekend. I knew there would be little chance of having a room available to check into so was prepared to check bags with the valet and come back to the hotel in the evening to officially check in. The front desk very generously offered me a voucher for free breakfast buffet in their downstairs restaurant since no rooms were available. They did not have to do this -- was a very nice thing to offer.I returned to the hotel at around 8:30 PM, ready to finally get into my room. There was a line of guests stretching from the elevators to the front door of the hotel. The hotel has an odd layout where the front desk and lobby are on the 2nd floor. But what was causing this huge backup was the fact that one of the three elevators was out of service! For a 44-story property, three elevators isn't sufficient so when one goes down, the entire hotel basically grinds to a halt. There was no valet downstairs so I could not pick up my bags. I walked up the stairs to the lobby to pick up keys. The front desk told me that the valet would eventually bring up my bags, but to be please be patient due to the situation with the elevators.About an hour later, the valet arrived with my luggage. I was actually pleasantly surprised it was only an hour as I was expecting worse. Luckily, I wasn't going anywhere else that night so I didn't have to deal with the elevator situation again. I went to sleep assuming that it would be taken care of by tomorrow. Unfortunately, the third elevator never went back into service so my entire weekend was spent with 15 - 20 minute waits for every elevator trip. When your room is on the 28th floor, taking the stairs isn't really an option. Needless to say, it's extremely inconvenient to add an extra 20 minutes into each trip on the elevator.To the hotel's credit, when I wrote to complain about how the elevator problem really made the weekend more difficult, they offered a sincere apology and Hilton Honors points. It's a tough situation for everyone, but the hotel really needs some work on it to have it meet Doubletree standards.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Elevators do not work and when they do they are SLOW. 10-15 minute wait at the ground entrance for the 1 1/2 elevators servicing 44 FLOORS!!! They are TINY and only fit 6 plus light luggage. You have to call the lobby to get your thermostat to work as there must be a lock out control. DO NOT accept transportation advise from the guys at the front door. They misrepresent costs of taxi/uber services so try and get you into one of their "buddies" vehicles. As a lifetime Hilton Diamond I've see it all and will NOT return to this location.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location couldnt be better for our very first introduction to NYC. Centrally located in the Financial District, with a few subway stations just around the corner and within a 5 minute walk to a hop on hop off bus stop. Beautiful places like the 9/11 memorial within a 10 minute walk. Id also recommend a visit to Battery Park on those humid city days. Cute little places to have breakfast or to have dinner nearby as well. We liked the Irish pub next door - a fun place to end the day.Rooms are tiny though. And the beds are so small! Annoying noice coming from the air regulator in the bathroom, same applies to the airco in the room. The view from the 37th floor made up for all that though. Staff at reception didnt seem to make an effort whatsoever, the rest of the staff was great. Always greating the guests with a smile and happy to have a chat.And the elevators.. yeah.. well, it often was a challenge. Especially during the morning rush and when its cooking outside.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Looks like they are doing some work there. Not all elevators are working and they are limited anyway for a hotel with so many floors, so you should get a room on a low floor and walk up /down the stairs.In the middle of the night staff opened my door, apparently at the request of another guest who did not know the room number. Not sure what the security protocol is here.Outlets in room are very limited. Either you make coffee or you charge your electronics.Apparently they have mildew and mold issues, there was a dirty commercial portable air mover in my room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is awkward. Registration 2nd floor, entrance ground level. Big waste of time by waiting for only 3 elevators for 40+ floors. Rooms are very small and also awkward layout. No where in the bathroom to put your toiletries. I kept my luggage on the floor no place to put on for an easy reach. Breakfast is not included in the price but I recommend going to the Dunkin Donut around the corner. Food was cheap and poor selection.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Lifts not working. Waited over 20 minutes to get to my room. Carpets dirty, mild in shower. Phone not working. Really surprised how bad a hotel in this location is. Also three check in staff dealing with one person whilst four people wait in line.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Under construction, elevators not working, hotel room carpet soaked, construction noises, room falling apart - peeling wallpaper, beat up furniture... the list goes on and on. I strongly recommend looking elsewhere

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: They have had a broken elevator for weeks, and don't tell you until you arrive that you need to allow 15-20 mins to wait for one, or take the stairs. Hard to do in a 43 story building. The AC in the lobby and hallways of the floors was not working so the wait til was exacerbated by incredibly hot temperatures which meant we were sweating thru our suits. Get your act together DoubleTree, this hotel is a disaster and my money will go elsewhere until you spend some of yours on bringing it up to acceptable standards.
user_name:
ClayD46
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: on GoogleIn July 2018, we stayed in this hotel with family. It is very good hotel with clean room, nice bathroom, cordial and cooperative staff. Location of hotel is very good. Subway station is very near and you can find every kind of good food around . I recommend this hotel for visitors with family. Good experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a decent hotel with good room and the location is really good; this is right on the subway lines and the charging bull is close by. Rooms are relatively good for NY and check in was good. This is a relatively safe area and the building is in good condition. However, it all depends on who is at the desk. I do not understand how any staff thinks they can talk like a boss with anyone let alone customers. The young interns are good but the managers talk to you like they are doing you a service by giving you any time even though you have paid money and are accounting for their salaries. At first, we were polite thinking they are having a bad mood but they only tried to impose themselves more. So, we ended up talking impolitely to make them sit up because they seemed to really dislike being talked back to and I did not understand why they are okay doing that themselves to customers; why be in hospitality industry if you can't be polite? We also moved rooms as the AC was not working and they had given us a lower floor before. Apart from the usual excuses of that this is not so and so's job and not doing anything worthy of reasonable service, they made us wait five hours to give us the key and didn't bother to check if the room was ready even though we did it ourselves and saw the room was ready. "Procedure," we were told but that's really lack of empathy and laziness. Again, they lost one of the items while moving and, as expected took two days and multiple managers and multiple reminders to get it done... all while it was with housekeeping. The managers and staff at reception really should be cleaning the dishes and doing housekeeping if they think being polite and enterprising is not something they are paid for.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The photo shown here says more than any review I can write. This hotel is simply unacceptable for business travel. The staff was nice however and the room was clean. Well located for meetings in the Wall Street area. Close to subway stops too.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Three elevators for 44 floors. Only one of them worked. One was perpetually stuck on one floor and one was gushing water. The employees did not seem to care, as if this was a common occurrence. No amount of cookies in the world would make up for the fact I had to take the stairs 12 floors every time I wanted to do something. I can't imagine being any higher, or having a handicap.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Pros of Doubletree ! - AMAZING view !-Great Room Service ! Bowtie w/ Salmon was PHENONOMAL. -Removed breakfast when I inquired :)-Very close to transportation-Very close to shopping and eateries-Complimentary waters and cookie depending what tier you are as a Hilton Member. -Comfy bed with soft pillowsCons of Doubletree-Only 2 working elevators w/ 44 floors. Unacceptable. I felt even more sorry for the couple who waited 15-20 minutes , and then decided to walk down the stairs. Due to limited elevator service, I didn't go to gym the way I hoped.-Breakfast ! There was limited options- and the bacon was extremely salty. And mediocre customer service at best. -No air in the elevators or hallway- A small shower-Outdated roomOverall, it was an okay experience but I wished it was better.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Got in late, welcomed with waters and a cookie. No free breakfast but coffee was great in the room, bed super soft, shower fine. In a very cute neighborhood if you have time to wander. For a place in the middle of the city, quiet and convenient.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Broken elevators with no signsBlack specs in water from sinkMosquitoes in the roomApathetic staffNot worthy of the doubletree name. Be prepared to carry your luggage down 15 flights of stairs or be trapped forever

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: When things go wrong, everything goes wrong. Labor Day weekend and the MTA scheduled subway track maintenance making it difficult to get to midtown. The hotel didn’t plan that so it’s not their fault. Of the 3 elevators 1 was broken and a 2nd was spotty. The posted it could take up to 20 minted to get an elevator. (44floors) Time est was about right. They also had no WiFi. Maybe you’ll have better luck...I won’t know- I don’t plan on giving them a 2nd chance.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: 2 out of 3 elevators did not not work for entire weekend over Labor Day .. wait was over 20 minutes to go up or down in elevator.. did not tell you until you get there and did not tell you until you checked in .. Totally not acceptable.. .!people carrying bags from upper stories down stairs to get out instead of having to wait 20 or moreMinutes . No apologizes .. just acted Like it was not a problem Room is so small , which Was no problem if you can Rlevati

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I thought the DoubleTree was one of Hilton's better brands. I was wrong. There is construction on Stone Street and it limits parking, except for City employees. There is no place to safely leave the car for the valet. Parking was several blocks from the entrance and we had to wait 20 minutes to get our cars -- since we had two cars, we were waiting 40 minutes! $60 per car, ouch!The hotel entrance is a small hallway and foyer with three elevators. The foyer shares an entrance with the restaurant next door. it was very odd. The elevator takes you to the second floor where you check in. Too bad breakfast did not come with the room.Check-in was quick and our room was ready. The rooms were clean and orderly. The shower door leaked and left a lot of water on the floor. The doors are very loud when they closed, waking me from a sound sleep at 6:00 am, and the sound from the deadbolt locks reverberated through out the floor.The hotel is in a good location and convenient for walking. Plan on an extra 30 minutes if you plan to valet your car!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We chose the hotel for its great location and were overall happy with our stay. The room was clean and quite comfortable, however, it was facing a dark courtyard and the windows were very dirty, so there was no daylight. We had an issue with the air conditioning, the systems seem quite old, but the staff is super helpful and managed to re-locate us in the middle of the night. Overall it is an ok hotel in a great location.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Today was the day from h*ll for us in this hotel. Woke up to no water available in any of the 44 floors. Returned after a busy day out and found only one elevator (out of 3) in working condition. Mind you this hotel has 44 floors. Also, the wifi is currently down. Pity the poor folks who are depending on it to check in for their Airline flights.Small room, leaking shower stall, loose toilet seat. No mjini fridge in room. But we lucked out in having an ice machine on our floor.Long wait times to use an elevator. (either up or down) A lot of grumpy staff, which does not surprise me.All this and over 200 bucks a night for a room. Oh, and they also put a $50 charge PER NIGHT on your card in anticipation of your tearing the place up.No explanations for all of the problems, no apologies for any of the inconvenience.Comlimentary bottled water available, but you'll have to brave the elevator problems to get down to 2nd floor where the desk is located in order to ask them for the water.Sorry all you Hilton Honors folks, but this place is a joke.To top it off, during all of these problems there was a hotel employee snagging people on their way in today to try and sell them on Hilton Honors.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed at the DoubleTree FiDi for a family trip to New York, largely because the location was convenient with the ferries and subway close by and the had a Junior Suite that would accommodate our family of four. When we arrived at the hotel, I expected that blankets and pillows would be in the room given that we had 2 adults and 2 kids on the reservation. Using the Hilton app, I requested that these be delivered while we were out at the theater and I received an acknowledgment from Vanetta that this would be done. I saved a screenshot of her confirmation. We returned after 11 to find that they were not delivered and the message had been deleted! It took almost an hour (with very tired kids) to get what we needed. On top of this, the couch was dirty, stained, and worn.Our AC was also leaking into the carpet giving a moldy smell to the room. When we spoke to the front desk the next day we were told there were no other rooms available but they would see what they could do. I was promised an email from Peter the GM, but ended up speaking to Enoch who offered to move us to 2 adjoining rooms instead.One of the new rooms still had the AC leaking into the carpet, but it was less moldy smelling!I had good experiences with Enoch and the bell staff, but problems were largely dismissed by other staff. I was told repeatedly that no one else had complained and that all they could do was ask for housekeeping, maintenance, etc. to act but that they could not do anything else to make sure it happened. As a Hilton Gold member I expect more and so should Hilton. The fact that the hotel was running at close to 100% occupancy means they don't have to!Platitudes from the front desk staff that they will try harder next time are worth nothing.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The room itself was fine, big bed with nice coffee/tea machine to make a coffee on the go.The entrance is odd as you have to take an elevator to the reception, and anyone can take that elevator without have to go through the reception.The elevator waiting hall is uncomfortable especially at night.We came back a few times late at night and it was dark and quiet and had to wait a time long for the elevator to arrive.The hotel is in a very quiet area at night with hardly any people on the street.For me as a very experienced female solo traveler I didn’t mind but I can imagine that when you are alone as a female it could be a bit uneasy.We also stayed in the Hilton metropolitan and there were a lot more people around.As a couple or with more people it’s fine.Hotel is in a good location for Statue of Liberty but it’s a bit out of the way if you want the ‘Times Square action’ in walking distance.Staff was friendly, and efficient.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Me and my wife traveled to NY for about three days, the hotel was great. The room was nice, comfy bed, nice bathroom and amazing service. Great location in the Financial District with a lot of places to eat, shop or just enjoy yourself. The only problem with the hotel is the SLOW elevators.. You get used to it, but I thought that it should be mentioned.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: stayed here 3 years ago and it is still good and convenient to where we wanted to go. My husband had to go into work for a day, and it was convenient to Water St in the Financial District, Staten Island Ferry, and Ferry to Governors Island

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Rooms were quiet, clean, great rain showers bathrooms, although a little on smaller side but the air conditioner's were nice and cold. Service was great, the guys at the door were welcoming. We just couldn't beat the location for statue of Liberty/Ellis Island departures, the Bull, not far from 911 and 911 shopping mall. Everything was fantastic

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: As the show 4 star hotel in website... But when we checked in we do not feel the hotel as advertised very poor service room was very small bathroom was very poor cleaning overall just wasted our time and money. Very unprofessional and route staff...

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Staff looked like they just wanted to go home. Issue with room, moved to diff room, even more issues . Did not want to move again so just tried to work with what we had. Was not the cleanest. Issues with aC system leaking water in carpet, used ice holder to keep water from leaking onto carpet. Sheets had hairs, and bed too soft as well as the pillows, felt like a water bed, body just sinks in. Water knobs in shower wee loose and falling off.One of the maintenance or engineering personnel was fixing a room, door open and laying in carpet and watching TV or videos on cell phone (at least hide yourslef)Need to keep a routine maintenance check to solve those little issues than can potentially grow into bigger problems.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: TINY room, poorly maintained (no hot water, phone broken, outlet didn't work) very nice staff though! Justinos pizza was walking distance and amazing! Parking is $40/ night but close by- probably reasonable for Manhattan?

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel was great. Just what we wanted for a few nights. Close enough to walk to Battery Park and get the ferry to the Statue of Liberty and pick up the Big Bus Tours to check out the rest of Manhatten. Close to Wall Street and the 9/11 Memorial is walkable.Room was clean and a good enough size for the 4 of us (2 adults and 2 kids aged 5&2) and beds were comfy. WIFI worked perfectly well.Staff on check in and check out were great.One tip though is leave a little extra time when using the lifts as you can wait a long time and often arrive full which wasn't ideal with a buggy/stroller.Would stay again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Small but clean room. Compact bathroom with narrow shower. Double bedswere not made for two adults. No real floor space or chair for a desk. TV was huge for a small room. Lots of storage space and safe in closet. No microwave or refrigerator.Corridors are narrow. But on 4th floor there was an ice machine right in the hallway.Lobby on 2nd floor. Elevators got busy around 9pm. A bit noisy on the street; I was not expecting that in that area.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is the perfect location, close to many attractions and subway stations, restaurants and bars. Downtown is a bit quieter, so it is very pleasant to come back to and get a good nights sleep. The staff is superb. Welcoming, helpful, friendly. The room was extremely clean and well appointed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is located in the middle of the city. The subway is in the street. 9/11 memorial is a couple blocks from the hotel! For some greet breakfast by Essen you have to walk one blok from the hotel and also for a great diner you havent to walk that far.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The outside of this hotel needs a facelift. The ground floor is hot and not pleasing to the eyes. There are like 4 elevators and all of them are slow as hell because there are 40+ floors so it takes forever to go up and down. The hallways are small and so are the rooms but that's expected. I found my room to be cleaned to my liking. The toilet ran and the A.c gave off a burning scent at times.There weren't always cookies available and I asked twice! I also had a package delivered and UPS informed me it was taken by front desk. No one could find my package for 2 days! I was legit about to raise some hell up in there!! Allan was able to find it for me so I was happy about that. There were many places to eat around: BKing, Dunkin Donuts, Starbucks, Essen for buffet breakfast, and a few taverns etc. This hotel is also in walking distance of Wall Street and the Staten Island Ferry. Many sites to see that aren't too far away. Check out was as easy as check in. The only way I'd think of staying here again is if I was able to get a good HHonors deal as I had this time around. But there is no way I'd pay almost 200 a night to stay here.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location is great, it is a nice hotel, cheaper than a lot of other hotels in the area and one that offers familyrooms. I booked two family rooms (2x double bed) but ended up with 4 rooms (2 connecting ones) what was nice because that means we had more space. But we had to wait for more than an hour before we could get into the rooms (we arrived after 3pm so ar check in time). We were told we had to wait for 10 minutes but it was more than an hour. That is a long time - traveling with 4 children and wanted to go discover the city. Two rooms were on the 9th floor, the other ones on the 19th floor. We didn’t had a curtain in our room. The elevators are a disaster and it takes like forever to be able to catch one. The coffee and tea are nice and the refill it really often. The toileteries are good quality. It is clean and the staff - except for the woman that checked us in - is really nice and kind and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I read a lot of different reviews of this hotel and whilst some were good, I would stay only one was accurate. This is I would say a 3+ star hotel(details below) with 4 and 5 star service, especially as regards the customer service and room service. Yes there are only 3 lifts for 44 floors, but the longest we ever had to wait was 5 minutes, except on day my sister waited 20 minutes, due to people leaving- that happens in any hotel!! The rooms were fine and cleaned daily. I will give a special mention to Ramses with his knowledge of New York, Simone, Harry, Tony and Tina who were extremely friendly and made our stay even better than it was. Also the hotel were extremely accommodating, even though the booking agency had got one of our rooms wrong and there was nothing they could do about it- my advice book with the hotel direct!! The hotel's location is superb and there is is subway just 2 minutes away. Chinatown on Canal Street is 40 minutes walk away off Broadway. Also the free Governor's and Staaten Island ferry is just a few minutes away too. Wall Street is just around the corner where you will find Starbuck- I love the coffee! and lots of place stop eat. Tony, we had a fantastic ride back to the airport and thanks for making us laugh Harry- You are all stars. I cannot recommend this hotel enough and we will definitely be using them again when we visit. By the way the rooms varied in size but were comfortable and normal for rooms in financial districts- trust me I have stayed in a few.. Only missed a fridge, hence the 3 stars instead of 4 star hotel, as used to fridge in the 4 and 5 star hotels I say in, but air conditioning will keep room cool enough for most mediations, unless it has to be kept in fridge like insulin. (Fortunately did not need fridge this time!) Still we loved it and highly recommend it. By the way the bathrooms were not that small, just normal for district.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I really think this is one of the worst Hilton hotels in their entire chain; I'm diamond member and have stayed in hundreds of their hotels around the world. I walked into my room, and the AC was broken; they switched me to another room, and it seemed freezing. when I turned up the temp from 68 to 69, the heat came on, so it was either freezing, or heat! It's 90 degrees outside. The toilets don't work properly in the bathroom. The walls are paper thin, and I could hear my neighbors tv past midnight. The wait for an elevator is the worst I have ever experienced in any hotel, anywhere. Only thing going for this hotel is it is conveniently located 1 block from major subway station (Bowling Green) that will pretty much get you anywhere in Manhattan or Brooklyn. Someone in Hilton management needs to seriously re-evaluate the service and conditions of this hotel and figure out how to fix it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at the Doubletree in the financial district without doing much research; the price was right and that's what mattered for a one-night stay. But I was pleasantly surprised! The hotel is 1/2 block from the W and R subway lines that take you midtown/uptown in about 15 minutes. My room was on the 6th floor overlooking a construction site so noisy during the day but quiet at night. You can (of course) request a room on a higher floor with a city or river view for a little more $$$. The room was a good size; bathroom was a little tight but totally OK with a good shower, sink and toilet and pretty nice towels. Very comfy bed; nice linens and a coffee/tea maker. Air conditioning worked well in the sweltering heat (just a bit noisy) and wifi coverage was good throughout. As others have noted, the elevator can take some time to get to you but other than that, a great place to stay in the city at a reasonable rate.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at the Double Tree Financial District during my recent trip to Manhattan and I wan not disappointed!! From the moment I walked in the staff made me feel like family. Every single staff member was friendly and helpful from the front desk, to the porters. I appreciated the warm cookies and water I received upon check in. The Jr. Suite I stayed in was super clean, had a huge comfortable bed and two huge TV's. I will say that the bathroom was a little small, but it was newly remodeled and beautiful. I highly recommend this hotel! It is close to the subway and the ferries and it's in a part of town that is surrounded by great restaurants and bars, but isn't crazy crowded. I will definitely be back!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Everything was perfect except the elevator. There are 44 floors but only three elevator. There's only one button for the elevators(which means only one elevator stops per a cycle), so if there are many people using it, especially in the morning or evening, and if you're staying in middle floors, it's almost impossible to use the elevator. You need to expect that you'll wait for 5 to 10 mins for the elevator in rush hours.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: You must first take an elevator to the 2nd floor to get to the front desk. At evening/night, there were plenty of mosquitoes at the entrance of the elevators. My room wasn’t properly cleaned at check in! I found an empty box of condoms, an empty water bottle, and a hair brush underneath the bed at check in! Strands of hair were in my shower! Check in just wasn’t pleasant for me. I also ordered room service which took nearly an hour to be delivered. It’s summer time and I often like to enjoy fresh air, I cracked the window (on the 9th floor) and mosquitoes took over my room. However, I closed the window over night and woke up with plenty of bites on my body. I don’t ever complain about hotels, ever, but today I had to take the time to say that this is the worst hotel I’ve ever stayed at in NYC. The rooms are also very compact!! - on a positive note, the doorman, if you will, were very polite and welcoming, the rooms have an exceptional design and bedding.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location was good. Ferry to Statue of Liberty is at walking distance. Beds are comfortable. A couple of metro stations nearby which made it easy to commute. A complementary service/gift would have been nice for occasions like anniversaries or birthdays, but unfortunately they don’t take such requests.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Had a wonderful vacation Saw all the favorite New York attractions Enjoyed the meals, tours and broadway play. 9-11 memorial was awesome Empire State Building was beautiful at night Hope to return again

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I've stayed here before, great hotel, close to Statue of Liberty, Wall Street, 9/11, Brooklyn bridge. lots of places to eat, old Stone Street has a ton of bars and restaurants. 2 minute walk to the Bull. train station on the corner, easy access to Brooklyn. Rooms are small, beds are very comfortable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is located near a lot of places to eat from casual eating to sit down. The subway is very close. Walking distance to Wall Street and Ground Zero. Hotel staff is helpful Kudos to Elizabeth, William, and Robert. Rooms are very small but comfortable. Elevators are slow, so be patient.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I know this sounds trivial. However this hotel easily takes top marks for the worst elevator. Two are always running, a third when not being used to take out the trash..... literally. All are equally slow servicing all 44 floors. They are not vented well and gather all the humidity from each of the poorly temp controlled floors as it runs - so hot. Great place for hot yoga if it weren’t crammed with people desperate to get on it. Beyond that the room is good, bed comfortable. Was told at check in that I had vouchers(diamond) for a full breakfast. Contrary to what I was told, day two was rudely chased out of the door by the waiter asking for money, hen telling us it’s only good for the buffet. The buffet is a joke. Had he been present in the past ten minutes he wouldn’t have had to chase us. Additionally wanted to charge us for the English muffin that I gave from my meal to my counterpart. Wow. Could have been handled so much better! Needless to say that was the last meal we had there and for the rest of our week were happy to pay for all meals elsewhere.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for only 2 days. Convenient coz it’s close to Duane Reade and couple of cheap food trucks nearby.And it’s close to shopping mall as well, only 10 minutes walking to Westfield Trade Centre.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: In the first place we got a room with a huge leakage on the ceiling (which apparently was also affecting all the other floors above and below our room). Even though the leakage was evidenced, and the room was not in an acceptable condition, the hotel rent us the room and as I could hear to other customers as well. To apologise they offer to wash the clothes that had been damaged because of the leakage but they lost my boyfriends’ shirt, that he needed to work on the next day. We spent a big part of our trip trying to solve these issues with the staff and I feel profoundly disappointed. I would never recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I had in mind to have a comfortable night in NYC, south Manhattan, and went after known names in the market. The hotel offered good price, great location. It all looked good. But since I got there, it seemed that they found an already built building and decided to fit a hotel in it. The rooms and corridors are narrow and never saw a reception in the second floor of a hotel. There is no place for you to park during check-in (ok, that’s NYC, folk) but you literally enter the hotel from its back. I left my wife and kids in the car, got an elevator to reach reception, and went to ask information, but I was checked-in in couple of seconds, got my rooms keys, and quickly took my stuff to my room. That looks good, except for the fact that the receptionist didn’t ask any questions about who’s entering the room with me, and that seems a very serious issue concerning the security of the hotel. It looked like you can bring in whoever you want. Next morning, went to a small restaurant where we’re supposed to have breakfast and I was asked for vouchers. “Which voucher?!” “The receptionist should have given you”. Leave your family and your good humor, go up one floor, ask for breakfast vouchers. By the way, the poorest breakfast in America. Hilton is no longer synonym of luxury hotels anymore. Oh, but there’s parking at the hotel, one block down the street. Don’t forget to ask the receptionist for stamping your parking ticket, otherwise you may have to return to hotel to get it done, and if it’s raining ... the bedrooms are clean, but politeness is not a crew’s strength. That’s just in one night, for me that’s enough.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is in the heart of the Financial District. Very convenient to all the local restaurants. Very costly when it comes to food but its NY. Wonderful Hotel and the Staff was amazing...this is a nice property. Nice rooms.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My wife and I stayed for two nights, and used a hilton rewards certificate for one night. When we got there, we had to explain to the check-in staff multiple times that we were there for two nights, not one. I've done the same before at other hilton properties, but this was the first time it was an issue. Additionally, while we were waiting in line to check in, someone else came up and was trying to get our info, related to "Hilton Grand Vacations". I don't pay to visit a hotel and get sold a timeshare while waiting in line. Our second day, we got back to our room and our keys didn't work. The woman at the desk said because we had two bookings, we had to go down and have the keys reactivated. She acted like this was our fault - and that we should have known all this. No other time I've used a reward certificate in combo with a booking has this been a problem.The room was fine, other then the shower leaked water all over the floor. The hotel is 44 stories, and has 3 elevators. We had long waits for elevators, and lots of stops up and down. I would suggest a floor low enough you can take the stairs if you don't want to spend 10 minutes trying to get to your room and back. The breakfast included as a gold member is the worst I've ever had at a hilton hotel. It's in a tiny room with only 5 tables. The hot food was OK. The first day there were no drinks - no coffee, juice, water, milk. The second day the waiter brought us some water, after we asked (saw other guests do the same). There is a hampton inn nearby, I will stay there if I ever need to be in the Financial district again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here when visiting our daughter who lives in Wall Street and prior to a cruise. It is a great wee hotel and the room was quite big compared to usual NYC rooms. We have a great shower which was great. The location is quieter than the busy Times Square area but suited us and easy access to the subway across the road. Stone street where the hotel is is quite but the other part of stone street is where the rest of the bars/restaurants are. The Irish bar next door was good. However although the food was great in the restaurant attached to the hotel, being served wine in a plastic glass was not on. Will be back next time we are in NYC

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I changed to this hotel, thinking paying the extra amount for a Hilton hotel in New York would be worth it, but unfortunately not..Rooms are small enough. Staff are friendly.Some of the reviews relating to slow lifts are a really a point of perspective. We came to a lift and it appeared after 2mins although the person waiting said it had been 10.mins and then complained that it would stop at every floor on the way down but isn't that the point of a lift that it stops at floors to let people on and off.It can be a bit slow but it is a 44 story building.Beds are comfortable but both myself and wife did get bed bug bites. The hotel really needs to address this as it seems to be a recurrent theme of comments.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location and friendliness of staff were the only positives about this location. The room was very small (not sure if this is the way NYC hotels are) and dingy smelling. The AC was very hard to stabilize temp in room. It was either freezing or hot and it also broke on the 2nd day. The shower was so small that at 5'4 I barely fit and it would flood the bathroom floor everyday.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Doubletree was a great stay! Plus Hilton Honors gets you free water and cookies which is nice! Clean, modern room. Wish it had an in room refrigerator but other than that good overall for price and stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I really like this hotel which is great location. You can get in the subway for R,W,4,5,6 line! within a few minutes Starbacks is aound the corner! You can walk to charing Bull!, Wall Street, Ferry to Statue of Liberty. Not too far from One World Trade Center.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The best thing about this hotel is the location. You can walk to Battery Park where you get on your cruise to the Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island. You can walk to Wall Street and the 9/11 Memorial & Museum. It is on a quiet street with a nice bar/restaurant across the street, a drug store around the corner and a Starbucks around the corner as well. There are other places to eat nearby as well. The price of this hotel is fantastic if you are shopping Manhattan prices. The downsides: the room was very small and the elevator situation is unacceptable. It is extremely, extremely slow. We stayed on the 11th floor and ended up dragging our suitcases up and down the stairs (not fun.) The ceiling leaked water from the unit above us and got my clothes wet in my suitcase. If you're on a budget and seeing things in the financial district, go for it, but be aware of the downsides.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed 2 nights for a family trip. We could walk to Statue of Liberty cruises, Freedom Tower, great restaurants on Stone Street and South Seaport. Rooms were small and elevators were slow but the friendly staff more than made up for it. Special thanks to Allen & Tony at the Bellhop. Always smiling, friendly, helpful. Remembered our names and always fist bumped our kids. Sad there were no chocolate chip cookies :(

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The financial district might not be the first choice when your primary activities are going to be mid-town, but this hotel is a bargain for Manhattan. If you don't mind walking a bit to catch the subway it's easy to get to other areas. There are good restaurant options in the neighborhood.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Horrible experience,  Ill start with the ok, I was offered an upgrade for being a Diamond member to the 44th floor, room 4407 to be exact, While quite small it was a nice cozy room. But the nightmare of being all the way on the 44th floor has its problems. I stayed for 10 days, and not once was I able to get either down or up on the elevator in under 20 minutes, This was the average wait time just to board it, The entire staff uses the same elevators including all the housekeepers and workers. Not once do they offer to wait, They just push them selves into it. But here's the real problem, On 7/14/2018 in the morning while in the elevator heading down with 8 yes 8 other people it stops around the seventh floor. It was stuck for over 30 minutes, with zero ventilation or air able to get into then elevator. The alarm in the elevator and the fire department also located in the elevator didn't work. Luckily we had phone service, One of the phone's called the front desk, Who was of zero help, She told us that this is the first time that this happened (Which is actually a lie, As the Bellhop the following day said it gets stuck all the time) She mentioned that it would be less than 5 minutes before it was running again, So after 25 more minutes we told her to call the fire department, As even oxygen was getting scarce, and panic had set in we asked the front desk to call the fire department in which she actually refused to do. So we called on an additional cell phone on our own, Just as the Firetruck was getting dispatched the elevator moved, We all got off the very next floor and walked down the stairs. I had such a horrible experience that I checked out a day earlier than I was supposed too and stayed in a different hotel. Zero compensation or even an apology were never extended my way.I dont want to even get started on how terrible the Breakfast Buffet was.I will never stay in this hotel again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is located in the financial district which I think is a good location and easy to get to all major attractions in new york. The subway is quite close and within walking distance. Lets start with the good things: Lobby – very nicely done it looks very professional and clean. It’s a good welcome to the hotel itself. The staff were very friendly and professional. Okay here goes the bad things. Bearing in mind that I have spent time in many Hilton hotels over the years and have been a diamond member. These have been at varying levels of cost and quality. Room – Standard size, same amenities that you would get any Hilton. Coffee machine which is fine, the linen was old and did have a whole in there. The iron needs replacing and ironing board also. The air conditioning is loud and I believe was damp on the carpet underneath. There is one sofa seat as well. There was no bath but shower which had decent pressure. The sink was too big and there was no place to put my shower gels, etc. Food – When I checked into the hotel bearing in mind it was my first time in new York I was actually quite excited about the breakfast and food in the hotel. I checked the menu in my room and was really disappointed to see it was standard menu that you would find in the uk. To add the menu was in such a tatty state, it was falling apart. In the morning I went to check on the breakfast. The food is served in a partner restaurant at the bottom of the hotel, I have not been more disappointed in hotel food in my life. There was a very limited selection of food, for the hot food, there was scrambled eggs, cardboard bacon, bad sausages and pancakes. There was no fresh rolls or croissants, the fruit seemed to be canned. I should have known that there was something wrong after there was no one in the restaurant for breakfast in the morning. Lifts- There are only 3 lifts in the building and they are constantly in use by the guests and the staff. The staff (not the receptionists or public facing staff) use the lifts themselves even if there is only one level for them to go. They could easily walk this but I don’t know why they don’t. They are constantly busy and at peak times you can wait for 20 minutes for the lifts. Overall a good location but that’s about it, unfortunately I have been told that hotels in New York are expensive but I expected more from a hotel that costs over 200 dollars per a night. I would not stay here again and cannot recommend it to anyone.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location with easy access to the subway. Our room was a decent size and very comfortable. The parking garage was close by and reasonably priced. We went to visit the NYU campus and catch a Broadway show and the staff was very helpful with giving us directions to various locations.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Meh. I guess this is what you get for just under $200 a night in the Financial District. I guess I am used o Q-tips, nicer soaps, a fridge. The rooms was pretty clean, not spotless.... and smelled fine too. Bed was very comfy. But whatever. I specifically requested a room with a tub... and they gave me a shower room... I switched it out with little resistance from front desk. Then, when I took a bath, (my solution to a cross country flight) I was interrupted by knocking at the door and a man's voice. I ignored, they continued, I got out and told them to go away, I hadn't ordered anything. I was a little frightened. I returned to the bath, anther knock, and a few more. Again I told them to leave. They said it was security. Now, I would think someone would call first, before sending two different men to a room with a single female occupant. No way am I answering that door, especially still dripping from a bath. I called the front desk and they said the room below me had a leaking ceiling and they had to check the room. They said they had called first... but I heard nothing. The phones are weird so who knows. They offered to send a woman from front desk up with the man but said they did need to check the tub. I decided instead to vacate the room. They called me shortly to say it was ok and fine to return. After I complained and asked to cancel my next night, which they refused a refund for... they instead offered to switch me to another room, with a view, and complimentary breakfast. Overall, it is fine. These things happen. But I would not stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I usually always try to book and stay at the Hilton properties but next time I'm going to avoid this Doubletree Hilton. I was on a business trip and was switching hotels.I checked out early in the day and remember that I've forgotten my watch charger and a shirt after I've arrived at work I gave them a call and told them that I've forgot them in the room ( maybe an hour or two after my checkout) I was told they would contact me back and they didn't I've had to go back to the hotel after work and I asked them if they were able to locate it. They told me I had to wait which I did 30 minutes and then they I told them this is taking too long and to give me a call if they do locate them and of course 3 minutes after i left they said they couldn't find anything. The Shirt was in the hanger and the charger was next to the TV I'm truly sad that this was my DoubleTree Hilton experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Loved the staff great location.Bit tiny room but the large tv to most of the attention of the size of rhe room.Clean and roomservice kept it so.Didn't notice any noise from the street even though we were on the 4th floor.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is just insanely frustrating. I stay at Doubletree and Hilton properties regularly - and this is the worst one I've stayed at. Pros: 1) Room was relatively clean 2) Bed was comfortable.3) Breakfast at the restaurant next door is good (and included in some reservations).Cons: 1) Elevators are SO SLOW... and the lobby isn't on ground floor... so every time you need something, you wait for the elevator and then get off on level 2. then wait AGAIN for ANOTHER elevator to go to your room. I timed it last night. It took 7 minutes to get from the ground floor to my room because I needed to stop at the front desk to pick something up. Absurd2) Rooms are TINY... you can barely walk around in them and 2 people cannot pass each other in the room. Even by NY standards - it is SO SMALL3) Noise - we had to move rooms because the screeching from the broken plumbing in other rooms was so awful we were up all night. They told me they didn't know what we were talking about - but then 2 other guests in the elevator said they had also been complaining. The old plumbing needs repair.4) Poor staff service. Other than the manager (who I corresponded with on text... not in person); the staff were not helpful or accommodating.
