And to be honest, the manager could have done more to help with the absurd noise our area of rooms was dealing with. One of them actually SCOLDED me for losing my breakfast ticket/voucher. What am I, 5 years old? Just stay elsewhere - this hotel is the pits. I suspect it will not be a Hilton property for long - it just doesn't meet their standards.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here with my son when we came to New York City to celebrate the end of his GCSEs. We chose the hotel mainly because I know the Doubletree brand and also the location in Lower Manhattan is good. The location is definitely the high point - right by Battery Park, the hotel is ideally situated to explore Liberty, Ellis and Staten islands and the financial district. We spent an entire day doing this. There is also a subway station at the end of the street for exploring the rest of the city. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and courteous throughout our stay. We had a view of the Freedom Tower from our window which my son loved. But the hotel itself is a little disappointing. The decor in the rooms is very tired and in need of a refresh. The air-conditioning unit is effective but incredibly loud which makes it difficult to sleep at night. So you have a choice of the 35 degree NYC humidity or being kept awake by the rattly AC. The lobby is on the first floor (American second floor) so the welcome on the ground floor is underwhelming. There are only two lifts so the wait is sometimes really long - 10 minutes plus, which when you're on the 32nd floor is tough. The restaurant is not actually part of the hotel but a separate restaurant next door with an interconnecting door. Don't waste your time having breakfast here - there are tons of much better places to have breakfast a short walk away. Pearl Diner, on Pearl Street, would be my top recommendation as it's an original American diner where nothing has changed since the 1950s. Overall the hotel wasn't worth what I paid for it. There are better options in New York City.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here with my family one weekend. Price was reasonable for NYC. Location was convenient and right in Battery Park. Room was small and the king size bed took up 1/2 the room. Great Irish tavern downstairs.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: i was here on a friday and saturday so the area was super quiet. it's close to a chipotle and very close to the subway.the hallways are kind of cramped and the elevators can take a while since they get crowdedroom was spacious for a NY hotel and clean. they had a good rate on booking.com when i booked for three nights (you get the third night free). got some natural light from my window although it was small. staff was great, especially the concierge. easy to walk to the 9/11 memorial. area was safe.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed there for 3 night for work. If it wasn't for work I probably wouldn't stay. got a room on the 16th floor but the view was blocked by another building. Had to wait a very long time for lifts, especially during peak times. Toilet looked worn out and the shower curtain was smelly! The breakfast buffet was so poor I decided to go out for breakfast. I will not be in a rush to go back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Wonderful hotel in a very crowded neighborhood. Staff was extremely helpful and the view from our room was gorgeous! Kids loved the warm cookies on arrival. I would definitely recommend this place for anyone.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I want a hotel to be cleaner and have decor that is at least on a par with my home. This venue was some way off the mark and would not recommend this anyone. Room appeared tired and needed a good refurbishment decided that the hotel relies on its location and just turns over the room. Novotel where we stayed two years ago and only a block away was much better, cleaner and with modern decor.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at the Doubletree for 4 nights at the end of June. On arrival which was late around 2am they were 2 staff at the front desk checking in no line just myself and one other couple came up to the 2nd floor where the lobby is located. I had the less competent of the two as she could not seem to get me situated. The couple was dealt with by the other lady within 5 mins and about 3 more people came and left after that and I was still waiting. Eventually I was told the room I booked(King Room city view) was not available so I was placed in a room with 2 double beds for the night and given complementary water(2 small bottles) and breakfast. The next morning I had breakfast. It was nothing spectacular and not a very wide selection. The basics fruit,toast, bagels, pancakes, pastries bacon and tater tots and a few other things. Got to check out of my room the next day and into the room I booked around midday. The room had a slightly smoky scent when I entered. Also the heaters in the bathroom took a lot longer to kick in. Like 10 mins for the shower to heat up. The other problem I had was with the temp control. I tried to turn the ac down a bit since the room was getting too chilly and then it just went kaput and started blowing hot air. After like 5 mins of trying to figure out on my own or waiting to see if it would readjust on its own I got frustrated and called to have maintenance come check it out. They came about 15 mins later by that time it was just overbearing. And that was on the same day I was getting ready to check out and trying to get all my stuff together didn't improve my mood. Checking out was a lot smoother however I checked my online banking to see I had been charged more pending than was on my booking so I made an inquiry and sure enough they had the wrong rate by an extra 20 a night which is an extra 40 a night in my currency which is A LOT. I'm not sure it would have been changed if I didnt draw it to their attention. The best staff were the guys at the entrance. A special mention to Allen who was super helpful with my luggage. Overall for the prices in NYC I need the service to match and I was let down by the service at Doubletree. The location is great with plenty restaurants closeby, the rooms are comfy and well designed but some fine tuning needs to be done with the staff and maintenance of the facilities.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I will start off by saying that if you read reviews on this hotel you will see a couple things that repeat review after review. One... the elevator situation. Really bad. Especially if you are on a higher floor. There were times I had to wait up to 20 minutes for the elevator to arrive. At one time.. out of the three elevators only one was working. There was a line for the elevator out the ground floor all the way up the block. Not sure why the hotel has not addressed this issue. Like I said its been the talk of multiple reviews. Another thing is the rude front desk. Another common issue. If you don't like your job you should probably should find a different job. Just standing there to check in multiple people were angry with the front desk service. Ok. Now on to the room.Our first room was on the 37th floor. We had to change rooms due to the air conditioner leaking water all over the floor. Sopping wet all around the bed. The carpet was had mold. So this had been going on for awhile. The air conditioner grill was broken and only half of the unit was blowing air. The air blowing out the vent... too smelled like mold. So after going down and talking to the front desk girl, she was rude and said they didn't have any rooms available. My wife started to get irritated. She finally got us a new room but it wasn't ready yet. So we left and came back later to another front desk clerk. This one was very nice. She told us that she was putting us on the top floor. I guess these were newer remodeled rooms. This is were we stayed the rest of our stay. Not to say that there weren't issues but we dealt with them. Hair left in the shower after the maid cleaned. Also she did not restock anything. Shampoo. Ect...The phone didnt work. The TV was acting funny. also the long wait on the elevator... Like I said we just dealt with it. I wish Management would deal with these issues. The hotel is in a great area. It just needs some attention ASAP. On a brighter side. The door men were the best. They helped us with everything we needed. With a smile. If it wasnt for them I would have rated the hotel less than average. We will not stay in this hotel again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Location was excellent, close to a variety of transport options and plenty of food outlets. Staff were efficient and friendly. The room was of adequate size and well serviced. The cookies provided on arrival were appreciated!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is located near the tip of Manhattan. You get a breeze due to close proximity to the river and it is a nice breeze. It is close to the subway and it is close to the South Street Seaport. It is in a great area for walking. I highly recommend it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Me and my son had a great vacation to the city for the Fourth of July. Hotel was comfortable, clean, and friendly staff. Hotel was conveniently located to the subway, great food and entertainment. Hotel staff was welcoming and very helpful with directions and recommendations for sights, food, and entertainment.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! This has to be the WORSE hotel I have ever stayed, there is a food tray seating outside for for night! (see pictues), my room has not been visit or clean. There is so much NOISE and door SLAMMING that it's impossible to sleep. The elevator bell it's so LOUD and it goes on every time the door opens.DO NOT STAY HERE!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is the third time my husband and I have stayed at this Double Tree, and we could not be more satisfied. From the minute we walked in to the hotel to the minute we left, we were always greeted or asked about how our stay was going by every hotel staff member. It's these simple gestures that make our experience at your hotel so worthwhile.Upon receiving our accommodations, we were placed in a city view room on the 43rd floor. The room and the views were amazing and so considerate of the staff to place us in such a great room! Everyone at the Double Tree genuinely wants their guests to feel welcomed and have a comfortable stay. You have no idea how we appreciate this and the time taken to do this. There is no doubt we will be back again and again. By far, of all the Hiltons we have stayed at in New York City, this has been our favorite!
user_name:
jennstuds713
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was our first visit to this property. The hotel is in a long, tall, narrow style building in the Wall Street financial district. The small three elevators from the entry point in the street level entrance gets busy and over whelmed at various times to service the 40+ floors. The front desk for check in is located on the second floor. Also, the hotel restaurant, which is a local restaurant as well, is located and accessed via the street level entrance. The breakfast menu, selections and service was not up to par for what I expect from a Hilton property. Also, the rooms, furniture and amenities need an upgrade at this property, besides addressing the elevators and restaurant issues. If it was not the interaction with the friendly hotel staff and managers, this property could easily slip into a "two" rating with the negatives that need work, but it also has the potential to be a "four" rated property as well, if the owners / management start to work on the deficiencies we encountered.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We had issues with a homeless guest in the main lobby and the elevator. The elevator had a very strong odor of human urine and feces. The main entrance is NOT monitored at night and anyone can access the ground elevator from the street. The rooms were clean. The elevator was not. The Italian restaurant next door was amazing!! I paid over $1000.00 for 3 nights and will not be back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Got this as a great deal through Hotwire, which was good, so can't complain there.Hotel is on the end of the island of Manhattan, so if you want to explore the Statue of Liberty or those attractions like wall street, this is the place for you. You're at least 30 mins from midtown so take that into account.Check in was nice, the entrance is odd and there is a TV playing odd things in the elevator welcome lobby. Lobby is on floor 2 and the agents were nice and efficient. Even though I couldn't get points she did take my number to get credit for the stay and got two free bottles of watter, so that was great.Elevators are not enough for the number of floors of the hotel and while there are only 9 or so rooms on each, elevators take FOREVER during peak times. Our room 2403 was fine. Bed was nice and the shower was too, but that's about all I can say about it. The room looked like it had someone who was on a bender in it before us, the lamp shade was broken, the grate on the HVAC too, and the desk chair was peeling. I guess it was clean? It seemed fine.Also the bathroom sink is ridicuilous- its a raised bowl and if you turn the water up at all it gets everywhere, and don't even think about shaving in it. Also we had no cold water in the sink, which was odd.I'd stay again if there was a good deal but there's so many great hotels in NYC, check out another one.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was in a great location. Lots of restaurants nearby. You are super close to the Statue of Liberty ferry and Battery Park. Not far from the Brooklyn Bridge and freedom tower. The subway was right across the street that took us to Time Square and Central Park. The room is big but getting to be a little out dated. It's fine for New York though. The real winner for me was the staff. Allan the concierge was awesome and I can't say enough good things about how friendly and helpful everyone was. Will stay there again for sure.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I checked in Sunday morning about 7:50 am. When I went to the room and used the key, the door opened up to a startled man who was asleep in the room! This is very problematic for security reasons. This isn’t the first time this has happened to me at Hilton properties and there wasn’t a satisfactory answer as to why the check in system can’t tell when rooms are filled. Very disappointing.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have stayed in many hotels in New York, this was the worst by a long way. The hotel is tiny, dated, the room had a sticky carpet (the type you would expect in a London Pub)... There was really nothing good to say about the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I would not recommend this hotel to anybody that appreciates cleanliness and sanitation in a hotel. After a 3 night stay for a work trip at this Double Tree, I found BED BUGS in my bed when I woke up on my last morning there. The maintenance crew was extremely helpful in checking out the room, but only found more when they came upstairs. The front desk staff seemed extremely unconcerned, they said they would have to wait until the manager was in later that day to resolve the issue. I was supposed to hear back from a manager 5 days ago. I have called everyday to get reimbursed for my room and to convey my frustration with the situation. I still have yet to receive a call back from management. The customer service at this hotel has been horrible in this situation, and I would not risk getting bed bugs by staying at this establishment.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I don’t normally write reviews but I felt it was important this time especially reading some of the other reviews. This was my first time staying at this hotel and was very impressed with the customer service, professionalism and welcoming staff. From the minute I walked in the front door, at check-in and in the elevator to my room, staff members were quick to greet me with a welcoming smile and light conversation. I’ve never seen so many happy staff members all working under the same roof. I was only at the hotel for one night but every time I came in and out this is what I experienced. My room was clean, quiet, the bed was very comfortable as well as the room temperature. I had no complaints and if I’m ever in the area again I will plan to stay at this property and will recommend to others.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Loved being in the "quieter" financial district. Comfortable beds. Professional, helpful staff. Close to abundant restaurants, bars, convenience stores and sightseeing. Loved the proximity to the metro system (half block). Enjoyed the tasty breakfast each morning (plenty of selections for everyone). Rooms were typical NYC size, but clean and suffice! Only downside....no mini fridge in room. (Would have loved one...especially while traveling with kiddies. Could have used a place to keep cold food & drinks on hand.)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Do not stay at this hotel!!!! They left a smelly food tray in the hallway for 3 days. Also left a housekeeping cart in the hallway for 3 days. The rooms where freezing and it was dirty. I will never stay here again! Oh there was also spiders in my room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Excellent location, plenty of very good places to eat around here, cheap or expensive, the hotel staff are friendly and helpful, and the room I stayed in was pretty small but very comfortable and clean. The shower and sink had excellent water pressure and almost immediate heat so taking a quick was easy and literally painless (I hate cold showers).The only complaints I have is there is no kitchen or kitchenette, or hot plate/microwave and no washer or dryer so all of your dining and cleaning will have to be done either outside of the room or by the staff.Really good place for a short stay but if you are going to be here longer than 3-5 days you may want to plan accordingly.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Firstly we have never stayed in the financial district before so I was looking forward to being close to a lot of important attractions. Price wise it is the same as the hotel that we normally stay at in midtown but doesn’t compare AT ALL. I had hoped that with the name Hilton that this would be somewhat of a guarantee for quality but for me, that quality is somewhat lacking. The room itself is small, even for NY standards. The air conditioning unit made more noise than the traffic in midtown and that’s saying something. After arriving yesterday, severely jet lagged, and before going out for some things, I asked for a small fridge for our room. No problem was the answer - there would be a fee - also not a problem. I bought some things that have to be cooled only to arrive back to hear that there wasn’t a fridge available but I could keep some things in their fridge on the 2nd floor. The problem with so many floors/rooms and the elevators had been well documented so you can understand that I wasn’t happy having some things on the 2nd floor with me on the 22nd floor. Breakfast is in the adjacent Italian restaurant. What looks romantic in the evening looks completely different in daylight hours. After going in I was told that I had to have a voucher for breakfast and that it should have been given to me at check in. So back upstairs with the s l o w elevator only to hear that it had been forgotten at check in. Back downstairs in the s l o w elevator. The buffet gives the impression it is an after thought. It’s all bit uncared for. The backroom in the restaurant definitely needs a makeover, everything is a bit dingy. Unfortunately that is where the buffet is set up. We are here for another couple of days and hope that it gets better.On a positive note, the staff is friendly, the rooms are clean, the bed is very comfortable and the tv is good but further for me it is all a bit outdated and tired.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is located in the main financial downtown, pretty close to the wall street. Let me come to the most inconvenient part, THE HOTEL IS FLOODED WITH GUESTS & IT HAS ONLY 3 LIFTS THAT TAKE AGES TO ARRIVE. The reception is on the 2nd floor, so for registration 1st you need to head to the 2nd floor queuing up for approx 20 mins for the lift then head to your room from 2nd floor to the designated one waiting for the lift again for 20 mins. We were in a group, totally jet-legged & it took us 1 hr & 15 mins to go to our room just because of the lift problem. The reception staff is not at all accommodating or friendly, i requested for a room change as i was given a twin room instead of a single king bed. The female at the reception bluntly refused to do so even knowing that i had a 4 year old kid with me. I had to get my tour manager involved , argue with them & then only they changed the room. NOW THAT's A BAD LEVEL OF HOSPITALITY. Coming to the room, the rooms are small & that's ok since its located in one of the upmarket area. The bathrooms were clean & so was the room, housekeeping was good. Breakfast spread was decent but worth mentioning was the staff, very humble, very polite & damn hardworking. Wanted to rate this property 2 but rating three for the restaurant staff.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location and friendly staff, but other than that this place was underwhelming. Room was so small it was comical, and bathroom didn't have enough room for me to even put toothpaste and deodorant down without place one of them on top of toilet.Entrance was in alley with small marking for hotel, which led to a service looking hallway and 3 elevators. I was informed checkin was on 2nd floor, which was also super small. Just felt odd...

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I like to stay here on weekends to be away from the bigger crowds of Times Square and Midtown crowds. The rates are great for the weekend, especially for the location. Expect delays with the elevators since it's an older hotel with three elevators servicing the entire hotel. (Tall narrow building) It's easy to get to Times Square or any of the shopping districts on the subway, and in the immediate area of the hotel you have the 911 Memorial Museum, Wall Street/NYSE, Battery Park, the Vietnam Veterans Plaza, Maritime Memorial/Museum, and Stone Street. Stone Street has a lively restaurant scene and great outdoor seating. It's a fun place for happy hour or watching sporting events. You also have Harry's and several other nice steak places nearby if you want to dine upscale. Great jazz in the cafes, especially during weekend brunch, and a laid back vibe. Get your Broadway tickets at the TKTS Seaport location where there's barely a line. While you're over there, check out the wonderful local shops for coffee, home goods and gifts, local hangouts and views of the water. You can also launch off from this location easily to tours of Statue of Liberty. It's my favorite area to call home base during my trips to NYC. I come here for business a fair amount, and it's fun to see how the personality of the area completely changes on the weekends.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: First time staying at this particular property. I was extremely impressed with the service first and foremost. Everyone was very helpful, and each day we were in New York, someone from the hotel would check in with us via text to see if we were want for anything more. Our rooms were very clean. Shower water pressure was on par with the best of fire hoses! You could turn it on low for a gentle shower from the rainfall shower head, or crank it up to have it massage you scalp and shoulders.The TV was incredibly large and served up all the necessary news or sports if you were so inclined to stay in the room.Situated a couple of blocks from Wall Street, 911 memorials and Battery Park, it is a perfect respite from the hustle of Times Square and does not include the crazy fares of the upper east side.We would definitely return to this property.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Arrived late in the evening. Staff very helpful. Allen, Tim, Melissa especially nice.Rooms were clean, but small. No problem as I wasn't going to party there just sleep. I wish the parking was less expensive. It's 40 something floors, so elevators are slow at checkout time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great hotel that had a really good rate for a Saturday night. The hotel is conveniently located near many NYC sites and also many subway stations.Staff was friendly and even though the room was small who spends that much time in a hotel room.Only down side of hotel there was no full length mirror. The shower did not have a lip so the bathroom floor absolutely was covered with water, we put down towels as the water went as far as the sink. Look for deals but a good hotel

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Pretty basic NYC 40+ stories hotel. Elevators are horrible - it's not unusual to wait for one for 5 minutes or more to get to a higher floor, so try staying on a lower floor if possible and take stairs. The most outstanding feature of this hotel is its location.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We did some travelling NewYork to Niagara and on to Toronto Canada. Double Tree New York was our 1st hotel booked. On arrival we were greeted with a friendly face. The rooms were basic but clean, the hotel in general is tired and outdated. We didn’t eat here so can’t comment on the food. We were looking for somewhere reasonably priced in mid town to lay our heads after days of sightseeing and the location is perfect for that. Situated in the heart of New York very close to the Empire State, Times Square and Central Park. I would recommend the passes for the open top buses to get around and also the city passes for access to multiple tourist attractions. In all New York is a great city to visit and this hotel is in the heart of that city.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Had a great experience especially since Tina from the staff was able to accommodate my request for an early check in. It made my life a whole lot easier. The complementary warm cookie and bottled water were a nice touch. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location close to museum Staten island ferry and close walk to Brooklyn bridge. Hotel room small but clean ,beds were really comfy . elevators slow and always crowded .be sure to ask for cookies it depends who's at the desk for them to be offered

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed on business, so location was excellent both for the office and convenient for wall street. World trade centre, battery park ferries and not far from Chinatown, south street seaport and little italy. Staff were also very friendly. Unfortunately the rooms were small and dated. Only one lift was working which meant long waits to get out of the hotel. Not an obvious choice unless you want to be in that part of town.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel was amazing and one block away from my client. The room was clean and comfortable, the staff was polite and helpful, and the attactched restaurant was a huge plus. If you are looking for a great hotel in the Financial District, this is one to strongly consider.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here over Memorial Day weekend (Rm. 4201) and found it to be fairly reasonable.The price was o.k., considering New York prices, and there were several eateries nearby.A few items to note:Rooms come with a mini fridge - nice;BUT no microwave and no clock radio or closet or bathtub (shower only) and the rooms are VERY small;Waits for the elevators can be long.Staff is very nice and the beds very comfortable. Getting a daily text message from staff is a nice touch.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here on business and was glad we chose this establishment. Arrived around 12 and was able to do an early check in and within an hour I had my keys to the room and settled in. The room was exceptionally clean and even received a txt message from the front office and housekeeping to see if there were any issues with the room. Received a follow up txt after checkout which was a nice little touch. Will stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very surprised to found that the hotel had only 2 elevators for 40 or 50 floors (way too long when waiting for the elevator and hopefully we were only on the 6th floor so we were getting down with stairs)!Shower not clean on our first arrival (hairs in shower)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a very nice hotel! Check in was fast and easy. All staff were very friendly and helpful. My room was very nice. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was very nice. There are great coffee shops, restaurants, bakeries and bars within a 3 minute walk. There is easy access to the rest of the city through close subway stops. It is only a 4 minute walk to the 1,2 subway, and a 2 minute walk to the 4/5. It only took 10 minutes to walk to the 9/11 memorial. The Staten Island Ferry, which is one of the not to miss free things in the city, is about a 4 minute walk. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel is reasonably priced and located. Room size are average for NYC. Largest issue is the elevator situation. You need to take the elevator from the ground floor to the second floor lobby for checking in and then again to your floor for your room. That is fine, except there are only three elevators and the hotel has 30 or 40 floors with ~10 rooms per floor. It can take a solid 5 minutes, which becomes worse during peak mornings, especially on a Thursday where people are checking out. It isn't necessarily a deal breaker for the property, but something to manage. Also, in case you were wondering. The stairs are really convenient as they are very steep, but it is an option. Mind you not with luggage and also in the mornings there is typically trash bags waiting for collection from housekeeping. If you do go, I suggest a low floor.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We came to the hotel early for our 2 night stay hoping to just stow our bags in a secure closet until our 3pm check in time. However, Tina at the front desk who was so delightful was able to find a room already prepared for us which was wonderful. This was so nice so we could leave our bags before heading on our tour at 2:30pm on Ellis Island. The hotel was room was very nice, quiet, & comfortable where we stayed on the 24th floor. The location was fantastic as well close to Battery park, New York Stock Exchange, and much more. Thanks Tina & housekeeping staff for making our stay special & very enjoyable. We'd come back in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel is right downtown, near many subway stops, our room had a water view. We were on the 44th floor so it was very quiet. The beds were very comfortable. Nice bathroom. Plenty of towels. No complaints about the room at all. Halls were a little dingy and elevators small and slow, but that's very minor. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great experience,The location was so amazing, so close from Subway station and plenty of options for have lunch and dinner. Once with subway so close you could be in times square in 20 minutes. For this is a great opportunity to stay at this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Third time staying here when visiting NYC. Close to public transportation, lots of restaurants, pubs, museums (Museum of American Indian and Fraunces tavern museum) Wall Street, a Duane Reede, and a great bagel guy on the corner, too.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Don’t use this Double Tree Hotel if you have I Bike with especially during biking events like the 5Boro Tour. No Bikes are allowed and they have no storage for your bike. The elevators are small and hot. Only 2 of 3 was working when I was there for the 5 Boro Tour.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was my 2nd visit in about a month. 1st one wasn't terrible but wasn't great either. This visit was the same. Rooms are clean and the rates are pretty good for NYC. Front desk staff are rude and inattentive. If you want a average stay with horrible hospitality this is your place.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Staff had an issue they could have handled with grace and chose instead to be outright rude and borderline hostile. I will never return to this hotel and strongly advise you not to stay here unless you enjoy rude and condescending staff.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms themselves are small (as you’d expect in New York) but are fine. They have normal amenities including a coffee machine, iron/ironing board etc. What really kicks the hotel down a few notches is the completely dirty floors (areas outside the elevators are full of pieces of small trash/dirt etc.) and the elevators are obnoxiously slow - at one point I waited 10 min for one to come. Would I stay here again? No!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My first trip to New York and this was the perfect location for me to maneuver around the city. We spent 3 nights and this lovely hotel that's perfectly located right in the heart of the Financial District. The Charging Bull is literally around the corner along with Bowling Green Park which is the oldest park in NY and very historic. Museums, NY Film Academy the The Twin Tower Monuments, African Burial Ground ... The NYSE... there are so many attractions with in 2-3 blocks. Restaurants and shopping are right there along with local night clubs. The hotel itself was well decorated and staffed. We were able to check our bags in early and hit the streets to sight see. I was impressed by the level of cleanliness and there where no old moldy smells or odors. Nice hot water with modern bath design and features overlooking the city makes this hotel ideal for those wanting to spend time exploring.  I would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is located on the Wall Street area, good location near the subway and places to eat. Fortunately, our room was ready when we got here and were received with a warm cookie and water. Nice touch. The room was clean and on the small size. The worst thing about it is the elevators, only 2 for the entire hotel. It takes a while to go in and out,

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: On Wednesday 4/25/2018 I called to alert the Doubletree we would be a late arrival, someone answered the phone and I told them we would be a late arrival. When we arrived at 11 pm, after using the parking garage around the corner, carried our luggage into the hotel. I went to check in with my confirmation letter and number. The front desk worker said, "Your reservations are canceled." I said, " Who canceled them? I just called earlier and told the front desk I would be a late arrival. She said she wasn't sure how they became canceled. I said that I would appreciate it if she had another room. She then came back and said she had 2 double beds for 650 plus fees.I had paid 398 I asked her to match it, she said she couldn't, but she could place us in the room for 650. This was after calling someone at home to ask a price. I then asked if she could please check surrounding Hilton hotels for availability. She said " You can check on booking.com " I didn't book my room through there, to begin with, I went directly to Hilton since we are honors members. Sadly enough, I asked for a manager, she said its late and none are on duty. I did then go to Booking Website and securing a Hilton around the corner and they were wonderful !! We carried our luggage about two more blocks. This is my second review since the first one appears to be gone !!! I called the hotel manager the next day and asked for a callback, and I NEVER received a callback. Sad, and not a typical Hilton, as they usually are the best !! A just really poor business person would ever send me to a website versus directly to their company.Very sad, this would exist anywhere in 2018 !!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is in a great location if you need to be in the financial district. Easy walking to Wall Street, restaurants and shopping.Upon arrival it looks like you are in the basement maintenance area. 2nd floor is the lobby.Digital check in was easy. As a Hilton Honors member I picked up my cookie and 2 bottles of water.I then waited 10 minutes for an elevator with a group of other guests. My room was on the top floor, so another ride with multiple stops so the cleaning staff could communicate. Very poor set up.Be prepared for very narrow hallways where 2 people cannot pass with out turning sideways. The carpet has seen better days and looks like it needs cleaning.On arrival my digital key worked great. The room is small, but comfortable. Very little space for luggage. I only had a carry on so 2 larger suitcases would be hard to fit.The room has been upgraded, but the maintenance is lacking. The wallpaper behind the chair is worn and ripped, but not replaced. The sink takes forever to drain. The bathroom is tiny. It would be impossible if you had to close the door.For $400 ish a night I would have chosen a different hotel had I known the set up.The restaurant on the ground floor is good- good food, service and prices. The staff are what make you overlook the building issues. They were helpful, accommodating, and available.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The room were pretty small. I'm sure standard for NYC. But very clean and all the staff were very friendly and very helpful. Great location for lots of sightseeing and convenient to the subway.I would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed at the DoubleTree recently for 5 nights. We chose the Financial District because my daughter’s apartment is very close to the hotel. The hotel location is indeed great. There is a Duane Read just around the corner as well as a Starbucks, Chipotle, Broadstone Bar & Kitchen (we ate there twice—it was great) among many other interesting bars, coffee shops and restaurants (it is NYC after all). There were some good things about the hotel and bad things. I think the bad things outweighed the good. While it wasn’t a horrible experience, I’d probably look elsewhere for my next hotel.First the good. The bed was comfortable. Overall the room was clean. Our room had a nice large LG flatscreen. The price was good. The staff was great. As mentioned, the location is great. And the bad. If I could offer only one piece of advice: make sure you get a non-adjoining room. When we first arrived and got to our room, within 30 seconds, the first thing we noticed was the loud talking, TV and singing coming from the room next door. Turns out we had an adjoining room that has a door between rooms. So there’s essentially no sound insulation because of that door. We could actually make out what our neighbors were saying (which included some obscenities—yay!). I immediately went straight down to the front desk to see if we could switch rooms to a non-adjoining room. Unfortunately, they were apparently booked that day and couldn’t switch us. But, we were able to switch to a quieter, non-adjoining room the next day. We got a king sized bed and my feet hung over the end of the mattress. I’m 6’1”. This must be a NYC thing because the rooms are so small—the same thing happened at a Holiday Inn Express in NYC just recently. I found that odd.Another odd thing: the only bedside electrical outlets are up next to the raised bedside lights. If you take a look at some of the traveler photos, you can see the bedside lights I’m talking about. So, in actuality, if you’re charging your phone, camera, smartwatch, what have you, the cord will be hanging down towards the bedside table. If you have a short cord, this could make charging awkward.As mentioned by numerous other reviews, the elevators are hit or miss—usually miss. In one instance I had to wait about 6 minutes for an elevator. Now, in the grand scheme of things, 6 minutes may not seem like a long time. But take the opportunity to stand there, wherever you are and set a timer for 6 minutes. It’ll seem like an eternity if you imagine you’re waiting for an elevator. By the time the elevator arrived and I got to the ground floor, there were perhaps 15 people waiting for that elevator. Also note that the front desk is on the 2nd floor. This is not immediately clear when you enter the hotel from the street. We entered, went to the elevators, then, confused, went back outside and thought maybe the entrance with the front desk was around the corner of the building. We asked a staff member outside and they clarified it’s on the second floor. So we went back in, around to the elevators, and sure enough there is a sign on the wall indicating that the front desk is up one floor. Reading other reviews, we’re not the only guests that had this problem. Perhaps they should put a big floor sign, right when you walk in, indicating that check in is on the 2nd floor. One of the worst things was the bathroom. There’s practically no counter space. There’s a small 2-3 inch or so ledge around the raised sink and a small glass shelf above the toilet, half of which is taken up by a tray featuring 3 tiny bottles of soap, shampoo and conditioner (which no one will probably use). That’s it. And the cramped shower (just a stand up shower—not a tub/shower combo) had very low pressure and the door wasn’t sealed properly so after each shower, I was left with a small puddle of water on the floor. And the lighting was horrible. If you’re in to mood lighting I guess it’s OK. But, if you’re trying to do make up or something, good luck!The air conditioner was loud, dirty and the front grill was hanging on by a thread. I tried to brace it to stop the knocking and rattling, and the grill fell off. Lastly, when I checked in on a Saturday for a Saturday - Thursday stay I was told it was actually 2 reservations and that I would have to actually “check out” Tuesday. Not a real checkout. We didn’t have to change rooms or anything. But I had to go to the front desk on Tuesday to “check out” and I guess check back in. All they did was take my key cards, update them, and then hand the same cards back to me. Then I was good until the real check out on Thursday. Not a huge deal, but very weird and a bit of a hassle as I had to make an additional trip down in their unpredictable elevators. If you’re looking for a room for one person in the Financial District and can deal with some annoyances, this could be a safe bet. Otherwise, it might be a good idea to look elsewhere if you have that luxury.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: From our initial arrival into an area that doesn't give you any direction as to where the lobby is (on the 2nd floor) until we actually left there was just one bad experience after another!! We had a parking package that despite confirming on check in and check out I received a charge posted to my AMEX a few weeks later..... so just be sure that you check your bill!The electricity went out in our room because someone had moved the phone from the side of the bed to across the room and either maintenance or housekeeping never bothered to repair the problem. The staff was pleasant enough, but the whole property just seemed to be poorly run. Breakfast was my chosen HHonors benefit but when you got down to breakfast they pointed us off to a mediocre breakfast buffet being attended to by a fairly inept waiter.The room was small and the bathroom was VERY POORLY appointed. I'm not sure who designed the bathroom but it had a very low sink with practically no place for 2 people to place toiletries. There were no towel bars and the shower had no accommodation for someone to shave their legs. The shower had55 one tiny little corner shelf that was totally inadequate and they didn't even bother to put a foot rest in for a lady to use to shave her legs. The only forethought put in to planning this bathroom was to save money!This is without a doubt the worst Hilton property I have ever stayed in my 25 plus years of being a Hilton member. My fiance just flatly said "Please don't ever book us into that place again!"

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here in February 2018. The hotel was in the middle of financial district just around the corner from Wall St.Reception was located on the first floor which was confusingReception staff were very poor and borderline rudeHotel was fit for purpose (a warm, safe and clean place to sleep whilst we explored new york city)Air conditioning noisy and hard to control

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: There is so much bad to say about this hotel, so it’s hard to know where to start and what to include, so will keep this to the worst attributes: 1. The elevators - you can routinely wait 5-10 minutes for an elevator and they are typically monopolized by staff as no service elevators (smart management would at least restrict employees from using elevators during rush hours); 2. Hotel and rooms are dirty. Room I had on this stay had what looked like a former guest’s nose pickings on the wall, an old dirty towel hanging from the shower curtain rod, dirty carpet, etc.; 3. Rooms feel shabby - this is a hotel in need of a room renovation - or at least a thorough fix of problems (like the inability to close my curtains. Just to be clear, staff I enteracted with were friendly and helpful, so this is a management issue.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is arguably one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in. The street entrance is shabby. There are only 3 elevators for 44 floors, and they are very slow and old. Its not uncommon to have to wait several minutes for one to arrive, only for it to be full. Ask for a low floor!The rooms themselves are tired, dark and old. My 2 nights' sleep were horrible - I'm not sure what was more disturbing, the whining sounds coming from the pipes in the bathroom, or the sound of mice and rats in the air con.My coffee machine was missing the basket into which the coffee pods are placed.I simply couldn't get the wifi working and gave up. The hotel also wraps its coffee cups and water cups in plastic which is bad for the environment - that needs a policy change by Hilton ASAP.The only redeeming feature of this hotel is the staff. Everyone from reception through to the maintenance guys, to the housekeeping team was cheerful. How they maintain that in an environment that must be as miserable to work in as it is to stay in I have no idea, but they are a credit to Hilton.Avoid at all costs.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Rooms were spacious for NYC, the beds were comfortable. The location was great, we were able to get anywhere in NYC for very reasonable and not as congested as time square, the service was great. I would stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location for me - 5 minute walk to my meetings - readily available to everything from a shoe shine to excellent restaurants. Always pleasant staff made the stay even better - room was more comfortable than I would have imagined.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: When I arrived, first I thought I was at the wrong place: when you walk in, there is nothing but 3 elevators. As it turns out, the reception is on the 3rd floor which I found very very odd. The reception was however nice and the check-in was quick and efficient so I thought it will be all good. Well, not really.The 3 elevators are VERY slow. It takes ages in the morning to catch an elevator that is not full yet - which is really unconvinient especially if you got to be somewhere on time.The room was small which I did not mind but the bed really bothered me. I had a king sized bed but my feet were still hanging off at the end of the bed. I suspect that due to the size of the room, they turn the bed to the side and push the length side to the wall.At night time, I could hardly sleep as a weird noise was coming from the bathroom (almost like the cistern was constanly filling up with water).After my first night, they did not clean my room, even though I left the room at 8.15am. The next day, I wanted to put the sign of "Cleaning please" outside my door but there is not such sign in this hotel.Finally, drinking water does not come with these rooms. I ventured to one of the floors that has an ice machine, hoping that the machine would also give filtered water. No luck there. I needed to go outside of the hotel to get some water.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Spent 4 nights here in Feb 2018. Excellent location and the welcome cookie was a nice touch. However I have never been eaten alive so badly during my sleep! Never saw any bugs mind you, but would wake up to an array of bites every night. Was also caught up in the cyclone and the staff were not particularly helpful with Regis to extending our stay or assisting with flights

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights with family (had 3 separate rooms) and really wanted to like this place, but the agonizingly slow elevator to get to reception was just the first red flag...Pros:- Convenient to subway station- Relatively quiet, especially on weekends- Near Battery Park- Friendly staff- Decent-sized room, comfortable beds, nice linensCons:- After the first day, housekeeping disappeared and my room wasn't cleaned the remainder of my stay. I was forced to skip one cleaning when I returned to my room after 5pm, and they still hadn't gotten to my room. My sister found one of the housecleaners outside of her room lounging on the hallway floor and talking on her phone...- No hot water in the shower my last morning; my brother-in-law also had spotty hot water.- Unclear what you get if you sign up for breakfast since there isn't a dining room. They list "Bar Area" as one of the amenities on their website, but there didn't appear to be one.- Already mentioned the elevator; it was so slow I always had to allow enough time just to get to the ground floor. I often ended up taking the stairs, which were less than clean.- Though the hotel's moderately priced for NY, the difference was made up by what I spent on carfare to get anywhere outside of FiDi.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location was great. It was close to several subways. The hotel staff exceeded expectations. They were friendly and very helpful. I received texts during my stay asking how my visit was going and if there was anything we needed. The housekeeping staff even left us chocolate! The rooms were small, but very clean. The beds were very comfortable. We were on the 40th floor, and had a great view of the Freedom Tower. The only problem we encountered was with the hot water. We were there 3 nights, and I never got a hot shower.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is convenient to all the Financial District...World Trade Center, Wall Street, The Bull and more! The room was very clean. The beds and pillows are extremely comfortable! Staff very friendly and helpful. Lots of good eateries near by.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We booked two rooms here during the week for spring break. Upon arrival we were directed to a hallway that led to the elevators to get to the lobby on the next floor. There was no key card entry for late night arrivals so it seems that just anyone can just come into the hotel at any time. Not the safest feeling. The lobby was clean, as was our rooms. The rooms were pretty small with tight bathrooms also, but hey, this is New York. The hallways were tight with a lot of chipped paint on the doorframes. Not really what you are accustomed to at a Hilton. The location was great for the Subway station and the Staten Island Ferry.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Look at ANY other hotel first. 44 floors only 3 elevators. On top of that the employees use them to go one floor. Doorman offered a flat rate, don’t fall for it as we did, price was double of what it should have been. Uber it and save BIG!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here back in February with my partner. Hotel was undergoing some sort of renovation so looked shabby, no clear signage. Once we found that reception is on first floor we were greeted by rude staff who struggled with our reservation (a women with white glasses could do with some customer service training), then had problems with our payment as the receptionist found it too difficult to understand that we wanted to pay in cash for the room. Room was tiny so luckily we only used it to sleep overnight. Heating system is hard/impossible to control. Wouldn't stay here again on our next visit to NY.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is clean and kept up. The location is excellent as it’s near all lines on the subway and walking distance to 9/11 and Statue of Liberty. The room is very small for the price you are paying. The bathroom didn’t have any space to put your toiletries. Elevators are slow. Couple great food/bars nearby. Didn’t hear any outside noise when trying to sleep.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Upgraded to top floor with Hudson River view! Not many rooms have river view due to many tall buildings. I will be back couple days and will try the city view at that time. Also received Great customer service from Tina!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Right round the corner from Bowling Green subway. In the financial district. Exactly what I expected from a Double Tree. Would stay there again. If I really had to moan, the hotel only has two lifts for 44 floors.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at the hotel from Friday the 16th to Monday the 19th of March.I had a horrible journey from JFK to the hotel. I got there late on Friday evening. Had a lovely greeting from the colleague on duty, (name started with a V) gave me a great room on the 42nd floor with a view of Freedom Tower and Empire State Building. Lovely soft bed, clean room, house cleaning was very friendly and polite. When I left the room the door wouldn't lock behind me, reception answered quickly, friendly guy came up straight away, sorted the lock, didn't hover around looking for a tip.Saturday morning I decide to see how far the window open, so I could take a photograph, wouldn't close afterwards. Mentioned it to reception, sorted when I got back that night. Guys at the front door, always friendly and very helpful when it came to leaving suitcases.If I had one small complaint, it would be you did have to leave the shower running for a while before it got hot.Great area, near the Charging Bull statue, two subway stations, Murphy's Tavern right next door, (no noise problem as far as I was concerned).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Since the first day i arrive, i ask the reception to check if can somebody could come to the hotel to see if there was something on the heat, nobody came. when i call the reception they didn't answer most of the time, so i had to go in person to ask things. one day we woke up late, and the maid never pass after, i went to reception to ask why nobody came, they say it was too late to do something, so i ask at least towels, coffee for that day, they just gave me some shampoos and soap. so i found a person who was near my room, he took some towels and gave me some and i had to go to reception to ask for coffee. One of the sheet on my bed had blood or coffee spots, like they were old or not well washed, and when i saw the toilet inside i was surprise when i saw the rust , i thought it was pooh or dirty.. i hope is rust. For the price i paid, i'm not at all satisfied , i thought just for being Hilton it would be a excellent place, i told that to one receptionist who was very nice and listen to me, she gave me a free breakfast just because i told her, i wasn't happy with the service.i won't recommend this hotel to anybody. concerning the elevator, we had to wait a lot to take it. one of the waiters wasn't nice... well if you stay there.. good luck!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good experience, very helpful staff, wonderful cookies, very quiet room, hot shower, strong staff service, and overall good experience. Initially had the reservation cancelled due to credit card snafu but the staff stepped up and did the right thing.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is fine. It's clean, the staff is friendly and if you need to be in lower Manhattan, the location is great. But, seriously, build in at least 20 minutes extra for your commute in the morning to wait for the elevators. They are incredibly slow, crowded and seem to make stops on every floor. If you are at the 20th floor or lower, I recommend taking the stairs.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Not a bad stay but too much light in room. Waiting for elevator was a pain in the but. Restaurant has a very limited breakfast menu. Price was very affordable. Defiantly worth what I paid to stay here.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Shout out to Vanessa and Venetta for making our check in a breeze!Rooms are clean and comfortable, location is ideal for business in the financial district. Close to subway and restaurants, would stay here again!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Location is perfect...near at the Metro station and tourist spots...staff were so friendly...rooms are clean and bed are comfortable...the only thing is the elevator!it takes a lot of time before you catch it most specially if you were on the higher floor.WiFi is also good, we really enjoyed our stay in this hotel!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Clean, cozy, and comfortable, this hotel was convenient to Battery Park, Staten Island Ferry, Liberty Island ferry, and the 4,5,R and W lines. For getting around to the boroughs, this hotel was located perfectly. Also, the staff were really helpful and friendly. In particular, if you need any help with directions or places to go, be sure to ask for Tina! Great stay, and I'll be back!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location of the Hotel is fantastic. There are many places to eat and drink in the area, from cheap $3 beers to high-end cocktails at the Dead Rabbit and also only a few yards away from a subway station. The hotel itself is a bit run down, the halls are dated and the lifts need some work. During our stay, one of the lifts was down and it did lead to delays, but not so long that it was a major problem. The king size room was larger than I expected but curtains were not very thick and the window was a bit drafty. The room was clean and changed daily. Very similar to what you would expect from a Travel Lodge in the UK. It is clear that the hotel is resident to people that have been housed there and are not tourists but there was never any bother and everyone was always polite. The staff are very very friendly and helpful. Being able to store our luggage there before our flight was a bonus. For the cheap prices, we paid compared to usual city standards it was adequate for our trip but if you are expecting luxury it is not the place for you.
user_name:
Louise M
Nairn, Scotland, United Kingdom

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stay away from this dive. Staff is ride. Lost reservation and even though I showed front desk clerk their printed confirmation, he couldn't give a damn about helping. Place is a hell-hole. Another giest was trying ti check out early because her room was so disgusting that we were kinda glad that they HAD screweed up our reservation.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Small, no room to move round bed. AC in a bad state. Bathroom door didn’t shut fully. Took over 10mins for sink and shower water to get warm. Lifts took ages and werr slooow!! Lock on door broken. Etc

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Perfect location to WTC and lots of options to eat and see financial district. Elevators can get slow at busy times but lovely staff and that Doubletree charm is still there including warm cookies! Just wishi asked for a fridge in the room but room and bed were fantastic!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for three nights on an advance purchase rate which I booked a mere 2 weeks before flying out. $109 (£75) dollars a night is an absolute steal for the location. It is an odd little hotel really, a tiny tower (albeit 44 stories tall) sandwiched in between other office buildings. The staff were all courteous and friendly, especially Tony at the front door. You'll get to know him very well because you will be waiting an age for the elevators. Three tiny lifts to serve such a tall building is almost a running joke in this hotel among staff and guests alike. You will never get a free run to the ground floor unless in the middle of the night and the problem is compounded by guests floor hopping ro use the ice machines. Rant over...the elevator service is dreadful. But to be fair that's the total of the bad news.The rooms are very small in keeping with the theme of this hotel, which is in a really good location with the Staten Island ferry terminal literally two minutes walk away, whilst the Fulton Center and the WTC are a few blocks to the north where you can access the PATH from Newark and pretty much any Subway line.Can't fault the cleanliness of the room or the facilities which are all typically DoubleTree. The hot water in our room (3707) took forever to come through but maybe that was just a characteristic of that particular room. Didn't try the restaurant but there are plenty of eating and drinking options nearby. In all a good experience and I can heartily recommend.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I went here for a conference where the tab was picked up, so I can't complainThe decor was upscale, the hotel was close to public transportation, and it was also close to great restaurants, the World Trade Center, The Financial District, and the Battery.about 8 years ago

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: i got bitten by bed bugs at this terrible dirty old hotel!!!! many not as visible areas in the room aren't cleaned - full of dust and dirt. also lost my personal toiletries in the bathroom. personal items fell down to cracks between bed & chest drawer - house keeping people didn't put them back properly. called to get an extra duvet - didn't deliver, had to call again to remind them. worst hotel stay ever. and didn't expect to be encountering this at a HILTON hotel at financial district in NYC.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Experience from hotels in the U.S is that they are all overpriced and rough around the edges. Doubletree by Hilton is no different. Imagine your grandparents bought a hotel in the 70s and miraculously didn’t die before 2003 and did it up again. They had the same dated taste including love for dark “wood” (melamine), stripy carpet and “stone” bath ware. There is a sepia tone to the lifts and doorways, which is less nostalgic-cool than abuse-by-nicotine. They are over-worked at peak time leading to audible sighs by the dozen.What’s super bizarre is just how many strange people it attracts: not foreigners or business people as you might expect but weird locals with pot noodles in their bags, booze on their breath and all kinds of crazy coming out of their mouths. No matter what time of day. I can’t speak for the food or the drink because there is no restaurant to speak of in the evenings. The dead flowers and hedges outside do however make for bad vibes on your way to work. The rooms are clean (minus the uninvited pube I found in my basin), the shower is fine, the products to shower with are under parr but that’s fine. Crappy furniture and chipped paint, worn away edges to literally every static thing in the place are nothing I’ve not come to expect in America it’s just incredible that my 90s youth perception of what a “Hilton” should be could be so so wrong.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for two nights. Staff were all friendly. Location is excellent. Only a couple minutes walk from battery park (visiting Statue of Liberty). Breakfast in the restaurant was not very good. It is typical small- mid size buffet selection but they were often out of key stuff. You had to ask if you wanted anything. Including water or a refill. Note that checkin /lobby is on the second floor. Elevators are on the small side. Only two worked during our time there. A third was being fixed. This led to LONG wait times for the elevator - even when not full. I waited about 15 minutes to get down. And I was able to get on the first one. This is especially true in the morning rush time. Other times the wait was less than 5 minutes. Out first room they have us was occupied. I didn’t make some woman very happy when trying my key multiple times. Oops. I ended up putting my bags in with the bellman (first floor) and went walking around.When I got my room it was super tiny. I couldn’t get my suitcase around the bed without lifting it over the bed to the other side which had a sitting chair and a desk chair there. Get rid of the sitting chair so there is some room. The bathroom has a sliding door and is located two feet from the bed. The rooms are a bit noisy if you have noisy neighbors or if any talks in the hallway. We also had the pleasure of having a crying baby on our Hhonors floor. You could hear the baby like it was next to you. For now, I would pass on this Doubletree. Staff was a bright spot. Always friendly and willing to help.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: After doing Camp America my boyfriend and I wanted to treat ourselves to a fancy hotel in New York. When we booked this hotel we got a good price, the location is perfect and the rooms are beautiful. We didn't really have much contact with the staff so I couldn't really comment whether they are friendly or not.On arrival we got asked for more money for a deposit, which was mentioned on the confirmation email but in small print, I feel that this information should have been more noticeable. This hotel is a 5 minute walk away from wall street and close to Brooklyn bridge etc if you want to walk instead of taking the underground everywhere.Overall, a lovely hotel in a great location.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: All of the staff are wonderful. They checked on us multiple times. Tony, the concierge, was fantastic. Kind, patient and helpful. The front desk staff were pleasant and efficient. Rooms were spotless every day. Bravo to all.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: With just 10 rooms per floor, this hotel is more like a boutique hotel. Small rooms and cramped halls, however it is convenient to Wall Street, Battery Park, South Street Seaport Museum, and the Staten Island ferries. The room was clean but the hallway was unusually dirty. Long waits for elevators was common.Tip: got time to plan? The Federal Reserve Bank Museum which houses more gold than anywhere else on the planet and it’s free. It’s very close as is Federal Hall (also free) where America’s first government met before it moved to Philly for 10 years while Washington DC was created.Tip: a ride on the Staten Island ferry is also free!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: For a hotel in Manhattan, known for small hotel room sizes, the rooms in this hotel are reasonably sized. The desk is minimalist in size, I would prefer a larger desk, but it is workable.This hotel practices energy efficiency in rooms lighting to a fault. I couldn't get a confident read on color matches anywhere in the room! Some hotels only provide one bright light in a room, this hotel managed to provide no bright lights. Ironically, the best light in the room was the ceiling light over the door entry!!! I found that to be an odd priority with respect to lighting. If I was managing this hotel, I would replace some of the bulbs with efficient, higher light output versions. It would make a big difference.The bathroom mirror was well designed with respect to providing even lighting without shadows, with long diffused lights on the right and left side of the mirror. The bulbs just aren't bright enough, emitting more of a glow instead of illuminating the area brightly. The sink is way off center from the mirror lights. The sink is nearly aligned with one of the edge lights, resulting in an inconvenient shadow if you are using the sink (such as one would be when removing makeup or shaving). The shower was nice. My particular shower had a couple of issues, however. The drain was very slow, so during the shower I ended up standing in a deep puddle (nearly high enough to flow onto the bathroom floor). The bottom 3 inches of the shower door were missing the splash seal, so that a significant amount of water escaped during the shower and created an inconvenient puddle on the floor outside the shower.The phone in the room was filthy - the housekeeping staff needs to be trained to to wipe off the phones periodically.I was awakened at least twice each night by noise in the hallway. Apparently the door doesn't seal out noise very well and falls short of what other hotels in the class accomplish.As others have noted, the elevator situation at this hotel is less than optimal. The building is relatively new, but apparently had a poor architect that didn't think that a service elevator was essential (or centered sinks!). During the day it is not uncommon to have a staff member with a cart consuming a significant portion of the elevator. Just be prepared during peak times (such as 8am-9:30am) to wait excessively long for an elevator.Despite the issues I have listed above, otherwise the hotel does a good job. The door staff was very helpful and attentive. The location was excellent. It was an easy walk any where I needed to go. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: $87 a night for Manhattan!!! Rooms were standard Doubletree quality in an interesting area in the Financial District. Restaurants close by. World Trade Center memorial, Battery Park, Ferry, Seaport an easy walk.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have a pleasant stay. The staff were very attentive and willing to help. From entrance front desk cleaning staff. I was in high floor and the view was nice. The bef very comfortable. I would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We thought the price was great as was the location. The room was what I'd expect in NYC from a size perspective - not tons of room (we stayed in a king room). The shower is narrow. It was quiet at night, room was clean and comfortable, and staff was friendly. Parking is right around the corner ($40 self, $60 valet). Lots of bars and restaurants in walking distance. The bull and girl statues are right around the corner. The waterfront is within walking distance. Easy to reach the Holland Tunnel. Definitely recommend.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Things to know before you book are... 1. This hotel only has 3 elevators to serve 44 floors leading to long wait times. Also, the staff use the same elevators to take loads of garbage down to the ground floors, to move furniture from floor to floor, etc. This means elevators are sometimes full of staff rather than guests and they don't exit the elevators to allow guests to use them. 2. There are only ice machines every 3 or 4 stories so you have to either wait for elevators or use the stairs to access an ice machine unless you are lucky enough to be on a floor with one. I was using the stairs to go to another floor to get ice when I came upon a group of malodorous people having some sort of meeting in the stairwell. They grumbled as I squeezed by to go up the stairs. I did not use the stairs again and I warned my wife not to move about the hotel without me being present. 3. I noticed unsavory looking people outside the hotel smoking while sitting in nearby doorways or sitting on the steps of the near by subway station. I later found myself on the hotel elevator with some of the same people!?? 4. As you'd expect, the bathrooms are small with only a small glass shelf above the toilet. If you are not careful, items can fall in the toilet. 5. My final advice regarding this hotel is you may want to check on the internet regarding this hotel as you may find some interesting things about it that staff can't tell you.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Dirty and old. They only thing about the hotel that was good is the free cookie on arrival and the service for your bags. The lifts take FOREVER and the caliber that stay in this hotel is not what you go on holiday for. Put me off ever going to another Double Tree again, can't believe Hilton put their name to this.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Location is everything - amenities a bit tired.Lifts are very slow so get down to the lobby early or you can wait an age.Otherwise its a pliant enough experience for the heart of the Wall Street district.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We got a great deal on a three night stay at the Doubletree, and it was worth every penny. The staff is very nice, the hotel is in a great location around the street from the Battery, the statue of liberty can be seen after a short walk, and there are several restaurants close by as well as a very convenient Starbucks and Duane Read around the corner.We were staying on the 32nd floor, so word of warning, if you're staying on one of the upper floors you will have to wait anywhere between 3-10 minutes for an elevator depending on what time of the day you are trying to travel. Also, the seal on our shower didn't work, so we had to soak up the water on the floor after each shower, which was a hassle, but not a big deal and I doubt it's a problem in every room. We didn't bother to complain about it while we were there.If you're a man over 6 feet or are traveling with a man over six feet tall, you may want to find other accommodations. My fiancé is 6'7, and his feet were hanging off the end of the king sized bed. We have a queen bed at home and it's not a problem, so the beds at the Doubletree run shorter than normal and you should be aware of that. I also was not a fan of the feather pillows because they don't hold their shape, but that's a personal preference.The hotel is convenient to the Staten Island Ferry as well as the Whitehall and Bowling Green subway stops. Also, I was there with my family who were staying at a different hotel close by and the Doubletree staff were nice enough to give them cookies too. We had a room overlooking the river, which was great. Everyone was so nice and so is the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We had a great time at the Doubletree Financial District. The room was smaller than what we are used to, but quite frankly, it was done well and we loved the view of the river. We were on the 41st Floor, so we were able to see the boats go back and forth and the sunsets over the river were beautiful. For the money, we thought it suited our needs. We like the fact that it is close to Battery Park and walking distance of the Freedom Tower, Trinity Church and Wall Street. They did accomodate our request for early check in. We plan on going back there soon.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Overall was a great stay for the price I paid. Wish the rooms were a little bigger and that it had a tub, but still good. Didn't really enjoy the food from the restaurant that provided the room service. The area I stood had great tourist attractions. Would stay at a Double Tree again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great area if you are doing business in the financial district. Great choices for breakfast and lunch. Some options for dinner but gets a little slow after 6pm due to this area being business oriented. Have a few places to go and get a couple of drinks also. Parking is a little on the higj end....but that is just Manhattan.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We selected this hotel because it was in the Financial District and close to an event that we were attending. The room was small but very comfortable and provided what we needed for a short stay. The staff was professional and responsive but not very friendly. The breakfast was poor in selection of food and quality. The elevators were slow but adequate. Overall, comfortable and clean at a fair price.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The cost for parking was ridiculous on top the additional charge for USING your car! a joke! Rooms, small, dark. Area not around great places to eat nor did I feel safe walking alone at night. Yea, I know its NYC, but really...Took 45 minutes for them to get me my car from Valet parking? To park myself was just a few dollars less and farther away.
