Not a good stay and left for something in Jersey City that was far better, cleaner, larger, accommodating, and only $20.00 to park my car ALL WEEK as I was there for work.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I absolutely love the double Tree. However the elevator service was not the best. There were only 3 elevators for over 40 floors and one elevator stopped working during my stay. Other then that the employees were pretty nice. Room was small but manageable. Overall good experience, just minor things to improve on. Would definitely return. Also microwaves or refrigerators would be so helpful! Limited rooms with those items!
user_name:
Destiny C
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Tina at the desk was always helpful!! Friendly, and great at giving us directions... Thanks, Tina!! The beds were very comfortable. Our room was on the smaller side and one of the elevators was down making for looong wait times to get the elevator but other than that. We had a good time
user_name:
Michelle R
South Tampa, Florida, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Office is located a few blocks away. This hotel is very convenient and reasonably priced. Staff is always pleasant. I have stayed here multiple times and the experience has been consistent. I would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was my 2nd time staying at this property. I was not as impressed as the first time. I was greeted upon arrival on Sunday, 1/14/18 on the street level by a long line of people waiting for the elevator. Some had been there for a while. In a building that is 44 stories there has to be more than two elevators working especially in the evening when many people are arriving. Because of the hotel's layout with check-in on the second floor, that means two waits to get up to my room. After a while I gave up on the elevator and made my way with heavy suitcase, laptop, and another item and schlepped up the steps to the 2nd floor lobby, where yet another several people were camped out waiting for the same elevators.I was checked in quickly since I had bypassed those who were still downstairs waiting. My Hilton Honors Diamond status was recognized with 2 water bottles. Although I had checked in a day ahead and selected a room on the 30th floor, staff had upgraded me to the 44th floor, which I believe is the highest.The room was again what one would expect in NYC. Tiny with best use possible made of the space available. Bathroom leaves noplace to put down any toiletry bags or the items themselves.Good night of sleep and minimal noise from outside at that altitude. However, the heat could have been a little quieter. Controlling the temperature of the room was fairly easy once I got the hang of the thermostat.In the morning, I could not get hot water for a shower. It was ice cold despite the fact I ran it for 20 minutes. One negative aspect of the shower is that where the only door is placed, one has to put their hands through the flow of water to turn the shower on or off or adjust temperature. That made it more uncomfortable since it was very cold.When I checked in, the front desk assured me that breakfast would start at 6 AM. I even verified this knowing it would be a holiday, and they said yes it would be open. So around 6:30 I took another elevator ride to the ground floor lobby, to find the restaurant closed. Back upstairs again , and then I went down again at 7 AM and it was open. I was able to partake of the buffet quickly and be on my way. The food was good, and I appreciated it being on the house.Upon check-out, I told the front desk about the water issue, and I was told that it was known that the 44th floor had a problem and that maintenance was addressing it. That would do me no good, since I was already leaving. I did not complain about the elevators, since the evening crowds waiting for it had to be witnessed by the staff the night before. I did receive an apology for the water temperature as I scratched the dandruff out of my hair and heaved my luggage back down the stairs to the ground level to avoid one more elevator wait.There are many hotels in this area, and generally those in the financial district are better priced than Midtown. If you have nothing to do but wait for elevators, this property comes recommended. Once you do get to the room you paid for, it is comfortable. It's also easy to get to from subways in the South Ferry area.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for two days with my friend during December. The hotel is nice, cozy and comfortable. The services are great, too. What I like about this hotel is that you will receive warm cookie for each and everyone of you whenever you do your check-in. The only problem is that the room is a bit small.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: You are far enough away from the NYC chaos but also close enough to get back to it. Great spot with lots of subway stations around it and excellent ammenities. Great customer service as well. My girlfriend and I arrived a little early and were in a pinch with a show on Broadway at 2 p.m. Vanessa was outstanding and helped us get a room and also we were treated with welcome cookies. Thanks to all, highly recommended.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms are small and cramped. There are over 40 floors and 2 working elevators. Takes 20min to go up or down via elevators. My room was not cleaned. The only came in to make the bed. Not worth money.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We usually stay at the Hilton a Times Square but opted for walk near the ferry and museum. Reasonably priced for Manhattan and quite convenient to subway. I would give a 5 plus for the hotel front desk. Sheniece fabulous went above and beyond!!! Friendly patient and knowledgeable. I stayed on 44th floor, bathroom decent size. Remember it’s New York. My only complaint is that no hot water in my room which is major. They offered to change rooms which is a hassle repacking and I was trying to make a show. They deserve a 5 for customer service

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We were able to use the subway a lot because there is a station right across the street. The staff was friendly and helpful when needed. I saw many being helped with transportation, we did not need that service, but if it was a need, I feel confident that it would have been handled professionally.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My wife and stayed at this hotel 30 Dec thru Jan 6 2018 and were very pleased,with the accommodations . We were at this hotel during the winter storm that hit NY during this time period and our flight was cancelled. The hotel was very and helpful in extending our stay a couple days. This really eased our minds at that time.The staff was very welcoming us to NY and were always willing to assist us in our stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We booked this hotel for 13 nights during the Christmas and New Year period. The hotel is on Stone Street and has a subway station less than a minute walk which takes you pretty much to mid-town and upwards.We chose to walk as much as possible and managed most of our destinations. The staff in the hotel and restaurant (breakfast buffet) were courteous and delivered an excellent service.The gym facilities were decent for this type of hotel.The elevators took time to arrive and sometimes we had to wait for over 5 minutes during the peak morning periods which was a bit painful, but we managed to use the stairs as part of "exercising".I would recommend anyone staying at NYC to visit this hotel because the rooms were not too expensive and it was in a fairly quiet part of town - it may also be because were were there during the Christmas holiday season! might be buzzing in the summer I am sure.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel houses homeless people, I felt very unsafe.There was always sketchy people in the elevator and the entrance of the hotel.The hotel is very dingy and dirty I was highly disappointed.Staff could not answer simple questions about joining Hilton Honors, parking, or restaurants they basically didn't know anything.There was no doorman when I arrived just a couple of rough looking teenagers hanging out by the elevators,I will not return and I do not recommend.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great hotel and view , good service and the added restaurant is a bonus , they greeted us with cookies as the Hilton way, the valet greeted us and gave us pointers on places to visit and also took care of our car before it was parked

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: After a bad check in experience and poor staff performance, our bill was generously adjusted. We were made to wait for our room to be cleaned and then we were forgotten. Evidently the cleaners did not respond and the second shift of desk personnel were snippy and dismissive.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at this hotel with my fiancee over Xmas break. The staff was fantastic and as always the fresh baked cookies were a huge treat (especially after coming in from the cold). My only qualms with the hotel are the fact that it is so tall and not wide so there were only three working elevators. We often had to wait soooo long to get up to and down from our room. The bathrooms were also on the smaller side. I wish they made the room itself smaller and had a bigger shower stall and more counter space. As a fairly broad shouldered individual I couldn't turn around in the shower without bumping into the door or the wall.
user_name:
Aman B
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We usually stay in Times Square during our numerous visits to the big Apple but this time decided to stay in the FiDi. The rate was good, staff was friendly and the restaurant was fine. Unfortunately the 44 floors of guests proved too much for three elevators and we were forced to use the stairs. Next time we’ll stay central and avoid the traffic/timely Uber rides. Time is money.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms were nice and clean, they were small but that is what you are going to get in NYC. The staff was super friendly and helped out however they could. It was a simple and quick check in and check out process. There were 5 subway stops within a 2 block radius which made getting anywhere pretty easy.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at this property from dec 1st-3rd. Soon as we got there around 11am we wanted to store our luggage the bellman wasn’t there 10min later he shows up and we are off to roam the city. St We got back to check in around 4pm it was about 15 people on the ground floor waiting after waiting around 20min we walked up to the 2nd fl lobby it was around 20 people waiting for elevators. This hotel has only 3 elevators for 49floors and the cleaning staff took over one of them to take out trash at such a convenient time of 330. That showed poor customer service by them not to get off and let guest go their rooms. Fast forward to later that evening I go to wash my hands and the water is scalding hot I burn my hands call the desk which she was very nice she called maintenance and couldn’t get problem fixed they changed rooms and the next room the water is ice cold and this time it takes them a hour to fix thru all this we miss our dinner reservations. The next day more of the same mess with elevators. This was my gf first time to nyc and this hotel left a nasty taste in her mouth because she couldn’t get to her fave restaurant. Needless to say I wouldn’t recommend this hotel if going to nyc I’m going to my normal Doubletree on 52nd and Lexington I would advise others to do the same

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We love the Hilton and have had wonderful experiences with it's cleanliness and Freshness... hoping the Double Tree would be the same. Well... the service was good but the stench of "cleaners/air fresheners" was enough to put us off permanently! (we HAD requested no fragrant cleaners/fresheners because of Asthma) We smelled urian in the bathroom and had to keep our window open WITH air-conditioner on the entire time. Do feel fortunate we had windows to open though! At the price we missed the refrigerator.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Location is good so have to cut it some slack. However, the average waiting time for a lift was over 5 minutes, sometimes 10, when the first one is full. There are some extremely scruffy (not that big a deal) but also very fragrant smelling guests now seeming to be in the same lift as me between 9am and 8pm. Earlier or later and fortunately do not come across them. Is the Hilton housing homeless people?Spending 17 days in such a hotel is not a good experience.
user_name:
Greg W
Kingston upon Thames, United Kingdom

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I'm sorry I would like to know if you accept all credit card like postepay Evolution MasterCard that is a prepaid credit card with IBAN...Or is it possible to pay the caution Also by cash.We booked and paid everything before but I know that it is necessary to pay a caution and I don't know how much is itThank you

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The room was a great size and tastefully appointed with modern but comfortable flare. In particular I want to point out the staff, from the folks working the baggage area, to the receptionist. They were incredibly helpful in a number of ways that went above and beyond what they needed to. Gave me a big warm fuzzy feeling about NYC in general. Thanks!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Absolutely wonderful hotel; very close to metro. Parking garage only 1 block away. Met by baggage greeter at the door, who assisted with luggage and brought up to the room. Room maid was very nice and professional.
user_name:
lorilU5894KP
New York City, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This property has seen better days - from the peeling paint in our bathroom and the out of service elevators to the staff that cannot communicate. Very disappointing - only plus is the proximity to attractions in the Battery. We requested a room away from the elevator and were placed directly adjacent to one and the service area where clanging dishes sounded at 4 a.m.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Love it the price was great for NYC Room was just the right size and very comfortable I would defiantly stay here again if I need a place to stay when I visit NYC big enough for 2 people and location was great, Staff was very accommodating

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Be prepared for the slowest elevator service you can imagine. 44 stories and only 3 lethargic elevator cars. If it's winter, be patient waiting for hot water. On the plus side, the rooms are small but well appointed and comfortable. The staff is outstanding and helpful. The restaurant and bar are exceptional.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel was just ok... It's a tall building with only a few rooms per floor on the upper floors, but it did lack some expected features like a mini fridge and an alarm clock in the room. It was on a weird street downtown that GPS and Uber had an impossible time finding, so I don't expect a quick pick up. Taxi cabs do come around on occasion though and the hotel is on the corner of an R train station and a block and a half from the Bowling Green train station. The elevator situation is a mess... There's only 3 elevators and they are slow to put it mildly. What's worse is the reception area is on the 2nd floor, so your first impression of the place is a long wait just to get to the 2nd floor to check in, then a long wait to get back on the elevator to your room. There's 44 floors so forget about taking the stairs!The good things about this hotel is it's location for everything else. You're walking distance to the famous wall street bull, freedom tower and everything else in the financial district.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I've given you this several times. Your elevators suck. Your employees are constantly taking them to the cellar - even when they have no reason to do so (they could walk a flight of stairs unless they have something too large to manage). You know this. If you don't know this you are in the wrong business. The guy who checked me in could not have cared less that I was unhappy about my 27yh floor room. He checked the computer and did nothing other than refuse me based on that.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: While not awful, this property just does not meet the standards I've come to expect from a Doubletree or Hilton hotel. The room - I won't call it a suite, because it was NOT - was small even by NYC standards. A suite means, to me anyway, two rooms. This was basically a room with a sofa bed and a king bed. Very disappointing, considering 2 beds were cheaper. The room itself had ratty furniture and a toilet seat that nearly came off. The sink and shower were nice, as was having a fridge. The Junior Suites are on low floors, so don't expect a view. Being low also meant very full elevators at times when going down. Staff were universally polite and pleasant. The people were, by far, the best part of the hotel! The cookies were a close 2nd! If my wife and I traveled alone, I would consider this hotel again, but for 2 couples, it wasn't a very "suite" deal!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: From the moment we checked in we knew we'd chosen the right hotel. The staff was extremely helpful, considerate, and friendly. The location is ideal for experiencing anything in the city with access to the subway just a few steps from the hotel, as well as plenty of great pubs and restaurants just a block away. The room was clean and the view of the river and Staten Island Ferry was super! It made for the perfect hotel for our anniversary trip, with a nice complimentary bottle of bubbly to get the celebration started!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Pro:Room was a little spacious for NY standard, standing shower, bed and pillows were very comfortable.Nice TV - good channels. Quiet, at 44th floor at least.Con:Customer Service - The DoubleTree Hilton page says we will get welcome cookies - none.When we booked the room 1 month prior, we asked for a quiet room with a view. We got a beautiful view of....buildings.I called the hotel right after booking through TravelZoo to mention that we did submit a request that we will be on our honeymoon. The hotel said it's not in their notes and will get that added.Also that we might be arriving around 9am, can we check in early if a room is available - the answer was absolutely!When we called from the airport asking the status of the room, we spoke to LaTonya and she was very curt and dismissive - we don't have a room available and there is nothing she can do about it, and hung up.When we arrived at 12pm, no honeymoon notes as well. We checked in and went up to the 44th floor, only to find the key card was not working. So, another 15 minutes waiting for elevator, down to 2nd floor lobby, and... just too tired to even explain.And we got a plate of fruits for our honeymoon. Fruits. Really?Structure - What you see in the page is NOT the entrance of this hotel, it's the WINDOW of their restaurant.The entrance is on the side, congested. And the restaurant is congested, the lobby is on 2nd floor (strange) and you guessed it, congested.3 elevators for 44 floors and they are not programmed to run simultaneously. So, unless you wake up super early and return super late, expect to wait at least 15 minutes for the elevator.Not to mention the running elevator will stop at all the floors where people want to get on, and the worst thing is if you want to go to the lobby, you have to get off on 2nd floor and wait another 15 minutes to get to the ground floor. With large bags, the elevator can squeeze in 3 people.Cafe - they are very partial towards the business patrons rather than the tourists. No one really paid attention to us. The coffee was good though, never tried the food, cos the place was congested.Heating - the room was overly warm at night. We had the air conditioning down to 65F, but it did not help. We got up a couple of times at night to get water as the heat made our throats very dry.Room - the carpet was very dusty, like it was hastily vacuumed and only on the major area of the room. My husband bent down to pick something that rolled under the bed and could not stop sneezing afterwards.The coffee area only had 1 creamer.Bathroom - I liked the standing shower, but figuring out the water temperature was a pain. It was either freezing cold water, or scalding hot shower. We never got the happy medium. we took scalding hot showers.The shower gel and shampoo were Lemon Verbena scent and were in very tiny bottles, which were alright.Tools - the hairdryer worked great, but there was hair on the comb that was in the little sack the hairdryer was in, so, that was gross.Accessibility - Great! Right down the street Staten Island ferry, Bowling Green Subway station, Statue Cruises. It takes 15-20 minutes to get to Times Square. There is Chipotle and a pharmacy right around the corner.All in all, I would say, the cons outweighs the pro and I am not sure if I would book at this hotel again. I would however, recommend this hotel for its great rate.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms are good from US standards, don't expect them the same like India. But yes 42nd floor provided me a great view. Food is same all 7 day, when it comes to breakfast. But yes the location is awesome, close to Wall Street, Charging Bull. If its work awesome place to be. Has a Subway station Whitehall street within 30 seconds. Starbucks, Dukkin Donuts... coffee shop, nice pubs all within the vicinity of the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is quite run down, the elevators are very slow and very small, no water was lfet in my room after cleaning, so I had to request it be delivered, there was no cold water in bathroom, making showers very tricky, there was paint peeling from the ceiling, and outside is a noisy construction area. The room was also very small.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here for business at NYSE. Hotel is located just a couple blocks away so we could easily walk there. Staff was also very friendly and helpful. However reasons to avoid this hotel far outweigh the positives:*rooms are extremely small. Expected for NYC however it seems like they have made the "king" sized bed shorter to accommodate the small room. I am only 5'7" and my feet were hanging off the end if my head was not right at the headboard. *showers are very tiny. Husband had to shower sideways. *no counter space. Sink took up the entire vanity top so all toiletries have to go on toilet or shelf below sink. Not convenient when applying makeup. * shower leaked all over bathroom floor and onto carpeted area outside of bathroom. *elevator situation was horrible. We needed to change between events and had to wait in line for over 15 minutes. Some people in our group walked up 25+ flights to avoid elevators. *i think other people have mentioned this but I do believe they have long term section 8 or equivalent residents living on some floors. *street level entrance looks like a service area. You have to take the elevator (or walk) to the 2nd floor to official lobby. Very frustrating to people trying to check in during the peak elevator time. I have stayed at the Ritz in battery park for not much more than the cost of this room so consider that if you don't mind walking a little more.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I visited NYC over the summer, and I thought the rates were very fair for that time. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance of great restaurants. And of course, with it being in Manhattan, you can easily access the rest of the city by subway for sightseeing.The service was also really friendly. No issues with housekeeping. The room was average - it was pretty small, but very understandable considering how sparse space is, especially in Manhattan. The only real complaint I have is how slow the elevators were. If you're on a lower floor, you would be doing yourself a favor by skipping the elevators completely and just take the stairs. Anyone on the upper floors - good luck. Waiting a full 15 minutes for the elevators should not surprise you.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I booked this online and was pleasantly surprised! I have been to NYC quite often and this hotel find was great. The staff meet us with a smile and Latoya who worked behind the desk offered great customer service. The Lobby was clean and decorated wonderful! After I checked in we were offered fresh baked cookies and free water. We went up to the room and had a beautiful view of World Trade Tower and was close walking distance to the pier for the statue of Liberty Boat Tours. Although the room was a little on the small side it was clean and was great for the money. When we checked out they offered to hold our luggage while we walked around the city some more and Tony and Alex went over and above to make sure they held our luggage AND even took care of calling us a cab when we left. Very very nice staff and will definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I had a pleasant 2 night stay over a weekend, but this property definitely has pros and cons. The pros include competitive weekend rates as compared to mid-town hotels, a friendly and courterous staff, and good location with easy access to Metro lines, Staten Island Ferry, and attractions in lower Manhatten. The cons related the overall design and condition of the building. The entrance is very under whelming...in fact I initially thought I was using the service entrance, as the dim and narrow space contained linen/service carts, and some checked luggage. Fortunately a friendly staff member pointed me to the second floor lobby for check in. As others have noted, the elevators are small, and it appears there are only two available to service guests for a 40 story building resulting, in long waits during peak periods. Finally, the condition of the room left something to be desired. While modern in decor and generally clean, it was definitely well used, with damaged bathroom and lighting fixtures, peeling ceiling paint, and torn curtains. These items are not unusual for a well used hotel frequented by business travelers, but still sub-par to other Hilton properties I've had experience with. If you can get a good rate, than still probably worth it, but during peak periods when deals are scarce it's worth spending a bit more else where for better conditions.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms were nice and very typical for NYC rooms - small but clean and our room was updated and fine. And the great subway access is hard to beat. However, there are not enough elevators and everyone was complaining about the long waits and "hitting every floor" rides. The breakfast was not good at all - including milk that had soured. It is also obvious that some of the rooms are rented as a sort of hostel or Section 8 type of housing. I applaud the effort but it sometimes makes for unusual elevator mates. The staff does it's best - all were courteous, but this hotel just misses the mark. All in all, a mixed stay. You could do worse but you could also do better.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This property is in a good location but incredibly overpriced. It is at best mediocre. The bed was great and the room was generally clean, but could not get anyone to answer the phone in room service for 2 days (the restaurant was fully staffed and empty when I went down after trying to make a breakfast order). The unforgivable sin is the housekeeper letting herself into my room twice while the “do not disturb” sign was hanging on the door. I’d like to believe that unless I’ve overstated my reservation or there is some emergency (I hadn’t and there wasn’t), the staff would respect my desire to not be bothered.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights over Thanksgiving. The reception staff on arrival were very friendly. Our rooms were a good size and nice and clean. The location was great... it was nice and quiet in the financial district over thanksgiving. We could walk easily to the subway at Bowling Green or South Ferry. The Staten Island ferry was a short walk away, as was Battery Park, Wall Street, the raging bull, 9/11 memorial and One World tower. It's easy to get a subway uptown. The only disappointment for us about the hotel was the breakfast. I've stayed in many Hilton hotels including Doubletree and this was the worst breakfast I've had. Food was mediocre, facilities are dark and dingy, and the staff unhelpful... tables not set for breakfast, having to ask for food to be topped up and cutlery to eat with, no tea for two days running! (There was a store at the end of the road where someone could have popped out and bought some teabags!) I would advise finding somewhere else to eat breakfast, but the rooms comfortable. Our check out receptionist also had a poor attitude which was a bit disappointing, but the bell boy was very helpful about getting us to the airport. Would stay here again but definitely not have the breakfasts.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I left the hotel early in the morning and forgot my Bluetooth headset. I called the hotel and they had found it. When I asked if they could return it via mail, I was told no problem. In the past when I have left personal items in a hotel getting them back was always a challenge. I was very happy with this customer service
user_name:
James Dean R
Ames, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Looks like the hotel has seen much better days, in need of refurbishment and refurbishing. That said, the room was comfortable and everything worked. Excellent location for business in the financial district.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights over Thanksgiving. Hotel staff are really nice and very helpful. The location is very good, close to 3 subway stations and there are some nice bars and restaurants nearby. Walking distance to Staten Island ferry station, 9/11 memorial, Wall Street and Battery Park. The lifts are a wee bit of an issue if you are using them at peak times but outwith those times we had no problems. The rooms are a good size, clean and well kept. Would recommend this hotel and would happily stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Choose another property if you don't want to stay in a hostel No reception area, lack of elevators mean you may have to wait 15 mins to get one, then spend 10 mins getting to the lobby stopping at most floors on the way up/down

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Overall enjoyable stay. Rooms were always clean and tidy. Appreciated the modern and sleek decor/ bathroom. Business district is quiet at night, unlike tourist attracting areas of midtown or Times Square. Had no issues that other guests did of homeless despite coming in and out of the hotel many times...so either I didn't encounter any or I just wasn't able to discern them from normal guests. Overall enjoyed stay with boyfriend and would definitely stay again!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I am not sure why the Doubletree brand does not value HHonors members. My family stayed here and I can not understand why even the suites get no service. In a room that accommodates 4, you will get 2 towels and despite the request, you will need to call for the extra towels every day. My biggest disappointment is that the hotel is aware of who book thru Hilton and who is part of their loyalty program. There was no water in the rooms as part of the Gold HHonors program and asking for any type of service seemed to be an inconvenience for the hotel. When I called to raise the complain, Andreanis was very quick to say that she was not responsible and was not her the one to point the finger at. I am sorry, you work for a brand you represent the brand. After this experience and after almost 10 years as a gold HHonors member we are switching brands. Why be loyal when experiences like this are now more and more frequent.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This Doubletree knows how to move people in an out of their hotel quickly---and how to keep their rooms clean and well-presented. But there is no service of any kind. Reception does not answer phones, maintenance does not come to fix things. It is a second rate operation---but well worth it if the price is low. The fact that the hotel manager wastes his time responding to these reviews--instead of helping to provide service---is good enough example of what a poorly run operation it is.
user_name:
Chicagobes
Skopje, Republic of North Macedonia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed for 1 night as had meeting in Downtown 9-10 Nov 2017. However, come evening, it feels a bit isolated in quite downtown when the Midtown central New York comes alive hence a bit of a travel. Hotel OK but furnishing and upholstery seems dated/ageing. Hotel is regarded as 4 star but not to the high standards seen in Europe and Middle East. It treads on the same path as the American airliners where service standards seems to be somewhat different from the rest of Europe and the Middle East. No refrigerator in the room which seems to be odd for a supposedly a 4 star hotel. There are only 2 lifts/elevators which is not sufficient and seems to take ages to arrive (expect to keep 8-15 mins on hand just to come down or go up in busy times).Breakfast is good if not the best, but a word of caution - entry for breakfast seems to finish 15 mins before the closing time hence best to be there with good time on hand.No concierge but ground floor staff can assist with odd queries.Overall, staff are great and polite.Tip. Close to 2 subway stations, Bowling Green and South Ferry so one need to choose carefully which one to walk as they are in two different directions/can take two different routes which may involve unnecessarily interchange at later point hence save time. Also Duene Reade pharmacy and US Post office nearby.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed overnight at the hotel before our cruise. Being in the Financial District it is in a good location for many attractions. Staff member Wallace, was extremely helpful and gave us the directions we needed.Rooms are generally not available until after 3:00 pm but reception staff were helpful and did their best to find us a room and 30 mins after arriving at the hotel we were able to check-in and get out and explore Manhattan.Our small room was situated by a lift and also an “in demand” ice machine, consequently the exterior noises contributed to a poor nights sleep and I was pleased we were only there for one night.Buffet breakfast the next morning had a reasonable choice but food was not very appetising.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Overall, very nice experience. The room/hotel was smaller than expected. The hallways were pretty narrow, but manageable. Our single King size bedroom had a door connecting to the room next door. I wish we knew we had that because we wouldn't have chosen to have that if we knew beforehand. The elevators were slow for the amount of floors there were, but there's not much to change that without remodeling the entire hotel. The location was great though. We liked being in the Financial district and it was pretty quiet at night which was a plus! Staff was friendly and helpful as well.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was double charged for my security deposite and when brought to the attention of the staff they stated i checked in in correctly and it was not their fault they took my card AGAIN and charged it. On top of that they were rude and would forward the calls coming from out room or hang up the phone. The room was expensive and TINY and any issue that were had were received with attitude.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was our second double tree stay in America this month and what a let down. Firstly have to say the bell man are great and the staff are a credit to the hilton brand but the rest of the place where do I start. Lift up to reception only two lifts very small and very slow which after a flight and long taxi ride not great. Always queues for lifts. It is evident this hotel houses homeless which a lovely to give those less fortunate a place to stay and very profitable one for hilton but you do not advise paying guests of this!! Check in was prompt then another slow wait for the lift to our room floor 23.. very dated decor rubbish on the corridor which was still there the next day. The room it's self dark and small. Bed a reasonable size but very dusty, dated and just not what I would call Hilton or double tree standards. Air con and heating were so loud. Also loud work going off outside the hotel across the street very late at night. Location wise good near subway and ferry and battery park. Also an Irish bar right next door and lots of other bars and places to eat. Lots of homeless people congregate with the homeless guests just outside of the hotel. We have been loyal to hilton for many years as usually hilton offers great hotels but lately they have just been a let down and not worth the honours benefits which are pretty poor anyway. Hilton spend some money and live up to your brand thinking of trying Marriott, radioson blue or Riu hotels in future

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here when spending five days sightseeing in New York City in February 2017. I stayed in a superior room with a city view and it was great. Reception will give you free warm cookies every day - particularly nice when it's freezing cold outside!! My room was modern and well-equipped. It was nice to have a coffee machine in the room so you could make fresh coffee each morning before braving the cold outside! It took about 40 minutes to get from the hotel to Times Square and it's not far to the nearest metro station. The restaurant on the ground floor of the hotel is not operated by Hilton (as far as I'm aware), but I decided to go there one morning for breakfast. If I'm honest, it wasn't good. The buffet breakfast was not cheap, the selection was very poor and the quality was bad. I didn't return there again. As I say, I don't think the restaurant is operated by Hilton, but I'd recommend going elsewhere for breakfast. But the hotel itself is good and I'd recommend it!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was one of the worst experiences I had. These were the issues I faced * The air-conditioning was loud that the engineer had to replace the fan, filter, etc. Eventually I just switched off the fan. * The water was burning hot. The hotel sent the engineer who had to fix the water at-least 4 times to make sure I do not get burnt with scalding hot water. * The 1st night, it seems that the window was left open which was making a knocking sound and I could not sleep at all. Eventually they fixed the problem at 1.00 PM * The second night I was locked out and it took 30 minutes to enter the room * The 1st day room service was not done till 2.00 PM until I requested

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Just back in Ireland after spending 4 fantastic nights at the DoubleTree by Hilton. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The staff were very attentive to our needs, hotel was very clean, room was beautifully furnished and very comfortable. The food was beautiful, a wide variety of foods were availabe to choose from which made dining there a wonderful experience. The hotel is very central to shops cutting down on the need for taxis. Raymond Lynch

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The DoubleTree Financial District is basically a huge homeless shelter. The city has, along with the DoubleTree's owners of course, contracted to house dozens or hundreds of the city's homeless. I have nothing against the homeless, and feel pity for them, but for the DoubleTree to charge paying guests $400+/night, when many are staying for "free" is an outrage.Elevators are always slow! The homeless tenants clog them day and night. The rooms are always smelling like cigarette smoke (coming in from bathroom vent system).Don't stay here!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. The staff were friendly and the welcome cookie is delicious. My room (27th floor) was spacious although the bed was quite small. The hotel is within a few minutes walking distance for 3 different subway lines and Battery Park is very close by. restaurants and bars too. The member of staff called Alan was exceptionally friendly and helpful, a pleasure to chat too.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The reception is inside a restaurantes kitchen, the elevators take ages (ask for a low rise floor) and rooms are VERY small Good hotel if you don’t plan on being at the hotel during the day, it’s just for sleeping

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We had read about NYC hotels (even $600 per night hotels) taking in homeless people in exchange for taxpayer money, but haven't experienced it personally. Until recently. 25% of the hotel is rented to them, and they ride in the very slow elevators with paying ($339/night for us) guests. I told the manager that if I wanted to stay with homeless people, I would sleep on the sidewalk for free. The people are rough and strange (they ARE homeless people, so it's to be expected). Guests should be warned BEFORE they BOOK at this hotel. The location is great, but there are some very, very serious drawbacks to this hotel. We will never stay here again. What is Hilton thinking? Do they not realize the liability of housing homeless people with their guests? WOW.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed at the Double Hilton - Financial District. Good location close to Statue of Liberty and 911 Memorial. Easy access to subway. Took subway to Times Square. Amazing Times Square. Got there early to take part in taping of Good Morning America. Lots of shops and places to eat, some different than home, some the same. Have a good vacation.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for 4 nights spanning Saturday to Wednesday (leisure and work). Room 4410. I'll start with the Pros: 1) The bed is amazingly comfortable2) Staff is extremely friendly and accommodating3) Great location for exploring the FiDi and lower Manhattan. Close to subway stations and Brooklyn Bridge4) Delicious cookie upon check in - which was really nice after a long cross-country flight5) View was amazing! Hudson River view. Cons: 1) Elevators are small and extremely slow (3 elevators 44 floors and no separate service elevator for the staff, so elevators are sometimes full with carts). I intentionally picked a room on the 44th floor so at least I knew there would be room to get on the elevator. One trip up took 17 minutes (10 minute wait and 7 minute ride)2) Horrible smoke smell piped into my room - it smelled like someone was smoking a cigarette and weed in my room at the same time. Gross and unhealthy. 3) Housekeeping did not leave new toiletries. I wasn't about to brave the elevators to go back to the front desk to get more, so had to forego washing my hair since no shampoo or conditioner4) Room and bathroom are very small - difficult to maneuver around with two people in the room I read previous reviews, so I knew about the elevator and the small rooms. I can live with that - I'm in NYC so those are realities. What tipped my review to only two stars is the horrible smoke smell and the lack of toiletries. As a business traveller, showing up to work smelling like cigarette smoke was gross. I am a fan of Hilton hotels and stay at the Conrad fairly often. I won't be staying at this hotel again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed there on Oct 27 and 29 Oct and again on Oct 31 till Nov 4th. Rooms was average and remember to bring along your toothbrush and toothpaste. Constant leak after shower till the room door. Hotel is near the subway which is just across the road. Had 2 very helpful bell staff which i need to compliment, Allen and Wallace. Whenever you need help or directions, just ask 2 both of them and they will find ways to assist to the best way. Thanks. Overall no fuss hotel which is simply good for a good rest after a tired day and also a very convienient place to stay. Food and attraction are all plenty and nearby.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: So this hotel has a good location and that is ALL it has going for it. We are here for the NYC marathon. We have stayed at many Doubletrees and ONLY stay at Hilton properties and have been Diamond Hilton members for years, which means nothing at this property. My husband has our profile set up for high floors away from the elevators. We are supposed to get upgrades when available. When we had the audacity to ask for an upgrade, were told there were none. We were given a room on the 30th floor (out of 44) which not only is directly in front of the elevator, but also is right next to the housekeeping closet. When housekeeping is cleaning on one side, and slam doors, it actually shakes our headboards. When they are cleaning on the other side, or other customers come and go, it shakes the TV. I actually had to move the pillows about a foot from the headboard to avoid the reverberations. Aesthetically, no better. Looks like a Hampton Inn, There is so much caked and visible dirt in the air conditioner filter that we will be lucky not to contract Legionnaires disease.... The leather chair is filthy. No microwave. No mini-fridge. No frills. No offer of breakfast or executive lounge. Hilton will get these complaints directly as well, but they don't seem to care much these days. I have never written a hotel review, so this should tell you a lot!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was ok. Location was great. Just don’t expect to save leftovers or takeout. Very disappointed that there was no microwave in the rooms. But I can say there are many good restaurants around the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Front desk lacking in help and availability! Had a problem in the room and could not reach the front desk for over 15 minutes - what if it was an emergency? It was 9:30pm so someone should have been available. On another note - cookies were always stale:-(

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location is what I needed. It's close to Wall st, battery park and literally two steps from the train R. The trains 5 and W are also very close. The room was comfortable the all the service was efficient. I can say that I would put a mini fridge in the room for the basic stuff. The elevators were fast but I often waited for them.
user_name:
silvi19872017
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed for a quick weekend getaway. Arrived Friday and waited a long time for the elevator to take us to our room on the 32nd floor. Trying to leave hotel Saturday morning, we waited over 10 min for am elevator. We could hear the alarms going off in one elevator, and if another elevator door opened , the car was overstuffed with guests and luggage. There was no response from the staff, no notice posted on the entry and when we reached the front doorman (after walking down 32 floors), he had no idea that there was any issue. We also had very noisy plumbing overnight. Otherwise, the room was clean and adequate.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Location in the Financial District was good. Close to a number of different subway trains. Room was small, but clean, modern, and comfortable. Bathroom was also small with a narrow shower, no tub, and little vanity space. Elevator service was extremely slow with waiting times of up to 15 minutes! In a high rise building this is unacceptable and I would not stay at this hotel again. If you must stay here stay on a low floor so you can walk down the stairs.
user_name:
David D
West Orange, New Jersey

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel located in the centre of Financial District, we needed a place where to sleep, therefore did not pay too much attention to tourist attractions. People at the reception were a little bit slow, but OK. The room was also good, nothing special. We had a dinner downstairs in the Italian restaurant: candle light, Italian music, Italian-speaking waiter :), good wine, tasty food, we really enjoyed it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We got to the hotel at 4 PM when check in time is 3 PM and they did not have any rooms ready until 430 which was quite a disappointment. We were on the 43rd floor which is normally not a problem although the elevator situation is terrible. Everyone was complaining about how slow the elevators were and often times we had to wait over 10 minutes to get up and down floors. For that reason alone we will never stay there again. To be fair the rooms were a nice size, they were clean and it’s in a good spot, near everything.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The air conditioner leaked making the carpet wet. The door lock was not working properly, I had to insert my key numerous times to gain entry. I was told by maintenance that is how these keys work nothing is wrong. There were only two elevators for 44 floors so when they got to the 18th floor they were full. I had to walk the 18 floors to get out.
user_name:
William Robert K
Clifton Park, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel entrance come is on the side street, but is hindered by Construction in the adjacent building. Also the parking deck used by the hotel is not close to the hotel, so carrying more than one piece of luggage could be a challenge for one person.
user_name:
karenbC7996YC
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Easy access to points of interest - ground zero and 911 museum and statute of liberty - lots of food choices and water front dinning - shopping - safe ! Rooms are small as typical for NY and up to date options for business travelers. Subway nearby and Uber was great.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Horrible stay. Bed was uncomfortable we couldn't get more pillows. Water from bathroom all out into the room. The room was so small and so narrow. Told the restaurant was open till 11 we went in at 10:05 and were told they were closed. It was an all around worst stay we ever had. Owe and a fist fight outside our room in the middle of night in the hall by our door.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is fine -- yes, the rooms are small, especially the bathroom, but the elevators unfortunately define the experience. The waits are always long. The elevators are always full, meaning too often you have to wait for another elevator. And in the mornings it seems there is always a Hilton maid and their "suitcase" (the hallways and rooms are too small for normal carts....) in every elevator. And we were there over a weekend -- I an't imagine how bad it is before/after working hours on a weekday.Oh, and although it wasn't the hotel per se -- if I was the hotel manager I think I would have sent someone from maintenance to clean up the broken bag on food garbage 50 yards from the front door. It was starting to really smell after 3 days....

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Traveling with 2 boys (6 & 8 yrs), we booked a room with 2 dbl beds on a high floor (quiet, scenic) -- for their first visit to NYC, including Statue of Liberty, etc. I booked directly through HHonors, paid months in advance and checked in using the app earlier in the day before our arrival. As things go, our flight was late and we did not get to the hotel until late (11pm?) with 2 very tired kids -- to be greeted with the news that our reserved room was not available, "but we can upgrade you to one of our junior suites" (HA!). And to add to the pleasant moment, he volunteered to our 2 tired and hungry boys that they did NOT have any warm cookies for them, but they could stop by the desk tomorrow... (why even mention it?!!) Then, we went to our "upgraded" room -- on the 4th floor, in a corner next to all the elevators, with only one bed and a pullout sofa -- which had no sheets or pillows -- and a close-up of a construction site outside the window (no sleeping in after that long nite of travel!). We were offered zero compensation for the inconveniences (other than a late check-out by 1pm) and no warm cookies on the next day -- nothing to thank us for our understanding and patience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Poor experience. Room and hallway never vacuumed. Desk chair too filthy to sit in. Tiny room and bathroom even by NYC standards. Plus-staff pleasant and good restaurant. This hotel fell well below the standards I expect from a Hilton facility. Elevators were very slow, room was poorly maintained with dirty, frayed furniture. Little to no sound proofing making easy to hear people in adjacent rooms. Cracked sink in bathroom. At $250 + taxes per night felt more like an upper-end motel.
user_name:
Stephanie Y W
Charleston, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location was good for many tourist sites & subway, the rooms were bigger than I expected and very comfortable, staff was always pleasant & helpful, and the arrangement with the parking garage was a big plus.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: When traveling to New York City, I've come to expect small rooms. However, the bathroom at the Double tree on stone street was beyond tiny. I had to shower sideways not to hit the glass enclosure. There is a sink on a pedestal, but no room for a cup, dock kit, let alone a tooth brush. The elevators are a big mess especially in the mornings. Seems the cleaning crew love to occupy it, delivering vacuums, dirty laundry and other items while leaving no room for guests. Waits can take ten minutes or more. Speaking of housekeeping, while spending their day on the elevators as if they were theme park rides, they failed to clean my room twice while I stayed. With new competition just around the corner, I can't imagine staying here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff were not too friendly. The room was not city view at all (I requested for city view) - I was looking into other high rise buildings. The elevator was very slow that I had to take the stairs from 33rd floor going down. There is no refrigerator in the room to store anything like bottle of water. The room was very warm even when the thermostat was adjusted. The business center is ok. If you are one of those that love staying at Hilton Hotels like myself, don't stay here. I don't recommend this location.
user_name:
Sandra O
North Brunswick, New Jersey

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I’ve chosen this hotel several times as it’s close to our office, but the location is also great for transport and sightseeing. The rooms are always clean and well presented, as you’d expect from this brand and the hotel is generally quiet. The entrance from the street is always disappointing, straight into the elevator bank with reception on level 2. The only issue with the hotel is with the ineffective elevators for this size of property, it’s not unusual at peak times to wait 10-15 mins for an elevator to arrive and then they stop at almost every floor (I was on 37) on the way down - I’ve never felt that elevator issues could spoil a hotel, but this one comes close!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Excellent would use this location again. The hotel is clean and located close to restaurants and attractions. Staff was friendly I use this hotel often when I need to travel to the city for business..

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stained bed linen, noises air conditioning, elevators that couldn't cope with the number of guests, dirty bed linen. Normally I would give a hotel the benefit of the doubt but for the amount we paid and the fact this hotel is part of a large chain the standard of this hotel really was poor

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Pros - I arrived at 8am and they had a room available for me to checkin. Location is good. Cons - room feels dark and dank. Many flies in the bathroom. I noticed a small dried blood spot on my sheets when I checked in and was there even after two days which made me wonder when the sheets were changed at all (and if they were changed before I checked in!). I had to ask the receptionist to request for it to be changed and they did. Breakfast is one of the worst I’ve ever had in a mid priced hotel. I’m just glad I didn’t pay for the room rate with breakfast and went elsewhere for breakfast the rest of my stay

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Rooms are size wise and in terms of facilities what you should expect in this price range, house keeping is quite OK. Same applies for the gym. Did not use the breakfast but that was in previous year more or less OK.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel with easy access to subway lines in short walking distance. Nice recreational sites close by including access to Liberty Island. Wall Street just a couple blocks North in walking distance. Starbucks right around the corner.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We booked the DoubleTree Financial District for a weekend visit to see a Broadway show and do a little sightseeing. Rooms are small but well laid out. The bathroom is small but has adequate shelf space next to the vanity sink. Water pressure and temperature were fine. As others have noted, the air conditioning unit has a noisy fan; it also drips water on the floor which makes the carpet feel uncomfortably damp to bare feet near the window. The view from our 40th floor room was pretty cool. We had a corner room on the City View side (01 thru 07) and the new World Trade Center buildings were right in front​ of us, with glimpses of buildings further uptown and a bit of the Hudson River. Elevator noise was not an issue and our elevator waits were not too bad. Considering this was the lowest priced decent hotel room in Manhattan for our visit, we were happy overall. Room Service did forget the coffee with our breakfast order, but brought it quickly when we asked.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I waited 15 minutes for an elevator before I took the stairs down 6 flights carrying my suitcase. There were 3 elevators available but only 2 were operational. Now I realize I should just have called a bellhop.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The room was clean. And the service is always very good when ever I stay there. But they did have a problem in the room with the bathroom. The door did not close correctly which flooded the bathroom floor.
user_name:
Lillian L
Grosse Pointe Shores, Michigan

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Excellent service,small but excellent room and very comfortable bed. The staff were friendly and professional. The warm cookies on arrival was a lovely touch. The location was perfect for all the sights.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights in August and was perfect for a short stay. The location was great right near 2 different subway stations. Very close walk to the staten island ferry and battery park for a good view of the statue of liberty. I booked this through hot wire and would definitely recommend as it is cheaper than other websites. Great stay and friendly staff.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We will not use this hotel again. The rooms were shabby and dirty. There were flies coming out of the bathroom sink in one of the rooms. The hotel did not meet the standards we have seen in other DoubleTree Hotels.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Although Doubletree has better properties but probably it's closeness to Financial hub of N.Y. makes up for it. There was a lot of feedback on here about slow lifts, however I did not find that an issue. Being on business I needed to be close to office so it worked, however I don't think I will book it for leisure.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: A great stay in the financial district Close to restaurants and sites fairly easy to get transportation I was there during UN week extremely busy area but walking distance to Empire State Hudson River and East River

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Evening Manager Miguel lacked integrity and assigned us an room that was not fit to accommodate anyone. He clearly doe not care about his job. He then left to go home. Pauline was left to fend for herself with one problem after another. When I left there was a man yelling at her but it was not her fault. Miguel just neglected to be a leader and left her standing in chaos. The two security guys did the same. I was disgusted and disappointed in so many ways that evening. Pauline provided a different accommodation at a nearby hotel to save the weekend getaway. Thank you Pauline!!!
user_name:
Spontaneity2015
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: poor cleanliness in 1st room they gave us; 2nd one is better but carpet is sticky as well; and shower water temperature is not stable all the time; the staff in restaurant had rude attitude when we had breakfast

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I've stayed here twice for the cleanness and the proximity to my destination.The other positive elements:- Welcoming staff- warm cookies- The proximity to some attractions (by foot): battery park, ferry to the statue, the bull, Wall Street, Stone Street, 911 Memorial, Brooklyn Bridge- Proximity to restaurants and barsSome suprising elements:- Lobby is on the 1st floor - not on main street- Elevator is slow- Corridor are narrow and darkAlso, a good way to measure your experience is when something wrong happened...I will come again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Nice hotel, noisy air conditioning unit, hard to find but clean rooms and good bathrooms. I would try to reduce the noise of the air conditioning unit and try to let one open the windows. the room has nice comforter.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I had to head to New York on a moments notice and booked this hotel. We were given relatively small, but amply outfitted room on the top floor. It was an excellent stay. I cannot get over our view. I’ve posted a photo of the view.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: On the positive side; great location, friendly staff, clean room and comfortable bed. On the negative side; the room is pathetically small (woefully small), there are no counter tops whatsoever in the bathroom, the shower is very small and the room does not have any space to use a luggage rack (without moving furniture around). They have used the very little bit of desktop space for the coffee maker and accessories, therefore, there is virtually no desk/work space.The breakfast for a Hilton Gold member was inadequate. We stayed 2 days and they offered the same scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage and pancakes each day... no variety to speak of. For the price paid and the discomfort of the minimalist space, I would NEVER stay here again. Hilton needs to sell this property to a lesser quality branded hotel and stay the course with their typical properties.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Our Double Tree room was very clean, quiet at night and the staff was very helpful. The lower Manhattan location was ideal for travel on the subways. The nightly room rate was reasonable considering we stayed in New York City. I recommend the Double Tree Hotel in the Financial District.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Small room, but clean, with nice amenities. We were on the top floor - never had any issues with the elevators - but ran into some people that said they waited 15 minutes for an elevator to stop for them. Good view & good location. Right in the middle of the financial district. Within a block of several subway stops. Charming bars and pubs just around the corner - a little slice of OLD New York.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This place is simply not worth the price. I usually stay in Midtown but decided to stay at this location because of meetings nearby. I was very disappointed in this hotel. The location is pretty good but that's about it. The rooms are cramped, as is common w/ NYC hotels. Decor was pretty disappointing for a place charging $300-$400/night. Also, this hotel doesn't have any refrigerators in the rooms and doesn't even enable guests to store food in the hotel's refrigerator for free. I asked and they said its $30/day to use their refrigerator!I will never stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Not realizing it was UN Week in New York, I had had a difficult time finding a hotel reservation. I found a Double Tree Hotel in the Financial District. I like that area of Manhattan because with the Stock Exchange close by there is extra security in the area. The front entrance was dreary. The hotel staff were friendly. The elevators took forever. I finally discovered that they didn't work if you want to go up, so I had to go down first before going up. The hotel room was reminiscent of hotels in the early 60's: dark, clunky furniture and tan, tan, tan color everywhere! The bed was extremely comfortable and if you want to have a place to sleep for a night, it did meet that requirement. I did expect cockroaches to come out when I turned out the light, so I slept with the light on. Needless to say, I found another hotel the next day.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I am a long time Hilton user with over 1,000 room nights at more than 100 Hilton hotels worldwide. This was the worst run hotel in franchise that I have experienced. Let's start with the good, however. Good location and nice bed.........that about covers the positives.The lousy experience started upon check in. The usual chocolate chip cookies the DoubleTree is known for were cold and hard. Worse, the hotel which should have at least 5 elevator banks has 3 and one of them was offline about a third of the time. We got our keys from the front desk and waited 5 minutes for an elevator. We open 'our' hotel room on the 19th floor only to find a nice, older Chinese man that must have been given same keys a few minutes earlier as he was unpacking. We apologized, waited another 5 minutes to get elevator and got another room on 20th floor.The housekeeping person on our floor was abysmal and we had to tell front desk to have her come twice after not cleaning the room when we were out at brunch and walking around for 4 hours. Front desk personnel were consistently surly and housekeeper did not speak a word of English. I emphasized that girlfriend was sleeping one afternoon and not to disturb her. When I came back I was told she was removing the sheets when my girl woke up.The clientele also seemed very down market despite a price of $340 a night (including taxes) hotel was charging. My girlfriend who is Brazilian and doesn't have a mean bone in her body, asked why there seemed to be so many 'homeless' folks in the hotel. Gym was sparse so it was also hard to work out frustration with the hotel staff. Unless you want an 'econolodge' experience at a Conrad price, avoid this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is well located for access to the financial district in lower manhattan. Check in was quick and efficient. Rooms are well appointed and very comfortable. Corridors on the small side. The wait for the lift can be long though so do allow time to leave the hotel if you are on a deadline. I haven't eaten here so can't comment on the restaurant.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: we made a mistake when booking this hotel and booked for one night instead of 2. when we tried to book another night we where told it was fully booked as it was the 9/11 memorial on the extra day we wanted. we tried elsewhere to find alternative accommodation but everywhere was booked. the gentleman behind reception who was very helpful (sorry we did nt get his name) said to come back later on and he would get us something. he was true to his word he managed to get us 2 rooms (we were looking for 3) and he at least had the decency to looked ashamed when he informed us it would be double the price of the previous night. i find it disgraceful that the hlton would rip off what is still a very emotional day for America. shame on yous.we took the $400 a night rooms or we would have had to go outside the city, something we did not wish to do as we don't know the area or cut short the stay. the hotel itself is clean and rooms are spacious, the staff are nce and helpful but OMG the bar, first of all its expensive and to top it all off the bar man did not wait for a tip which he would have received but added 15% to every round we bought, considering he only served us at the bar (not at the table), this is his job and we took empty glasses u to him to clear the table i think this was shocking, then the bar closed at 11 oclock. we had been in new York from 8am - till 9.45 so were looking to relax and unwind with a few beers ..not in this hotel you wont.overall cant fault the rooms but was it value for money? not a chance, shame on the Hilton for clearly making money out of a disaster, if and its a big if i ever venture back to new York i certainly wont be booking this hotel, in fact it has put me off booking any Hilton.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location and nice, clean well appointed rooms, some with nice water view, but beware of elevator service and be prepared to wait a long time. We previously had poor experience for breakfast in the restaurant so we avoided it this time.
user_name:
Al6244
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is ideally located for those travelling to the Financial District for work, it is clean and comfortable with all the amenities that you'd expect. WiFi is present throughout but doesn't seem to be free, although codes are provided. It can take a long time to get to or from your floor as there are only three elevators and they're often very busy. The bathroom sink did not have a plug, making shaving a slightly awkward experience. We had breakfast included, it is adequate but there are better options nearby for similar or lower prices. The entrance does seem rather run down and gives a bit of a negative impression, but the lobby and rooms are much nicer. Would happily stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed just one night as we were attending a wedding in nearby Battery Park.The hotel is conveniently located in downtown Manhattan. A few subway stations (different lines) within walking distance. Also within walking distance are a few different food outlets. There's a drugstore next door (not open 24/7).Only a few rooms on every floor, so the room is quiet.When staying here, do allow additional time to cater for the lack of elevators. There are only 3 elevators covering many floors. Housekeeping and porters also use the same elevators, so it does get a little bit crowded at times.Rooms are small, but that's not unexpected in Manhattan. Reception staff are efficient and polite. Special mention goes to one of their porters, Tony, who took one look at the number of bags we were handling, and immediately made recommendations for our transportation to JFK airport.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for 7 nights earlier this month. Really chose the hotel due to its location being near to where my sister lives and the fact that you can walk to so many places - Battery Park for the ferries, South sea ports, China Town, Little Italy, Brooklyn Bridge, Freedom Tower and the memorial pools and the Occulus. Also very near to subway station where you can catch trains to Brooklyn, Central Park, Times Square etc all reached within about 20/25 minutes by train. I was slightly disappointed upon arrival at the look of the hotel - its above a restaurant with 'net curtains' at its windows that looked like they needed a good wash!! The hotel reception is on the second floor. We arrived at 2pm but sadly our room wasn't ready so we were told to leave our luggage and return an hour later. This meant taking our luggage back down to the ground floor where concierge looked after it for us. Upon our return an hour and a half later our room still wasn't ready and it actually took around a further 30 minutes or so until it was. The gentleman called Will on reception gave us a voucher to use in the restaurant below the hotel as an apology for the delay which was very nice and we used it one lunchtime and the food was very good. Our room was on the 35th floor with a view of the East river in between a couple of buildings. It was a very small room, the bed was very comfortable although the furniture was rather dated and although we were supposed to have a sitting area there was only one rather shabby desk chair. The room itself plus the bathroom were very clean and was cleaned every day to a high standard. I am a light sleeper so sadly I was kept awake by the ice machine in the corridor very near to our room which would make noises during the night as it made ice. You would then get inconsiderate hotel guests wanting ice at ridiculous times of the night/early hours of the morning. Although being 35 floors up you could also still hear car horns, traffic, dustcarts, builders working etc during the night plus guests who don't give a second thought to letting their room door slam shut. Perhaps the hotel could look at ways of having the doors shut slower or quieter as that's very annoying. After three nights of being kept awake by the ice machine I asked if we could change rooms. Will once again helped us out and we were able to move to a room on the 6th floor where there was no ice machine. We did loose the view but I needed to sleep so it was worth it. This room was bigger with an armchair in addition to the desk chair which I had been expecting in our original room. It was also a room which had a connecting door to another room and I did hear the occupant of that room return around 1am one night and then make a phone call. I could hear her on the phone for about 20 Minutes. As previously said I am a light sleeper so maybe I'm just unlucky but again it's just another guest who doesn't consider their surroundings. On a more positive note ALL the staff were really friendly/helpful and the different concierge would always welcome you upon arrival or wish you a pleasant day/evening when you went out. Will was extremely helpful. The lift situation as mentioned in other reviews was a little annoying but once we moved down to the 6th floor if it arrived and we couldn't get in then we would just walk down. This was no real hardship and we would have done the same even if we had been up as high as say the 10th floor. Overall the hotel was adequate for our needs and I feel that wherever you stay in a city like New York you will hear noise from outside.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was my first time in New York with my mom. We wanted a hotel from a Manhattan but not from straight center and we ended up choosing DoubleTree Hilton Financial District.The price was surprisingly low compared to other Hiltons which was great for our budget.When we reached the hotel after 13 hours of traveling we were happy to notice that our room had been upgraded to city view room with an AMAZING view to the One World building on the 43rd floor. There is a coffee maker on each room and beds are super comfy!Reception was nice, the staff was friendly and very helpful (special thanks to Alex ). Our flight back to Finland was at 21:50 pm and we got the late check-out for free untill 14:00. You can get late check-out for 13:00 with Hilton Honors, which I highly recommend! Wifi was fast. The hotel is located to the very bottom of the Manhattan which is nice and calm area. There is a subway station right next to the hotel for the R and W metros which go straight to the Time Square in 15 minutes and back. The subway seems complicated first but when you get used to it it's the best way to get around. This won't be the last time I visit New York and I'll definetly come back to this hotel! Thank you for a wonderful stay you provided! ^_^

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Comfortable bed, was quiet at night, but the room was old and needs updating. Carpet felt worn and could be more plush. The coffee pot could be cleaner. The sink only had hot water upon arrival and when we didn't notify maintenance, cold water in the shower quit on last day as well. We reported the problem on departure.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
