review_body: I had a standard king room which was of adequate size for Manhattan. I had complimentary breakfast being a hilton being a hilton gold member. The breakfast spread is very limited and didnt look appetising so didnt l eat there. I wasnt offered any room upgrade which I usually get offered being a gold member. Also, please note that there is no Exec lounge. The hotel gym could have had a few more items in it, but ok as hotel gyms go in Manhattan.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: All the amenities expected in an ideal location; next to several subway lines and Staten Island Ferry terminal. Concierge very helpful with taxis and commute times. The one disappointment was the variety at breakfasts; specifically very limited cooked buffet selection, otherwise all very good.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Poor hotel with soft mattresses, poor heating with terrible breakfast. Breakfast staff unfriendly and too busy texting to serve. As a gold member I got far from gold standard service. Not up to the standard I would expect from Hilton

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at the DoubleTree FiDi hotel for business for two nights, and although the staff was amazing, the hotel itself was not. It was old and not the best upkeep. Towels in my bathroom had slight stains making me not want to use them. The room was very small and the hotel itself was oddly laid out. Bellmen were very nice and check in and check out was a breeze.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The furniture in the room is cheap- the type you buy from Target in a box and assemble yourself. The dresser drawers won't stay shut. There was tv remote in room. Maintenance came to room in middle of night uninvited. Room keys are disabled before your stat ends.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: What you see is not always what you get! Paid an extra $10 a night to get better view, higher floor and more space. Got the higher floor but not much else! No breakfast available and one choice of restaurant.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Staff were very helpful and location was definitely in the best place for my needs. There were a few negatives to my trip but they were minor to me. The first was there are only 3 small - medium elevators that caters to 42-44 floors worth of guests. The wait time could take forever or some times you may be stuck waiting on just one elevator to go up and down. The second was the house cleaning staff would ask to service your room, and when I responded no thank you, they still came in to realize that I said no thank you. I mean I could have placed the do not disturb sign up, but I just didn't need my room serviced. These are really minor to me but some other people may find them more serious.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: NY metro links is fantastic. The nearest station to DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Financial District is Whitehall station. Use Stone street exit to get out of metro and once you are on the road level, cross the street and Doubletree is 2 mins walk away. It is about 5 minutes walk to Bowling Green station and 7 minutes walk to South Ferry station.The hotel uses Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries and there is a coffee machine in the room. It does not provide daily complimentary mineral water. As with DoubleTree - Hilton culture, you get the welcome warm cookie and mineral water.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: So here's an interesting hotel. Everything about the room was nice. Comfy bed, easy to control temperature, water plenty hot. Two issues though: apparently DND signs are suggestions as the first day my room was cleaned despite the sign on the door. Not the worst thing in the world though, but still, come on. Second, as mentioned by others, the elevators here are a train wreck. I waited 9 minutes one day and I was only on 25. I can't imagine what life was like on 33...which I was originally supposed to be on and then was switched for some reason. It's to the point where if you can get up to your room without making a stop it's like winning the lottery.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hands down one of the WORST hotel experiences I've ever had. Arrival: When I arrived I was not allowed to use the cart to bring my luggage to the lobby, on the second floor after taking a ride of the SLOWEST moving elevators ever. When the first elevator arrived an employee with a towel cart took it, while I struggled to hold the weight of all of my things. Hot cookie? No thanks. The hot cookie you get in arrived...mine was cold and burnt. Room: I felt like I was at a dingy motel. The water was scalding hot and burnt me when I tried to shower for a black tie event. Barely an apology from the front desk and no offer to fix it for our one night stay. Literally nothing in the room. No hotel pens or overpriced water you can buy. I had to go or and buy water so that there was something I could wash my face with that wouldn't melt my skin. AC - had it as low as it would go and the room was still too hot. There are so many nice places to stay in NYC - even if you have to pay more GO SOMEWHERE ELSE. I have never felt so strongly and been so disappointed in all my years of traveling. There was one nice employee - Tony working Valet in the front. He should probably be working at the Ritz and not here, where service is not their business.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Had a fantastic time here. Massive bed, very clean, beautiful view. Very happy. Thanks for making our stay brilliant :) It's right next to a delicious steak house and a Starbucks round the corner. Also it's minutes walk from the statue of liberty :) staying here puts you right where you want to be and if your traveling any where don't take a taxi, use the subway. So easy to use and very regular :) price was perfect considering we went a week before xmas, can't wait to visit again :)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel was in a great location. The staff was very friendly. Checking in took a long time, and there was a little confusion about something on my account. The comforter was also stained and turned down towards the bed. Overall it was quiet and comfortable. We had trouble connecting to the internet, but I think that was the same for the area.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Decent hotel. Room was fine. Clean, no noise issues. If you want to be downtown the location is fine. But there is a serious issue with the elevators. The hotel layout is a little different in that there are a small number of room but a large number of floors. And only 2-3 elevators. You can have long waits for elevators. People in our party waited 15-20 minutes to get an elevator. Some people rode them up just to ensure that they could get one coming down. Plan ahead.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at this DoubleTree for four nights and I had a great experience! I booked the hotel at an amazing price for New York City and am completely satisfied. The location was great being steps away from Wall Street and the Statute of Liberty. However, it is a fairly far subway ride away from other attractions such as Times Square and Chinatown, but since New York City is such a large city, the transportation time is reasonable. Check-in was not a problem, and it was especially welcoming how the doormen greeted you upon arrival each time you went back into the hotel. I noticed that the room size and elevators were an issue in some reviews, but in my experience, I did not have much of a problem with this. The elevator wait time was around 2 minutes average for me, with the most being about 5 minutes. The rooms were small, but for staying in NYC and for the price, it was completely fine. Although small, the rooms are nice and clean, and this is what I am mainly looking for in a hotel along with location. Given the opportunity, I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to future guests if they don't mind the elevator wait or room size.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My room smelled like wet cigarettes. I called the service line and was told I would have to bring all my stuff to the lobby and wait an hour (maybe longer) for someone to clean my room. This was not possible for me as I had a business dinner to attend, the staff said it was the only option, they couldn't move me.I had a horrible night's sleep as I was congested and was dealing with a headache all night. I've stayed at this hotel many times for both business and pleasure and have seen first hand the slow degradation in quality and experience. I will not be staying here again and will be recommending to my travel manager that we no longer have thus DoubleTree listed as a preferred hotel... There are plenty of other nearby options.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Wonderful staff and services! Location, location, location! The staff is overly accomodating, friendly and the hotel is immaculate! The restaurant was an experience in itself - the food was fabulous and the service was even better!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel being a Hilton brand had me fooled. I stayed here thinking that it would be like all of my other experiences at Hilton's and it wasn't. The furniture was old. The elevators took forever to come and then they were hot. The hot water didn't work all of the time. You could be in the middle of a shower and lose hot water. The worst was when the AC went out and my family was forced to sleep in a room that was over 85 degrees during the night. My infant and children were extremely uncomfortable. I was told that no one worked in maintenance overnight so we would have to wait until the next morning. No offer to move us or anything just basically tough it out.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Super clean hotel in a quiet location downtown. Granted you're about a half hour subway ride from the heart of the city, but if you want something for a good price and don't mind the location, this is the place for you. The elevators are a little slow but that's the only downfall. Friendly staff, solid internet, and they really do give you a warm cookie!! (They have nuts in them though, so be careful.) :)
user_name:
Gina L
New York City, United Kingdom

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The room was small but it served its purpose. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. It is located in a very touristy area with lots to see. The 911 memorial is a must see. We only had one issue which was a leaking AC unit.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The Doubletree Hotel on Stone Street in the Financial District could not be better situated for tourists. It is within walking distance to numerous sites, including the ferries to the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, Staten Island and Governor’s Island. It is steps away from the famous Wall Street “Bull”. Just down the street is the magnificent Alexander Hamilton Customs House which houses the Smithsonian’s Native American Museum as well as the wonderful NYC branch of the National Archives. You can walk to the NY Stock Market, Fraunces Tavern, Bowling Green and the “Museum of Jewish Heritage, A Living Memorial to the Holocaust” on Battery Place. The subway on the corner will deliver you to Times Square and the theater district in less than a half hour. Just a short walk away is South Street Seaport where you can purchase deeply discounted Broadway theater tickets for same day evening shows and “day before” matinees. Lots of restaurants are nearby including convenient breakfast stops just around the corner as well as numerous breakfast carts practically in front of the hotel. Like most NY City hotels the rooms are small, but they provide all the amenities you’d expect in addition to the warm chocolate chip cookies provided at “check in” by all Doubletree Inns. Popoo

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Spent Friday-Saturday-Sunday nights there visiting family nearby. Price was very reasonable. Employees very friendly and very helpful. One caution: our king-sized bed seemed shorter than most king-size beds, possibly an accommodation to the typically smaller NYC hotel rooms. Hotel is two blocks from the Stone Street historic area which has many places to eat and relax, even on weekends when most of the financial district is very quiet (strongly recommend the Stone Street tavern for dinner and for brunch).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Average hotel, but my complaint has to do with the slowness of elevators. Our room was on 34th floor and each time we wanted to go down to the lobby or back up again, we had to wait between 10 and 15 minutes for the elevator. When I complained to the reception staff, they said yes, elevators are a problem but they can do nothing about it. Obviously, it's impossible to walk up and down 34 floors so taking stairs was not an option.We won't stay at this hotel any more because of this.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel provided an excellent stepping off point to see the city. Close access to Wall Street, Battery Park and Statue of Liberty and fast trip to everywhere else by subway. Very clean and comfortable hotel in the heart of the financial district. Small rooms, but clean and modern. Breakfast was OK, nothing to write home about, but convenient. Not bad for family, but can't comment too much on amenities as we spent most of the time outside the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location of the restaurant was nice. We enjoyed the city view, but the elevators made the stay unpleasant. Seemingly only one of the three elevators was working at anyone time. We stayed on the 40th floor to get a city and almost every time we took the elevator, only one was working and we nearly stopped at every floor, both going up and/or down. It is unfortunate because this is what remembered about the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: For a 46 story hotel building it only has 3 elevators which is also shared by the cleaning and maintenance staff. During the busier hours, e.g. mornings and afternoon, you can spend up to 15-20 minutes waiting for the elevator. Once a fight nearly broke out because another guest had been waiting for a while and by the time it arrived it was full and they tried to pushed their way into it. This is worse than taking the 6 train during morning commutes!
user_name:
LuckyMenace
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Of 4 different hotels I've stayed in for business in the Financial District, this one was definitely the best one. It's located very close to battery park and the raging bull, at the southern tip of Manhattan, so it might be a bit of a walk (5-10) minutes from your point of business, but it's worth it.The room was small as standard in the area, but not so small you can't move around in it. The hotel is designed nicely, the room was clean and reasonably quiet, and the bed was pretty comfy. Staff was of course pleasant and WiFi was acceptable. The surprise was the price - much cheaper than even a holiday inn express in the area, and you can't possibly compare the quality of Hilton and that.The disadvantages were minor - no breakfast, slow elevators (or not enough of them), the area isn't very pleasant or clean (no area in Manhattan is, really) and the WiFi could be better. Overall would stay there again if I needed to be in FiDi.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed for 6 nights for a friend's wedding. Hotel itself was great - rooms are clean, great location and in hotel staff are friendly. However - their charging system is crazy. 3 days after leaving the hotel, Doubletree still have £1700 preauthorised on my card - despite having paid for the room. Once you've checked out, getting in touch with someone at doubletree who can help is impossible - no one answers the phone, and if they do they are super aggressive and unhelpful. Such a shame - would never stay at a Hilton group hotel again when it seems their policy is to bankrupt guests !

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: It was an awesome experience, first time in NewYork all the fun and craziness with friends, one of the best hotel experience in Double tree Hilton, amazing staff and good house keeping, travel guidance system, Room was tidy. refreshments were great, all round was a great experience, we really loved it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I've stayed here many times and have always found the staff and hotel a great place. Unlike many hotels in Manhattan, the desk clerks usually let me check in several hours early. The room is always clean. Easy walking distance to all the sights in that part of town.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a good business hotel conveniently located near Wall Street. The rooms are clean and well appointed, wifi is good. The restaurant (in the same building but not run by the hotel) was excellent -- I was pleasantly surprised. If you want a different option, Fraunces Tavern is nearby. An irritating thing about this property is that the elevators take a long time to arrive, and have no lights or bells to indicate they have arrive, or which way they are going. So it's easy to miss them, extending the wait time. Service personnel seem to spend a lot of time in the guest elevators.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We were here for 7 nights and had a lovely stay.The hotel is in close proximity to a subway station, bars and restaurants. It is also within walking distance to Battery Park and the Seaport areas.The hotel staff are very friendly and will be happy to help if you do have any problems. All you have to do is ask and you will get service with a smile. They will always aim to please. When we checked in we were given warm cookies which are delicious and a nice touch I thought. You can also have complimentary bottles of water every day too.We were not comfortable with the first room we were given as it was very small. I know it's to be expected as we were in NY however it would have felt, in our opinion, very claustrophobic for a 7 night stay. We asked for a bigger room and the hotel very kindly upgraded us on the second night once a bigger room became available.The second room was lovely , very spacious and clean. We had a view of the river which was an added bonus. The room was cleaned to a very high standard every day.The concierge staff are fantastic! They will answer any question you may have or sort out taxis for you.We didn't eat at the hotel at all as we like to go out to explore the local area and we found some amazing places to eat. Would we stay here again? The answer would be yes without a doubt! * Not a hotel related issue but a little word of warning.....Thankfully the hotel booked us a taxi through Uber on our way back to the airport. This was much cheaper than the traditional yellow taxis they have waiting outside of the airport when you land! The Uber price includes any toll or tip fees. The yellow taxi we were advised to get as it is a 'set fee' is not so set after all! The taxi driver insisted on a 25% tip on top of our fare. We travelled from Newark to the Financial District. We were made to feel very uncomfortable by the driver and did end up paying just so we could get out of the cab! Please don't get caught out like we did. A $125 taxi fare is not a good start to a holiday. Uber was around $80.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My daughter and I stayed here for one night and that was the best part about the stay – that it was only one night. When I made the reservation I was not told that we would have to drive a block away and park our car in a garage and pay $80. Had I factored this into the room rate I would've just stayed at a better hotel with a garage in their building. What a major pain it is to walk in pouring rain with a heavy backpack and laptop bag and pocketbook (in 90° heat ) wading through a sea of people to get to the hotel and then again when we headed back home. We had a double room and it was fine. The best part about the room was the water pressure in the shower. IT WAS THE BEST. It felt great after a long day walking around the city. We had some room service- club sandwich and shrimp cocktail- it was okay. I hated the whole layout of the hotel. The reception desk is on the second floor. The elevators take forever to come because it's a 40 something floor building and pretty old.  Next time I'm going to do a little more research and find a better suited hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I enjoyed staying here, the wifi was good with clean and comfortable rooms. Obviously it was near a plethora of useable subway stations and only a short walk from the Staten Island Ferry, Federal Hall and Wall Street. However prepare to be waiting a long time for elevators.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel registrations on the second floor and you get a welcome cookie for everyone and two bottles of water for an HHonors member. There are only 3 elevators to serve guest rooms for 4 to 44 floors. I recommend you get a lower-floor room so that you can use stairs when you cannot wait for your elevator. It is probably inevitable for New York hotels, but its rooms are small and corridors are narrow.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at the double tree on stone street in New York when I got there the hotel seemed nice and the ppl seemed nice however I was supposed to only be there for 4 days for business then end up a bit longer the worst mistake slowly but surely things start to come out the wood work the elevator are slow as molasses ,then when I tried to leave on a Tuesday to go to work then the elevator seem full with the same set of ppl riding the elevator and they smelled some of them spoke only to realize that they live in the hotel some when I got to a certain set of floor to let them off and pick up some I noticed the floors smelled like them so they had to live there and they also had there own security guards so that alone shows you something the only highlight of the trip was a couple of people I met including venneta from the front desk beautiful personality and an asset to the team and one young man his name was dennis from the housekeeping department he was very pleasant and courteous but who helped me out and was promt even with the slow elevator I requested towels and shampoo as none was in the room after they cleaned it and he gave me advise on shopping where to eat as I didn't like the food prepared by the restaurant and where to go inthe city.. my advise is to either turn that hotel into the shelter or move those people out of the hotel because I will not be back and I will definitely tell my friends not to either ..

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at this hotel in June if this year and I must say from upon entering the hotel I knew it was not goin to be a good stay ,first of all the room was not ready and it was after Check in time around 4 pm .then the room was not cleaned good there was a dirty towel left behind the door the floor was sticky the sheet was dirty found hair in the bed 3807. When I picked up the phone to call the front desk know one asmseerd I remembered I left a long line down there. I went Down to front desk to report the matter i some how run into the housekeeping manager I think her name start wit a s .by the end of the conversation I wanted to forget have ever met her she obviously need to be fired she doesn't know what she is doing I don't know how she is a manger Especially of house keeping no wonder the room are not cleaning good please pass her a gum.. the front desk staff was very nice and professional they are the asset to your team most importantly venneta she was the best

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Comfy bed, great location, nice size rooms by NYC standards. However, the wallpaper was peeling in places, damaged in places and completely missing in other places. The outlet next to the sink was falling out of the wall and the shower door wouldn't close all the way so water spilled out onto the floor. The carpet felt sticky. Annoyingly, the alarm clock went off at 5am because housekeeping didn't turn it off after the last guests left and the reading light over the bed came on by itself at 6am (no idea how or why). All in all, it was cheap and conveniently located so I would still recommend it. Just don't expect 5 star accommodations.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The only good thing about this hotel was the staff. How they remain working at this location is amazing, they were always handling complaints from disgruntled guests. I was on the 38th floor waited one day 25 minutes for the elevator, the average wait time was 15 minutes. That is horrible, witnessed near fights amongst guest trying to get on an elevator. The hotel overall is in near of updating. The chair in the room looked as if it was retrieved from a dumpster (I have pictures). The desk had pieces of wood knocked off, the door was also in very poor shape. One of the outlets did not work, maintenance said a whole new light and power unit would have to be ordered. (That unit would have to be ordered). One of the beds was so bad & NOT " Sweet Dreams by Doubletree Sleep Experience". I could go on & on, however I am sure you are getting the point. I have used Hilton hotels around the world. This was the worse. If I had never stayed in a Hilton property previously, I would NEVER stay in one after this experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The room was clean. Nothing fancy. Good price for NYC. I am a Hilton Honors member and stay at their hotels often. I have nothing negative to say about this hotel except that it takes a long time to get an elevator.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is about a ten minute walk from the Statue of Liberty, and the World Trade Center. The rooms are small, but clean. The front desk staff was very friendly. I booked this hotel off of Priceline and paid 107 per night. Parking is 40 dollars per night. Construction is going on across the street and can be loud at times. Overall an above average hotel when your in the city.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location, easy access to the subway and sites, the room was small and shower had a leak where the bathroom floor was always wet and carpet was sticky. The front desk staff did not seem to know the hotel policies and was very rude. A few angry and disappointed guest in the waiting area. The greeting staff at the door were very helpful and friendly. I was told that I had to LEAVE the hotel ( with my 10 year old son at night) because I had cash for my deposit, WITHOUT a refund of my full stay payment. After showing the receptionist the policy online which stated that cash was accepted as a deposit only then I was given a room. I think that was very hearted. I would never stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms are small and the bathrooms barely navigable ["cozy" is the real estate term], and there are only 3 elevators servicing 44 floors of rooms. Other than that, the fact that the hotel is around the corner from Broad Street at Stone makes the limitations on the amenities excusable. If you want a room with working space, this is not the hotel for you. The staff is friendly, but the "gift shop" contained an empty cooler and a self-serve kiosks with iPhone chargers. For food and miscellaneous snacks as well as seating for a small group meeting, 'Essen is around the corner on Bridge Street. The room was clean [although a little stale until the air conditioning ran for a few minutes], and the bed was comfortable. If you don't ask for or expect more, this is a good option.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Really happy with the price of this accommodation, excellent friendly and helpful staff on the desk and in general. Clean, quiet hotel in a great location for business or travellers/tourists. The restaurant is next to the hotel, nice place to eat, again staff were very nice and the food was great and very reasonably priced. If you want a location thats a few minutes walk from the water and Statue of lIberty ferries then this is the place for you. There was a Starbucks, pharmacy and food store less than a minute or 2 walk away.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here with my mother and a 5 and 7 year old for 4 nights in July. The hotel is clean and tidy. The location is very convenient for Statue of Liberty visit or a stroll in Battery Park. The subway is just on the corner. Breakfast was served in the restaurant downstairs. Typical of a NYC hotel, the reception was on 2nd floor. To me this is not ideal but as said for NYC it is ok. We didn't have any noise, a/c issue. The wait for the elevators can be quite long at times, and this a bit surprised me. There didn't seem to be a service elevator for hotel staff to carry laundry/towels and to me this amplified the situation but overall it was a pleasant stay, served its purpose.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We spent two nights at this DoubleTree Hotel in the heart of the financial district. It was very nice and the staff were very friendly and accommodating. This was my first visit to NYC and I was a little surprised at how compact the rooms were. I guess they have to build to fit a lot of people. LOL! If you are looking for breakfast go the Leo's Bagels around the corner. You won't be disappointed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I chose this hotel because it was in walking distance to the East River Ferry. We were attending a race in Brooklyn and planned on taking the ferry to get there. Hotel was very clean. No complaints there at all. Nice view from a city view room. Convienent to Historic Stone St. No parking at hotel but discounted parking at a nearby garage that the hotel recommends. No "unloading" area but that isn't all that unusual in the city. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The Doubletree is close to subway lines, good restaurants, Financial area, South Manhattan attractions, Battery Park, 911 Memorial, Statue of Liberty tours, Staten Island Ferry, a helpful and nice staff

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Location is everything with this property. Centered between Bowling Green station, Whitehall, and near South Ferry. Fantastic restaraunts and convenient stores nearby. Small rooms but expected that downtown NYC. Staff was very helpful and accomodating to us. This is a busy hotel at all hours of the night. You will hear street noise from the upper levels (20th floor). The doors slam shut loudly and the rooms are close proximity. Bring your earbuds if you are there to sleep. The coffee, water, and cookies are a nice touch.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed in this hotel in September 2014 while in New York for three nights, Loved this hotel for its location. Only a five min walk to the 9/11 site, Trinity church, Wall street and very close to the subway. The hotel staff where second to nine still the best service I have ever had in any hotel, the lady working on the desk was more than helpful and couldn't do enough to make sure we had a great stay. Next time I am in New York I will not stay anywhere else.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location is great. The elevators are horrible. Allow 20+ minutes coming and going to your time for getting an elevator. You will push your own luggage. There is no breakfast in the hotel unless you pay $$$. Bathrooms fair on cleaning.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Cleanliness... We arrived late so did not pay much attention to our room until the next morning. We were very unhappy to find it was not clean at all. Dust and dirt on every surface. After asking to move our second room was cleaner but the carpet was completely filthy and sticky all inside the bedroom door and most of the way around the bed. It hadn't been deep cleaned since the winter! We were offered a further room but by this point we had lost confidence in the hotel cleanliness and decided to put up with the dirty carpet because we doubted any room was completely clean. I had to keep my shoes on in the room the entire stay. Very disappointed! Water... On three occasions we did not have any hot water to take a shower. On the first occasion we were told by the front desk later that we should have been notified of maintenance but no letter arrived under our door. That day (our wedding anniversary )we had to take cold showers to make our reservation. On the second two occasions we found the warm water would arrive after about 30mins of the shower running. Again not quite the facilities you expect of a Hilton operated hotel. Security... We were shocked to find our guest room was left unlocked and OPEN! when we returned from a day out in the city. The room service had been in to clean and obviously not checked the door on the way out as the catch was preventing the door from closing. We were lucky as nothing was taken from the room but given there is no security at street level potentially anyone could have found a way in taken our belongings. This again was below the standards of any respectful hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My sister and I were here several years ago and had a great experience, so we paid a little more than other options this time. I'm not sure it was worth it. Front desk staff weren't particularly interested in helping or correcting mistakes - I'd requested foam pillows because I'm allergic to down, and I had to ask twice more before they were delivered, and no one could explain the charge on my card that happened prior to check-in. The AC needed coaxing to keep cooling, the toilet didn't flush quite right, and the wifi was pretty slow. The location is fine, but for the extra bucks, I'd rather stay somewhere cheaper, closer to more subway lines.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My sister and I stayed here 4 years ago and had a fabulous experience - great service, friendly, helpful employees, and a fairly quiet environment. This trip was different by almost all accounts. The room was comfortable enough for sleeping, but the toilet didn't flush quite right, the AC needed some prodding, the internet was slow and the pillows are clearly worn. The staff didn't respond to requests - I was told they'd send non-feather pillows (I'm allergic and had requested prior to check-in), and I had to twice more before I got them. There are only 3 elevators (typical NYC small), and that's clearly not enough. At one point, we timed a 9-minute wait from our room on the 35th floor. Overall, it wasn't an awful experience, but for the same price, you can stay in other Hilton brands in more central locations, and I'll do that next time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: There is nothing wrong with this hotel but there is nothing really great about it either. It's functional and economical. The rooms are basic with everything you'd expect but nothing special. We had to move rooms as our first one was dirty and had not been cleaned properly. The staff were very apologetic. The best part was being greeted on arrival with a warm chocolate chip cookie - honestly one of the best cookies I've had. Good choice for the price but don't expect any added luxuries. This hotel definitely caters to business people.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location was really convenient to the subway station and a lot of restaurant around the area. The staffs was amazing too. The ac was kind of hard to set to the temperature that we want, so the room was either a little too hot or too cold. The discounted parking offered was a nice perk too.
user_name:
Thy1210
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Probably the worst Hilton chain hotel I have ever stayed in. Location great, near Wall Street, but the rest looked like 3 star hotel to me. No personal touch, no pool or sauna (unfortunately this is New York standard), but not even a good restaurant for breakfast. No rooftop bar. Room solid, because I picked the room by myself as a Hilton honors member.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I debated between a rating of a 3 and a 4, but decided on a 4 based on the interactions with employees while there. My wife and I stayed here a couple of years ago, but brought the kids to NYC this time. So, staying in a safe part of town was a must. Pros: *Clean rooms*Friendly, helpful staff - this stay, they were awesome every time - from the front desk to the bellman to the ladies cleaning rooms*Safe part of town - and relatively quiet, at least by NYC standards*Convenient location - 3 min walk to Subway station, 5 mins to Staten Island Ferry, and in the historic Lower Manhattan/Wall St. areaCons: *Shower makes a terrible screaming noise every time you use it, for the duration of the shower*Room size - while the rooms were clean, they were tiny*Elevators - be prepared to wait. . and wait. . and wait (going up or down)*Breakfast - as a Hilton Honors member, we got breakfast vouchers to cash in at the restaurant next door. Glad it was free, because I would've been sorely disappointed had I paid any money for that.Overall, it felt safe for the family, and we were able to see the whole city by grabbing a ferry or the subway within a short walk of the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was really disappointing as an overall hotel experience. Not what you would expect from Hilton. Great location - in fact superb. Rooms were of a high standard. The rest of the hotel was a nothing - restaurant was poor for breakfast and dinner, entrance was uninviting, no lounge areas of any quality - no bars. Staff were mildly interested but a bit dizzy - except for the bell boys who were grand. Still a good stay as location was awesome.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I guess I got lucky. I got a good deal for this hotel at the heart of the Financial District. The location is worth a lot, with walking distance to lots of popular sites, 9/11 Memorial, Trinity Church, ferry to Lady Liberty, Battery Park, Wall Street, etc.The facilities and the rooms look and feel quite new. The staff are very friendly.The building, the elevator and the rooms are not very large and spacious, but still OK.If you get a good rate, go for it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I recently stayed for 6 nights and 7 days at this location. Upon reception, the agent did check me in early which I did appreciate greatly, but I did not receive the standard welcome treat of Double Tree... the delicious chocolate chip cookie. My room was on the 41st floor. Entering I did have a very small room although it was well cleaned. My view was great as I had a view of WTC 1. The A/C was great when it was 67, but if you clicked it higher than that it became a sauna in the room. The bathroom amenities in my room were not complete upon arrival. The shower leaked all over the floor upon every use and required more than 2 towels to sop up the excess water. The noise level in the room was acceptable until the neighbors came back and you could feel every vibration from doors closing to drawers being closed. What was aggravating was the elevator. On more than one occasion it took me from the 41st floor to Ground floor an average of 9 minutes in a warmed elevator. Slow and some of the occupants that got on from the lower floors appeared to be street people who had been allowed to stay the night at the hotel. They had their carts with their belongings with them. While I think that is a great idea and a worthy cause... I was just shocked to see them in a Double Tree. Lastly, two major complaints were upon returning from a very long day out and about on a warm day in NYC -- one of the elevators was out which took getting up to my room quite a while and then also upon entering my room seeing a notice that I had no water with no expected turn on time due to an emergency and for ME to "prepare myself accordingly". All I wanted to do was take a shower and could not. Some of the good things were the staff were nice and tried to be helpful when able. This just did not seem to be "in step" with the full Double Tree experience that I have encountered in the past. I would NOT recommend this hotel as a Double Tree. I would recommend it as a budget hotel with issues.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Utter disaster. Carpet was too sticky to walk on barefooted. Shower screamed when turned on and wouldn't stop. Bathroom faucet gushed scalding hot water every time when turned on, even when set to cold. It would take a minute for cold water to come out. The bathroom door squeaked very loudly. Windows were dirty. Couldn't be more disappointed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good value for money. Room was very nice and clean and there are several subway stations really close to the hotel so it's easy to get around and places like Ground Zero, Staue of Libery and Brooklyn Bridge is just a short walk away. Had read in other reviews about having to wait a long time for the elevator but didn't experience it being worse than anywhere else.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed at this property for 7nights from the 21st of June 17.The hotel is in the heart of the financial District but if you are after the buzz of Time square its not suitable property and location for you. The taxi ride to go to Time square is about 20 minutes long and its not worth getting a cab everyday to go to Times square. The costs definitely add up.Secondly the elevator is very slow and you can wait up to 20 minutes for the elevator. This was a nightmare for us because our room is on the 20th floor , Sometimes we had to go up the stairs because the elevator wouldn't come down. This was a very horrible experience for us.On the day i checked out the it took us 30 minutes to get an elevator from the 20th floor and ended walking down 20 flights of stairs with very large suitcases.Thirdly when we checked in we were not given the signature double tree hilton cookie. This was just shocking. All the double tree Hilton properties i have stayed at provide this signature cookie upon check in.Lastly there were very roudy people staying at this property. They would make noises in the hallway at all sorts of times at night . I Complained at the reception a couple of times but they never did anything about it. This is unacceptable especially after paying thousands of dollars for the hotel room.STAY AWAY.....

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Excellent location, very close to the 911 Memorial, statue Liberty, Trinity Church. All around subway terminals. I will definitely recommend buying the sight seeing city bus it takes you to all different places as Time Square, Brooklyn Bridge, China Town and more.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Was pleasantly surprised by value for money; awesome location near Statue of Liberty & Statten Island ferries, 9/11 memorial, transportation all over NYC; over the top helpful and friendly staff. Highly recommend. Only negative is slightly small room size...but it is Manhattan.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Room was small but very clean. Staff was professional and helpful. The surrounding area was clean and restaurants nearby were really good. Parking was a nightmare though. No parking at the hotel. There were no directions to the parking garage for the hotel and no initial reception at the main entrance to ask; so it was difficult to figure out. Overall, a good stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Chose the Doubletreeas we had stayed in one in Orlando and had been highly impressed. Stayed here for 6 nights Jun-Jul 2017. The entrance to the hotel gives a bad first impression its a side door into a poorly laid out hallyway and you have to take the elevators to the second floor to check-in. The elevators are very slow and small so when the do arrive they are often already full. The rooms are average size for a city hotel (we stayed in a queen room) but they have everything you need. The carpet could use a good steam clean as our feet were sticking to it in places i actually wasn't comfortable in bare feet and thus wore my socks at all times. The blackout curtain hem had fallen away and needs to be sewn back, the air conditioning unit and the celine fan in the bathroom could both do with a thorough dusting. The outside noise is less here than you would expect however the walls between rooms are paper thin and on more than 1 occasion not only were we woken by our neighbours tv/talking but when they close their bedroom door the entire wall shook along with the head of the bed! Also other guests were clearly smoking weed as the smell was unmistakable and this made me uncomfortable as I was travelling with my daughter -I am unfamiliar as to the laws in NYC if this is legal or not but they were not hiding it and the hotel staff didn't appear to be bothered. All in all it's a basic hotel not the worst but not the best either. I would certainly say I was disappointed with the Doubletree on this occasion attention to the details make a huge difference. Just to clarify the staff are friendly, the rooms have everything you need, the location is good for Battery Park, the 9/11 memorial and Wall Street but a few tweeks and it could be a much nicer hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is tucked away in a small side street near Wall St. Subwy entrance is accross the road and its a 2 min walk to Battery Park. Wall St. Bull is just around the corner aswell. Rooms are excellent. Well set out with plenty of room. Breakfast is good. Plenty to choose from and concierge are a friendly bunch. Mid range pricing at about AUD$300 a night for NY we found.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights and loved it. Easy access to subways, tours, trendy or historic restaurants, Battery Park, Wall Street, Museum of Native Americans and many more sights. Clean and updated rooms with gorgeous water and skyscraper views. Friendly and helpful staff. My small reasons for not giving this hotel an excellent was room service didn't make up room until after 4 PM, which us when we had already been out for the day and came back to change for the evenings. Also lobby and elevators didn't have A.C. so we're hot, but really since those were my biggest complaints, not bad at all. Would definitely stay there again and woukd recommend.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If you have small children, the shower will terrify them. The shower drenched the entire bathroom every time. Smoke seeped through the vents daily. The shower and bathroom space is terrible. The pull out sofa was terribly uncomfortable, hardly even full size, and thin. We ordered cheese and strawberries to be waiting in the room. The quality of the food was cheap and terrible. We ordered in-room breakfast the first morning and the food was tasteless and overpriced. We have never had this experience with your brand before. We waited hours for towels. In -room dining would not answer phone. Housekeeping does their best. The folks that delivered to our room were courteous. We will pay more to stay in a different hotel in New York in the future.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I found the room very comfortable. The elevator was a bit frustrating since it was slow (too many floors for the number of elevators...) but otherwise I really enjoyed my stay. I have a question that perhaps someone could answer? I LOVED the bed so much. I had a very good night's sleep! I am mad at myself though, since I was going to check the tag on what felt like a a mattress topper, but left and totally forgot! It felt like there was a separate piece on top of the mattress. I wonder if that is the type of thing I can purchase for my own bed at home? If there is any way to have someone tell me what that was, I would be very interested!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Elevator call buttons didn't light. Elevator down one day so it was hard to tell on other days if the elevator was down or the call button didn't work. When the ekevator was down, staff didn't post any signs so you didn't know what to do. Some furniture in room was old and worn.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed for 4 nights in this hotel. I got a room with the view and I love it. The overall room was great, clean and comfortable. The bed was so soft I fell asleep instantly even with my TV on. However, the carpet was kinda damp so that's a point off. Even though the hotel is not located in the downtown Manhattan, it's so near to a lot of subway stations and it's in a safe neighborhood. So transportation was easy. It's in walking distance of the charging bull, trinity church, 9/11 memorial and the Staten island dock. You can also walk down by the river to see the view of the city at sunset, so beautiful. The staffs there were so helpful especially the front desk. There's a guy who helped me with the traveling plans which was awesome. I would like to mention Helena and the other guy I didn't catch his name at the front desk, thank you for giving me a great room. And Romaine, I didn't know what you do but you were hilarious. Also Daysi who drove me to the airport was the best driver, very nice car and I got to JFK airport within 45 minutes. I will definitely stay here again!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My new go to when im in the city. Home away from home this Hilton in the financial district offers a comfortable stay that is like being at home. If you are looking for quite and cozy in reach of action? This is your place
user_name:
Joseph M
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The breakfast at the restaurant was terrible. Definitely not DoubleTree standards. Two elevators for 44 floors - 10 rooms per floor. Even the cleaning service uses the two elevators even though they are suppose to use the service elevator. Expect to wait!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Trip with family following grandson's baseball tournament in Cooperstown. Took family to Yankee game and to see Statue of Liberty and 9-11 Memorial. Hotel was in a great location for the last two locations.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is located in the heart of the financial district, only a short walk away from the charging bull and Battery Park. The freedom tower and the 9/11 memorials are not too far either. The main reception is a couple of floors above the ground floor. The lifts can take a while to serve all floors, especially at peak times. The reception staff were friendly and welcoming.The room was small as is typical in NYC hotels. There is an AC unit right underneath the window. The bed was clean and comfortable. The bathroom is well equipped. A hair dryer is provided. An iron was also available. My room was facing a restaurant/bar across the street so on a Friday night it was a little noisy but otherwise I has a good sleep.Breakfast can be included in the booking and is served on the ground floor in the Italian restaurant joined to the hotel. The breakfast quality was good and an okay choice of variety with warm options available. All in all, a good base to explore Lower Manhattan including Brooklyn Bridge.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was very convenient to Battery Park. I had a wonderful evening walking along the water. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the hotel is located on a quiet street away from the sirens and traffic of NYC.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for a night as a diamond member. Excellent location and it was quiet area. You could get a good night sleep. Staff was quite friendly and accommodating. The bed was very good and comfortable. It was much bigger than the bed at the Hilton Grand Central. There was free breakfast. Although, they forgot to register my guest even though I was assured at check in that it would be done. However, it was fine. I was given two vouchers without any issues. Yet, it should have been given at check-in. Breakfast was adequate enough, but not enough choices and it was very dry and bland. Quite tasteless muffin and oatmeal. Also, the hot water took too long to come on and I hope slippers can be provided in the room. Service was quite good though. A lot of the people were friendly and they would acknowledge you even from maintenance and bellhop. Recognition to Tracy and Tina for smiling service. Maybe, an executive lounge in the future? Thank you.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff were wonderful, but the rooms are small and very expensive. Also, my room, and as I learned later, some other rooms, have a/c units below the window that tend to drip condensation onto the carpet, soaking it, and apparently leading to mold, which caused my asthma to flare up. The clerk at the desk was very accommodating in finding me another room the following day, and this room was much better.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at this Doubletree for a week for business (with two extra days tacked on for pleasure), and as a frequent traveler to NYC, found this hotel, compared to other options, only average. Pros: Nice rooms, somewhat competitive price, very convenient location, overall friendly staff. Cons: Extremely slow elevator service

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Super close and easy access to several subway stations. Also there are many restaurants nearby and a drug store just around the corner. The room is adequate only if the shower space is larger and the water pressure is stronger. Some construction nearby, but the noise did not bother us on higher floor. And the construction mostly happened during daytime. The elevator works fine, no as slow as other reviews said. Will definitely stay at this hotel again when in NY.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is one of the most OK hotels I’ve ever stayed in. The service was OK – impersonal but professional, as you’d expect from a big chain in a business district. The rooms were OK – clean and fairly spacious by Manhattan standards, although the bed was unable to fit all 6’2” of me lying down without my feet dangling over the edge, and the in-room coffee & tea service had plenty of coffee but almost no milk. We had a city view, which was OK. The area is OK – easy to get to and quiet at night, but with a lot of construction going on nearby. In fairness the wifi was free and fast, and the gym was above average – small but with everything you need, and with 24 hour access as well.However, I hate to echo what other reviews have said but it’s a reality here – the elevators are terrible. There are only three elevators serving 44 floors; so unless you stay on a low floor, or only come & go between around 8pm and 5am, you are going to spend a significant amount of time standing in a corridor waiting for an elevator to arrive.If you want somewhere with character and/or in the thick of the Manhattan hustle & bustle, this is not the hotel for you. However if you’re just looking for a clean, comfortable, quiet and relatively cheap base hotel for you to rest your head at night, you could do a lot worse.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This trip was for a Girl's Weekend trip to meet up friends to celebrate my birthday. This property is located in the financial district in lower Manhattan. It is in walking distance of South Street Seaport, Staten Island Ferry, and a host of local eateries. The hotel is a high rise structure with five elevators. The check in desk is located on the second floor, which will require an elevator ride or taking the stairs, the elevators take a while. The business center and refreshment area is also located on the second floor. The front desk staff was friendly, professional, and accommodating. Our room was on the 33rd floor. The halls were clean but tight. We had a king room with a restricted view of the East River (see pictures). The room included a king bed, single serve coffee maker, 40" inch tv, desk, two night stands, an armchair, and a shower stall in the bathroom. The bed was very comfortable and there was no issue with noise from the hallways or adjoining rooms. For a quick turn around stay with a very familiar friend or loved one, this room and hotel can be very accommodating. For stays longer than a weekend, more than two people, or anyone you're not used to being in very close quarters with, I believe you would need a larger room. I hope you find this review helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Have stayed at the Doubletree FIDI twice in the past year. The norm is lots of street noise late in to the night and several hours of the next morning (construction and street cleaners/garbage pickup etc.) when you are on the Stone Street side. I wouldn't be surprised to learn that there is a glass recycling center on that block since bottles are clanking for hours and hours starting very late until at least 2/3 am. Elevators are always extremely slow (when all working) and the staff do not have their own service elevator so often times you are stuck in the elevator with staff and equipment etc taking up a lot of the small elevator space. One day I was on the elevator with two staff members hauling 4 suitcases and a giant black trash bag with linens between floors. I found this particularly concerning since I was bit during the night by some kind of bug or spider the first night of my most recent stay. The affected area was huge and swelled up to the size of 4 quarters. I'll spare you any more details - allegedly there is an "investigation" going on but I have not heard any feedback.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: 1) No where to park when off loading your bags 2) after arriving and you're looking for the front desk, but it's on the 2nd floor (next day I noticed sign saying "front desk on 2nd floor") 3) rooms are nice but smaller...it's NYC 4) all front desk staff were great 4) elevators take a long time to arrive and half the time the elevators were too full in get in 6) nice hotel for the price!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at the hotel for 7 nights and EVERY day the elevators were slow and filled and many times stopped at all the floors but not able to take on guests. The rooms are SMALL and the hallways are stuffy and hot. The room was nice enough and the bed was comfortable but they had the a/c rigged so that it went off after an hour and made the room uncomfortable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The DoubleTree in the Financial District is easily accessible by subway and off the noisier tourist routes. Affordable food is nearby as well. It offers the usual Hilton chain amenities. If you don't mind travel time to mid and up town destinations, this is a nice option. Safe and marginally more affordable. Rooms are well appointed for NYC: desk, chairs, comfortable bed,
user_name:
Calien L
Cape Elizabeth, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: No variety in breakfast Fruit bowl has just cantaloupe and honey dew only. Long waits to get elevator. Wastes time and is very inconvenient, That is all folks. Good luck. It wants 200 letters, so here is the rest of these.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: we spent 1 week there, the hotel is situated close the metro bowling green and battery park, very close to wall street, ground zero and ferry to Statue of liberty. The location is beautiful and easy to reach. The rooms were clean, but smalls. Personnel very friendly. Only bad exeperience was with the breakfast: the variety of food is very poor, not a lot of fruit, no yogurt, only bakery and classical american breakfast ( bacon, potatoes, eggs).The restaurant is a bit " dark" and didn't feel very clean.Overall the price vs service maybe a bit too high

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Not at the standards of a Hilton affiliated flag. The hotel pipes in the shower squeal like a loud fire alarm. The toilet was off hinge. AC leaked water on rug. Reported it twice and no repairs were made except toilet. Two of three gym treadmills do not work. Anyone off the street can get into elevators and access any floors, even at night. Security doesn't appear to be a priority. Rooms are small. Room cost is high for the value. Won't stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms here are a little larger than the typical New York small hotel (think European hotel sizes) and tastefully decorated. Bathrooms are a little larger but there is zero counterspace in the bathroom. Service is 5 star, from the doormen to the reception staff to the maid service. Only drawback is that the elevators are a bit slow during the morning rush when most folks are headed out for meetings. I had an excellent view of One World Trade Center from my room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was clean, neat, comfortable and the staff was friendly, helpful and generous. Cookies and free water were terrific! Elevator service was very slow at times, but the location was perfect for all the sites our friends from Utah wanted to see,Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, Wall Street, Wall Street Bull and the 911 Memorial/Museum.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The positives first. Staff at reception were friendly & pleasant, bed comfortable. Negatives: air conditioning not easily controlled, only 3 elevators for over 40 floors, used for guests & service meant long waits every time you went up or down. Restaurant not very clean, breakfast buffet disappointing.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: No upgrade for long term million point Diamond member on an extended business trip. Millennium downtown is a much better value. Tiny room, no view, no minibar nor refrigerator. I am currently checked in and considering leaving for Marriott right now.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Barring all the frill, I'll list out the pros and cons.Pros:1. Location- located in downtown at a walking distance from the battery park, Statue of Liberty ferry point, the subway stations, one world trade, charging bull and the hop on hop off bus pick up.2. Restaurant- nice cozy restaurant adjacent to the hotel with ala carte and buffet options to choose from.3. House keeping: the room was well serviced everyday during our stay.4. Cost- affordable as compared to other hotel options in that area.5. Offer: the Hilton website had a spring sale on which offered us premium wifi and complementary breakfast for our stay.Cons:1. View: totally depends on the wing and location of the room. Ours being on the 19th floor didn't had that of a great view as the property is surrounded by buildings. Higher floors might have better.2. Our stay had complementary breakfast which required breakfast coupons to be presented at the restaurant. We didn't know this and had to collect them from the checkin counter (which is on a different floor from the restaurant) ourselves the next day when we went in for the breakfast. Had they given us those coupons the time we checked in, it would have saved us time and efforts.3. Room service- we asked for a pasta which was supposed to come with bread and butter. Got just the pasta. Had to call again for the bread and butterConclusion:Though I listed some cons, most of them were circumstantial. I hope the management will work on them. Overall, we had a quality stay at the DoubleTree by Hilton and would definitely choose this hotel next time we visit the city!Cheers!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for business- my company is near Battery Park- a block from hotel. The room was just right- quiet, clean. modern and comfortable. I had a room on the 32nd floor- quieter that high up. Fast elevators. The staff very helpful and friendly. Highly recommend !

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Allan was awesome. All staff were great. Great value, comfortable beds, for the city it was a great stay. Water pressure was great and hot once it made it to the 41st floor. Overall, great stay. Would definitely highly recommend ..

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We were very happy about our experience here. Good price too. Great location. We will stay here again when we come back to New York City. Staff was very nice and helpful. We want to bring family back to NYC and would be happy to bring them here. Only thing is no complimentary breakfast.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was pleasantly pleased with the hotel in general and the room. My room was ready upon arrival and I arrived well before the normal check-in time. The room was larger than I thought it would be, being a NY hotel, which are usually on the small side. The staff were all very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Excellent location & Staff attitude, the location is near by a lot of pubs and famous restaurants, moreover it a walking distance from the battery park and the Hudson river overseeing the statue of liberty. the only thing about this hotel is the lifts operating to the rooms are not enough and might take more than 10 minutes sometimes waiting for the lift!!
user_name:
V4991GYahmedb
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Clean comfortable room with all that was needed for our 5 night visit to NYC. Helpful doormen and staff. Lovely bed. Comfortable room good value for money. Close to attractions The Bull, Wall Street, Statue Liberty, Statten Island Ferry etc. Ground zero. Good subway and bus links. Quiet at the weekend. If you dont want to use Subway take bus 20 from outside the ferry as it will take you all the way up to Lincoln square and only costs 2.75 dollars... use your metro card. Also breakfast can be found around the corner at a reasonable cost with large selection at various small cafes. If you dont do all the attractions the visits you must do are The Empire State at night and Ground Zero. Stunning views at night of the city. Top of the Rock gives views of central park but it is not lit up at night so thats a daytime visit. We got on the free statten island ferry twice at sunset to go past the statue of Liberty. We ate at the ferry terminal on the other side which has a restaurant outside overlooking the NY skyline. Well worth a visit and good food. We had a room on 6th floor and one on 41st floor. Both were comfortable and clean but the view from the 41st floor was amazing and the room was lighter and less cluttered. Overall fab stay at good location and would recommend.Downside.The lifts are a pain as there are only 3 so you can be waiting a while especially at busy times in the morning and afternoon. The air conditioning in the room on 6th floor was very noisy! We didt get offered our cookies on arrival!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very poor managers and the prices to check in is a pain. Need more elevators for this property. The location is prime and accessible to most trains, Uber's, and monuments. There also several restaurants that surround it. However if you care about service this is not the hotel for you.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Look, I get it. NYC is incredibly expensive, and if you're visiting from out of town, you don't want to spend $500+ per night just for a bed. $180/night for a hotel room in Manhattan sounds like a steal, but the real steal is by Hilton, from your wallet. This is the third time I have had the displeasure of staying in this hotel this year, and none of those times have been by choice. My firm put me up in this hotel for work in March and after two nights of not having hot water in the shower, I was allowed to switch to the Marriott on West Street (it's about $40 more per night and stunningly beautiful - I highly recommend it). The last two times (including this time - I'm currently staying there until tomorrow night and then I'm free, thank god) were not by choice. I've been swapping out one hotel room with a few rotating colleagues over the last month and a half. While I've had hot water these last two times (save for the 5 minutes of freezing cold hell this morning), neither handset for the phones work (I complained about this a month and a half ago and they have yet to fix it - I had to yank the battery out of one because it wouldn't stop beeping) and the elevators actually seem to have gotten worse. Idiots who stay in the hotel (and I've seen staff members do this too) think that pushing the up and down buttons at the same time will make the elevator come faster, but it just screws up the scant logic the elevators already run on and makes a terrible problem exponentially worse. If you're on an upper floor, plan at least 15-20 minutes to be able to get to the ground floor (that is not sarcastic). This building was built without a service/freight elevator, so the cleaning and maintenance staff make use of the three elevators, which causes all kinds of problems for the guests. Oh, and due to a unique NYC initiative, the hotel is currently housing several homeless New Yorkers. The reaction from tourists when they get on the elevator is quite entertaining, so that might be the only cheery side to this hellish hotel. The rooms are tiny, there is inadequate storage, there is no place to put anything in the bathroom, the keys require a midas touch and the patience of a saint to work, and the front desk staff is usually pretty rude. Also, there is no maintenance staff after 11pm or before 7am, so good luck if you have a maintenance emergency at 11:01. My advice: please stop staying at this hotel, let it close down, and maybe they'll level it and rebuild it correctly.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel was dirty, dingy and unacceptable. When we arrived at 5:30 in the evening (2 hours after we stated and over 2 hours after standard check in) the room still wasn't ready, meaning after 9 hours on a plane we were told to sit and wait in the lobby. Everything was dirty. 2 tiny lifts serviced a 40 story building meaning a long wait and very cramped lift. Our room was tiny and well over due a renovation. The wall paper crumbled off the walls and many of the handles were falling off. The shower was horrific, it left a huge puddle flooding the bathroom floor and would randomly go freezing mid shower or scolding hot. The AC sounding like a tractor combined with the uncomfortable bed meant I had very little sleep. The breakfast was disgusting, I actually didn't eat as everything was dirty. I have stopped in many Hilton hotels and thought they were adequate, I won't be stopping in one again, that's for sure.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I had two rooms for my daughter's graduation. As they were during my past stays, both rooms were clean and well appointed. The staff was very kind and helpful to all my guests. The hotel is a great value if you are looking to stay downtown.
user_name:
Roland S
Newark DE, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: A few problems with this Double Tree. If your arriving by car, the hotel entrance is on Stone Street which is one way and very narrow so you won't have much room (if any) to get your bags out of your car. My wife had to ask someone inside the hotel to get our bags instead of being greeted at the curb. I had to circle around the block because I was blocking trucks from passing. The elevators are painfully slow so you'll need to leave plenty of time if you are heading out to dinner or a show to get up and down. Our bathroom was not as clean as one would expect especially the hair dryer and there were no tissues!? A positive was that the service was friendly and the bed was comfortable and that it is within walking distance of many sightseeing destinations. In summary, this hotel is ok if you get it a reduced rate and aren't planning a long stay. They could (should) do a lot better!!
user_name:
Mark S
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was ok, average, but after dropping my luggage with 2 bellmen, my gold necklace went missing. I have had that one with me for 15 years, never lost or misplaced it. If you wanna book this hotel, do not leave anything of value in the room or with the bellmen. Sleep was poor, you can hear all kind of noises from upstairs room and next door room. Loud

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel was nice, the layout was different as the elevators were in the middle and rooms were down the hall on the sides, like horshoe shaped. But it is New York. Elevators were a bit slow during the prime time. Garage is half block away, not too bad of a walk. The only thing I was unhappy with was that I was not allowed to take my bicycle to my room, due to fire code. The room was spacious, bike could have fit on side wall without any trouble. Had to leave bike in garage, an additional cost of $7/day. Other than that the location is great, around the corner is the Charging Bull and Fearless Girl statue, short walk to staten island ferry ride to see the statue of liberty and about a 10-15 minute walk to world trade center. Lots of food choices in the area, Starbucks, Walgreens, Irish Pub caddy corner to hotel. I enjoyed my stay and staff was very friendly and attentive.
user_name:
Keila R
New Cumberland, Pennsylvania, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The GOOD: The location of the hotel is convenient to several subway station stops and near the NYSE. If you've never stayed downtown, this hotel is near Battery Park, Bowling Green, the "BULL" statue and the Staten Island Ferry. The BAD: However, having stayed at DoubleTree hotels before, I was very disappointed with my room. It was designated as a HiltonHonors room, but clearly had not been maintained. The air conditioning/ heating unit was broken and filthy. In the bathroom, some of fixtures were severely loose. OVERALL: As a HiltonHonors member, I would stay at a different DoubleTree or other Hilton brand on my next visit to New York.
user_name:
Courtney H
Los Angeles, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff were very helpful and got a room as soon as we arrived, before 3 which was very helpful. This hotel is right around the corner from the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. It has several subway stops right near it also. You are one stop from Wall Street on the subway. The only complaint that I have is that my cookie was not as soft as some other Double Tree.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is clean, tidy, and great location downtown near Wall Street. Good restaurants are within walking distance. do yourself a favor and stay on a lower floor. I was on 4th floor and it helped as the three elevators have a lot of work to do. Try the cookie place around the corner called Insomnia.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great time in the big apple and stayed in a super location close to the start of the bike ride. Excellent service and super clean facility. Staff went out of there way to assist in anyway possible. From the doorman to the check-in staff, nothing but top quality service. Assisting is transportation, good restaurants, finding the locations of destinations and services.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is nice, some rooms are not isolated well so a lot of noise from the room next to you. The people in the hotel are very nice with the exception of the people in the breakfast room, they don’t give me the feeling that I’m welcome. A big issue from my side is that this hotel does not have it own parking facility.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great stay among the restaurant scene in the Financial District of New York City and 1/2 block from the subway. Would stay again with no reservations about doing so. Three block walk to the office and within steps of 30 restaurant choices. Even had a view of the Harbor and Lady Liberty.
user_name:
Monica B
Saint Louis, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Room and common areas very dirty. Someone may have used the ice machine to dump a milk or cream drink. Stayed that way the entire stay (7nights). Room dirty, broken fixtures and furniture. Tub stained dirty.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: GREAT location.. N line subway is 200 ft away, the 4,5,6 line is 600ft away, the 1 and D line is 0.2 miles (5 min walk) away. If you turn right of the front door go to the end of the street of you look to the left you will see the road fork, follow to the right of the fork there you will see covered picnic tables in an alleyway with 10+ restaurants on both sides! A hidden (seemed to be mainly locals there) jem that I am sharing with you. IF you can't find something to eat there you don't like food! .8 from the ferry to the Statue, 10 min walk to WTC/FT, 32 min train ride to Yankee Stadium/ 15 minutes to time square....
