Then there is the hotel, GREAT hotel.. construction going on across street (05/17) so I would suggest staying in a room away from the road, they start up around 7:30, so if you want to sleep in, well....

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Travelling to NY from London is a long and arduous task (especially on a sub-standard replacement aircraft) so when we arrived at the hotel, it was a welcome sight to be greeted with such friendly front-of-house staff in such a lush lobby.Check-in was easy and swift so it wasn't long before we jumped on the lifts to the 40th floor only to be met by a considerably loud ice machine. In the room, it was all we could hear so we immediately rang reception and requested another room. At first they seemed reluctant to let us switch rooms but after reciting a brief tale of woe, they were quick to act and moved us to a room on the 8th floor which was much quieter (albeit with an inferior view).The rooms are compact but meet all requirements with a great shower and huge bed. Amenities like hairdryer, TV and coffee machine are also included.Housekeeping was daily but sometimes like to come early (sometimes as early as 9) so make sure you put the sign on the door.The location is spectacular with subway stops at the end of the road and another one on the other side of the museum. They were doing some renovation works to the main entrance when we arrived so the exterior wasn't amazingly pleasant at the time although this was not a problem for us.All in all, this hotel met expectations. It served as a great base-camp and i would definitely come back.Top tip: Be hasty with the lifts, the doors close fast so be on your toes.Also: Head to the cobbled street round the corner for some good food and drink. Great place to chill in the evening.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for 7 nights in November. The hotel is in a great location, close to multiple subway stops, close to Battery Park and walking distance to Ground Zero, the ferry for the Statue of Liberty & Ellis Island and Brooklyn Bridge. It's located down a quiet street and has many restaurants, bars, cafes, Starbucks etc. near by. The hotel has a lot of floors, if I remember correctly we were located on the 42nd floor. We had a room with 2 queen size beds - the room was small but was very comfortable and well equipped. The only issue we had with being on such a high floor is that the lifts are very slow and stop at every floor on the way down. In the mornings, it could take up 20 minutes to get from our room to the hotel entrance so factor this in if you are heading out somewhere for a particular time.The hotel has free Wi-Fi which always worked well for us and the bathroom was well equipped with a walk in shower (no bath).It took around 20 minutes on a direct subway to Times Square, so if you're going to New York and want to stay slightly out to get better value, I'd highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Only go to this hotel if you enjoy being entertained by how terrible a hotel can be. From the room not being ready 2 hours after check-in to a toilet that wouldn't flush to phones that don't work to a total lack of effort by the staff to fix any of those issues, this hotel will surely be out of business soon.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Absolutely no lobby - you have to take and elevator to floor 2 (not great signage). Elevators - there are only three for 44 floors and they're VERY slow. No security to get on elevators (anyone can use them from the street) We did end up seeing security patrolling the floors later in the evening, but only saw them once. Our room was TINY and had lots of scuff marks on all the furniture, the glass shelf in the bathroom was broken, the slats on the AC unit were all twisted - the room was in desperate need of a "spruce up". AC didn't work at first, but maintenance changed the batteries in the thermostat, then it worked, but there was water seeping out towards the end of the evening. As I said, the personnel and staff were very friendly and nice, but the room was not a hit!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: DoubleTree by Hilton - Financial District is a hotel located very close to Wall Street, Battery park with the ferries to Staten Island and Statue of Liberties and Brooklyn Bridge.The hotel has spacious rooms with standard sized bathrooms, but be patient if you stay at a floor where you have to take the elevator because they are slow and we spent lots of time waiting.The staff of all categories are very service minded and helpful.The food: we did not eat the breakfast as there are so many nice places to eat nearby - you should try some of them.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Well priced for NYC - $US175/night advance purchase, king city view.Showing its age - peeling paint & wallpaper in bathroom, carpets feel like they need cleaning, but otherwise in good shape. Bathroom is small but adequate, good shower- plenty of pressure, consistent hot water, small vanity - not much room for toiletries. Bed is excellent. Great service by all the staff. Lifts very slow during peak times. Happy with our stay overall. Good position, easy access to subway, ferries.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is pretty far from the hustle and bustle of Times Square but is an easy subway ride to anywhere you need to go. The benefit was a lower nightly rate ($159) and a calmer location. It is a half block from the subway and Smithsonian Museum of the American Indian and a two blocks from Battery Park. Historic Stone Street, with great pubs/restaurants, is a block away. The rooms were tiny, but not unexpected for NYC. The bathroom could use a face lift, but was clean. Breakfast was not included, but Leo's Bagels and a few other inexpensive spots were close by. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is a perfect spot in the financial district. Great staff, and the room cleanliness is on point! I would highly recommend this hotel. Plus the staff is so kind, and they gave me double cookies!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: A good hotel, nothing over the top fancy but a well run, clean Doubletree by Hilton. Reasonably priced for the financial district in NYC. The only drawback is the small number of elevators for a 44 story building.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights as part of a 50th birthday trip for my wife. The hotels in an excellent location, close to numerous subway stations, a short walk to the Statue of Liberty Ferry service, Staten Island Ferry and Ground Zero. It suited us as it was away from the hustle and bustle of uptown and there were plenty of good bars and restaurants within a few minutes walk. The hotel was not up to the usual standard I expect from a DoubleTree but I would return next time we visit New York. We didn't like the fact that the reception was on the second floor as this meant the only staff we saw were the Lobby staff as we left and entered the hotel but they were all very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff were efficient and friendly. Helpful with directions and recommendations.The room was the largest I've had in Manhattan. I was able to select my floor and room, and check in prior to arrival. It was great. Security staff were present when we came home late.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel was adequate. Rooms were tight, but it's NYC. Great location for subway due to proximity of multiple stations. Check-in was a disaster. Took over two hours for rooms to be ready. Bell staff were amazing and made up. For price and location it was adequate for a long weekend.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location if this hotel is fantastic, as was the value compared to Times Square hotels. Don't think you're "out of it" by being in the Financial District because you've got lots around you that you'd want to see and the Subway is easy!! Only reason it's not 5* is because it's quite dated and is still a lot of money for what you get. I'd still recommend it though!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here to see New York and all the things. This hotel is well situated being close to Subway Stations which can get you to different places all around New York. The hotel is very tall with it having 44 floors. The rooms were ok, they weren't too big but they were very nice. The TV had a great range of channels, including kids and sports channels. One of the very annoying things were the lifts/elevators, they were incredibly slow and massively used. One day one of the elevators got stuck on the 12th floor and the other 2 were being used constantly, it wasn't very nice walking 21 floors down to the 2nd in fire stairs smelling like static electricity. Next to the hotel were some nice places to eat/drink which was very good. Now to the title of this review, the clogged toilet. The hotel give you very little toilet roll and it gets used very quickly having 4 people staying in the room. Tissue was used in it and it got clogged, we phoned reception and they came to fix it which was very good.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel was lovely! It's a lovely high risk near Battery Park, the Bull, Trinity Church, and several subway stops. The room, though small, had a large, comfortable bed. The staff are lovely, even upgraded us to a city-view room upon check-in, and like every DoubleTree, fresh cookies are provided for each guest. It is ideal for those that want to save a little money by not wanting to stay so close to central Manhattan, but still stay in a quality hotel. The only downside is the elevator: there are three, but with nearly 50 stories of guest rooms, it can take a while to get one. Keep this in mind when checking out, as Sundays around noon they get packed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Having read some of the previous reviews I didn't know what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised. Stayed for a week, room was serviced everyday which was great. Bed was super comfortable, coffee machine in room was great, shower was also nice. Room was a nice size and very comfortable. Location was good very close to Wall Street, battery park and Statue of Liberty. Q train right outside hotel which can take you uptown and to times square (49th street), two more subway stations within walking distance which will take you to the west side and East side. The location of this hotel is excellent if you are up for using the subway, if you are not maybe it's not for you! 24 hour Essen 1 block away aswell as lots of bars and restaurants have a wander and you'll find them. Lots of people have mentioned elevators, I had anticipated waiting long periods of time for one, this only happened 2 or 3 times every other time it was fine! Really enjoyed my stay here and thought the downtown location was really lovely!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was clean and comfortable and quiet. It is close to Broadway, Wall Street, and Battery Park. There is a large selection of restaurants nearby. The fresh cookies at check-in are a great bonus! Our only complaint was the long wait for the elevators.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Nearly an excellent stay. Unfortunately the hot water in my shower was overly and extremely hot. It was fixed by engineering but too late for me to get showered after my run. Might have been nice for them to have offered compensation or suggested an open room for the shower. Gym was a bit poky but functional. The room's a/c had broken grill but was otherwise functional. It made the room look rather cheap though it really wasn't!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We are just back from an overnight trip to NYC. This hotel was amazing. The staff was super friendly, room was clean, free breakfast and wifi. They also have a deal with a parking garage around the corner. There was construction right across the street so we were up with that at 7:30 but that has nothing to do with the hotel. The elevators can take a little time but there are quite a few floors so plan for that. We will def stay here again in the future. Located right in the heart of the financial district, if you like historical things to do, that's the place to be. Federal Hall, Fraunces Tavern, Trinity Church.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If this were my first stay I would rate the hotel one star. The front desk had a bad attitude when asked to move my room due to a malfunctioning thermostat. I have stayed here other times and would rate this Doubletree 3 stars overall and 4 for location.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is nice. There is a very close metro station so it's easy to travel around. The cleaning lady threw away a paper bag with the receipt inside that she was not supposed to, because I needed to go back to the store to ask for a refund, and gave me such a hard time to do so. The store didn't let me have the refund and I had to get something else instead. It was a alright solution but I just didn't understand why throw away the bag and leave all the bins with actual litter still inside. Reception is friendly and gives warm cookies when we arrive at the hotel. Just watch out that what you think you'll pay when book using booking will not be that, there's always extras that they will charge you.
user_name:
flavale
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Checkin is on the second floor and when it's busy, the elevators take forever. It didn't help I was on the 44th floor. All together a good trip and nice staff. No mini fridge or microwave but that's clear in the hotel room descriptions. I could see part of the river from my room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel, while downtown is only steps away from uptown or Brooklyn subway trains. We used SpotHero for a parking garage that was $17 a day near the hotel, and a couple of restaurants and bars are on the same street that offered solid fare at reasonable NY prices.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great service. Hopton was very helpful and friendly. This hotel is always one I make it a point to stay at when traveling on business to NYC. Great job of making your guests feel welcome. The staff has always been helpful here.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We were not given an HHonors room upon arrival - no big deal - but the problem was that we had requested a bathtub and the room we were in did not have one. So we asked for one and the staff member said it would be no problem...just to go to the 'new' floor (we were on the 38th and she said she was moving us to the 44th) and an assistant would be right up to give us the key to our new room. 30 minutes later a janitor comes by with a key and opens the door to our room...which had a couple already in bed inside do god knows what. thankfully our 6 year old son didn't get too curious. Another 30 minutes pass and we’re told we need to stay in the original room and would be moved the following night. the following night we’re in a new room, but the room didn’t appear to have been cleaned (toilet seat left up, sheets have holes in them, trash on floor). at this point I’ve given up and am glad we have a bathtub for our son to bathe in. Our third and last night we come back to our room and the keys don’t work. I’m told that’s because we needed to go back down to the front desk and get new ones since there was a second reservation for the last night (this i asked on at least 5 different occasions about prior and every time i was told ‘no problem, you don’t have to do anything’) now’s a good time to mention that the elevators in this hotel need reprogramming. on average it took us 15 minutes to get to our floor from the ground floor. SUNDAY MORNING with everyone in the hotel still sleeping it still took more than 5 minutes! I lived in New York for 20 years and we’ve stayed in dozens of NYC hotels, several Hilton, and I’ve never had this experience. I will never book this hotel again. I’ve had much better experiences with other Hilton brands in NYC. Everything from Hampton, Hilton Garden Inn to the Conrad. If this sort of service goes on I’m going back to Marriott.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Small, small room. Worn furniture. Mold on shower, cracked sink, no room service menu, poor service, slow internet. Garbage not removed, shampoo and other amenities missing, By far the worse hotel experience. This property should be removed from the Hilton family.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My partner and I stayed here for 6 nights in early March, I booked 6 months previous on booking.com and got a reasonable price, but I was concerned after reading quite a few negative reviews on here. I'm relieved that I ignored them and stayed here, we had a lovely stay. When we first arrived after a long journey we were told that they didn't have our booking on their system, not really what you want to hear when your tired, but after a short wait and a few phone calls they eventually found our booking and gave us keys to a room on the 41st floor. The room was beautiful, lovely big comfy king size bed and amazing view of the one world from our window. However we had a very unpleasant surprise at 7am when we were both woken up by loud banging and drilling from a construction site on top of a tower being built opposite. I'm a heavy sleeper and it woke me up, and even after putting ear plugs in I could still hear it. I went and spoke to reception about it and asked to be moved to the other side of the building, the receptionist said she didn't know of any construction work going on and it shouldn't be getting done at that time of the morning. I found this a strange comment, I'm really not sure how she couldn't possibly know about this massive building being built right outside the hotel! Luckily they had a room available later that day on the other side of the hotel. Our second room was on the 38th floor and was also a beautiful room, we were very happy and comfortable in it, it was spacious and we had a lovely view of the Hudson. Our room was cleaned every day, it was well equipped and most importantly we didn't hear any construction noise for the rest of our stay.The main concern for most people on here is the lifts at this hotel, and it's true that there is only three quite small lifts for this quite large hotel, and they can get quite busy especially as the housekeeping team also use them. Maybe we were just lucky but we had no problem getting or using these lifts, I think the longest we waited was a couple of minutes and the lifts are quick when they don't have to stop at different floors.The staff were very helpful at this hotel, they stored our bags for us when we changed rooms and on our last day as our flight was a late one, and reception did solve any issues we had. The main selling point in my opinion is the location of this hotel. It has subway stations on its doorstep that can get you anywhere in manhattan quickly enough, and has plenty of amenities nearby. There are some lovely bars and restaurants in the stone street area that stay open very late every night, and battery park ferry stop, charging bull and one world and 911 memorial are all easy walking distance from it.Overall we had a very pleasant stay and I wouldn't hesitate to stay hear again next time we come back to this amazing city, and I would recommend this hotel to friends. Thanks doubletree and keep up the good work!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: NYC isn't known for its safety, but I expected a little more from a hotel that earned four stars on most travel sites. On the second night of our stay, the safe in our room was open when we returned, even though we had locked it that morning. We had a Do Not Disturb sign on the door to prevent waste of water through laundry services. Nothing was stolen from our room, but we felt unsafe after we realized that the staff had been in the room and had opened the safe. The desk staff also told us to take a train that wasn't running at the time, so we had to pay $100 for a taxi to get to our flight on time. It's a nice hotel; we got great prices, a comfy bed, a clean room, and friendly staff, but the lack of safety and privacy was a huge issue.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed at this hotel with friends for a concert weekend. They had stayed in past and liked the rates and location. All seem to be fine until the second day. We left our room service order on the doorhandle . It was never picked up. Called front desk...NO ONE answered. No housekeeping. No wifi the day of checkout. So disappointed. Its a Hilton. We expected better

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff were very friendly and very helpful. The rooms were clean, and the location is perfect for subway and touring around. Highly recommended. A couple of decent bars very close by, safe environment too. About and hour subway from LaGuardia including the Q70 bus from the airport.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff was very courteous and helpful. The only problem I had was with the breakfast crew, no too pleasant. They would greet you and ask if you want coffee, that was it. They wouldn't come and check if we needed anything else. I would ask for cranberry and apple juice, I would get cranberry and orange juice every morning (four mornings). Once they would bring the juice, they were all sitting near the bar on their phones, watching whatever they were so deeply involved with on their phones; other than that, the staff was good. Also, one day my room wasn't cleaned and it was after 4:00 p.m. when I returned to my room. But, not too bad after staying a week and one day missed.
user_name:
Ray C
San Antonio, TX, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I previously stayed at this property about five years ago. I prefer to stay in midtown, but the rate was too good to pass up. I had a good experience five years ago, but this experience was better. The staff were much more friendly and very helpful. The rooms are clean. As other reviews state, there is definitely a leaking shower problem as I experienced it both times in different rooms. This time the leak was so bad that the baseboard in the bathroom actually began pulling away from the wall. The location of the hotel is so convenient to multiple subway lines that can have you in midtown, the upper east or the upper west sides in 15-30 minutes. The hotel location also provides easy walking access to Statue of Liberty, 9/11 Memorial, Wall Street, Seaport, and the Bull. Definitely consider the property as an option during your next visit to NYC. It's a great bargain.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: upgraded to a larger room.The room was great, but there was an issue with the window which made the room a little cold. was a one night stay. would recommend on a short stay.service was great with the receptionist

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Slow elevators. Bathroom too small for a single man to place his toiletries in the bathroom. Had to use shaving bag on the bedroom credenza and move items into the bathroom only when needed. Bed king size width but shorter than queen size length. Change for a $50 bill not provided at front desk.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I had an amazing time. I would recommend this hotel very comfortable and clean. Staff very friendly and good location for everything you need. I will be coming back as I love New York !!!! Enjoy all the restaurants that are nearby. Very near Rockefeller centre

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Staff is great, food is very good. No real ground floor lobby, but it works.The elevators are a serious problem during rush times, but other than that very nice experience.Doorman Hopton is top notch!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel service was excellent from the bell person to room service, the rooms were clean. I stayed here for 3 nights and the only problem i had was parking which is around $60 for one day valet parking. No in and outs. But it is new York city

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The first room we were assigned to was quite run down and down right dirty. The overall condition of the room reminded me of a Motel 6 - burned out light bulbs, peeling wallcoverings, stained and scratched up furniture, ripped curtains, piled up dirt in every corner, worn/gray towels, and mystery stains. The biggest concern was electrical plugs falling out of the wall, which is a big code violation no - no. If a child would stay in this room or the outlet can into contact with water, it could be dangerous. The weather was rainy and we were bringing into the room wet coats and umbrellas. We asked for a different room but it was not possible for the first two days of a seven day stay. The second room was better, but not great. They "lost" our fax and when I asked for packages of decaf coffee, the woman at the desk was pretty grumpy. She finally said we will bring them up, I guess. They never arrived. Good location, but the rooms are below standards you would expect for this chain. Hilton - do you job and inspect these hotels.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is located on Stone Street, a stone's throw from Wall Street in the financial district. It is very accessible on the subway and is within a couple of blocks of several different subway lines (R, W, 1, 2, 3, A, C, 4, 5, J, and Z). We were thrilled with the location.This is a tall, skinny hotel -- more than 40 floors, but with maybe 8 or 9 rooms per floor. There are only 3 elevators for the hotel. We were glad to have a room on a lower floor so that if we couldn't quickly get an elevator we could just take the stairs.A special shout out to the doormen, especially Hopton, who helped us store our luggage on our last day and was super friendly. He had great advice about places to go and gave excellent directions.One caveat: there is a major construction project going on just across the street, with people jackhammering well into the evening. It was really loud.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I loved the location, it was very safe downtown neighborhood with easy access to subway and state island ferry. Lots of Irish bars on Stone street. mcDonalds nearby on Broadway and a local walgreens on the corner. Able to take public transit from JFK airport by taking the air train to jamaica center and then the subway train to Broad street. Room was lovely with coffee maker which was handy in the morning. we set the heating ourselves and turned it off at night.It took a while for the lifts to arrive at your floor. 3 lifts serving 44 floors so a wait at peak busy times. The staff were very courteous and polite.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed for two nights and would stay here again. The location is ideal for financial district business, and also very near a few subway lines including the 4/5 to get uptown.The room was clean and spacious by NYC standards with a work station desk. The wifi never failed me.Good size fitness center with a few bikes, treadmills plus weights and space for stretching and abs (medicine balls, too).I opted for a lower floor (7), so didn't get a great view but I didn't want to have to wait a long time for the elevator.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel for business before this trip. I have run into issues on other trips as well but they fell down this time. The toilet was lose, the A/C did not work, and there was a hook missing from the bathroom door. The last item is insignificant but the other two could use some attention. I notified the front desk when I was leaving to go to meetings assuming they would fix the problems. Got back late and nothing had been done. Called down but no one came. I will be asking my travel department to book me somewhere else.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Awesome staff and service. Felt so welcomed, I did not want to leave.From valet to check in to eating at the restaurant to check out ;warmth, hospitality and great customer service.Amenities were excellent too.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The front desk and security people were very helpful. The hotel is right in the heart of Wall Street. Very accessible to subway lines. Hint: close to 9/11 memorial. American Indian museum (free) and free ride on the Staten Island ferry where you can see the Statue of Liberty.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is clean and problem free, and the staff is very helpful. The hotel is close to several subway lines, the ferries, and to many breakfast carry-outs and other restaurants, with many of them Irish on St. Patrick's Day. The rooms are small, especially with four occupants, but all we want is a safe, clean, problem free room to sleep off our many NYC activities!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location is close to two subway lines that will have you to broadway or central park in no time. It is also within walking distance of the Staten Island Ferry and the Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island ferry. Check in was friendly, but confusing as the lobby is on the second floor, and the signage for this is minimal. Rooms are small and oddly laid out. Room was clean and for being the city pretty quiet.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We had stay an extra night due to flight cancellation due to heavy snow storm. I was told room occupancy should stay normal but we were charged 200% of regular rate. When asked, i was told it is "market price", I say it is a classical price gouging which is illegal. We also had a sleepless night due to neighbors fighting, we had to call security at 3am. Instead of highest commitment to customers, we were told "sorry".

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We've stayed at this hotel twice--would we do it again? Probably not--mostly because of the elevators. Seriously.Pros: -Reasonable (for NYC) rate booked through Travel Zoo: $149 + taxes and fees.-Good location in the financial district and convenient if most of your destinations are downtown.-Friendly and helpful staffCons:-Elevators take forEVER. Seriously, this is a real problem. If you book here, book a low floor so you can take the stairs, otherwise you'll never get in or out of the hotel.-If most of your destinations are in midtown or further uptown, you'll spend your whole trip either in the subway or in a taxi/Uber.-The rooms are very small, no bathtub (shower only), and the whole place could use a freshening up. -Vallet parking takes a loooong time to get your car. A hotel in NYC is expensive, and this hotel at least allows you a couple nights in the city in a clean room that won't break the bank. But the elevator problem hasn't improved in the year since our first visit, and it adds an unnecessary layer of frustration to what should be a good time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The entrance is like a block of flats, reception on 2nd floor. Long line for service - just one person on duty. The room is tiny - you'd be forgiven for thinking it was a project apartment. Really poor. Then, after a journey to get here, feeling tired and hungry, no matter how much I called, no one answered the phone. It generally looks neglected and sad. I won't be back!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Manhattan is a very expensive place, so getting a clean and fairly new hotel room for $200 a night is a pretty good deal. But price aside, this is not a great hotel. As many others have pointed out, the rooms are small, not enough elevators for the 44 story structure, and the 2nd floor lobby is confusing. I will add that the beds are too soft, much more so than any other Hilton I've stayed at. I am a gold Honors member, and had a bad problem with the climate control in the room I was originally assigned. After a short delay, they were able to move me into an upgraded room, which I appreciate.I didn't deal much with the staff. The few times I did, they were all capable, if not especially friendly. This is New York, though, so that's not unusual.All in all, if I returned to this area, I'd try a different hotel. But if this was the only place available, I would stay again.Biggest plus for me was the low price. Biggest problem was the soft bed. Everything else was pretty much average.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Fantastic hotel in a great location. Easy to hop the subway to get to Broadway/Times Square. We were in town for ACC basketball tournament at Barclay Center and was a perfect spot to stay. Clean and comfortable. Murphy's Pub right next door for a quick bite. Friendly staff and yummy cookies.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I booked this hotel primarily for it's location and cost as I didn't want to be in the middle if the city, especially at night in order to get a good nights rest. At first, I was a little worried as I read some reviews regarding slow elevators, old rooms, poor air conditioning, no hot water and rude staff. Thankfully, to my surprise, my experience was anything but similar to what I had read. I arrived an hour before check in time and was politely greeted by the front desk. I explained I was a little early and she had no problems checking me in early. I got my key cards and proceeded to my room on the 18th floor, and didn't have to wait long for the elevator. The rooms were clean, kept well and the shower had no issues at all. The room was cleaned properly and thoroughly each day and being a fan of The Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf, it was a nice perk having that as their coffee of choice in the rooms. My only not-so-perfect experience was one morning when I waited about 5-7 minutes for an elevator, but other than that, no complaints at all. The subway (Yellow line) to the city was also just at the corner of Stone street so it was easy getting around and transferring stations. Also, for those who want to take the Air Train to the airport, the staff informed me that one can just walk about 10 minutes and take the J or Z train and transfer to the Air Train to the airport, which is really convenient, and can save you $65 for a taxi. The total travel time took about 45 minutes to an hour so just keep that in mind.This was a great hotel, with great staff and a fantastic location so I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. For those that may have had a less-than positive experience, I strongly suggest that you give this hotel another try, and chances are you'll be pleasantly surprised.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I booked this hotel as nothing suitable was available in Brooklyn. I wass attending the Mens ACC Basketball Tourney. Very reasonable price and close the Bowling Green Subway entrance for easy and quick access to Barclay Center (where games held) or midtown for Plays and other sites. Small rooms but adequate. Wonderful staff. Alas, the breakfast was not up to my expectations. Some tourist sites nearby but mostly a business area.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Spent there 2 weeks . Great location to go anywhere in Manhattan and Brooklyn .Staff at the door are always smiling and nice, while staff at the desk is uppity and never solved our requests.Room is well kept but cleaning service should be doublé checked. We even asked for it, but one and then another worker at the recepción, didn't mind till Cindy the supervisor who never got our queues, had a personal eye on it.All the other workers of any other área smiling and friendly.I would recomend it and go back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location and value for what you receive is perfect. This would be my first pick whenever traveling for business in the future. It is within walking distance to everything you would need. Subway, ferry, coffee, food, businesses.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: For the first time ever I wish I could give a hotel zero stars.I'm a Hilton Diamond Rewards member. Remember, if they treated me this poorly, imagine how they will treat an everyday traveler. Environmental control unit whistled all night. The toilet wasn't attached to the floor. No, I'm no kidding, it would slide back and forth across the floor. Incredible. Worst than I'd expect from a Motel 6.But even worse was the way they responded, or failed to respond. When I reported the above in person at the front desk at 5:30 AM on a Saturday, the response was, "Oh, really?" When I said I would be cancelling the balance of my stay the response was, "Okay. So, you're checking out now?"I then asked to speak with a manager but was told there wasn't one available. (Perhaps a good reason why the customer experience was so poor...)I left my number and requested a call back. I'm still waiting.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: super clean super and fresh sheets and towels !!! sweet front desk people & helpful staff best views of downtown new york city close to many food and bar options & close walk to all the cool things the financial district offers

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The room was very comfortable, staff friendly, courteous, helpful, kind. The price was very good, did not come with breakfast which was perfect for me, there are so many places to eat in Manhattan. Great place to stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The elevators in this property are notoriously slow, and one was broken, overloading the others so that they did not stop at lower floors if the nineteenth floor can be considered lower. After waiting half an hour, we called and were told that nothing could be done which I still do not believe.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Standard shoebox size rooms typical of NY. The property is clean, bed was comfortable and furnishings are in good shape, staff is decent.Convenient location for access to lower Manhattan and a little less of a crowd mess here than hotels near the WTC. Noise from adjacent rooms and hall was noticeable. There are only 3 very small elevators for a 44 story hotel and none are programmed for upper and lower floors. so you will wait and wait and wait some more. Skip the breakfast (even if it's free) and hotel restaurant. Both days I had cold eggs, bacon, sausage, burnt toast and stale pasteries. The service was poor as well, perhaps nonexistent might state it better.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Room was fine, I didn't think it was too small considering you're in a tall building and had what you'd expect in it (apart from a hairdryer which was a notable omission). Booked a room with a city view at a good discount on booking.com, wouldn't have paid full price for what I got. Had room service twice, one evening meal and one breakfast. The food was really good and came hot despite being 43 floors up. Didn't think the lifts were too much of a problem, expect the occasional 5-10 minute wait and a few full lifts to go past you but you get used to it and in reality you're only doing it once or twice a day anyway. If I found it discounted again i'd probably stay again! On my last night there, there was some maintenance work taking place with plenty of warning and scheduled as to not be intrusive (ie when guests would usually be out exploring the city anyway!) nice touch to be notified.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Room small but it's nyc. Hotel clean and newer. Be in good shape because elevator situation is rough. Get to know stairs because you will need to use them. One of those typical NYC hotels that is placed in a small place. Good location in financial downtown and subway.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is in a great location to explore the city and surrounding areas. The bedroom is ok, a few bits of wear and tear on light switches but it did the job and was reasonably priced.Not enough lifts to service the building for the guests and staff to use, which meant waiting a long time to get a lift, and once you'd gotten one it took a long time to get to your room. Room was clean but there was a tray left outside in the hall for a few days. Also there was no duvet cover on the bed,rather a duvet with a sheet under and over it, so when you slept you ended up unravelling it and touching the duvet which is unhygienic.Had an issue being overcharged and one or two member at the front desk were rude almost to the point of being unhelpful in this regard, although the doormen and security downstairs were lovely and friendly.I'd never stayed in a Hilton group hotel before and expected a higher standard for some reason from the brand, would be reluctant to stay in any of their hotels again after this.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Pre-Christmas NYC trip to see the store displays on Fifth Avenue and simply enjoy the sights and sounds of the holidays in the city. This hotel is one block from Battery Park, initially not on our list to see but were able to fit it in since it was so conveniently near the hotel. It is also around the corner from the NY Stock Exchange, Wall street, and other financial district icons.The rooms are small and sparse, but enough for our needs. The beds were comfortable and always cleaned (we stayed 3 nights). staff was very friendly. Lobby was very small and cramped. The hotel is very tight on space, hallways were very narrow, even elevators were small. Oh well, it is New York city after all. Hotel parking is one block away. We drove in so we kept our car there for 4 days and had no problems. We took the trains to midtown NY and it was easy to figure out. Train stops were quite a long walk from the hotel though. Overall it was a good experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is an odd hotel in the heart of the NY finance area at the Southern tip of Manhattan. The entrance is easy to miss, and the lobby is on the 2nd floor. There is nothing on the ground level except access to the restaurant. I did not make use of the breakfast or other hotel facilities, only the room. What I saw of the hotel showed a lack of ongoing maintenance to keep things looking good and working properly. Some little things, and some glaringly big things all pointed to a hotel needing better care.The staff were helpful, and when I brought up the largest of my issues, they were apologetic, but I am not sure whether they will fix is properly, or just try some duct tape on it! It was a serious electrical safety issue, so I hope they do it right. As mentioned by others here, the room was small but acceptable, the bathroom even smaller, with no counter space. The elevators get packed during busy times, to the point where some people can't get on, and they too showed signs of wear and tear (wall coverings falling off).I come to NY often, but I don't think I will be staying here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Entrance difficult to find at first and then have to go to second floor to check in. One night person staff very helpful but the the rest didn't really seem to care. Elevators slow and not enough of them. Room average but carpet matted and sticky. Definitely needs updating. Beds nice and clean. Bathroom updated but made a terrible noise when shower ran. For the price it was a good choice but would not go back there.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The financial district is a great place to stay on the weekend--the pace is slow, the financial markets are closed, there is little traffic. There is plenty to see and do; the hotels are available and offer good prices. The DoubleTree brand is reliable and their hotels are clean and quiet.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The bedroom could do with updating and the bathroom was showing signs of age.Tea and coffee making facility in room was a definite plus and the staff were always willing to provide extra supplies. Every member of staff went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. The only downside was the long wait for the lifts.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: a big disaster in any situations. At first, the people was o.k.,have try to help and was gentle.But the interior, the room (cold and loud),the breakfast and many other things was absolutely bad. After first night a must change the hotel and I find one for the same price and modern with a great view to the "Ground Zero".

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We booked a king room thru Expedia and got a great price (4 nights, 2 round trip tickets on JetBlue from SFO for about $950). Check in was fine, but our keys didn't work in our door. They sent someone up quickly and got that fixed. The room is small, but that's fine...I don't mind small. Unfortunately, they've not done well in planning their space or choosing the fixtures/amenities. Luggage rack doesn't fit in closet when it's unfolded. The only place to put it was in the corner by the nightstand. The coffee maker turned water brown...WITHOUT ADDING COFFEE. The shower leaked all over the floor from under the shower door (they did send someone to fix this while we were out). The bathroom sink faucet wouldn't stay on unless you had it all the way to cold or hot...if in the middle, it wouldn't hold. Lastly, they give you the standard reminder about hanging up your towels to conserve water but give you nowhere to hang them! There's one little hook next to the bathroom sink...no other rack or hook on the walls. (???)The cookies were nice, but I don't think I'll book again until they've worked out their room problems.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Solid stay, clean facilities. I enjoyed. Greeted with a cookie upon arrival (Always appreciated). Little more quiet which I enjoyed at night as Wall Street closes down. Quick access to the uptown MTA trains. Staff very friendly and intuitive.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a great place to stay for business. It is an easy walk to Wall Street or any location in the Financial District. There are lots of great places to eat near the hotel - most within walking distance. The hotel staff are great. The rooms are comfortable and clean! Overall, it was an excellent experience! Highly recommend this hotel. Will certainly stay there on my next trip to New York.
user_name:
Patsy P
Columbus, Ga, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Let's start with the pros.- great staff, very friendly and good service- bed is comfortable - good for short 1 or 2 nights Cons:- the hotel has 44 floors and there's only 3 tiny, slow elevators. It's not worth having a room on the high floor cuz it will take forever to get up and down. - the rooms are SO small. Not a lot of desk space or space to store luggage. I would definitely not recommend this hotel for extended stays or for families. - bathroom is small and looked like it wasn't cleaned really well- rooms are cold even if u turn up the heat and not that I care but the TV is smallI won't stay here again.
user_name:
Rangan p
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: It was very cold in the room (less than 20 degrees Celcius), but I thought that in general the hotel was ok. But in the end there was an unpleasant incident. I booked a taxi at the reception to drive me to the JFK airport. The taxi was in time however it turned out to be an illegal taxi! There was no credit card terminal. The driver offered to pay with his iphone but I refused. The price was 65 USD. I gave him 100 USD in cash but he had only 20 USD back. It took him 10 minutes to find change. Finally I asked a receipt (at least written on a blanc) because I was in NY for business and needed some document to prove my costs. He told me that he doesn't have any blancs and can't give me a receipt. I was shocked because I didn't expect to find an illegal taxi in a respectable hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Room was ok size, staff were quite helpful - we asked to move rooms as we were too high and I felt sick and they accommodated us very well. The guys on the door are very friendly and always are able to help. Rooms are cleaned to a good standard. The only downside was the restaurant - the breakfast only had one guy working and he couldn't manage very well. He was having to clean, tidy up, serve drinks as well as taking orders and people weren't very happy. The evening menu is Italian and there wasn't much choice on there. For a 44 floor hotel there are only 3 elevators which are very slow so you could be waiting for one for a very long time. Overall stay was good.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is clean, tidy and all the staff we spoke to were helpful. It's easy to find and well connected to the subway system where you can take a subway train to JFK Airport with little fuss. The hotel is tall and skinny - no surprise for NYC. We stayed on the 36th floor and had a good sized room. But....there is a lift problem for some floors. If you're staying on the upper floors like we did, there's a bit of a wait for one of the three lifts. The positive is that the lifts have space and we were able to get in. When the lift stops at floors 25 and lower, the lift is full and guests have to wait for the next one. It's too far to walk down, so wait it is! This is not an issue when returning to your room from the ground floor.Advice - sounds odd if there's a lift issue, but ask for a high floor. Not only are the views better, but you won't waste time waiting for a lift.All in all - great hotel, great location and we would book here again when returning to NYC.Tip - Deli literally round the corner called Flavors. Have your breakfast here - you won't be disappointed (Construction workers use it which is my acid test!)
user_name:
Chris T
North Yorkshire, United Kingdom

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was well staffed and welcoming . room was dark and dingy but had necessity in. Had a problem with hot water which was resolved by maintenance within in 1/2 hour . Location was good next to subway. Requested city view which couldn't be honoured until last night at a charge.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have recently returned from a 4 night break in New York City. We stayed at the Doubletree in Hilton in downtown Manhattan and had a great stay. The staff were fantastic especially Kailyn and Floody who work the night shift and checked us in on arrival with a smile & great attitude. Both very informative and helpful, no request or task seemed to much.The hotel is reasonable in price & a great location to access a number of locations around New York. Two Sub stations with in walking distance to take you to a number of locations and sites.Make sure you say yes to the offer of a cookie, the best cookie I have ever tasted.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If you have to stay in the Financial District in New York City please give the DoubleTree on Stone Street an opportunity to provide you with excellent service. This location is very convenient, the rooms are well appointed and functional, and most importantly clean and comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel. Best stay ever!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The Double Tree on Stone Street proved to be a very nice place to stay. Our only gripe was the small elevators, for which we found ourselves regularly waiting. The hotel is in the financial district situated very near bars, restaurants, and a subway station. The hotel is also a short walk to the Staten Island Ferry terminal. Our room was small but clean and nicely decorated. The staff was very friendly and the housekeeping crew was especially helpful. The price of the hotel was reasonable and there was a great parking garage (not associated with the hotel) a very short walk away. Overall, we enjoyed the Double Tree and found it easy to recommend.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I booked this hotel because the deal was so great but after booking & reading the reviews I was concerned & thought about cancelling BUT I'm so glad I didn't. This hotel was everything I expected it to be for the price, basic, clean, comfortable & best bit perfect location - Freedom Tower, Ground Zero, Statue of Liberty, Wall Street, Brooklyn Bridge & Staten Island Ferry all very close by with several subway stations only a couple of minutes walk away which can get you to upper Manhattan within 5-10mins. As soon as we arrived a lovely guy (didn't get his name) made us feel very welcome & took us to reception. Reception lady (again didn't catch her name) was friendly & gave us warm cookies. Our room was 704 & it was big enough for me, my partner & our child especially given the time we would spend in the hotel, there was also a big shower, the double beds did seem a little smaller than UK double beds but was perfectly fine & comfortable. A lot of reviews I read talked about the elevators I can honestly say we never experienced this, we stayed Friday to Monday but the lifts was there within a minute sometimes even less, this could be because 2 of our days fell over the weekend but even on the Monday when we left at 8am it came within a minute (maybe we was just lucky). I personally recommend the Staten Island ferry, it's free & runs every half hour 24hrs a day 7 days a week, you get a great view of Statue of Liberty & the Manhattan skyline & it's literally a 5 minute walk from hotel, we did it both in the daytime & nightime. I can highly recommend Murphys bar right next door to the hotel, food is lovely. When we checked out a really lovely guy called Tony was so friendly & helpful & stored our bags for us till we was ready to collect them & told us best way to get to Newark Airport. All in all we had a fab stay for our first time in NYC & if we go back we would definitely stay here again. If your looking for a no frills, cheap hotel that's clean & comfortable & just somewhere to lay your head in a great location this place is perfect if your looking for 5* luxury I've heard the Plaza or Four Seasons is good

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel, the location is good for seeing the sights and attractions that New York has to offer.Check in process, quick. The rooms are of a decent quality and the beds are comfortable. Toiletries are replaced daily. I had some issues with my booking and the hotel resolved the issues to my satisfaction.No complaints at all.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: A basic NY hotel with acceptable big rooms, good showers. Room service good and fast. The coffee machine a bit outdated. What is a bit of a down grade, even with 3 elevators you might wait for 10 min to go down.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Close to everything that we wanted to see. Close to Subway stations. Great service at the hotel, they helped me alot when a package dident show up on time. Highly recommend this hotel! Will stay there again next time in NY.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a nice location if you're staying in the Financial District. The room was a little cramped (but it is NYC). The lobby is not on the ground level so you need to take an elevator to the 2nd floor for check-in. The gentlemen greeting you at the ground floor are extremely helpful and friendly.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. Hotel is located in heart of financial district which has its advantages, less tourists, close to many of the major sites such as the Statue of Liberty etc. The hotel itself is clean, the rooms are a good size, with all the amenities you require. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, a great asset to the hotel. We were on the 22nd floor overlooking Stone st, we didn't have a great view but hey we were here to explore New York not the hotel! Cannot understand the reviews complaining about waiting for elevators. We never waited more than 3 minutes. We will certainly recommend this hotel to our friends and family. NYC...what a fab city, dynamic diverse and super friendly !!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Located right outside the subway so very convenient. Greeted as soon as you come in. Staff was very polite, even give out cookies! The room was small but very comfortable and best of all CLEAN. The bed was super comfortable. Would go again!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I didn't read previous reviews because I want to be able to be objective and form my own opinions. I stayed at this Doubletree on Sunday night, 1/29/17. I was there at a quite off-peak period, arriving around 9 PM and not checking out until 11 AM next morning; thus I did not experience issues with the elevators. I was greeted at the front desk with a smile by Tina. She was quite efficient and helpful. My Hilton Diamond status was recognized and rewarded. The room was what anyone should expect when staying in Manhattan. Yes it was small but I always find it interesting how hotels make use of the space available. I did not lack for anything, except space in the bathroom to put down my toiletries bag. Perhaps some of the foyer area space could be used to expand the bathrooms a bit.I got a good night of sleep, finding the bed and pillows comfortable. The temperature in the room was easy to control, and the HVAC system was not overly noisy.In the morning I went down to claim my buffet breakfast, and it was good. Upon checkout, Tina was there again and was as professional as the night before.The price was right for me, definitely a great deal for New York City. It is convenient to subways and the PATH train at the World Trade Center. I strongly recommend this property.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The DoubleTree hotel is oke, not great but it is oke. Breakfast is good. The rooms are small, but everything is in the room. The bed was not long enough for me. Because of the height an extra elevator is recommended.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Fantastic trip, spacious room, close to a range of subways, lots of cool bars, pubs and restaurants nearby. We loved the area and it's convenience. Hotel was excellent value for NYC. Try Murphy pub next door for $5 happy hours drinks and good food. Ulysses has excellent live Saturday night music, drinks and food.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The room was clean and location and price excellent. If you need a simple and comfortable room to stay by Wall Street this is good. If you like a grand open concept, this is not your hotel. My room was clean but the shower leaked due to bad design on a swinging door that doesn't push the water back into the shower. The bed was very comfortable which was perfect because I was there on business. Floor corridors are tight on space. Staff is excellent.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The best part of the hotel is the location, it's literally a two minute walk to the nearest subway station, five minutes to battery park and about ten minutes (ish) to the One World Trade Centre, Wall Street and the Brooklyn Bridge. Besides this and the helpful/friendly doormen, everything else was pretty average. The front desk staff appeared under staffed, when in the morning people were trying to check out or in our case get some assistance with the safe in the room there was only one member of staff at the front desk and a huge queue of people waiting to be served. This was a bit of a hassle as it was the one morning we had to be leaving quickly. It does seem like a lot of people have mentioned the wait times with the lifts and this was a bit of a pain. There's only three, quite small, elevators that you have to wait 90% of the time over 5 minutes for so if you're in a rush it's not ideal. Our main disappointment with our stay was the room cleanliness and the construction going on right across the road from the hotel. When we booked our stay and when we checked in we were never informed about the construction of a new building that would be starting/going on during our stay, so when you are woken up before 6am every morning with exceedingly loud drilling/banging noises is a bit of an inconvenience. If we had just been informed it wouldn't have been such a disappointment. To add to the disappointment of the stay was the cleanliness of the room. Our room was really pretty dirty. When you first walked in and looked around you would think the room maybe hadn't been occupied in a while due to the dust. The dust was everywhere when we arrived, in the drawers, on the dressing table, wardrobe, desk and it was really bad in the air conditioning unit. So when you went into the bathroom there was hairs everywhere, so clearly the room has been used recently. There was hairs in the shower, on the toilet and all over the sink. It really wasn't very pleasant. Apart from the disappointments we really enjoyed our time in NYC and just avoided being in the hotel for too long.
user_name:
Nicole G
Edinburgh, Scotland, United Kingdom

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Rocked my world, each of them. In the most, customized, and niche way -- for about 5-hours, straight, serving, beyond satisfactory, sensational, service, and eager to come back, again and again, and again, to simply, experience them, again + not too mention, coziest, rooms and awesome. Everything awesome. Keep it up. This method of sharing the awesome though - is so, bornig and not as exciting and cool, as the rockstar, overnight-crew were...Yawn. But them, the hotel + " AWESOME " Thank you.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff were extremely friendly, and tried to help wherever they could. The rooms are tiny, and there are only 3 elevators (with about 10 rooms per floor, and 40-something floors), it takes forever to get to and from the room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff here is pretty friendly compared to other hotels we've stayed at in NYC. The rates are great and the room sizes are decent. You have to be a little patient with elevators but not a big deal. The restaurant next door "antica" is pretty awesome too. I will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We had a perfect stay. The rooms are super clean and the staff was very nice and helpful. However, I forgot my suit pants when leaving and being already outside the US it would be nice to have a way to communicate with the Hotel via E-Mail... Unfortunately, I was not able to find such on the Internet. It would be great if it shipping of the pants could be arranged...

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Its good but I stay in others Doubletrees and believe is not the bestI ck in late for two rooms ask for rooms in the same floor the lady who was taking with me was very very nice Tina but the other one Cindy so wrong YOU HAVE TO TAKE WHATEVER WE HAVE AT THIS TIME omgg what a customer service training that lady have????Fortunately Tina help us with so much professionally The rooms are very nice location is ok just a lot of constructions at the moment

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Wait, wait, wait for an elevator. You think I am kidding? 10 min wait this am to get out of the hotel. No service elevator so staff and housekeeping use the guest elevators adding to the wait. Building construction across from the hotel will catapult you out of the deepest sleep at 7am, sharp. No need to use the alarm clock which is good since there isn't one in the room! Seriously?????Otherwise, it is a clean, mid- grade hotel with no amenities. I stay here for only one reason: location. It is one block from our hq. Happy trails.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: For whole stay there was no heating and cold water, you have only extremely hot. They have tried to fix heating but without success. At the end we have paid just one night instead of two. Cookies are excellent btw

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: World class service!Big thank you to Pauline Agard for the great room, personable and professional service! Please pass this on to her manager, Martin Owens Staff like Pauline is why I would always come back to the Doubletree Hilton - Financial. Thank you kindly.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The room was clean, comfortable beds, Great location- 2 subway stations very close to hotel. Shopping and restaurants close to the hotel. Staff very friendly and always offering to help. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend to other travelers. Thank you Tony for your help.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Room is simply average although staff was very nice. No fridge or microwave and dated furniture. 1st day elevators VERY SLOW...and was on 42nd floor. Service elevator was the only elevator with any speed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms were small but nice, but make sure to allow extra time for elevator use. At times it took up to 10-12 minutes waiting for one to arrive. Staff was nice, but too busy to be "welcoming". The downstairs restaurant was very busy so we got very poor service there. The food was good, but we waited an hour and 15 minutes after ordering, and the waiter was quite rude at times.
user_name:
Carolyn G
Las Vegas, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If you are in the area for work this hotel is perfect. Rooms are comfortable and quite. Some might find the elevators take a long time but that is to be expected when you have three elevators and 40 plus stories of rooms

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: It was ok, clean sheets, clean room. the thing i hated was NO water in the room, dry air meet i need water one bottle would have been nice. put it on my bill. the bar was a ok staff was very good. i will go back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed in this hotel during our stay in New York for New Year. The hotel is tucked away in a side street right beside Battery Park which proved to be a great location as we had everything in the financial district within walking distance and had several subway stations very close by. After reading the reviews for this hotel I was a little wary, however there was nothing I could complain about during our stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful, we even got a free cookie upon check in. The room was very clean and spacious in New York terms. The bed was unbelievably comfy and the bathroom had all mod cons. My only advice would be to ask for a room on the lower levels, after reading reviews on here I knew to ask for a room on a lower floor as waiting times for lifts can be a problem. We were on the 4th floor so we just used the stairs rather than waiting for the lifts. A very happy stay here for New Year overall.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel was in a really good location. Close to Subways and hop on and off buses, ferries and wall Street. The hotel rooms were nice. Staff was friendly. The breakfast was ok. The restaurant staff were very attentive. This is a good hotel. You may have to wait for elevator but that's minor to what you are getting to be around the corner from Wall St.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Located close to subway, bull, battery park, ferry to Ellis Island and statue of liberty and one world tower/9/11 Memorial. Uptown you get by metro in 15 minutes. Fitness center is ok, though 2 things were damaged and it did not seem that anyone would repair it. Elevators take long time in peak times. In general not. Rooms are clean and quite ok. Paid a rate of 70 dollars a night, which is fair. More I would not pay for it. All in all I can recommend it. Friendly staff.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Conveniently located for the downtown financial district it is within walking distance of Battery Park, Wall St. and the 9/11 Memorial. Room was relatively small but not overly so, covers the basics for a business trip - king size bed, shower, TV and wifi. Waiting for the lifts is probably the biggest challenge - it's not a huge hotel but lobby and ground floor areas were constantly busy.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed in this hotel during our Christmas trip to New York. To start with, the main entrance of the hotel is a little bit confusing as the reception is located on the 2nd floor. There are only three elevators for the whole hotel so it is ordinary to wait for the lift, especially in the morning (aprox. 10 minutes).Speaking of our room, it was medium size, well kept and clean. The bathroom was fine as well. The room was cleaned everyday. The hotel is located next to Wall Street in Dowtown Manhattan, easy to go everywhere by subway or cab. Close enough to walk to Staten Island Ferry, Statue of Liberty Cruise station or Ground Zero. The area is very nice and calmer than other parts of Manhattan.Very good standard for the price! There is nothing to complain about, we simply recommend this hotel to everyone. We had a fantastic time in NYC!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was a serviceable hotel for those that need to be down in the financial district or want to stay in NYC without paying the higher prices for the a better mid-town hotel. Rooms are a little tight but still relatively new for a New York hotel. Staff wasn't as engage or experienced in other Hilton, Dobuletree properties but professional for the most part. Free buffet breakfast was what you expect, very average, service staff not that great. Bonus benefit is it is very close to the Bowling Green Subway station.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good location if you want to be in lower Manhattan. Convenient next to two subway lines. Rooms were good and nice gym.But the elevator was terrible. For a 45 story hotel it only had 3 elevators that was slow and small and used by the hotel staff. Good thing our room was on the 7th floor so we used the stairs all the time. The breakfast was average. Food always ran out and the waiters were slow.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: It's an okay hotel-overall it was good location and walking distance from the metro. The rooms weren't as clean as expected by DoubleTree standards. Staff was very friendly and good at giving directions. Bellman was very help getting us cabs when we needed and also telling us not when to take a cab. If you're going to out and about all day it's fine and good price for the location.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Elevators so packed you have to let several go by before you can get in. Asked for extra blanket that never came. Very small room. Very crowded lobby most of the time. The concierge was very helpful. No slippers or extras one would expect in a Hilton.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Poor accommodation & limited staff ! Poor location, extremely old and small rooms. Not enough room for two people to walk. The bathrooms are outdated and small. You need to shower sideways because an average person can't fit. Limited staff and not very personable. Not worth the price!
user_name:
Ernie S
Hillsborough, NJ, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good value hotel . Stayed here for four nights in December. Near to Trade centre, Battery Park, Staten Island Ferry, Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. Choice of subways one actually on Stone Street but was closed during our visit . Next Closest subways South Ferry and Bowling Green ...few minutes walk away.Room was comfortable as was the bed but this was surprisingly small for America same as a British double bed. Irish bar next door where we had a good meal and reasonably priced drinks . Staff friendly and helpful would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We spent a night at this hotel and were able to check in early and check out late. It is in lower Manhattan and we could see the Freedom Tower from our room. Nice view!!! We spent one day at the Smithsonian Native American Museum (Free Admission) and the next day on a water tour to Liberty Island. It was the ideal location to enjoy these two adventures. The price was reasonable (Groupon) and the staff were pleasant and helpful. We would most definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel is just okay. the location is not bad if you are in the financial district. But, the room was small and dark, with some mold in the shower stall. The section of Stone Street it is on looks a bit iffy, but, when you go through a building down the street and enter onto the renovated section of Stone Street, the entire area changes, with lots of good restaurants and bars

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Doubletree by Hilton Financial District for 5 nights over Christmas - it was our first Christmas away from the UK and our first time visiting New York. Our stay was lovely! The warm cookie upon check-in was just as yummy as the Doubletree hotels we have stayed at in the UK. The staff were friendly and welcoming, especially the doormen who offered help and assistance whenever we needed it. The decor of the entire hotel is warm and inviting and our room was much better than we expected. It was clean, well laid-out and bigger than we had anticipated for a room in NYC. We even had a small bathtub which was unexpected. There was an ice machine a few steps from our room which was very convenient. Having stayed for 5 nights, we cannot understand why so many of the reviewers have complained about the elevators - we used these every day and they usually arrived within a minute; the longest we waited during our whole stay was around 3 minutes and we stayed on the 20th floor. No issue at all with the elevators. The location is brilliant - there is a subway station right across the road and being in the Financial District we found it fairly quiet at night. On our last day, the security staff offered to hold our luggage for the day and gave us tickets to retrieve our bags upon our return. The doorman also asked what time we would be back and had a lovely hire car waiting for us when we returned - much more luxurious than a yellow cab! Overall we had a fabulous time and would recommend this hotel to anybody.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Well it is not cheap but affortable. The thing is that for its price is very good. The rooms are spacious and the facilities are good enough. There is wifi all over the hotel and also a gym for free.The only problem is that there is not a free breakfast and there is not a fridge in the room.Close to bars, restaurants an metro station.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location is ideal, close to the ferry terminal for Statin Island and the World Trade Centre memorial, Trump Building, Wall Street and the Stock Exchange to name a few within a ten minute walk.The hotel was clean and the staff pleasant and efficient. Received a cookie and a bottle of water on arrival. Found reception slightly out of place with it not being on the ground floor and having to take the lift to book in/out. We found the wait for the lift acceptable in comparable with other reviews and the noise from the building works across nothing to worry about. All in all a very pleasant stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days after Christmas 2016 and booked via hotels.com/ Expedia. We stayed on the 42 floor and enjoyed a great view over the area. We arrived at around 10:30pm after attending a basketball game in Brooklyn, there are multiple subway stations nearby so a very convenient location and accessible. Check in was prompt and The complimentary warm cookie at check in was a very nice touch. Our room was a standard with a king bed and was spacious and well laid out with a desk and arm chair. The free wifi was reliable and housekeeping staff were thorough and even left a note thanking us for our modest tip and wishing us a happy holiday which was also a nice touch we had not experience at any of the other hotels we stayed at during our trip. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel, the only minor annoyance was that there are only 3 elevators for the 44 stories and at busy times it can be very slow and cramped to get an elevator. We waited 20 minutes at 11:30am when checking out. It was on average a 5 minutes wait on each time we came and went so ensure you factor this into your plans if you have a schedule to meet. Overall an enjoyable stay and a fair/ competitive price paid for the standard of the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Not many hotels have I stayed in where receptions aren't on the ground floor. However once you realise that there's a wait for the lifts it's not too bad. Receptions were polite and got us checked in quickly once we were able to get served. No apology for the wait nor a cookie was given to us when more arrived, but that's just not picking.
