The corridors for the floor we were on seemed narrow but the room itself based on location however was spacious and clean although other reviews prior had made me wonder if it was going to be. All that being said, great location for lower manhattan as you have a number of subway lines nearby taking you in all manner of directions. Check out was efficient and polite again and was wished happy holidays. Whether I'd pay full price I don't know but if you can get a deal its wellWorth considering.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I would gladly recommend this Hotel to anyone staying in New York. I travelled solo but had nothing to worry about, everybody working at this hotel worked superbly and efficiently. I'd read that rooms at hotels are small but not in my case, I found it a decent size and had everything I needed. Would not hesitate staying here again. It's a bit out the way from the hustle and bustle but within a few minutes walk or subway ride you're in the heart of it all. Once again I can't recommend this hotel highly enough for price, cleanliness and hospitality.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a tough one to review. Honestly? Not very impressed, especially for the money. But by all accounts this was one of the cheaper hotels in the city, so I think that compounds the issue. New York, it seems, is as over-priced as most major cities. In the financial district, the area felt very safe albeit rather lifeless out of hours. There really aren't many bars, shops or restaurants around. But it's conveniently located near a couple of metro stations and within walking distance of the Staten Island Ferry and Ground Zero.The lower ground entrance is completely uninspiring and the 2nd floor lobby is presentable but small. The building feels like it's been crammed between it's surroundings and just three lifts convey people between over forty floors. So you can wait ages to get up and down. One morning, we took the stairs down 36 floors, we got so sick of waiting. Not everyone is quite as fit!The first room we had - small, a tad tired, tap fell off, chest of drawers broken and single glazing meant we were woken at 06:30 by very loud building works, despite being high up. We changed rooms and while the second was nicer, a dividing door/thin walls and a screaming child meant we were still disturbed.Small things, like finding the coffee filter difficult to fill; no fridge; noisy air con; speakers with an old ipod dock connection (not lightening port) and no pay-per-view movies meant that a comfy evening in just didn't appeal. The restaurant is tiny and breakfast was mediocre to say the least. Stone cold buffet, reminiscent of Holiday Inn Express in the UK - it simply wasn't what I would expect of Hilton Doubletree.Staff were pleasant enough and handled any issues politely. But when we wanted to check out and pay with a different card, we learnt they had already settled the account. To my mind - you do that WHEN the guest departs, not before.At the end of the day, we weren't there for the hotel. It was a bed for the night. But when I think about the fact that I could get a 4* all inclusive week in Spain for less money, it really hacked me off. But as I say, it's New York. I know London and elsewhere aren't necessarily a great deal better.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I'll start from the beginning. My stepdaughter is getting married December 31st 2016 and she organized a block of rooms for some of us. My wife & I arrived at this hotel Late the 27th of December. The Main & only Entrance to the Hotel looks like your entering the loading dock. There were bins of garbage & laundry in front & inside the door. We asked the bellman if this was the main entrance and he saying yes. We unloaded our SUV onto 2 carts. So we were supposed to be staying here for 6 nights. My wife is always willing to give things a chance so we went to the 2nd floor to the Lobby front desk to check in. Upon entering our room that we were told was the largest room they have in the Hotel (Junior Suite) we realized immediately this room wasn't going to accommodate 3 people along with all of our luggage UGH! Again we thought we would give it a chance. Finally we got a chance to sit down after our 3 hour drive from CT. I included photos of the room to go with the next sentence. So what I noticed about the room was this: -Bathroom towels by the sink looked like the rags my housecleaner uses at my house / -the desk chair was ripped in two place and looked dirty / -sofa bed when pulled out would have blocked the way to the bathroom for us from the bed / -wallpaper was pealing off the walls in a couple of places / -phone looked like it hadn't been dusted in awhile /-our door looked like someone must have tried to break into the room at one point because of the damage to it /-the refrigerator was full of scratches & dents & didn't fit under the counter /-in the hallway in front more than one room there was garbage /-the hallway was so tight my wife couldn't extend her arms out all the way and last but not least the bed looked like at had been slept in, so I being the germaphobe that I am slept in my clothes and didn't even take off my shoes..... Pretty bad. After securing the Hilton Millennium for the rest of our stay & getting the Front Desk Manager to confirm I wouldn't be charged for the next five nights we came to grips with the fact that we were staying there for the night. Oh by the way the other Hotel gave us a lower rate. We also made sure to cancel our Cousin's room so they could come to the Millennium with us. Our nightmare ended when we checked into the Millennium.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is okay but nothing more than that. It's in a good spot for subway stations with 3 separate subway lines very close the door guys were friendly but as I've seen on a lot of the reviews the elevators are very slow you can easily be waiting for 10 minutes for the elevator so if your not to worried about views which I didn't get one anyway try get a room in the lower levels so you can use the stairs besides that the rooms were tidy and modern for the price I got around Christmas time it was good

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: It's a great area of NYC. Very close to Financial District, Staten Island Ferry and Battery Park. Staff was exceptional. Rooms are filthy. Repeat. Greasy counter tops. Strange objects in heating system. Furniture stains. Lobby looks amazing but be careful. It's what's behind the door that counts. Lots of loud construction.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed two consecutive weeks. The first week was the best of times. Nice room with a good view, no issues, everything good. In fact, the water in the bathroom was so hot I almost complained. The second week was the worst of times. Room with a view of the roof of the White Horse Tavern (it's actually written on the roof). Same desk area as the first week, but no power outlets. Finally found some after I moved some furniture. Got there on Monday; on Tuesday morning tried to take a shower. No hot water. Waited 15 minutes with the shower running - still no hot water. After an incredibly quick, frigid shower I complained to the desk. "They're working on it; it'll be fixed in 5 minutes. I had to leave, so I didn't wait around to find out. Next morning...same thing. I waited longer this time (about 25 minutes), and *finally* started getting some tepid water. I longed for the scalding water from the first week. And, by the way, the room the 2nd week was on a "Hilton Honors" floor. Beyond stickers next to the floor number on the elevator, and next to the room number, I couldn't see what was special. So, I rate it a "3". 5 for the first week, 1 for the 2nd. Average of 3.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The water was very cold and not able to be warmed by running for a while. The elevators were very slow. I was disappointed by the breakfast because their prices were way too much for children and side plates of just bacon. I could not communicate with waiter to get the prices and amounts of the food per plate to determine how much to get, I would have hoped that he maybe would suggest that the food ordered would be way too much but I guess the $70 breakfast is normal for them.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Check in was a mess. We had 3 rooms reserved under 3 different names. Could barely understand the English of the front desk girl. And I have immigrant parents, so I am very understanding, and not being rude when I say that the hotel needs to get a literate person up at the front. When we asked for our bags to be taken up to our room we were told that she would be leaving and so no. The girl at the front desk gave the wrong room to each person. Wine for an anniversary was left in the wrong room as a result. The upgraded room was given to the wrong person as a result as well. Beds were short. I mean, for a 5'5" person's legs to be hanging off the bed short. A simple request for a few more coffee and more creamers (only 2 per room of each were there for a 4 night stay) to be brought up, a cup full of creamers were brought up. No coffee. Rooms were so close together that you could hear every sneeze and throat clearing, as 4 rooms were in a 1 metre entrance area. So bad. So disruptive. Our friends room key wouldn't work and had to get a new key each time they came in. They tried to communicate that there must have been a problem with the card reader, to deaf and uncaring ears. Spend the extra $$ and book another hotel. This was a mess. None of us will ever be staying here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Where do I start? Negatives : NILPositives: Arrived to a few welcoming guys at the door who showed us to reception. Reception was beautifully decorated for Christmas. Reception staff were well mannered and we got checked in really quickly - hot cookies were lovely and were a treat after a long day travelling! I had emailed prior to arriving to advise it was my husbands 30th birthday - we got a complimentary upgrade to level 40 with a Freedom Tower view in front and to the left the hudson river - what a treat! Room was perfect for us - cleaned daily, comfortable beds and a good heating system - plus waking up and looking out was perfect.No issues with lifts and never had to wait any longer than a few minutes for them!Special shout out to Martin who gave us more cookies and a complimentary drink at the bar on my husbands birthday! We never ate in the restaurant but the wine and beer was good!Subway was beside hotel which was very handy - yellow line (Whitehall street) plus the green line (Bowling Green) was a minute walk from hotel. We bought a weekly pass $32 dollars for unlimited rides on any lines! Great value for money!!We would definitely stay in the Doubletree - stone street when going back to NYC and would recommend it to our family and friends!Tips: we had our breakfast at a cafe beside the hotel "Flavors" each morning - very popular with the locals and so much choice! If visiting NYC and you are going to do tourist attractions buy the New York Explorer City Pass - groupon do a great deal on this!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I would not qualify this as a 5-star hotel, but it does have redeeming features: Location is quiet, near multiple subway lines/and Staten Island Ferry and more, It is nearby the World Observation Tower and other interesting locations. Rooms are small but decent. On-site restraunt: morning breakfast is good, except when the hotel has a large tour lodging there. Evening Italian dining is great, but $$$. Overall, average NYC lodging

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The booking system is non-dependable: our reservation (done through Booking) was not available at the moment of checkin (we also witnessed another couple go through the same experience on Marathon weekend, November 2016): not a good experience, at all, when the city hotels are overbooked.The front desk night shift had no clue on how they should handle these situations from a technical standpoint, but at the same time, used their better judgment to navigate the situation as good as they could.Our hotel room had a great view, was confortable and had the right equipment in place, outside of the bathroom, where the shower had a design problem and every time you got into it, the whole bathroom floor would get overflowed with water.On the bright side, we didn't experience issues with the elevator (3 units for 44 floors), and the hotel didn't charge us for deliveries from Amazon or other merchants (and they didn't try at all to sneak hidden charges).I would recommend this hotel based on the value proposition (good location, good price, good service) while managing expectations.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If you wish to be in downtown New York, this hotel is well situated. The rooms are comfortable, standard Doubletree style; high quality bathroom amenties. BUT...the major issue is the elevators! There are three elevators for a hotel of some 44 floors, and the wait to go either up or down can be very lengthy. I found this a major irritation and would look elsewhere in future.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: 20 minutes to get to our room because elevators are over worked, filled to capacity and not large enough for the 45 floors it serves. Light bulbs were out, shelf was hanging broken off the wall, shower leaked gallons onto bathroom floor. No fridge. When I asked about a Microwave they said they would heat stuff up for me in the staff lunch room. LOL!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is in a great location for sightseeing in New York made visiting sights so much easier, nice and close to the Staten Island ferry terminal and for the terminal for the Statue of Liberty ferry too and the 9/11 memorial. The hotel was nice and clean and the bed very comfortable and with nice spacious rooms. The concierge staff were lovely, friendly and very helpful. The only issue we found was with waiting for the lifts there are three but it's a busy hotel and sometimes we we're left waiting for ten minutes or so until one became free (even resorted to walking down all 25 floors at one point) but this was my only gripe. There is even a computer for guests to use in the foyer which is really handy for checking onto flights home and printing boarding passes.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel's best feature is definitely its proximity to several subway lines as well as many taverns on Stone street. It also has clean and updated rooms, although our room was very small even by New York City standards. As many other reviewers noted, the elevators are slow, but we really did not find that was too much of an inconvenience. They staff was friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay here, it was good to get away from the chaos of Midtown....rooms were comfortable, bathroom clean and modern, beds very comfortable. No issues at all with the lifts, we were staying on the 39th floor....would liked a mini bar in the room but that's my only real comment for improvement.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is average at best. Tiny rooms but clean. The restaurant downstairs is no longer as good as in years past. The breakfast buffet was a definite PASS. The single most irritating part was the construction across the narrow street. It started at the latest 730am. It was a service disruption that should have been told to those of us who are repeat customers. I will not be back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Staff was rude and yelled at us because elevator was full. Room was filthy and had food smeared on wall. Phone was broken and had no dialing info available. Staff never answered phone downstairs. Door had been kicked in and never repaired. Safe didn't work. Lights didn't work and were hanging crooked on wall. Only 3 elevators and no service elevator so staff use also. Filled out room service slip to hang on door for ease before flight out. Never picked up even after we called from the phone in our new room. They assured us that it would be picked up but never did. Horrible stay. Small disgusting and rude.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The good: general staff is kind. The bad: Room in disrepair. Ceiling in bathroom coming down, sink plugged. When moved, new room wasn't very clean and cracked bathroom sink. Noise across the street due to construction starts at 6am. The ugly: Was charged for a breakfast and realized it right after checking out. Called from the airport several times, then called again when I reached home. Took more than 6 phone calls to correct and then manager was rude almost accusing me of trying to get out of paying for a breakfast! He finally emailed my updated bill, never left a message despite leaving phone number. Email message said "FYI" and that's it, no apology, nothing. I've never written a bad review but this was awful. So sad as the general staff was kind throughout the stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We had to report that the bathroom sink was leaking and that all of the towels were wet 2 different times. It had not been fixed when we left. The entire buffet breakfast was cold. Not much was able to be eaten because of this. A yogurt and cold cereal was all that was fit to eat.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms are actually a little larger than many New York hotel rooms, although I wouldn't call them big. Pretty consistent with what you'd find in most hotels in Europe. Although I am a Platinum Hilton Honors member, when I arrived for a 1 week stay, no Honors rooms were available so I am in a standard room. It is nice and modern, and has a king size bed. When I stay in a hotel, I like to have a TV that I can plugin a Chromcast or a Roku device. These options weren't available in my room. Typical Hilton breakfast buffet, not bad but not good either. I did eat dinner in the restaurant my first evening. I ordered a veal dish with mushrooms and artichokes. I enjoyed it very much. The second night I was worn out from a long day at work so I went for room service. I ordered a bowl of their lobster bisque and the New York Strip, medium rare. The lobster bisque was outstanding, probably the best I have ever eaten. The steak was ok. The steak was cooked properly but it did have a lot of gristle and it was entirely too large. At least two people could have eaten the steak and been full. It is a high rise hotel but there are only 3 elevators. It isn't unusual to wait a long time for an elevator and if it is a busy time of day, when one shows up it might be full.The only reason I didn't give the hotel 5 stars is the TV configuration. This may not be an issue to most people but access to an HDMI port on a TV is getting to be a popular configuration and it is important to me.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I only spend a few hours here, so my comments may not relevant to many.Pros: location is close to many downtown attractions sites (WTC, Statue of Liberty). It's in a heart of financial district, access to food isn't a problem.Cons: service is lacking, room amenities missing a few things such as blanket and additional pillows. It's winter now, despite of what I do, the room is pretty cold. The room that I stayed in I can't open the curtain, but I can peek.Like I said if you looking for a place to sleep and more or less secure this hotel isn't bad, but don't expect much. By the way, there are 3 elevators for 400 rooms, so you need to plan wisely.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Location, location, location. But you pay the price. Beds were comfortable. We had a room on 22nd floor. No real view except building next to us. Breakfast voucher for $12 each? Not a good value unless you really fill your plates. But this is New York and they are out for every dollar and even smiles may cost something.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This Doubletree is located near Battery Park and the Statin Island Ferry terminal. Several subway lines also converge at this point so transportation is close. The hotel is very clean and the staff is good. Perhaps the biggest issue with this hotel is the terribly slow elevators. They are so slow in fact that Doubletree actually put a television by them to watch during your long wait and these are certainly some of the slowest ever. The rooms are very small but not the smallest I've seen. No coffee in lobby but Dunkin Donuts is right around the corner IF you can get down and back up in the elevator. No refrigerator or microwave in room but there is s small safe. I'd probably go back and stay near Chelsea if I had a choice.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location in the financial district with a comfortable bed. The staff was extremely friendly.... so much so, that I am relatively certain staff are told to say hi and be friendly whenever they encounter guests on the premises. The room was clean but much smaller than the Double Tree uptown. The hot water was barely hot enough for a shower. After my shower, housekeeping knocked on the door as water was leaking below.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I've stayed here a few times over the last couple of years, not because I wanted to but because it's the only place available when the Millennium Hilton is booked. This hotel is old, with tiny loud rooms, and virtually no amenities (and even a proper bar, lounge, or entrance).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I wasn't impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel. Simple things - hair next to the new bar of soap in shower and the faceplate for the plug was off and needed to replaced some. I didn't charge my phone with it as it didn't look safe.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed for 4nights, on the 35th floor. Clean, modern decor, good bed, view of the sea(a little bit anyway), good customer service etc. Really no flaws, the wait for the elevators wasnt that bad either. Situated close to subway stations, duane reades, dunkin just around the corner, good bar next to the hotel. Would recommend if you prefer not to stay near Times square and those more of a tourist areas.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very friendly and professional staff, the rooms were very clean and comfortable. If you want to be in lower Manhattan it is hard to beat this location. Also has the benefit of an excellent Italian restaurant on the ground floor.
user_name:
Philip B
Long Island NY, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location is great however elevator service is so inadequate that we sometimes waited 15 minutes for an elevator. The buffet breakfast is not as good as other Doubletree restaurants. No omelette and no plates set out for breads or muffins or any of my three day stay. Rooms are small but quite comfortable. .

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is the second time my husband and I have stayed at this hotel. We chose to stay at the hotel again based on our previous experience. We like the location of the hotel and the staff is very friendly. Because of the location, you do hear some exterior noise (especially since they were doing construction in the building across from our room). One tip is to stay on a lower flower because the elevators are incredibly slow! We just used the staircase since we were on the fourth floor. The subway is really close by to make it easier to travel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Excellent hotel in the Financial District. Great location with 4 metro stations in walk distance from the hotel. If you don't want a touristy and crowded area, this is a great hotel. Unlike what we imagined, there are several pubs within walking distance from the hotel and we even became friends of Barry, the waiter of the pub next door.The room was always clean and the maid was always very pleasant.A good tip for breakfast is Essen, 100 meters turning right the hotel exit. They have good options for breakfast with an affordable price.Some guests complained about the insufficiency of the 3 elevators for the whole hotel but we didn't have to wait more than 3-4 minutes for the elevators.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Lovely hotel , the location is great to get out and about , nice clean rooms with amazing shower, i never tried the bar and restaurant as ate out every day, we just used the hotel as a base to sleep , nice friendly staff, luggage storage area and the guys who work that are lovely, the only grumble and this is slight was that there are only 2 lifts to service the whole hotel so you can be waiting a while for one,. If i was to visit ny again i would stay here

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: There is nothing particularly special about this hotel, but it was a pleasant stay, especially at a nightly rate< $200. The location is great, close walking distance to downtown sights, with close proximity to a few subway stations for trains to uptown and Brooklyn. The front desk staff were also helpful. The hotel room was a bit dated, but did not find it too small ( for NYC) but the lifts can be a tight fit, and the halls are narrow, if this matters to you. I had a high (41st)floor room at the back with a semi view of the East Rivers. I did not have to wait long for the lift, likely due to being on a high floor. The only issue I had was not getting hot water in the shower, but it was just once, early on the morning I was checking out so was not a big problem for me.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Room was small. We had long waits for the elevators every time. The AC in our room was not working right, maintenance had to come work on it every day that we were there. Never really got fixed so we were either freezing cold or sweating hot. On the Positive side, we a had a beautiful view of the One World building and were close to transportation options. Bell men were all Very friendly and helpful. If we didn't have such a bad experience with the comfort of our room I would have been able to give 4 stars.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If your business takes you to very end of Manhattan in the financial and legal center, you might want to consider the DoubleTree by Hilton on Stone Street in NYC. It has fine help and they try hard but the rooms are average and the Antinori Bar/Restaurant is OK. Plenty of other restaurants around the area that are most likely better.So, this hotel is certainly a safe place and will provide a room for you but just not very special or differentiated in a City that invented the work "differentiated."

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Enjoyable stay in a nice, clean hotel. Room was a good size, with all the ammenities and was cleaned thoroughly on a daily basis. The bed was huge & extremely comfortable. Facilities in the room are just perfect. Hotel is located in a great area, close to several subway stations so access to everywhere is easy. Staff were very helpful & friendly.We stayed on the 26th floor - we did have to wait for the elevators but for no more than 5 minutes each time & we could berely hear the construction on the building across the road. We did have a few broken objects in the room, e.g. Pull for curtain, heater blowing only cold air (which was fixed during our stay), heater cover, which were unexpected but did not effect our stay.We stayed for 7 nights, all but 1 night was peacefully quiet. We had a door to an adjoining room, for 1 night the guests in that room were inappropriately noisy, luckily it was just for 1 night.Overall a great stay & would consider staying here again should we return to New York.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a old Hilton hotel, the rooms are small, the elevators are sooooo slow. The staff is pleasant, and they attempt to be helpful. What you pay for what you get is really out of sync. Did I say how small this room is????

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for a week in november 2016 at a price of USD 130 per night for a double room sleeping 2. Its a pretty average slightly old hotel in a good location on southern Manhattan in New York City. No trouble at all checking in and out. The rooms were a bit old fashioned but contained the basics with shower, TV and kettle. Rooms were also reasonably clean and not too old fashioned. We never tried the restaurant and the 1 floor fitness centre but at least it was present :)One significant negative was very long waits for elevators, around 10 o'clock it could be as much as 15 mins to wait and the hotel is 50 storys tall so taking the stairs isnt a real alternative. If you want a hotel room to just sleep in at southern Manhattan this is a decent choice. A good choice if you get in and out at different times than most people.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel needs to be refurbished. Waiting time for an elevator sometimes more than 15 minutes. Staff not well trained. The Italian Restaurant is terrible and overpriced. Security is questionable. This is the worst Doubletree I have ever stayed in.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My friend and I recently stayed here for one night and had a wonderful time. The staff was very friendly and the room was very nice, although a little small. We had a King Size bed and it was big and comfortable but the room was a little cramped. The area was great. There was a great tavern across the street with great music and delicious food. The only issues is how far away it was from times square. It was about a half hour cab ride so going back and forth was a little expensive. But we honestly would have been fine to stay in the area, there is always something to do in nyc. Just a heads up, the lobby area is a little cramped. As soon as you get off the elevator you're looking at the lounge area and the couch is inches from you. But overall I highly recommend this hotel. One of the best stays in nyc.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We travel to NYC from Alabama about twice a year and stay in different locations each time. We were able to get a great deal on this hotel through Expedia and it did not disappoint. It is near the R, W, 1 and 4 Subways... each were easy to get to, however, the ride to most popular places was a little longer because you are all the way downtown. (It is located near the Wall Street Bull) One of the recent reviews said the elevator wait was an issue, but we didn't have any problems with it, only waited made a minute once or twice and we were there over Thanksgiving Holiday. The room and bathroom were very nice and there was plenty of hot water and the bed was extremely comfortable.The guys at the entrance are very friendly and helpful with keeping your bags and helping with transportation etc.The only complaint I have is there was a self-service snack bar. The self-serve part wasn't the problem, it was that there were very few choices... there were Doritos, Snickers, M&Ms and Reese Cups... and a cooler with drinks. You pick it out and scan each item and pay via a computer-like machine. I would have preferred a few more choices other than candy and chips.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Overall a decent Double Tree, great location. There were a few things which were sub par - Firstly - the elevators - I understand it was an extremely busy period so I could let this fly - but waiting over 10 minutes for an elevator? Also - there is no Hilton branded breakfast room - instead it's located within a private restaurant - the service was sub par and as a HHonors Silver member I would expect the breakfast to be complimentary. Since there was no space to sit in the tiny room I requested breakfast to go - I was given a tiny foil container which could barely fit 2 croissants at best! And to believe I was going to be charged for this?? I gave up in the end and just went to the Starbucks around the corner.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: First:After arriving at the hotel at 10.00pm and being told that our room was no longer available we were told to stay in a substandard room with no compensation whatsoever. After getting to the room we were surprised to discover this bed was a king single (which is a boarder line joke for two people to stay in) I rang up the front desk to ask if there was a room with anything bigger and after being on hold for 2min we were given a room with a king size bed as per our original reservation. I understand the explanation given to us why rooms are given up if guests don't arrive until after 6pm (to basically make sure you can always have your hotels beds full even though you don't seem to care if you honor your reservations into what room size they paid for). Upon having a shower in our new room we were surprised to find it flooded the bathroom and after complaints to the front desk over several days no action or compensation was offered so every time we had a shower the bathroom was flooded it was slippery to a point of dangerous and we constantly had wet towels to clean up the water. Questions:How can it be possible that over a period of around 7mins at 10.00pm our original reservation can go from not available to available??Secondly if the room is available why is it up to the customer to ring front desk and ask for our original reservation to be honored??Thirdly why was no compensation offered by the front desk - surely you would agree that a king single bed is deplorable to offer to two guests?? Is it standard operating procedures for the Hilton to provide showers that flood the bathroom every time it is used OR were we given a room that was actually defunct and should have not been given provided to a guests due to the danger of slipping and electrical shock exasperated by the water leaking into the bathroom. Room number was 4109. NEXT COMPLAINT:While we were checking in we were not asked to provide the details of the credit card we had booked the room under - however we did provide the details of a traveler card which we were told was not acceptable (even though money was here to provide any sort of deposit they hotel wanted.The credit card we booked the room under was actually a family members of ours and when we wanted to double check the details of the billing to do the differences in currency we were told to provide physical evidence of the credit card and after not accepting any other cards (which we had 3 debit/debit credit/traveler credit cards) I was forced to walk in the freezing cold to get $250 cash for the front desk and terribly rude manager until our family member could photo copy the credit card and paper work approving the use of this card.Messages were constantly left on our room phone by the front desk until the details were provided and it was a full 12 hours after the confirmation was emailed to hotel staff before we could get our cash ransom back which us the guest had to initiate conversations with the staff to get back. This all could have been avoided if 1) the staff member did their job when we checked in and 2) the hotel accepted any other card we offered when we checked in and when we were forced to leave a cash ransom.FINALLYUpon leaving the hotel they charged us for the room BUT DID NOT CHARGE THE CREDIT CARD WE WERE FORCED TO RUN AROUND GETTING APPROVAL FROM OUR FAMILY MEMBER BUT INSTEAD THEY CHARGED OUR TRAVELERS CARD!MY QUESTION IS WHAT WAS THE POINT OF MAKING A GUEST RUN AROUND FOR 2 DAYS GETTING PAPERWORK DONE FOR THE HOTEL IF YOU ARE NOT GOING TO CHARGE THE CREDIT CARD EVEN THOUGH YOU ALREADY PLACED A HOLDING FEE??WHY WOULD YOU THEN NOT CHARGE THAT CARD AND INSTEAD CHARGE A COMPLETELY DIFFERENT CARD WHEN WE WERE TOLD THAT THE TRAVELERS CARD IS NOT ACCEPTABLE AS A DEPOSITI have stay at hostels in morocco for $2.00 per night that had FAR better service than this pathetic excuse for a hotelThis hotel and its staff have ruined my partner and I's experience of New York which was a once in a lifetime for us due to their complete inability to follow their own rooms, provide simple service and constantly hassle us for moneyI expect a full refund for the stress provided to my partner and I, plus I expect an apology from general manager

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: this was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. From the entrance to the staff that wasn't there to the restaurant, etc. The only positive thing I can say is that the guys on the ground floor were very helpful in getting transportation.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Weekend of thanksgiving 2016. The staff was proficient at their jobs, friendly and the cookies at check in were great. The women checking us in, while very friendly, could slow down while talking as some of us are not that adept at understanding English with a strong Spanish accent, I'm sure I missed some of what they said. The lobby is on the 2nd floor. The ice machine on the 10th floor was not operational. The hallways and the rooms are smallish since it's NY. The rooms are reasonably clean. Larger shower head but mildew on the tile grouting, somehow the shower door leaked. Small bathroom sink with no counter. No view. No mini fridge but did have a safe. Great location at the tip of Manhattan. Location was good for the money but I expected more from the room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Bathroom floods because shower door doesn't close. 45 min and 3 phone calls for a shower cap that never came. no bottled water on room. three elevators with a lobby On level 2 for 44 floors. wait times ridiculous for the elevator. Small pillows. 23 degrees and below ac turns on 23 and up heating but suffocates you at night as its too hot. location is good otherwise not much to say about. oh and no fridge. bathroom vent disgusting with dust and coffee for 2 ppl with 2 milks and a coffee machine that leaks hot water.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We were in this hotel the thanksgiving week. The best of the hotel is the location as it's located in the financial area close to the Statue of Liberty, Wall Street and the Staten Island ferry as well as good subway connections.It is true what people comment about the elevators; there are only three for like 50 floors. Although they are fast, they do a lot of stops which makes it very slow.The room was ok, a bit small but with a king size bed. The WiFi worked properly.The staff was ok, they welcomed us with a cookie when we check in. The room was cleaned everyday. However there is a very negative point in my experience as one day we did not have any shower towel nor dirty nor clean. Also that day we didn't have coffee and the first thing I do in the morning is prepare some coffee. I think that fact is not acceptable in a hotel with the Hilton brand in his name. In the room there was a iHome but it was very old only available for old iPhones so we couldn't use it.Apart from this everything was ok and we spend a good holiday week.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very pleased with our stay this past weekend. The hotel was very clean, and the staff was very friendly. We enjoyed the location it is very close to Ground Zero and The Statue of Liberty Tours. Many great food choices are close by.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: There are plenty subway stations around the hotel so getting anywhere in New York is quite easy. The hotel is also a few minutes walk from the ferry and WTC memorial so location is great. The hotel lifts weren't nearly as bad as some of the other reviewers suggested. We waited 5 minutes at most but generally didn't wait much at all. The room was small, but it's New York and this is standard.Staff were friendly and except for a leak at the shower base we didn't have any complaints.
user_name:
Greg W
Cape Town, South Africa

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. After seeing reviews I was worried , but we had a great stay. Awesome price, very clean and no problems. I would recommend to family and friends! Nice, quiet location but close to good restaurants and a few key sites to see!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: There are several problems with this hotel.1. We arrived there when it was freezing at night. There is a heating system that is air conditioning kind. The room have very bad insulation, as soon as the heating stops, the cold penetrates in the room and the machine top gets very cold. So soon after the room has reached the temperature you want, you feel cold air coming and soon the machine starts again and it is very noisy, Very hard to sleep with the noise. 2. The bed is large but short. I have never seen this in the US. I am 6" height but my feet were reaching the bed bottom.3.There are only 3 elevators for a buliding of 43 floors with many rooms on each floor. In the morning you have to wait a very very very long time. The elevators are crowded and if you are on the lower floors they get full and you have to wait for the next one. Moreover, once the elevator got stuck and we waited for staff to fix it.4. The service is OK but we did not get coffee refill.Last time we came to Manhattan, we went to the Hampton Inn 2 blocks away anf it was much better value for money.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Check in girls have a major attitude problem. I didn't like it much the room was good and the area was good and they also said I would have a refrigerator and I didn't I had to cool my milk by leaving the window open and had to keep the heat on the stay warm.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I spotted some seriously negative on-line reviews shortly before our scheduled arrival which sent us into a panic. We came prepared, & were very watchful. Had a 3 night stay with no problems whatsoever. Nice linens, towels, toiletries. The room was tight but for the price and NYC real estate, that's hardly surprising..... Elevator waits were minimal. My co-traveler was impressed by the fitness room. The location is well served by the subway.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Overall a good stay in the Financial District. Poor lighting and very tight room space. Great hospitality, service, and attention. They are very personable and accommodating. Dealt with Tina, Helena, and Tony. They were friendly and it's always nice to be greeted and conversate. The security downstairs as well looked like they enjoyed their jobs because it probably has to do with good management. On another note, it does take the elevators a lengthy time to arrive... I get it. We're in NYC and I'm a native New Yorker but one cannot blame the hotel elevators and their speed for their local code. It's a highly populated area and a nice one as well. Being on the 40th floor the sound proofing was quite established and I did enjoy my stay. The lovely decor and furnishing made up for the small rooms and tight space of the bathroom. I would surely return and all the positives listed are reasons why I am a continued, loyal member of HHonors.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Nice high rise hotel for a great price in nice FiDi neighborhood. Close to Bowling Green subway stop.People at the hotel are friendly and accommodating. My only disappointment was there was no complementary coffee in the lobby.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Had a business trip and stayed here for a conference. Lobby and rooms are updated and made for a quiet evening's sleep.Elevators are slow (to be expected in NYC) and crowded in the AM hours.10-15 minute wait is common to get down.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location in the heart of financial district, but my room on the 20th floor was not well looked after, looked and felt old and tired. Some problems were easily fixable - burnt out bulb, but others were more challenging - moldy shower, leaky shower door leading to bathroom flooding

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was there for 8 days and it felt like home from beginning to end. I brought my own electric tea pot and internet source as backups. I was in the room working 15 hours not including sleeping each day and I was comfortable, warm and felt safe. I have never stayed in a DoubleTree before but will from now on.
user_name:
david f
Clifton Park, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: It was fine to sleep. Definitely within walking distance of Battery Park, Wall Street, 9/11 and the subway. The elevators are HORRIBLE.... plan an extra 10 minutes just to get one to pick you up on your floor. As in any old building in NYC the hallways are narrow and the rooms/bathrooms are small

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel definitely not to recommend despite acceptable location. Reservation of junior suite for 3-night stay and late arrival via internet was not accepted or recognized at all - only very tiny bedroom was available - no excuses or anything else was accepted by service personnel. Change of room was only possible after massive intervention. Very slow and des interested support for room change. Offered Junior suite in 4th floor had after entering unfortunately been proven to be nearly unacceptable, is for massive construction work on the neighborhood woke us up at 6:00 in the morning - every morning!Even having a HHonors membership did not help to find acceptable normally used to treatment in this premises.Never ever again! Unacceptable customer focus!Breakfast buffet also on the low side of offerings. Unfriendly service personnel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Every day we had to remind the cleaning staff that we were three people in the room as they kept setting up the room only for two people... and trust me it is not nice to have to go EVERY SINGLE DAY to the reception (40 floors with a busy lift - as the phone in the room wasn't working) and queue to speak to the only person in a busy reception just to ask for towels!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel was in a good location, but did not provide enough rooms for us at check-in, resulting in our late preparation and departure of a Broadway Show and lots of confusion due to the varied times of check in for our group. Cold air came from the heater no matter what temp it was set at. The elevators were so slow and so small it created a HUGE problem! Breakfast buffet was not worth $20 plus 18% gratuity. The only thing we really liked was the shower. Great water pressure and plenty of hot water. I don't recommend this hotel, especially to a large group.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We had to stay in New York for an extra 4 nights due to hurricane Matthew preventing us from flying down to Florida. We chose this hotel for our final two extra nights, moving from mid town.The view from our very comfortable and large room on the 41st floor was breathtaking. An amazing view of the new World Trade Centre tower.That view was worth the entrance fee alone.We spent lots of time just staring out the window at that tower. But when we weren't partaking of 'tower staring' we were out exploring the areas bars and restaurants. There was a great eat-in deli just around the corner called Essen which was amazing.As for this hotel. The room we had was the best out of the three we stayed at while in New York. Besides the view, the room was unexpectedly big with a great walk-in shower and an extremely comfortable bed. But as many have already said, the lift situation in this hotel is completely inadequate for a hotel with this many floors and rooms.I came out of the gym one morning, which is small but okay, situated on the 3rd floor. Instead of waiting for the lift up to the 41st floor, I decided to run up the stairs. I was amazed to find quite a few people coming from the lower floors (4 to about 15) with their suitcases down to check-out of the hotel. I stopped and asked one man why he wasn't waiting for the lift. He told me he had been waiting for half an hour at the 12th floor and whenever the lift door opened, it was packed tighter than a rugby scrum - dangerously overcrowded with no chance of getting in with his suit cases. So please bear this in mind if you go there. The hotel could solve this problem by installing another two lift shafts but they would have to lose quite a number of rooms to do this, and in this day and age of money-making, I can't see mr Hilton doing such a thing.If it wasn't for the lack of lifts, I would have given this hotel a five-star rating simply for the location and the views. Someone mentioned in a review about poor sound-proofing in this hotel. I think that goes for the rooms, too, as one afternoon while walking back to our room, we could clearly hear a couple who sounded as if they were having 'a really good time - a very loud 'really good time.' Ah, the joys of youth, hey. Well, we assumed they were young, and good on them, I say.So come on - mr Hilton - drop a few more lifts into this hotel, it deserves it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel is dated and dingy and the carpet needs vacuumed. I tried to call down to reception but the two phones in the room don't work and the main line I called from my cell only takes reservation, everything else is and endless loop. Now I find the outlets and lights next to the bed don't work. I asked for a room awway from the elevator and I got the room across from them. I didn't give the lowest score as I haven't seen a bug.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is in a great NY location, just off Wall Street. It's tall and thin and limited by the number of lifts, the floor space and the not very modern state of facilities. Outside there's always noise - it's New York - but soundproofing is pretty poor. In this situation the staff do a good job. Concierge and reception were helpful, the hotel is clean and the hotel manager was exceptionally helpful when I left something in my room that needed to be sent on to my next location. Service from Martin Owens was excellent.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Upon Check in , I received the keys to the King Room with River View numbered #4310After wayting about 10 minutes for 1 of the 3 elevators, I was lifted to the 43rd floor, to my room with a superb view to the Hudson River and a good acclimatization provided by an internal AC unit .The Room is less than 20 sq. meters, but OK , with a good walk-in shower in the small bathroom, and the smallest wall armoire I ever encountered at any Hotel, in Europe North and South Americas and Africa !...But this solution for a 3-4 stared Hotel is superbly located south to the very heart of the Financial District , quite next to the National Museum of the American Indian , in an area that almost makes you feel to be at Boston !Everything is near you : Subway to Mid Town, Battery Park, Coffee Shops and Restaurants, Pubs, Gardens ...The only problem with this Hilton Facility lies on its internal accessibility : Command for the 3 existing lifts is wrongly formatted : It should be Collective-Selective upon descent . As it is functioning, one has to endure several stops while going up and down, when such an inconvenience should happen only upon descents ! Further to this very uncomfortable reality (and quite physically near to it) lies what may (let's hope such a misfortune never happens...) be a trap for customers upon disaster : The emergency stairways !Such a dangerously narrow emergency stairs would never have an official approval upon licensing such a tall building for Hotel use or Offices !I sincerely hope that a fire never happens on any of the 44 Hotel floors of this Hilton Unit !

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: AVOID !!! I always thought double tree was a great hotel that cared about their guests but apparently not. First off the front desk employees were not completely trained and they were unaware of how to do regular check in procedure. The elevator wait times are incredibly long at least 10 minutes to go up or down. The staff is RUDE ! I called the "care line" to receive another remote after room service took mine and the lady gave me attitude and hung up on me! The night before that I called for an extra blanket and they told me that "they ran out"... how do you run out of blankets ?? The room service is a entire new level of rude. I was sleeping in very late and she barged in without any knock what so ever demanded what timeI left so she could clean. The cookies were old, the shower would randomly leak during the night and the rooms are SMALL. However its location is convenient for close tourist attractions. I spent over 1200$ for this room and I REGRET it .. try somewhere else if you would like good help. The only thing good about this hotel is an employee named FLODDY ! He was so helpful and kind. Truly the best thing about this dump. I was so upset and frustrated but his patience and kindness went a long way !

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Construction that surrounds the hotel is too noisy. Sound insulation of rooms is a also a problem, people are able to listen to talks in another room pretty clearly and you have to lower down your voice to avoid being heard. Elevators are small and slow. Even during the peak checkout time, 10am - 11am, the hotel scheduled a moving using the big service elevator, which cause the other two small guest elevators extremely crowded. We waited 30 minutes to get into the elevator and many people chose using stairs.
user_name:
Nan D
San Francisco, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: 3 elevators for a 44 floor hotel doesn't cut it. Sometimes the wait for them is long, and they're often full during rush hours. Staff was excellent. Be aware that there is major construction happening on the Stone St. side. I had a 4th floor to avoid the elevator problem, but the noise was unbearable. They start work around 6am. Make sure to get a room on the other side higher up. I moved to the 12th floor, facing the other side, and it wasn't bad.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If you need to stay in the financial district this is a nice hotel to stay at. I had a room on the 43rd floor with a nice view of the Hudson River. Room is small but that's standard for most NYC hotels. Shower is tight. If you were a very large person you might have an issue. Front desk was very nice and customer service driven. Breakfast buffet is standard....scrambled eggs, bacon sausage. Nothing special. For price paid its a good value hotel

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Customer service was very good along with the hot cookies . Room was very clean. I had a Hudson River view room. Everyday I came back my room was clean and stock. A king size bed room has enough space for 2 adults. It's good for the use of showers and sleeping. I would highly recommend.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good location, elevators always busy. Room kind of small and without a fridge. No heaters, only an air conditioning very noisy. Staff in the lobby not always ready to help, very disappointing. View from our room was very good, floor 43. Is not bad for that price.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good location and clean. staff helpful and friendly. elevators are terrible with only 4 elevators for the entire building of 45 floors.expect to wait 10-15 minutes to go up or down during morning hours and lunch hours.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Amazing customer service from Floddy. Was very friendly and fast at solving any problems I had. Although I was having a bad day managed to cheer me up with a cookie. Would definitely stay here again! Hotel looks nice and the location is great also

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Recently enjoyed our 4 day visit to 'The Big Apple' to attend a family wedding in Central Park - beautiful! Our stay at the DoubleTree in the Financial District was generally very good with an ideal location. The only disappointment was the quality of the buffet breakfast for such a large hotel chain in New York City. Love the city, but a word of caution, don't hesitate when exiting a New York City cab unless you want to hear horns blasting and cabbies jumping out of their cabs screaming at you before you have had a chance to get out, even if you are desperately trying to hurry to get a baby out of its carrier. I guess it's just the New York way! Anyway, great trip and look forward to returning some time soon.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good located hotel, few steps from subway entry. Nice clean rooms, not too small as other described. Standard rooms. What else as sleeping you want to do in hotel room? We never waited more than 3 minutes for elevator. There is 3 fast elevators. Awesome cookies at reception. Friendly staff. Unfortunately, there is a building development across the street, so noise begin at 7:00am to noon. Maybe will be better if you bring earplugs for sleeping. But i can only recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel was in a great location for Statue of Liberty, Wall Street, and 9-11 Memorial. Park right across the street was most convenient. Train stations near buy for easy access to all parts of city. Very good value for hotel in NYC.
user_name:
Daniel N
North ANDOVER, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Shower did not worked, room was extremely small and not like any other Hilton. The elevator takes forever, only two elevators available for more than 43 floors. Definitely don't recommend this hotel to anybody

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Quiet hotel in downtown location. Hotel was clean and all employees were super friendly. Subway station in basically across the street. Hotel was very quiet and rooms were spacious by NY standards. Not a lot of dining choices close.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: After reading the reviews I had prepared myself for the worst!!But the hotel was perfectly fine for our 4 night stay.We never had a problem with the elevators. We were on 33rd floor and perhaps it we just timed our descent well but We didn't have to wait! The room was spotless and it was cleaned and refreshed daily.The hotel layout is a little bit strange. Once you've checked in you don't need to venture near the reception until you check out. So it almost doesn't feel like a hotel. More like renting a room in a tower block. It would easily be possible to not see a staff member for the whole of your stay!!However, the staff we did meet were all friendly, helpful and happy to assist us.The location is brilliant. Its away from the busy tourist areas so when you go to one of the many bars, cafes or restaurants nearby you really feel that you're mixing with the locals. There are lots of subways nearby ( if we managed to figure out the subway system, anyone can!!) Brooklyn Bridge ( jet lag meant we walked it as the sun came up!!) Ground Zero, and the Statue of Liberty ferry are all within a few minutes walk.The hotel suited us perfectly. Its not 4 star though....If they rated it as 3 star I'm sure people wouldn't complain so much. The cookies were good too!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The stay was nice. Walking distance to Battery Park, to the World Trade Center Memorial and the subway has a couple stops close to the hotel. Several restaurants nearby. If you want a quiet stay after seeing the sites uptown, this works.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I booked this hotel for a business trip in October. I read the reviews and they were average so I agreed to stay. I must say, my experience was not good. The hotel was dirty. How dirty? The same paper and dirt that was in the hallway that was there on Wednesday when I checked in was still there on Friday afternoon when I checked out. The carpet in my room was sticky, my feet stuck to the ground. Traveling with a coworker, I went to her room and she complained of the same thing. I kept socks on the whole time. The bed was very comfortable, but on the last day I noticed spots of blood on the comforter. Had I noticed this on Wednesday, I would have checked out immediately. On a positive note, the staff was very nice and the location was good. If you choose to stay here, check cleanliness and remember your slippers.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel had small rooms. It was close to Battery Park, The Museum Of The American Indian and walking distance or short subway to The World Trade Center Memorial. The bed was comfortable we slept well. The best thing I love about this Hotel is the free Warm Chocolate Chip Cookies!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Old and not well maintained place, lots of broken things, a 'no' service attitude in general! Avoid this place at any cost!, Not worth the price! On top of this noisy as not well insulated. Still love big apple and will come back but never ever to this hotel

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Upon arrival, we were offered DOUBLETREE complimentary cookies, which was just one of the ways the staff went above and beyond. Everyday, we were greeted with a smile and friendly exchange, and the location of the hotel was perfect. We combined business (for which there's a dedicated centre on the 2nd floor) and leisure on our 5 day trip, and the close proximity of the subway stations to the hotel was perfect for exploring and getting the most out of our trip. Direct links to every borough was within walking distance of maybe 5 mins, and it was really close to Wall St, Staten Island Ferry and 9/11 Memorial Museum/ World Trade Centre. The room was fab, and was very spacious. Would highly reccommend to anyone whether for work or for sightseeing!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I do not recommend this hotel. The toilet was not well fixed on the bathroom floor, the heater was not working properly and the hotel didn't have extra blankets to provide us, the elevators are extremely slow (average wait time - 15 minutes). Moreover, the staff was not helpful or courteous, the location is not good for those interested in tourism, and the price charged per a (very small) room is not consistent with what the hotel should offer. I do not consider it a 4-star hotel, it seems more as a 3-star hotel. Avoid it whenever possible!!!
user_name:
Caroline N
São Paulo, São Paulo, Brazil

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I've stayed at much better places for the price. Room was in need of repairs and I'm also missing a sweater and can't get any response from housekeeping. Stayed at a DoubleTree in Philly the night before that was head over heels better than this one. Very disappointed.
user_name:
Rebecca B
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: No frills hotel. Best part of stay was bed was comfortable. The sink in bathroom is stylish but not functional. Lobby on 2nd floor not first. The hallways are so tight it feels clastraphobic. The bathroom has a sliding door on hinges but you can't close door completely because of the style.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Clean, very friendly and helpful front desk and valet staff. Stored bags and arranged transportation for us to train station and LaGuardia. Great service. Room was very nice and spacious (as it relates to NYC). Very convenient to our needed conference location, so a great place overall. 10 minute walk to Freedom Tower/9-11 Memorial. Nice hotel. Would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: . I chose the Double Tree Hotel on Stone street, just around the corner from my work location. It is the worst $350/night hotel I’ve ever been in. The rooms are very small, with barely enough space to walk around the bed. The desk is so narrow it cannot hold your laptop. The bathroom is the smallest I have ever seen, and had dirty grout. There is no room to put your own toiletries. The three elevators are very slow and always crowded, so it takes a long time to go up or down. The corridors are very narrow, and a laundry/trash cart was in mine for 3 days. It was there even after I alerted the staff. The walls are so thin, you can hear any conversation on the rooms next door. For two nights, I had cigarette smoke coming into my room from the room next door, even though this is a non-smoking hotel. When I alerted the front desk, I said I would like to move, but they said I could not as they were booked up. I had an opportunity to leave, so I left early. I will never stay there again. I have also lost any faith in Hilton.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is absolutely horrible with completely inept service on every level. My family and I just spend the weekend there and were plagued with so many problems you'd think we were writing a comedy. Here's a rundown of the problems we experienced over three days between three rooms:- elevators consistently took excruciatingly long to arrive and are always jam-packed;- inept front desk took more than half an hour to check-in;- we had to reprogram the key cards three times over the weekend;- after housekeeping completed cleaning, they left a room door wide open;- the battery in the door lock of another room died, so it was unlocked for several hours;- two of the showers leaked;- no hot water and had to wait almost an hour after two calls for someone to fix it;- no comforter for one of the beds, and none provide for a day after request for it;- filthy air conditioner;- TV signal comes in/out constantly;and the grand finale after we had complained and checked-out, of course....They charged our credit cards DOUBLE ("by accident" of course)I'm not a nit-picker by any stretch. None of the above is embellished for effect. I urge you to stay away at all costs. There are far better choices for hotels in downtown NYC.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is situated in the financial district and close to the Ferry and several restaurants. For lower Manhattan, it is one of the more affordable locations but still pricey for what you get. The elevator is a nightmare during high traffic times and the rooms very small. But with that said, the room was clean and comfortable. The hotel will hold your bags if your flight leaves later in the day and you have checked out. If you are just visiting Manhattan for the first time, stay in upper Manhattan and take the subway to lower Manhattan for the day to site see.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We and a number of family members stayed here this past week end. The good: location, price and comfortable bed. the BAD: the elevators were so crowded that you needed to wait excessively long times, especially going down. On Sunday morning, the stairwell was filled with people walking down (I walked from the 22nd floor). My Niece never got a blanket for her bed, we had to ask three times for extra pillows and another relative came back to their room at night and the door was open and unlocked. The halls always looked like they needed a vacuum. The water pitchers in the lobby were there but filled only once. It is really crowded in the entry.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Difficult to find entrance, narrow corridors, small rooms; no courtesy treatment for Diamond members; rooms, furniture, bathrooms are aged and not clean. Breakfast is served in a small Italian restaurant downstairs, disgusting buffet, lousy service. Big disappointment and with pricey room rates even at preferred corporate rates certainly much better deals around in the financial district.
user_name:
CKL0815
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is at a very convenient location, right at the financial center district. It's very convenient for business travel. The service was nice.However, the rooms are very small. This being Manhattan, I didn't exactly expect it to be roomy, but it was sufficiently small that it was hard to put down an ironing board. The bed was also very short, and I say this as a 5'9'' person. My feet was teetering on the edge of the mattress, so if you're 6 feet or above your leg would definitely go over the edge. I ended up having to sleep diagonally on the bed.The shower door leaks at the bottom, so when I stepped out the entire floor was wet. The hallways had bunch of carts and items left over by the service staff. The elevators were slow. Worst of all, I asked for a wake up call at 9AM, but the call was never made. Luckily I had already woken up by then myself.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: While the location was near subway stations, beautiful battery park and walking distance from the WTC, the hotel was below average. The elevator system was a complete mess. Three small elevators that are also used by the hotel housekeeping staff makes for a long trip. 23 minutes to get downstairs to be exact. Even from the 36th floor, you hear lots of noises down on the street (to be expected). My last comment is related to the carpet in my room, it was sticky all over and I didn't feel comfortable at all.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel has a great location if you want to be in lower Manhattan. Easy to walk to subway and bus lines. I had a view unexpectedly of One Observatory Tower out my 38th floor window which was a powerful sight. The elevators are awful - small, turtle slow, and often occupied by cleaning carts - so if you have to be somewhere on time, you will need to allow for a long wait. The registration desk is on the second floor, making the elevator situation even worse than it might otherwise be. There is also construction going on right across this narrow street right now so be sure to ask for a quiet room. The staff at the desk were friendly and helpful. The lobby is small and cramped. Avoid it if you can at peak check-in and checkout times. A parking lot is right across the street - $40 a night although I'm told this is not a bad price for NYC. Our room needed a deep cleaning of rugs and curtains but was relatively clean otherwise. It was an adventure trying to get the right quantity and type of towels.The shower leaked water on the bathroom floor every time despite efforts to avoid it, and the HVAC unit also leaked. Would I stay again? Probably if the price was better than I could get at nearby hotels, but I'd look around first. It's an old building so I understand many of the challenges but it's also worn and in need of rehabbing.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Nice place conveniently located in the financial district with excellent access to transportation and restaurants. Traveled to and from Brooklyn daily and had no issues. To access uptown and other areas was no problem with a subway station located at the head of the street. Staff was very friendly always eager to greet and conversate making you feel welcome. NYC is constantly under repair and the area had some late night street construction that was inconvenient, however I got sufficient rest.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel was really good. Sure the elevators were a bit slow at times, but nothing that ruined the day or anything. We stayed on the 33rd floor and never really had an issue with the elevators. I guess if you stay on a lower floor there is a possibility that the elevator would be full on the way down, but it was almost always empty when we got in on our floor to do down. When we were going up, it was the same thing. There were numerous times that it was too full on the way down and people had to wait, but if you can get a high floor, you can get a great view, and the elevator will be empty when it picks you up.The hotel was clean and we didn't see anything that was alarming as far as cleanliness. I am a gold member, so the breakfast buffet was free at the in house restaurant. It was what you would expect for a free breakfast. Nothing fancy but certainly worth the cost. I would not pay money for the breakfast buffet.The staff was friendly and courteous. Housekeeping was prompt and early and the room was cleaned quickly and efficiently. The room was not small by any standards and I had a great, though slightly obstructed, view of Brooklyn and the East River. The walls are thin and you can hear what's going on in the hallway pretty god, but turn the TV up a bit and it all fades away.It is less than a block from the Yellow line R and N subway. This line will take you right into Times Square all day and night or you can transfer and get a ride anywhere in Manhattan, Queens, Brooklyn, or the Bronx. The area itself was filled with many small cafes and shops. It was quiet on the weekend and not nearly as jammed as Times Square. Great hotel and great location. Well worth the cost of the room.Great for a no non-sense, business/professional type of stay that doubles as a rest site for a romantic weekend or a launch site for a crazy weekend out.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have to admit I was very worried after reading some of the recent horrific reviews. Don't worry. The place is fine. Yes the elevator situation needs to be rectified. I would factor that in when comparing properties with the same price point. The problem is there aren't enough elevators for that size building. The elevators are modern and work well but if you have to stop at several floors from 4 to 42 it takes a long time. Our room was a city view King bed. The room was fresh and clean. Very quiet both inside and no city noise outside. The bathroom seemed to be recently remodeled in the Euro style with a large walk in shower with glass doors. So much nicer than the old fashioned tub shower curtain combo many NYC hotels still have. Plenty of towels. The room size was more than adequate. It was square size so the desk was to the side and out of the way. Huge closet, bigger than many hotel rooms. The bed was very comfortable. The bedding was new and clean. The location is in the financial district but it's also a perfect location for a weekend getaway to NYC. So many restaurants around, some famous. A five minute walk to Battery Park. A very safe and quiet location, near World Trade Center but not too close that there are throngs of people around. There are also several subway lines that converge in the area so getting about is easy and quick. Bottom line, a great location, great Value, clean and quiet but the elevators take longer than other places. How many times a day do you use the elevators? Just factor in a few extra minutes and you won't be stressed out
user_name:
SusanD320
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is definitely pricy and less compelling if you don't have specific thing to do in downtown. Overall clean and provide relative comfort. Breakfast was limited and reminded Holiday inn old hotels. Mainly for business travelers or tourists that have no other options.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is in a great location just minutes from the WTC and Wall Street. It carries the Hilton name so I thought it would be a good place to stay for 1 night while catching a show off Broadway.Despite having a very nice room on the 40th floor overlooking the hudson, there were some issues with the room.Firstly, the sheets had holes in them and the bottom sheet was just resting on the mattress. No mattress protector or fitted sheet!Secondly, we hung the breakfast menu from our door as instructed with our selection for the following morning. The menu was never collected so we didn't have breakfast! I spoke to the front desk attendant upon checkout and she offered to have our breakfast served in the restaurant on the first floor, but by then we didn't feel like paying over $50 for breakfast. The moment had gone of having breakfast.One nice touch was upon arrival when we checked in, we were both given a welcome cookie.I don't think I would stay again despite the nice views and convenient location.
user_name:
David E
East Windsor, New Jersey

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was a nice hotel for a decent price. After I booked the room, I read some really bad reviews about the place. However, my room was clean and quiet on the 26 floor. It's near Wall Street and within walking distance of several restaurants, including a Starbucks, a steakhouse, a pub, Dunkin' Donuts, chipotle, potbelly as well as a drugstore. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I am a loyal Hilton customer and selected this Double Tree because it was close the site of a recent family wedding. The hotel is 42 stories and has only three small and old elevators. It also has no service elevator and thus guests compete for space with huge laundry carts, garbage cans, and cases of beer. Waits were huge to get an elevator and half the time they were full of people or stuff. Furthermore there was no security on the elevator requiring a room key to go up and the elevators were easily accessible from the street with the lobby on the second floor. We returned at 11 pm one night with nothing (not a person or technology) to stop anyone from going up the elevator. Two bulbs were burned out on our room and despite repeated requests they were not replaced during our three day stay. This place is not up to Hilton Double Tree standards.
user_name:
Dan A
