Ann Arbor, Michigan, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Dealing with the elevator was a nightmare...every time it was 10, 15, 20 minutes...when we complained the response was "we know"...everyone was complaining...thinking she was going to miss a shuttle to the wedding we were in town for, my daughter came down 10 flights of stairs in high heels. Going two flights up and down from entrance to lobby instead of wasting time waiting for the elevator carrying our luggage was not good on my knees and not something one should have to do at a hotel. There was trash in the 10th floor stairwell which is a fire hazard. The double flusher on the toilet in our bathroom was broken and hard to flush, no shampoo, room and bathroom tiny...only thing acceptable was that the bed was comfortable. The day before our arrival date I received a message as a Hilton Honors member, that I could pre-register and pick a room...big deal! First I couldn't figure out how to do it so I called the hotel number and got hung up on...when I did figure it out my only choices were rooms next to the elevator. There was only one time over the weekend that we saw more than one person at the desk and we had to wait and wait and the person was less than solicitous and we're still waiting for those famous cookies mentioned in your ads (least of our problems). So no, won't be going back and won't be recommending DoubleTree.
user_name:
Dorothy R
Reading, PA, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We couldn't wait to leave these cramped quarters. The waits for the elevator were extreme. The staff was terrific, and it was clean. Just extremely cramped. Spent extreme amounts of time waiting for the elevator. Was allowed to check out the night before, so saved on that congestion.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The room was fine but the hallways are very small and the rooms are very close together so it is noisy. The cleaning staff came around at ten a.m and we weren't ready for them to clean the room... and then they never came back. We tried to get extra pillows and it took the staff twenty five minutes to arrive: with one pillow. The time it took wasn't surprising as the three elevators in the 44 floor hotel were likely the slowest elevators in the State. It was a realistic four to eight minute wait regardless of the time of day. And other customers mentioned they were that slow last year too... so it's not a maintenance issue and unlikely to get better. But the location is great. Right in the heart of the lower financial district. Seconds from a great steakhouse (Nebraska) and a minute from the Stone Street pub district.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Online check-in and room selection was great. I also "pre ordered" extra towels and pillows to be in my room upon arrival. These items were not in my room and it took 3 calls to have them delivered and then they brought the wrong items. At this point it was 9:45 p.m. and we just wanted to go to sleep. But we couldn't because our shower leaked all over the bathroom floor and maintenance was there for aver 1/2 hour trying to fix it. When I took a shower the next day it still leaked all over the floor. The elevators were terrible and we waited almost 10 minutes on multiple occasions. There was construction right outside our room and the jack hammers started before 7:000 a.m. The staff could also use a course in customer service. They had no desire to help or listen to any of my concerns.
user_name:
Kimberly S
Cuyahoga Falls, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We were in this hotel for about 10 minutes before we asked that they cancel our reservation. Upon arriving, we told them that we were on our anniversary, and any special rooms would be greatly appreciated. We were tersely told that since we booked on Priceline that nothing was available. Once we got to our room we found it to be dirty. It was tidy,a s if housekeeping had been through recently, but there was dust on tables, smudges on doors and the pictures on the wall, gum wrappers on the floor and it just didn't feel sanitary. To the hotel's credit, when we told the manager about our issues they released us from our reservation and we were able to go to another hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: You can trust a DoubleTree Hilton. The check-in is efficient (warm chocolate chip cookie upon arrival is a nice touch). The staff is polite. The facility is clean. The elevators are admittedly slow and there are only 3 of them. We were on floor 17, there may be 30 floors. So remember this if you are pressed for time. A parking garage is right across the street. Stone Street is very small. It's a bit of a challenging drive due to the one-way streets. We were in town for a wedding and weren't interested in a "hotel experience". Our room was all business, slightly bare, but just want you need to get in and out which was just what we wanted. One thing I wish to note, the curtains in our room didn't close enough to fully darken the room at night. The dim that shone in from the outside bothered me. Other than that, this is a fine place to lay your head for a night or two!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Poor service on my visit on 10/7/16 - 10/9/16. I was on NYC for my daughter's wedding and was traveling with my wife and parents. Checking in was fiasco. I had called on 10/6 and asked for an early check in so that we would have time to change and make the rehearsal at 5:00. The person I spoke with assured me that arriving at 1:30 would be fine. We arrived around 1:00, two rooms together were not available, the desk told me to have lunch and come back at 2:00. We returned at 2:15, the rooms were not available. Checked back at 2:45, still no rooms. As I waited at the desk, other guests had similar issues. We got rooms at 3:15, not together. I expressed my frustration to the manager. She said she understood and would reach back to me. That was the last I heard from the manager. We had to scramble to change and make the rehearsal through Friday afternoon traffic.The next day, we went out in the morning, returned at 1:00 PM to find our rooms not yet made up. My parents got done after we left for the wedding (3:00). We chose to leave the come back later sign on our door - no point in having the room serviced that late.Sunday morning, it was raining. We needed to hunt down a bellman to call for our car. The car was delivered, the bellman disappeared. I loaded my car in the rain and we helped my parents into the car. The bellman did show up to roll the empty cart into the hotel. The rooms are small, but that is NYC. The bed was comfortable. The service was dismal. Long on promises - short on delivery.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Small elevators and not enough for 42 floors!!! I had a 30 minute wait and ride down- stopping on every floor and people jamming to get in!!!! I am not making this up-- I do NOT recommend this hotel!!!! Small rooms-- only good part was location to Fraunces Tavern and Stone street.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel needs a big revamp. The biggest issue is they do not have enough elevators to deal with customer traffic. I spent hours trying to get into/out of the hotel and the lobby is on the 2nd floor. Unpleasant experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We know New York hotel rooms, so were bracing ourselves for the usual tiny cramped room. But our room was pleasantly roomy (unlike what other reviewers said -- maybe we just got lucky? )-- with even enough open floor space to stretch out and do yoga exercise in the morning. The location, at the very bottom of Manhattan, near the Staten Island ferry terminal, is very convenient, as so many subway lines from all over Manhattan and other boroughs converge down there. It's very quiet at night (unlike a lot of mid-town locations). There are LOTS of inexpensive restaurants (on Stone and Pearl streets), and retail places to buy wine and ready-made take-away meals. The Essen food mart around the corner is open 24/7 -- very fresh healthy food in steam trays, salad bars (very reasonably priced by weight) or made to order from a grill. Vast selection of breakfast pastries (tho the pain chocolat is gone by 8 am -- and the fresh food selection becomes limited after 9 pm). As for negatives: the elevators are unbelievably slow, so it's good to be on a lower floor, so we can walk up and down. The AC was loud, so bring ear-plugs. Beds were very comfy.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Our stay could have been better - but the property is in the midst of revamping itself. 2 staff members in particular were FABULOUS!! One was our bellman, Allen Ho, who was just pleasant and kind in the most sincere way. He greeted us every time we saw him with general conversation about our day, and was just an overall lovely man. I expect at some point, that he will be training other bellman. The 2nd is James Faughnan, the Asst. Front Officer Manager. Genuinely kind, personable, and went out of his way to attend to our needs. Amazing 2 staff members that we won't forget!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The room was fine, but the front desk was very understaffed both at check in and check out. Elevators slower than any I have ever seen. Waited 5 minutes or more many times, sometimes to find them full when they arrived. Never have seen anything like it / so bad. So if you go stay on the 4th floor, then it's only three flights of stairs from the street.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel staff was very helpful and nice, Location was great. Easy access to everything. Clean, quiet room. The Internet access was perfect to complete my work and prepare for my meetings the next day.
user_name:
Jill B
Texas Gulf Coast, Texas

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is an okay hotel. Like most New York City hotels, the rooms are small. The upside is the walls are not completely paper thin so it is RELATIVELY quiet. There are a number of slightly more affordable parking lots nearby and the location is really great. Not touristy, but also close to the 2,3,4,5 and R trains for ease of access to a majority of the city. Service is pretty good, too.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Worst Hilton-portfolio hotel I've ever stayed in. The front desk is severely understaffed and there were long waits at check-in and check-out because there was one attendant and he was also handling the phone lines - including responding to phone calls from hotel guests who were angry because they had to wait 20 minutes for someone to answer the phone. The bathroom shower leaked all over the tile floor, with water running outside the bathroom and creating a slip hazard. There are only 3 elevators for all 40+ floors, creating routine 10-15 minute waits for an elevator. I often walked down 23 flights of stairs (where I encountered many other guests who were doing the same thing). The hotel is a complete embarrassment and either needs a complete overhaul or it should be closed.
user_name:
Ross L
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Location is great with regards to accessing everything that i cam to Manhattan for. Room a little small, gym very basic, elevators take forever and sometimes dont work. But Allen made my stay worthwhile. Very friendly and knowledgeable about the hotel and the area

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here while attending a wedding. Given that the hotel is in Manhattan, the hotel was a good value. The room was small, but it was clean. I checked in on line and was able to choose the room I wanted, which was helpful. But those elevators! There were only three small elevators serving a 44- story building, and there were no service elevators. Half the time when an elevator finally arrived, it was already full, usually with hotel staff. Depending on time of day, it could take at least 15 minutes to get to or from our room.We tried having breakfast in the restaurant one morning. That was enough. The restaurant was woefully understaffed. It took 30 minutes and four visits into the main dining room to get coffee and water. The chafing dishes were perpetually empty even though the staff was working at full speed to keep them filled. The buffet was set up in a crowded corner so that we couldn't get out of our chairs to get into line to get food while it was available. We would have ordered from the menu if we had been able to flag down someone to take our order. The next day we were checking out early, so we ordered coffee from room service (the night before) to arrive between 6:30 and 7. At 7:50 we tried calling room service to cancel, but nobody picked up. We called the front desk and eventually got someone to pick up the phone. We cancelled the order. We were not charged for the coffee.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The layout of the hotel is odd. The view from the 43rd floor is magnificent ; you can the buildings including one. The front desk is on the second floor. The bathrooms have almost zero counter space. The bathroom has no where to hang your towel - not even the hook that all bathrooms have behind the door. The rest was good. The room was cleaned to standard every day; the check-in was hassle free. It's close to the metro stops but it feels very impersonal. I recommend it more for business trips than personal ones. Try to choose a room on the lower Floors because the wait for the elevator is ridiculous! And there are a total of 4 elevators.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is not worth near the money they charge. The room was tiny and I have stayed another Manhattan hotels before so I have a comparison. Plus a light didn't work in the room the sink in the bathroom was backing up and the sink was definitely not clean and the amount of dust on the back of the hairdryer was disgusting. Told the front desk of the issues and they did nothing. Will find another hotel chain to stay at next time.
user_name:
triptakers84
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is in the perfect area in New York. It's called Financial district and in all streets around are the most important subway stations to reach every point in NYC. The hotel itself is small and the rooms are small too. There was no minibar and a very annoying big old AC in the room, what made it impossible to sleep at night. They don't have a central AC, just this old ones on the window. Also at check In there was no staff which wanted to help us with our luggage so that we carried by ourself to the room. For the Name of the Hotel and the price per night its in my eyes incomprehensible!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Second time stayed here, says a lot about good quality+service+location - will stay again. Rates good for NYC Acess to subways etc are great - many restaurants within walking distance. Entry a little strange, beyond that had a good stay!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: So...you come to a hotel with clothes and you expect those clothes to come home with you right? Well, I laid some clothes out under the desk on top of a garbage bin and they were thrown out. I thought, okay, this is on me, even though they were laid out perfectly because the room is the size of a shoe-box and I had no where else to put them, since they were on top of the garbage, maybe the staff thought they WERE garbage. Next day, I put a shopping bag of clothes on the floor before leaving. When I get back, guess what, bag is gone!!!! Vanetta and team felt really bad about this and are trying to make this right but this is so strange. Why would someone throw out clothes?!?

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stay here occasionally on business while in the financial district. The price is moderate for New York. The rooms are very small but clean. The staff is friendly and accommodating. When I was checking in late at night there was a person with me who's room was not ready. The hotel gave the guy 5000 points for his trouble !!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 1 week. We liked this relatively quiet location just a few minutes walking from Battery Park, Brooklyn Bridge, Wall Street and World Trade Center. We had our room on the 36th floor with the view to One World Trade Center and that was really nice. Hotel room was large enough, king size bed with 4 pillows was fine for both of us. Toillet with with shower was clean. Room was cleaned everyday, we had no complaints. Check-in and check-out was fast, receptionists were all smile and polite. There was no problem with the hotel lifts, sometimes we had to wait a few minutes longer - especially in rush hours, but that was still OK. In the close neighborhood of the hotel, you can find lot of restaurants and bistros. That was our first trip to New York, and I was happy that I chose this hotel. My first idea was accomodation in Midtown Manhattan close to Times Square where it is very noisy, as I recognised later. If you would like relatively quiet location, it si better to stay in Financial District. You can reach Midtown Manhattan from the Double Tree Hotel easily by Subway line R (from Whitehall St). We would really recommend this hotel if you want to spend one week in New York.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed at this hotel two nights this past weekend. In town for a wedding at a nearby venue. The positives were location and very nice and helpful doormen. The parking situation was difficult at best and the front desk staff were not helpful at all. The hotel rooms are tiny as is the bathroom, which wasn't a huge issue but not expected for a doubletree. There weren't enough pillows or towels for the room and our room was never cleaned while we were there. The elevator situation as others have stated is abysmal! Thank goodness we read the trip advisor reviews and requested a room on a lower floor and were given a room on the sixth floor. We used the stairs often and were glad we sacrificed the view. I would not stay at this hotel again, but would stay in the area again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel has a great location right in the heart of the financial district that makes it easy to get where you want to go. The surrounding area feels very safe, even when you're coming back later at night. The hotel itself is fine and in line with my expectations for the DoubleTree brand. The rooms are a bit small, which is to be expected in NYC, but modern, clean and updated. The staff is very friendly and personable, but I found they were completely overwhelmed during rush periods and maybe needed another person or two at the front desk to assist guests. The elevators do take an extremely long time, so plan accordingly, however, the longest I waited was about 10 minutes during rush/busy times (7-9am and 5-7pm). I would stay again - this hotel is a good value for the money and in a great location which are super important to this traveler!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is tucked away on Stone Street in the jumble of streets down in the Financial District. Clean, comfortable and close to subways. You can get to any part of Manhattan in just a few minutes. Great rates for NYC and god value. The bathroom is a touch small, but aren't they all in NY? The restaurant is awesome.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Access to subways and MTA is 3 buildings away on same street is the best part. Getting a metro senior pass was easy. Hotel is in heart of financial district, so easy ride to Statue of Liberty and Native American Museum up the street is worth visiting. Wanted to go to the first federal building in NYC but didn't have time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: 1. Rooms are Ok, the elevator takes forever (Imagine waiting half an hour for the elevator)....2. Don't expect too much for Hilton Diamond membership or whatever you have....(They don't have much rooms to upgrade you though, even Hampton Inn have better room choices)3. Noisy, crowded, the management needs to improved.4. There are certainly a lot more good options in Fidi. High end properties like Conrad or Andaz. Millenium is also good. Hampton Inn is cheaper and actually way much better than Doubletree. If you are on a budget, pick Hampton Inn, but not here.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Nothing that I expect from Double Tree. So few elevators for the size of property. You could wait 1/2 to full hour for elevator, and miss your appointments. Check in and out n second floor is extremely inconvenient, with slow or non existent elevators or any other porter help to lug the baggage by stairs.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location in Manhattan. Close to museums and transportation. Hotel service was excellent. Staff was friendly and helpful, offering assistance with baggage and elevator access. Value for NYC was better than most.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was not a terrible experience, but it did not live up to the quality of a 4-star hotel. The lobby, hallways, and elevators were not air conditioned on a muggy, 80-degree day. Our room was missing hand soap and an alarm clock. The shower water pressure was very low. All the pillows were down-stuffed (not great for allergies). There was a used room service tray in the hallway all evening from 8pm and was still there when we left at 11am. The room was clean and comfortable and we had zero issues with noise, but it did not have the service level or quality of a 4-star hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good luck trying to find a parking valet or bellman accessible. Check in is on 2nd floor and understaffed. Elevators are so slow and ridiculously crowed with people and luggage. Not at all what you would expect at a Doubletree. Find a different hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Let me start by saying that we chose this hotel because of proximity to my wife's office and price. On line the hotel looked great so we had hope. When we checked in Saturday we were greeted by an energetic and friendly gentleman at the front desk who presented us with two bottles of water and two warm chocolate chip cookies.These were the high points. When I inquired about an upgrade we told that the hotel was sold out and no upgrade was available, even though I am Hilton Gold. As a consolation I was told that WiFi was free. Like, WOW. In place of points we opted for coupons for a complimentary breakfast buffet. So we took our key and headed to the elevators for the trip up to our 34th floor room. What felt like an endless wait the elevator finally arrived. The room was clean and well appointed but compact even by NYC standards. The bathroom could not be smaller and had no place for a toiletries bag, good thing the bed was in easy reach. The bed was comfortable but the TV was small. Breakfast in the morning was served in a restaurant on street level. The food was ok but the layout of the buffet was a bit weird and the staff was running around like it was their first breakfast service ever. After our initial greeting at check-in it appeared that the hotel staff was overwhelmed and poorly directed/managed (we are both managers so we notice these things). We were glad we were on a high floor (don't expect amazing views) because people on lower floors could not get on the elevators because of crowding (think Lexington Avenue line during morning rush hour) . Oh, and did I mention the elevators are slow? Plan ahead and give yourself an extra 5-10 minutes to get down stairs (or you can use the stairs that give you access for all floors). Would we stay here again? Probably not unless it was amazingly cheap or we were comped.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My wife and I had 4 nights in a row where we were unable to sleep due to a phone constantly ringing in our room at night. The hotel management were aware of the problem, from before we checked in, but did not inform us (a maid told me). I was on the first day assured that the problem would be fixed few hours after check in.It took them 4 nights (5 days) to fix it, and I was told that I should accept it or be asked to leave the hotel, as it is fully booked.So if you expect service, because of the name, forget it. They are quite mean and threatening. Not recommendable to talk to them. They threatened me to kick me and my pregnant wife out of the hotel, if we complained about the fact that we payed for 4 nights that we got no sleep.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel would be fine, but it is impossible during peak hours to get an elevator in under 15 minutes. P There is a long line, and people on lower floors often resort to walking down rather than deal with the excessive waiting. Also issues with getting hot water on higher floors.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stood 2 Nights at the hotel, while NYC had to welcome the UN general assembly.... prices for those times jump up tremendously: for my tiny little room a had to pay more that 250 USD. But I could have booked the Waldorf for 705 USD/night... I loved the room 3808 with "city view"; this was a view to Hudson Bay between much higher rising buildings. Funny to see the hotel in the mirror of a building next to it! Coffee equipment is there bathroom is clean and perfect. I like to point out that the hotelIs about 50 meters from the Whitehall metro station which gives access to the "R - train", and other stations like ferry station. You are 20 Minutes away from w everything!!! Great place! Hope the prices will be a bit cheaper when there is no UN convention... recommend the place!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Fine, comfortable hotel way downtown. Elevators are slow, it's a tall building with just three elevators, but other than that, fine. Nice view from the higher floors. Dead Rabbit bar nearby. Blah, blah, blah, getting up to the 200 character minimum that this silly site requires. Is this enough?

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: There was a bit of confusion with the rooms booked, since we had several rooms for a wedding party, but in the end the staff worked it all out and we were taken care of. We enjoyed the weekend here, and would choose this hotel again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for 4 nights.The room was a comfortable size for a city centre hotel, with a decent bathroom, and flat screen TV. Wifi access was good, and ice machines were available on near by floors.As you may read in other reviews the lift (elevator) seems particularly slow, there were porters helping people to catch lifts most of the time, but I took advice from other tripadvisor members and checked in through the HiltonHonors app and chose a room on one of the lower floors, meaning I wasn't dependent on the speed of the lift.I stayed in Room 507, which was a little noisy with garbage collection on the street level.I had a very pleasant stay overall, and will likely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I am just back from a 5 night trip to this hotel with my husband. This was our first trip to NYC and we loved it. Hotel location is really good really nice area with good food and bars nearby it's also really near battery park which is nice. It's bit quieter and out of the rush bit of Times Square but still really easy to get up midtown only 15 mins on the subway which is right across from hotel. Great for getting to Statue of Liberty, Brooklyn bridge and the new world trade centre. Hotel was clean and nice, maid service always good. The front door staff always friendly when you arrived back and willing to help with anything too. Only issue as people have said is elevators. We requested a lower floor on arrival so that we could just walk up and down most of the time. Other than that everything great would defo recommend hotel to others visiting NYC.
user_name:
Stacey B
Glasgow, Scotland, United Kingdom

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is definitely not doubletree/ Hilton standard hotel, no air con, stifling heat, room small, bathroom small, don't eat in the restaurant, food disgusting and it's not cheap. Look somewhere else, I know rooms in New York are generally small. But at least have some decent air con. Staff are very helpful and polite.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My husband took me to the DoubleTree Hilton for my six year wedding anniversary. It was amazing! The moment we got to the Hilton (in the financial district) the staff was friendly and informative. They directed us to the front desk, who were welcoming and quick. There were rose petals on the bed and a gorgeous view of the water. I relaxed on a bed full of roses and rose petals enjoying the warm, tasty cookies the front desk presented me with upon arrival. It was memorable to say the least! We loved our stay and can't wait to go back!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The major attraction of the hotel is its central location. The room was rather small with very little leg room. Staff were generally responsive to requests. The waiting time for the lifts was irritatingly long.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: After waiting 10-15 minutes for a lift, I reached my stinking not room. The carpet was soaked through. The aircon was broken. The room stunk. I left and requested that these issues be fixed. I returned to sporadic aircon and floor that was merely damp. Returning from my day the following day of my stay, the floor was soaked again and the room was impossible to be in given the smell. I was told no rooms were available to relocate to. I also heard another couple complaining about the same thing. Unbelievable for a four star hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: By the time I got to the hotel I got a friendly gesture by Allen. He made me feel like home and everytime i stepped into or out of the hotel he always said something nice to me. That kind of staff is just amazing, and it spreads positive energy at the hotel. Much love to Allen!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was in a great location by some really cool bars and restaurants, but the hotel itself was not so great. The elevators are crazy and you have to wait a long time only for it to be full by the time it reaches your floor. The walls are also very thin, I had to call the front desk because there was a party next door going on until 1:00 am and I could hear every word they said and their music. I am also pretty unhappy that they charged me a deposit of $50.00 per night in case of room damage. I didn't see that anywhere on their website, I was only told upon check in and then what are you going to do about it. I was told it would be returned in 5 days, but it is now day 8 and I don't have my money back. I called the Doubletree and was told I was misinformed and that if you use a debit card it will take 14 days. I definitely wouldn't have stayed here if I had known that in advance.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location. Battery Park one block away! Staten Island Ferry, ferry to Statue of Liberty, Wall Street all within a few blocks. The history of this area is amazing!! 911 Musuem, One World Tower and Oculus a short walk away.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel lobby was very hot when checking in. They give you a complimentary cookie and hot bottle water. You can request a mini fridge but the room is so small there wasn't much room to move around in. The elevators are very slow. There is no service elevator so be prepared to share the elevator with housekeeping with dirty laundry and maintenance with steam carpet cleaner. Did I mention the elevator is small too.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is fine, but we have to talk about the elevators. It's not the speed that's an issue, it's the fact that there are only three small elevators to serve the entire building with no dedicated service elevators. Waiting ten minutes for an elevator, only to have the one that arrives be filled to capacity with bags of soiled linens, is not what I expect to experience at a hotel of this caliber. Or any hotel, really. I have to wonder if they've tried making one of the elevators staff-only. Considering that a second elevator which might have had room for me passed my floor while the full laundry elevator was stopped, I'm not sure having all three elevators open to both guests and staff actually decreases wait times. If you are on a high floor, factor at least 10-15 minutes of either elevator wait time or stairs time into any plans. The room was much smaller than any I've ever had at the same price point, especially considering the discount I had as part of a wedding block. But I can chalk that up to paying for the Manhattan location. Very convenient to Battery Park (thus the Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island), the World Trade Center site, the Staten Island Ferry, and Brooklyn which is just one stop away on multiple nearby lines. Also walking distance from Federal Hall, the Stock Exchange, and Trinity Church. I liked the location for a trip requiring lots of back and forth between Manhattan and Brooklyn. I will likely try a different Financial District hotel next time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I'm a frequent guest and when the rates are low the Dtree offers good value. Pluses are location, breakfast, friendly staff, and access to services. Minuses are checkin lines and slow elevator service, especially when the occasional tour bus arrives or departs.
user_name:
John W
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Except for location if you need to be near the Financial district, this Double Tree room design is quite weird. Not fancy and quite pricey. The water jug in the lobby was always empty, did not bother to ask the Front desk as they were always busy. Weird elevators placement maybe because of the tight space. Not a fan of this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location near everything that we wanted to do. Subway station just across the road from the hotel. Staff very helpful, room was nice, bed was so comfy, towels changed every day and bed made. Would definitely recommend and stay here again

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We were staying 5 nights so we could move our daughter into her dorm room. We were traveling with 9 large bags. When we went to our room, I noticed the air conditioner was not cooling. I was told to give it some time. We went out and about for several hours to return to a hot room. I called for service multiple times. Finally after about an hour someone came to the room (11:00 pm) and said it could not be repaired. Said they would talk to the front desk about moving us. I waited for about 30 mins., then went to the front desk. They gave us an new room. However, when we finally repacked and got all of the bags to the new room, the air was not working and the windows were open and they were spraying air freshener. We refused to stay there as it was worse than the original room. Finally, after midnight, we were sent to the third room of the night. We had been traveling since 11:00 am. Because I had a pre-paid non-refundable reservation, I was told they could not comp the night. I was given a breakfast coupon and a $75 voucher for the expensive hotel restaurant to use toward my $150.00 meal (BTW -did not even include a bottle of wine). I made multiple additional calls to report the air conditioner leaking and saturating the carpet surrounding the unit. They had to continue to vaccum the moisture out of the carpet. Staff was nice but the facitlity was lacking. I was really dissappointed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great stay, pretty pricy but a good value for financial district in Manhattan. Rooms are a descent size. Online check in allows you to choose your room. Use map to get a larger room with online checkin.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The price make sense however the elevator wait makes so sense. There was an issue with the parking of my vehicle however it got resolved but it took 30 minutes to resolve. The hotel should've just taken ownership however I had to waste my time discussing with the front desk agent.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Can't beat the location. But 3 elevators for 44 floors? And each only holds about 10 people. Absolutely crazy. We were on the 9th floor and often walked down the stairs. Some people said they were waiting 20 minutes for an elevator, and I get bet there were more. Also, we were charged an extra $50 a night, which we were told we would get back, after checkout ...in about 5 days. I guess they hold that in the event they find damage to the room. Breakfast buffet...not so great either. I'm not usually the type to say anything bad about anywhere, but I knew I had to post regarding this hotel. Also, they didn't replenish all the towels; had to ask for extra washcloth and toilet paper. Again, location super for subway, Southstreet Seaport and Stone Street Historical District. But hotel itself, not so much.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed for 5 nights. The concierge were very pleasant upon arrival and we each got a chocolate chip cookie.We started on the 18th floor, they asked if we wanted a high or low room, I went high cause I thought we'd get good views, we had to move the following day cause the shower leaked and I found the outside noise disturbing! The concierge were very hospitable and we were moved no questions asked, we ended up on the 27th floor, there are 44!The rooms are standard, beds are comfy, lots of storage in draws and a cupboard, air conditioning, a tea/coffee maker, flat screen tv, hairdryer, iron and board, safe and free wifi. The bathroom has a decent sized walk in shower but there is a serious lack of storage and place to hang towels! The air conditioning is too noisy to have on at night but keeps the room cool during the day when it's on. We reported that out toilet and seat were wonky but they didn't do anything about it.The maid service leaves a lot to be desired for, don't get me wrong it's clean but common sense does not prevail...there was 2 of us in the room but we only had 1 glass & 3 pillows, they only gave 2 milks at a time for tea/coffee and didn't often replace things that had been used.The worst thing about the hotel is they only have 3 lifts to serve 44 floors & reception is on the 2nd floor so more often than not you never go straight to ground! When the lifts do come they're full so you have to wait for the next one, lots of wasted time!I won't end on a low cause I've stayed in much worse places, the hotel was in a great location in the financial district, at the top of our street was the subway stop Bowling Green, adjacent to that was battery park and a short walk away was the 9/11 memorial site and Century 21 (department store).In hindsight it wasn't an awful stay but the little gripes do add up.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Worst Hilton brand stay ever! I picked this hotel based on location, price, and the Hilton brand. This hotel does not live up to the Hilton and double tree standards I expect. For visiting NYC and access to subways and landmarks the location is the best. The property is in need of major physical and staff upgrades. My arrival day front desk and concierge was horrific. I arrived early before Check in time and was turned away in a rude manner by the clerk and told to come back later. When I did I was given a room with a broken AC. The maintenance crew did a temporary fix but did not have replacement parts. It took them to argue with the front desk to change our room later. The elevator are slow to arrive. The reason is that staff do my have a dedicated elevator and use. Guest elevator. I have a pretty large list of what went wrong with this week long stay. Staff are not happy because they are low on supplies guest ( e.g toilet paper and parts to fix things). The treatment you get at front desk just depends on who is there. Do not leave your luggage with the concierge. On arrival day they made us retrieve our own luggage that we check when waiting 6 hours to check in and on departure day we found that our luggage was left unattended unsecured for 30 minutes. Anyone could of walked up and took it. They leave it real close to front door. Even though someone will respond to this posting from the hotel saying they are trying, they are not.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If you are ever in the financial district area in NYC, I highly recommend staying at the DoubleTree! Thanks to the GM, Billy, not only will I continue to come here but I will suggest this fine hotel to all of my friends and family. Billy was so attentive and concerned about all our needs. We stayed in a king sized bedroom on the 39th floor, very clean with a spectacular view. Billy even gave us his card so if we needed anything, we could contact him directly! Never have I been to a hotel where the managed cared about their patrons that much. Thank you DoubleTree Hilton for an amazing hotel experience and thank you to Billy!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel should DEFINITELY have security at the front entrance, a bell man or something, 24/7. This is a 44 story hotel, without someone at the front entrance 24/7. Considering the location and that it is off an otherwise quiet, and dark street, there should be someone there. I did not feel safe.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel overcharged me for our two week booking (I was charged twice for it). They didn't believe me and insisted I was wrong. I eventually showed them the transactions on my card. It took 10 days for them to return my money. I travelled from Australia for this holiday (with my niece) and spent a year looking forward to it. I wasn't able to shop, sightsee or go to any shows because most of my money was taken by this hotel. And they never so much as apologised for their error ...

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Staff was helpful in fixing any problem we had. Problem was with reservations and elevator service very slow. Breakfast was very good. Location is fabulous. Walk to river and Brookyln bridge. 911 memorial and so much more.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was happy with my stay at this DoubleTree since the friend I was visiting lives in Brooklyn which is only one subway stop away. It was also nice to be in the Financial District since it's not as crazy as the Times Square area. I stayed in early August and booked a few weeks beforehand and got a great rate considering hotel prices for NYC - out the door about $160 a night. Thankfully I'd requested an early check in which they were able to honor shortly after I arrived which was much needed after a red eye flight. It was just me so the room size was fine and everything was clean and comfortable. I have to mention the rainfall shower head was extremely refreshing as the weekend I was there was miserably hot and humid. As some reviews mention, the elevator situation was a bit ridiculous at times. The worst I experienced was a 5-6 minute wait when I needed to be somewhere at a certain time so I ended up walking down the cramped stairwell 22 flights of stairs. The business center computers were a bit slow for loading and printing my boarding pass but did the job. Staff was friendly as well from housekeeping to the front desk. For the price and location I was pleased with my stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was a trip to meet with NYC Transit and this was right around the corner. Had a wonderful time. Good bed, clean/new room, bag serviceman Hopton greeted me and held my bag while I made my meetings after checking out. Such a professional and kind gentleman seems like a truly good soul which is so refreshing being in NY.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: While spending time in NY to attend a wedding my husband and I spent a night here and it was wonderful. We got an amazin price ( <200) for the night and enjoyed the FiDi for 30 hours. Will certainly look to book here again

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was a 4 night stay while on business locally to the hotel. The initial issue from the minute I walked in the ground floor lobby is inadequate lift facilities. It takes 10-15min at any time during the day to wait for a lift. Hotel staff use the lifts and monopolise them while carrying out services. Annoyingly, this was worst at prime 'breakfast' time every day. Then the hotel fails to do my dry cleaning. I got lie after lie about what went wrong, blaming just about everyone (except themselves) and merely returned a dirty, smelly, crumpled suit that had been in laundry bag for over a day. Business meetings and dinner engagements had to be re-scheduled, but the hotel just didn't care in the slightest. I tried on numerous occasions to speak to the hotel management, without success. An overnight duty supervisor did make an effort, but the promised contact from the hotel manager has never been received despite having my cell number and email address. I would not recommend staying at the hotel unless you have a considerable amount of spare time to sit around waiting.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I booked this hotel solely for its proximity to a conference I was attending in the area. Due to a change in schedule I had to modify the length of my reservation and leave 2 nights early. I attempted to do more than 2 weeks in advance but I was told that in order to do so but they would charge me an extra $100/night even though I was doing it more than 2 weeks in advance. I could have cancelled the reservation with no penalty but to modify it would cost me more. Because I was completely unfamiliar with the area I chose to do make the change anyway, even with the extra fee. Having said that, I will not be staying at a Hilton hotel again. This extra charge is ridiculous. During my stay the hotel was not even full anyway. Anyway, lesson learned, avoid Hilton for me. With respect to the hotel, it was average at best.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Allen is great help, always greet you very nicely and help out in finding restaurant, or train or get cab etc. He is always eager to help all the customer. Rooms are small but manageable. Only problem is no., of elevators. for 45 floors, only 3 elevators are there. So in the morning and evening time, you need to plan 15 mins ahead.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great reception by Sherman at the front desk, he handled several late arrivals with humor and professionalism - he offered water and warm cookies as soon as we arrived. Nice hotel decor, rooms were clean and updated. Good overall experience and service - would stay here again and/or recommend!!
user_name:
akalet2016
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We arrived here and the valet Allen was so awesome! What a great guy! Ready to do whatever it takes to set up your every transportation needs! Talk to Allen when you arrive! The hotel staff is awesome here!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Our second visit to this hotel was not as pleasant as our first. Our room had a strong smell, maybe rug cleaner?, that didn't go away during our three day stay. Others have complained about the slow elevators. They are truly annoying. We had trouble regulating the air conditioning. It was either producing frigid air or nothing. And while it was running, it was very loud.The hotel's location is convenient to many subway lines and to all the lower Manhattan attractions. Our room was quiet and the staff was courteous and efficient. The wi-fi was free and worked perfectly. We thought the hotel was a good value during our first stay but this time, not so sure.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I had recently traveled around the USA for two weeks and was finishing my trip in NYC to relax over the weekend before my flight on Monday! I hadn't slept for two days so upon arriving to the Hotel you could imagine the first thing I wanted to do was just go to sleep! - I was checked in my a gentleman called 'Shermon' - I rarely find the time to write reviews good or bad, however I had to sign up and jump on here to explain that this is without a doubt the best customer service I have ever received. Shermon welcomed me to the Hotel and NYC, he was very upbeat, funny and most of all extremely professional. I was checked in within minutes and found my room very pleasant. I was only In the hotel for two nights however I found the staff very accommodating and If I needed anything I knew they were on hand! Apart from sleeping I wasn't in the Hotel much, so I'm not best placed to comment regarding the Hotel's services etc however I can vouch for their Customer Service is second to none.If there is a Manager Reading this, please pass my thanks to Shermon for making my stay easy and stress free! Also please show him some recognition as his work ethic and customer service is the reason I'll book again.Many Thanks.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed for a week in August. Service experience at check-in was average. 3 slow lifts aren't enough for 40 floors. Room was good, clean, fair sized. But no bar fridge. Despite building works across the road and front facing room sound was bearable. Location is great, near major subway lines to Brooklyn and Manhattan, and Staten Island ferry terminal.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The first room I was checked into had bed bugs. After complaining to the front desk they switched me to another room and said that the infested one would be "investigated". There was no apology. The room I checked into had mold in the shower and smelt musty but as far as I could tell no bugs. I decided not to complain again and risk getting another room with bugs. I never heard from the staff about the "investigation" until checking out where I found out I would not be billed for my room. This was never made clear to me and the checkout process was very confusing because of this. The person at the front desk looked astonished that I asked for a receipt showing a $0 balance. This hotel is disgusting and the staff is borderline rude. I will never stay at another Doubletree again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We were a bit vary about this hotel judging by some negative reviews, but we needn't have worried. As soon as we arrived at the lobby, we were greeted by a lovely receptionist, who upgraded our room right away even without asking. What a start! We got one with a king bed on the 36th floor, with awesome views over the city skyline. The room itself was very small, but being in NYC, it's kind of understandable. The bed was super comfortable and everything was clean. The one complaint we had was the A/C which was very noisy. They also don't provide a shower gel, even though they do provide shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and face bar. I've noticed that also in different Doubletree hotels that the shower gel is missing. I wonder why? Having a refrigerator would have also helped.Being on the 36th floor, we were worried about the waiting time for the elevators. We didn't have issues until the last day when we were checking out. It seemed the whole hotel decided to use the elevators at the same time - we literally stopped at every second floor on the way down. It was so annoying! Location is great though. The subway lines are a street away, you could get to Times Square within 15 mins. Overall, a very decent place to stay in the financial district.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel elevators are very slow and small. Waited for ever for elevators. Rooms was very small. Service from lobby staff was not good. Key did not work on last day at check out. Would not recommend staying there to anyone. Especially those who do not like climbing narrow stairs!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I had booked three rooms (two in one booking and another one separately) for early August 2016. My woes started even before I got there. The booking was made through booking.com and was supposed to be payable at the hotel with a no-show cancellation of the first night only. To start off, the hotel decided to block my credit card for the full amount plus incidentals plus extras (the reason for which the staff could not explain) for all three rooms. Due to this excess charged by the hotel, my credit card was over limit and the credit card could not be authorised for the third room. To sort this out, I added another credit card on the day of checkin and two hours later tried to call them to confirm all was fine. Somebody answered the phone after I rang 17 times and said (a) new credit card detail was still not there: and (b) it was not their job to check with booking.com and therefore, it was my role to ring booking.com to ask booking.com to contact the hotel. (Note: this was when I was running to catch a flight!). When I called booking.com and they tried to contact the hotel, the hotel would still not answer the call!The next bit was when I reached the hotel and asked about the credit card amount they authorised. They had no explanation for the excess and was adamant that the booking was supposed to be prepaid (all amounts paid in advance) which is not what was set out in my booking confirmation that I received from booking.com.The morning concierge staff was polite and helpful but we also had an incident with the evening concierge/ caretaker (on the ground floor) who was so arrogant and rude that he should be out of the service industry. We reported this and the evening manager very kindly and graciously offered us breakfast to make up for this incident. We are very grateful that he tried to make amends though such an incident leaves a very bad taste in one's mouth.Finally, we decided to make the final dues settlement at 9am on checkout day but requested that we keep the room till 11am. At about 10am, a member of the housekeeping team who barely spoke English came to prepare the room for the next guest and her only response was talk to Reception. Not sure why she would come to start cleaning when Reception was already aware that we would be in the room till later.On the plus side, the location was excellent (close to shops, restaurants, the subway and ferries) and the rooms were standard. One good point is that we had AC issues one night at 2am and they did send someone to sort it out. The wifi service was good as was the signature cookies. The lifts were on the slow side but manageable.
user_name:
madhurima19
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Rooms are small and smell like cat litter. Internet is bad. I had to badger the front desk for 2 1/2 hours to get them to fix my internet service which made me late for work. Front desk is rude. Elevators take forever. Plan on waiting at least 15 minutes to even get an elevator and then another 15 minutes (if you are on one of the top floors) to get off the elevator.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If this is a Doubletree Hotel you can't tell. It's such a disappointment as the hotel is dingy and service is almost non existent. Room had dirty carpets, dust encrusted air conditioner and bathroom fan just for starters. Staff seems overworked or unmotivated as no enthusiasm. No one answers the "care line" until after 20 rings at least and then requests are not filled. Elevators are terrible. Only positive thing for hotel is the location.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: It is rare to receive consistent outstanding service from hotel front desk staff that are constantly in the midst of balancing numerous requests, both in person and on the phone, yet somehow, both Doron and Swapna at the Doubletree by Hilton-Metropolitan on Lexington Avenue in New York City manage to do so each and every visit. To rate them at a "5" out of "5", does not do justice to their dedication and commitment to excellence and professional service. They are personable, polite and provide attention to detail that is second to none and this Hotel and Guests are the beneficiaries.Thanks to Doron and Swapna, we will return again (and again) to the Doubletree by Hilton-Metropolitan on Lexington Avenue in New York City!Cliff and Gail Schechter

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: There were long waits for elevator and front desk. Business Center computers did not work even after reporting it twice. Did not have clock/radio in my rooom even after requesting one be sent to my room twice.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Location of the hotel is good. Good restaurants and tourist spots around. Close connections with many subway lines.But for a Hilton, the facilities need to be improved. The bathroom has very bad smell. We complained as soon as we checked in, they came and sprayed and the smell kind of faded off. But the second night, the very strong bad smell haunt the whole room and woke me up at 3am!! It was like sleeping next to a big sewage drain!!! It was very bad! We checked out the next morning. The manager of the hotel replied to my complain very promptly which i truly appreciate, offering to ensure better services in my next visits. But we're tourists and going home to Malaysia there won't be next times - to be honest I won't want to go back and be suffocate also....Also, the room AC is also very noisy, and difficult to control the temperature. Either too cold or too hot!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great hotel with for New York spacious rooms at a very reasonable rate. Parking is right across the street. Taxis and subway right around the corner. Good restaurants, battery Park and Wall Street bull and bear are 2?minutes walking distance. I booked with Captain Kirk and received a great rate.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here on a holiday recently.Smooth check-in and the staff was very helpful in arranging a late checkout too.Breakfast is a bit of a dampner but one can always eat out. Wall street is just around the corner and subway station is right across the hotel.Wifi works very efficiently.Rooms are a tad small but its fin district so its more or less expected. No views, so it's not your room with a view kind of hotel.Too class otherwise.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel was fine. Room was fine. Staff is friendly. The wait for the elevators was horrible!!!! The ice machine was not working on our floor so I had to walk down and up 3 flights. :( The Irish pub next door was a convenient option for a late night snack and drink.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Housekeeping brought clean towels daily, but no washcloths. We had to call to request them every day. They offered a door hanger to fill out for breakfast service. The hanger said to have it hanging outside the door by midnight for the next morning. The night before the only day we had an early start, I hung it by 11:30. It was still there at 6 the next morning. This particular morning, we didn't have any washcloths either (after 2 calls to the front desk). The towel bar came unattached from the mount every time I rehung a hand towel. The shower door did not seal properly, and we had a small pond on the floor after each shower.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: ...and elevators weren't always reliable but the location was amazing. Couldn't get a room with two beds so two of us slept in king and one of floor because there's no room for a sofa. But once we adjusted to essentially living like we were on a sailboat, the location was amazing, right near Leo's Bagels, staten island ferry, and lots of subway stops plus the new Eataly/911 memorial etc! We'd go back! Kids loved the free cookies. And if you craned your neck you could see the water from our inexpensive room!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The Hilton Double Tree hotel in Manhattan New York good location and clean. The hotel lacked WIFI servIce although they claimed to have the service available for HHonors members. The elevator service to the 40th floor took on average 10 minutes or more.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We have stayed in over 20 different locations in Manhattan - this one is perfect - a quiet neighborhood, close to 3 MTA stations (for Times Square, upper east side etc.) Very clean and well-appointed room, friendly staff. Great gourmet coffee shop, pub etc. nearby, close to Battery Park, World Trade Center etc.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed for couple nights and generally liked it. Room is small but modern, bed is very up to Hilton standards, our view from the room was grand - onto new WTC tower and couple other nearby skyscrapers. Rooms service was good and room was cleaned up well. However, there were few issues as well. Our sink faucet was completely ripped out of the wall and then basically put back in place without securing it, so when we turned the water on, it completely detached from the wall. Another problem in the room was with the safe - it was not functional and did not work. However, both issues were quickly fixed once I notified hotel staff. As for outside the room, just like everyone else we had issues with elevators. We were on the top floor and our main issue was not getting into the elevator, but mainly making it all the way down. When we were checking out, I think we stopped on probably 15-17 different floors on the way down, while our elevator was already packed and completely full. The hotel is small (7-8 rooms per floor) but tall (44 floors) and has 3 elevators that are pretty speedy when they are not stopping on every floor. As long as you avoid rush hour traffic you should generally be OK. Also try to book the highest floor possible, at least you will be able to get into elevator. People on floors 15-25 could not even get into elevators as they were full coming all the way from the top. If you are bringing your own car, the hotel does not have its own parking. Instead they use parking lot across the street that gives you a discount rate ($40 a day vs regular $56 a day). When we arrived, parking lot attendant was behaving sketchy, asking us for tips saying that he is giving us a good rate (meaning $40/day) as if he was the one giving us the rate as opposed to Hilton. Just beware of that - it's a hotel rate. Finally, as Hilton Gold I was hoping for free breakfast but that was not included. I was advised that I can either get points for my stay or free breakfast. I deferred to points. Luckily, it is New York, and there are variety of breakfast places around, so you can easily find something for pretty much any taste.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We arrived late at night, and were welcomed by loud guests in the room next to ours, who were smoking pot all night. We tried to alert the hotel staff to this issue, but no one answered the phone at the front desk. In our daughter's room, the air conditioner was not functioning properly and left the floor soaked. The issue was not fixed, the staff just left a towel over the wet area. We also filled out the breakfast card that was supposed to be picked up by staff before morning (so that we could have it when we woke up), but it was not picked up. When we called to place the order, we were told it would be there at 9 am, then we were called again to say it would be ready by 8:45 am. We still had no food at 9:30, and when we called to ask what had happened to our order, they finally admitted that the kitchen was so busy feeding other guests that the order had been ignored and not made at all. When we finally received our meal at 10:00 am, it was incomplete and nothing special. We put our room service tray outside in the hall to be picked up, and it remained there for 3 days straight. We were given two breakfast vouchers in order to make up for the misunderstanding, but when we went to the restaurant downstairs, we were seated by a waiter who seemed confused and annoyed and who put us in the back room when the front room was full of nice tables (and air conditioned). The general maintenance of the rooms was appalling and not up to the Hilton standards that we expected. We spoke with the manager (Vanetta) about our problems and she gave us connecting rooms and 30% off ONE NIGHT. It was a nice gesture, but to be honest, it wasn't at all sufficient. In our new rooms, our daughter's toilet was entirely twisted, the showers leaked all over the floor (even out into the bedroom on our first night in the new rooms). The elevators were incredibly small and slow, it became more efficient to use the stairs on almost every occasion. Just really not a good value. For the amount we spent, we expected Hilton quality rooms and service. We were highly disappointed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We spent 4 nights at DoubleTree by Hilton New York City and it was good. The location is good, you can easily reach popular attractions on foot. The basic room was ok, it worths the price. I can say too much about the view, because we were at the 3rd floor. :) I can recommend the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Nice location in the financial district and very easy access to the subway. However, you have a long wait for elevator service. Three slow elevators to take care of 40+ floors. Other than that a very good hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very nice and modern DoubleTree hotel in the financial district in Manhattan!Clean and beautiful rooms with some great views.Breakfast at the restaurant was very good with many choices. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and can recommend it!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Just finished up a 5 night stay at this hotel. The location is great, 1 minute walk away from the Whitehall Street station where you can catch the local R train to time square or to Brooklyn/Coney Island. Also an abundance of great food located nearby, I would recommend Flavors for a cheap breakfast and the Dubliner for dinners (avoid murphys next door to hotel). The staff are very accommodating and their busy centre was a life saver when it came to FREE printing! The elevators are extremely slow during peak times so always make sure you are ahead of schedule or take the stairs if you aren't too high up.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Elevators take FOR-EVER during the morning. If you're late for a meeting you'll miss your meeting. My room door didn't open easily, the key reader had a malfunction to a point where I asked for help and the person told me to "go downstairs to get new keys" (I had JUST asked for new keys, the problem was CLEARLY THE READER)The AC in my room didn't change temperature or shut off so I had to manually unplug it from the wall outlet otherwise my room would be freezing.Most hotels in NY will leave your bill under your door in the morning so you're automatically checked out and don't have to stop by at the front desk. Guess what? This hotel doesn't do it.Reception is on the 2 floor, street level is on ground floor so if you have bags you have to wait for one of the three elevators that serve 44 floors, which as I mentioned already can take FOREVER.NYC has way too many hotels, don't choose this one. I was very disappointed because Hilton is my favorite chain.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed for 3 nights in 3309. Walking distance to the ferry close to restaurants and bars. The rooms are very nice. Not large but for NYC decently spacious. Modern new bathrooms. Some rooms (3307) have a bath tub others have a glass standing shower. Rooms were clean and comfy. The ac unit was loud and I found the bed and pillows too soft but linen was soft and fresh. Parking is $40 for regual car but #55 for oversize our F150 counted as oversize. Parking lot is across the street

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great price and a great location for what we wanted. Near Battery Park, The Statue of Liberty, 911 memorials, 1 WTC and subway entrances. Room was not big but it worked. The staff was friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms were not very clean, the toilets made whistle sounds when flushed by us and the people above us (all night long) the elevators were not working very well and we had to use the stairs from the 8th & 9th floor often or wait 15 or 20 minutes in unfair conditioned hallways. The restaurant was great for both breakfast and dinner.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Second time I stayed here, this time in room 3902 with city view. The rooms are so small compared to other Hilton hotels in the area. For $325 per night, you would think/wish the room would be bigger. There was a coffee machine and a safe which were positives. Overall, the room and the hotel are clean. The three elevators are always busy stopping at almost every other floor during peak hours. It doesn't help to have the reception on the second floor because of that. Although it may be minor for some, i care about not having a fresh roll of toilet paper. The room service should replace the toilet paper regardless of how much is left for new guests.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was concerned about the elevator wait times after seeing many negative reviews about it. After my 3 day stay last weekend I could honestly say that the elevator wait time issue was not a big deal. I stayed in the 38th floor and the most I waited was less than two minutes. Shout out to the night time security guy who would hold the elevator for us to squeeze us in and not make us wait for the next elevator. The room was small but it's comfy. I loved my hotel room view of the freedom tower. Definitely worth the extra price for the views if your into hotel views. Two subway stations are within minutes from the hotel with easy access to midtown and Brooklyn. The area is still active at night time with lots of people walking by but not as much as midtown/times square. I would recommend this place.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Walking distance to Staten Island Ferry, Wall Street, Shrine to St. Elizabeth Seton where 911 survivors found solace, and a convenient subway stop. Clean, more than adequate, service was the priority. The lobby, off street level, provided a more secure gathering spot. I felt satisfied, except:Slow small elevators for a high rise;They forgot to keep the ice water dispensers filled, even though guests spent significant time in the lobby... late July New York City... Makes no sense!;And finally...I stopped in the restaurant one morning during my stay. I asked where breakfast is served. The host responded, "it is not free." I asked again, where? Received the required direction. I noticed a fly buzzing around one of the serving dishes, so naturally I walked around the corner to a local deli, mumbling to myself, " even if it were complimentary with the price of the room, it is not free, but that is not what I asked the pretentious host." Then I got over it, because...More than adequate comfortable stay in an establishment where service for the most part was a priority.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This should be a positive review, as Doubletrees are usually a good value and this property is well located for a business traveller or tourist wanting a convenient location in lower Manhattan's financial district. Unfortunately, this hotel has serious problems, some fixable, some not. I would avoid this hotel.This is one of the seemingly growing number of hotels with the lobby and check- in above the ground floor. This is fine if a hotel has good elevator or escalator access to the check-in and good security. This has neither. I waited 15 minutes just to get an elevator to enter the hotel. (With very spotty security for anyone going upstairs). This pattern of very slow elevator service, with resulting packed elevators for 30+ floors, continued for movement between floors during my stay--going to the gym (which was nice), breakfast (food ok, but so so service), or checkout. The clear and unfixable problem--the hotel simply does not have enough elevators. Fixable but a problem: if you have a car, self or valet parking is a block and a half away. I waited 40 minutes for my car to arrive, after I was told it left on its short journey.Rooms are ok--room was clean, but carpets a bit gritty and need cleaning, bathrooms lack adequate counter space. As noted, security entering the hotel with immediate access to upper floors, needs real attention by management.If you are on any sort of schedule where unpredictable delays are a problem or you don't like sardine like elevator transits stopping at every floor, you should avoid this hotel.
user_name:
JeffromDC
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is not a 4 star hotel 2 starts at most. Room smelled, air conditioner leaked, mold in the shower, 20 wait for the elevator, staff was rude, breakfast awful. I had a late check out and "do not disturb" on my door. She woke me at 8:05am to see if I was leaving "today". I will never stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Trip to Wall Street for some meetings. It was an ok stay. Elevators are brutal at this place...long waits. Otherwise, decent hotel. Nice staff, good people. Not very good room service - never picked up phone so I went to restaurant and it was empty. Weird. The rooms are clean and a/c worked great on hot day.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I had the pleasure of staying in this hotel on a short trip to NYC. The rooms are clean although a little small. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was small but clean. The Wifi was good. It is well located near the Statue of Liberty boat cruises and near Wall street. Even though it is located in a busy area, there was no noise in the room. Overall good value for money.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Just because you can squish a very tall hotel into a small patch of real estate in NYC doesn't mean you should. My college friends and I stayed over the weekend and every time we tried to leave or return to room we had to wait for 10-15 minutes for an elevator and then get squished in like sardines. The hallways outside our room was very narrow and hot and so by the time the elevator finally came we were drenched with sweat. Granted the temp outside was 95. if we'd been in a much lower floor ( we were on floor 16) we would have taken the stairs but that was not an option. I was very concerned that if there had been an emergency we would not have been able to exit

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was by far the worst hotel experience I have ever encountered. We arrived on the day of check-in, and the hotel had clearly given our reservation away. They made up an excuse that "the air condition in the room is broken" (or the front desk staff just shows no remorse to these circumstances because I still have no inclination that it was true) as I mentioned that we didn't mind staying at a room with no A/C. "No, we can't do that."I asked if there are other rooms we can be upgraded/downgraded into. "No, we're completely booked."So without giving us a choice, transferred us at 11pm to a much shadier Hampton Inn. The email specifically stated that our reservations are GUARANTEED. And I even paid for the rooms already when it was booked more than a month in advance!Absolutely disgraceful how they take advantage of tired and leery travelers. I wish I had the energy to fight them the first night, but we were too tired after our cross country flight. After storming to the front desk livid the next morning, I was promised that the manager would "make everything right." I waited 2 days to be contacted by the manager, but he/she was in a "conference call"...for 2 days and couldn't be bothered. Finally they decided to refund our first night. Yet 1 month later, without any money returned, I called today. Waited on hold for 15 minutes only to be told to "call back later."I was content with how they settled things until I was promised a small refund (more as an acknowledgement of their failures) and now I have to act like a debt collector. I will continue up the ladder until they fix their unacceptable practices or at least hear an actual apology from the manager that I've yet to hear from. The DoubleTree and Hilton name is being dragged through the mud from this atrocious experience. Not only am I not satisfied with my stay, I don't think anything has been handled correctly at any step of the way. Expect this to be posted everywhere until resolution.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I didn't notice it, but my grand daughter complained of a bad smell, she sprayed air refreshner around and didn't complain anymore. The room was nice, but small, especially the bathroom vanity. It was hard to place everything I needed on it, had to go back and forth to the bedroom.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
