review_body: We arrived in NYC around 9:30 am and we're excited to find out we could check in early. Our stay was fabulous from that point on. The front desk staff were very professional and very helpful when we needed help getting around the city. We plan to stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The air conditioner in my room did not work. Maintenance could not repair it, nor was there another room available to transfer us into. It took hours for us to receive a fan. Because there was no where else to go, my family had to stay in that hot room, and was only offered a 60% discount. I would never be a guest at this hotel, nor would I ever recommend anyone to stay here.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel and restaurant staff were all very friendly and helpful. With one small exception - slow elevators, this is an excellent hotel. Close walking distance to good restaurants. If I were traveling to NYC Financial District, I would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I am a frequent traveller to NYC for both business and pleasure. This was my first time staying at the Doubletree FiDi, as my office has located and is right next door on Broad Street. This hotel was the most disappointing stay I've had in a long time - with a poor experience across the board, other than the great location. Starting with the positive - the hotel is in a great location, with a 5 minute walk to several subway stops connecting you to Brooklyn and uptown Manhattan. It's close to Battery Park, Wall Street and the ferries to Liberty and Statem Islands. And that's it - there is no more good. The bad. Everything you read about the lifts is true. It's absolutely ridiculous to have to wait for 20 minutes for a lift - ignore the hotel's comments, the wait isn't confined to 'busy' periods, it's all the time. Incredibly frustrating to have to wait every time you want to leave the building, so much so we found ourselves avoiding popping back into our room to freshen up or drop of bags because it would take 45 minutes to make the round trip.The hotel itself is tired dark and needs an updated. The lobby and the hallways are all dated and dark, and the hallways itself are tiny. People leave their dirty room service trays in the hallway and you need to step over them to get past, and the staff don't clean them up. One room service tray sat in the hallway for 24 hours - not great in a city with a rat problem!The room itself is tiny, and there are no amenities - no mini bar, no fridge etc. The week I was there is was 37 degrees Celsius outside, and the Doubletree doesn't provide any bottles of water, or a space to store your own water. Fairly poor for a relatively expensive hotel not to provide even a small fridge for chilled water when it's so hot. The sink is so small and the tap is so cramped I couldn't even fill up my own water bottle from the sink. All in all a shabby hotel with few redeeming qualities. The staff are generally absent and I will not be staying here again. Surprised Hilton lends it name to a hotel with so many issues - particularly when the same issues (elevators, shabby decor) are repeated time and time again in the guest review.
user_name:
Jacqueline S
London, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Nothing about this hotel was acceptable. From the 30 minute wait for the elevator to the lack of hot water to the line of complaining clients in the lobby. The junior suite is anything but. Its mattress is all springs and blocks the bathroom and exit out when down. There are no amenities at all. No bell service and they rarely answer the front desk phone. There is no service elevator for the staff so they are forced to use the guests elevator. Food service is not picked up outside of rooms for 24-48 hours. Gym is 87 degrees and they refuse to cool it down. I could say more but you can probably just get from this review, do not stay here. It sucks!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location and staff were pleasant here. However, the rooms are not what you expect from the brand. Little things like broken handles on drawers in the room, screws sticking out of the wall, hooks for towels in the bathroom coming out of the wall ( I removed the dangling hardware so it didn't fall and it was not replaced), room service trays not being picked up for two days, etc. are not what I typically associate with a Doubletree. The elevators are painfully slow as well and you may have to take the stairs a lot, unless you don't mind waiting in excess of 20 minutes. However, the hotel is in a quiet location for NYC and close to many subway lines. It's an OK choice for budget conscious, but not a four star property or normal quality for the brand.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The elevators in this hotel are literally the slowest on the Eastern Seaboard. Last year when I stayed at this hotel they blamed the slow elevators on construction. This year they gave up on that ruse and instead encourage you to stay on a low floor. If you enjoy being serenaded by New York City street traffic complete with horns, sirens, and drunks from the bar next door, by all means keep it low. Add on to that the fact that they want you to stay on a low floor so you'll take the stairs down in the morning and up in the afternoon, I wonder how this place maintains the Hilton name. Stay at the Ritz. Its less than a 1/4 mile away and the rates are the same.
user_name:
Philip W
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here just for a random weekend stay-away, and we enjoyed our stay for sure. There were a few minor downsides, but for the most part it was great. As we came into the room it smelled super clean and fresh as if no one has ever stayed there before. That was a double thumbs up! Everything was perfectly placed and neat. We had the regular king room so it was a bit smaller from what I've had in other hotels BUT it was a perfect size for just me and my boyfriend. The downsides: -No physical TV Guide -Some channels went out of signal some times-The shower wasn't fully sealed at the bottom so the floor was a little wet-Elevators were slow-Doors arent soundproof- There were rips or snags in the bed skirt and 1 pillow. (Which didn't bother me but I just didnt want them to think that we did it)Also there aren't too many food options that are close by. It'll definitely give you a reason to walk.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel was in a good location, nice friendly staff in the hotel and the rooms where nice and tidy and very comfortable, only prob was the a/c wasn't working in the room and it was hot in the room with temperatures out hitting 30.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I arrived and found my room soaked with musty water. I complained to the attendant three times in person and once by phone over a two hour period. They kept telling me that they were aware of it and would check it out. After two hours I spoke with a different attendant who moved me to another room. In the second room there was a long black hair in the sink to greet me. Other staff members were friendly and helpful but I would never recommend this hotel to anyone

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 4 weeks from June -July. The room was clean and neat! Everyone was extremely accommodating at all times. We did not want for a thing. We requested a refrigerator and they even had that as well! The team here was fantastic! Shermon, Kingsley, Juan (Engineer), Juan (housekeeping), Venetta and Allen! The manager of the hotel, James even blessed us with a voucher for the restaurant and the food was fabulous! I totally recommend this hotel if you are coming to the Financial District! Love those guys!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Ok location because it is not full of noise pollution like other parts of New York, however the hotel quality is poor. The entire room smelled and there were mosquitos in my room upon arrival. The bathroom was quite gross and I did not trust to put my items anywhere in my room except in my suitcase. Good hotel for a quick visit if you don't mind where you sleep, but do not be fooled by the name Hilton like we were. If possible, cough up some more money and get something more hospitable. On the bright side, I will say that all of the hotel staff were very friendly and were wiling to do anything for their guests.
user_name:
ChelseaKo7
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel staff were very pleasant and accommodating. If you need directions, food, or just plain info, Allen is the man to see. He was informational and had a very warm soul. Thanks for the hospitality.
user_name:
Dantaurus O
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed from June 7-13, 2016 for a weedingROOM:- Room on 9th floor- very quiet and small- bathroom had no space to story toiletries - ZERO space around the sink to lay items, only wide enough for contact case- Large hole in the bathroom sliding door, could not close the door easily- poor maintenance, called several times for service and hung up on usElevator:- only 3 in the ENTIRE HOTEL!- Each time waited 20+++ mins to catch the elevator- people would not make room so we could get on repeatedly- started pushing our way on the elevator- started taking stairs up and downLOCATION: EXCELLENT**** - great for our wedding events - great to see the Statue of Liberty, Brooklyn Bridge, 911 site

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I picked this hotel cause i thought it was close to the Brooklyn bridge where we were attending a concert. Regardless with Uber rates and traffic it was ok I guess. I did not like how the lobby check in was on the 2nd floor. Bathroom was so small and elevators/stairs looked old and run down. Location was ok near some bars, and food but overall I guess it served its purpose. Shower setting was nice, wish they had a microwave and fridge. I found this on a deal so it was worth it in the end.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Location was conveniently located with short walks to the ferry's, subways, & Wall St. And not too much farther to the Brooklyn Bridge & One World Trade Centre. We would've liked a fridge & microwave in our room as a personal preference but the room was cozy and just enough space for what we needed. Elevators are slow as other people have mentioned and we read that going in but it wasn't that bad of a wait. Halls are narrow and our room was directly across from the elevator but we didn't have any issues with noise. We arrived later than expected as our flight was cancelled and our luggage didn't make it on our new flight....Staff were friendly and helped us find the nearest CVS still open so we could grab some essentials. When our bag finally arrived 24hrs later it was brought straight to our room. Staff were always friendly and helpful during our stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The DoubleTree is my second home and the I consider the staff my friends!!! It starts as you enter and leave with Luis, Hopkins and Allen at the entrance to James, Donna and Ana at the front desk getting you situated with your room to Brian Davey who is always there to help on those weeks that you require additional accommodations!!! Thank you to the entire staff at the DoubleTree for making my travel life easier!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The service standard in front desk was different from customers to customers eg the one before me was given cookies and drinking water and when it's my turn there were none and after me they were given again. Not sure it's because I'm Asian while the others are Caucasian. House keeping was also bad

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed one night with my bf, the price wasn't that bad. The parking was odd but whatever. The only problem we had was with the elevators, there are three in total. And like 48 floors or a bit more in the Hotel. Waiting took forever and sometimes when it would finally arrive, it be too packed to get in. The room was small and cozy and well air-conditioned. The bed and pillows were super comfy I fell asleep fast. We had a remote missing but we called to the desk and another one was quickly brought up to us. The location of the hotle is good. It right by the bull and the stock exchange and the dock where you can see the statue of Liberty and also get a boat ride to it. I would definitely stay here again when I go back to NYC.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location for Battery Park/Financial area. Rooms are very small; but it's new construction in an area with limited real estate. Hilton rooms are normally spacious, but I surmise if they made them any bigger in this hotel they probably couldn't turn a profit.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I arrive at 11am on a Saturday. One lady at the desk. Says I can't check in until 3. I have to return to a bellman one floor below. Bellman no where to be found. Walk up the stairs to avoid the slowest elevator in the world. She calls bellman and I walk back down. Return later check in to a nice room but to a mattress that is so soft and curvy I could roll out. Ugh
user_name:
coffee1728
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I do not like the setting of swimming pool is indoor and close to the lobby. almost everybody so you swimming but no sunshine.the maintainace is ok. the food is disappointed. the staff service is ok. the stairs is too much . not disables friendly
user_name:
Mi C
Atlantic City, New Jersey

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Went to New York for a week with the family and stayed for 7 nights. The location of the hotel is great very close to the subway and Fianancial District. The staff were very polite and gave us warm cookies when we checked in. The elevators were a bit of a nightmare sometimes would take 5-10mins just to get in one as there is only 3 elevators and over 40 floors in the hotel but other than the elevators I would recommend the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Always waited at least 10-15 min for elevator, then when it came, you were crammed on it , horrible !!, bathroom toilet clogged, light out in bathroom, room dusty, door man had his own scam going for a friend's limo service,

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We had three rooms in this hotel on the 29th, 39th & 40th Floors during our recent seven night stay. Excellent hotel, very friendly staff with great service and always willing to help. The six of us could not fault anything and would gladly stay again if we return to NYC.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at this DoubleTree for the first time, for a nearby business conference. The hotel is very convenient to the Financial District for business meetings, and near lower Manhattan attractions ranging from Fraunces Tavern to Delmonico's. Other than the occasionally slow elevator service, the hotel was a very good value compared to pricier hotels in the neighborhood. The public areas and rooms were clean and the staff responsive and friendly. I plan to stay there again in the fall.
user_name:
jonathanrL8486KM
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Love the hotel and the location is excellent. A little less crowded downtown feels more neighborhoodish. Great restaurants all around and the subway is a quick walk away. Staff was very quick with check in and getting you your warm cookies

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The entrance to the hotel is through luggage storage with the lobby on the 2d floor. Walk up the stairs if you can rather than wait for the elevator. The elevator takes forever. IThe views from higher up are good but the convenience of being able to walk down and up and not having to wait for the elevator is better. The halls aresmall and not air conditioned.However, the convenince of being close to all the sights in lower Manhattan overrun some of the negatives. If you are more interested in luxury look elsewhere. But if want to be close to Batry Park, feries to Staten Island and the Statue of Liberty, the 9/11 sites, and Wall Street itself then you may like this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great service: from doorman (guy who greets and directs folks in the lower lobby of the hotel) to the housekeeping staff to the hotel receptionists! Double Tree (FiDI location) was able to accommodate several last-minute requests that I had, even though I booked through a 3rd-party service. Friendly staff, clean rooms, great view (I had the city view room), and very professional. All for a great rate. Only cons (which in my opinion were not major at all): Elevator situation can get bad (only 3 elevators for 40 floors). Might have to wait up to 20 min for an elevator ride. Also, can hear doors closing and people in hallway.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was a decent business hotel. They wouldn't let me check in early, which would have been great since I had a red-eye flight, but everything else went smoothly. Enjoyed the cookies at check in. Room was big (I had an accessible room) and comfortable. Checking in and out went smoothly, which is important when you're traveling for work. Elevators did take awhile. Not my favorite hotel in the area, but all in all, a good hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Overall great hotel, clean, good breakfast etc. - very long wait for elevators and they were often full when arrived so you had to start the process all over and wait for the next one. My recommendation would be to request a lower level floor so you can take the stairs.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location in financial district. Staff was all friendly. Rooms were nice and clean. The doors closing behind people leaving their rooms were quite loud. Elevators could be slow and could take awhile to get one if full. A positive experience though.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location but...too few lifts for such big structure (3 lifts for 200 rooms, you can easily wait 5-10 minutes for your turn). Extremely expensive breakfast for its very poor quality (nice bacon though).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at the hotel for 8 nights on my business trip to NYC. Following are some observations: Positives: 1. Staff - Front Office & Housekeeping were outstanding. Reservation interaction with Natalie in Sales was excellent. Also Violet in Front Office. 2. Location - Very good for business around Financial District and Wall Street. Very close to Battery Park for ferry to Liberty Island or Ellis. Right next door to the museum of Native American history etc. 3. Room Rates - Very competitive for the location. 4. Laundry Service - Outstanding! 5. Rooms - Small but functional (I was on the 30th Floor) 6. Murphy's Tavern - Next door tavern is a great option to get your brew and food. 7. Connectivity – Excellent Subway connections to anywhere in NYC and beyond Could be better: 1. Lack of in-house restaurant is a drawback. The attached Italian restaurant has good food but available only till 11:00 PM which doesn't help in a city like New York. Also, while the food they served was very good, the staff at the restaurant could have been more polite. 2. Room size - however, for the price in NYC, its still a bargain. The hotel could do with a refurbishment, though. 3. Location - Nightlife limited in that location (as expected because its in the Fin. Dist.). You have travel uptown to get more late night options. Final Thoughts – Great hotel for those with business in the area. Not recommended for tourists unless it matches their budgets. Tourists are better placed towards midtown or the Times Square (which is also pricier).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: First impression on entrance was not impressive. The reception area was super busy with groups of people and the employees were ignoring other people so you need to be assertive. I've slept in more comfortable beds. But for the price and area it was the best option.
user_name:
nikkir598
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: King size room was very very small - - cancellation policy is 24 hrs -- too short if you're on a business trip. Room rates are very inconsistent. I was charged $259 for a king room, the next night the room was $199 and the next week the same king room was $139.
user_name:
Linda T
New Jersey, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Smaller rooms than a usual Doubletree but very clean and very nice. Good location for South Street Seaport, Wall Street, Ground Zero, Batter Park etc. I did not use the fitness room or restaurant so i cannot comment on that. My only con is that the elevators are very slow.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed for 6 nights. Our room was at 25th floor. The building has 41 floors in total, however there were only 3 elevators. So, we spent most of our time waiting the elevators. Room was clean, but very old. They give you free cookies while checking in. These cookies were delicious. The hotel was close to the Whitehall station. The Whitehall station was not so close to the central Manhattan, however the hotel was close to the Liberty Island, Ground Zero & One World Tower. The price is not high for Manhattan. Summary: Low price for average accomodation

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel was great. Location super close to subway. Very clean, organized, great view of the city from the 35th floor facing north...Elevator was a problem, but not a deal breaker. Only 3 small elevators for entire hotel... Expext a wait.Staff was not friendly or welcoming at all.Receptionist did not find my reservation, eventhough i had called in and let hotel know i was checking in very late, and had checked in on the HHonors app... Finaly got my information up. No cookie or water was given or achnoledged that perhaps they had run out? Who knows. Its not about the cookie, or water, its the principal. When you pay for something, you expect consistency.
user_name:
gabeochoa
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We decided to spend a weekend in NYC from Connecticut and found a special rate at the Doubletrees in town. We took the train into the city and arrived at this hotel before check in time. They were very nice and attempted to accommodate our early arrival and did well. Craziness started with the three elevators. There was no rhyme or reason to how they functioned. You had to wait, wait, wait... At least once we had to go down the stairs from the 10th floor. The first time we first got off the elevator on our floor I was a little shocked at the small hallway that was in the process of being repainted. At first I thought we were in the wrong place but realized they were remodeling. The rooms are small and the bathroom was quite small. We were not there much so it was okay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have been a Hilton diamond member for 8 years now and have never provided a real complaint or bad review...until now. Horrible Experience. This was my first time at this hotel. Upon a Sunday afternoon arrival no water available. Monday, same thing still no water. Gift shop/snack shop area completely empty of everything just about. Even the little water jug vases were empty. Breakfast restaurant didn't even have to go coffee cups. Tuesday morning, my shower didn't have hot or even warm water. Completely ice cold. Horrible way to start the day. Elevators are slow (3 of them that aren't banked). I could have gotten around this but the water and shower issue ruined the hotel for me. When I requested to speak to a manager they were suppose to call me back during the day and never did. I had to call again and eventually talked to Anna at the front desk. Believe she is a shift supervisor. She was very nice and provided me with a food voucher and some Hilton points (pretty standard I'd assume). I ended up using the food voucher of course. Couldn't let it go to waste. The room service food was decent for room service. The location was nice. Close to Wall Street and metros. Some nice running paths as well. Given The price +$200/night (seemed reasonable for the area) I have to imagine there are much better properties in the area and probably even other Hilton properties better in the area.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Love: great location at the Battery, very nice staff, clean facility, new and well maintained main floor. Compact but well-appointed & updated room and bathroom. Hate: noisy halls and thin walls, view (construction site). Everything you hear about the elevators is true- I left 20 minutes extra to get downstairs and ended up walking down 16 flights with my luggage, was still late. My co-workers were also all late for our morning meetings. Get a room on the lowest floors and walk, or prepare for insane waits.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My daughter left important documents in the room and Ms Suela Vata promptly contacted me and gave instructions on how best get items back. I will be forever greatful to Ms Vata for her, and her staff's honesty and integrity.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Room is small but adequate and clean. Great location! But...1. Two people at front desk but one was brand new and no one to train her so we all stood on a long line while she did nothing.2.No one picks up phone at front desk requiring me to take elevator to lobby to get any service.3. No concierge4. Had to go to lobby to get someone to clean my room5. I am supposed to get free water as Diamond member but they had no water6. No magazine about what us happening in townSo disappointed

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is a great location, easy walk to the 9/11 memorial, Staten Island Ferry, Battery Park, Wall St, Stock Exchange. The 'Bowling Green' (and Wall St) subway stop is around the corner. Chipotle Mexican restaurant is close by (if you arrive late and need a quick meal, it's good and open late) and Flavours is also around the corner (fresh, healthy food). Stone St is another excellent place, within easy walking distance for a vast array of restaurants. Don't miss the Dead Rabbit bar, also very close. Although I don't like to leave negative reviews, and there are many pluses to this hotel, it can't be ignored that the wait for the elevators in this hotel during 'peak hours' (morning and evening) is excruciating. And once you get an elevator, you stop every floor until you are crammed in with as many people as the lift will fit. I have no idea why the elevators take so long, up to 15-20 minutes! Within one day I had figured out the situation and would walk down from my 24th level hotel room most mornings rather than wait. The elevators are that bad! Also, the Hotel lost all my laundry on day 3, kept me guessing for 2 days as to where it was (assuring me every morning & evening when I called to enquire that they had it & would deliver it "immediately" - lucky for them I was gone most days from 7am to 11pm so it took me some time to realise what was going on). Once I figured out they had lost it, they showed "some" interest in helping me while I was in the USA (to be fair, there were several staff who seemed like they were genuinely trying to help - shout out to Sherman who was the nicest, most polite person I've spoken to on the phone in a long time, he was delightful to deal with and really wanted to help, but we were under time pressure as I was waiting for flights home to Aus). But once I was back in Australia, they wouldn't return emails and I haven't been able to get any return emails right up to the Assistant GM. Thank goodness for travel insurance! While clean and reasonably priced and the staff friendly, if I were to return on a business trip, I would be asking to stay elsewhere. The elevators were just too frustrating, and I don't agree with rewarding a hotel with return business given their approach to fixing a problem (ie the lost laundry). If you do decide to stay (and besides the elevators and my own unique problem with the laundry) it was fine - don't use the laundry service and request to stay on the lower levels where you can use the stairs to get in and out of the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is reasonably priced in a very good location. The room is small, but we did not stay in our room very much. We explored New York City for the weekend and this hotel was sufficient for that. It is closest to the subway and also to battery Park if you want to jog through the park in the morning.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the doubletree. The front desk (sharnice) was very helpful and friendly. It's a great location in the heart of the financial district w/ easy access to the rest of the city. The bellhops provided my with great suggestions of places to eat and drink! I stayed for a week and my linens and sheets were replaced twice! If your looking for a stay at a clean convenient hotel in the financial district I recommend the doubletree.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Lodging in NYC is notoriously high; however, my stay at this location was very reasonable and closely located to Wall Street. This was very convenient for my meeting. There were also a number of attractions nearby as well a great deal of places to select from to eat. I even found a number of food trucks nearby.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed at the double while visiting family Father's Day. The staff was very courteous and helpful and they were able to accommodate an early check in. The room was pleasant and the king sized bed was very comfortable. We slept great! The location was convenient and only a five minute walk from the Wall Street stop. The national museum of American Indians was close by and very interesting - and it's free! We would definitely stay there again. There was often a long wait for the slow elevators - this was the only drawback.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Elevators Elevators Elevators.... I would rate 4 or 5 stars if not for the Elevator situation, at busy times you can wait 20 minutes and this is annoying, only 3 Elevators for a 50+ story building is inadequate I was on floor 17 and took the stars a few times and this was quicker, I wouldn't fancy taking the stairs from the top floor, On the Hotel side of things the rooms were a nice size and clean with coffee machine and Aircon, the staff were really helpful and friendly especially the Luggage guy, close to Subway and nice bar around the corner called the White Horse, cheap beer and whiskey.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel has a nice location close to Wall Street , 9/11 memorial , Battery park , Statue of Liberty cruise pick up . Staff is friendly . Rooms are pretty small , just ends when about to start . With a family , you need bigger rooms . Ice vending is available . Value for money if you are not spending much .

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is a good option if your business takes you to the financial district. The room was clean and reasonable size. I've stayed here about 4 times over the last few years and I'm never disappointed. Plus the subway stations are close by so you can get to midtown for some entertainment. Would definitively stay again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Normally a four star but I give it five due to the location and amazing staff. You can walk to most of the sites, close to bars and restaurants, and the staff was friendly, helpful and professional. Best rates are Friday and Saturday. You have to book two nights to get the great rates. If you drive, Stone street is hard to find but off Broadway. Self part is across the street and they offer valet parking. Rooms are New York size but clean and comfortable. The manager helped us with additional nights. A fantastic stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I'm not even sure where to start, the floors weren't clean, the nets were dirty, the lifts were terrible. Three rooms were offered and I wouldn't have walked barefoot in any of them. Shocking hotel and the staff could care less.I'm presently going through Hilton direct about this as I've stayed in many nice hotels and this one wasn't in any way in keeping with the brand or the stars. This hotel had the temerity to charge me for one night when I didn't stay and it was beyond awful. I'm speaking with my credit card company about this also as you're covered for incidents like this in the UK.Ruined my whole impression of the Hilton brand.Ended up staying in the Knickerbocker in Times Square, amazing hotel and the staff know how treat their customers.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great place to stay! It was a VERY clean place and easy walking distance to food, 9/11, and various other tourism spots. Also had a Subway entrance right near it.. So you could head up to Times Square/Broadway in about 20 minutes. The only downside was the elevators. They have 3 but they aren't timed correctly. Made it hard to drop off items at your room before you went out for the evening. Would definitely stay here again though!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for a weekend visit to New York. Manager greeted us with a smile and offered an upgrade straight away which was fantastic and very welcome after our long journey to get there! Hotel was clean, comfortable and catered for all needs. Food was lovely and staff couldn't do enough.Definitely recommend this hotel as a good place to stay for a visit to New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location of the hotel was fine for where I needed to be that is why I chose the hotel as well as the price was reasonable. But the front desk staff all except one young lady was rude. Housekeeping comes way before checkout time. I had a 1:30 c/o and they came at 10 banging on the door. I had to ask for my linen to be changed twice because housekeeping had not been in my room to change sheets nor towels since the room was prepared for check in. The floors were never vacuumed the entire time and looked like that upon arrival with visible dirt all over the floors.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed in the double tree at the end of a business trip to New York. The location was perfect for me as it was close to the subway and tour buses. It was very reasonable for New York City. The room was very nice with everything you need but the lifts can be packed and slow depending on the time of day. The warm cookies on arrival were a nice surprise and the staff were very helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will book again. Tony, Belfast, Ireland.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The DoubleTree is my second home and the I consider the staff my friends!!! It starts as you enter and leave with Luis, Hopkins and Allan at the entrance to James, Donna and Ana at the front desk getting you situated with your room to Brian Davey who is always there to help on those weeks that you require additional accommodations!!! Thank you to the entire staff at the DoubleTree for making my travel life easier!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The only good thing about this hotel is the location. The rooms are tiny and don't even include a refrigerator. The elevator was a catastrophe. It took me over 20 minutes to get down every time. They said all the elevators were working but it seemed like only one was running. I would have been disappointed if this room cost $150, much less that it was $300/nt.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We had a great stay at this hotel. They were very accommodating with my needs (2 kids). It's a great place to stay if you like it quiet at night (compared to Times Square)Being greeted at the door was great. I was able to ask the door man directions to my various destinations in the city.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in May. The location was excellent. it was right in the heart of the Financial District. There were lots of restaurants, shops and subway stations close by. Upon check-in we were given coupons for breakfast at the restaurant associated with the hotel. The breakfast was very good and the wait staff were awesome. The Hotel staff were friendly and accommodating. The rooms are smaller, but we didn't feel cramped during our stay. The rooms were clean and well appointed with comfortable beds and a very good workstation setup. The internet speed was decent as well. On the downside the elevators are slow and we choose to take the stairs from the 12th floor down on a few occasions due to the wait. We would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My boyfriend and I reserved a king size bed for Friday and Saturday night. I was excited to stay two days and not have to pack my things up until Sunday. We took a bus up to NY from DC Friday night after work, so I made sure to notify them we would arrive between 11:00 pm - 12:00 am. I even wrote a note about our expected arrival time during the reservation process. When we finally got there after 11:00 pm, the front desk said they gave our room away! They would give us a 2 double bed room. When we asked if we would get a discounted price (we did pay for a king bed), he said they can't. He gave us two free breakfast passes - the best he can do. They said if we could pack up our things Saturday morning, they would move our bags to a new king room that would be available for our second night stay. We did this before exploring the city on Saturday. That night we returned to the hotel and got our new room. Early in the morning, we were woken up because it was FREEZING in our room and the A/C was quite loud. We tried all we could to adjust it, but it wouldn't shut off at all. I tried putting towels over the A/C with my bags on top because I couldn't take it. Even my boyfriend was freezing, which never happens. That sort of worked, but then we heard dripping. We realized the carpet was soaking wet - the A/C was leaking! That was it; I called the front desk at 3:00 am. They sent someone to come fix it. The next morning, I politely explained our whole experience to a different front desk representative. She said that in terms of compensation, she sees that we were given breakfast passes for the first night stay. For the second night stay, she could give us 30% off. We calmly agreed. But honestly - I was never given an option to choose breakfast OR a discount on my first night stay. I would definitely rather have that. I can get a cheap breakfast anywhere after having to share a double size bed with my boyfriend. I left a comment card explaining how dissatisfied and upset I was. Have I heard back? Nope! It's been two weeks. I am never returning here again. I've told all my friends and family about this place, and I will always remember it. The reviews on Booking Buddy for this place were great, so I was excited. They were wrong. Do NOT book this hotel.
user_name:
CristinaMichelle
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Couple initial comments:1) The lobby is on the second floor, so when you enter the hotel you need to wait for the elevator (see #2)2) The elevators are the slowest I've seen in NY. There are something like 45 floors and only 4 elevators. If you are on a mid-level floor, be prepared to wait up to 15-20 minutes for an elevator in the morning. Guests from higher floors (particularly those checking out) cram the tiny elevators, and they tend to be full by the time they get to the lower levels. Tip: pick a lower floor (guest rooms start on 4) unless you want to be frustrated with waiting for an elevator every time you want to enter or leave the hotel.3) Hilton's Hhonors program allows you to pre-check in and choose your room, but this invalidates you from getting an upgrade. The front desk will give you a hard time if you ask for an upgrade and you've already checked in. The only time I received an upgrade was when I forgot to check in on the internet and got lucky. Per #2, I'm not willing to be stuck on the 35th floor so I just deal with having a tiny room of my choice.Now, about the hotel itself:1) Desperately in need of a facelift in the common areas. The carpet is tired and coming up off the floor near the walls. Shelves in the halls are falling off the wall. Ice machine is broken on the 4th floor as of June 2016. Nearest ice is the 7th floor.2) The halls are *very* narrow. I've seen people really struggling to roll full size luggage around3) Rooms are smaller than average (the Hampton Inn just around the corner is much roomier), and the shower stalls are so small that if you are a large person you will really have a hard time.4) The rooms also desperately need a facelift. My bathroom sink is cracked (a hairline crack along the entire basin), the toilet doesn't flush properly, and several light fixtures don't work.Overall, the only reason I stay here is because it is close to my office and I want to get Hilton points. I'd never spend my own money at this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is lovely, in every way. We were well aware that the elevators were slow -- and they were. Other than that, the hotel is great. We had an amazing view of the Hudson River. The hotel is also in a fine location -- centrally located.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Every time I come they always seem to double charge me for something. Even though they fix it later it's an inconvenience. When I have all these pending charges on my account. Next time I'm going to try another hotel. Also the elavators take forever. I've been coming to this hotel for several years and it's always the same issues.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Let's hit the big topic first. Elevators. Depending on when you leave and return each day, the elevators may or may not be an issue. When I left before 8am, I only had stops at a few floors on the way down. I was on floor 34. No issues. BUT if you are using the elevators to get down around mid-morning or weekends, prepare for long rides. You almost stop at every floor. I did not time it but it felt like over 5 minutes on the elevator. Some folks ride up just so that they can get room on the elevator on the ride down. The reviews are true that they can be really bad depending on the time of day. Get a LOW floor so you can take the stairs. Really.Location - was great b/c I had a course a few blocks away. There are a lot of restaurants and bars nearby but breakfast places can be closed on the weekends. The Seaport area is a short walk and it has a lot of restaurants and shops. Really neat area. Subway is near the hotel and easy to figure out. Our cab ride from LGA was about 60 bucks with tip. We took a limo on the return trip and that was 41 with tip.Room - was clean and nice. Small but that is NYC. There is no breakfast or coffee/tea in the lobby. You are on your own. There is a restaurant right off the elevators which seemed busy for breakfast. There is a Le Pain Quotidien a block away which is a great breakfast place. You can get a small refrigerator delivered to the room if available. They are free. No microwaves in room.Would I stay again? Yes, but there was a Conrad nearby that was about the same rate if you like the Hilton chain.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We were greeted warmly with the famous Doubletree Cookie and even though we had a double room reserved, they were sold out so they gave us 2 adjoining king rooms. The view from the room to lower Manhattan was amazing and the service was fantastic. They paid attention to details and made sure that we were well taken care of. I'll definitely be back!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The room was mostly clean but the bathroom was clearly not completely cleaned. A bottle of cleaning solution was left on the bathroom counter and the shower wasn't completely cleaned. The second day the fire alarm went off incessantly for several hours. The man on the intercom asked us to ignore it but it went on for so long it was difficult to do so.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If a hotel has 440 rooms, and accepts 441 reservations for a particularly night, the 441st reservation is going to be turned away. The manner in which the guest is ”accommodated” can often make the difference between a slightly annoying experience or a truly MISERABLE one. We were that 441st guest on Saturday night the 11th, after a long day on the road, but the experience at this Doubletree was singularly the worst, most incompetent treatment we have ever received at the hands of a hotel. We attribute this experience, not to the poor, beleaguered, desk clerk, but rather to the poor training (any?) that she had received in preparing for what must not be an uncommon overbooking situation (at least from a review I have read from earlier this week of the same hotel!). According to the “folio” we subsequently received by email, we arrived at 11:36 (in fact, it was more like 11:15, but the single desk clerk’s delay in greeting us (she was under the weather, and was, in truth trying to power through her cough) wasted close to 20 minutes. The reservation system was balky, but finally recognized our reservation number. We were finally assigned a room, and with the obligatory offer of chocolate chip cookies, we ascended the elevator to find, upon entering the room that it was already occupied! We felt terrible for the people whose rest we disturbed, and quickly retreated, with apologies. One might think that similar apologies might have followed FROM the desk clerk, but instead, when we returned to the reception desk, we received nothing more than a wide-eyed stare, followed by a silent retreat, into the “administrative office.” Nothing more for 10 minutes, when a young man emerged from another door, with no further information----we had to retell the story of having barged into the already-occupied room. Then HE retreated to the administrative office, finally (another 8 – 10 minutes) emerging to inform us, matter of factly, that there were no available rooms, and that they would instead walk us over to another hotel in the Hilton chain, the Hampton Inn, about 5 minutes away, and that we would “be called by his manager” the next day. NO meaningful apology, nothing to acknowledge that our own discomfort---never mind that of the people whose room we had “invaded,” was the least bit out of the ordinary. Short story: We reached the Hampton on our own steam, they were absolutely fine, and we finally got some sleep. But the experience at the Doubletree will discourage us from dealing wIth Hilton ever again---despite the fact that we are “Hilton Rewards” members. Final points: The “folio” showed that we departed at 12:13 AM. Close to 40 minutes of chaos and inconvenience. And, oh, by the way, no call from the “manager.”

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Wanted to stay at a hotel that was away from all the hubbub of the Midtown area so picked this Double Tree in the Financial District. Overall enjoyed my stay with a few minor exceptions. I had paid a little extra for a room with a "city view" and was given a room on the 44th floor but the view was of Brooklyn and not the Manhattan view I was expecting. The room was quite comfortable and clean and a good size for NYC. There was a bit of hallway noise from doors slamming and the ice machine but not too bad. I compensated for that by turning on the fan of the ac unit which blocked out much of the noise. A nice tip: the hotel provides a free refrigerator if you ask for it at check in. One of the gripes many people have is the slow elevators. Have to say this wasn't a huge issue although I did notice many of the staff using the same elevators to ride up or down a floor or two. There is lots to do in the FiDi with plenty of restaurants and attractions nearby and the R train stop on the corner. I felt completely comfortable taking the subway to Broadway shows and returning late at night. Would stay here again if I had the chance.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed at the Double tree for two nights. I had room at the 16th floor with some view of the city. The rooms are excellent, great restaurant when you can order almost anything. I loved the breakfast. There is a variety to chose from and whether you are a vegetarian or meat eater. A gift shop is within the lobby for those who are too busy to get a last minute gift for family or friend. It's location is great for easy pick up and drop off by taxi. I loved the interior deco.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: a/c so loud that evertime it kicked on we had to raise the volume on the tv. a lot of outside noise all night. elevators broken or slow and we had to walk up and down with our bags. drunk guy in lobby
user_name:
Mandy B
rockland county, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a great hotel for a quick girls weekend in NYC. If you've been to NY before, you will soon realize there is no need to stay in the heart of Times Square. Although it was a bit further, the subway system makes this very accessible. It is a great location as it is close to the water front with easy access to the financial district as well as the water taxis. The hotel was great. It was clean, compact and comfortable, plus the cookies are always an extra bonus. No issues at all during our stay. Our room was cleaned everyday with new towels. Would return when heading back to NY.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed in room 1908 June 6 - 10, 2016. Sixth stay in 3 months. Location in NY Financial District is perfect. Hotel service and maintenance keeps deteriorating. - Phone did not work - A/C noise was worse than a freight train; maintenance could not fix it during the whole stay - No alarm clock in room; when requested, it was dropped off while room was unoccupied, left unplugged on the desk - Sink has many cracks - Toilet flushing mechanism was broken. Paid over $400 a night for a regular king room; definitely not worth the money.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My room is clean, bed is very comfortable, I'm on the 37th floor with a spectacular view of the Freedom Tower. It's also quiet, the shower doesn't leak, the employees are friendly, and the A/C is absolutely kicking on 66 degrees. And I have not experienced one problem with the elevators on a sold out weekend. So, I don't know what everyone else complaining about the elevators is talking about. I consistently go from floor 37 to 1 with no wait and no stops. Also, don't listen to people who say FiDi is boring, head over to Stone Street for dinner to a fantastic Italian and pizza place called Adrienne's Pizzabar. Look it up. It's also quiet and normal around here and not swarming with tourists like Midtown. Enjoy your cookie and your stay!
user_name:
cpheavensbee
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: 44 floors, 10 rooms per floor. Although everything seems to be small, e.g. rooms, elevator, lobby - the hotel is modern and updated. Parking across the street is $40 per night vs. $60 per night at hotel. The only downside is the very slow elevator. Having room for only 8-10 people, the elevator is a challenge with a full hotel in the morning or evening. If not in a hurry, this is a small price for a great location. Two blocks from Battery Park and great dining/bar options. Catch a ferry to Statue of Liberty from Battery Park. Subway is one block away from hotel. Good stay!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Few steps away to the subway, few blocks away from the battery park to go to liberty and ellis island, to wall street, charging bull and starbucks! I only gave 4 stars because of no place to hang your clothes in the bathroom, no fridge nor microwave. Love the cookies!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: You enter on the groundfloor. The great bellman directs you kindly to go to the 2nd floor to register - then you wait for the elevator. Give yourself 10-15 minutes for the elevators which move pretty slowly.I found the reception people to be inconsistent - some quite attentive, others did not want to hear your needs.The room was ok, we had a street view. But the temperature was difficult to regulate. The only herbal tea is chamomile and the I could not figure out how to get a full cup of water from the coffee maker.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a nice hotel in a very good location if you have business in lower Manhattan. It's within easy walking distance to a lot of great restaurants and attractions such as Battery Park, the Statue of Liberty, the Staten Island Ferry, Liberty Park, the World Trade Center and moreTypical of downtown hotels, the building footprint and rooms tend to be smaller than what I'm used to but overall very clean and comfortable.The staff were also very professional and helpful as is typical of Hilton staff.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Elevators are inadequate for the building size. Shower leaked. Air conditioning stopped working after first night. You get what you pay for because price was a major consideration in the choice to stay here.
user_location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
user_name:
Ray D
Washington, District of Columbia, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: 1.Warning for somebody plans to drive to New York.The hotel doesn't have car park.Me and my friend arrived hotel very late.We followed hotel staff's instruction to park our car at the nearest car park yet found it wan't opened. So we found somewhere else to park the car. It costs us around US$50 per night and total US$250 during our stay.2.It takes forever for hotel staff to answer their "Careline'.Neither me and my friend bring any tooth paste, it wasn't provided yet you can call their "Careline" to ask for it. One time I called at 11 am, I waited like at least half an hour to have them answer. And another 10 minutes with second call to have my tooth paste delivered. And they provided two small bags at one time...3.The shower room is quite small.(This could be understandable since it's New York)The stool is somehow wobbling.The curtain couldn't block all sunlight from outside it's kinda annoying when we woke up.4. The only advantage I can think of this hotel is good location and free wifi.Close to a pharmacy and subway stations.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed there for the weekend. It's a good location. The 9/11 sight, battery park and wall street is with in a half mile. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms are very small and could us a up grade. Some the light switch panel's were broken also the ac unit was leaking water on the floor. Don't pay extra for a city view not worth it ours was look at a rusty roof top ac unit. Thus also located very close to several subway stations.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is located near several attractions. The rooms are reasonably priced. Because you're in NYC, space is at a premium, but our room was larger than expected.The best thing about the hotel, by far, was the friendly service we received. Two different bellmen--one named Henry and the other whose name I didn't catch--spoke excitedly with our young children and made them very happy. Every time we came into the hotel, they greeted us warmly and chatted as we waited for our elevator. We were very pleased with this.There were two drawbacks to the hotel, although one is so specific as to not matter to most people.There aren't many elevators, and with so many floors to cover, you could be waiting a while. The elevators are pretty small, too, so you and your family may not always fit on the first one if it has other riders when it arrives.Finally, for those traveling with service dogs, there aren't any good places to relieve your companion near the hotel. I had to go with my guide dog to the end of the block, near the pharmacy, where there was a small patch of concrete he could use. Obviously, this is not the hotel's fault, but it did add some mild stress to my visit and is worth noting if you travel with a service dog.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: the Hotel Double Tree in Manhattan has a very good location friendly staff ready to help in any way , giving maps of New York and explaining all questions needed by the guest The hotel is very clean and very clean rooms also just missing a mini bar very clean rooms good restaurant

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I just spent a weekend at this hotel with my son and it was very convenient and nice. I used to live in NYC, and recently moved to a different state, but I keep going to the city to visit friends and places. This time I wanted to go alone with my 2-year old and stay at a hotel in Manhattan instead of at my friends' places in Brooklyn. I mention that because the location of this hotel is perfect if you are going to be visiting both boros. The hotel doesn't have a garage, which in Manhattan is a bit of an issue, but they do have a special rate at a garage in the next block, the Icon. Even with the discount, it was pricey, especially because my large SUV had a whooping $40 per night supplement... city things that I do not miss... what can we do. At least it was discounted. The lobby was nice, not very large, but again, lower Manhattan is like this, the rooms though are nice. We were in a beautiful room on the 36th floor, with a fantastic window facing the new Freedom Tower. We got there late friday night, and my son was so excited looking out the window, he was looking down at the tiny people and tiny cars, up at the beautiful lit-up tower... I can imagine for a tourist, this view is worth a million dollars, it is 100% what we all want to see when we go to NYC. Now, I called twice to make sure I could get a bathtub, they told me my room would have a bathtub, and for me that was kind of important because my little one doesn't love showers, he prefers a bath. Well, the room did not have a bathtub, but the shower was really big and he could be as in or as out the water as he wanted. Most people won't be affected by that point, but it is the fact that I called twice to make sure. Anyway, it worked out, it was just 3 days. The staff was super nice, helped me around with the stroller, the bags, in the rain... and when we left, the bellboy whispered to me "Can I give him a cookie?" and I nodded smiling, he went running to a back room and came back with half a dozen cookies "for our trip" so nice, such a nice little thing to do. The location is super convenient, we woke up early on saturday and just 1 block down the street we took to the free ferry to Staten Island, which takes you next to the Statue of Liberty and then the view when you are returning and are approaching the city from the bottom, is like woah. Very recommended for tourists too. My son, if you have little ones you will understand this :), he was super excited to be seeing the statue and that view because it appears in the famous Minions :) and now everywhere he sees the statue in a commercial or anything he says NEW YORK!! and it was free :) The hotel is next to an R station which takes you all the way up to Central Park, Times sq, Macys, Union Sq... name it. And down to Brooklyn and almost Coney Island (one transfer). Very convenient!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: A great location. Near Battery Park, Wall Street, Brooklyn Bridge and many other NY sites. Hotel is average. Small and compact. The day I checked in the shower handle came off in my hand. I called the front desk and someone was there within 5 min to repair. Was offered a new room which I declined. Repair was made quickly. Hotel elevators (only 3) are slow. The adjoining resultant uses them frequently as well. With this being high rise hotel, the elevator wait can be 5 min.+. Staff was very friendly and eager to resolve any issues.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Spent one night here for work. It was a great location for an event I attended on Wall Street. Breakfast was good. Otherwise - lots of issues. Someone came into my room while I was getting ready (room was locked), I called for room service twice and no answer (gave up), I had two conditioners and no shampoo, air conditioning would not adjust. Very disappointed!
user_name:
Bella S
Cary, North Carolina, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very noisy construction project across street never mentioned. Hotel overbooked rooms with 2 queen beds and put my son and I in a king plus sofa bed. No sheets, etc. for the sofa bed. No housekeeping service first night. No concierge. Front desk staff don't know area, and can't handle anything without checking with manager (add 20 minutes waiting time). 3 very slow elevators completely inadequate - walked up to 5th floor multiple times. Shower door leaks onto floor. Room service food lukewarm. Avoid this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We booked the Double Tree for a great rate over the Memorial Day Holiday. Very comfortable rooms and helpful staff. Unfortunately, there are way more rooms and floors than the elevators can accommodate. Also, a fire alarm went off while we were there and while it was a false alarm, no one made an announcement. We stayed on a lower floor but those on the top would have made over 30 flights before learning - likely from someone else in the stairwell.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: First and foremost, this hotel is in a great location. It's right by Wall Street, 15 min walk to the 9/11 Memorial, close to the Staten Island ferry, 10 min walk to Brooklyn Bridge and you've got great subway access. They also give you nice warm cookies at check in. That just about sums up the good stuff. This is one of those in and out hotels. It really offers no additional incentives to guests. Zero glitz. Just a room and a shower. The hotel rooms (for a King) are tiny. The hallways are veeery tiny. The bathroom is an ok size, but I couldn't get the water to stop leaking through the glass doors. I ended up having to shower pressed up against the wall so that the water wouldn't puddle on the bathroom floor. the base for the shower nob rotated, like it wasn't installed properly. The carpet seemed a bit moist to me - maybe it was a bit humid? The bed was comfy, but there were flies in the room. Tiny ones, maybe a bit bigger than fruit flies. Again, maybe because of the humidity. Our last full day there, the AC gave out. Only the fan worked. we called to get it looked at and when we got back from dinner, everything was the same. We called again and were told that it was probably the compressor and that they could switch us to another room. They did, and it was nice and cool - but it smelled some. and that AC looked as if someone had let their frustration out on it... I didn't have a problem with the front desk at all. everyone was pleasant. However, when we got there, two people were in line complaining about their rooms. One of those guests got a bit snippy with the receptionist and she told the lady that she'd be with her in a minute but she kind of lost her temper and rolled her eyes visibly and in front of everyone at the guest (I mean I get it, but if you're in the hospitality field, you need to keep that in check, or private). We had arrived too early to check in so we left our bags with the bellman. When we returned, the bags were unattended. on the group floor. and we stood there for about 5 min. until someone showed up(a different bellman). We could see our bags and contemplated just grabbing them ourselves. I thought it was horrible that all of these suitcases were just left there, by the door, for anyone to grab. Every morning and afternoon there was this tray of used plates on the floor by the elevator doors. not moved. at all. i pointed it out the morning after we arrived and another guest told me that he'd seen it there since two days before. Maybe they were new plates each day, but it made me wonder ... We knew about the elevators ahead of time, per the reviews, and we had decided that it wasn't a deal breaker. it's not horrible unless you're in a hurry. at least two were working and we didn't mind waiting too much - until we were late, but when we planned ahead we were ok. The view itself wasn't good. Construction in between buildings. So if you go, you basically only go for a place to shower and sleep. I guess it served our purpose, but if I'd do it again, I wouldn't stay here. and I wouldn't recommend it to any of my friends. I'd much rather have paid the extra $30-$50 and stayed elsewhere

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is right in the heart of downtown financial district. Two blocks from the New York Stock Exchange, near train, easy access to the city and Brooklyn. The security staff was very friendly, helped hail a cab and provided directions when needed. Only complaint was that housekeeping was a little loud while cleaning the rooms nearby.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was comfortable for the night. I believe their target clientele is persons travelling for business because the rooms were just appropriate with minimal luxury, including a shower cap which by all standards is not a luxury but we had to ask for it and we were informed it was not available but was later delivered, after i had taken the shower. The shower room is tiny such that if you start showering while facing the front, you cannot turn until you are done. If you happen to drop your soap, you have to stop the shower open the door to get sufficient room to pick it up. The bed was very comfortable, especially after a day of walking around Manhattan, nothing could be better for the body and soul. The staff were good to deliver the service and nothing more. Maybe that's just how it is in New York but being an East African and experienced the hospitality of the likes of Double Tree By Hilton at Stone town Zanzibar, this was below par.We were tourists and from the hotel it was a walking distance to wall street and everything financial about New York. The charging bull was right outside the hotel, we walked back after the Statue of liberty tour. The location is perfect to reach most tourist places in New York. I would stay at the hotel again but i will remember to bring my own shower cap.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: To start off the elevator takes forever. Upon arriving the people checking people in had attitudes. I don't care if this is New York you treat people with common courtesy even if they are making a mistake. A lady opened up the drink canister to get ice from inside with her hand and the man behind the front desk starts telling her how she's not suppose to do that and proceeds to mad dog her and dumps the ice. He puts the canister back and is saying things to her without looking at her face trying to bully. That is now how you handle yourself professionally even if she was being a disgusting pig. The hotel hallways are not air conditioned, it's really nice while you wait forever for the slow elevator. The carpet was gross and black. Nobody was there to greet you upon arrival or departure. Nobody to hail a cab or if you needed help with luggage or cart. We called the front desk on three separate occasions and nobody picked up. IVE NEVER IN MY LIFE STAYED AT A HOTEL WHERE THE FRONT DESK DIDNT ANSWER!!! The bed was comfy and it was suppose to be a king but was the size of a queen. The shower pressure every two min or so would scald you. The maid were very nice though! The hotel was very quiet that is about the only nice thing and the location and price. Will never stay here again!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The room was correct and the hotel is well located. However on our first night we did not have the room we have booked and the baby crib and bedsheets were not ready... We ended up having them 45 min after asking again! It was 2.45am so you can imagine how upset was the baby! also we paid 40$/day to have the car parked at the south William parking/icon next to the hotel. When we came 3 days later to pick up the car they have parked, we ended up with scratches on our rear bumper! we will not go back to this place at our next weekend in NYC and are not recommending this to our friends and colleagues, especially the parking!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Even though this hotel is in a business focused location, I stayed here for leisure purposes and still found it to be well located to get on the subway to travel all over the city. Mostly the hotel was very comfortable, although the room had a slightly unfinished feel to it where some of the fixtures were broken or missing. See picture for how the corridor outside my room looked when I arrived! When you check in be sure to ask for a room on a lower floor so you can use the stairs rather than wait for the VERY slow elevators.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good: The reason we chose this hotel was that the place my wife had to for work was a block away. The location is nice.. I would have preferred living in mid-town but this hotel saved us some commute time.Bad/Needs improvement:- Tiny rooms: The rooms a super small and there is no space to walk or move around. It was a pain to have a little baby in the room who wants to move around.- Not clean: The bath rooms had mildew everywhere and the bed sheets were torn or dirty. I had to get the replaced a couple of times.- BAD Staff: The staff here sucks big time. As we were travelling with a baby we asked them to help us with sterilization of bottles. First night they did it without any issues. The next morning when we called them, we were told the microwave is not working and it will get fixed in a couple of hours. Till 10PM at night they keep telling us the same thing. Once i ran out of patience, I told them to let me talk to the manager, at that time they told me that the microwave is fine but they cant let us use it as it is for their staff only. (are you kidding me!!!). They could have told me at 8AM and i could have made alternate arrangements.We escalated this issue to the higher management and they said they can help us change the hotel and will talk to the hotel staff. but nothing happened.We stayed their for 5 nights and could not sterilize bottles as they did not let us get a microwave either. Over all, never going back to this hotel again. To the manager and corporate: I am not longer going to stay at your hotel and will make sure none of my friends or colleagues stay at double tree. This hotel does not live up to the brand name associated with it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was in a great location and had the subway right across from it. The staff at the hotel was extremely nice and helpful. It being a NY hotel, space is always and issue but the rooms were very decent in size and the very clean.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Excellent rooms, wonderful staff -- attentive to all details. The front desk staff were quick and friendly .. Rooms were comfortable, with great city view. I would like to add that Alan the doorman is exceptionally helpful

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very disappointed in the Hotel, it was difficult to get. Taxi, the elevators were slow, , rooms were small, hallways were small, I had a problem with a authorization form that I filled out to charge my clients room because I was not going to be there when she checked in.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: On the plus side:- comfortable bed- clean bathroom - cookie on arrival Things that make you pause & wonder...- why there's an imprint of an iron on the wall?- the air conditioning unit looks like it lost a wrestling match- the random dingy hanger which they clearly got from the local dry cleaners- why it would take 4 calls over 24 hours to get a shower cap and a toothbrush?It's barely average, but inhabitable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed two nights at the DoubleTree Hotel in Financial District, and while the hotel looks nice on picture, the experience wasn't the same for us. The place is elegant but the service was not. We are HHonors Diamond Elite members, and we absolutely didn't feel any difference in treatment with any other guests during our stay. When we asked about our benefits (free continental breakfast for 2, room upgrade, free Wi-fi, etc.), the front desk clerk had to verify that information and ask her manager if this was OK for us to have free breakfast, as if we were trying to take advantage of them! The room we were given was high in the floor but still standard, not a Suite with a view of the East River. The insulation in the building is not that good, so you can hear toilet flushing, guests taking showers, etc. The breakfast was given at the adjacent Italian restaurant on the first floor, and the staff was also rude (or inexperienced). The waiter would pour already coffee in your cup even before asking if you wanted any. I was also suffering from a foot injury with a cast and walking with a cane, and as the staff seemed busy doing nothing or figuring out what to do when we walked in. I took the initiative to take table in the back where I could seat down. A waiter asked me to stand up again and to take a different table since this one was already reserved! I found out from other guests (met in the elevator) who were seated next to it that this wasn't true and the table was still available even after they leaved! This hotel gets overcrowded with tourists and we had sometimes to wait a good 15 minutes to get into the elevators. At the checkout, the same staff was still as unfriendly and we were looking forward to leave. There are lots of hotels in New York, and I will definitely not go back to that one!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We have stayed in numerous hotels in the city but t his was our first time staying in the financial district and this hotel was perfect! It's a small hotel and not easily found but it is very clean. The rooms are well laid out to maximize space and the bed was super comfy!The best thing about the hotel is the staff! EVERY staff member we encountered - from the front desk, to maintenance, bellhops, and cleaning crew - were so very courteous and friendly. EVERY one of them always greeted us with a smile and friendly word and always wished us a happy day! GREAT JOB DOUBLETREE STAFF!!!! Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel is convenient to subway stops and Battery Park. Hotel is very narrow - halls are very narrow. Only 10 rooms on a floor or so. The elevators are very small and for someone with claustrophobia they can feel very uncomfortable quickly when people are loading them up. Next time I would ask for a lower floor - so that I could walk down more easily. Hotel personnel are very nice. When we first checked in - we went to the 36th floor and the keys didn't work. A bellman was right behind us and his key wouldn't work either so we waited for someone from engineering who came in about 5 minutes. He replaced batteries in the door lock and then it worked fine. I would recommend the location and price.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: 2nd floor lobby. 44 stories. Staff is courteous. Narrow halls. Rooms are small & narrow but clean & comfortable. Bed was very comfortable. Window units for heating and air conditioning. Updated small bathroom. I liked the stall shower instead of a tub shower. Adequate breakfast is included. (Cereal, Muffins, fruit, yogurt, etc,) Parking is very expensive. $60 for 24 hrs. by valet or $40 in a garage a couple of blocks walk. Good stop-over for the price.
user_name:
Doris L
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I've stayed in a lot of hotels in NY. This is the bottom of the list so far...Small room, dirty carpets, old tired bathroom, last occupants clothes under the bed, bedside lamps falling apart. remote control missing and safe didnt work. There are a lot of better hotels than this one!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Rooms were a good size, free coffee, wifi and TV. Bed was really comfortable. Service was good and just around the corner from a number of tube stations. The attached restaurant was good too. Good range of local attractions, pubs and tour buses. The ferry was great!The only down side was that it is a very tall, thin building so it was hard to judge the weather and was somewhat windy!
user_name:
Paul J
Newton Le Willows, United Kingdom

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotels strength is its location and the Italian restaurant on the ground floor. Reception is hard working but the problem is the lifts and the room service. Room service is at best lackluster and allow at least 10 extra minutes for the lifts. Basically for a 40 floor hotel three small lifts are not sufficient.
