I was also disappointed to be bought a limo when requesting a taxi and in particular a limo that could not take credit cards efficiently.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good hotel at the right area if you need to stay at the financial district or close to battery park, highways to NJ or the south. I didn't use much of the hotel facilities but what I have seen looks good. The housekeeping is perfect! One comment is that not all the lights worked in the room - hotel staff of this class should verify that all lights are working on a daily basis.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for a business gathering in the financial district. This is not a well-conceived hotel. Small rooms are par for the course in NYC, but one should not have to line up for elevators at peak times. Apparently, there are only three of them, and they double as service elevators. Bathroom was tight. Poor value for the price. Had a much better experience a couple of months ago at the Residence Inn a few of blocks up Broadway -- had a free breakfast, too, and still within walking distance of anything that would bring you to lower Manhattan.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is supposed to be 4 star hotel..In general clean with some awful exception (see remote contr. photo).there is no even bottle of water in the room, no fridge. It took me literally 13min waiting for a lift when checking out... the "view" I had was a wall of other building(see photo), but I guess this is just standard for most of hotel in Mannhatan.Located in a quiet neighborhood (fin. district) not far from the Brooklyn Bridge and ferries . didn't have opportunity to taste the food so can't describe.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Comfortable living. They do need to put attention to modern environmental thinking though: all the towels and opened soaps were replaced by new ones everyday, which is not necessary, only a huge waste of resources.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If you're looking for just a bed and shower then you're probably fine. But this hotel definitely doesn't cater to the business traveler. The rooms are ridiculously small. There was only space for the bed and desk. The bathrooms were also smaller than normal and that's saying something for NYC standards. Also, found an ant crawling in my shower so needless to say I cancelled my reservation for next week and will try a different hotel in the area. The breakfast buffet (free for Diamond HHonors members) was very basic, eggs, bacon, sausage, pastries and fruit. And also the breakfast area felt very enclosed and I definitely will be taking my meals to go. Overall, I wouldn't go back to the hotel because there are definitely better options around the area. But the staff seemed friendly and the bellman were very helpful and nice.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Close to transportation, a few blocks from Battery Park, quite a few places close by to eat. Hotel was clean, staff was pleasant. Could see the Freedom Tower from our window. Had a nice stay in New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Two minds about this hotel. I got it at a very decent price (via priceline) and probably for the price it was fine. Its in the financial district, and close to the Freedom Tower, Wall Street and the Stock Exchange and also to loads of public transport. But as a tourist, there is not really much else going on in that area and on the weekends its a very quiet neighbourhood.The rooms themselves are fine, if on the slightly smaller side.One major annoyance, they only have two elevators and about 40 floors, meaning you end up having to wait ages to get the lift and sometimes you might have to wait a few times as its often quite packed.Front desk service however was very pleasant and helpful. You also get warm cookies when you arrive, which is a treat!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: this is not as nice as your typical doubletree. This is old and if you are going to be hanging out in Manhattan the location is terrible as it is very far from everything. Word elevator ever. So slow and goes up instead of down and vise versa. Everyone in the hotel was complaining and it took 15 minutes for the elevator to arrive once the button was pushed and then it was usually full. This happened two times in a row. Tried to take the stairs but 24 floors is pretty far!! Called for extra towels and wash cloths that never arrived. Would not stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff was friendly, the hotel was clean and modern. Great location for the area and it was easy to get to trains and ferries from the hotel. It was also a great check in and check out process. Everything was quick and easy and had help from the desk staff to apply a Hilton gift card I had.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: At the time of booking for our trip, this was great value for money. If returning to Manhattan I would not book this hotel again though. The Pro's : Fantastic, Friendly StaffGreat LocationCleanGood valueThe Con's :Couldn't always get seated at breakfastQuite noisyLack of facilities Doesn't have its own bar (although the Tavern next door is a fun friendly place) The view wasn't as expected (not what I'd call a city view and I was on the 34th floor) The bed was really hard(which may suit some)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The Hotel is in a great location, right at the heart of NYC Financial District. The Hotel is ok but is a bit tired and could do with some modernisation. I had a room on the 22nd floor. The rooms are relatively small and a bit dark and soulless. The beds are extremely comfortable though and the shower is powerful and refreshing. Wifi is good and fast. Staff are friendly and helpful. The worst thing though is the elevators. They take an age to come and are often full. Don't expect to catch one in a hurry at busy times.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I love the Hilton Chain of hotels and they are always my first preference. The rooms were much smaller and narrow and I believe that is the culture of NY buildings. The food was great, and the staff at the hotel were awesome!!!!!!
user_name:
Temeka T
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If you are in a rush in the morning, know that you will have to budget 10 min to wait for the elevator and the many stops on the way. There are more than 40 floors after all. Other than that, it's your run of the mill doubletree. Decently updated and reasonable bathroom size for NYC.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for the Great Saunter - a 32 mile walk around the entire island of Manhattan. The starting point is right around the corner from the hotel at the Fraunces Tavern. The front desk and bell desk are very warm, friendly and welcoming as well as being very helpful. The hotel can get busy with tourist groups so be aware the elevators can get busy. The rooms are small but clean. You get two water bottles and a warm cookie upon check in. Housekeeping is very efficient and my room was cleaned quickly each day. I had breakfast in their restaurant which is small but the food was quite good and the service was excellent. It was very easy to do some sightseeing by getting on the subway. On the weekend, the financial district is not so busy so it was nice to walk around without large crowds.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This seemed like a very nice, conservative business hotel when we checked in. We had a decent enough sleep, and wanted to go out early and find some breakfast. What we found was a wet, dripping used condom hanging from the doorknob on the outside of the room! I was beside myself, and beyond disgusted. When I called the front desk, they didn't seem surprised at all. After another call, they sent someone up to remove it and clean the door. However, they did NOT even offer me a refund or comp of some sort for the emotional disturbance this caused. Totally unacceptable. I would not ever stay here again because of how this was handled.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here with friends when my husband did the 5Boro Bike Ride last week. It was a great location to stay for this event. The hotel is clean and comfortable; the staff is helpful and pleasant. They were very accommodating to all of the bikers....bikes were allowed to be stored in guests' rooms. The rooms are small but it is New York and the rates were very reasonable. We were able to check in early; we arrived about 1PM. the hotel is located within easy walking distance of wonderful restaurants, Battery Park, the World Trade Center Memorial and other places of interest. We would go back. There are computers in the business lounge and a nice restaurant.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good overall hotel in financial district. Nice touch that a warm cookie and water is provided at check in. Staff friendly and welcoming. Rooms are a decent size for NYC. Many restaurants near by (walking distance) as well as one adjacent to the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My first time staying at the DoubleTree in the Financial District and I will be back. I can't say enough about the staff and the warm welcome I received each time I walked through the doors. I was so impressed that I persoanlly collected the names of the staff to ensure management knew how satisfied I was. Allen, Kelliani, Hopton, and Sally are excellent representatives of the DoubleTree brand and should be rewarded for their excellent customer service. Thank you for making my trip a memorable experience.Lamar H. Panama City, Florida

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Checked in on Saturday (in town for the 5 Boros bike tour). It was a little early so I wasn't expecting much - turns out our room was ready but it turns out a "double room" means a double bed, not two beds (so be advised when on the DoubleTree website!). Anyhow, Damien, the front desk clerk, went above and beyond getting us a room with 2 beds. So lucky us. The staff directed us to local parking, saved a ton on parking the bikes (they would have let us take them to the room but - the room wasn't ready and they will watch luggage but not bikes). Icon parking charges $7.00/day for bike storage, cars are $40.00/day). Granted the room was a little small, but hey, the shower was hot with good pressure, it was clean, the staff was terrific. See you next year!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is in an excellent location in lower Manhattan. It is a quiet area especially on weekends. It is close to excellent restaurants(some historic). There is a parking garage right across the street which is very convenient and accommodating(garage is not a hotel owned). The hotel is in walking distance of Battery Park, Ferry to Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island, 9/11 Memorial, Brooklyn Bridge, Trinity Church, St. Paul's chapel, Liberty Church, Broad Street. This was our second stay and we retuned because we liked the area and hotel so much. It is a great place for family.
user_name:
Elizabeth B
schenectady, ny, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great service and very clean. The subway system entrance is right across the street. A lot of nice restaurants and bars in the area with very good food. Also, a few coffee shops less the a block away, which was a great way to start the morning. The 2 only issue is the hotel is 44 floors, so if you are on the topposite it takes a while to go up and down due to the stops. Also, the room is very small. It didon't matter because we were out all day but if you have lost of luggage it could make it very tight.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel itself is fine and in a good location close to Battery Park. However, someone from hotel staff or housekeeping stole the bag with our 6-year old daughter's bike helmet and all of our numbers for the TD 5-Boro Bike Ride (worth $500) the day before the event. Fortunately the race managers are working with authorities to find the people who used the numbers so hopefully we'll track them down.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hilton Honors member only had small room with 2 double beds, offered me points to take small room which never materialized, dirty, elevators are horribly slow, computer system down on checkout, receipt still hasn't made it to Hilton website for printing, called hotel to get receipt emailed but Hotel computer was down, called back and call got dropped, called back later and put on hold for 10 minutes, staff unfriendly. Simply an horrible hotel .. they are only in business because of location and relatively cheap rates

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is in a great location, close to transportation and all the lower Manhattan attractions. Many restaurants and bars within walking distance. The rooms are tiny but clean and comfortable. No storage in bathroom , no refrigerator. We had a king size bed that seemed to have been shortened as our feet were off the end and neither of us is that tall .The walls and windows are paper thin. We were on the 37 floor and you still heard all the street noise. Anytime someone opens their room door it sounds like they are coming into your room. We were woken up several times each night this way. While waiting for elevators you can hear conversations and televisions through the walls This morning I got 5, yes 5 wake up calls by 7:15 that I didn't order on a morning I hoped to sleep in a bit.The elevators are horrible. 3 small slow elevators for 44 floors. If you get off at the lobby on 2 it's impossible to get one going up as they are so crowded. At 5:00 I waited on line about 15 minuets to get an elevator. A trip to get ice, machines are on every 3rd floor took nearly 20 minuets.Would stay somewhere else.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Right across the Whitehall Subway station R line in downtown Manhattan, exit Stone St. or a few more steps to the 4 or 5 lines Station Bowling Green. Ferry Terminal to the Staten Island Ferry, State of Liberty, Ellis Island. Wall street and so much more is just a few Minutes Away. Nice clean Room, i had a nice big Junior Suite on 4th Floor. Comfortable Bed but bit short. Ofcorse mabe better views on higher floors, but i think nobody is here to have views why it's just a short walk to have the best views from the Battery Park or Brooklyn Bridge Park. Bit special that when you enter the Hotel (by the way not easy to see) there is an Italian Restaurant, the reception you find on 2th floor. And for Manhattan realy good Prices at all. Good Dinner at the Restaurant, average American Breakfast, not that wide selection but ok.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Location, location, location! The hotel is close to 3 subway stations and the Staten Island ferry terminal. Perfect for a few days' stay in NY! The rooms are fine, though rather small. Walls are pretty thin. Service was fine. The room was clean and had coffee facilities but no mini bar. Would stay again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If you are attending an event in Battery Park, this hotel has the best proximity. Walking distance makes it very accessible to the park. The weekend rates are typically lower, being that it's in Wallstreet financial district. If you stay on a high floor, expect a long wait for the elevators. The restaurant is nice and serves a good breakfast. Get a room away from an ice machine, they are very loud when dispensing ice in the middle of night.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was an excellent location for staying in the Battery Park area, very close proximity to The Statue of Liberty Tours, Ellis Island, and the World Trade Center. This was a trip for my Grandaughters birthday she had a wonderful time and we would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I know It's been said many times, but the elevator situation is miserable! Bring it up, and front desk will roll their eyes at you. I'm sure they hear it all the time. They either need a solution or better talking points for personnel. Plan to wait, wait, wait. Rooms are compact, but that's New York. Location was close to a good selection of restaurants and bars, but many are closed on weekends.Unlikely I'll stay here again given the major frustration of coming/going to the room

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We weren't sure what to expect, but we were pleasantly surprised. We really enjoyed our stay at the DoubleTree in the Financial District. The location is great; near many good restaurants, taverns, shopping, Battery Park, and much more.Our room was very clean and nicely appointed. We stayed on the 40th floor which made for a nice view. However, fair warning, it was good that we weren't in a hurry because the elevators are not fast! Please keep that in mind if you have dinner reservations - just allow some extra time. Overall, it was lovely and we'd stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The Double Tree in FiDi NYC is a great hotel. Our room was very clean and well kept. The location of the hotel near the subway made it easy to travel around the city. The staff was exceptional, the best was the evening door man. Wish I knew his name because he went above and beyond the call of duty helping me and my BFF get to Brooklyn for a special event. I would recommend this hotel to anyone any time. It will be at the top of my list of places to stay in NYC.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I would stay in this hotel much more regularly if it weren't for the elevators. It has a nice breakfast/restaurant, decent rooms, and usually reasonably priced. But the elevator situation must be addressed. It can take 3-4 minutes for an elevator to come. I noticed that many guests had taken to walking down the steps (as I did) and saw one women with her luggage topple down a full flight of stairs. It was very fortunate that she wasn't badly injured. The hotel simply isn't so big that it cannot be serviced by 3 elevators.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The Double Tree was one of the nicer hotels I've stayed at in NYC. The price is a great value. I had a standard room and it was an average size room for NYC standards. It was clean and modern. The only small negative was the slow elevators but nothing that would make me not come back. I would definitely recommend the hotel!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel was comfortable and staff were pleasant but some things were overlooked. My room was not cleaned while I was gone for 9 hours and when I called to get it cleaned in the evening they didn't do a thorough job. Wake up calls didn't work, either. Those little things mean a lot.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Noisy location. Woken up each day at 7am with outside noise and construction. Also, No cold water in room (so no showers!). Repeated calls couldn't get the issue resolved. Delays with elevators and being full with staff switching floors is extremely annoying.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was one of the worst NYC hotels I have ever been in! Terrible value, when there are so many hotels in NYC to choose from! It needs a total makeover! The rooms were cramped; the bed was very uncomfortable; the shower leaked onto the bathroom floor; the desk staff was disinterested; the lobby was practically bare; the restaurant was over-priced for the quality of the food; and, the elevators were slowest I have ever experienced! The only bright spot in the whole hotel was the doorman. I will never stay there again!
user_name:
Sandra O
New York City, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is very clean, efficient, and comfortable! One of the most comfortable beds I have experience during my travels! Hotel staff are very efficient and friendly! Made my business trip most enjoyable!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is very convenient for a short stay in lower Manhattan. The rooms are on the small side (as are many in NYC), but they are clean and functional. The location is great to visit the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, Brooklyn Bridge, World Trade Center, etc. As others have noted, the delay for the elevators can be maddening at times.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is within a few blocks of the Yellow, Green, Red and Brown subway lines. Great location. Friendly staff. Nice bars and restaurants within walking distance. The elevators are crowded and slow, however.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Average hotel with very slow elevator service! Rooms are small, but normal for NYC. As a regular Hilton customer, given a choice, I would prefer the Millenium Hilton if revisiting the area. We did not use restaurant facilities so unable to offer comments on food.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We were in town for a college revisit, but this hotel would work great for sightseeing too -- steps to the Statue of Liberty or other ferries, and near the twin towers memorial and financial district. If you want to go to a Broadway show, the R train from Times square will drop you off literally 30 yards from the hotel. (late night eats at Murphy's Tavern, next door, are a plus.) The only tip I have is, keep in mind this is a TALL, NARROW, hotel. If you really want to stay on the higher floors, build in time to wait for the elevators!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: No cold water in the bathroom. Not enough elevators to serve guest so it takes time just to get to the guest reception area to check in, to check out, and to reach your room.Bedding is very lumpy and not the typical "Hilton" quality. Cannot find any menu for in-room dining.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is ideally situated for a short visit to New York. Restaurants, places to visits and feeling the city is experienced when you stay in this hotel. Also quite easy to get to the major airports.
user_name:
Nico J
Port Elizabeth, South Africa

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was not impressed with this hotel--the elevators as many people have noted in their reviews were miserable to deal with and despite reporting the situation I did not have any cold water in the bathroom. I also found the room to be on the small side as well.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We booked this hotel through Hotwire, which we do quite frequently when booking hotels for NYC and have never had issues before. When we checked in last night, we discovered we were in a handicap room with only a single double bed. When we called the front desk to ask to be moved, they basically blamed it on Hotwire and told us they're was nothing we could do. I was annoyed, but figured I would deal with it since we were only here for two nights. When my husband went to get in the shower this morning, he discovered the shower head was busted. This resulted in water spraying over the entire bathroom (and my dress for a wedding tonight, which was hanging in the bathroom because the closet was designed for someone in a wheelchair and thus too short to hang my dress). When we called the front desk, they again basically blew us off. They told us they're fully booked and, besides, we booked our hotel through Hotwire. I guess they take that to mean they don't have to provide even decent customer service. My husband finally got them to say they'll send someone up to take a look, yet here we are, 30 minutes later, and no one has visited our room. I don't know about you, but I sure love my whole entire day of plans going down the drain because of someone's deplorable customer service. I frequently book Hilton hotels both directly through Hilton and third parties and have never received such poor customer service. I would not recommend this hotel no matter how you decide to book it.
user_name:
RMar03
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Although this hotel is conveniently located in the financial district of NY I would not really advice it. Better spend a few bucks more. The reception is on the second floor and everybody can just enter the hotel. The rooms are small and noisy. People were talking on the corridor and the reconstruction around the hotel kept me awake.
user_name:
Paul D
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very small rooms and common spaces. No storage in the bathroom. No attention to details: no complimentary water, hair dryer was broken, wifi very slow. Heater was so noisy I could not sleep. The only positive experience was the welcome cookie

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Had some friends in town for the weekend and everyone had a great time and the hotel was wonderful! The financial district is nice and quiet from the normal noise the city can produce and the staff made us feel welcomed as some were coming from out of town.
user_name:
Jeff S
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff at this facility are like my second family, it starts at the entrance with Luis and Hopkin and goes to the Front Desk where James Faughnan and Kelliani or Ana always greet your arrival with a smile to Brian Davey who always tries to help me out when difficult travel circumstances require managements assistance. Thank you all for making my travel life easier.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: While hotel has a great location for anyone needing to be close to the financial district, the hotel was disappointing. My shower door leaked so badly that the bath mat was completely soaked and water was running beyond the area of the bath mat causing a very slippery situation. I had to wring out the mat and then use my other towels to dry the floor so that I could stand in the bathroom to finish getting ready. Everyone mentions the elevators so we knew to expect the long waits. Since we had a lot of time to wait for the elevator to arrive, we were able to really take note of the surroundings. Someone had gotten room service and the finished tray sat outside the room's door for at least two days. Also, it did not appear that the carpet in the hallway was ever vacuumed.We opted for the hotel restaurants breakfast buffet on Saturday morning and were quite disappointed that the $18 per person charge had a 20% service charge added to the total. Seriously, I have had better free breakfasts at low end hotel chains, so paying nearly $50 for two people was outrageous. Oh, and in addition to the 20% service charge that was added in, the receipt still had a tip line. Skip the hotel breakfast buffet and head to Flavors, Au Bon Pain, Starbucks, or even Dunkin Donuts and I guarantee you'll have a more enjoyable experience. Next visit, I am determined to look elsewhere. I understand it's nyc and everything's expensive but this place needs work.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I had a friend fly up to attend an event over the weekend. We decided to make a weekend of it and stay in the city. This is my favorite area to stay on the weekend. Pearl Street and all of its little restaurants is right around the corner, the subway entrance in across the street and it is not as busy on the weekends. I was very impressed with how clean the property was and every member of the staff was friendly and approachable. I would absolutely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel room is typical NY but staff is very nice and went out of their way to accommodate my sick wife. Hotel located by battery park so not many restaurants open on weekends and quieter than time square area. Many subway stops close by so easy to get around.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I realize it's counterintuitive for a native New Yorker to write about a New York hotel, but here it goes...My wife and I stayed overnight at the Doubletree after a concert on a Thursday on "a mini staycation." The hotel features some of the amenities associated with a "4-star rated" hotel. Nice overhead showers, comfy beds, and a well-maintained lobby area.Here's the problem, however. The lobby is extremely hard to navigate. Although an employee is standing near the entrance (we passed this area three times), they never provided instructions onto how to get to the convoluted hotel lobby (located the floor above). The room, itself, had a set of minor concerns. Our room emitted this mechanical sound from 12:15am until around 6:30am. Further, the room does not offer a "tv checkout" option that any other hotel seems to have.The hotel is situated conveniently, next to the "Wall Street Bull" and the ferries to the Statue of Liberty, however it has a ways to go to live up to the reputations of a true 4-star hotel.
user_name:
FlaneurNYC
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff here is great, especially Hopton and the other bellhops. I have been coming here almost every week for the past year and they are always friendly and helpful. All of the staff is that way and always has a smile and initiates friendly conversations. This is one block from where I am working so couldn't ask for a better location. Not the biggest rooms but they upgrade you if you are a Hilton Honors member when available and I think it is comparable to other rooms in the area. This hotel will definitely continue to be my top choice in the area. Biggest downside is lack of elevators but just ask for a lower floor and get a little exercise by using the steps! Once again, can't say enough about Hopton and crew; terrific customer service! Hotel restaurant is very good as well, love the Chicken Parm.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We visited this hotel for a father and son weekend in early April. It was the perfect base camp for exploring the Battery and the Financial District, and an easy train ride over to Brooklyn. Very close to metro stops for a couple of key lines.The bellhops were very friendly and serious about delivering excellent customer service. They were patient and accomodating about car service when our flights kept getting changed.We are Hilton Honors, so we had complimentary wifi, which worked very well for us. We watched a movie on our phone with only a few lags.There are only three elevators, so check-out time could be a bit busy. One minor quirk -- the tv channels did not match up with the printed channel guide.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I've stayed at this hotel many times and each time, have experienced problems. Some minor, some pretty bad ones. In any instance, the hotel does not respond to issues despite their "make it right" policy.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff were absolutely amazing. Special thanks to Tony and Hopton for their friendly and helpful service. Room was very clean :) This hotel is located in a safe area and is also close (1 minute walk!!) to subways so was very easy for myself and my partner to get around the whole city. Highly recommend!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We got a good weekend deal for a room on the 35th floor. The room was good and the staff were friendly.The downside was they were confusing about where the parking was (it was in the garage right across the street) and there was no self-parking. But the valet pricing was the same as self-parking so it was ultimately fine. There is parking available right on the street on weekends as well.One warning is they have only three elevators for the hotel and at checkout time on a Sunday in February it was a major hassle. People were waiting for 10 or 20 minutes.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: - Acoustic isolation: i could hear everything my neighbours said or did. - Elevator: very long waiting times. Up to 15 min in my case. Staff populating them all the time and not stepping out for a client when the cabin was full.- Worst of all, everybody should be aware of this. Breakfast (btw: buffet not impressive): they charge gratuity automatically on the bill, hidden as "serv ch", and make you tip again. No notification whatsoever that tip is included. All restaurants pre-charging tip notify duly, and refer to a possibility to donate "extra tip".

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Water in bathroom was not working properly. Only hot boiling water. Staff was not very friendly. Lacked the Hilton customer service I normally experience during other hotel stays. Good location. Nice area.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have stayed at this property two times in the last 45 days and I am sorry to report that outside a great location in the financial district, this hotel falls far from the standards you would expect from a Doubletree. The rooms are very-very small, the lobby is on the 2nd floor which causes a traffic jam at ground level as guest are trying to get to their matchbox rooms and new guest are trying to get to the lobby to check in. The hotel is 44 stories tall with only 3 elevators trying to get up and down.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a very nice, very clean hotel. The two young ladies at check in were very warm and have a very nice smile. I love the warm cookies! The location is perfect, near everything. The view from my window was perfect. Keep the good work!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel was 10 mins walking distance from my NYC office on Browadway. It is a nice walk in the morning passing by the charging bull (when no one is there in the morning lol) and the trinity church and the wall street. The metro is easily accessible and there are lots of good eats nearby. The A line from nearby Fulton street station takes you to the airport under an hour. The hotel staff was very friendly. The reception is on the 2nd floor. My room and hallways were a bit compact and the elevator wait was longer than ideal however this hotel is situated in a prime location so I will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff were always friendly. You get a nice warm cookie when you check in which was a nice touch. The coffee in the room is nice and they provide you with travel cups so you can drink on the go - handy.Location wise its great for everything in the south of Manhattan. Easy walking distance to the 9/11 memorial and one world trade center. There are also a few metro stations in the close vicinity if you wish to travel that way. There are loads of places to eat and drink within a few blocks.I would go back to this hotel

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Room and bathroom were clean. The location of the hotel is very good, near to metro, ferry. The room is small, not enough space for a big luggage. There aren't enough elevators in the building. The room was noisy..

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good hotel . Cost for food is high and low quality . Breakfast is not worth 20 dollars. Rooms were ok but old especially the bathroom . On a scale 1-10 was a 8. Convenient for location.Price for parking $60 was to high regardless is isvalet or not ... It is too high

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff was awesome and the location is great! Always enjoyed walking in after a long day and getting a "welcome back" from the staff. :) Walking distance to so many awesome things. And of course the cookies can't be beat!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This staff at the hotel was great. Friendly and helpful. The Elevator service was horrible. Too few for such a high building. Had waits of more than 15-20 minutes. Often had to go down flights of stairs, may flights.
user_name:
Pumpkin C
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I can't say anything bad about the hotel, really, but it wasn't particularly great, either. The entry is strange because there is no "front desk" or anything, just a hallway and an elevator, with a sign that says the main lobby is on the second level. It felt like I was in the wrong place, but I wasn't. Typically there are porters waiting to greet guests, but I arrived around 1:00 a.m. so there was nobody to greet me. The room is clean but small. The shower leaked onto the bathroom floor. I ordered room service one night. It was delivered promptly and the food was good. People complain about the slow elevators, and although I agree they are slow, I also think it wasn't too bad. I waited only 3 or so minutes for an elevator. The ice machines are not on every floor, and the one on my floor wasn't working so I had to go up several floors to find a working machine, which wasn't fantastic when you are in your pajamas. So in summary, it was fine, no real complaints, but nothing exceptional, either.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a large business hotel. We were there for a wedding in the area, and it was a very convenient location, close to restaurants and many interesting sights. We took several walking tours of the financial district, Battery Park, Bowling Green, Seaport Village, etc. It is close to the 9/11 memorial. The location is excellent. The rooms are small but well organized. Bathrooms are very small. The staff members were very friendly, especially the cleaning crew. Beds were comfortable, and the towels were soft. The wifi was excellent in the rooms.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Staff was great, but the 3 tiny, tiny slow elevators for 40 floors were impossible. Waited 15 minutes for elevator. One person in our group walked down 23 floors when he could not get an elevator at all. There is no "lobby" on the ground floor, only an inhospitable alcove where the bellman puts luggage and another small alcove with elevators. Lobby is on second floor. My room was NOT quiet, industrial garbage pickup every night made huge racket. Room was very small, no place to put things. Absolutely no counter space in bathroom, not even room for a toothbrush. Only stayed here because it was near wedding venue. Would never stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Room 404 is way too loud with street noise. Id suggest trying other hotels first. The heater in the room was extremely loud like a broken jet engine every time it kicks in. The lobby staff are friendly though.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: No complaints we got free cookies and water discount parking bacon and eggs for breakfast rooms were ok little small but you are down town manhattan and for the price I was satisfied only complaint was the used bar of soap in the bathroom

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms are comfortable, the location in the financial district perfect for the 9/11 Memorial, Lady Liberty, and other Lower Manhattan sights. Be forewarned the elevators in this hotel are slow and you need patience, particularly during check-out time in the morning.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: On arrival to the hotel you arrive to the ground floor lobby and you have to go to floor two to find reception, the lifts are dreadfully slow, three lifts to service 44 floors.Hotel was undergoing redecoration and made the place look even more shabbyRoom was small and when you used the extractor fan in the bathroom you experienced a horrible smell of foodCarpet fitters were removing carpet one morning before 8amHotel delivers check out invoice in the very early hours, i had mine delivered at 05.30 and boy did they make a noise about doing itLocation is the only thing that was positive about this hotel I complained on my departure about the smelly room, the disturbance from the carpet fitters and the delivery of the check out invoice, the hotel did offer a discount but really you should not have to complain you should never be put in this position in the first place

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Do not stay at this hotel if your not prepared to wait FOREVER for an elevator every time you need one, especially during peak hours. Took nearly 20 minutes to get down to the lobby. And the staff just considers it acceptable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: It was my first stay in a hilton hotel (as far as I can remember) and it was due to a issue that I had to expand my stay in town and switched to the doubletree downtown. The staff was always polite and very helpful, except for the reception. Put the young (asian-american?) men up to the front desk, he's awesome! And the worst thing is the elevator. You wait for 10mins easy! even longer.. but then again the bed makes up for a lotta things. I've slept perfectly! Overall I believe it's a stabil choice when you can get a discount on a regular price. because I think it's definitely not worth 200 a night. But 130-160 is cool.oh, the room-service was ok, but not worth the money.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Excellent location for business in financial district and/or leisure activity near battery park. Overall service and accommodations did not meet my expectations for Hilton and Doubletree. Wallpaper peeling in bathroom, shower leaked onto the floor, electrical socket in bathroom was pushed halfway into the wall. Curtain in room torn/shredded at the bottom edge.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: A rarity in NYC: a quiet hotel. This is because it is located in the Financial District which pretty much closes down after 6PM. It is also not located on any through streets so no constantly honking taxi's or dumpsters or fire/police/ambulance sirens. If you know your Doubletree Hotels this one is just like all the others (and it is good).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: First impression wasn't great because you go into a dinky unadorned elevator lobby on the ground level and then take the elevator up to Floor 2 for the main (but still small) lobby. This hotel is old ... tired. There are three small elevators and they are not adequate to handle the number of people especially at busy times like 8 a.m. when the packed full elevator opened on every floor but no one else could get in because it was so full. It made for a very long descent. When I first went to my room, I realized it was directly across from the elevators ... very directly across ... like 4 feet from the door of my room, you'd be standing in the elevator. Too close! If the elevator door was open and my room door was opened, strangers in the elevator would be looking fit into my room. Plus I was concerned about the noise. So I went back to the front desk to ask for a different room. But apparently there were only rooms on other floors across from the elevators on other floors. Nothing else. It wasn't even that late, 8 pm, when I checked in. (Try to avoid rooms ending in 03 or 04.)The bathroom in my hotel room appeared to have been updated (large overhead shower head in a shower with glass doors); but the new sink was very impractical because it took up too much room and didn't leave much space for any of my toiletries etc. Also, two of the pillows in my room had stains on them (see photo). I will say, however, that the warm cookie upon arrival is nice and their staff was quite nice, despite being unable to give me a different room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Second stay here. They have 3 elevators for 40 floors and never more than one bank seems to operate at a time. Long waits only to have one show up full. Then stops at 10 floors with people crowding in because the wait has already been 20 mins. Was given a room with a wet carpet, horrible damp, mildew smell. Little was done by management.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great hotel all across the board. Staff was exceptional, had a phenomenal view of the World Trade Center and the cookies were perfect. Was very pleased with everything with the exception of having 2 working elevators at the time, but would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Really good hotel, just for spending 2 or 3 days at nyc, their location is excellent because is near the WTC and the ferry where t can take you to the Statue of Liberty; however, the room for 2 was small and we ordered 2 separate beds in a double room... And they gave us only one and very little..., But I was very clean and clam to rest.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Found this hotel at the last minute. Great hotel close to everything. There was a computer glitch and the front desk staffer was extremely pleasant and friendly (Kellieni). The cookies were amazing!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: A special shout out to Kelliani. she went above and beyond to help me in a tough situation. she made sure I was taken care and I knew I was in good hands the whole time. she deserves recognition for her attention to customer service!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hall was a little shabby but the room was nice and clean. Staff was friendly and efficient. Great location for the district. Best cookie ever! You can actually buy a tin of these cookies for a very reasonable price. So, if you're in the area stop in and buy a tin of cookies. I think they were 6 for $10.95.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed in a junior king suite on the 4th floor. At first I was disappointed we were on the 4th but soon realized it was for the best. The room was clean and a good size for three of us. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The biggest con is the elevators. As said in other reviews sometimes the wait times are ridiculous. We took the stairs mostly because we didn't feel like waiting. One couple said they waited 40 minutes for an elevator. Also, as stated in other reviews, the bathroom was small. We didn't have any construction noise during our stay and didn't have any food in the hotel. The location is good if you're going to stay mostly in lower Manhattan. Can rides up to Central Park and GCT were between $20-25. We walked to Soho and enjoyed the day there. I would go back for the great rates and location but I would ask for a lower floor

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Perfect location for the Statten Ferry, 911, wall st. Close to metro line, lots of places close by for eating, drinking and buying snacks. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Room was comfortable and clean. Free cookies on arrival, coffee machine, iron and hairdryer in room. We were on the 34th floor at the back so nice and quiet. Free internet which worked great, also computers and printers in the reception. Room had aircon.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Just switched jobs and am looking for a new place to stay when in NY on business...this won't be it. While the staff were wonderful and that goes along way to giving an average rating - and the size of the rooms wasn't horrible for NY - too many nit picky things pushed this to the bottom of my list.1. Pro and Con - the Italian restaurant next door does room service - decent food but the menu choices were mainly Italian - not a lot of variety. 2. Pro - the restaurant also does the breakfast for hilton honors statused guests. Decent eggs bacon sausage coffee juice - nice spread3. Con - elevators - there are 40+ floors and maybe 10 rooms per floor - and three elevators...long wait times during rush hour...I don't recommend staying on the 10th floor - the first day I noticed that every time I pushed the button to go down I got an elevator going up...I had to push the up to go down...I reported it and by the second day I finally gave in and pushed the up button when I wanted to go down4. Con - very small bathroom and the lighting wasn't so good for makeup - the bathroom door is a barn door sliding style - good for a small place - but there was no hook(s) for towels in the bathroom...that was very annoying5. Con - the blow dryer in my bathroom was missing - nothing like waiting for a blow dryer when your hair is wet and you need to get to work6. Huge Pro - the hot water was very quick in the morning - I hate waiting for 10 minutes in the morning for hot water...maybe a minute or two and it was HOT! 7. Admittedly stupid nit picky and really not material - I love the cookies you get at check in at Doubletree...mine was dried out and burned...boo!So it was decent price and location wasn't bad but overall not one of my better hotel stays...several of my co-workers stayed as well and we all agreed that we need to look for something else.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel Location (huge factor in rating). Typically I'm a big fan of all Hilton brands, but this one was just ok. My issue was mostly with the property itself as opposed to the staff I encountered. The staff is very friendly and attentive so if you're looking for great customer service, this hotel gets an A+ in that department. The only reason why we stayed at this particular location is because it was the cheapest given the nights we chose and once in New York City, it's very easy to get around. However, I somewhat regret the location because the Financial District in general, particularly at night is extremely desolate and nothing is open. In walking distance from several subway lines, (4,5,J,Z and R), I think hotel is better suited for persons traveling on business. Definitely not pleasure. Literally the most annoying part about this location is that you will not find a parking space. Being a native New Yorker, and having an understanding that using a car in NYC is more like a liability, most, if not all the parking near this hotel is reserved for commercial vehicles. Although parking garages are available nearby, you're going to be paying out big bucks to park your car and depending on the size of your vehicle, you may be charged an additional fee. The rate at the garages is approximately $60 per day, but the hotel validates parking (YOU MUST ASK) for which you receive a $20 discount. Hotel Itself: Despite the aforementioned, this seems to be a very popular hotel. They have over 30 floors, but the building is narrow. Although the rooms are nice, they are small and whatever you do, do not choose a room that's directly in front of the elevator. There is literally 2 feet between your room and the elevator door. What I also don't like is that the Front desk is located on the second floor, so when you actually get into the hotel, you need to hop on the elevator just to get to the reception area and as you can imagine, given the number of floors, the elevator can be slow. We ended up walking down the stairs on numerous occasions, thankfully we were only on the 9th floor. What I did appreciate: Fresh cookies every morning at the front desk. The staff Providing us with a later check out time, which we greatly appreciated. Although I wrote plenty of negatives, it was a pretty good experience. If you're looking for entertainment constantly, seek a Hilton brand uptown because you may be disappointed solely due to the hotels location.
user_name:
Krystal C
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was leary after reading reviews but ended up booking it due to the location and price. This hotel is a great location for walking to Battery Park with the statue of Liberty and the World Trade Center Memorial. It is close to the metro and provided easy access to get to time square. The staff was friendly, some though were not very knowledgeable about the area. They have computers with internet and a printer in the lobby which helped alot looking for things to do, places to eat, and printing out our plane tickets. I also appreciated their checkout procedure. We were able to have them hold on to our bags after check out and they arranged a car for us (at a flat fee) to get to the airport).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: One of the worst hotel experiences. The cleaning staff and SOME of the front desk staff are nice. One front desk lady gave us a sassy attitude when asked if we can have water bottles brought up to our room. However, the service is nothing compared to the condition of the hotel. It is old, shoddy and jenky. Walls are extremely thin; I can hear conversations from neighbors and the elevator going up and down. Also there's construction nearby, it starts ~6 AM doesn't end until ~12 AM. Non stop drilling. I barely got ANY sleep the week I was there, by end of week I was completely DELIRIOUS. Please don't stay here.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We arrived jetlagged to a room overlooking a construction site where work and noise continued until gone 10pm. The front desk initially reassured us it was only the evening, but work re-started at 5am. When we asked to move rooms, the staff member responded with a shrug and "construction is the city", but did agree to move us and the higher floor was much quieter. It's near to battery park, and several metro stations. For our final night we moved to the Residence Inn just up the road and it was much much better - go there instead!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Room very comfortable. Had to switch rooms due to late night construction noise, but that's NYC's fault, not the hotel's. Friendly staff and waiters at breakfast. Coffee is really not good. What you'd expect, but I always hope for a good cup. Breakfast fills the belly and not much else. Dishes and flatware did not seem clean. Not sure why every other hotel faucet has to be complicated but took a lot of adjusting to get hot water (at 5:30a) Whoever decided on the curtains in the rooms is a very very stingy person. No point in heavy curtains if they can't serve as blackout curtains. This was my solution.
user_name:
B D
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Facility is undergoing significant renovation...at least our floor was, and it would have been nice have been warned by the desk personal! Quite a shock when we stepped out of the elevator into a beat-up, derelict-looking hallway. Room was finished, and overall was clean and comfortable. Some of the renovation work was shoddy (e.g., peeling wall paper in the bathroom) and the bathroom was not very well designed--we expect small spaces in NYC, but the space could have been used more effectively. Staff was friendly and helpful, and the location was excellent, about two blocks from the NY Stock Exchange. We chose the hotel due to a great room rate and location; we would probably return for the location and for a reasonable rate—certainly not for the facility itself.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location and friendly staff! I haven't been to NYC lately but I was amazed how friendly the people are and how clean the city was. It seemed very safe. I would stay as far from Newark as humanly possible. The hotel staff very helpful especially advising me of options for airport commute.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Listen, the convenience of this hotel to lower Manhattan is unsurpassed. The nightly rates are good also. The staff at times does not seem to care, and there always is something broken or out of order and nothing seems to get fixed. I was on the 10th floor -- ice machine is broken. Toilet seat was loose in my room, gym water cooler doesn't have cool water and the "Please Service" warning flashes repeatedly. I seemed to have arrived in the middle of a renovation job and I don't remember being warned about. I was at a seminar next door and I as well as others noted that on the morning of 4 March there was no hot water. We just had to suck it up and go with a cold one that day. On the 5th day at checkout I spoke to a Cindy at the front desk and told her my stay was pretty crummy. She offered 5,000 HH points and an apology, but then said the points wouldn't post for -- I kid you not - 2 to 6 weeks. I stay at this hotel very often, and the restaurant and gym are pretty good for the money. I'm going to forego the convenience next time and try the Hampton Inn nearby. There are too many persistent issues at the DT. Too bad because I stay at this hotel 3-4 times a year. BTW, budget 5-10 minutes to get in and out of your rooms during the morning. The elevators are unpredictable.
user_name:
Brian J
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here with 3 colleagues for 4 days on a business trip. The hotel was undergoing a refresh which meant the corridors were part re-decorated. This didn't distract from the function of the hotel - as a place to be comfortable and get some peace and quiet. The rooms were clean and fairly spacious for a relatively small hotel. The beds were comfortable and the bathrooms very clean. The 'open all hours' gym proved a useful distraction with a body clock that was working 5 hours adrift from the local time. All in all, I'd recommend it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: As other reviews consistently have stated over the years, the elevators are atrocious. Otherwise the location is great. Safe, quiet (shocking in NYC), and nice. Great for wall street people or sightseers destined for Ellis Island/Statute of Liberty. Bed was comfortable, refrigerator was provided promptly upon request and all of the staff was kind and courteous. I think this location will always be a 4 out of 5 because of the elevators, or lack thereof.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights at this hotel, have stayed their previously and you know the quality to expect from a doubletree. The hotel is well located downtown in the financial district very safe area and close to the subway. Ideal location if visiting Staten Island ferry, Wall Street , world trade memorial, however definitely not as many resteraunts, shopping options as midtown, but definitely a place to get a quieter night sleep. Hotel itself is fine, bed comfortable and small but nice room. Lobby area is on the 2nd floor and entry lobby is a bit strange. Lifts also a bit of a problem often have to wait for some time. Whilst we were staying there I think there was a problem with the air conditioning in the entrance lobby as there was a very strong smell and water dripping from the ceiling. They also had a problem with a water outage but I think that was just a one off. Have stayed before and would stay again based on value of accomodation. If it was my first time to New York I would recommend staying midtown instead.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms were in pristine condition and the staff were incredibly helpful The hallways are being remodeled and it will be nice to see what they look like when it is all complete. This hotel is a nice alternative to other busy parts of the city. The neighborhood is clean, and relaxed, and feels more professional.
user_name:
David R
Kansas City, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Nice hotel, expect a city room - not an expansive room, small comfortable lobby, elevators are limited in number and space so expect a small wait. Great location very convenient to R train as well as others, and easy walk to great restaurants and bars, Battery Park, World Trade Center, Wall St.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Arrived slightly earlier than check in time, but our room was ready. Check in was quick, and the receptionist was very friendly. The hotel is clearly going under some refurbishment in the hallways on certainly floors, but this never had any impact on our stay. The lifts were never an issue during our 5 day stay. The room was lovely and clean, yes they are a bit small but adequate enough and cleaned everyday.The location was perfect, with subways just at the end of the street, Staten Island Ferry, Wall St, The Bull all a few blocks away. The area is clearly improving, and there are lots of lovely bars and restaurants, in and around the area.Would return to the hotel and would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: When I arrived, the gentlemen who handled my luggage were very kind and sweet. I did check-in really early but the front desk agents were so sweet by offering adjoining rooms to accommodate my friends and I, which I didn't know was possible! Elevators do take some time, but it makes sense for having a lot of floors to make stops at! When we accidentally locked ourselves out of our rooms at a very inconvenient time, the staff came very quickly to help out and were very professional and efficient. When we checked out, they assisted me with getting me a taxi in minutes for the airport. Thanks again for a lovely stay!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here in late Jan - early Feb. We had a great time! It's in a fantastic location, near the red, green and yellow subway lines. Overall, it was great! A few little things to note though, but nothing major. The staff are friendly and easy to talk to. The room was great, nice size, bed was super comfy. House keeping wasn't so great with filling up our amenities each day, which was a little disappointing. We asked on the last day when we saw someone from housekeeping and they were happy to assist us. We used the printers which are slightly awkward and weird, just ask reception to print what you need. We read there were issues with the lifts, but we asked to have a quiet room on a lower floor and the lifts weren't an issue. As we are from Australia, we weren't familiar when asking for taxi, at reception, they arrange for a private car. This seemed fine with us, until we realised they charge more! This was a little disappointing.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I"m one of "those" guests. Always needing something strange and willing to request anything. Was treated as though my crazy requests were of the most importance and of no trouble. Fantastic location. Soft fluffy beds. Clean rooms. Amazing staff. And the restaurant meals were fantastic. Thanks for a great stay!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Friendly staff, clean rooms, close to the subway, good location. Don't order room service. But the restaurant downstairs is top notch and a must visit! Front desk staff super friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean, quiet. Bed was comfortable. There are only 10 rooms per floor, and only 3 elevators, so plan extra time to wait for the elevator to get out of the hotel. The neighborhood it is in, was clean. A few block from the ferry and the Bull of wallstreet. You can catch the hop-on hop off bus by battery park, a few blocks away.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: In the weeks prior to the reservation, I received multiple emails offering to have wine and other items ready in my room when I arrived. I placed the “request upon arrival” order. I had hoped to surprise my fiancee with the champagne on arrival, but it was not delivered. I called the front desk and was redirected to the restaurant. The restaurant employee was dismissive and insulting stating that they “could never give me wine at that price.” I spoke with the front desk in-person and was promised a resolution. No resolution was actually reached—they never even addressed the issue. The elevators in the building are intolerably slow. We found it necessary to build 10-15 minutes into our travel plans throughout the weekend stay in order to accommodate the wait for the elevators. In addition, the elevators do not properly account for whether a person is heading up or down, so they open on the wrong direction of travel. On one day, we were in the room much of the morning but leaving at approximately 11:45AM. When the housekeeper came by at 11:30AM, we asked that she come back in 30 minutes or so. She never returned and our room was never cleaned. On our last morning, we were jerked to sleep at about 8AM to the sound of wallpaper and baseboard being ripped from the hallway walls as the workers performing the work yelled at each other. We had hoped to sleep much longer as we had a long day of travel ahead and my fiancee was ill. The noise proceeded all morning until we left at 1PM. As we left, the hallway was quite dusty and wires protruded from the hallway walls. Getting an elevator was even more difficult as the construction workers were using it to haul carpet and garbage between floors.
user_name:
Robert L
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Customer service over my stay has been a friendly experience ...Comfortable and good window view of WTC.It's been pleasant trip and Thanks to the guidance and help of Floddy, Luis, Kelliani & Cindy for showing me the paths to explore NYC as I was new to New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is not a luxury hotel. Few friends of mine chose to stay here as we were not going to be in the hotel for the whole day so dint want to spend a lot. There are good food options nearby. However if you are looking to party look at a hotel may be more centric and towards lower east side.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: While the location was very convenient, the state of the room meant our stay was less than satisfactory. The single towel rack in the bathroom fell down, a drawer pull on the night stand was broken and the trim on the bottom of the door was falling off. Although free WiFi access was promised (we were given instructions & password to log in), it was not available. All of these problems were reported to the front desk and only the towel rack was half-heartedly repaired (it was still loose after the repair). Elevator service (3 elevators to service 44 floors) was slow and the stairway, if you wanted to avoid the elevators)
user_name:
Roberta R
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The room was comfortable and clean. The check in was quick and the water and cookies were a welcome bonus. The price was affordable for Manhattan. The rooms were part of a block for a wedding party. I would definitely stay at Double Tree again!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was my first time staying at this hotel and I was pleased. It was only 10 minutes away from the financial district which was great. My room was on the 30th floor and had a nice view. I had to ask about the chocolate chip cookie instead of it just being offered to me.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I typically stay at the Doubletree in Midtown and needed to be downtown for business meetings. This hotel was close to the financial district and was only a 10 minute walk. The hotel was clean and rooms were a nice size.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Rooms are small but comfortable, lifts slow, staff friendly. A short walk from Freedom Tower (One World Trade Center) and Statue of Liberty boats. Good value for Manhattan at under $200/night. Breakfast rather ordinary for $35.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: * No assistance with luggage * One person working check-in with a long line of guests waiting. * Digital check-in was worthless. We still had to go through the entire check in process. * Very old, small, and slow elevators. * Narrow, dirty hallways. * Room numbers were printed on paper and taped to the doors - no kidding! * At 12:50 A.M. the phone began ringing and would not stop even when the receiver was removed from the cradle. We finally removed the batteries. We could still hear phones ringing in other rooms. * On a positive note, they had the very best warm chocolate chip and walnut cookies! Also, check was a breeze.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is in the heart of NYC's financial district. Easy walk to everything downtown. I work downtown and stayed here after a late night in the city, since it was close to my office. At check-in, my key was waiting for me. Perhaps the fastest check-in I've ever experienced. I got to my room and it was perfect. The exact size you'd expect for NYC. It was clean and quiet (I requested a high floor). I was only staying over for one night and this room met all of my needs. I'll definitely stay here again.
user_name:
GuyDownTheStreet
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great hotel located walking distance to wall street and battery park where the ferry to statue of liberty is. Very clean, staff was very friendly. Only downfall was the elevators, there are only 3 for 44 stories of rooms and they take a very long time. They often fill up before they got to our 30th floor going down.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: long story short .... made a reservation with priceline but had problems being bounced around between the hotel and priceline. the reservations team was able to figure out what was going on and then coordinate a proper handoff with the front desk., front desk team (anna, stephanie anc cindy) were very helpful and thanks to the manager on duty (james) i was able to cancel the priceline reservation and get the correct reservation with the hotel. kudos to the hotel team for helping solve a problem they did not create.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Located in the financial district, walking distance to everything, and near subway. Great staff. Good prices, nice bars, restaurants. We took the subway to Central Park and to Time Square. No problems.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was my second time at this hotel and they rolled out the red carpet. They designated me as a "Special Guest" and treating like Royalty. The room was on a high floor facing the new World Trade Center. The view was amazing. Very clean. I would definitely go back.!!!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I've stayed here many times and am always made to feel valued and welcome - the staff are great, very friendly, dependable and always very helpful - all of which are unexpected in the Financial District. Breakfasts are delicious. A modest hotel in many respects (definitely not luxury), but in an area with few other hotels, the location is very convenient, gym is ok and rooms are comfortable, with great views.
user_name:
Rosemary S
East Greenwich, Rhode Island

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel is good, not grand. Rooms are clean. No coffee in the lobby though. Restaurant in the lobby is outstanding. Beware of the elevators as there is often a wait for one. Staff overall are very good.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My husband and I were on a business trip that required a six week stay in New York's financial district. We chose the Hilton Doubletree hotel on Stone Street because of it's convenient location. The best thing about this hotel was the staff, especially Tony, Allen, Luis and Hopton at the front door. We also appreciated the assistance given to us by Kelliani, Damian, Venetta, Cindy and Valerie at the front desk. Everyone always provided service with a smile, no matter what we needed or what time of day it was. Additionally the housekeeping staff was excellent, always responding promptly when we needed our room cleaned. This was important because my husband was working long hours in the room, so getting it cleaned every day on our schedule was a must. The restaurant on the first floor has very good food and excellent service. This was also important because although we did eat at neighborhood restaurants occasionally, we often just opted for a quick bite downstairs because we needed to get back to work. Our room was on the 42nd floor and had a great view. We were grateful for this because we spent so much time in it, That said, we often had to wait many minutes for an elevator to get downstairs and that was a bit of a drawback because the three elevators were a bit slow and required patience. The hotel itself could use some remodeling, especially the hallways and the elevators. The room was adequate in size. The shower had a great shower head but the shower door leaked. It wasn't a big problem as long as we didn't take showers that were too long. There was a fitness room on the third floor that I used frequently that was well equipped and of a decent size and this was a big plus for me. Another big plus was that the hotel was quiet. Noise was never an issue. Also, although it is located on a small, quiet street the hotel is within walking distance of a variety of restaurants, taverns, cafes and shopping. If we needed to stay in this part of the city again we would likely book a room here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: You need to take the elevator to the second floor for the hotel lobby. So when you first walk in, on the first floor it was underwhelming. Sort of a hallway to 3 elevator banks. The lobby was efficient since I had checked in online. He had my keys ready to go, with cookies, and 2 bottles of water.The room itself was standard business issue. Had not view, except the other office building. But it was clean. Had everything I needed.Location was hard to get a cab. Took 15-20 minutes for the doorman to get us a cab from the corner. But the doorman went out of his way on the rain to make sure I had a cab.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed for 1 night. Beautiful hotel! The room had a great view and the bed was so comfortable. Free cookies and water bottles upon arrival. Front desk extremely helpful and friendly. Don't let stone street fool you... it's the quiet part!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Location and amenities are fantastic! Customer service was top notch. The front desk supervisor Kalliam is the best in customer service that we have ever had at any hotel. She found out it was our 10 year anniversary and did a few special things to make our stay special for my wife and I.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My mother and I booked this trip and got a fairly good deal for the hotel itself as it's away from Times Square. However, I actually preferred the location because it was away from all the hustle and bustle but just around the corner from Wall Street, 9/11 memorial and next door to a brilliant Irish bar! You could also easily get to where you needed to go using the subway so Times Square was only a short ride away.Hotel itself was ok. Quite a marked difference between the staff attitudes though. In particular, concierge and maintenance staff were lovely, couldn't do enough to help you but reception staff for the most part made you feel like an inconvenience.Décor etc. wise, lobby looks like it could do with some work but rooms themselves were fine. Bed was comfy enough, room was clean and good facilities except for tea and milk. If you ask though, they are happy to provide more. (Just make sure to ask the maid and not the reception staff!)Check out was challenging. Full cost of room added to bill when we'd paid 50% upfront. Attitude of staff again was disgraceful but we'd come to expect it at this point. We were in a hurry to catch our flight, so did what we could to challenge it there and then but have had to pick this issue up separately on our return. Despite it's relatively minor faults, the hotel is still good value when compared with other New York City hotels and so we'd consider going back again. We'd just know what to expect this time!
user_name:
kerryt780
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Everything that you would wish for when you travel. Great staff, nice rooms, comfort away from home. We went for a week end getaway and were lucky to pick this hotel. It was in a good location, near many places we wanted to see. Subway was across the street when we wanted to go a bit farther. Murphy's Tavern next door had great food and lots of really neat people to meet. I left feeling like we had some new friends in NYC. I will definitely go back again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Nice hotel and polite staff in a great location. Easy to get to the subway and attractions. We were staying here with our kids and had selected two beds when we made our reservation however when we checked in they only had us down for one king bed and weren't able to move us as they were fully booked. The rooms are so small they can't have roll away beds because it's a fire hazard so our son got to sleep on the floor. At least they brought us extra pillows and blankets so we made a pillow bed for him. :o/

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My husband and I travel to NYC once a mth for business. Last mth we stayed here 4 nights. It was ok very normal experience for NYC loved the location and we had a view of the river! Room was small ordered room service once for breakfast the first day the messed up my order quite a bit even after the claimed to be out of what I had originally planned on ordering. No one came to pick up the room try I set it outside the room to be picked up n it was moved to out by the elevator the silverware was removed n the rest was left there for the remainder of our stay. Be aware Elevators took a long time there were 3 for 78 floors. Staff was mostly friendly and helpful.
user_name:
Sm L
