Portland, Maine, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Although in the Financial District, the DoubleTree is convenient to subway and surface transport. Facilities are clean, well appointed, good sized and quiet. Staff are friendly and helpful Although a woman alone, I find this location safe and easy to get to even when travelling to mid-town and the Lincoln Center area
user_name:
Calien L
Cape Elizabeth, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The elevators here are extremely slow and small. When the car finally arrives it is usually full with people. Made a two day stay here inconvenient. After checking in for our two day stay, my partner showered. We discovered that the shower leaked and there was a large puddle on the floor which I slipped in after stepping in it. I observed that the plastic strip that the glass door rested against was cracked at the bottom, allowing water to just flow out of the shower basin and on to the floor. We used most of the room towels to clean this up. I alerted the front desk to the problem and advised we would need fresh towels and that the strip needed to be fixed and that it was a slip hazard. Upon returning to our room a few hours later, the wet towels were removed and replaced, however after showering again we discovered that the leakage problem was not addressed. No one from maintenance came during our stay to fix the problem so we continued to use towels to avoid a mess and slip hazard.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was scheduled to stay at the Doubletree on Jan 25th. One of the worst snow storms in history hit NYC hard. My flight got cancelled. When I called to cancel my hotel stay, I was informed by, James the front desk manager, that I will still be charged for 1 nights stay about $200. This is the second largest snow fall in NYC history and there was no flexibility. Clearly James didn't realize that I will never stay at this hotel in the future and I travel to NYC regularly. For $200 he has cost the company thousands and I will surely be telling all of my co-workers to avoid this hotel in the future. He should be held accontable for his lack of professionalism and for being a bad representation for the company.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff at this DoubleTree make it my "go-to" place every time I teach a class in New York. They really go out of their way make you welcome and comfortable during your stay. The property is located within easy walking distance of anything you may need. The front desk staff, particularly Cindy and Kelliani are top quality professionals who provide the best customer service that any guest could hope for.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We didn't want the crowds of Times Square. This hotel is in a great location, reasonably priced. It's not five-diamond luxury, but it's classy enough. Reserved and got a high floor with a city view. Outstanding!! The room was not huge, but it was clean, very nice and comfortable, and all the amenities we needed. The staff was great here. We were always greeted with a friendly smile, a hello, and cordial conversation, not the stuffy stand-offish attitude you might expect from a city this size. Front desk, bell folks, housekeeping, everyone we encountered made us feel welcome.We wanted to be close to the new 1 World Trade Center, 911 Museum, etc. These are all easy walking distance. Plenty of other things are also close and easily accessible.We would stay hear again without hesitation.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Quick access to Staten Island Ferry. Room was VERY small for 2 people. East access to Wall Street and 9/11 Memorial 20 min subway ride to time square Friendly and funny staff Held our luggage after we checked out at 11am till we got back at 8pm to then get a ride to the airport.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great hotel for business travel if you need a comfortable room with good amenities in the financial district. Good restaurant, nice fitness facilities and amazing staff. They are always willing to go above and beyond to make sure you enjoy your stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Staff were somewhat friendly. Water came out brown in bathroom at first, got a note under the door saying plumbing was going to be shut off during our second night and to schedule use around the repairs. Faulty shower door left everything a mess, and dirty towels were left on the floor after requesting fresh towels because of the excessive water leaking from the shower. Savings in hotel cost was not really worth it compared to increased transportation costs when compared to the quality of other hotels in the area.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was a nice clean comfortable hotel. Not many bells and whistles but super close to the subway, amazing coffee house across the street. You can walk to Staten Island Ferry battery bark and many yummy eateries. Nice quiet area. Staff was very friendly. Rooms were clean. Beds comfortable. It was pretty cold though, they could have used some warmer blankets on the bed or an extra in the room. Nice towels. No breakfast or those kind of frills, but the little coffe shop across the street fit that bill. A great coffe and super selection on breakfast sandwiches and other novelties. Smaller bath, but nice sized shower. Welcoming lobby with computers and ample seating if you did not want to hang out in your room. I think there was a gym, cannot remember, we walked so much there was no need.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: For NYC, it was in a great location, quiet, and within walking distance of getting anywhere in New York. The only thing(s) to diminish are the fact that the lobby is on the 2nd floor (minor detail) and the elevators are slooooooowwww. Plan ahead by at least 10-15 minutes before you really want to leave just to account for the elevators. We waited for one almost 20 minutes once before even getting to get on one. Staying here you felt as if you were doing the hotel a favor. When we checked in, there was no mention of my being a Hilton Honors member, forget more still that we are Diamond level members (which should have resulted in a free upgrade). I don't ask for those things, I just note them so I know what hotel(s) to use in the future. We also had a slight issue with getting enough towels (there were only 2 of us) to the room. We called down twice one morning, before I finally just went down to the lobby and got some myself. Overall, I would consider staying here again though, just based on the price and the quiet location down a little side street. Good, safe area in the Financial District.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I booked a room here to attend a wedding at Battery Park Gardens. As expected in NYC, the room was tiny, but It is located in a quiet street and was conveniently close to the subway. During the weekdays, food options are convenient. Security was good- bouncers near the entrance asking if you're a guest- but the elevators are slow going to and from the 8th floor. Do what my smart friend did: request a room on a lower floor so stairs are an option.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stay in the Financial District a couple to 4 times a year, usually the Hampton, but this time, I went out a bit further from our office and stayed on Stone St. The room was larger than any I've stayed in for this area of NYC, and I was quite happy with the stay in general. The gym is also larger than most I've seen in lower Manhattan at a hotel. The building is at least 45 stories tall, and I found that the elevators were much quicker than I expected. Front desk staff people were very nice. The water in the shower and the sink became hot within seconds. A very different experience for hotels in this area. My only complaint - the room was unbearably hot, defaulting to 72 degrees no matter how often I tried to lower the temperature. I called on the last night and an engineer came up and adjusted the 'preset' temp for me. Should've called sooner. I didn't realize until this trip that hotels may set a default temp that has to be overridden manually. I would definitely stay here again. As always, loved the Hilton bed and bedding.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location is ideal; it's quiet downtown on weekends. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The room was very clean but small, but we weren't in New York to hang out in our hotel. The elevators never bothered us, as it was the less-busy weekend.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a favorite hotel of mine when I'm staying in lower Manhatten on business. It's in the Financial District, so it's within a short walking distance from Wall Street. What I like about this hotel is that it's on a quiet, narrow one way street, but a block away in either direction there's a lot happening and lots to do. Great restaurants nearby. A couple blocks from the piers, river and Staten Island Ferry. You can walk to Battery Park. Rent bikes and ride on the bike trails that run along the river. Shopping on Broadway. I always walk several blocks to shop at Century 21. The hotel staff are friendly and accommodating. The hotel rooms are really nice, clean and recently remodeled. They are a bit tight (small), but that's normal for a hotel room in NYC.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was my largest complaint during this trip and ultimately why I decided to spend my second night at the Millennium Hotel. As a fellow Hilton employee, a Hilton Honors member, and beyond that a GUEST, I was extremely disappointed with how the staff treated me. To begin with, out of the several interactions I had with your employees there were only two that greeted me with a smile and made me feel welcome. The front desk agent, Charnice Mohammed, and a house keeper whose name I was unable to obtain. I understand that your hotel is large and is located in New York City - an area not exactly known for its hospitality and friendliness. Unfortunately, this is a Hilton hotel and hospitality is the name of our game. Beyond this, it consistently took over five minutes for any front desk agent to pick up when I called. I know this because I began timing the calls after the first time it happened. On this same note, three different times throughout the day I called to request red wine glasses be delivered to my room while I was out seeing the city. The first time the agent failed to get my room number and hung up on me. The second time I was transferred to the restaurant who seemed hurried, which I understand. To verify that the glasses had brought up to the room I called a third time, where I was told that the glasses had not been delivered and would be. Mind you, each of these one minute calls took five plus minutes due to the delay in answering the phone. Upon my arrival later that night after several hours of walking, I had found the glasses had indeed - not been delivered. At this point I decided that it would be best for me to get them myself and so I went down to the restaurant. Now, I am going to write this in a separate paragraph because this, by far, was the worst experience of the entire trip. Upon arriving to the restaurant I went up to a gentleman and told him I was a guest in the hotel and I would like two red wine glasses. His response was "Where are your keycards?" Fair question. I showed the gentleman my key cards and his response was "What is your room number?" This is where I began to get annoyed. I had showed him my key packet/key cards. Read it. So I gave him my room number. He goes behind the bar and asks again "What did you need?" Two red wine glasses. "What is your room number?" You see where I am going with this. At this point only minor irritation but what happened next definitely escalated the situation. The gentleman proceeded to hand me two water goblets and said the following "If you do not return these in the morning I will personally make sure that you will be charged $20 per glass." Let me stress that he handed me two water goblets - I have my degree in Winery Management and have undergone several hours of sommelier training - I know the difference between a Riedel crystal burgundy and water goblets. As minute as this sounds it was extremely insulting for him to assume I would not know the difference. Speaking of assumptions, for him to even comment that he would charge me for the glasses implies that I would steal them. To backhandedly call a guest a thief - I am speechless. I am almost positive that The Double Tree of the Financial District of New York City is not financially hurting enough for this comment to be made. As for the last part of his comment, that I would need to hand deliver them to the bar in the morning. I drove six hours to get to Manhattan. I walked for six plus hours to see the city. The last thing I wanted was a chore. As far as I know, housekeeping is responsible for returning glass ware/plates/etc. to the restaurant - room service. After returning to my room and waiting five more minutes for the front desk to answer I refused to waste my time talking to anyone else but Charnice Mohammed as she was literally the shining star of my trip. Later around midnight, I received several phone calls while I was asleep. Eventually I unplugged my phone because it just would not stop. In the morning I found that it was the front desk trying to service recover me with a $50 voucher for breakfast and a free bottle of wine - a note under the door would have sufficed. To sum up, it is my opinion that the gentleman in the bar is in severe need of several more hours of training on Hilton Cares or should not be in the hospitality business and should find work elsewhere. I am a Night Auditor/Front Desk Representative/Manager on Duty. I am proud of this company and am dedicated to its promise, but I walked away from this hotel ashamed that it is part of our family. You have a beautiful property where you have the luxury of meeting hundreds of people per day to show them that Hilton is far superior to other brands when it comes to getting it right - I only wish 99% of your staff could see this opportunity and embrace it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel has a lot of positives-- great location near Wall Street, Stone Street, the World Trade Center, Status of Liberty ferry etc. The rooms are clean and functional. While this isn't a luxury hotel, for the price, its a great choice.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was last September on a business trip, I had a free weekend and I use it to visit New York with my wife.The hotel is very good located, close to the WTC and the ship to Liberty island.The room was fine, not so big, but comfortable. We were on the top floor, 44th, and our views were amazing, just in front of the One World Trade Center ( Freedom Tower).The staff in the hotel were nice and friendly.The only not good point for us was the restaurant at the street level. Waiters were very slowly, and prices were very expensive.As a summary, hotel highly recommended except the restaurant.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good clean hotel in an very good location. pros are the location, friendly staff and of course the cookies. sound proofing can be improved a bit. Not as spacious as some of the other double tree locations, but this is new york city. No complaints over all and biggest con was location, location, location.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location is pretty good, next to the charging bull on wall street. 9/11 Memorial is also within walking distance. Several metro stations are also steps away. The room is not big, but enough for your stay. We had a nice stay here. The wifi is free and the signal is pretty strong.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: It's a bit tired and the room smells like people have been smoking in it but it's ok. More a 3 star than 4. My judgement may be a bit tainted as I've just stayed in two much nicer hotels in NYC with rooms twice the size. Shower is a bit mouldy but room is generally clean.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel property is extremely run down. The guest room hallways are filty. The guest room furniture is old with varnish coming off the side bed tables. HVAC is load (I turned mine off). The condition of this property suggests the owners are running it to the ground. Save your money and find another property. This one does not meet stringent Hilton standards - this is Motel 6 1960 version quality.
user_name:
Jim P
Fort Washington, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Checked in on Christmas Day, waited for room to be cleaned, not an issue for me, I was on vacation so left luggage and went out. The room was good size, bed was very comfortable. Location was excellent, subway very close, sightseeing, restaurants close.The only negative was the elevators are very slow, not an issue in the beginning, but it gets old after a couple of days,especially since one was broken.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: No better stay, no better location, no better value, no better price than the Doubletree on Stone Street in the Financial District of NYC. My family and I spent Christmas, my daughter's 16th birthday, and New Year's of 2015 in this hotel and with this staff, and I couldn't imagine a better place or better people to have done so.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at the Doubletree Hotel New York City Financial District in September 2015 following a business trip to the city. The Doubletree was more budget-friendly than hotel near my office where I stayed earlier in the week, but I found the service, comfort and cleanliness to be very close to the same. I'm also a fan of the cookies offered by the Doubletree at check in. The hotel was easy walking distance to Battery Park as well as several different subway lines for convenient access to all of Manhattan. Being in the financial district, I learned that near by restaurants close early, but I was able to enjoy a late dinner at a tavern on the same block.I enjoyed my stay and will add this to my list of reasonably priced accommodations in the big apple.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is the second time we started at this hotel this year, once in the summer and in December and have found the location and price fantastic. In the summer you are close to South Street Seaport and all the water taxis and in the winter it is quiet and quaint like a European city in the winter. Don't forget to eat on Stone street. Lots of great restaurants.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Service and cleanliness has gone down. Maintenance is deplorable. Trays left outside in halls for hours after calling several times. Hallways unvacuumed. Cleaning staff loud while cleaning. Gave us shredded towels in bathroom. Maintenance staff elevator so it takes 15 minutes to actually make it to the lobby... one of the elevators was down for 2 days, so it took us 30 minutes to get down to the lobby. Somebody dragged feces all over the entryway and by the elevator which caused significant disruption entering and exciting the building. Never staying here EVER again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is our second time staying here and it was great- very clean. Front desk staff Charnise and Cindy were very helpful. Subway was only 2 minutes away, and a very safe area to stay in. Parking was a bit expensive- around 40 US per night. We would come back here any time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We Stay for 5 nights. We get a "promotion" price. and Is just the price that I would pay. the normal rates are to much for the level of the Hotel. No the best service. One day we only had a single towel, just one. ( usually is 3. one hands, one toilete and shower.) neither for come out of the shower. we called twice requesting towels. nobody appeared. The hotel request 50 dollars per night as deposit. to be a "high" level hotel is a Joke. plus I requested quite in advance to get a High level. they didn't pay attention. just offer to change the room the next day. obviously the Next day nothing available. Not clear at the time that you are charged in the Bank account. I should be Chargerd around 700 Euros. and I paid 1700 Euros... It supposes that in 15- 30 days I will be get back the difference. You call them to claim this and they transfer you 4 times because they are busy.... just a joke. not professional. the Room was tiny. clean and good bed. shower with warm water. but all the water overflows out. toilet broken. flush of the WC broken... to be in Wall street is easy connection. in 10 minutes you are in Times square.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: For an HHONORS member, I couldnt believe how small my room was. Wont be coming back. In the Financial District, I expected more quality. The free breakfast was average but the help was terrible. I expected more from HILTON.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I would highly recommend staying at this hotel. It is comfortable and clean. The staff is friendly and courteous. The bathroom was modern and what a nice hot shower! The bed is comfortable and the furnishing are also modern. The only drawback is having to wait for an elevator if you are staying on a higher floor.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stay was booked through a third party, Virgin. It included breakfast. Receptionist demanded travel paperwork which we did. Our paperwork showed an "American Breakfast" but she stated she didn't know what that meant; it was our problem for going through a third party (they are the ones with contract) and we could be lying and trying to get a free breakfast. We had not bothered with breakfast for the first morning so we had even skipped a free breakfast at the hotel. Manager came in and when we looked to him he rolled his eyes and stated he had "just walked in." Well after much frustration (this went on for an exhaustive 45 minutes) he relented after yelling at the travel agent I had called to clear it up! We called Hilton headquarters and a few minutes later we got a call on the hotel phone from an apologetic manager. By then hubby decided hotel not a good place. We got a room at the Belvedere. Would never stay here. Would advise travelers not to stay here.The photo is a tray outside our room for two mornings. When we told the hotel they kept saying it was a new tray. We checked...it wasn't. Didn't post that photo...Petrie fish!!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was a weekend trip to New York City for shopping and entertainment. Although we did not select a hotel in the immediate midtown district the excellent transportation system made it easy to travel back and forth to our hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel rooms in general are tiny, same goes for this hotel. The rooms are nicely appointed and feature comfortable bed, TV, desk and bathroom (Shower only). While there is definitely noise, it is in a smaller Street and therefore not too bad for NY standards. The Hotel has rooms on floors 3-44 but there are only 3 elevators. There can be wait times of up to 10 mins in the morning.The hotel is adjacent to a small Italian restaurant, where the breakfast is served. All in all, I felt comfortable and safe.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at the Doubletree hotel for the weekend. Great location and most importantly a very clean hotel. All of the employees were professional and super helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone vising New York. We had a great view which was an added perk to staying at this hotel.
user_name:
Tiffany O
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The Double Tree is one of my companies usual hotels. It is great location for lower Manhattan and the financial district. Close walk to subway system or Battery Park or World Trade Center. Like all downtown hotels the room are small and the bathrooms smaller. But they make good use of the space you get. Ask for higher floor if street noise bothers you. It can be very noisy in the AM with trash trucks etc. I do ask for a low floor but that is because of the hotels biggest short coming - their elevators. There are 3 but at peak times you will be waiting. So I stay low and use the stairs. The rooms are clean and the staff are great! The bellman are always there to help with bags or getting a cab. The lobby is on the 2nd floor so other than checking in, I rarely go there unless I need to. The hotel is in the city so views are of other buildings. There is a small gym. I get free WiFi but it might be a perk of my frequent stays? I believe AT&T does their WiFi since it also popped up on my cell phone (AT&T).There are 10 rooms per floor. x01 - x06 go across the front of the hotel. x10 sides up behind elevators and can be noisy. I like the rooms away from elevators (x07, x08, x09).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Doubletree/Hilton in the Financial District was clean, helpful, and there is discounted parking in a nearby garage if you need that. The room was NYC/small, however, comfortable and attractive. It was close to attractions we wanted and not nearly as loud as other sections of the city. I would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here in December for a long weekend. Our first room was on the 17th floor and facing other buildings. It was too noisy as the ice maschine was next to our room and there was a contact noise from the outside. We change after the second night to another room with a great view.Rooms are rather small, but you have all you need and the location is fine for a New York visit. There are bars and restaurants in the neighborhood, so no need to go back to mid town in the evenings.Hotel staff was nice and friendly.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Being NYC , I see why the room was so small. The only complaint was that the closet, upon opening, was stinky (Body Odor), it hit me in the face right away, also the toilet was cheap, watch out when closing, slams. It's a good thing that I brought along a spray fragrance. The good thing about staying there was that it was in the heart of the financial district area.
user_name:
Fabian L
Dover NH, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Typical NYC business hotel. Microscopic rooms and astronomical prices. Getting out in the morning is a nightmare with only 4 elevator banks in a very tall hotel. Normally you wait and wait for an elevator and sometimes you just opt for the stairs. Tip: get a low floor to negate some of this. It is very centrally located to Wall Street, many restaurant options nearby and subway stations within walking distance.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Room was small. There were only 3 elevators for a 44 stories hotel - which was very uncomfortable to say the least. Breakfast is too expensive. I had a reservation for 3 nights and i checked out after 2 nights because the room was so uncomfortable. I was not reimbursed for the 3rd night.defiantly will not come again to this place and recommend others not to book there.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location in downtown NYC, close to all the lower Manhattan points of interest such as South St Seaport, Century 21, financial district, WTC, Freedom tower, Battery Park etc.Rooms are tiny, but that's the city for you! Would stay again.
user_name:
NicknackF
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Typically NYC smaller rooms, but the location, service and atmosphere is really very appealing. Walking distance to every type of restaurant you can imagine, plus other NYC features ... including the 911 memorial site and harbor access for tours to the Statue of Liberty. Reasonably priced parking just across the street. Clean and comfortable plus ideally located.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My wife and I spent 4 days in NYC and stayed at the Doubletree. Hotel was clean, hotel staff was friendly and it was decently located. The negatives about this hotel are that the rooms are fairly small, elevators take forever and the in-house restaurant is not worth visiting. It is close to the subway and within walking distance of the 9/11 Memorial and the Ferry to Liberty/Ellis Islands. If you want a basic hotel that's clean and out of the shoulder to shoulder people, I would recommend.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I am extremely pleased with my stay. Upon reaching the reception, The staff was very accommodating and welcoming. Upon getting in the room, it was clean and fresh just as how I expect when I stay with Hilton properties. During my stay, everything was great and I had a comfortable night of sleep. Just how nice I was welcomed, my check out was also a great experience. Overall, my stay at Double Tree in Financial District is a reason why I prefer to book my hotel stay with Hilton properties.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed at the hotel this December for two nights and we were not happy about the rooms at all. Even though we were booked in to a room with a King bed, we were given a Twin Size Bed which is comparable to a kids bed. wWen we asked for a King size bed, they were all sold out. The good thing about this place is that is steps away from the touristy places in lower Manhattan. Like some of the other reviews we too had issues with noisy neighbours and slow elevators.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Horrible experience checking in there. They gave me a real stereotype view of New York rudeness and discourtesy. And I am an HHonors Diamond member. Hilton really needs to fix this hotel. Their general manager obviously doesn't understand how to teach the employees how to treat customers. The rooms are incredibly small and the furniture is uncomfortable. There was lots of noise from the adjacent rooms, also.
user_name:
Michael T
Santa Maria, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I really adore this hotel.My friend and I we usually stay at the doubletree.. last time was Feb 16th to March 2nd 2015.That time was especially unforgettable, because they had some problems with the elevators, sometimes only one was working. And then however, there was a fire alarm at exactly that time when we wanted to leave for breakfast.. Gosh that was awesome! Walked down about 38 floors.. xDIt was just a false alarm i think.. But it didnt matter at all! Because it was action though! And btw, the guys working at the front desk are really nice! and always greet you when they see you..The rooms are as usually very clean! Chapeau to the houskeeping, really!And the beds are so comfortable! As soon as you lay down you'll sleep believe me!The only thing I really miss, is the bright day light in the room.. :(I cant wait to be back for another stay "about" two weeks from Feb 14th 2016 :)Hope to see you all soon again..Hana :)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We recently stayed at this hotel and we were very impressed with the overall hospitality and professionalism. We were greeted with friendly smiles and sincere helpfulness. This remained the case throughout our stay. We enjoyed the downtown location with South Street Seaport just a few minutes walk away and some cool bars and restaurants in the neighborhood. We would stay here again, without a doubt. Best staff ever!
user_name:
MariepixNY
Albany, New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is in a beautiful area in lower Manhattan. Lovely cobblestone road nearby lined with taverns. Hotel rooms are small, but well appointed and clean. We had a room (3010) with a gorgeous view of the water. The warm cookies they give you at check in are a nice touch as well. Overall a nice place to stay in a quitter area of the city.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Staying at the Doubletree NY made my fist visit to New York a wonderful experience. I will definitely stay again in the future. My room was very clean and the staff was wonderful and very helpful. Those cookies....oh my, so delicious!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The Doubletree is fantastically placed seconds off of Broadway and a few minutes walk from the new World trade Centre and 9/11 memorial - so for the sights and sounds of the financial district, work or pleasure, you could not ask for more.The rest however is all a bit jaded, old and small....and simply is not good enough to be better than average. The lobby is small and overstuffed, easily becoming packed on a friday afternoon during check in time or with groups. The 3 elevators are hopelessly overwhelmed with the number of guests, and being no staff elevators, are frequently full of employees and service personnel running from floor to floor.The fitness centre is small, just 2 treadmills. The rooms are small, no bathtub, and unless you are above a floor in the mid 30,s there is no view to talk of unless you like staring into the office of a nearby building.Be happy that most of the time you are not in the hotel but rather outside.If you must - I am sure there are better....

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed at the Doubletree at the end of November. This was my first ever visit to New York and after reading some of the reviews on here I was somewhat apprehensive. However, the hotel was beyond all of my expectations. It's clean, well presented and the staff are friendly and helpful. I'd chosen to upgrade my room to a city view and I wasn't disappointed in my choice. The view was spectacular and really helped to make the trip. Sights like the World Trade Centre and the 9/11 memorial are within walking distance, as is the Staten Island ferry, statue cruises (for the Statue of Liberty) and Wall Street. There are 2 really convenient subway stations nearby to take you uptown and a handy Walgreens on the corner for any bits you might have forgotten. In all I'd highly recommend this hotel and will consider staying there again when I next visit New York.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was the first time in New York, and let me tell you all staff from bellboy (asian guy) to the front desk (latin girl) was very friendly and helpful, we arrive early and the front desk Agent despite the hour she was very nice and accommodated us very quickly, also the chocolate cookies!!! don't leave the hotel without ate one of those!!, the location is was OK, not so far from the action, we definitely go back again!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stay in a lot of hotels when travelling for work but on this holiday I particularly enjoyed my stay here. The rooms are clean and tidy, not the biggest but big enough for the time you spend in the room when in New York! The beds were huge and very comfortable. The staff were so helpful, friendly and professional throughout our visit and couldn't do enough for you. We used the hotels taxi to get back to JFK after our visit which was the same price as a normal taxi but was much easier to get, it was waiting outside the door for us as soon as we came out the door. Really enjoyed our stay here, it was reasonably priced I thought for the lovely quiet location but still just a few subway stops (which is just on the corner of the street) from the madness of Times Square and all the other tourist destinations. Highly recommend. You would pay a considerable amount more to stay in Times Square which I've done on a previous visit and I'd never stay there again. In my opinion the financial district is the best place to stay if you're willing to use the subway- just download the NYC subway app on your smart phone and you can get anywhere!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is average but value for money. All staff from doorman over receptionists to cleaners are extremely friendly and helpful. The location is excellent for business trips to the financial center of New York. There are nice restaurants and bars in the vicinity.
user_name:
Machiel V
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Dont ever stay at this piece of crap place..Granted rooms are decent and cleanHowever, walls are paper thin and noise penetrates throughHad to move rooms twice because one time- two girls were fighting with their bf's at 4am in the morning totally drunk and wasted..second time..a couple fighting with each other at 2am in the morning...third time-- stupid spanish people deciding to sing karaoke at 1:30 am with no regard to their neighborsthe worthless security barely knocked on their door and apparently people did not careBetter spend your money with thicker walls and a rule for respect of noise levels !!!AWFUL EXPERIENCE EVER IN NYC!! Never Again
user_name:
patricia730
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for 4 nights with my 4 year old daughter specifically for the Thanksgiving Holiday. The hotel itself is ideally located downtown. Though we were quite away from midtown and "all the action" I personally liked this fact since we were able to escape the hustle and bustle of Times Square. The hotel is sandwiched between at least 3 different subway lines that ran almost every 5-10 minutes so getting to and from Midtown was really convenient.The room itself was admittedly cramped but it was still fairly comfortable for just us two. The shower did have a crack in it and the bathroom ceiling was peeling however the maid staff did an excellent job of cleaning. I have heard of complaints of price point but I stayed at the hotel for less than $200 a night on one of the busiest times of year. The hotel staff were extra polite and provides us with plenty of cookies and even a free ride on our first night. Charnise was extra kind to me and my daughter and we appreciated that! Also wifi was free!!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I would give this hotel 3 star. Make sure you have a room on the lower floor, otherwise you will be waiting for elevator forever:) waiting time approximately 10-20 min, but the location is amazing. Restaurant staff's service is outstanding. Would definitely go back.
user_location: Ashby de la Zouch, United Kingdom
user_name:
nataliewarwickshire
Ashby de la Zouch, United Kingdom

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Just back from a stay here. Damien at the front desk was a joy, he was so helpful and pleasant to deal with as were all other staff. Great location Whitehall subway station is just at the end of the block. Bathrooms a tad small but we expected this in NewYork. Rooms were cleaned everyday and standard was great- coffee and tea in rooms was surprisingly lovely (have stayed other places and it wasn't great). Only draw back was the elevator wait time, but it wasn't a massive deal for us. Will definitely be back !

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Unacceptable for the price point. Poor room accommodations, Guest Services refused to acknowledge or align with guest issues. I have stayed in other area hotels, paid less and obtained a far better overall experience. I would take the risk to stay elsewhere than stay at this location again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stay at this hotel at least three times a year for business trips to NYC. It's always comfortable and I enjoy my stays. The rooms are small (hey, it's New York) but well appointed. The staff is friendly, and while it's not a super high-end experience, it's nicer than many places I stay.There are two drawbacks to my mind. First, every shower door that I've had in this place leaks (since starting to stay here in 2011). The showers are trendy clear glass, and they look nice, but you'll have a puddle of water on the floor when you're done. Second, since it's a 44-story building, you can be hard-pressed to catch an elevator in the morning. If you're on the first ten floors, you're probably better off walking down the stairs. If you're above that, make sure you allot 15 minutes to catch an elevator. I've seldom needed that time, but it has happened.You're within one block of both the 4/5 trains and the R, and the 1/2 aren't that far away so transit is easy. There are a couple of museums nearby. The Financial District is pretty dead at night, but Stone Street can be fun.All in all, I like this place. I know what I'm getting and I like what I get.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a tough hotel to review. The surface appearance is not great. The street entrance is functional, and leads to a set of elevators, which are indeed very slow, as many have pointed out. The lobby is standard international. The staff are efficient and get you booked in fast. The rooms are tiny, but comfortable and well sound proofed, as long as you don't have an interconnecting door to the next room. If you want a view, you have to put up with slow elevator service. If you want a quick exit in the mornings, request a low floor (below 8th) and you can walk down the stairs. Otherwise, be patient.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was able to get a really great deal on this hotel. Was a little smaller then I expected however well worth it. I requested the very top floor with a view and they did not let me down. The staff was also extremely helpful and courteous. Defiantly wouldn't mind coming back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: It's a very basic hotel, nothing special, so don't expect much from it. It's good for a one night stay for business. I had no hot water in my shower, but did not report the problem. I was also overbilled for my stay, but then later the right rate was applied. I was originally given a bill for $438, but my credit card reflected the amount charged was $488. They later made it right without me reporting it. Also, the room had no shower cap, no tooth paste, and no body wash. The soap was terrible.
user_name:
Nadya M
Mahwah, NJ, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was a sort of half business and half leisure visit to NYC for me. The leisure bit included the slight distraction of running in the NYC Marathon on Nov. 1. The reason I booked this hotel was because of it's proximity to the Staten Island Ferry which takes one across to the Staten Island start point of the Marathon. It was also the most reasonably priced of the 3 or 4 star hotel available in Lower and Midtown Manhattan. I realised afterwards about the complaints about the elevators (lifts in my part of the world) being slow but still took the risk. It is not as bad as many reviewers say. I went up and down to the 20th floor where my room was many times a day and the only part of the day when it was slow was between 8am to 9.30am - but even then it was tolerable - maybe 5min to get down or up. It's not the worst I've experienced in my travels. So what else is good about the hotel. The location is fantastic for visiting Liberty Island and Wall Street area and downtown Manhattan. There are about 4 subway stations within reasonable walking distance and we had no problem getting to Times Square and other parts of NYC from the hotel. The Whitehall Station (yellow line, R train) is like 50 metres away. The floor plate is small, there are only 10 rooms per floor - it's good because it offers privacy. Nothing much to complain about the hotel and service. Staff were friendly and helpful - especially the staff who were stationed on the ground floor to welcome guests (reception is on the second floor). I even got an extra warm cookie for my better half who arrived later. An iron and ironing board was provided in the closet. Everything was up to the mark. I'm surprised at the poor TA ranking of this hotel. Small issues and minor inconveniences that one might consider when booking this hotel. The room is small. I think it was no more than 200 sq feet so quite cramp but there's enough storage area for us - and we had 3 large suitcases. The shower is fine with enough water pressure but the cubicle design is such that water seeps into the toilet floor. There is no mini-bar - not in the room I was in which was the King Room. There was no view from my room but I understand the upper floors might be better but you would have to pay more.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Ive never stayed in a hotel in Manhattan. Everything is sort of down sized from other hotel rooms in other areas and in other Hiltons...I suppose its the city way of life. While the room was nicely appointed and the bed and bedding were quality ( I had a King bed) the room was small. The end tables were about 12 inches wide and just enough room to get into bed on one side. On the window side of the room there was a little more room. At the foot of the bed was a dresser/tvstand/coffee counter (all in one) were there was just enough room to pass between the dresser and the foot of the bed. I like a nice big room. The bathroom was remodeled with modern fixtures. We got there at checkout time so the elevators were slow and packed. There is no lobby on the main floor. The check in desk was on the second floor where there was a comfortable seating area..Not really a convenient lay out. People left their luggage to walk up to the second floor because of the elevator situation.. This hotel did not have the vacation feel I like when I stay away from home. I view it as a business overnight hotel. I would try another hotel if I were to stay overnight in NYC again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a great hotel in NYC. Location is good and close to alot of subway stops. Yes the elevaters are slow but its a tall building and unless you're in a real hurry, its not a big deal...enjoy.Theres also a great itlian bistro in the lobby and an awesome Irish bar next door.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We were visiting King's College and this was perfect! Close to so many things in Financial District, and such friendly, helpful staff. We will be back! Beds were comfortable and except for some loud people entering their room next door, we never heard any other noise. (Once they were in their room, we couldn't hear them)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is very clean and comfortable. Staff friendly. Rooms are cozy and beautiful. City view. On Day 2 were two large towels instead of four. However, this was not a problem. I'm glad I stopped just in DoubleTree by Hilton New York City - Financial District.
user_name:
Anastasiia Z
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: As a Double tree this is not one of the better ones, its ok and the staff are great but it has some problems. The main on is the elevators, if you are a tourist and have lots of time then this may not effect you. The average wait for an elevator in the morning and around 5pm in the evening is 15 to 20 min. Often the faster route is to go up to come down, the elevators can only hold 8 people, that's with no luggage and in the evening most are checking in. Also it also seems that around 5pm they use one elevator to collect bags of trash!The rooms, for a US hotel these are small more like what you might find in some of the older European hotels and the shower... you have to stand side-ways otherwise you keep knocking the shower door open. Having said this I have stayed at this hotel many times but prefer the Hampton on the next block, unfortunately so do others and it is always sold out

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: A very convenient property if you're working in the financial district where there are few alternatives. Clean and well appointed rooms, staff who understand business guests, and laundry service that treats your dress shirts with care. In the morning the elevators are operated by staff members so that after three or four stops they are run as express cars to the lobby, i.e. no stopping when you're already full. When you're trying to get to the office time is money!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed for only 2 nights but the room was very clean and the floor was quiet. I was greeted by the bell hops going and coming and they were very knowledgeable. The one thing I liked most was how welcomed front desk agent Charnise made me feel checking in and out. Her smile was warm and the cookies hit the spot. Charnise really added something special to my stay. Ultimate professional.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Things that went wrong: Towel had mould/stains on it, tap kept turning itself off, leftovers from room service next door was sitting in front of my door for most of the day, asked for bottled water, although they gave it to me but told me it's supposed to be only provided on the first day of stay, but not subsequent days. Colleague stayed there a week before me, waited for lifts for at least 15 minutes EACH TIME everyday that he had to walk the stairs for 17 floors. Bathroom flooded after shower.Will never stay there again, worst hotel ever with the stars rating they claim they have.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed 3 nights on a mini getway. Staff was very friendly. The doorman even remembered us each time we saw him. Rooms are small but very clean & nice. Loved staying in financial district. Alot to see. Quieter in the evenings & just a short subway ride to the heart of the city. Loved the free warm cookies at check in!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great staff and very attentive. Nice location at far south end of nyc. Rooms are a bit cramped and the elevators are few and slow, so leave plenty of time if you end up on a high floor. Very clean rooms, great quality, comfort and decor. Reasonable pricing.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Spent four nights there on a business trip. My room was small, but clean and well presented, with a very comfortable king size bed and an amazing view. The neighbourhood is interesting with Wall Street and Battery Park very close. The breakfast in the hotel was disappointing, with limited choice and a poor display. The elevator provision was my main concern with long annoying waits in a morning being quite normal.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here for our very first time in NYC, we paid $220.00 per night. Well worth the price. The financial district is quiet and easy to get around. We used subways to get from Times Square, Central Park and all the other attractions. I would definitely recommend this hotel

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms are small but very nice. Great bedding! Room was very clean and comfortable. The staff at the hotel are all very nice and accommodating. Good business hotel. Breakfast was a little off, but no other complaints.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here last weekend. It was a busy weekend with Halloween and the NYC marathon. This was a perfect hotel even with some obvious issues. They need to work on getting hot water. I took showers and had to pretend I was in a rainforest under a waterfall. But the staff is so friendly, if you have a sense of humor, it's worth the price. The car service they hire to take you back to the hotel is so professional and efficient and reasonably priced. The Irish pub next door has a bartender with the sweetest and funniest personality. If you're visiting the 9/11 memorial or interested in any tourist attractions on the lower end of the island or in Brooklyn, this is a great place. But even if you are going to a Broadway show, which I did, you can get to Midtown in no time. I highly recommend this hotel. PS They comped one night for the cold water.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: There is no space to put things in the bathroom except a small shelf. Fine for a weekend away but not a longer trip. Staff polite. Room good except for noisy air con. Good free wifi and business centre.Downtown is not a good place to be if catching a Go Airlink Shuttle because you will be in it for a long time getting to / from the hotel since they stop / pick up there last and first respectively.
user_name:
Howard R
Auckland Central, New Zealand

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel and staff are very friendly and accommodating. Charnise at the front counter was very pleasant to work with and professional. The room was quite large by NYC standards and quiet. The doormen that greet you are genuinely helpful as is the rest of the staff whom I encountered. If you are traveling on business going to the financial district, I am unaware of any other hotel at this price point that is so centrally located and of similar value. In summation, this is a clean, comfortable and quiet hotel that is moderately priced. It is exactly what you hope you would pay for while traveling to NYC.
user_name:
James K
Providence, Rhode Island, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here on a business trip. Many nice restaurants close to the hotel. The rooms are small but that is probably the size of all hotels in this area. The lobby is on the second floor due to a restaurant being on the first floor. The elevators are slow at times so be prepared to wait a bit. Staff was friendly.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Doubletree has become my home away from home for business trips to NY Financial District. From the moment you arrive & the Doorman greets you with a Welcome to the desk staff who are very helpful, friendly & professional. Kelliani delivered terrific service during this visit. Rooms are clean with fresh aroma, fast wifi, location convenient for both work & play...close to Liberty Island Ferry to Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, etc. Loads of great restaurants in all price ranges, from classic NY pizza all the way to 5 star Michelin dinning. Thank you!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Excellent hotel and seemed to be good value in price when compared to other hotels. Friendly and helpful staff. This was our first trip to New York with a mission to sight-see the city. We wanted to see where everything was. We mostly walked and used hop on /hop off tourist bus. Used the subway one time. Once you understand the subway system (if need) it is easy to get from hotel to wherever you want to be. Much quieter and less congested than around midtown.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The Hotel and Staff were kind and professional from check-in to checking out. The room was clean, fresh and the internet service was strong. I would highly recommend this hotel to family and friends. We felt safe in the surrounding area both in the day and evening hours. Food was available on almost every corner. It was a great experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Rooms are clean.Close to subway stations.Close to subway for JFK.Cafes, bars, pubs and restaurants around.Elevators are few for such a huge hotel with 44 floors. In check out and check in hours you have to wait for a available elevator.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: It is greatly located hotel in the heart of financial district with many restaurants and cafes around and easy access to metro. The staff is very nice. The room was OK However, they are some problems. There are only 3 elevators working for 44 floors, and they are notoriously slow. The AC in my room was very noisy, the old style one, I had to switch it off during the night, otherwise I could not sleep.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We selected this hotel because I am new to the Hilton Honors program and we needed a place to stay in the Financial District of NYC. The hotel was nice with friendly staff. But for the price we paid, it was missing some of the amenities I have grown accustomed to at this price point in NYC. I travel to the city 4-6 times per year. The room was clean on its face, but upon closer examination, could have used a thorough cleaning and dusting. The room was amazingly small, with a very small and uncomfortable to use rest room and shower. The building had 40 or more floors only serviced by 2 functioning elevators. The floor was not quiet at night and it seemed like we could hear everything around us - from the elevators, to adjoining bathrooms, to the people above us. Good location for the purpose of this trip, but not worth the cost.
user_name:
John A
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Rooms are very small but I assume the majority of hotels in New York have small rooms. The hotel is clean and the concierge are very helpful. The warm cookie on arrival was a very nice touch. Great location, close to Battery park and Wall Street. It has three subway stops all within a five minute walk that do different routes - buy a subway map before you set off, it will come in very useful. The only downfall of this hotel is that the 3 lifts are very slow and unfortunately the staff have to use them so you may have to cram in when housekeeping are in a lift with their trolley. We had a room facing an office block out back and we were on the 28th floor so we were not disturbed during the night at all. We didn't try the hotel restaurant so cant comment on that but it did smell nice from outside. Would definitely consider this hotel again on a return visit. Thank you
user_name:
Lucy B
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have stayed at the Double Tree in NYC’s Financial District several times a year for the past 4 years. I accept the fact that the “complimentary breakfast buffet” at the Double Tree is not worth the money that would otherwise be charged. I cringe if I am offered a room on a higher floor as it will add a great deal of time to my coming and going. (There are 44 floors and only three elevators used by guests and staff). I am more than a little disappointed that the cable guide lists AMC as an available channel – which it was not, something of considerable importance to me given I currently watch a particular show at 9 on AMC on Sunday nights like the rest of America. It is the little things that can cause ones business trip to become more of a chore, but generally, life is good at the Double Tree, all things considered. I now feel compelled to write a poor review - not something I am in the habit of doing.During my recent stay, I was checked into a room on the 5th floor, a complimentary upgrade. I went out to dinner and chose to climb the five stories because the wait for the elevator takes such a long time. Upon getting to my room I discovered that I had not brought my room key with me. I walked down the four floors to the lobby on the second floor. There was a line of six people checking into the hotel. The check in process takes several minutes. There was only one attendant checking in guests. When a second attendant arrived from the back I asked her to scan me another key - a process that takes less than a minute. She told me to wait in line. I did. As I was standing in line, I looked to see her name, “Charnise”. Charnise noticed and asked me in a snarky voice if I would like her to write it down for me. I replied, “Well, yes”. She rudely replied that the person working next to her was her manager and her manager could write it down. I have never been so rudely treated at a Hilton property. I stay at the Hilton hotel chain often and am at the highest level of their customer rewards, Diamond. I am considering other properties the next time I am in NYC Financial District.
user_name:
TomBruce52
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My family and I had an absolutely incredible time while staying at this hotel. The location in the financial district is essentially unbeatable with close proximity to the subway truly "unlocking" the city. The rooms, although smaller than most were cosy and comfortable. I never felt like I was in a box. Seeing how I was visiting family my time was hardly spent in the room anyway! The Check in / Check out process was smooth and simple.Something I'd like to specifically point out was the incredible help that me and my family received by the doormen downstairs. Allen, originally from Hong Kong was incredibly courteous, funny and friendly. He took his job seriously and it showed through with his work. Such an incredible guy with a great attitude. Ibrahim, from Senegal was equally as incredible. Studying the cures for ebola to become something great in this world. I truly wish them the best! I highly recommend staying at this hotel. At the end of the day, these two men downstairs made everything worth it. Especially since the elevator is quite slow and it's nice to talk to people ;)
user_name:
Harzstyle
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff took really great care of me. Mike in particular was wonderful. He personally picked me up when I was lost. They also found the Kindle I lost and sent it back to me. I would like to thank you all

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed two nights in this hotel in October 2015. We were on the 5th floor and the first night some drunks were having a party in the street under our window, very noisy. Other than that, our stay was fine. The restaurant had a good breakfast. The room was very small but adequate for our needs.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We wanted a location that was within walking distance to Battery Park, restaurants, coffee and breakfast, and was fairly quiet in the evening and this hotel located on Stone Street was it, and besides; Doubletree by Hilton hardly ever disappoints. Check-in and delivery of luggage was super and what a treat it was to receive a nice warm cookie upon check in, yum!! The bathroom was nice and the shampoo, conditioner, and lotion was of good quality. No shortage of water pressure - it felt like a "gushing waterfall" great for sore muscles after a long flight!!!The room was great with wonderful white fluffy bedding and coffeemaker. We especially appreciated all the electrical outlets.Staying in a hotel with 40 something floors one can expect slow elevators and this was no exception.Except for the carpets, which could need a little TLC the hotel has a nice overall clean feeling.The on location restaurant is convenient, has good Italian food but it's a little pricy.Overall we were very happy with our stay and we will be back should our travels take us through New York again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at the DoubleTree in the Financial District in October 2015 and overall had a great experience. The staff were very friendly and checking in and out was very simple and quick. The room had a great view of the Hudson River and was reasonably sized. The bed and bathroom were pretty good overall and had no complaints there. The elevators are a bit of a pain. The building is a 44 floor building and there don't seem to be enough elevators to handle the number of floors/guests that they have. The location of the hotel isn't the best, the entrance is on a smaller side street as opposed to on the main block.Overall I had a great experience and would definitely stay at the DoubleTree in the Financial District again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My group and I stayed here recently. A special word of thanks to Charnise M. for her professional check in of my group and her friendliness. Also the Bell Staff Tony Flobby and colleagues were so helpful.Also a super location. Thank you for a wonderful stay. looking forward to seeing you all again. Aideen Higgins Tour Manager Just You
user_name:
Aideen H
Province of Rome, Italy

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: After flying in from LA where hotel reception staff had no customer service these guys were fantastic, sorry can't remember their names but great advocates for the hotel. We chose this hotel purely on a cost basis compared to the ridiculous prices closer to uptown. However there were subway stations across the road and after spending 1.5 days there we managed to go up Empire State Building, see a Brooklyn Nets game at Brooklyn Center, Statue of Liberty cruise, saw a Broadway show and walked Times Square and caught subway back to JFK.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: In summary, staff and bed&bathroom were positive experiences. The gym, elevators and room floors require an immediate upgrade due to their obvious problems. However, the location just isn't cosy.The best part was friendly and helpful staff. However, the hotel is located in an area filled with enormous skyscrapers and tiny alleys. The sunshine is minimal and roads are dark and dirty. The activity seems to die out at evenings after local employees travel back to their homes. This is no place to hang out or enjoy your freetime. Luckyly, transportation is easy due to several subway lines crossing the area.The bathroom was actually a good one and it might have been renovated some years ago. Also, the bed was comfortable and clean. The coffee maker was also useful addition to the services. However, the floor carpet was extremely stained and dirty looking. The floor alone is so critical aspect of hotel room that it alone made the room look old-fashioned and dirty. The problem would be easily replaced with a new floor. The gym was also a disappointment. The cable-machine was partly broken. There was no barbells for squats but only some cardio machines. Luckyly, dumbbells are so versatile that you can train most of the muscle groups with them. The dumbbells covered all the way to 50 lbs.Slow elevators became a problem when cleaners had to move their stuff from floor to floor with them.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel and Bell Staff exemplary. Great location for my needs. Small room but that's NYC!! Bed amazing. Bathroom small but had what I needed. Ddin't try restaurant but it looked quite nice. Loved the neighborhood Trish bar-Mrphy's next door. defintiely worth a visit.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Nice Hotel, great employees, very busy elevators in the morning......close to ,many great places to eat and lots to see within easy walking distance... very near all subway connections and variuos ferry rides also
user_name:
Gary C
Mesa Az, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: A great stay, nice clean rooms, fantastic staff. Easy access to the subway, 20 minutes to Times Square and walking distance to Battery Park, Stanten Island Ferry and the 9/11 Memorial. A lot better price than the Hotels in Times Square. The only downside is it is a 42 story Hotel with only 2 elevators--so spent a lot of time waiting to go up and down (stayed on the 35th floor this visit).
user_name:
Kevin James B
Charlotte, North Carolina

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I'll start this review how I start all my reviews... I travel for work. I stay in over 100 hotels annually and over 1,000 in total so far. I've stayed in everything from the highest end hotels, to boutiques and mid level chains. I've seen the gamut and have pretty realistic expectations of what to expect from a property.I chose this hotel solely based upon its location in the city. I needed to be on wall street for work, and chose this property because it was within walking distance. If you're looking at this hotel, it would only be specifically because of it's location. It is close to the twin tower site and battery park, but not much else you'd want to see in the city. The rooms are very small, and the bathrooms even smaller. It made a multiple night stay feel very claustrophobic. Forget two people trying to share this bathroom, that won't happen! The hotel is very tall, 45 floors or so. The entire property is services with only 3 elevators, so prepare to wait anytime you want to use one, and stop at a lot of floors. At one point it took me 10 minutes to get from my room to the lobby. The one thing that annoyed me was the air conditioning unit in the room. NYC is noisy, and I like to keep the AC units fan on to help drowned out the noise of the city. Unfortunately, these units can't do this and they are loud, so I was either kept up by the sounds of the city, or awoken by the AC unit turning on and off all night. It didn't make for a great nights of sleep. The room was clean, and well maintained. I can't complain about this hotel, it suited my purposes fine and I would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is compact since it is NYC, however the staff are fabulous. Their fabulous service makes up for a smaller room. The hotel is conveniently located to a lot of NY sights. It is easy to access public transportation.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We enjoyed a great stay! Very reasonable and comfortable in the financial district, within walking distance of historic sites and great restaurants. Our stay included a full breakfast, which was great.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed on the 40th floor with a great view of One World Trade Center (The Freedom Tower). Stayed Friday and Saturday night. Parking directly across the street. Breakfast is offered in the adjacent restaurant. Friendly staff. Clean. Only minutes to Battery Park. Easy access to Battery tunnel to visit our son in Brooklyn. Also, easy access to the FDR. We would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for a few nights as part of a trip to New York in September. You often know what to expect with large chain hotels, so the little extras improve a stay. We received a room upgrade on arrival to a higher floor with an amazing view of the Freedom Tower.Very friendly staff at this hotel, on the front desk and the porters. Clean room and very comfy bed. The welcome cookie was also a nice surprise! Conveniently located near Battery Park and the ferries to Liberty/Ellis Islands. Also easy access to subways to the rest of the Manhattan and beyond. Only downside was the length of time waiting for the lift to reach the top floor but that was only a problem twice a day!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is probably one of the smallest double tree rooms i have ever stayed in. But i guess thats what you get for being in the city. Clean rooms, convenient location. I was hoping for more of a view from my room but all i could see was the back of two very tall buildings nearby. Good restaurants in walking distance.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Nice hotel, definitely a good value for New York. Modern and clean. But these rooms are small, more like a hotel room in Europe than New York. This is an old building, elevators are also small, and creeky/slow. There is no staff elevator that we could see, so housekeeping uses these elevators, too, which makes them even more slow. Saying all that, it is, as I said, a great deal for NYC prices. And we happened to have a fantastic view of Freedom Tower. Staff is helpful and nice. So, saying all this, I would stay here again. Decent enough at the cost, to put up with the negatives.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I really enjoyed our stay at the DoubleTree. At first I was kind of worried that it wasn't in the middle of the action but it turned out to be a blessing. The hotel is on a small side street and very quiet. At the corner it the subway stop which takes about 20 minutes to get into Times Square. Also near the hotel is a Chiptole, Duane Reade, Starbuck, Au Bon Pain, etc. Granted some of these close early since its in the Financial District. Our room was on the 30th floor and didn't have any issues with the elevators. We may have waited a minute or two but it was nothing to complain about. The bed was incredibly comfortable too. Overall I would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location of the Double Tree is centrally located in the financial district, with easy access to the subway. The hotel's staff was very helpful and courteous. Our room was a little small, but had everything we needed. Would recommend.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was built with a small footprint and 44 stories, just note the lobby is on the 2nd floor from the ground entrance. At the ground entrance was staff to assist guest with transportation, storing luggage or general information. Each floor has 10 rooms with narrow halls during my stay noise from neighboring rooms was not a major factor. My first stay was on the 10th floor facing Stone Street and did not notice a lot of noise. I had to extend my stay after check out and was able to get another room. This was on the 4th floor facing the opposite direction, here I did notice more noise from outside. The staff was excellent and am planning on staying here in the future if business brings me back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel experience and the quality of the rooms and their amenities were up to the standards of other Hilton properties. The staff was friendly, and the beds were comfortable. The rooms and hallways are definitely on the small side, but it's about what I'd expect for Manhattan.A couple of things prevent this place from getting 5 stars:- The elevators are slow. When you've got 44 floors, 3 elevators just doesn't cut it, especially when they're slow. The problem is further exacerbated by the fact that the lobby is on the 2nd floor, so you wait forever for an elevator because people are taking them from the ground floor to the second floor and back down.- The king beds are not quite king size. They're about 4" short. Didn't bother us too much, since you can sleep a little diagonal, but it is noticeable.- They don't have any automated check-out, either on TV or on the phone. Despite receiving a statement under my door on my last night (and having a credit card on file), the desk staffer on the phone said I had to go down to the front desk to turn in my keys. I hope it was just a miscommunication.Now there's a lot to like about this hotel, including the price, and the views from the upper floors on the Hudson side. The doors, windows, and walls are very soundproofed -- we did not hear our neighbors at all, nor did we hear much traffic noise. But the elevators and lobby can get crowded, especially at check-in and check-out time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good quality price. Great location to visit NYC and his attractions. Rooms are nice and clean.My and my wife really enjoyed our stay. Close to restaurants and Ground zero.I'll stay again here in my next trip!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I enjoyed a nice, restful stay here while on a busy business trip. The room was clean, comfortable, and quiet. The location is great, near some fun restaurants and bars, with easy access to transportation.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: At first glance, this narrow wedge of a hotel seems so tiny but it juts 44 stories up into the lower Manhattan sky. The lobby is on the 2nd floor, so you must take the elevator up, which is the first hurdle. There are three tiny elevators in all, and all are mighty slow to arrive! We could tell that the staff was very embarrassed by this problem, and did all they could to help guests maneuver. There are only 5 or 6 rooms on each floor. Each very small but pretty well thought out to maximize space.The bathrooms do need a bit getting used to. The faucet at the sink is easily bumped, and friend staying here had the faucet pop right off, causing water to spray all over. There is one tiny towel bar, and no space for a tissue box. The shower was nice, but the GRAB BAR is too far away from the shower head so you can't hold on, and the soap shelf is also at the opposite end of the shower. That is not the fault of the hotel, but of its designers, but Doubletree needs to know that!Checkout was smooth; there was a minor issue with one of the folios, but staff took care of it smoothly and immediately. Every staff member we encountered was professional, courteous and very helpful. Avoid the restaurant for breakfast - $18 for an omelet is a bit much, wouldn't you say?

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The rooms were very clean and quiet. The staff were really friendly and went the extra mile to work with me on getting the type of room I wanted. They really made me feel special and like they were there to make sure I was happy. I will definitely recommend this hotel to others staying in the area.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location, but a little run down. Narrow dingy hallways, very loud air conditioning, understaffed lobby and elevator problems. I was here for a couple of days for business, so it was fine. Would have been more upset if it was a vacation with the family.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was a little concerned after reading all the reviews mentioning the elevator delays, so I was very happy to see that all three elevators were in service when we arrived. Unfortunately, that didn't help; elevator service was so slow that it wasn't uncommon to wait 3-5 minutes for one to arrive.
