Once it did arrive, we had about a 50/50 chance of it being full of passengers already.This is especially bad when entering the hotel: since the lobby is one floor above the entrance, it wasn't uncommon for guests to hop on the down elevator when they wanted to go up. This meant that you could either spend 10-15 minutes waiting for a second or third elevator, or walk up a few dozen flights of stairs to your room.Making matters worse, on both days of our stay, busloads of tourists were checking in and out. The entryway and lobby were filled with suitcases and/or lines of people waiting for the elevators. Be prepared to take the stairs at every available opportunity.Did I mention that all three elevators were in service?The room size was typical for a NYC hotel. However, the room itself was worn out. Light fixtures were bent / dirty / burnt out, the TV didn't have any HDMI inputs (seriously -- it's 2015), the clock was completely dead, and the overall impression was really underwhelming. I could forgive all of this if this were a 2-star hotel or we got a major discount, but this is a four-star hotel, and not a cheap one at that.The only pros of the hotel are its location and the fact that it was very clean. There's a lot of restaurants and bars about one block east on Stone Street. However, you can find much better hotels nearby at the same or lower prices. This hotel should really be downgraded to a 3-star, if not 2-star rating.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Right from the start the staff was rude and disrespectful. I have special needs and they did not accommodate the way a hotel should. I did not have a shower seat and they started off by not even giving me a wheelchair accessible room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a very good hotel in the Financial District. A friendly welcome and quick check-in (with warm cookies), nice rooms, clean, plenty of wall plugs for chargers, comfortable bedding, nice showers and TVs, good desk space in rooms. Whitehall St. subway station (the R train) is just two buildings down the street, which was great. Subway (South Ferry) for 1-2-3 trains also close by.We had a problem with the thermostat in our room, and an engineer came within 2 minutes to fix it (just new batteries) so we were good to go.Lobby is nice for sitting, using one of the computers, ice water available, also a tiny gift shop for a cold soda or snack. Though there is a small mini-mart next door to the hotel, too.The only problem was that with 44 floors of guest rooms, you can sometimes wait for the elevators. Three small-ish elevator cars, so a lot of wait time. But maybe all NYC hotels have this problem. We picked a room on one of the lower floors, which helped.But all in all, a comfortable, clean hotel. Be sure you try the Italian restaurant, Antica, on the ground floor for dinner . So nice to have an excellent restaurant right on the spot. And Nebraska Steakhouse, also excellent, is just across the street.
user_location: An American living in Northwest England
user_name:
MJP-22
An American living in Northwest England

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel and staff were great but only 2 working elevators brought out very long waits and crammed conditions when elevator did arrive. Caused some tempers to flare when people tried to get into filled space and those inside felt crushed. Understand both sides tho.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I booked this as was a Hilton and in the right end of town. The entrance is scary and weird as on a totally different level to check in. The 'welcome' at reception was rude and all that they said to me (and others) was 'Hello, give me your passport and credit card'. No hello, welcome or even direction as to how to find the room, just dismissed. The rooms are not cleaned during the day as no staff available. Severals calls to their 'care line' made no difference. I've stayed at Hiltons before and this one seems to be out on a limb and without any management or care at all. Avoid.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Room is small, like startlingly small if you're from the west coast and are used to expanse. But everything is clean and modern, so there's nothing wrong, just getting used to the small-ness. One thing that I noticed was a lack of places to hang things like robes or towels, also the housekeeping was highly irregular (not a problem, but it became a game with myself to figure out where and if there would be a bath/mat left, how many towels etc)Yes, elevators are a problem. You should plan 10 minutes to leave the hotel, but you will rarely use the whole allotted time. Bring earplugs and sleep mask! The construction on the street goes late into the night, and even from the 16th floor I could have participated in the workers' conversations because of the echo. There are also a lot of lights.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This place is not how it looks on the website. It is old and needs to be renovated. The rooms are small, the hallways are small, the bar is not inviting. I would never stay there again. The staff was friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was traveling solo on business and had an enjoyable stay. Clean and comfortable. Breakfast was great and lots of options close by. I myself did not venture out but trip advisor had many recommendations very close by.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Pro: good location. Right off Wall Street and Battery Park. Near 911 Memorial and Freedom Tower. Near Fraunces Tavern, and near the Subway. Clean.Cons: Micro-Rooms. Pricey. Only 2 elevators. They are SLOW. We waited as long as 10 minutes for an elevator.Do your homework.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here on our first night in NYC, basically just a stop off for the night and the hotel was really pleasant.. Clean and spacious rooms with friendly staff. The location was surprisingly really good - well it was for us.. It meant that the Statue of Liberty along with battery park and Wall Street were all on our doorstep so we got to see that side of New York whilst staying there. Tourist desk was really helpful. Would stay again.
user_name:
laurenjadecrabb
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for one night. Hotel is in good location if your need to be in Financial Distract for work or vacation. The rooms are adequate for NY hotel, but small vs other standards. Bed was comfortable. Two big issues from my stay, first, the hotel is 44 stories and has only three elevators, which service all floors. You have to wait and wait and wait. While they can't retrofit the hotel, they should invest in technology to better manage the lifts as other hotels do in NYC with limited lifts. Second, they assigned someone else to my room while I was in it, not fun having someone walking into your room late at night. They didn't apologize until check out, when I brought it up. Check out was slow and they did not leave an invoice at my door. So if you must stay here, just know to leave time for the lifts and be sure to lock your door from the inside. Otherwise, stay somewhere else.
user_name:
RJMGreenwich
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location of this hotel is excellent and we specifically wanted to stay here because of its proximity to our friend's home. It's really easy to take a train uptown to either side of New York from the hotel and there are great restaurants around, especially the Bluestone Lane coffee and Route 66 steakhouse. Hotel staff were helpful when asked for assistance. Hopetoun was specifically helpful in arranging a vehicle to the airport. With two little kids, we were extremely grateful for a room on the 5th floor. The staff really worked hard to manage the lifts in peak times. If you are travelling with kids, we would highly recommend the Junior Suite so that you have room to move. Everything was clean and after travelling 30 hours on a plane, the clean room and bathroom is exactly what you need. Tips for travellers staying here - water only goes on the floor if you hold the shower door open; the hotel lobby is a very nice place to sit if you are awake at 3am with jetlag; go for breakfast early or later than 8:30am if there is a tour bus staying there.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a tall narrow hotel that suffers from a serious logistical flaw. The elevators are insufficient for the design and create a constant, irritating bottleneck. After waiting for extended (5+ minutes) isn't unusual, the car that stops is often jammed with guests, or worse room service carts, that force you to wait for the next one. The rest of the experience was about

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Depending on what price you get, they tend to be on the higher side, with lower amenities. Staff is excellent, quick resolve to issues like clogged shower from previous guest. Biggest problem was the elevator - sometimes you can be waiting up to 10 minutes.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I paid extra for a river view - totally misrepresented on the website. River could be seen through cracks in the building and only from one angle in the bedroom. Noisy air conditioner which I could not have on to sleep, ice maker outside room made noise every time guest came for ice. Got very little sleep, which did not help my business trip.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: awesome location downtown near battery park & wall street. Hotel staff is very friendly - will stay there againHotel is right around the corner from Fraunces Tavern - was a nice surpriserooms are cozy & clean - great walk in showers

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: First I will start by saying the hotel is situated close by WTC, 911 Memorial & Museum, plus Battery Park & ferry to Statue of Liberty. All walking distance. The hotel & rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. Now the bad part. The hotel, I would guess is more for business by the room size. No more than one person could use the bathroom at any time. No microwave or mini frig in room, due to lack of space, only coffee maker. The hallways were narrow, compared to other high rise hotels and there were only 3 elevators for 44 floors, so be prepared to wait whether going up or down. City View room for extra cost, questionable at best. My guess, while staying at this hotel, you pay for closeness to surroundings, not room size or amenities. Subway easily accessible from Penn Station and restaurant on site any direction outside front door.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Room clean and quiet. Two elevators for 44 floors. Horrible! Waited 20 min for elevator. Carry your own bags unless you want to wait 30 minutes to receive them. Nice breakfast. Staff nice. Nice area of financial district with lots of restaurants nearby.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Overall the Hotel is OK. The rooms are VERY small and there are some significant issues with the elevators (wait times in excess of 20 min). The Hotel staff on the other hand are outstanding, providing kind, courteous and responsive attention to Hotel guests.The Hotel restaurant on the other hand treats guests terribly. After returning from a long day in the City, my wife and I ordered takeout from one of of favorite restaurants in NYC. Upon returning to the room I called down to room service to ask for two sets of plates and silverware. I was unkindly told by the onsite restaurant personnel that I would need to come down to the first floor in order to pick up these items. I was so excited that I declined to wait the requisite 20 min for the elevator and RAN down 35 flights of stairs so I could commence my romantic night with my wife. When I reached the restaurant I was given two sets of plastic flatware. When I inquired as to the availability of actual silverware and dishes, I was informed by the restaurant manager that this was impossible because he could not track them (WHAT?!?). He told me he was only capable of tracking items provided as part of Room Service and not dishes/silverware provided to guests. This still makes no sense to me since he could easily have provided the items via room service, just without the food. After significant discussion he finally allowed me to leave with 2 dishes under the condition that I physically bring them back that night. I eventually got back to the room (after the normal elevator wait) and showed my wife the mediocre victory I had achieved. She was irate, not only with the fact that I was down in the restaurant arguing with their staff for 30 min, but with quality of service we had been given. She called down to restaurant manager and expressed her complete disappointment with his service (we were offered free breakfast for our stay, but declined). It was after this discussion with my wife that the restaurant manager, apparently fearing complaints, finally offered to bring dishes and silverware to us.The moral of the story is that there are a number of hotels in the area that provide a much better experience to their guests. Until such time as the restaurant staff realize that we are PAYING to be here and treats guests properly, I would stay somewhere else.
user_name:
Danny_Nelson529
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel's location was ideal-various subway stations closeby, great eateries/restaurants within 1-2 blocks, a (free)museum around the corner, the famed Wall Street & NY stock exchange a few blocks away and Battery Park & Statue of Liberty ferry about 2 blocks away!!! And more! I was a bit disappointed at the entry of the hotel-definitely needed some sprucing up but the 2nd floor lobby was small, clean and the staff were quite efficient, friendly and knowledgeable. The room was small but clean and cozy. I would definitely stay here again. Best price for this location!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: OK rooms, great location, but 3 elevators for 44 floors is a stretch. Then when one was out of service for most of my stay, waits to get out in the morning were horrible. Room was quiet and A/C good. Good dresser space and a compact desk. Bathroom space is tight.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was expecting a little more from this Doubletree Hotel. When we checked in, the lobby looked like a homeless shelter with many people (presumably guests waiting to be checked in) just sleeping in the chairs or on the couches. As expected, the room rate was pretty pricey but I wasn't expecting such a tiny room and bathroom. Positives about this hotel were the great location to the train stations, comfy king size bed, and a fantastic air conditioner. Negatives include having only 3 elevators, a small room and a tiny bathroom with very little storage space (towels were stored underneath the bathroom sink). The 3 small elevators were generally full either with guests or with the hotel cleaning staff. Overall, just another average hotel!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We asked for a high floor so we ended up on level 41 out of 43.check in was quick and easy and included a free warm cookie and water which was a nice touch.The room was nice, cable tv, coffee machine, roomy, clean and good condition.The location is great. In 5 minutes walk there are 3 subway stations, Statten Island ferry and a few restaurants and bars. Felt 100% safe when walking any time of the day or night.The room was regularly cleaned and sheets changed after 3 days.We only had to deal with reception on check in/out and when we collected our delayed luggage. You will see the staff around who are always happy and exchange pleasantries.My only criticism is there are only 3 lifts for 43 floors of rooms. During peak times they are sometimes full and some people get the lift up to come down as they are so busy.I would stay again, highly recommended

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was the cheapest, decent hotel I could find in Manhattan for the weekend I stayed. Upon turning on the bathroom sink, the entire faucet head shot out at me, and water started to spray everywhere. After calling the front desk they said they'd send a technician, but I asked for another room and they obliged, plus I got a free breakfast the rest of my stay.What everyone says about the elevators is true. You'll wait a long time and by the time they arrive you're completely cramped.There was no toilet paper in my bathroom, so I had to make do with the box of Kleenex provided. I never asked for some (should you have to in a hotel?) but not once did they provide any.The room itself was nice, and being in the financial, pretty quiet. And the staff was helpful, but looked like they could have used more help. For the price I paid (around $200 a night) I was expecting much more, but NY hotels are like NY apartments. Space is limited so they can charge a lot and don't have to be very good.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Charnise was friendly, welcoming and acknowledged my frustration in trying to check in earlier. Every hotel experience starts with a good checkin and Charnise made this one great. Rooms are functional. Comfortable bed. Hot shower. Wardrobe. Definitely returning to this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: typically small rooms. more expensive rooms are the same size just with a river view -not worth the extra cost. elevators are frustrating at check out/in time and at 5 PM when the cleaning staff switches duty. don't count on good cable TV or wifi. it's there but third rate. staff is nice but overwhelmed. Great location - the only good thing.
user_name:
BillF270
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My stay at the Doubletree by Hilton in the financial district was nice and comfortable.Upon check-in we received warm cookies which was a nice surprise. The room was modern and cozy. As with other hotels I've stayed at in New York, the room wasn't humongous, but it felt clean and not too "lived in" which was my main concern staying in the city.There were some renovations being done so the wait for the elevator was super slow the entire trip. Other than that, the staff was friendly and helpful.The location was good for my trip as there are a couple of train stations nearby. There was a Chipotle nearby which was helpful after getting in from a long flight but other than that you'll have to walk a bit to get to another food place.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I enjoyed my weekend stay here. The room was small which is expected of most NYC hotels. The bed was huge which was the best part. I got free wifi for being an HHonors member. Their was a restaurant that seemed to get a lot of visitors, but I was not a fan of the menu since it was mostly pasta options. The staff was very friendly and always had a smile. I would stay here again for a quite getaway in NYC.
user_name:
CHRISTOPHER M
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I go there for one night, in general its very good, the location is great the only issue for me is the voices from the next room, if you have a noisy person next to your room you probably will hear every thing otherwise the hotel is very good and every thing is great

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: First of all, the staff was friendly and helpful... so not a reflection on those folks. However, most likely not a return property. Elevator situation was awful. Only three elevators for a 30+ floor hotel. We were on the 9th floor and walked down several times after waiting 10 minutes or more for elevator. Heard some people walked down from much higher floors. On the rooms... expected small rooms, but the bath was just too small. No place to put anything! Had to keep my dopp kit out side bath and my wife had absolutely no place to put her makeup, etc. Had to actually enter the shower to turn on the water. And what design genius though putting lights in the mirror.. only pointing directly out.. would give light for shaving, etc. There was a restaurant on the ground floor, but staff acted like we were doing them a favor by coming in for breakfast..

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great hotel that is reasonably priced for the area. Very close to Metro with easy access to the rest of Manhattan, Brooklyn etc. Walking distance to Wall St, WTC, Battery Park etc. Great Irish bar next door thats open late for drinks or food if room service does not ring your bell

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: It is a corporate hotel down in the financial district, it is Spartan, functional, and not meant for a lavish experience - I.e caters to its primary clientele. It's price point on the weekend is hard to beat so if you're looking for a weekend where you are mostly out eating and enjoying the town, this is a good affordable place to crash. Rooms are small, hallways are small, and the service is hit or miss.On the other hand it is clean, neat, and useful. If you have lavish expectations and imagine it like the Ritz Carlton across the way in Battery Park you will be disappointed - and deserve to be so. But, if you're with friends and spend little time using hotel amenities and need a place to stay and a great price, this place will serve you well.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We had booked a king sized room. When we arrived we didn't get the best service as I said my name and then the receptionist disappeared. As we had been on a long haul flight and it was gone 10pm it seemed like she disappeared for ages. In the end we had to ask her colleague where she had gone. The problem was my credit card I booked with had expired so they needed a new one but it would have been good to be told this rather than hanging around at reception for 15 minutes with no idea what had happened. Then there was no king size rooms available so we ended up in a twin double - we had to wait for this room to be got ready. We were given a room on the 4th floor despite asking for a high floor as there was no other rooms available. However, this was great as we could easily walk to here and not have to get the lifts. There was a few problems with the room like the toilet roll holder had fallen off and a few things were missing but these were quickly rectified. We were very impressed with the maid our room was very well maintained. We thought the location was great - we arrived into Newark and got the NJ transit to Penn Station and then got the red subway line to Wall Street stop which was under a 10 minute walk. The hotel was on the same street as the yellow line with stop Whitehall street on the same street as the hotel. Also Bowling Green on the green line was just around the corner. This meant no matter where we were going we rarely had to change lines. A number of attractions are within easy walking distance of the hotel such as Staten Island, the financial district and One World Trade Center. There are lots of bars, restaurants and shops nearby. Overall despite the initial teething problems we were very happy with our stay, we had a large clean room and no problems whilst we were there so I would recommend.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: First things first I want to provide some context. My business trip was last minute and on a holiday week that also happened to include 9/11 making room availability in lower Manhattan scarce. The only room I could reserve was handicap accessible which I HATE. Before starting my review I want to compliment the Front desk who was able to find a non-handicap accessible room when I checked in. The Good: Cooperative front desk staff, attentive doorman, comfortable beds, plenty of plugs for electronics, somewhat updated accommodations, I could use my iPad to stream HBOgo with no issues. The Bad: Little help from their "Care Line". A significant amount of Water was making it out of the shower to the bathroom floor. Called the Care-Line but nothing was done. Filthy vent in bathroom blowing out dust bunnies. Called the Care-Line, nothing was done. As a Diamond member eligible for a free breakfast buffet very disappointed that there was literally no seating available in the restaurant each morning. The tv channel guide was outdated. Called the Care-Line, no new guide provided. Extremely long elevator wait. Compared to other Hilton stays, this one was a little below average but maybe this was bad timing? I think I may need to stay here again and update this review to see if the issues remain.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Rooms were very small, Had to get into the shower to regulate it. No Housekeeping for 2 days. Elevators went down for several hours and guests had to walk up and down as many as 44 flights. No one seemed to care
user_name:
Sal B
NYC, NY, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We arrived earlier than our reservation and they had our room ready within 30 minutes and offered us warm delicious cookies and bottle water. Room was nice and Comfortable. Very nice staff and very helpful especially the doorman. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Upon arrival, the first friendly face that we encountered was Luis. He was the bellhop/valet attendant/cab caller/ elevator director (not sure how many other jobs he had either). He was great. He took our bags and our car and then told us we could go up to the lobby to check in or have breakfast in the restaurant. We opted to go up and see if checking in was an option (which it wasn't yet - but that was ok it was before 9AM). The young lady at the front desk told us that we could leave our bags downstairs, which we did. I saw her offer the man in front of us a voucher for breakfast in the restaurant downstairs, but figured we didn't get one because we hadn't checked in. We ended up eating downstairs in the restaurant and paying for our breakfast. Morale of this story is - ask for your breakfast voucher or whatever.The next day we were checking out. We left our hotel room at 10:00am and stood in the hallway waiting for the elevator to go down for 30 minutes. My boyfriend and my sister's boyfriend ended up walking down the stairs to try to see if they could catch the elevator up to the 19th floor to get us. We would have also walked, but my sister is disabled (lung disease) and could not really make it down all the stairs without getting winded. The guys called us from the lobby and told us that one of the elevators was out and there was a long line of people trying to get upstairs. Against our will, we had to take the long walk down to the 2nd floor from the 19th floor (thank God for oxygen tanks). We made it to the second floor, checked out, and then proceeded to the lobby to get the car from the valet (which we waited 20 minutes for as well). Once we left, i received an email from my bank for and extra $110 charge from the hotel. When I called, I inquired about the charge and was told that the car was parked in the valet for an additional 30 minutes and they charged us for another day. I do not really find it far to be charged a whole day for parking when we waited 30 minutes for the elevator and 20 more for the car to be brought around.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My husband and I needed a night in the city and chose this hotel just so we could stay in a different part of town. The location was great, the staff was warm, friendly and helpful and the the price was perfect. I really enjoyed my stay. A particularly thank you to the lovely desk staff who checked us in and located another room when ours wasn't quite ready. Charnise defined good customer service!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The service wasn't as bad as the other reviews say it was. They did take care of their customers the best they can. However, the elevators is the main problem. They are really slow and there are only 3. The room is really small. There is no space to walk besides to the bathroom which is like 2 feet away from the bed. The room looks modern and clean so that was good. The bathroom was clean but did not have a blow dryer and hand soap. Overall, it was an average hotel. Seen and been to much better ones in NYC.
user_name:
Joong Y
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The Doubletree is centrally located in the financial distict, in easy walking distance of everything interesting in this area. It's a typical Doubletree - friendly service, decently furnished rooms, allowing you to have a good night's sleep. And it's typical New York, room sizes are on the smaller side, not cheap, rather dark.I would have given it 4 points, it it wasn't for the elevators. It's a tall hotel with a small footprint, but has only 3 elevators, and one of them was under maintenance. That meant up to 10 minutes wait. If guests are inconvenienced in such major way, one would expect a token of apology. But nothing, apart from a sign to prepare for longer waits.So if you are looking for an ok room in a central location close to Wall Street, the Doubletree is not a bad choice. If you have higher expectations towards your hotel, look elsewhere.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The doubletree by Hilton financial district has a fantastic location. Around the corner from battery park the raging bull and Wall Street you have everything you need for a stay in New York. Subway about 300ft away from hotel and it will take you about 20 minutes to get to Times Square. Rooms were good and clean, however try and get a room on the 4th or 5th floor or all the way up top. Elevators take a long time since there are only 3 for 44 floors of hotel. However since you will be spending most of your time in the city this is not a real problem. Parking across from the hotel for 40$ per 24 hours. Slightly cheaper a couple of blocks down. Very nice place to stay if you want to avoid the busy time square hotels.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Went here with my mom, best hotel in Manhattan. Great location and you have everything you need just outside the door. The staff is really nice and they have a great restaurang. The room we had on the 9th floor hade a lovely view

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here due to it being close to Brooklyn, which was where we were going. Worked out perfect! great places to eat around the corner, hotel staff was so so so helpful! short walk to Battery Park, Freedom Tower, Wall St. and the Bull of Wall St. Close to MTA stations

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here as part of a tour group package but also booked a very expensive extra night I guess it was due to it being New Years. Located with good eateries in walking distance but is away from all the hype of Manhattan. Our view was of other buildings which was expected in the concrete jungle. The rooms were well set up and modern although bathroom was a little awkward. The only issue I noticed was the lobby was on the second floor and was a little confusing with no signs when we first arrived. There wasn't enough elevators for the number of floors and we always felt like we were constantly waiting to get up and down especially seen as we were on the 27th floor. Would only stay here again of the rate was cheaper

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: They offer a very comfortable room, I enjoy the personal attention given each time you arrive and leave. Parking is available one block away for the most affordable price. And when I fly, I request a car and it has always been there when I need it. I recommend all my friends stay here.
user_name:
Julie C
Traverse City, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here with with wife and daughter for 4 nights. The hotel is located close to Wall Street just 2 blocks from Staten Island Ferry. The lobby is on the second floor, but the bell man was very helpful and took our bags and there was no hassle at all as we checked in late on Thursday night. The check in was very smooth and pleasant even though we got in only by 11 PM. The room had been held ready for us. We had requested a city view room and got one on the 35th Floor. We were welcomed with a smile, a bag of cookies each, and complementary bottles of water. The lifts are fast. There are three lifts which created no problems on the thursday and Friday morning and after Sunday afternoon. Friday afternoon onward got quite crazy. The hotel was very busy with peolel checking in and checking out all the time from Friday afternoon till Sunday afternoon. The service personnel use the same lifts and we had to wait 5 to 15 minutes (if the lifts arrived packed and you coulod not get in) on these days.The room is small but comfortable with 2 queen beds, and a wardrobe. there are no closets but plenty of drawers. So we could stash away all our clothes and stand up the 3 large check in baks and 3 carry on bags, and still move around the room comfortably. There is a coffee brewer woth paper cups and complementary coffee packs and creamers, but no tea bags (cant figure out why). The beds are soft and comfortable with plentty of soft pillows making for very good sleep. The bathroom is small but clean and neat with a shower stall. Plenty of hot water. Complementary toiletteries are available. There was an ice machine on our floor. there are drinking water fountains neat the common wash rooms. The complementary Wi-Fi and the common complemnetary PC stations in the lobby (from where I am penning this) are a great plus. The hotel has no restaurant but there is a very good authentic Italian restaurant on the ground floor (soup, entree, and main = $55) which hosts the breakfast buffet ($18). Our room rate included the breakfast which was quite sumptuous (scrambled eggs, sausages, bacon, pancakes, breakfast potates, cut fruits, fruits, a selection of muffins and croissants, mixed granola with brown sugar, toast, a selection of cereals, and tea / coffee/ juice). Taxis are available right outside the hotel. The Gray line Down Town Hop-on-Hop-off stop is just 2 blocks away on bridge and state. You can take the bus to the Hop-on-Hop-Off cruise at Pier 77.Fare from airport to the hotel by Yellow Cab is $55.Rooms are cleaned every day and the staff are all very pleasant and helpful. There is a concierge desk that can arrange tours, transfers, and other services.All in all a great place to stay on new York.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: First time to NYC and we made a good call in where to stay. We had read reviews about delays with the elevator, but only had that happen once in four days. The room was clean and quiet, and this area of NYC was safe and was conveniently located to subway station. A couple of minor, minor things with speedy service but other than that it was what we wanted - a quiet room and being left alone.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is one of the worst hotels I have ever experienced. The elevators are soooo slow and we even planned an extra amount of time to be able to use them when necessary. I called ahead about a double bed and I talked to a really nice lady who told me as long as their is availability that day they can switch us, but when we got there this horribly rude lady told us we would have to pay $50 extra to switch and she didn't know who i talked to but they gave me false information. I also accidentally left a charger there and have called over 20 times to talk to a housekeeping person but my calls are never answered and my messages never returned. The room was actually decent size for NYC but my towel was threadbare and I could see through it. I asked for new towels and they were never brought. They also told us we could check in at one so we showed up at one and it was not ready. Please do not waste your money on terrible customer service.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed at hotel over weekend for a friend's NYC wedding. Nice location as quieter than the ones very close to tourist places but still easy to get around. Several good restaurants nearby for easy walk. Room was comfortable but NYC-stereotypically small. One downside was the elevators were very few. Plan to take awhile for them to arrive if the hotel is busy!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This past weekend I booked and prepaid for a double room at this hotel using Plum Benefits. The room was for my best friend's bachelorette party whose wedding I am a bridesmaid in. A week prior to the reservation, I called the hotel to inquire about checking in earlier than the standard check in at 3 PM since we had a lot to prepare for the evening and several people coming from out of town. When I called, I was told early check-in is not guaranteed until the day of check-in but to call the morning of the reservation and see what the likelihood was of getting in early. When I called the hotel at around 11:30 in the morning on the day of my reservation, I was greeted by an extremely rude front desk person who said, "Let me explain something to you, I don't know WHO you spoke with here or who told you to call, but we do not confirm early check-in over the phone. You would have to be here and in the lobby for me to check you in early..."After basically being yelled at by this woman, I decided against heading downtown early and decided to just wait until the standard check-in time at 3 PM. I arrived at the hotel at almost 3:30 due to some traffic getting in to the area. When I got to the front desk, I was told that my double room was not ready yet. This sent me into a complete panic because I had people arriving soon to begin the evening and who needed to get ready, not to mention the bride coming in 2 hours. I explained to management that I needed to know if the wait would be 15 min or much longer and that I actually called the morning of the reservation asking to get in early. The front desk person then proceeded to call and page housekeeping 5 times without any answer. The manager came over and said, he was just awaiting confirmation from housekeeping if the rooms were ready or when they would be ready...I'm still not sure what kept him from just going up to check the room himself. After standing in the lobby for about 30 minutes waiting on some kind of confirmation or ETA on when I could get in, I'd had enough and said I needed to be in a room very soon or my evening was going to be ruined. The manager then explained he could put me into a room, however something in the shower was broken and they would have to send a maintenance man to come work in the room while we were in there, or we would not have an operating shower. Great.The manager brought me up to the room and said a maintenance person would be up shortly to repair something in the shower. This was at 4:00 PM, a full hour after standard check-in and technically, the room still wasn't ready. 5 minutes later, the maintenance person arrived and asked me what needed to be fixed...I had no idea, having just gotten into the room myself, I thought for sure someone would have told him what he needed to fix. He then called the manager from the room's phone and I had to listen to the manager on speaker phone berate the maintenance man for walking into a room and not knowing what to fix. Awkward. The maintenance person was in there about 5-10 minutes and then left, thank goodness. I still have no idea what was broken or if it was even fixed.The only thing I was offered as consolation for this entire mess was a free breakfast voucher and that was AFTER, I had to ask to be compensated. Nothing was actually offered to me without provocation.Throughout the whole weekend, whenever we called the front desk to ask for anything, we were treated poorly and I was only given one room key upon check-in. To top off everything, there were little gnats flying all around the room and since there were only 3 elevators servicing all 40+ floors of the hotel, we spent a significant amount of time waiting to even get downstairs. Over all, I'm just glad we were only there for one evening. I will never be back to this place. Skip it.
user_name:
Christie S
North Bergen, New Jersey

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is OK. Its central in the financial district, close to the ferry but needs a bit of a makeover. The air conditioning was noisy and I had to switch off over night. There was no bath in the bathroom but the shower was good quality. The rooms as you might expect aren't the largest but OK. They seem to be sorting out the problem with their lists as there was a note apologising for having one out of action whilst upgrading. Staff were friendly and approachable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed 3 nightsProsVery quietFree wifiFree breakfast coupons Comfy bedGreat value for nyc ConsELEVATORS Slowwwwww even when all 3 are operating on weekendsSmall roomsNear battery park and sightseeing bus stops and subway

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Staff is friendly enough, but service is not what I expected. One elevator was out (there are three). Extremely long wait to get on one that wasn't full. Bathroom is small. Tight sink space. Bath towels were on a shelf below the sink, while the wash cloths and hand towel were on a bar connected to the vanity. I had to re-arrange the hand towels in order to close the bathroom door. It would have been helpful to have a concierge available at the desk. Unfortunately, no one was there when I stopped by. It's a good thing that I knew my way around somewhat. Other than those minor issues, the hotel is clean and in a great location. Be sure to get a list of the restaurants in the lower Manhattan area. The hotel is in the financial district, and some places may not be open on Saturday or Sunday.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel was perfect for our family event. My daughter and I stayed here for a long week-end. We chose the place because of the good brand of Double Tree and the perfect location to my other daughter who lives in the Financial District.
user_name:
Jana M
Camp Verde, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The price was right with AAA, and the room was surprisingly a decent size for NYC. While still smaller than the average non-NYC room, we had two people in a king bed room and didn't feel like we were tripping all over each other. The room was clean, but we wished that a mini fridge would have been in the room. It was inconvenient to have to chill our food and drinks using just ice. However, we only stayed one night.The location was fine, albeit a little quiet after dark. But it was conveniently located to multiple subway lines, the 9/11 Memorial, and Battery Park. Two issues worth discussing: the elevators and parking. As others have noted, the elevator situation in the hotel is EXTREMELY inconvenient. Not all of the elevators are working, which caused very long waits and very cramped elevator rides. Additionally, we were told by the gentleman that greeted us upon arrival (not the front desk, someone on the first floor) that we could park across the street for $40/night. After checkout, they tried to charge us $52 for parking and said we needed a stamped ticket from the hotel. No one from the hotel told us anything about needing a stamped ticket. We showed him our hotel receipt and they did eventually honor the rate, but they were surly about it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Near by local trains. Starbucks is a plus for many and you can find 2 very close to the hotel. Within walking distance of the famous Battery park!!! The hotel restaurant had decent food but the service was average. Hotel staff was helpful for the most part.
user_name:
Marielena C
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: i visited the hotel last week in February this year. The hotel has many positives: - It's location. This hotel is somewhat out of the way of the real hustle and bustle of New York but in a nice and easy commutable distance. There is a subway station at the end of the road and is only 15 minutes to Boadway/ Times square. There is also some good tourist attractions close by such as 1WTC, Staten Island Ferry just around the corner and also Wall Street. There is also a really nice pub next door which can get busy with a decent child out atmosphere of an evening. - Rooms. The rooms are very good value for money compares to other hotels in New York City. They are clean, a good size and if you can get a room at the top (pending you're not scared of heights) there are some great views of the Hudson or the 1WTC. The rooms also had a good choice of TV channels - Fast WIFI! A real bonus - Porters are really helpful with cases and other baggage (don't forget to tip) On a negative note: - Cleaners. hmm now a lot people state how Americans can be a bit 'peeved' if you do not tip them if they are offering you a service. being British we don't have this cultural problem. Throughout my trip i gather a lot of coin change, which i was chucking in my bedside table.... on one afternoon i returned to see that all the change had been taken... now it was only $7/8 if that... but in Britain, we'd say that if you are not given something... to take it, it is called stealing. -front desk staff. at times the staff can be really abrupt and rude. we made our booking through booking.com... on our booking the price was clear... when we arrived at the hotel after travelling for near 20 hours the front desk staff told us we also had to put down a cash deposit of $50pppn.... now we did not have this (although we had the full cost of the hotel) the clerk argued with us for a good 40 minutes. he advised that he would 'check' with his supervisor if we could continue to stay....a real lack of customer service! - THE LIFTS. Grr having 1 lifts for a hotel with 46 floors (the other always broken) was a nightmare... there was an evening where we waited 22 minutes for the lift to get to us... we was on the 44th floor... nightmare! -(at no fault of the hotel) It snowed the whole week we were there... now although i did say this hotel was in a very good location. using the subway was real tricky with the ice and snow.Would we go back? ... well it was good value for money, so i think we would...

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Really liked staying near battery Park. This hotel is very close to several subway stops for easy access to uptown and Brooklyn as well as the ferry station.The rooms are tiny (typical NYC) and we had no view to speak of. But, it was well appointed, clean and had a very comfy king bed. Two upgrades needed are bars/hooks to hang towels and surfaces to place suitcases on.The staff are great. Very helpful and accommodating. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The Doubletree-Financial District is in a great area next to Battery Park. Close to the Freedom Tower and Wall street. There's alot to do within walking distance. Great hotel with above average size rooms for NYC. Only down side is the elevators are slow due to renovations in the hotel

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This Hotel is nicely located near Wall St., however we discovered that some taxi drivers were not willing to go there. But the subway is just a few minutes to walk.First we had a room in one of the lower floors, which was quite noisy because of some construction work outside (even at night). When we asked the manager about this, they gave us room at a higher floor which was way more quiet.(A room at the other side of the building was not available.)The food was nice and so was the complimentary cookie (there is a chance of getting some more, if you ask really nicely ;) )

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel has a good location close to Wall Street and Water Street. The room was larger than others in NYC and was clean. The lobby is on the second floor, which threw me off but no problem once you figure that out. For tourists, this is also a good choice. The side street it’s on isn’t anything special but it’s walking distance to lots of activities and close to many subways. I would certainly stay here again if the price was right 
user_name:
JuliaTryon
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Firstly, this is in the financial district and there is not much to choose from anyway. I stayed there due to work. Pros: The rooms are clean and pretty well maintained. Room was quiet. Interior Lobby was nice. The Italian restaurant at the base of the hotel is very good. Cons: The lobby is on the 2nd floor, which is okay, but 1 of the 3 elevators was not working so the waits were long. I was on the 14th floor and the view was really bad. They advertise free Wi-Fi, but it would not work & had to go across the street to a vendor's office for internet.
user_name:
William D
New Orleans, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Fantastic location - hotel is close to the financial district and walking distance to Ellis Island/Statue of Liberty ferry. Subway is 20mins to Time Square and goes regularly. Our king sized room was smaller than those in other counties but still a good size, bed was comfortable and everything clean. Flatscreen TV with loads of channels. Check in was quick and convenient, as was checking out and there are facilities to look after luggage until the flight. Only downside was the elevators (as mentioned in other reviews). Signs apologising for the delays were not dated and so who knows how long the maintenance has been ongoing. A ten minute wait to go down one morning meant we took the stairs instead. Wifi is also in the lobby only and struggle to make it up to rooms on higher floors. Overall, a very relaxing few days and would gladly recommend.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If you are looking for a hotel right in the financial district this is a great location for you. This is my 3rd stay for exactly that reason. At some point I might learn the subway system and stay in a different neighborhood. Also the hotel seems to be reasonably priced. The rooms and bathrooms are really small, but clean. There are only 10 rooms per floor and 40 something floors. Elevators are an issue. One was down for repair for the duration of my stay. Also because the floors are so small you get a lot of elevator and ice machine noise in your room. Check-in line was very long and slow. They need a dedicated Hilton Honors line like most other hilton hotels have. Front desk person was anti-helpful. I had pre-checked in. He said he would give me a better room. Instead of being at the end of the hall in room 1 as I had pre-checked, he put me in room 10 which is grouped around 4 other rooms (so you hear doors banging shut at all hours) and an ice machine. Either he doesn't know the layout of the hotel he works at or he did it just to piss me off. Not sure which, but not a good way to treat a diamond member.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Near metro stations and Staten Ferry terminal. Lots of cafes and restaurants nearby. The quality of the hotel room is tip top. The only 2 complaints I have 1. It took me 30mins to wait for the elevator at 23 floor as they had maintenance security check during the week I'm staying. 30mins is very long! 2. No one offered me 1/2 day rate or allowed me to have late check out when I said I will leave for the airport at 6pm.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: stayed here for a week - it is difficult to find a decent room at a decent price at this time of year in nyc - but planning in advance meant we got a double room for below $200 per night . this tall skinny hotel is squeezed in between buildings in the heart of the financial district on an odd but well positioned little side street set in the financial district. very well served for subway options and because of the big office population in the area very lively early and at lunch time with numerous good lunch places to choose from within a stone's throw - dig inn, chipotle etc. you will read about the elevator problems here and its not such a great situation but we booked a room on the 4th floor and used the stairs sometimes to avoid the wait but it was generally ok and not as bad as it might appear in the reviews you find here. the snazzy reception is on the first floor so don't be concerned by the underwhelming entrance lobby. meals including nice breakfast served in a restaurant on the ground floor. our room was compact but pretty comfy and room staff excellent did a great job everyday. a/c a little temperamental (dealing with +90 degrees can't be easy) - but it worked if a little rattly. front office reception staff were absolutely fabulous - helpful, friendly, efficient, courteous and patient ready to help with everything - they should all get huge raises immediately : - ) - why are more hotel staff not as friendly and accommodating as these guys ? we visit nyc regularly and although it is not the center of manhattan this hotel represented very good value and i would definitely stay here but probably only if the price remained competitive in comparison to midtown options.....

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Attention when booking this Hotel! The policy of this Hotel is blocking a high amount on your Credit Card for nothing. In my case near the same as for my whole stay (7days). Then you can wait long time until this Deposit will be unblocked from the Hotel!! Unbelievable practice....Also, the elevators not working good. Waiting times up to 15 minutes....no comment...The aircondition in the room is very loud, also not a plus...A one time experience, this Hotel is not worth 4stars....is between 2 and 3 stars, not more!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here about 18 months ago... owing to the great location for business and the nice attitude of the employees I gave it another go despite sub par elevator experience last time. This time my better 1/2 came with- so my review here focuses on the room as well. The lack of full time, responsive elevators is the reason behind the poor rating I give. The hotel is supposedly "working" on the elevators but it's beyond the pale. Not only that, but the tiny hotel room isn't efficient. the restroom is small but, geez, howabout using the small space wisely? there's a lack of rails to hang anything and the set up is not smart. I "get" we're in NYC but it would be smart to hire an efficiency person to get better use of your small room. The staff remains dedicated and the location is excellent for work...

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: + located in the middle of the financial district, close to subway station and ferry + clean rooms with good views+ Amicable service/staff o Standard breakfast offer - Very small rooms (I know it's New York)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Carpet was dirty in the hallways and the elevators were the slowest in the world. However, the staff was excellent service providers from Floddy at the front door to Venetta in customer service. They mailed me my headphones that I left in my room. Very nice people.
user_name:
Walter C
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Our stay here was perfect. I wish I could remember the names of all the staff that were genuinely friendly, knowledgeable and helpful - from the people at the door, front desk, housekeeping and restaurant. Perfect location for what we wanted (Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island, WTC, 2 blocks from the subway), and the rooms were tidy and tasteful. Parking is $40 (get it stamped/validated) for 24 hours and is two blocks away, but don't plan on taking your car in and out, because it costs you every time. Which was fine for us because we took the subway everywhere, from the Bronx to Brooklyn and in between. Don't expect a room with a view. My only regret is not going out to the trendy bars and restaurants nearby. Definitely will stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Front desk staff were very friendly and accommodating as were the bell staff. Rooms were tiny, but that is to be expected in NYC. Wonderfully comfortable bed! No room in the bathroom to put any toiletries or makeup, they kept falling into the sink...Only real issue though were the elevators, they were very slow and since I was only on the 7th floor, it was much easier to take the stairs than to wait for the elevator.
user_name:
kimberlyh377
Forest Hills, Pennsylvania, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location, near multiple subway stops, walking distance to tours to Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island and Ground Zero and 9/11 Museum. The staff was friendly and the room was clean and comfortable. Good value for price.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The DoubleTree in NY's financial district is old and behind the times. Elevators are very very slow. If you decide to take the stairwell you'll have to walk around trash that people throw in there from their rooms. Air conditioning is noisy and has to run constantly due to the poor insulation of the old building. On the bright side the staff is great, accommodating and very friendly.
user_name:
Joseph K
NY, NY, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We had booked this room through a third party (ie;hotwire). Upon checking in, the reception desk identified that my husband and I would be uncomfortable in a full size bed for 5 nights. They were able to move us the second night we were there, and even moved our luggage for us. In addition, the communication between the staff at the reception desk was superior. The hotel is located in a convienent location close to the subway or walking to WTC and amazing restaurants. The only negative was the slow elevators. That being said, it was clearly communicated and posted thorughout the hotel that warned us that due to some construction, there would be a delay and we should plan accordingly.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights over a weekend. Hotel is just across the street from the R line and walking distance from "Z", "J", "1" and "5" line. It is in the Wall Street area and quite close if you want to go visit Chinatown, Little Italy and Brooklyn. Staff were really polite, helpful and friendly. It's quiet over the weekend because offices nearby are closed. However, that also means train services in that area may be suspended or less frequent. I had a room close to the elevators but the noise level were acceptable. However, the hotel's elevators are going under maintenance and sometimes there are long waits. Do not expect any views through the windows though. Overall, it's a good hotel for sightseeing.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I chose the DoubleTree for the location near a client on Wall Street. From the entry into a small elevator lobby to the front desk area and the guest room, the hotel is in need of a deep cleaning and refurbishing. The elevators are being worked on, which I understand has been going on for a while, so the wait is long to go between floors. Also, the hallways throughout the hotel do not feel like they are air-conditioned, so you are already feeling muggy before you even get outside. The room I reserved was not available, so they gave me a smaller room with a double bed. I noticed that some papers from the prior guest had been left on the desk in the room. The worst thing is when I pulled down the bed covers, there were body hairs and crumbs on the sheets. Clearly, this room had not been cleaned and the linens had not been changed. I called the desk and they very quickly moved me to a new room. The room was clean on the surface, but not sure if it really was. Furniture is shabby with lots of dings and stains. Bathroom grout is moldy.The room size and layout is okay for NYC. However, they provided only a tabletop ironing board and no full-size ironing boards were available. It is impossible to iron on those ironing boards. The other major complaint is the lighting in the room is very poor and even the bathroom lighting is too dim to really see when you are putting on your makeup.The staff at check-in were very courteous and the person who came to the first room to bring me the keys to my new room was very kind and apologetic. The staff were the best thing about the hotel. The location is very convenient to Wall Street, old Stone Street, and subway lines.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Understaffed, under construction, wait 5-10 minutes for an elevator, mold on the bathroom ceiling from a leak above, minuscule rooms. Oh and since the elevators are slooow, you often have to use the tiny stairs, which they pile garbage bags in. I suppose a good price, but truly a "bottom of the barrel" NY hotel.
user_name:
gordon b
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I had been to NYC before and remembered a lot of places we visited were near the bottom of Manhattan so when booking for my family thought this would be a good place to go and a bit quieter at nights too. The Doubletree hotel was clean, the rooms were reasonably sized and the staff were friendly and helpful. The location was great - handy for visiting Liberty and Ellis Islands, the Brooklyn Bridge, Staten Island ferry (great for a free trip at night coming back the view of the lights of Manhattan are amazing!) and close to plenty of metro stations to take you further uptown. The breakfast was great and buffet style too. My only moan is that the reception is on the 2nd floor and it can take a while to get a lift to get up there - one was out of order during our visit and I never saw anyone working on it to fix it. Wouldn't put me off returning though, overall a great hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I booked four rooms together for my family. I could not get a guarantee for all the rooms to be together until I checked in. When I checked in there was not one room available on the same floor. I was on the 22nd floor, My Mom was on the 6th floor, my sister on the 11th floor, my daughter on the 21st floor. This hotel has 44 floors only 2 working elevators, and one of them was used as the service elevator.... Our suitcases were all mixed up delivered to the wrong rooms. Waiting for the elevators was....FUSTRATING!!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stay at the double tree in NYC Financial district on a regular occurrence. I have found that the staff goes out of their way to ensure you have a pleasant stay. The rooms and hallways are clean. I would suggest the facility to anyone coming to NYC.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel location is ideal for financial center business. The 31st floor location should have offered good city views but was blocked by the building nest door. Elevator service was slow and spotty. If you want a clean bed with a terrific shower, this is for you
user_name:
David D
red bank, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Really a good location and clean and spacious quarters. Have stayed there several times. Restaurant on street level which is good and affordable. Courteous staff. If active or retired military ask for the military discount rate. It is a good rate. Will definitely stay there when I have work in Manhattan. Located next to Murphy's Pub on Stone Street.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The area is the best area in the Financial District. Close to the subways and amazing staff! I had an inconvenience with my flight. When I got to the hotel the Front desk had made sure that I will have a nice stay by making sure to give me a nice room with a nice view. Staff are always helpful and turned around my mood into one great one. Love, love, love the shopping that I did! Front desk gave me pointers where to go to! I will definitely be back soon!!!
user_name:
Marie-Christine C
New Jersey, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My family and I stayed here for an extended weekend. The staff were friendly and nice. The rooms were clean. Enjoyed the free cookies upon arrival.  For the cons: if you like small spaces this is the place for you. The hallways too narrow and no air so someone walking through with BO will definitely stink the place up . The rooms will challenge your fear of confined spaces. The newspaper is available, but you'll have to go to ground level to get it. Why not deliver to the rooms you ask. The 3 elevators they have are without a doubt the slowest I have ever experienced. I gave it three stars because this is my first trip to the Big Apple. I don't know if the 'everything is small in NYC' is the norm.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Small NYC rooms, which is the bane of the City, and not unexpected. Close to the ferries and Delmonico's. Room was clean, internet worked fine. Solid experience. As far as hotel food, with so many options in NYC, don't rely on the restaurant for "Italian" food. Also, the breakfast is very limited and of mediocre quality.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We love staying at the DoubleTree in the Financial District! The price is great and the service is outstanding. However, the night life in FiDi/Tribeca was less than impressive. If you don't mind spending a little extra cash, I would recommend either a hotel in MidTown or taking a taxi.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great stay and staff! Was given a nice and very clean room. Bed was very comfortable. Staff was very helpful and genuine. I will definitely be returning to this Doubletree when in New York City. Subway stops right around the hotel. Lots of restaurants. Battery park, stock exchange. Overall great stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is relatively new -- maybe so new the first floor isn't complete? It's missing a proper luggage storage desk and bellhop there (luggage is just put behind a tarp). The real lobby is on the 2nd floor which seems really inefficient for travelers and confusing.There are only 3 elevators for more than 20 floors of rooms which means a long wait time going up or down. While we were staying there at least 1 of the elevator banks was out. There is some nice refreshing spa type water with infused fruit that makes up for some of it. The staff is nice and friendly. There isn't much immediately around the hotel but it's close to a few major subway lines so it can be convenient if you aren't going uptown a lot.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Loved the location, close to subway lines and Wall Street and Battery Park and ferries etc. Very well placed. Very friendly staff and very clean rooms. Our only complaint is the wait times for the elevators. They are slow. Very slow. They seem to "rest" near the top floors and so you can wait several minutes if you are staying on a mid-level floor. Its a nuisance, but not really a problem, per se. Just annoying. We'd stay here again for sure.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Although nowhere near the best place I have ever stayed, nor the cheapest, for its location, right next to Battery Park, I would recommend. Our room was a city facing room on the 36th floor. It was clean and had everything we needed. The air con was loud from the building roof across the road and the room air con was very loud when on, as well as the noise from the bathroom fan. These altogether made it a little unbearable at times. But after a day or two there, it seemed ok. People say the lifts are slow, I agree. But plan your day right, don't leave at 'rush hour' and you'll have no problems. Excellent transport links for metro, buses and ferries.Polite staff, average room, bit too much noise but excellent location, comfy bed and half decent views mean it does have its good points.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is like Motel 6 at best. Upon arrival late from west coast (3AM in the morning) in the night not only the staff gave us a feeling of welcome, they were rather annoyed to have to deal with a large group late in the night. When we entered the hotel, the carpet was clearly dirty, room cramp and cabinet in bad shape. Next day maid service was omitted. Overall very poor experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff of this hotel and the restaurant was amazing. Always offering to help and always smiling. They even kept us informed of which elevator would be next. The food in the restaurant was magnificent. The best Gnocchi i have ever had.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Location is great. Close to 911 museum and ferry to Ellis Island. Right in the heart of the financial district. Subway was right across the street. very convenient. good customer service. Room wasn't ready and everyone worked towards getting us settled.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed at the doubletree in the financial district in July. The rate was reasonable for the location. The location was pretty good. That was the only pro of this hotel. Dirty rooms, shower full of mold, elevators weren't working, paper thin doors. When we went to use the iron in our room, it was stained and ruined our clothes. Needless to say, we will never stay here again!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We selected this hotel to meet up with family and tour the city. Staying over 4th of July holiday was a mistake since housekeeping significantly declined during that time. At first it was ok but then we had dirty tile floors, dirty shower doors/toilets, etc. it never improved until the last day. Rooms are the smallest I stayed in at a Doubletree but comfortable and modern. Elevators are ridiculously slow at this location. Management posted signs asking guests "to allow extra time" when requesting an elevator. We were on the 30th floor and often times we had to wait no less than 20 minutes for an elevator down to meet our family. Staff is using elevators also they do not have a service elevator so this impacts everyone. Overall the price is good if you can bear to deal with the housekeeping issues and the elevators but we opted not to stay here again next time.
user_name:
Tanja S
Collierville, TN, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Drive by car from JFK took almost 50min late in the evening, so have this in mind.Check-in was good, friendly staff.Hotel is located at a rather small street, thereby reducing noise from traffic, which we found good.The room was ok, quite regular. Could have used bit more space for our luggage, but ok as we only should stay at the hotel for one night.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed at the Double Tree - Financial District (8 Stone St) for 3 days over the 4th of July. Hotel rooms are NYC small (to be expected) but very clean. They appeared to be recently renovated. Very pleased with our stay. Great location to see Lower Manhattan. The old section of NYC is just a block away. Lots of restaurants. Good vibe. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is the fourth time I have stayed at the hotel and it has been deteriorating every time I'm there.Firstly, lets start with the positives - the location is good, loads of subway lines close by and good for thr financial district. The wifi is also very goodHowever the negatives significantly outweigh the positives. I had to wait in a line for 30 minutes to check in on a Saturday afternoon. There was only one person working the desk. There are only 2 functioning elevators in this 44 storey hotel. This is hugely important as you may have to wait 10 minutes for an elevator to arrive at busy times. The rooms are very small and need significantly updating..I do not plan on staying here again and would not encourage others to either

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: A Groupon deal led us to this particular Doubletree, and I’d stay again if I could get the same kind of deal. My review is similar to all the previous ones. Hotel was nice, elevators took forever, staff was friendly enough, cookies were awesome. Rooms are tight, but that’s to be expected in NYC. Our room was quite dark, though, and one of the two bulbs in the bathroom mirror was out so it made it a bit difficult to put on makeup in there. No light overhead, except for inside the shower. I don’t go to New York to spend time in a hotel, though, so it wasn’t a big deal. Beds were comfy. I probably wouldn’t recommend this hotel to tourists who are going to NYC for the first time since it’s at the very south end of the city and away from the majority of things tourists want to see on their first trip. But, for someone like me who has been many times and feels comfortable with the subway, it was perfect. Whitehall and Bowling Green stations are both within a block or so and serve a number of lines. I don’t think I’d pay full price to stay at this hotel, but if there was another Groupon deal, I’d consider it again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good location if you need to stay in Financial District. Good room size, but not very clean. The rest of the building was not really nice. Lift very slow and one did not work. Buffet breakfast very very poor. Not really satisfied considering the price of the room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good location if you need to stay in Financial District. Good room size, but not very clean. The rest of the building was not really nice. Lift very slow and one did not work. Buffet breakfast very very poor. Not really satisfied considering the price of the room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We had a 3 nights booking at this place and promptly checked out after the first night when we found a much better (not so well known brand) place at a cheaper rate. Thankfully there wasn't any penalty. Pros: Probably the location if lower Manhattan is where you want to be.Cons: Tiny rooms, decor is slightly dated and the rooms have a not so great smellService - just okay.Elevators - nightmare will be putting it mildly. A 40-45 storey building has 3 elevators that are quite slow. When we there I think only two worked. So it takes ages for you to get into one!! Service staff - had asked for extra bedsheets and pillows as we were 4 people in a suite. The staff that came didn't speak English and couldn't understand what we were trying to say (the duvets didn't have and cover/spread). Exasperated we gave up!Better to avoid this one at all costs unless you have no better option nearby and definitely don't fall into the trap I fell into - the Hilton brand name, certainly not worth it!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: `We felt very much at home here. A great Irish bar next door, plenty of food places in close proximity as well as the subway. The elevators are very very slow but we just made that part of the fun! They serve fresh baked cookies when you arrive ! We go to NYC annually and will plan to use this hotel again.l

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I can honestly say I didn't have high expectations when I first booked this hotel. I was just looking for an affordable place to stay for my second time in New York. And this was the only reasonably price hotel available for my dates of travel. I'll start w/ the bad. Only bad thing I have to say is the elevators are incredibly slow. There was a sign posted stating that their would be maintenance on the elevators so they may be fixed by now. If you happen to request a cab or Uber you should do so after you reach the 1st floor. It literally took about 10 minutes to get to the 1st floor every single time I left my room. Oh and another con is the rooms didn't come w/ refrigerators or microwaves, but I think I read you can request one while I was checking out.Now the good. When I first arrived my girlfriend and I were greeted by the friendly staff and presented w/ our room keys, free breakfast vouchers, bottled water, AND THE MOST AMAZING COOKIE I'VE EVER HAD! Ok, maybe not best but definitely top 5. The front desk associate pulled them from out of an oven type compartment and they were WARM and FRESH! Everything in the room was clean and inviting. The rooms are a decent size and the closets are adequate. Bathrooms aren't so big, but hey wash yourself and get out. Wi-fi was solid and reliable. The breakfast was real good also! I thought it would be your typical dry cereal and waffle maker breakfast. They had fluffy scrambled eggs and crispy bacon, fresh fruit and also a menu if you wanted something more fancy. Next pro about this spot is location. My first time in NY I stood in Hell's Kitchen near Times Square so I wanted a different location for a different experience. I chose the Financial District so I could easily get to the Brooklyn Bridge and the pier to see the Statue of Liberty. Soho is a short train ride away also. Overall, I would definitely consider coming back to this hotel. Keep up the good work.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff were all surprisingly hospitable and friendly. They provided unsurpassed customer service. My room and aminities were to my liking, especially it being very near the subway and Starbucks. Great location! Unfortunately, I didn't like the long waits for an elevator. One of three elevators was out of service the first day of my three-day stay. Overall, I enjoyed my stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
