review_body: Really great place! Location is also attractive; just beside the South Ferry station. Calm and quiet enough to spend some quality time with your loved ones. Reception was also very helpful and cordial. Lovely environment inside and outside. And of course, I would say you are gonna love the decoration. Would like to go there again, may be for future vacations.
user_name:
SampreetiKhan
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Rooms were excruciatingly small. Shower stall leaked and the elevators were in service during our stay. The hotel staff was very helpful save for a slow registration process (never saw more than one employee working the desk). Good location in lower Manhattan although tucked away on a street easy to miss.
user_name:
Jeffrey A
Kansas City MO, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I had to stay close to the office. The Doubletree was convenient as it was close to the office. The Financial District is very different in the late hours, which I was able to see when I stayed down here so late. As a tourist, I would have preferred something either more midtown or even uptown and preferably near a residential area. I've noticed that prices are more accommodating for budget travelers in these areas and also offer better entertainment and restaurant options than in the Financial District.
user_name:
RomanaLola10
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff at night is not friendly. The woman that was at the front desk was very rude and looked like she didn't want to work that night. She didn't give us the Cookie everybody receives as a Welcome gift. She didn't mention anything about the breakfast, even though we had breakfast included. Obviously, she didn't give us the tickets for breakfast either. She told us we had to pay for Wifi, when our reservation said it was free of charge. She gave us the room next to the ice machine, which was making noises all night long. The fan in the bathroom didn't stop making noise either. The room was tiny. The elevators take forever to come. It's a very tall building and only three elevators is not enough

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Was on a business trip. Convenient to the Financial District where I needed to be. Hotel is not that big, i.e. not more than maybe 10 rooms per floor, but a lot of floors. 2 of 3 elevators where in repair, which led to long waits going up and down. My room was comfortable and bed very comfy. Room is small and bathroom was a bit tight, but again, adequate enough.Nothing special, but convenient.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Recently stayed at this hotel and it was pleasant experience. Usual price for staying in the city, but it's in a good location and staff was friendly and room & bath were clean. One picky observation- drapes couldn't be closed to block out early morning light

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We love staying at this hotel. It's our fall back hotel if all the other hotels in the area are too overpriced. The rooms are clean, modern and fairly spacious for the area. The beds are super comfortable and we always sleep well here. Sheets and pillows are to die for. The location isn't ideal as it is situated in a fairly quiet street undergoing some construction, but it's literally next to the R Whitehall train and near plenty of restaurants. The staff is hit and miss. Sometimes they are friendly, sometimes not so much. But at the end of check-in, there's a free cookie, which makes everything all better. ;) We've stayed here for both business and with family. Each time equally enjoyable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Love staying at this hotel. Great location, close to the museum and easy walking distance to local eateries. As an HHonors member I get free wifi with my stay which is just an added perk. Elevators can be a little slow but not a problem.
user_name:
Carolyn M
Clinton, MD, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I wasn't expecting much but the DoubleTree met all my needs. Room was clean, heating/air conditioner unit was very powerful, bathroom was clean, and staff was friendly. The only problem was there was construction going on close by so street closures made it hard for Uber and taxi drivers to come to the door. Not a big deal.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Me and my wife just stayed here on father's day weekend. This is an excellent location with the subway station at the end of the block. Since our flight was delayed, we arrived pretty late. The staff was a little abrasive and very "to the point" with no warn reception. They didn't have the cookie at check as promised because they ran out. In the morning, we hit the city because there's so much to do, but when we get back, we noticed few housekeeping problems. 1. The pillowcase was stained with blood from the previous stay. 2. The comforter was stained with small dots of blood and some yellow stain. 3. We let the front desk know on the way out, and said they would take care of it, only to come back to find nothing had been done. 4. While the room was cleaned, the housekeeper tried to disguise the comforter by flipping it to the foot side of the bed and folded the pillowcase inward to hide the blood stain. This is absolutely unacceptable and pure laziness. We let the front desk know again and they came up and immediately changed everything. They were apologetic. This just ruined our stay. The bathroom is very small and the shower door and bathroom door collide when open at the same time.  The shower is narrow and your leg hits the shower door if you're sitting on the toilet. They didn't even ask for my Hilton number at check in.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed two weekend nights here. It was good because it was quiet. We were close to Wall Street and the bull statue. There was construction that made it difficult getting to the hotel on Fri/Sat but then it cleared up Sat/Sun. The elevators were slow (40+ stories) as the maintenance crew used the elevators too. Make sure you check out early because it will be hard to get an elevator with everyone trying to check out at the same time. Despite this, it was nice to be at a place where it was not crazy busy as soon as you stepped out the front door.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Clean room, comfortable beds, very close to Whitehall, South Ferry and a few other subway stops. Pleasant walk to lots of points of interest, including Freedom Tower, Brooklyn Bridge and Staten Island Ferry.This hotel has a good Italian restaurant on the property, though we didn't eat there, and a steakhouse across the street. There are a few different options for a quick breakfast for affordable prices within a block or two.Ana and Damien were just a couple of people at the desk who were helpful when we needed to print boarding passes. Another guest was using one of the three computers to watch cat videos on Youtube, another was writing a paper, the third one didn't work, but Ana printed them for us. Bellmen at the ground level checked our bags for us on our last day and held them until we were ready for the airport. Yes, the elevators were slow, but we were on the 9th floor. We did choose to use the stairs on Saturday morning at checkout because they were slow. They are short floors, fortunately. The room was quiet, housekeeping was very good. I've certainly had better views in Manhattan, but a good, clean, pleasant place to bathe and sleep was all I really wanted. I'd use the Doubletree again.,

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is ideally situated in Battery Park of lower Manhatten, ideal if you are working in the area. The rooms are clean and tidy, and well maintained.The thing that lets the hotel down is the service, not only the amenities (i e. lift is terrible) but the occasional attitude of staff.To me this is a place I'd say if I HAVE too.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Bottom Line: Location is ideal for visitors to the downtown Wall Street area. Other than that, the hotel is generally unimpressive. In a city like New York, many better options to be found even at this price point.Pros: Good location, modern decor is a nice touchCons: Service (only one representative at check in/check out), Room Quality (musty smell to the room, carpet damp), Cramped feel (lobby is on second floor after a landing type entrance on ground floor, small bathroom)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have stayed numerous times at this Doubletree - it is where my employer has us stay when in NY. Unfortunately, I have yet to have a positive experience - something always goes wrong. This past stay, the drain in my bathtub didn't work and my coffee maker was broken. On two other stays, there was no hot water. On another stay, there were mosquitos in the air conditioning system. While the bed is comfortable, it is shorter than a normal king size bed and because I am tall, I have to sleep at an angle. The noise level is also a big issue - both outside and inside the hotel. Overall, the place isn't well managed and if I wasn't required to stay there, I wouldn't.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Purpose of the trip was for business. The Doubletree was conveniently located downtown, close by most offices you need to get to in the FiDi, and also plenty of subway options if you need to get uptown (1, 4-5, R). this is not an area for great shopping.Check-in was swift. Staff was friendly and even offered a cookie! I wouldn't have known if she didn't offer, so that gesture was MUCH appreciated.My room was right behind an elevator shaft and ice machine and was not disturbed by these during my stay (I am a light sleeper). The room was clean albeit a bit snug, probably just enough for one person. They provided the foldable luggage stand, but i could not find floor space for this and chose to leave them on the counter instead. Bathroom was also clean, although i spotted an ant hole near the shower area - didn't bother me as they steered clear of my toiletries. Apart from the usual shampoo, conditioner, and shower foam, other toiletries (shaver, q-tip etc.) was upon request only. Would be swell if they provided these upfront. I did not request for these as i found it to be too much of a hassle. The air conditioning was noisy and temperamental. I felt that lighting in the room was insufficient, even in the bathroom (I was unable to get enough light to tweeze my eyebrows).Free wifi not provided!!! your only option is pay-per-day, unless you are a hilton member. i ordered pasta from the room service, which came from the Italian Restaurant downstairs - Ancora. Service was quick but food was nothing to shout about (very fresh ingredients though!). I stress: I was looking more for convenience than good food.my biggest concern was the elevators, which, to my relief, I did not encounter horrific waiting times. there really is no "best time of the day" secret to taking the elevators but on the whole, my elevator experience (from the time it took to hail a lift, to the time i got off the floor i need to get to) took me anytime between 2 and 10 minutes.Check out was delayed due to a technical issue with the printer and I almost got an incomplete printout of my bill, had the staff not chase me down just as i was about to leave in the elevator.overall, stay was comfortable but i probably could not stay here for an extended period of time (>10 days)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for one night. Parking is only available around the block and approx 40 usd. The hallways are very tight and the rooms are small.However, the rooms and rest of of the hotel were clean, so I would still recommend to stay there.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: As previously reviewed, hotel is tight / compact - but about average size for New York City. Was very conveniently located near WTC for my business travel. Was clean well kept location and staff was very helpful / accommodating. Hotel is close to the Subway - Z line from JFK - very convenient 2 block walk. Arrived Sunday night late to learn there are very limited restaurants open within the Financial District - as most are privately owned and this is their day off. Found an Irish Pub (Murphy's Tavern) right next door with good bar food offering - also learned of another bar (Whitehorse) around the corner.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: On the positive: Excellent location downtown. Good friendly service from staff. On the negative: Space constraint means narrow corridors and long wait for elevators. Also noisy door latches and loud guest conversations after midnight made it difficult to sleep at times.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel offers clean comfortable rooms with friendly professional service in the heart of Manhattan's Financial district. There are a few drawbacks though: - the elevators seem poorly programmed and waiting times are significantly longer than other similar establishments I have visited - the windows offer poor noise insulation from outside - they charge extra for Internet access which seems completely unacceptable for a business hotel in this day and age - the breakfast buffet is spectacularly poor value. Cooked food is not kept warm, choice is limited and there is no variety from day to day. By contrast, the rooms are comfortable and well-furnished and the housekeeping is of a very high standard. I might consider going back but not until I'd tried an alternative.
user_name:
John S
New York, United Kingdom

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My stay at the DoubleTree-Financial District, NY began very positively. The receptionist was friendly and getting a warm chocolate chip cookie at check-in is always a nice touch. Things went downhill after that. My originally assigned room had a roll-in shower, which made it difficult to keep the water from seeping onto the main floor in the bathroom, the light bulb for the desk area was missing, and the ice machine in the hall near my room made noises that kept me awake practically all night. I was moved to second room, which had a strong musky smell. The odor lingered even after a thorough room spray with air freshener. I was then moved to a third room. It was clean and comfortable but a bathroom fixture needed minor repair. Since this was my third room over a two-night's stay, I decided not to even call this one in. Based on the Hilton brand, my stay did not live up to my expectations.
user_name:
CarlDMV
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms, something was wrong with the elevators. They were very hot and incredibly slow, plus the staff used them to go up or down one floor, which added to their slowness.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Overall great experience -- friendly and courteous staff and a great location in the financial district! Easy access to the subway and the ferry. The guest rooms are well maintained and offer a very comfortable night of sleep and the floors are quiet and, who doesn't love the warm chocolate chip cookie upon arrival. You are treated like one of the family.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a good hotel and the staff is friendly but the elevators are slow. 3 elevators for 44 floors. Just be sure to leave 10 minutes early. The showers on the upper floors change temperature regularly. The rooms are clean and comfortable but small.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Loved the staff . The hotel was so clean we stayed ont he 32 floor . My boyfriend and i love the view . Parking in New York is already crazy the garage across the street was a little pricey but it come with the district your in . Very convenient to any subway station just a few stops away from time square. Would stay here again

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Thank you Rosie for making my trip a comfortable one. I had to ask for special accommodations and Rosie was very understanding of my needs. Thank you so much Rosie. My only complaint is the carpet on the 15 th floor was filthy. But inside the room it was fine. The staff is wonderful especially Rosie!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location. Right in the heart of the financial district around the corner from the NY Stock exchange and the charging bull. And right next to stone street with is a quaint historic street lined with great restaurants and outdoor eating (in the summer months). I was treated like royalty by the staff. They were so friendly and accomodating. When I left something expensive in the room they had someone escort me up and let me look even well after it was check out time. 4 hours after. It's a beautiful hotel with well appointed rooms. I'd definitely return!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The room and hotel met my expectations but if you are using room service be prepared for a long weight and addition the food is mediocre at best. The location is excellent and the rooms are clean and and comfortable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: On our first evening we pulled down the linen and found the blanket (Donna) was soiled. It took 2 phone calls and hour wait befor a single bed size blanket was delivered for a King size bed. Housekeeping was required to be asked to take the soiled one away. It was the first challenge. On our thitd day stay, the room was not tidied until 5:10pm. Only 1 bath towel was given. As usual, a call to housekeeping again. There are only 3 lifts to service a 44 floor hotel. You definitely need to allow at least 10 minutes and much longer during peak hours. Temperature control for Air conditioner is very temperamental. It blows hot air @71 and freezing cold air @70 ~ nearly nothing in between while on auto. One positive note is that staff at the Ground Floor entrance are very friendly and greet you all the time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel staff was excellent! Our room was not ready upon arrival, so the doorman took our bags to storage. They also gave recommendations and maps to get us on our way exploring town. Nice and friendly!Check in was a breeze, got warm cookies when we went up to our room.The room itself was rather small in comparison to others I've stayed in - it would have been better suited for a king size bed rather than 2 doubles. But then again we just showered and slept and went out again - so it fulfilled the purpose. The room was nice and clean and got new towels every evening upon return to the room.Overall I'm very pleased with the service and the location and would definitely stay here again.The hotel is on the same block as the Whitehall Station, and 1 block away from Bowling Green station. About a block and the park away from Statue of Liberty cruises. Lots of little cafes/restaurants etc in the vicinity.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel serves only the need of overnight accomodations. The overall hotel feel is one of tired, worn and cramped, and it begins at the street and continues into the hotel. The entrance and lobby underwhelms. Room was a neutral, bed was a plus, shower was a plus, room size was a negative. Service was a plus.
user_name:
William Jeffrey N
Hinsdale, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: good overall experience. friendly staff. updated room and bathroom. outside patio and sidewalk needs to be swept regularly and perhaps power washed to make more inviting. I will stay at this location again.
user_name:
Peter L
shaker heights, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff goes out of their way to be helpful and accommodating. The hotel is located right beside the subway. You can catch a train to most of New York's popular sites. The rooms are updated, clean, and comfortable.
user_name:
Donna J N
Atlanta, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: First two nights in NYC spent here, so quiet could not believe we were in NY where the most common complaints I read relate to noise. Approach down an unimpressive side street had us a bit worried but it was that blessed side street that kept it so quiet! Very friendly staff, clean cosy room, fabulous location, highly recommend

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We've read the earlier reviews about the slow elevators, but we went ahead and booked this hotel anyway because it's right next to a subway station. Yes, the elevators were still very slow when we visited. The service was also slow when we check in, we checked in the late afternoon and we still had to wait in the lobby for like 15 min before we can get our room. The lobby was rather small and crammed. Lastly, we asked the maintenance staff to fix the towel bar next to the sink, because it was broken by the previous guests- but it was never fixed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel room size was bigger than I expected from previous visits to NY. Service was great, a little inconvenience check in which was quickly solved. Location is wonderful, few steps to 3 different metro/subway statuons, very near to ferries and water taxis, options for quick byte, coffee or a drink, plus places to eat.Also a lot quiter than mid Manhattan and with metro service, distance is not a problem.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We recently visited NYC and stayed at this hotel in the financial district for 3 nights over the Memorial Day weekend. We had a standard room and we took the opportunity to pre-select a room on the 16th floor, to avoid elevator traffic or one too close to the ground level. This hotel is well located, 2 minutes walk to subway stations, a Duane Reade pharmacy and a few eateries. During registration, the clerk offered us warm baked chocolate chip cookies as a welcome treat, which was nice. The cookies were good too!The room was small but this is par for the course in NYC. The king size bed was comfortable, and room amenities were adequate, including a small closet and a safety deposit box, but no fridge. Some of the sockets unfortunately were out of order but there were enough for our various connectables. Wifi was complimentary. Bathroom had a separate enclosed shower stand but there was only one hook, surprisingly, and some limited space in the shelving unit under the sink. Manageable but for the inadequate number of hooks. Like all glass enclosed shower stands, this one leaked at the sides onto the floor and for the life of me, I don't know why hotels install this impractical facility, however water does dry, I suppose.The hotel has an excellent fitness facility, including 2 ellipticals, two treadmills, and one stationery bike; a full rack of free weights; and a multi-purpose weight tower (although an expensive and excellent machine, it was missing one hand-hold wrap so half the possible exercises requiring two hand-holds were not possible during our stay. I informed the management and was assured that this would be rectified.) There was also a small italian-style restaurant offering breakfast buffets but otherwise not particularly noteworthy from its menu offerings or its service. One doesn't come to NYC to stay all day at the hotel and eat there!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was here 2 weeks ago on a business trip and it was great. This trip being my first to NY I decided I wanted the highest room available to get some good views of the city. However, I would advise against doing this as the lifts took forever! I waited 15 minutes and then decided to walk down 31 floors to get down, this needs sorting. Other than the lifts I had no problem with this hotel and would stay here again. Front of house staff on the ground floor really do deserve credit for the way they welcome you and offer advice. Well done guys!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very nice hotel. Room was excellent. Location was excellent. Front desk staff was just ok. Normal issues with elevators - long waits, crowded, etc. but we've learned to expect this. Room was outstanding.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: ~3 minute walk from the subway, surrounded by Duane Reade stores, plus there's a Chipotle down the street. The rooms are fine, dark furnishings so looks a bit cramped. The elevators take a long time. As a Hilton Gold member, breakfast was free (small dining area, food was very average but can't say no to free breakfast). The front desk staff were patient and helpful. I had made three separate bookings using different credit cards (for my friends and I), and the staff graciously helped me sort out all the details. I booked through agoda.com and my credit card somehow didn't go through for one of the bookings, so I called the hotel before my stay to clarify. The staff were super patient processing everything.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is located close to all the tourist attractions in the area and Staten Island Ferry . There are numerous restaurants and bars in the area and it is quite for New York standards in the evening . On arrival it's easy to miss the entrance and check in is on the Second floor . Use the lift to get there and your problems start . Luckily there is a TV and free newspapers while you wait and wait for the lift . Check and the staff are friendly and efficient . Off to the room and again the lift . Wait and wait , not good if you have things to do and are in a hurry . Rooms are very clean , beds are comfortable , but the showers are very narrow . This is a good affordable base in the financial district let down by the slow lifts .

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very clean hotel with nice amenities. The rooms were larger than most NYC rooms and the beds were very comfy. The service was fantastic and the location is great. Had no issues with the elevators. Never waited for more than 3 or 4 minutes max. Definitely will choose this hotel again when I am in the city on business. The only negative I have is the that bathroom is tiny and the shower is very narrow. They need a little shelf for your toiletries.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The double tree hotel in the financial district was a very pleasant experience. I booked a room for my family 2 person with 2 children. It was one of the rare hotels offering a nice double room. The hotel location is great with easy access to subway and tourist attractions. However what made it exceptional is the staff of the hotel.The employee were very pleasant and welcoming. I would like to particularly recognize Anna as one of the most professional and helpful person. She exceed on listening and understanding our needs while making sure things were done swiftly and properly. The staff over all was very helpful for instance our room did not have a fridge while we needed one for medicine. The hotel was full that day and they were not sure to have any left but sure enough it got fixed very quickly and a fridge was brought to our room in no time. Any questions or help we needed was answered promptly and Anna was always there to help. We had an amazing stay!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is one of those typical skyscraper hotels tucked into the financial district. Narrow hallways and small elevators allow room for more hotel rooms. The room was small but comfortable enough. The bathroom was tiny, but my expectations were not underwhelmed because, hey, it's New York where space is at a premium. On the plus side, the breakfast was a very good American breakfast - a step above what you receive at Hampton Inn. The staff was very helpful and prompt to bring an extra blanket and to arrange a cab at our departure.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I would have given this hotel a higher rating but we never did dine at the hotel. We stayed for several nights and had the 42nd floor w king-size bed. Very quiet and the staff was always helpful. Clean and large room for NYC! - recommend this to anyone wanting to stay in the Financial District.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The Financial District DoubleTree offers a good balance between affordability and value, which is what any business traveler on a budget would want. The only issue is related with the elevators, which, because of the building layout, take eternities to arrive at the desired floor to be boarded.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: A good three star hotel, well located for subway stations so that getting around Manhattan was easy. Our room was clean and large by New York standards and the ensuite facilities up to expectations. The breakfast spread was adequate. Our only complaint was that the lifts were slow.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: It was a prime location in the middle of financial district easy accessible by public transportation and near main tourists' destinations; the room was tiny and oddly shaped. It was clean and reasonably priced though.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Not your typical Doubletree. Store front type entrance is hard to see. Lobby is dingy and check-in is on 3rd floor. Elevators are inadequate for size of property - expect long waits. Rooms are extremely small and there was no counter space in bathroom. Breakfast buffet for Gold/Diamond members is nothing special and no better than a Hampton continental breakfast.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We found this hotel expensive and with several issues. First though, the bell staff are exceptional - very willing and service oriented. One front desk clerk or perhaps manager also went out of his way to provide excellent service. However, we typically waited 15-30 minutes for an elevator, and the wait for a table at breakfast was equally long. The restaurant crew was completely unprepared for the number of customers and were really struggling to provide any service at all. Customers were visibly upset by the long wait and lack of service.It should be noted that the rooms are small but the beds are very comfortable. Everything was clean and nicely arranged.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I highly recommend this DoubleTree hotel for their excellent service, quality of the hotel and the location. There are so many sights to visit and places to eat in the area within walking distance. Subway stations were nearby as well with close proximity to the adjacent boroughs. I completely enjoy the New York City experience!
user_name:
William Jr H
Hollywood, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Loved my stay here! I stayed at the doubletree for 4 days and although it's pricey the service was great. One of the employees TONY was so nice from the moment we got to the hotel. He helped us find restaurants near us and even walked up the street to show us where the nearest open pizza place. And he called a cab for us when we left NY. I am definitely staying there again on my next trip. Only because of tony!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: had a last minute getaway to the city, we checked the prices on line and walked in.. No advance booking and still a great rate. Free WIFI that worked well. The neighborhood was charming and very walkable with a lot of choices for places to eat or to get a drink, Battery Park is literally right around the corner, a beautiful place to see the harbor.One warning, the elevators are small, you have to jostle a bit to get up and down.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great value for money ! Top position in financial district , close to subway , great smiling staff and very comfortable room, free wifi ! Beautiful area, safe and very close to 9/11 memorial and Wall Street as well as ferry for Liberty statue ! Hope to come back here !

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: i booked for feb 14,2015. so as planned i went there, next thing u know is there is no booking with hotel. they booked me for march 14 instead. i called AMOMA, they said they cant do anything. no refunds or adjustments or credit for $400 hotel room. i end up paying $800 hotel for one night stay. customer service promised they will help me in some way for sure. so they opened the case and they investigate it for 4 weeks and then they say we cant do anything. i always use expedia, but this time i tried to use TRIVAGO. i selected feb 14 and it gave few options. i go ahead pay and book for feb 14 and then i go to hotel just to findout there was no booking. worst experience and customer service ever. i will never recommend this website to anyone. i so in total i paid $1200 for 1 night stay in NYC.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was worried at first because after booking I read some awful reviews but we didnt have any problems. Staff was always pleasant and helpful. yes, the room was a bit small but clean and tidy. I read a lot about issues with the elevator and while it was slow at times we really never waited more than 5 maybe 10 mins when one would get to us but was packed and had to wait for the next and we were on the 28th floor. It is so conveniently located to the subway and lots of restaurants etc that I would def stay here again and tell others to do so.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was very nice, clean, and friendly staff, all willing to help with directions, restaurants, etc. It was also a good price for the area. Walking distance to South Ferry area, 911 Museum and Memorial. Didn't seem to have as many restaurant choices as in Mid Town Manhattan.
user_name:
Janice P
New York City, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel was great. The staff were extremely friendly and very accommodating with storing our luggage. We enver had a problem with check-in or check-out lines, it was very fast service. The 3 elevators they have are small and with 35+ floors you can expect there to be a wait if it stops on every floor. We never waited long and used the elevator at different times of the day. We stayed on the 25th floor. The rooms are small, but not cramped, the bathrooms are small but modern. No real counterspace for a lot of toiletries. The water pressure was great and instant hot water. There was no street traffic to be heard. Was very quiet for sleeping. The beds and pillows are amazing! You could hear people talking outside in the hallway quite clearly but never heard any noice from the neighbours. Location was great for easy access to subway. I would definitely recommend staying here for the price.
user_name:
Darlene B
George Town, Grand Cayman

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: How this hotel is listed as 4 star I have no idea! Small rooms, no luxury whatsoever! Stayed here based on location and star rating. The positive reviews are a puzzle to me. Stay in elsewhere unless you have to be here because of location. The price reflects location, no quality in this old hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: First and foremost, our requirements for a hotel on our vacation were the best location and rating we could afford, with the options of room service, en suite bath, and near a subway station. That being said, we booked 5 months in advance and prepaid to get an amazing price. We'd requested a high floor and a refrigerator in the room. The staff was very accommodating with both requests. About a month prior to the trip I'd read the upsurge in comments about the elevator problems, and contacted them to change us to a low floor. They booked us on the 4th floor and we did have a refrigerator in the room. Checking in was no problem. I meant to speak to James and thank him for his amazing customer service, but did not get the opportunity. So, Thank you! We only had 1 day when the elevators were so full we took the stairs. Sat. morning is a very busy time.The room had a very comfortable bed, and was not rundown. Housekeeping did a fine job each day. Lu even left us a little note one day, adding a very personal touch. Issues some people may have:The bathroom is small, and if you have a lot of cosmetics/toiletries you may find it difficult to store them all. There is only the one towel hook, as reported previously. Perhaps adding another to the same wall, would calm these concerns. Personally, I wasn't doing the laundry, so it was not an issue for me. To save space in the room and the bath, there is a 'pocket' door to the lav., which means the full length mirror is on the outside of the door. There is a type of chifferobe to use as a closet, with plenty of hangers. There was also space in there for our luggage, which cleared space in the room. I believe for the price we paid this was an excellent value, with a fair sized room in an amazing location. Impressive location:Within a 5 minute walk were two subway stations, Whitehall, and Bowling Green. We were able to get to Time's Square or Coney Island in less than 30 minutes. A leisurely 10 minute walk gets you to the Staten Island ferry or the Statue of Liberty port. We walked to the Wall St. Bull, Wall St. NYSE building, the Federal Building, Trinity Church, and the 9/11 Memorial and Museum in about a mile. We were incredibly pleased with all the staff, location, and value of this hotel. Would stay there again, and recommend it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here with a few friends this spring for a weekend trip to the city. Overall, this hotel was average. We did not have a bad experience and we did not have am excellent one. The lines seemed to always be long at the front desk, but it was the weekend in Manhattan so that was expected. The workers were always friendly though, despite being busy. The rooms were small of course, but good for a New York hotel. And they were always clean, which is very important to me. As far as location, it is at the very southern part of the island. So it is far from the main tourist attractions up near Midtown, Times Square and Central Park. But it is close to the Staten Island Ferry to see the Statue of Liberty and the 9/11 Museum (which I recommend). There are a few metro stops literally steps from this hotel.As others have said, the elevators are very slow. It was okay going up to the room, but going down was always a lot slower. I did take the stairs down a few times. So I would request a low floor in case you want to take the stairs. So if you're okay staying a little farther away from the busier parts of the island, I'd reccomend this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: After I checked in, the hotel booked another (stranger) into my room. They showed up and opened the door while I was in there. Safety is not their priority. My second room smelled like incense, but not enough to bother switching rooms again. Breakfast buffet is anemic at best. This was not something I would pay for, but it was provided complementary after they tried to assign me a roommate. The staff was courteous and prompt, and the rest of my stay was pleasant. If it weren't for the above incident, my stay would have been very good, but as it was, it was poor.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was great, but I did get an upgrade that gave me a better view and regretted it. On the second day, when I arrived around 5 pm, one elevator was out of order and it was a little painful, as we had to wait longer to get them coming. The concierge area was helpful, giving me choices for restaurants in the area and printing walking directions to get there. On the day I was leaving, I wanted to print my boarding pass, checked in no problem using the computers in the lobby, but was unable to print. The staff was very courteous and helped me print it at their desk.. That said it was an inconvenience.I would stay again for the location, specially if you have business around wall street. So close to Battery Park and all that area, subway entrances to the NR and the 1 route.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We were here on business. This hotel was recommended as part of our business meeting, so we did not pick it. I have stayed here (with the same kind of business) before.The room size was extremely small, which I guess isn't that unusual for this part of town (or Manhattan in general). There were slight problems with some details - they forgot to bring butter with our breakfast (room service), next room was almost like in the same unit (we could hear their coughing eerily sharply). We were on the 20th floor with perfect view of other tall buildings right in front of us :(On the good note, their room service was fast! Staff was generally quite courteous. The place is located perfectly (depending on your destination of course). I also appreciated that the shower when turned all the way to max heat produced a water temperature that's good for showering, so one doesn't need much adjusting. Another good thing was the WiFi being complimentary. Valet parking is $55, but we paid 1 day for 2 nights. In the end of the day we were OK for what we got at the price. We would not necessarily look forward to be here, but we also would not mind next time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel on a recent trip to NY. Overall, the hotel was nice, but the reason for the 3* ratings is that the bed was considerably undersized. Our room supposedly had a king sized bed. However, the bed looked short, and so I measured it -- it was 72" long, while the standard length for a king-sized bed is 80". I'm 5'6", and my feet hung over the edge of the mattress when I laid flat on the bed. My companion is 6'2", and we had to untuck the sheets at the foot of the bed so that he could sleep comfortably. (The width of the bed was also 72", which is standard for a king bed and was o.k.)However, we did manage to sleep pretty comfortably, and in all other respects the hotel met my expectations for a Doubletree. The location is convenient (across the street from the R subway stop and a block or so away from another line (4/5?). The neighborhood's a bit livelier than our last stay in the financial district (at the World Center hotel). The only other complaint is that there is absolutely no counter space in the bathroom -- just a giant sink. Given the limited space, Doubletree would have been better off going small on the sink but leaving a bit of counter space.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is small. Small hallways, small rooms: that being said we had a great view of the freedom tower from our room. The staff was very nice and the hotel is located in a good area especially by the a World Trade Center museum and there is a great row of restaurants down the block near Williams St.Here are the cons:The AC can be hard to control.The elevators are slow.The welcome cookie was stale and hard Dirty dishes were in the hallway which are extremely narrow There is no tubs but we did not have a problem with the shower They charge a 50 dollar fee but it falls off after you check outThe parking is 40 dollars cash but is down the block on another street- you will be dealing with your own luggage Overall this is a decent hotel

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: A Nice hotel that fits on the Hilton quality worldwide. Employees are nice.The corridors are narrow.If it's rushing time, expecto to wait longer than you like for the elevator.The hotel is very well locasted and is close to major things to visit In Manhatan

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We had a very enjoyable stay at the Double Tree on 8 Stone Street, (Financial Area) New York. We have no concerns with the hotel other than the ATM they have at the check in will not take international debit or credit cards. We went to the pharmacy at the end of the street and they had a ATM that worked great. When we arrived at the hotel we saw the parking ramp right across the street. I rolled down my window and asked if they were affiliated or were part of the Double Tree across the street. The person did not speak good English but he did say yes, so we pulled in to the underground parking. When we got to the ticket booth the assistant said it would cost us $42.00 then he "Oh I made mistake you have van so cost is $52.50" well we thought the parking would be taken care of at the registration desk only to find out that this parking lot is not part of the Double Tree - their parking lot is about a block away so quite a distance to carry bags and suitcases. Had we known we would have dropped off our luggage at the front door and one of us would park the car. When we got to the registration desk that is where we learned about their parking lot although the clerk did stamp our tickjet and said it was up to the parking attendant if he would accept it. You can all guess what happened about the stamped ticket. The hotel was great - the check in - no problem as we had booked ahead of time. We were coming to NY to go to the 911 Memorial and we had the opportunity to see the 2 pools of remembrance. We had dinner at the little pub right next door to Double Tree and we had a great evening. We were about 5 min's late for Happy Hour but the honoured us the first round of drinks and the server was most informative, even going to the owner and telling why we were here (my husband is a Canadian Fire Captain and we wanted to pay our respect to the 911 Memorial. The little pub was great and nice and close. When we left the next morning and went directly to the parking garage only to find out they would not honour having the ticket stamped. We were stuck paying $52.50. I told the attendant that he had misinformed people working there. Had we known the parking lot was not affiliated with the hotel we would never have parked there but we were between a rock and a hard place. I told the attendant that I was letting the BBB know about then and he said "call who you want". Great stay at the hotel but the parking is a big concern.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for our honeymoon and thought it was excellent, friendly and attentive staff, well located for a base for exploring.The hotel was well equipped, we had a high floor room with lovely views out over the river.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was my second stay in this Double Tree, and like last time I was more than satisfied with it. The lifts can be a bit of a pain but you simply have to work around that and try to plan so as to not use the lifts at rush hour. It was no problem for me. The rooms are nice and clean (although of course no bath tub) and the staff are helpful. On arrival they stated that internet access in the room would be extra, and this is on a $300 per night rate. I think they saw the look on my face and gave me access immediately!The breakfast is fine, and the restaurant is actually pretty good. I also used the gym, which whilst limited in terms of equipment is perfectly adequate for most people. I liked it, and would return here.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I paid 375.00 a night for 4 nights, which is not pricey for NYC. The staff was very friendly and responsive. However, the elevators are ridiculous. Slow, overcrowded and not enough for 399 guests. Every day the lines for the elevator were there They don't even have a service elevator. The water in the shower spiked in temperature all the time. The breakfast at the downstairs restaurant was awful, could not finish it. Such a waste. Will not stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in July 2014. The hotel is clean, but the rooms are very small (smaller than what we got in other hotels in NYC). We got the breakfast at the buffet on two mornings, it was good but nothing amazing. The front desk lady was a bit rude during the check-in, but didn't had an issue with the other staff members.The hotel have a parking, and that was good for us coming by car. (Parking is around 3-4 min walk from the hotel).Not sure I will come back to this hotel for a future stay, but it was a great stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: One of the smallest hotels I'd ever stayed in, but a most friendly and helpful staff and excellent location made up for size. Within walking distance to the Brooklyn Bridge promenade (a great way to spend an afternoon), Ground Zero and Liberty Tower, China Town, Little Italy, a multitude of restaurants, shops, banking, and entertainment galore! Convenient subway locations made getting to other areas a breeze. Doubletree crammed a lot of goodness into a very small space!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If you want to experience a more "quiet" part of new york with a local twist downtown is a perfect location. The hotel met all expectations. Service was great. I never once had an issue with the level of service. The only thing I can complain about was abit water spilling out from the shower. Having said that, front desk did offer me an upgrade but I refused because I couldn't be bothered relocating.The gentlemen at the entrance were helpful. The lifts are a tad slow but I was on the ninth floor so I didn't really feel it being a major issue. So I missed my flight to vegas and I thank James for accommodating me as best as he could considering the hotel was booked out once I'd checked out. Management tried tirelessly to find me another hotel and was kind enough to mind my luggage for a good part of that day.In general I've never had a bad experience with hotels.. i guess if you rock up with a bad attitude, expect a bad one back. Point is, whatever happens before check in, eg a bad flight or taxi experience..leave that experience behind you and you'll find you'll have a better one at the hotel.The rooms were fairly spacious for new york standards. The bathrooms were abit limited but clean. I'd much rather a small clean bathroom than a big filthy one. I would stay here again. I bonded well with the staff and access to everything is a train ride away. I really enjoyed waking up and going for a stroll amongst the local corporate crowd. There are a few cool cafes and bagel places around stone street. Stone street / wall st is full of history if your into that stuff and the WTC site is a ten minute walk away. Again I'd like to thank all of the hotel staff for such a pleasant stay. The polish kid at the desk was a gentlemen and the jamaica dude downstairs was great "early hours" company.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I like this hotel. It is new-ish and modern and clean and well located (for me). Price was reasonable compared to other options. However there are some issues that are typical for a hotel of this size and location (NYC). But these issues are not fatal flaws and are not signs that the hotel is not trying to be a good hotel. Instead the issues are related to the shape and size of the hotel which are fixed and are what they are. You can work around the issues and you will be fine. The key issue is that all spaces in the hotel are small and tight. This is what you get in downtown NYC for a modest price nice hotel. The room is small but fine. They cheat with the 'king' size bed, which is wide enough but not truly king sized in length. I'm 6'2" and had my feet hanging off the end. The shower stall is also particularly tight fit, but who cares. The hallways are narrow, but who cares. The breakfast restaurant is small and tight as well, so you might have to wait 10 minutes for a table at prime time. All of these things are worth noting but are not huge problems.There is a real problem with the elevators. They are new and work fine. There are just not enough of them. Again, this is a problem that the hotel cannot do much about. The hotel's footprint is very small (8 or 10 rooms per floor) and it is very tall (over 40 stories). There are three elevators. But at rush hours it is very hard to get an elevator that is not jam packed when going down. People on upper floors report that the trip down takes forever because it stops essentially at every floor for people waiting, but since the elevators are full these people wait some more so it becomes a viscous cycle of slow elevators. People on the lower floors just give up and walk down. I'd suggest getting a room below the 10th floor and walking down. We walked down perhaps 80% of the time we were there. Going up is better because the elevator is essentially empty when it starts its journey up and will go to only the floors needed by the people in the cab. I dont think the views are spectacular anywhere in the building so just ask for a low floor and walk down. There is no parking, but the lot down the street charges $40 per day for hotel guests which is not that bad. Plus on weekends I would suggest that you might actually score street parking within a few blocks if you are lucky. The location was great for us. Walked to Statue of Liberty ferry. Walked to 9/11 memorial. The Wall Street bull is 2 blocks away. The subway is 100 feet from the hotel and we took the 'R' train to Central Park easily. Taxi's to mid town were $15-$20.All in all we were happy with our stay here. Location makes up for tight fits. I did not mind walking down a few flights to avoid the elevators. Would stay again if the price was right relative to the neighborhood.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel was perfectly situated for our needs. The rooms were quiet, beds comfortable and the hotel staff went out of their way to welcome us. Previous reviews mention the elevators. We were on the 31st floor and had to wait sometimes but it was not really a problem.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Found the fire doors propped open on the stairwells past two morning.This is mor like a bus terminal. If the company had not selected this Hotel. I would have checked out and never looked back.Also the restaurant in hotel was very expensive. I know this is NYC. But soup and tapas for 50$ (ice tea no drinks)!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was close to Battery Park to go to the Statue of Liberty, Ground Zero and a train away from Central Park and Central Square. The staff was great and the cookies were awosome! If they offer the cookies you have to try it, they are so delicious. The room was nice and confortable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was so pleasantly surprised with this hotel. I feared mediocre service and accommodations because that is why my dollar usually gets. Not here. These folks, Damien in particular, welcomed me and my partner, provided us with a room upgrade without us even asking, offered free water when we were about to purchase some from their supply area, etc. We did not have too much interaction with the staff since everything went so smoothly, but whenever we did, we were greeted as if we had stayed there a million times--almost like a doorman or concierge in a high end apartment building. And they were extremely accommodating concerning our luggage upon departure--they held it for free until 6pm when we finally went to catch our train. This meant that we were not shlepping our bags around all day long!! I would stay there in a NY heartbeat.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This Doubletree is not a whole lot different than others in the city (this is my third NYC Doubletree). The decor is attractive, the room was fairly spacious, the location convenient to public transportation. My biggest concern was the shower. It's poorly designed - you get wet turning it on. Plus, no matter how carefully I closed the door, there was a pool of water on the floor when I finished. Most importantly, though, is that the temperature of the water fluctuates. The water got really hot at random times during the course of the shower. So, just be forewarned and be careful. Finally, the channel lineup is very hard to figure out and remember so it would be extremely helpful, and really cheap and easy, for the hotel to provide a channel guide.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We booked a king room. We got there a little early and it wasn't ready, but a queen handicapped accessible was ready so we took it. Mistake. The bed wasn't a queen, it was a full. The walk in shower allowed water to flow all over the bathroom floor when we showered. We had to take a bunch of towels to prevent the water flow from going everywhere. If you are in this situation, wait for the king room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Overall hotel very clean. Hotel staff that we encountered were professional. Arrived late at night. Street very dark and no where to pull over and get information - no one outside. Upon entering, had to take elevator to lobby -- worried about car being outside on the street. Upon check-in was told they offer no parking but work with a garage a few blocks away. No conceirge to take the car or help unload -- not the best situation with young children or arriving late at night. Be prepared to pay for the parking -- added to your room charge, not really a "bargain" anymore. Good thing they "work" with the garage a few blocks away..parking was no bargain whatsoever.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great choice of a hotel when on business in the financial district. Fast and easy check in. Plenty of restaurants in the areas to choose from. Quiet and clean rooms. Walking distance from most Manhattan landmarks.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel really meet my expectations in pricing, friendly staff and convenience close to subway which easily take you in no time to every iconic location in Manhattan not to mention that nearby you can go to statue of Liberty and wall street. Staff is great always willing to help by telling you how to reach any place in Manhattan. Don't forget to have a coffee across the street and meet two friendly Argentinian guys with best coffee in town (is colombian!!)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The Double Tree in the Financial District in New York is an excellent choice. I felt very welcomed, safe, and they treated me very special. It was a great experience for me. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Big Apple and have a desire to stay some place that has easy access to tourist attractions, the subway, and great restaurants.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I had a great stay from beginning until end. Good staff, roomy rooms, and a great location in lower Mahattan. I would definitely stay here again. The elevators were not an issue for me, and I think this hotel is a great find.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The Financial District has much to offer away from the hubbub of mid-town. Access to subways makes getting around easy and efficient most times of the day (except rush hours). Much quieter and more affordable than mid-town with access to green space, improving restaurants and attractions from World Trade Center site to Seaport.
user_name:
Calien L
Cape Elizabeth, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed four nights over the Easter holiday. Our room was spacious for New York and the rate was reasonable. Perhaps because it was a holiday weekend, the area was bustling with people but the hotel and our room were quiet. The hotel has been well used and looks a little worn. The staff was always friendly and competent. There are many subway connections in the neighborhood making it a convenient location. However the huge construction projects nearby keep traffic backed up and make cab rides slow and costly.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Kelliani checked us in upon our arrival making us feel very welcome and at home.She gave us a wonderful surprise for our anniversary with the approval of her supervisor, James.With these wonderful people our weekend stay was a 10+.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My family and I live in Manhattan, and I work in hotels (housekeeping, specifically) in the city. We needed somewhere to stay that wasn't too expensive. We couldn't stay in our apartment for the night. The hotel is in the Wall Street area, so I was close to my work, and it was a good rate I got with Expedia. When I got to the hotel, Alex was genuine with his welcome. Very lively, and helpful, and very sweet to my daughter. When I got to the front desk, I had a mistake with my Expedia reservation. I was very pleased with the attention and service given by Venetta and Cindy. They were very patient, and helpful with getting my reservation in order. Apparently, I didn't completely confirm my reservation, but they made sure everything was ok with getting me and my family to the room after everything was confirmed with Expedia. All in all, my family and I had a good stay! Oh, and the cookies at check-in are nothing less than AMAZING!!!!!! (I want more. lol)
user_name:
queentoyatee
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here in early April 2015 for business. Great location since my meetings were on Water Street and this was in walking distance. Staff was friendly (had interactions with the desk and a gentlemen working the door in the evening). Rooms were spacious compared to others in FiDi. Rates were also a bit lower than other hotels within a 1 mile radius. I would recommend the hotel and will likely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was staying here for conference nearby and this was recommended and fell within my companies travel budget (read: cheap). The lobby is on the second floor and the ground floor feels like you walked into a garage. It's dirty and not welcoming. Second floor lobby is better as they did as much as they could with it (modern furniture, computers) but just felt lowclass. The hotel is high with around 35 floors. Lots of complaints about the elevators but if you take a really high floor they are programmed to come quickly so that wasn't the issue. If you are with your luggage in the lobby and near to go to street level, prepare to wait until never. They won't stop. You need to tell the receptionist and she has to call it in to engineering to get them to stop the elevator. Crazy.The hallways are super narrow and there are only a few rooms per floor. Only corner rooms are far away from the elevator so you wouldn't hear them.Rooms are super tiny, but that is typical of NYC. But not comfortable for 2 people. Bathroom is nicely done for the size, but there is not place to put anything down it's so small. How about adding a shelf? Furniture is updated and modern so at least that is going for it.Front desk staff is nice enough, but the hotel lacks any sort of class. For example, elevator stopped to pick up a housekeeper. She held the door while we were in it so she could drag her vacuum, mops, and bags of dirty garbage in the elevator with us. What housekeeping staff uses the regular elevator for the garbage?? Gross.I just got a dirty feeling from the common areas I didn't like. Elevators were dirty, floors were dirty, walls were dirty. Just needed a major scrubbing.Breakfast was free for me as I'm Hilton Gold. Was buffet. Fine selection, food was good enough.With NYC having an abundance of hotels, just skip this.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The finer New York hotels, like the Doubletree Hilton NYC-Financial District, offer so many of the same qualities that it's difficult to distinguish one from the other. But the Doubletree offers one thing the others can't match--extraordinary care and a service mindset. Specifically, Ibrahima and Floddy make every trip thru the ground floor lobby a joy. Their smiles, helpful attitude, knowledge of the city, easy to follow directions, and their attentiveness to detail belies the rough New York reputation. Thanks Ibrahima and Floody for a great few days.
user_name:
Ron W
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed at the Doubletree Hotel, in two rooms, for a long weekend and it was very nice! The beds were extremely comfortable. The room was clean and we had plenty of towels. Our room was missing a T.V. remote, not that we had time to watch a lot of T.V., but it would've been nice to have. We were on the 15th floor and the elevators were not an issue. We didn't have to wait more than 5 minutes for one to show up. We had a king room that was connected to an adjoining room that did not contain the rest of our family. It was quiet until our last night when the adjoining guests came back to their room at 2 a.m. It sounded as if they were talking right next to our bed! I could even hear them close the drapes. Better insulation should be installed between those doors. The location of the hotel was good. Very close to Battery Park, Wall St., and within walking distance of other sights. Check out Rockwell's, on Broad Street, for breakfast. Overall, we were very pleased with the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The service at this hotel was amazing. Our first night we had to be put in a room different from the one we'd reserved and had to switch rooms the next morning. The staff made the switch very easy. As well, they were very helpful in other ways. This hotel is very clean, and the breakfast buffet was quite good. Ask for a room on a higher floor, as the city view is spectacular!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was fine, and met all needs, but did not exceed any expectations. The rooms (typical for NYC) were too small. The location was good. The desk staff was hit and miss. Would likely not stay here again, opting to try for a better experience in the same area. The business area is within the hotel lobby, providing little privacy or quiet.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The only good thing about this hotel is the location, it's just 5 minutes walk from the Wall Street. The rooms are average, Wi-Fi is on only in the lobby. Elevators are a big issue, you have to wait for quite a bit. Staff is good and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Although there were some good things about our late-March stay, unfortunately the non-functioning elevators warrant my Poor rating. The staff, particularly bellmen Tony and Michael, and James at the front desk did what they could to compensate for the unreliable elevators. We were NOT informed of the elevator situation when we checked in- had to figure it out the first time we tried to go down from our 12th floor room and realized the up/down lights weren't coming on, elevators were passing our floor by, and guests from higher floors were using the steps to go down. The hotel's solution was to have one of the 3 elevators (for 44 floors) running in "manual" mode, which meant you called Guest Services from the phone in the hallway, and they sent a message via walkie talkie to the staff person operating the elevator. One person in our room waited 30+ minutes to smoke a cigarette, after calling for the elevator 3 times. The positives about the hotel, should you consider it, or if they get the elevators to function: easy walking distance to Battery Park, Wall Street, 9/11 museum, Staten Island Ferry, Bowling Green or Whitehall subway stops; bellmen who go out of their way for you. (thanks to Tony who walked my 80+ year old mom and me 3 blocks away to hail a cab, after the one he called for us didn't wait, while we were waiting on the elevator)I did discuss our issues with Assistant GM Misha Foster who refunded us 1/2 of our first night stay, which was appreciated. But I informed her that my reviews would still be negative. It's unfortunate that the hotel can't do what it takes to get the elevators working, and not place unnecessary burdens on their hard working staff.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Everyone was so helpful and all did it with smile. I was offered free breakfast to try it out when I asked if it was included with my stay. Specially the door persons were always smiling and greeting each time I went in out out of the hotel. Two thumbs up for them.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: As of this writing, I have stayed at this property 5 times during the last 3 years. During all but 2 of those visits, the hotel's elevators have had problems. I don't know if an easy solution exists but a solution is sorely needed.This DoubleTree has many attributes in its favor. The selection of television channels is above average. The exercise room is open 24/7, includes 3 incline treadmills, which I favor, and a handy water filter (although of modest importance since the quality of the tap water is decent (half-liter bottles are a good size to bring for refilling)). The HHonors breakfast is served starting at 6:00AM on weekday mornings, whereas far too many other hotels operate under the erroneous presumption that a 6:30 start of the morning meal is early enough for business travelers on the go. As to the quality of the breakfast buffet, the food is consistently good, whereas the quality of the service fluctuates. If the restaurant manager is on duty, the service is crisp. If he is not, the service varies from good to lazy.Numerous restaurants can be found within a 5-minute walk, including Pot Belly, Au Bon Pain and, my favorite, Flavors Café. Conveniently, there's a Post Office just down Whitehall from the end of Stone Street.Taxis can be difficult to find but the hotel has a doorman on duty most of the time who can assist.Perhaps best of all, half of the rooms on the upper floors have a truly unbeatable view of the Freedom Tower, which is gorgeous and inspiring day or night. It is a worthy successor to the previous edifices which were taken from the world by brute force.The rooms themselves are snug but it's important to remember that all spaces tend to be small in Manhattan.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I am in NYC a couple times each month, and this was my default go-to hotel. Over time, however, I noticed that service deteriorated, the staff became surly, and the property was a disappointment. I complained once, and didn't get a satisfactory response. The last straw for me at this hotel was when I wanted to store a small bag on a Friday when I was checking out - and returning to the property on a Sunday (48 hours) - so I wouldn't need to lug business clothes with me to the beach. The hotel said that for liability reasons they could not store my bag. I spoke to the Manager on Duty who said it was their policy - even for a Diamond Hhonors member who was a frequent visitor. I guess if they aren't going to be hospitable to me, then I won't give them my business.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I've been here for few days before easter. I think it's a very good Hotel, nice rooms, people very kind, position priceless. If I must say something I would say just that the breakfast takes place in an Italian restaurant at ground floor, and even if I'm italian I don't think it is the right location (small, very small) not even the staff is the right one to be honest :-( . The second thing, I have to say that sometimes you cannot be perfect 100%, one of the lifts was KO, and the time to go up and down was little bit too much, but this as I sayd is not a fault, this is just bad luck.
user_name:
FabioMorana
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: As a frequent Hilton guest, I was amazed at the poor quality of service at this hotel. The elevators weren't working properly for the first 2 days of our stay, and then only hot scalding water (no cold) was available. The hotel did little to communicate the problems to guests. Most guests were irate, yet little was done. Hard to believe that these repairs take days.
user_name:
Jeffrey P
Grand Rapids, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I'm not a frequent business traveler, but I was really impressed with this hotel. The rooms were great--clean, updated, nice view. Most importantly, the service was terrific. Each employee I encountered was exceptional. Great location too! Easy walk to everywhere I needed to be.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good location however elevator was inoperable for three days causing significant wait times for a sole elevator that was working. Staff was very unresponsive to the plight. Until management change, avoid this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I am planning to stay at this hotel later this month and had numerous questions about transportation to and from the area airports. Needless to say, this could be a sticking point since transportation in and around NYC can be pretty daunting! So I called the hotel and spoke with Kelliani at the front desk. Her customer service is just the best. She was pleasant and professional and took me through the various options - even confirming several different scenarios. She helped me pick the very best option and now I can plan my trip with confidence! Thank you, Kelliani!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: So our family travels to NYC a few times per year and I will typically book a mid-town hotel either through HHonors or a discount like Hotwire. This usually works out pretty well for us and we have gotten used to having four of us in tight spaces - hey, it's New York! This time we were focusing on sightseeing in lower Manhattan a decided to stay in the financial district. We were really glad we did. This is a great great property. I am not anywhere near high tier in HHonors, but that got us free wifi and bottled water at check in. I had booked a king junior suite since it was the same price as a room with two queens. We arrived an hour earlier than the stated check in time and there was not junior suite immediately ready, so we were offered two adjoining king rooms instead. What an upgrade! Having two bathrooms and the extra room made this a luxurious weekend. Thank you Justina! I felt like the guy on the "booking.yeah!" commercials. We stayed on the 6th floor (of 42) which allowed us to walk down if we did not want to wait for the elevator. These rooms would have been a lot more expensive and a lot smaller in a more crowded hotel in mid-town. Staff were uniformly excellent. Obviously the financial district is not the weekend madhouse that uptown can be. We were surprised how great the location is. Multiple subway lines are within a block, the restaurant scene on Stone Street could not be better, and Battery Park was a three minute walk. Very convenient for World Trade Center and Lady Liberty. We did a theater evening and it was less than 30 minutes by subway. Coming home we took a cab and it was only $15.50 from Times Square. My wife keeps asking if we can stay at this Doubletree the next time we visit NYC. I say yes.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Located in Financial District. Less than .1 of mile from my work location, good restaurants in the area, staff on top of their game. Staff very attentive. Breakfast was comped, rooms and service exactly what I needed for business. Would stay here again, if business brings me to financial district. Good value for the location.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for 2 weeks in March and receive excellent service specially from Kalyani.I asked for humidifier and small refrigerator and it was provided well in time.I would like to stay there every time I come to NY.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is nice and the staff is great. However, the entire stay was ruined by the elevator situation. There are only 3 elevators for 44 floors and only 1 or 2 were working throughout the weekend. Also, the shower went from hot to cold every 15 seconds.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed for 6 days. The service was excellent at the hotel. Elevator was broken a few days which made it difficult to get downstairs from 40th floor. The only problem I had was I got lost trying to get back from Time Square. It was midnight and was pouring rain. I couldn't get a cab, my phone was dead so I couldn't call anyone. I was nervous walking at night from 42nd St. to 4th street. I finally found a coffee shop where a nice young girl let me use her phone. I called the hotel, told them I was lost and soaking wet and needed to get back to the hotel. they said they couldn't help me. They left me stranded in NYC in the rain after midnight all alone! the nice girl at starbucks downloaded an app on her phone and called a car service for me. She was a God send!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location. Lovely (small) and clean. Everyone was very helpful and professional, particularly the young men who work the bag check room. I read the reviews and changed our room from a high floor to one on the fifth floor and didn't regret it. There are just not enough elevators for this property. However, that would not deter me from staying here again. The location is superb, very close to subway lines, and the rooms were clean and updated.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed 3/27 through 3/30 on the 38th floor with broken elevators. The average wait time was 20 minutes, the 4th day of the issue we waited 28.5 minutes and the staff did not seem to think that was a problem. The bell hop actually had the nerve to accuse me of exaggerating the wait. Additionally on Sunday .we left the room at 11 and returned at 4 and the room had not been cleaned
