hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great value as compared to other hotels that I considered staying at, however the elevators were spotty at best, waited 15+ minutes even after calling their "Careline". Room was clean and comfortable but bathroom lacked serious space for any of your toiletries. Inconsistent water temp. Was there for one night stay.....neighbors had gotten room service and left their tray outside of their door which was still there more than 24hrs later. With housekeeping and elevator men you would think someone would've picked it up.Few things to improve upon but was overall a good place to stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Like pretty much every other hotel room in NYC, the room is small and the plumbing is inconsistent. As long as you don't have expectations of grandeur, it shouldn't be surprising. The furnishings were comfortable and the bathroom nicely updated. There was no fridge or microwave, likely due to the lack of space. That being said, it would have been really nice to have somewhere to hang towels in the bathroom. I don't think a rack or a couple of hooks would take up too much real estate.So the burning question: what about the elevators? If you're looking to multi-task and get a workout in while, say, contemplating life's mysteries, make sure you get an upper floor. I was on the 41st and got really good at navigating the ups and down with heels on. During my 3 night stay only 2 of the 3 elevators where in service. If you needed to get to your room off-hours, the wait wasn't too bad. During rush hour, well, read two sentences back. Or, set the alarm 30 minutes earlier than you normally would.As far as convenience, it's smack dab in the middle of the financially district and tons of restaurants. Don't ask Yelp, just walk around and you'll find something cool and different for every meal of the day. WTC is just a few blocks away, as is the river. I had a car and there was a parking garage directly across the street that was, by NY standards, very reasonably priced.3 stars because of the elevators. I think I paid extra for an upper floor, but hey, I wasn't carrying a highrise pack up all those stairs, so took it in stride. (See what I did there?)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: elevators didn't work. Very annoying. I was in a very high floor. I typically stay at double tree when having to travel for business. Changed my view of Hilton big time!Please invest some resources in getting your elevators situation fixed. Not likely to come back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Overall, this is a very nice hotel. It is within walking distance to many great restaurants and interesting landmarks. I was here on business and chose this hotel as it was close to where my 3 day workshop was located and it had an onsite restaurant. The rooms are clean and comfortable; the staff is very friendly. I had no issues with guest services in any way when I needed them. I was concerned about our room being right outside the elevators, but any noise concerns due to elevators proved to be a non-issue. There a few things that I would consider drawbacks to the stay:The elevators, as many have noted, are extremely slow during peak hours for business. It was next to impossible to get an elevator on our floor in the morning, even waited as long as 10 minutes. My colleague and I ended up taking the stairs each weekday morning of our stay, and most evenings. Thankfully we were on the 11th floor and in decent physical shape, I think this would present a challenge for most people. It takes several minutes to get hot water in the shower. I didn't actually time it, but I got to the point of turning the shower on and letting the water run until the shower door started to steam- my guess is 5 minutes. I never got anything more than lukewarm warm water from the sink. There is too much sink and not enough counter space- the bathroom had one of those modern style sinks rather than a basin, so there was minimal room for one person to put there toiletries down, let alone two. lack of counter space also resulted in either putting the hair dyer in the sink, on the toilet lid or on the floor when styling hair - not desirable at all. We ended up moving the hair dryer to the desktop area, which was more ergonomically better, but sacrificed lighting, unless you turn on ever single light in the room. So even though were "ecelogical" by reusing towels each day, the waste in energy and water just to get your normal daily grooming done was very high. Food trays from someone's room service were left in the hallway for over 24 hours - which surprised me due to the cleanliness of the hotel. If the guest did not call for tray pickup, you would think housekeeping would have when making their rounds. These concerns would have me looking at other options if I were to stay inn this area again, but neither would they preclude me from choosing this hotel again as the overall experience was fine. The staff was great, the room was always in great shape, and the location was terrific. The restaurant was above average in quality as well.
user_name:
Mary D
South Meriden, Connecticut, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The reviews of the elevators are not to be dimissed. Although the staff try to address the issue it was a persistent concern causing LONG delays. I would not stay here again as a result. There are signs stating to call for assistance but the phone does not work. The restaurant is lovely, traditional Italian. The hotel did not follow through on wake up call requested, causing me to be late for meeting but they did try to make it right when pressed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel's location is perfect for visitors to Battery Park or Wall Street. Located right off Broadway on Stone Street, the hotel is a short walk to Battery Park and has a number of great restaurants near by on Stone Street. The rooms are tiny, but comfortable. Was not a fan of the restaurant in the hotel, but there are a number near by. The elevators are slow, but generally were not a problem.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The desk chair was terrible. the lounge chair was near end of life. The telephone handset didn't work but the speaker phone feature was working. The elevator took too long on one day. Staff did nothing to help up. We had to ride up and then down to get out of the hotel. The valet service took 30 minutes to retrieve my car. Over all, very clean, very good flat screen TV and the internet worked very well and fast.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I like this hotel and have chosen it a few times because it is clean and very quiet, which is a quality I really look for in a NYC hotel. I've been in many higher-rated hotels in which I can't sleep because of the noise. This one is great that way. The one problem is that the elevators get very delayed. On my last trip I had to wait 10 mins for the elevator on the way out the door. I try to stay on a lower floor, since noise is not a problem here, so that I can use the stairs if necessary or in a rush. If you stay on a high floor make sure to budget extra time for elevator waits.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: There was a fire on the 14th floor which was handled horribly compromising everyone's safety.Had to contend with trampling over bags of trash in the fire escapes. We had even complained about the trash in the stairway on the morning BEFORE the fire and it was not removed, jeopardizing the evacuation and people's lives. Only one elevator was working out of 3 resulting in having to walk up/down 19 floors.The breakfast was very basic and service terrible.I have complained to the fire department for citations to be issued. Every guest that we spoke to was angry.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have booked here numerous times over the last few years (I've probably had stays above 10 times). I started booking this property since my corporate office moved into the neighborhood and it is short walk from the property to my office. I don't have much choice if I want to be close to the office and stay at a Hilton property. I stay here only because of the geographic convenience, not the amenities or service which are decidedly poor. The elevator situation is incredibly appalling (it takes me 20 minutes or more just to get out of the building and I always have to stop on the second floor - when the elevators are working) and the staff do not have a business traveler culture in mind (no chargers for handheld devices, etc). To put it bluntly: This is not a good property for business travelers and I am contemplating moving back to the Millennium Hilton where they know how to greet guests and make them feel at home away from home. In other words, you can keep the warm cookie and water. Really don't like this hotel - it is and sorry to be rude, a dump.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: For the most part, all of my issues were well within the hotel's ability to control. My main beef is that I asked no fewer than four times for itemized receipts for the meals I had on-site. My company will not reimburse business expenses without an itemized receipt. I am sure this must be true for 99% of business travelers, so why this is a surprise to the waiters, restaurant managers, and front desk staff is a mystery. Certainly they are asked this every single day. As of now, I still don't have them, despite being promised the manager would email them in 24 hours. I had concerns about the overall safety and condition of this hotel. I was on the 20th floor and the entire room had a weird vibration about it. I was wondering if the laundry or mechanicals were on the floor beneath me. It actually made me feel a little sick on the first day. I had adjusted to it by day 2, but it was certainly not a pleasant experience. The room was tiny and cramped, more than one person in it would have been an issue. View was of the office building across the street.The room also had an unpleasant odor. The shower had mildew or mold in the corners, and didn't look clean. I had work to do, but found myself looking for reasons to go out and walk in the cold to not be in there.Elevators are an issue. For a 40+ story hotel, there are three elevators and only two of them appeared to work. One is reserved for the hotel staff and they will personally take you up to your floor if the one working elevator is elsewhere. This is such an issue that they have a letter from the management posted next to the elevator. I realize they may not have control over the speed at which the elevators are repaired, but based on other reviews, this has been going on for some time.Room service trays were left in the very narrow hallway for hours on the end. Disgusting.Cabs are also scarce. I ended up walking to my destination in 30 degree weather, fine for me, but not great if you have expectations that cabs will be readily available. The bellman suggested allowing an extra 5 to 10 minutes to wait for a cab, I think this is good advice for anyone staying here that needs a cab.The doormen, as others have reported, are great... they are truly the best thing about this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed on the 43rd floor with a city view and could still see part of the river. Room was great for just me. Staff was also very friendly and helpful. Food in the restaurant was great and their staff are excellent. This hotel is .3 miles away from the Wall Street subway and walking distance to the ferry's that will take you to the Statue of Liberty, and also walking distance to the 9/11 memorial. Also, the subway train is very easy to ride if you want to get to Times Square, Central Park and any other tourist attractions.To comment on the previous reviewers of the elevator: Yeah, it does take sometime for one of the three elevators to accommodate guests on 44 floors. But it doesn't take forever like some people think. If you have a little bit of patience and understanding you won't have any issues with them.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: First off let me say that while the hotel may be a bit hard to find at first the location is excellent as it is within walking distance to many restaurants and bars within the Financial District and 1 block from the nearest subway station. The employees of this hotel are great overall including the housekeeping staff. I am a Hilton Gold member and upon check-in I was given a WTC view room on a high floor as I requested. This turned out to be a very bad mistake on my part. Firstly, the hotel is over 40 floors and is serviced by only 3 elevators. At the time of my stay only 1 of the 3 were operating on the first day and 2 of the 3 on the second. This caused extremely long waits to either get to your room or get our of the hotel. Usually to leave I waited around 7 minutes for an elevator to come to my floor. To get up to my room from the ground floor was usually on the longer side, around 10 minutes. My stay was for the weekend of February 14th. On Saturday evening probably starting around 4pm the fire alarm started going off for a few minutes at a time followed by an announcement that it was just a false alarm and that they are working on the system. I thought nothing of it but then it happened a few more times over the next hour or two. I left the hotel for dinner and returned around 9:30pm to head to my room. Right around 10:30 or so the fire alarm began to go off again while I was already asleep in bed. I assumed it was another false alarm and tried to ignore it and go back to sleep. After about 30 minutes of continuous alarm I began to hear noises outside of my room and looked outside and realized that it was an actual fire alarm as people were rushing for the emergency exits. This is where having a room with a view on the 38th floor did not bode well as I had to quickly find warm clothes to put on and then proceed to walk down 38 flights of stairs to exit the building. This also happened to be the weekend of New York's coldest weekend in 20 years with temperatures in the low single digits and wind gusts of 30mph. As we neared the ground floor there was a huge amount of confusion amongst the guests as to whether we were to be waiting in the lobby or outside in the cold since the rumor that had quickly spread on our long walk down that it was a false alarm from a broken pipe or something of that nature flooding an elevator shaft and some of the rooms. We ended up congregating outside waiting for some direction as to what was going on. Many of us ended up heading to the bar next door that was luckily open still to wait it out and get some warmth and beer. Once the building was given the all clear to go back in we all quickly realized that there was only 1 elevator in operation now for the 40+ story hotel and that every guest needed to get back into their room. This created long lines out into the cold of people standing around waiting and hoping the single elevator would be coming by soon and that it would not be full already from other guest who walked up a few floor to try to catch it empty on the way down. When it was all said and done I ended up getting back into my room just after 1:30am. Now having a fire alarm go off can happen in any hotel at any time. The main issue I had with this hotel was that they had numerous false alarms all evening with no explanation besides the pre-recorded one saying to ignore the alarm. Then once the real alarm went off majority of the guests ignored it. Had this been a real fire and we all waited like we did to pay attention to the alarm I am sure there would have been many casualties that night. The building's management does not seem to have any fire safety system or protocol in place to handle a situation they had like that night with contractor issues and repeated false alarms. Once all the guest's had exited the hotel with half in the lobby and half outside there still was no direction from the hotel as to what was going on. It was just a matter of mulling around in the freezing temperatures outside until the firemen had left the building and we all just decided it was okay to make our way back in. Understanding that the building may be quite old I feel like management should be hiring more competent contractors that know how important it is to have at least 2 elevators working in such a huge building at the minimum. They also need to have a better plan in place for such emergency's which they obviously didn't. We never received any type of message on the room phone or a note under the door the following morning or the next apologizing for the situation or at the least explaining what exactly had happened that night. That simple note under the door I think would have appeased majority of the guests the next morning. On the plus side, the bar next door had TouchTunes!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I got an axcellent deal on this hotel, even better than most AirBnB places I looked around. The staff was very attentive and helpful. It was clean and convenient. Everything was in good shape. As you might have read they have a problem with the elevators, but it they come fast if you use the intercom they have in front of them to ask the front desk to move one to your floor. Anyway, we were only in the 8th floor (the building has 40+!).The subway conections are also very good, and there is a variety of places around to grab a nosh.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here the first weekend in March. Room is Manhattan size but designed to make the most of the space.The king bed was very comfortable and I slept well every night. There was also a comfortable easy chair and desk chair. So once in the room, everything was OK. Getting out of the room and down to the street was problematic. As stated by everyone who has stayed here, the 3 elevators are very slow. Not only that but you could hear the elevators pass our floor and never stop. They had a problem with the middle elevator a few weeks ago so it was run manually for the weekend. Signs by the elevator said to use the hall phone to call the desk to have an elevator sent but we only got through to the desk once. Received busy signals all other times. I used my cell phone to call for help. Once we finally decided to walk down 16 floors to get out. BTW, I passed on a room upgrade to a city view room on the 44th floor. The elevators were not the only problem I encountered. The phones in my room would not keep a charge so I could call out. Push a button and the phone would go dead. Googled the hotel on my cell phone and dialed the first number listed on the Hilton link. Received a message that I dialed a wrong number and it was not in service. Got through on the second number. An engineer came, told me to unplug the phone for 15 minutes and plug it back in. That worked for a day. By the next night, the phone no longer worked. So I'm on the 16th floor with no hotel phone to call out and elevators that never come.Hotel excuses ranged from we know they're slow that's why we have a manual elevator to we have 2 large tour groups and that makes it slow this weekend. Shouldn't the hotel have large groups every day?Bottom line: the room was very comfortable but the elevators and phones make me wary of staying there. Next time I may try the Hampton Inn that I could see from my window.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is just a step from Wall Street and while I suppose it's a very busy neighborhood Mon-Fri, during the weekend it is totally and completely empty. Lots of cafes and restaurants are either closed or open just for a few hours. I have checked in online, using the Hilton app and was very disappointed to find that the room I selected was given to other guest. Receptionist who was checking me in did not apologized for this mishap nor did she offered me an upgrade though I'm a Diamond member with Hilton and have got accustomed to red carpet treatment. The building is very narrow and tall (40+ floors), elevators are very slow. Rooms are quite small. The bathroom is reasonably sized, but most of the space is wasted, because the shower is very narrow, and with glass door (not curtain) it is quite difficult to wash properly - not enough space to move one's arms.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is tucked away with major construction across the street, but close to everything. Service was stellar, staff is very attentive. No problems getting to anywhere on the island. Elevators are slow is the major complaint.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Spent 3 nights here and on arriving very tired at 1am in the morning was disappointed at how small the room was. Only suitable for one person although the bed is a double. If you have more than one suitcase you will struggle to find a home for the second suitcase without tripping over it. The room, including the bathroom, were clean and the wardrobe space was tiny and suitable for only one person. The bathroom again in my opinion did not provide enough shelf space for two people. Thankfully lots of clean towels were provided and shower is a joy to use with a fantastic shower head. Adequate desk space and a chair provided if you need to get some work done with a spotlight to brighten the dull lights in the room. I was located on the 9th floor and had a wonderful view of the brick wall of the building opposite me! While this may seem not wonderful, I must be thankful that I was not placed any higher as the lifts service does not arrive in a timely manner and after the first time going down and having to wait 15 minutes for the lift to arrive, we opted to walk down on each occasion apart from when we were checking out! Special mention to the door man/bell man 'Tony' who knows the meaning of customer service and was very helpful and friendly when I was departing. Would not recommend and I won't be coming back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have stayed here many times in recent years for business, and have grown to like this hotel very much. The rooms are tiny but comfortable, the restaurant downstairs is more than decent in a pinch, and the neighborhood gets better every year. This time we arrived late (at 11 p.m.), went over to Vintry Wine and Whiskey on Stone Street, and had a marvelous late meal and drink. The only drawback is the elevators, which are always slow.
user_name:
Roland G
San Francisco, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel was clean and reasonably priced for NYC. Staff was courteous. We didn't use the hotel's amenities as we had family functions scheduled. I could have done without the snow. Cabs did not come by the hotel that frequently; we had to walk (short) to the Staten Island Ferry Terminal to get transportation.
user_name:
Calvin W
Lawrenceville, GA, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I want to start my review of the Doubletree New York City Financial District by saying from the first greeting when I walked in the door on the ground floor, to the last staff I saw as I left the hotel, hotel management should be proud of their staff and the way they present and represent the hotel. The lobby is on the second floor and when I arrived at 11:30 on Monday evening, everyone was friendly, recognizing my Diamond status, giving me my cookie (excellent, by the way), and presenting me with a present for being one of their top 12 guests for the day. Then they told me if I had arrived earlier, they had tickets for me for a concert at the Conrad. I thought that a particularly nice touch, especially after a frustrating day with Delta Airlines making me go around the world to get to NYC, arriving seven hours later than scheduled, I thought the trip was getting on a better track.Now, remember I praised the staff at the Doubletree Financial District in the previous paragraph. I cannot say enough about their efforts to make their guests feel welcome. The hotel certainly needs that because while I have not read other reviews on the hotel, I had plenty of people tell me over the course of the week that all reviews mention issues with the elevators. Well, I’m here to attest the elevators, at least during my four night stay, were an issue. In fact, on Wednesday, there was only one elevator running, but they did have hotel staff operating it, probably as efficiently as one elevator in a 44 floor hotel can be. At other times, there were two running, one under normal operation and the other manually. Here again, the staff was excellent, and my kudos to them.Anyone who has ready any of my reviews knows I am a “Hilton guy” as well as the TravelGuy. Having spent close to 150 nights in Hilton properties in 2014, I think I’m pretty dedicated to them. The hotel is typical for NYC, with ten rooms per floor, best I could tell. I was on the 44th floor, good for getting a place on the elevator going down, but inconvenient when the elevators were struggling. One of the staff told me he makes the 44 floor stair walk twice a day, for security purposes, I suspect, and it takes 20 minutes to climb the 44 flights. I did experience a couple of times when I thought after my wait for the elevator, I would have been better off just getting a good bit of exercise by walkingWhen I got into my room, it looked pretty good and the size was huge for NYC, based on previous experience. When I went to set the alarm, the display on the clock was cryptic. I couldn’t tell what time it was displaying, so it was pretty close to impossible to set the alarm, so thankfully I was able to use my phone for my alarm. Then, as I got ready for bed, I went to the closet to get the laundry bag. Ooops, no laundry bag there. This was the second item I added to the list to leave at the front desk on Tuesday morning. Tuesday morning brought shower time and when I get out of the shower I realized the door didn’t shut/seal and there was a puddle of water, only modestly absorbed by the rug. This was another item to add to the list. Just one other thing while I’m talking about the shower. I couldn’t get the water to shut off so that was the fourth item for the list I left at the front desk on Tuesday morning. One other thing, while I’m talking about the shower, I want to salute the men and women of the United States armed forces for the job they do every day in protecting our country and freedoms, because the inconsistency of the water temperature reminded me of the old military barracks days when if someone turned on the cold water or flushed the toilet, the shower temperature heated up quickly. That was my experience during several showers.When I came in Tuesday afternoon, the water had been turned off in the shower, but it was obvious housekeeping had not been in my room that day. It was 5:00 or so when I got in, but a call to the front desk and asked to get the room cleaned and they promptly got prompt housekeeping to clean the room; however, still no laundry bag and the shower door didn’t appear any different. Oh, and the clock was still cryptic. Anyone who knows the Hilton system knows Diamond and Gold members receive a complimentary continental breakfast but the NYC Financial District provided a complimentary buffet. My kudos go out on that one. The buffet had a good selection, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, pancakes, bagels, muffins, fresh fruit, yogurt, and probably some other things I missed. Tuesday and Wednesday morning didn’t seem that busy or maybe I had gotten up early and got in and got out. Food quality was good both of those mornings. Thursday and Friday mornings seemed to be particularly busy, but I got seated quickly both of those mornings. It was busy and it seemed the eggs and bacon particularly were being replenished on a regular basis and while they were fresh, the eggs were cold both mornings.The fitness center is located on the third floor and is equipped with three treadmills, two ellipticals, a bike, weight machine, and free weights. Pads and balls are also provided. For a hotel fitness facility, it provided good equipment in a nice sized room. Cardio equipment faces Stone Street so you can get a view of the Nebraska Beef Steakhouse across the street.. One other note, recognizing the hotel’s efforts to correct the problem, they had the elevator people work overnight Thursday night and being on the 44th floor, that was where they were running the new cable for one of the elevators that was down. I know they worked well past midnight because I could hear them working with the cable (not a quiet task). I finally got to sleep but woke up to the noise of the workers before 7am. I understand the urgency in getting the repair completed, but really!All said, I hate to be negative, and hopefully you have noted I recognize the staff at this hotel as top-notch in making guests feel welcome, but the Doubletree NYC Financial District certainly had Murphy’s Law going against it during my four night stay. The front desk staff did provide additional points at checkout for my stay for the inconvenience of the elevators, and being the “Hilton guy” I am, I would probably give the Doubletree Financial District another opportunity if I am in that area, but I will be guarded in hoping all three elevators are in operating order if I return. Again, kudos to an excellent staff for making up for the other multiple shortcomings I encountered during my stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I booked this hotel as it was a block away from my client's offices. Lovely warm cookie on arrival, helpful staff and a lovely clean room with fabulous views of the Hudson. Bed was huge and very comfortable, great coffee maker and tv had a decent amount of channels.I arrived just before the #blizzardof2015 and whilst the area was not badly affected, the city was essentially closed. Whilst the streets were deserted you would not have known anything about it inside the hotel! There was a reduced housekeeping service for one day but they still came round to take rubbish and provide new towels.I relied on room service a lot here, the food was delicious and the service quick and efficient.I have seen comments regarding the lifts being slow but I think this is fairly common in NYC hotels! There are generally tall and narrow buildings, common sense should tell you that there will only be a few lifts and with them servicing 40+ floors it will take some time! I allowed myself extra time when I wanted to go anywhere and I really did not have a problem. Location great for Battery Park and Wall Street, subway right across the road and a fab convenience store a few doors away. I would absolutely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for 1 night last week for work and the main reason is it's close to our main office. They have good staff but the hotel is quiet small. As other reviews have said, don't count on the elevators cooperating. Luckily I wasn't on too a high floor and I eventually ended up taking the stairs in the morning after waiting for awhile. I do like the warm cookies at check-in.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The experience with this DoubleTree Hotel was excellent. It was close to the training location that I had to attend. It's walking distance to the ferry for the Statue of Liberty was close. The staff was super friendly and the Hotel super clean.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Well, to start it off, it says on google maps that this hotel is a modern, business-oriented hotel, and it also happens to be a four star hotel; to have that expectation beforehand made the stay somewhat disappointing for following reasons: a) the elevators were a huge letdown for not just me and my friend; no screen whatsoever on the floor we were staying and it was just a long waiting game to see which one of the three elevators would be happy to take us. b) the room was small, but this was bound to happen, with it being located in Manhattan and all. no mini-fridge. not too crazy about the dual function sliding bathroom door/mirror; the iphone/ipod dock was an okay touch and there were two complimentary bottled waters. c) no 24/7 drugstore nearby, but it's not the hotel's fault; it's situated in one of those business-oriented area where it gets quite quiet in the evening; there's a Chipotle and a subway station within a walking distance (~1 minute), so I sort of liked that part of the accessibility.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The reviews of this hotel are pretty accurate unfortunately. I had a meeting a block away and that was my only reason for booking this hotel knowing I was only staying for one night. Let me tell you, I wish I would have booked elsewhere and had a further walk, even though it was freezing outside.When I arrived, I was pleasantly surprised because my room was available and it was only 10:30am. Once I got into my room, all the pleasantness was gone. Let's start with the bathroom. It was disgusting. The toilet seat was fifthly. Luckily I travel with disinfectant wipes so I was able to clean the toilet myself. The rest of the bathroom looked like it hadn't been cleaned in sometime. There was dust on the shelves and oh did I mention the toilet? I was in a rush to get to my meeting so I didn't have time to complain. When I did take a shower, the other reviewers are correct, the hot water is not consistent. It goes hot, to cold, to hot, etc. While in the shower I noticed a dirty towel hanging on the back of the door, which was not mine. Talk about disgusting.The bed also had a funny smell, which made me think the sheets had not been changed. Anything is possible though, right?The only positive thing I can say about this hotel is the restaurant downstairs which has nothing to do with the hotel. Other than that, please take all of the reviewer's words on this and stay somewhere else.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My stay was interrupted by a fire on the fourteenth floor of the hotel. Preceding the fire an alarm (test alarm) continually went off preventing customers from sleeping. The staff was not helpful in resolving that problem. James, a night manager, eventually found a relocation spot (three hours later) for my sick mother and myself and assured us of a 100% refund. The hotel told me that they would contact me to resolve the refund the next day, but never did. The Guest Assistance Specialist Michael never contacted me, after an initial email saying he would resolve any problem, despite the assurance that he would do so within 72 hours. I had to contact the hotel through Expedia, four days later, and was informed that I could only receive a 50% discount.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The good: staff are all very nice, and helpful. Warm cookie at check in is cool. The room was clean. The bed was comfy, good downtown location. The internet was good and guest computer_ printer worked. Good strong heater worked. Super hot water.The bad: Waited 5-10 minutes for elevator half the time during my stay. Also had a "fire alarm" situation that turned out to be a busted sprinkler pipe on the first floor or something. Maybe because of the record cold these days. Anyway, Elevators go down, firemen show up, minor flooding on the first floor, sorry for the inconvenience everything was back to normal half an hour-ish later. Shower door does leak as others have mentioned. What can I say, not horrible but it has issues.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: 5-6th time here, all of which below the bar. Elevators were down resulting in some nice sweaty runs up and down 12 flights of stairs. Noisy floor fans running 24/7...Sounded like I was sleeping in a Data Center.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is terrible. Elevators not working. Long lines to get a lift to the 16th floor. There were repeated "false" fire alarms before we were finally advised of an actual fire. Rooms are very very small. Shower had no side so water flooded bathroom during each use.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: we had to arrive one day before our plan and ended up to have to book this hotel at last minute .When we arrived inside the hotel to check in , a small fire had declare due to the heating overheating , so we had to wait one hour and a half outside in the cold to wait to be allowed to go back in .The reception beeing on the second floor and two out of three elevators not working , it was a nightmare to go up .Not beeing able to provide a room for us , as some rooms were not useable due to the water damage , we had to sleep in a different hotel .I have to say that the staff were very kind to be able to find us an other hotel .But this experience has made me feel insecure towards this hotel :(

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The reviews seem a little generous on this. We stayed for week, when we got there we were given a cookie by a not grumpy but certainly not happy member of staff. Went up to the room, it was clean and functional with a good TV selection and extortionate Wi-Fi rates. The room was a little on the small side, but on the flipside this is central New York. Gave the impression that it was like a facility that processes tourists, rather than one that attends to their need, functionality rather than luxury, though it wasn't an oppressive environment. It had the metro downstairs so this was benefical within easy reach of major attractions allowing you to traverse the city with ease. Probably a mid to low end business hotel rather than a hotel for luxury or to relax in. Perfect for a short stay (5 days) but no longer. Low cost too. Overall - distinctly average.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The bad experience started from the moment I arrived and continued until check out. I arrived to one of the three elevators working. I had two rooms on the 9th Floor for me and my godson. We found ourselves ascending or descending steps repeatedly during the entire three day stay. At one point all three elevators were out of service. Long lines, stretching outside to the brutal cold, formed on the ground floor as guests waited for the one elevator that had come back into service. Guests were not happy. Saturday evening fire alarms repeatedly went off for hours. On the intercom hotel staff assured guests that it was only a test and that there was no need to evacuate. At one point fire trucks could be heard arriving at the building, but because of the announcements I gave no thought to leaving the hotel. I learned as I left later that evening - riding the one working elevator with water dripping from the ceiling - that there was an actual fire on one of the floors above me. I was told by staff that one of the two inoperable elevators has been flooded with water. I also concerned about the cleanliness of the hotel. On my floor room service trays with half eaten food sat in the hallway all day Saturday and Sunday. They were still there when I checked out early Monday morning. I didn't understand this since housekeeping made up my room daily. The rooms in the hotel were modern and nice sized. The beds comfortable, but getting back and forth to the rooms and the fire alarms made the stay must unpleasant. Worst of all management of the hotel seemed oblivious to the entire situation. I'm a loyal Hilton Honors customer. I've stayed at other Hilton properties where management has written a letter and had it delivered to the guest rooms apologizing for service that fell below Hilton standards. And in those instances, it was nowhere near as outrageous as what I experience at this Hilton property. The DoubleTree Financial District management placed their staff at a disadvantage in dealing with irate guests. I witnessed staff being berated by guests upon my checkout at 4 a.m. One woman was so irate security was called. I can't see myself ever staying at this property again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Our stay was wonderful! I loved the room. The bathroom fixtures were fancy. The bed was big, comfy, clean, and had enough pillows. The staff made a pretty display with the tissues on the tissue box. The tv was a good-size flat screen with a fair number of channels. The 1-or-2 cup coffee maker was great, and also offered 2 kinds of tea.Upon check-in, you get fresh warm chocolate chip cookies, which were wonderful. The staff was very welcoming and accommodating. We went to the Statue of Liberty on the morning of our check-out. We thought we'd be back in time for noon check-out, but we weren't, so we called the hotel, and they were more than happy to push back our check-out time. The doorman was also friendly and professional.It should be noted that wifi is an additional fee, but we were only in the room one night, and didn't really need it, so we didn't pay for it. Also, parking is at a regular garage, and costs about $40, after validation from the hotel.The entire experience was fantastic. I don't stay in Manhattan often, but I would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My friend and I stayed there for a "girls weekend in NY". The hotel is pretty close to the subway and Statue of Liberty. The room was small, but we didn't spend time at the hotel. Front desk staff was friendly. I will definitely go back to this hotel, because it is in great location and very clean.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We recently stayed at the Double Tree in the Financial District of NYC. We selected this hotel primarily for its convenient location and reasonable price. Both objective were met, but you get what you pay for. The room, although well appointed and with a view of the Hudson River, was quite small. It was too small for the King bed which took up most of the space. A queen bed would have been more appropriate for the room.Our other concern was finding it. We gave the cab driver the address but he road around the block in lower Manhattan two or three times because the hotel is on a short one way street not well marked from the street. The lobby is on the second floor. You enter through a hallway to a bank of elevators that are not visible from the street. There is only a minimalist marque above the entry.The staff friendly but the handle on the shower door broke off and even through we reported it, it was not repaired during our three day stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We were in NY to visit the 911 Memorial and found this to be a perfect location. The hotel rooms were very comfortable and clean, but the very best part was the staff! They were all incredibly helpful and pleasant....our stay had to be extended one night due to weather, and they couldn't have been more accommodating. We felt like family! When was the last time that has happened at a big hotel chain!!:) PS. Great cookies too!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: While the front guest had us at "warm cookie" my husband and I cannot overstate how courteous, friendly and professional the staff is at this property. It is not a 5-star or even 4-star hotel nor does it cost as much as that. We had a terrific deal from Travelzoo. But from Tony, the Doorman and Antonio in the restaurant and everyone we ran across, this staff is five star all the way.Great location half a block to subway R line, short walk to 2,3 line; Fraunces Tavern, Museum of American Indian, Staten Island Ferry and of course, Wall Street.Parking lot directly across the street is great - and their people were very helpful too. Car was clean, undamaged - $40 per 24 hrs as of 2/15.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: 1st time to New York and I saw this hotel via booking.com. Stayed here for a week, staff was great, housekeeping was great and friendly too. Great location was able to get to loads of places as there is 2 entrances to Whitehall st station by the hotel less than 2mins away. Then Bowling green 4mins away. Didn't need to pay for Wi-Fi for my stay but I didn't need it as i was able to use my data with my network in the US. Great size bed for me.Local shop round the corner if needed big store too.Depending on your budget i would advise to book a private cab instead of a shared shuttle to/from airport costs more but the travel time is much quicker.Didn't experience any issue whatsover with this hotel. Despite the other reviews! Would definitely stay here again! :)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is very clean. The rooms are small, however this is normal for NYC. The elevators are slow, but it never took us loger than 5 minutes. The Front Desk is on the 2nd floor, which is annoying for C/I or C/O. If you are more the Times Square type, look for a hotel over there. Otherwise you have to take the subway for around 30 minutes to go up to the 42nd street.The beds are really comfortable, you get to dream pretty fast!By the way, there actually is free WiFi in the rooms, I dont know why people keep telling there is no WiFi in the rooms!?My friend and I we use to visit NYC at least twice a year, since we stayed at the doubletree financial district in summer 2014 we planned to stay here more often for the future. The rooms are pretty dark, due to they have one window only. If you like to wake up with the sun, ask for a room where the sun goes up.Looking forward to our next stay from Feb 16th.Cant wait!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We've stayed at the Doubletree Hilton Financial District hotel for 8 days. Housekeeping was good, even sent us a thank you note for our tips. I know the Europeans are known for being bad tippers, in our country is not a common thing but after our last visite we try to adapt to the US culture of tipping when we really believe somebody is trying to do their best. Our shower was leaking so everytime we've taken a shower and the whole bathroom was flooded, my boyfriend told the front desk about it and it got fixed asap. In the end of our trip it started to leak again. The room was average size, good clean and modern for NYC standards. We used hotels.com to book the hotel and got a great deal for a Doubletree Hilton in Manhattan. We loved the big choice of tv channels, the bed was comfortable, kingsize a bit short for my Dutch tall boyfriend but it was all good. Cons There was no free wifi in the room you have to purchase for USD 9,99, but because of the snow blizzard or maybe because of our tips we've received complimentary wifi for the last 3 days. On the day of our departure we checked out at 12 'o clock. We had already arranged our own transfer to the Airport with a car service I always use the same car service when I am in NYC. We had to depart from the hotel to Newark airport 2:30 PM. The frontdesk told us to go downstairs and give our luggage to the bellboy for storage. The bellboy did some small talk asked us our pick up time for the luggage and asked us where we need to go to. We told them we will be back at 2:30 PM and that our own driver will pick us up, he asked my name and my room number and gave me the tickets for our luggage. We had lunch outside and did our last round of shopping and returned early to the hotel to go the restroom. When I arrived I already saw a car parked in front of the hotel with my name (misspelled) on a piece of paper, I thought it was weird because our carservice is run by Chinese and I have a common Chinese last name, but I did not pay attention to it. So we went to the lobby for a quick pit stop collected our bags from the bellboy (I gave him a $1 tip) and were driven to Newark airport. When the driver approach the car I noticed he was not Chinese and got suspicious, because our car service is runned by Chinese drivers. We were stuck in traffic for almost a hour and even though we left on time we had to rush a bit because of the traffic jam. On arrival at Newark airport the guy took our luggage out of the car my boyfriend paid him in cash USD 60, that is a fixed price including a tip. The guy started to tell us that we did not pay him enough. At that point I told him it is a fix price and I told him to call his boss. Then he got a pricelist out of the car and we saw he was not from our taxi company. I told him that we are in hurry to catch our flight and it was not agreed on to pay more he got really mad and shouted at us and got agressive and cussed at us. I told him to call the police if he disagreed with us. My boyfriend try to mediate but he would not stop the driver got back into his car and was mad and drove away we ran to the check in desk and catched our flight. What happened is that the bellboy sent our car service away and phoned his own car service. I am so disappointed about this. In a review from booking.com something similiar happened to a couple from Switzerland they got also scammed by the carservices that the bellboy had arranged. We did not ask for a car and then he sends our own car away. I would like to report this at the hotel manager and I really hope that they deal with their staff.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed from the 29 Jan til the 3rd of feb. This hotel is across the Whitehall Street station and 2 minutes from Bowling Green Subway so travelling all over NY is easy. Staff are friendly especially the night concierge Diana and Gloria. The hotel is clean, with comfortable bed, free wifi, Restaurants and Pubs all over the area. Hop on hop off bus just a few streets away..perfect for what we needed...will trully recommend to others.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great experience staying here. Good restaurant, nice-sized room for just one person and close to everything in FiDi. All staff committed to great customer experience so just ask them! Business center was small (2-3 stations) but I did what I needed to do. Free wi-fi and printing. All staff are friendly and attentive. I did have a couple of issues but they were handled well and right away. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms are nicely enough done... the showers work but it just is men there on business- there is no buzz in the hotel (except for people complaining that the 4 elevators can not service the 47 floors... personally I was fine, but it was the talk du jour in that otherwise awkward silence The lobby is on the 2nd floor, which just gives the place a crappy feel in my book, the rooms (bar one on each floor I think) have no view and a loud air conFine for a night or two and have work but go to airbnb if you are there for anything else I would say... it is in the non-NYC part of town anyhow! PS Damien on the desk is a lovely guy- proper front of house, he has a 5* feel... including remembering peoples names and preferences from what I saw (the other guy who sniffs and snears a lot- not so much)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Got a great rate ($99/night) during a cold and rainy winter weekend. For that price, I wasn't expecting much, but I was very impressed with the hotel. The location is a short walk to a few restaurants, shops, and downtown landmarks. It's also only a block or two to many subway lines, so you can get anywhere. As others have mentioned, the elevators are a bit slow but not annoyingly slow, as the hotel wasn't crowded that weekend. The hallways are not for the claustrophobic, but I was pleasantly surprised when I opened the door to see that my room was large, with room to walk around the king bed, lots of clothes storage, and everything updated and clean. I was on a Hilton Honors floor, don't know if the other floors are similar.I'm sure it's much different during the week, and during conventions, but I liked the relative quiet of the Financial District. In the past I've stayed in midtown, which is convenient but also very busy, noisy, and crowded all the time. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Room and bathroom was crazy small and directly across from elevator but the noise was non-existent on 31st floor. Price was high but for NYC it was ok. Room was average overall but liked location being close to everything I needed in financial district.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I really recommend this hotel. The location is great. Even though is far from Times Square, a couple of subway stops are located at only steps from the hotel. There are also cafeterias and restaurants close by. The rooms are small but comfortable, clean and quiet. And the staff is super friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The Doubletree on 8 Stone Street is a comfortable and well located hotel for the Manhattan/Financial District. Its close to many good restuarants and other landmarks. The restuarant is very good and the breakfast is excellent. There are 44 floors and and the rooms are small compared to most Doubletree hotels, but are comfortable.
user_name:
Larry M C
Dallas, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great place to stay not far from Stonestreet restaurants. This is one block from my office on Whitehall. I like this hotel because of its locale the chief complaint I have is the elevators are very slow. The staff is a tentative I only wish they had more than one restaurant. But the alternative restaurants on stone make it exceptionally easy to get a good meal. I like the fact that the hotel has over 40 floors I stayed on the 41st and got a good view of the water

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Clean elegant rooms and a nice view. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our close friends and family. I specially enjooed the friendliness of staff and the decor of the room. The location is very convenient for a qick tour of the financial district or to hop on one of the ferries for a cruise around Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I've stayed at this hotel twice and have had a great experience both times. The location is perfect for my purposes (near our office), and the rooms are extremely clean. Also, love the cookie at check-in.
user_name:
Jennifer P
Kansas City, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location is good: you can readily walk to Tribeca etc and can cab or train to other parts of Manhattan. The Brooklyn Bridge is close, Wall St is closer as is the Staten Island ferry. Battery Park and the walk/cycleway is very close (with bike hire). There is a pub next door (built after 9/11 but it looks older) and other bars/pubs nearby.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is lacking in frills, but on a business trip I'm more interested in location and cleanliness, and this hotel provided both. The staff I did encounter were friendly. I would prefer softer towels, but the ones I had did their job. And, the in-room omlete I ordered was not worth the $31 I paid for it. The cook needs better direction on how to make an omlete. i couldn't even eat it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I called ahead needing a quiet room and at check-in they were very polite and welcoming even though they were training someone new. When I got to the room it was a connecting room so I called and asked to have it changed. The keys were ready when I got downstairs and they gave me a corner room with a view! Thank you Damian! The rooms are great with updated furniture and very nice bathroom. (That's always a big thing for me because bathrooms gross me out!)The bed was super comfortable. They brought things to my room very quickly (shower cap, cups) and checked up on it later to make sure I got it. If you are complaining about the size don't come to New York! The room was pretty spacious compared to other hotels in the city.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We got this hotel at a very good rate via Priceline.Staff were ok. Nothing to really comment about regarding them, which perhaps is no bad thing. We were given hot cookies upon check in which was nice after such a long journey. Hotel is very closely located to the subway (despite the fact that we always move by foot when in NYC). There's also a 7eleven located on the corner next to the hotel, which was great.Small clean rooms. Contemporary space as a hotel overall. There's a flight checker service in the lobby and free wifi at the bar. Luggage storage costs if you have a flight post check out, though I can't remember how much.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff at this hotel really went out of their way for us. My daughter, her 4 month old and I stayed for just three nights. She was there on business and I was taking care of my granddaughter during the day. The housekeeping staff were responsive. I asked to have the room cleaned while I took the baby out for a stroll for about an hour and they did. It was very cold at this time so that was extremely helpful. They gave a very generous late checkout on our final day which was amazing. Thank you. The room we had was recently remodeled and had everything we needed - including a requested refrigerator and crib. Yes, in general rooms in NYC are smaller and this is no exception. If your destination is the Financial District this is a good option. No free internet but the lobby had wi-fi and computers. I could do all the research I needed on my cell phone in the room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Through Booking.com we got our room here for a song. The financial district is a bit of a desert on a cold winter weekend, but the subway is fifty yards away, and the savings allowed for a better show, good meals, and a Double Tree. Works for us.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is typical for NY - very small rooms, tight bathrooms and not a lot of space to work with. You have to pay for wi-fi, which is a pet peeve of mine. The bathroom could use some updating; the baseboard was pulling away from the wall and the corners of the ceiling were peeling. The thermostat was a little tough to regulate. One moment it's blowing hot air and the next it's cold. Also, this hotel has 40+ floors but only 3 elevators, so be prepared to wait some time. However, I give the hotel high marks for being in a GREAT location (close to subway and plenty of restaurants and bars), having an onsite restaurant/lounge, and being clean and quiet. The bathroom had very hot water, which I personally LOVE. The staff were responsive and friendly. I also used the fitness center which was nice. I'd stay here again. I's a decent place; just nothing really special stands out.
user_name:
ksweet93
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location but wish the very friendly and helpful security staff on first floor entrance could replace the unprofessional management at the second-floor check-in. Booked through a travel promotion which was criticized upon arrival. Management could have been so much more friendly and helpful. Called hotel after stay about lost article in room. Phone call was never returned. Stone Street is great, however. And KUDOS to the SECURITY STAFF for being great and making up for poor front desk management.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: stayed here in the weekend following Christmas. What i first liked about the hotel is the location. Though i wasn't offered a room with a view, but i could imagine how it would have been, the hotel was sold out on that particular week and we had to wait for a longer time for the elevators. with just 3 elevators its really bad. There wasn't a hair dryer in the bathroom and this annoyed us a little bit. The cookie offered during the check-in was a delicacy. the staff were courteous and helpful. the concierge service was also good. to get a view of the brooklyn bridge just walk from the hotel and the closeness to battery park was also helpful. The most important and underlining point is that the hotel is close to a metro station.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed there for New Years Eve with my wife and baby, two busy nights that I would definitely expect for nothing less than chaos in a hotel. For my surprise, my stay was perfect! Ravi at the front desk was an exceptional person who handled everything I asked with care (except a late, really late check out). And by care I mean I could see he cared for both the hotel brand he work for and more specially the guest (I say this as a loyal customer to the Hilton hotels). If I had to point one negative side of this hotel, I would say, elevators, slow and packed with people, specially to go up, but, again, that was during an extremely busy holiday, so I would not take points out because of that. The breakfast is awesome as well as dining on the Italian restaurant of the hotel, Antinori. One odd thing is the entrance, since is on the ground level while the lobby is on the second level. One great thing about location, steps from Wall Street, Battery Park and subway. So, If you are a tourist and don't mind of staying far from Times Square, and by far I mean +-5 minutes on subway, I definitely recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My wife and I spent 4 nights in this friendly place. On our arrival, we were greeted by smiles and then we were offered warm chocolate cookies fresh from the oven!! You need to see it to believe it. Two racks of ovens just behind the reception desk offers you fresh cookies. Of course fresh coffee or tea in you room can make your arrival "sweet" and pleasant. We stayed on 32 floor and had no problem with the elevators. The hotel is in the heart of financial district, close to the famous Wall Stree "Bull". There are several metro stations within walking distance. Bowling Green station is just so close with connections to many places.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel are good for traveling in New York, as it is very close to three subway stations.The downside is the quality of facilities, the coffee machine was broken (replaced with a good one later), the temperature of the shower was not stable, one button of the flush toilet was not working properly sometimes, bulb for the bedlight was not working. Maybe I was just bad luck.Not like some warned, the elevator is fine, the typical waiting time for me was less than two minutes.I would recommend this hotel for staying in NY for its fairly valuable price and excellent location.
user_name:
hopper d
Salt Lake City, Utah

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The room's windows were very drafty, had to constanty run the heat at 75 to maintain a 'normal' 68.(might have just been my room, Who knows?) I was staying here while on a business trip. I took my phone off the charger and went to lunch, when I arrived back to my room mid afternoon, the bed had been made and fresh towels deposited in the bathroom. My nice 6ft phone charger was also gone from the wall socket. After informing the front desk/ manager of my issue, he informed me that cell phone chargers are a dime a dozen so I shouldn't worry too much. Feeling relief from his sentiment, I simply showed the amtrak conductor my black phone screen and assured him that my ticket credentials were up to date.....
user_name:
Alex N
Cape Cahd, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The price was very reasonable for such a spacious, clean and quiet room in New York City and there were plenty of restaurants and museums in the vicinity. The metro was only a block away. I would stay at the Double Tree Hotel in the Financial District again on future visits to New York City

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I received a discounted price of $99 per night and booked a trip to NYC just because the hotel room was so cheap (booked through TravelZoo). I feel like I got an absolute steal of a deal because this place was very modern, clean, updated, and the room was bigger than I anticipated it would be. The shower was a little small but what can you do, it's NYC and they're pressed for space. My only complaint would be the VERY thin, non supportive pillows. Staff were courteous and charming including our housekeeper who took immediate care of a cigarette smoke smell outside of our room. We planned a trip to Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty, the ferry for that is within walking distance of the hotel. There's also a ton of restaurants and bars located within walking distance of the hotel. Super pleased with my trip and would highly recommend this hotel to others.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for a week in December for business. Arrival is alright. The entrance to the hotel may be a bit hidden to the untrained eye, and walking into the building, you would think you're not in a hotel as you're just met with an elevator bank. Checkin was smooth, and the cookies are great—they are at every DoubleTree, so that doesn't really boost the review of this particular location. After getting a good night's sleep, I woke up, got ready and headed over to the elevator bank. The conference I was attending was literally a 90 second walk around the block, so leaving my room with 20 minutes to spare should have been perfect. However, the elevators in this hotel are SO slow that I was late. You heard it. I waited 20+ minutes for an elevator to stop on my floor, and I was late. When I returned back to my room that evening, the heater was broken. I called the front desk and asked for someone to inspect, and then I left for a few drinks and food. There are a ton of bars and places to eat in this area. A lot are Irish pubs, but there are other options available. When I returned to my room, the heater was fixed. I experienced no more issues with it. The elevators continued to be a sore spot. 15-20 minute waits every time I wanted to lave the building. In short, the rooms are alright, and the location is great, but the elevator service is horrible. Plan to wait an obnoxious, abnormal amount of time to leave.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel had very good staff working there who were very friendly. Lovely place with a nice reception area. It is located in the financial district and there is a metro station entrance 70mts from the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We were home for Christmas and needed a night away...waaaay away. Meanwhile, we thought my hubby lost his wedding ring. We called the the front desk for a flashlight. Instead of giving us a flashlight to look around, the front desk sent engineers who helped us look by getting down on the floor looking through under over inside and behind every single thing in the room. It was so nice of them and above and beyond what we were expecting them to do.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We had issues with the shower. It would start okay then as you rinsed shampoo out the water would get ice cold. Then, as you adjusted the temperature, it would get scalding hot! Spoke to front desk. They were waiting on technician to fix it. So, we had no hot water for one day. I had to skip a shower but thankfully I'm a clean guy anyway. Otherwise, concierge was helpful for tickets, rooms are small of course but IT IS New York. The city view was nice! Especially the Freedom Tower. The elevators were busy so caused groups to scurry into fast closing doors. But once inside the elevators were fast. The Italian restaurant downstairs had less than hoped for service and food. Overall, would stay at another comparable hotel but would check-in here if the deal I got was still offered(Groupon).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: All i can say is that i loved my stay here!! Wonderful staff!! Especially Ashley - So helpful!! Thank you again for a wonderful stay!! Definitely going back :D:D:D So clean, no noise! Excellent cookies! In a great area! Just perfect!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Situated in the Financial District, the Hilton Doubletree on Stone street offers a quiet and peaceful respite to the energy of Manhattan. We stay here frequently and appreciate the proximity to parking, the hospitality of the staff, and the charm of historical Stone Street.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I've staying in NYC many times (always in soho, central park, or chelsea) and only stayed at this location because my dad put me here b/c he thought he was going to get Hilton points so I took one for the team. This was one of the worst stays I've ever had in any hotel ever. Yes this hotel is very convenient BUT there are hundreds of hotels in NYC that are convenient so not a good positive on this one. The bell staff and concierge were very nice and very helpful. again every other hotel in NYC i've found this. I stay once a month here and change hotels for variety in the city. First - I was here only 2 nights, 3 days, and dropped a dress off to dry cleaning. I needed it for a play. It sat behind the front desk for 48 hours in a bag, never picked up, nothing. I was never called or notified and when I called to get my dress on day of check out, I had to call 2 different people both of whom never called back. I went to front desk as I had to check out at this point and the girl gave me my dress in the same laundry bag uncleaned and wrinkled with only I'm sorry. Horrible customer service, no offer to clean and get it to me that night or pay for dry cleaning elsewhere or next day when I needed it. DO NOT TRUST THIS PLACE WITH IMPORTANT NEEDS/SERVICES. SECOND, the water in shower was not consistent and would be luke warm, then really hot, then really cold. this was the cycle every shower. Mostly the water was on cooler side and I was always cold getting out of the shower. horrible shower. you have no control in temperature.THIRD, the beds are not that comfortable. I had trouble sleeping and bathrooms so small you can't put much in it.I will never recommend this place and never stay again. My dad is a Hilton Honors member and he will complain as well to Hilton.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If you are going to be paying full price for this hotel, please do not do it! The rooms were unfinished, we had to call for maintenance a couple of times, and the receptionists were rude (however, I did enjoy speaking with the Bell-Hops and 2 maintenance men we had to call)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My room smelled very strongly of fried Chinese food but it wasn't worth the hassle to walk back down the 10 flights of stairs with my luggage to the front desk and get a room change. The elevators are consistently full by the time that they reach the second floor lobby because people queue up on the ground floor. I just took the 12 stories of stairs to my room each time I wanted to go anywhere after waiting 20 minutes for full elevators. I ended up taking 84 flights of stairs during my stay. The only time it was a serious hassle was when I needed to take the stairs in my formal business clothes with my luggage. I wasn't planning on starting my morning in the office off sweating.
user_name:
Tyler N
Kansas City, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: As others have mentioned, the hotel is very convenient to the WTC, wall street, stone street and numerous subways. It is clean and well maintained. The one drawback is that due to the number of people traveling from the entrance to the 2nd floor lobby and others traveling up and down to/from their rooms, the wait for the elevators can be very long.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This location is around the corner from the subway, my office, many restaurants, and Wall street. This is my first time staying here but my office has stayed here often for meetings. The location makes it easier to travel while on business. the staff is attentive and the lobby has security to make sure you are safely in the hotel and when you need a cab or car service they will acquire a vehicle for you.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Our stay was wonderful. Only complaint is the beds are way too short. For anyone over 6 ft., this is an issue. However the mattresses are comfortable. The warm cookie upon arrival was amazing. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. The subway station is conveniently located right across the street, which makes it a quick ride to midtown Manhattan.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here during 2 day business trip to NYC. Hotel lobby was pretty (decorated for Christmas). All staff was very courteous (one staff person even carried my bag down stairs from the lobby to the ground floor!). It was nice to check in and go to my room and make a cup of tea and enjoy my cookie. Thanks!
user_name:
Helen K
Clifton Park, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed during December. The hotel is well located if you're doing work downtown. It's clean and the rooms are comfortable. It's a good business hotel-you sleep there, the rooms are better than average but not much to do in the hotel. Stone street is interesting area. Lots of bars and restaurants all within easy walking district but they're all loud and jammed with the under 30 set

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I highly do not recommend this hotel at all. First, they do not provide parking. Second you have to pay for wifi. Third the elevators are super slow. Fourth the staff are not that welcoming. Fifth the AC/Heater system sucks it's either too cold or way too hot had to keep getting up at night turning it off or on. And six to top it off I was robbed. I left money there (cash) in my bag in my luggage I came back to the room at night and checked my things and my money was gone. Went down to front desk and called security and saw that last person to go in was housekeeping. Told us nothing could've been done till next day when the manager was in. Went to go talk to the manger next day and he was rude, careless about the situation. And while I was there another young lady had somethings stolen as well. They did not do anything to help me. So I called the police. Something has to be done there. It's not right that they have staff(housekeeping) going through people things and stealing! I left many things including money in the past in hotel room especially Double Tree by "HILTON" and never had this happen. Please check in to other hotel NOT this one.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was our first time to New York City. The first folks that we met (other than our shuttle driver), were those at the Doubletree Hotel New York City-Financial District. Not a bad impression of the city’s folks.So, I really want to be fair to this hotel (actually, I always want to be fair but truthful). Right off the start, I will state that we probably would return to this establishment but would also look around for a better deal first.The staff that we met, to a person, were knowledgeable, efficient, pleasant and more than willing to help with directions or suggestions. Our three day stay was great and most of it was due to these new friends.Location wise, the Doubletree Hotel New York City-Financial District is close to several subway stations. It is a short walk to the boats to the statue of liberty (right by Battery Park). Lots of pubs (seemed to be mostly Irish) and restaurants are just a stroll away.The much often mentioned elevators were never a problem. We were in room 3802 and used it a lot. The longest wait from calling to landing was 3 minutes. As suggested I took a book to read and never got to the first page. Having stated this, we were there on a weekend (good time to be in the financial district). Perhaps they are busier on weekdays.The hallways are hallways. They are about the size of a cruise ship’s. I had no problem with them and I am six foot 205 pounds (before pubs). There are only 10 or so rooms on the 38th floor. So, we never met too many patrons in the hall.Our room however, was small about the size of a cruise ship’s suite. There really was no problem with that as we spent little time in it. The bed is short (about the size of a cruise ship’s). It is about 5 foot 10 inches. I slept like a (curled) log. The staff that serviced the room could have been much better and really pulled down my rating. The only time 3802 was made up, the towels were changed and the bed made. Not a single thing else. No clean glasses, ice bucket not emptied, no fresh soap, shampoo (almost ran out), conditioner, etc. This is my only real complaint.The shower was okay but you had to learn a pattern. Set the water to the desired temperature. If it starts to get hotter, step out of the stream and wait a second or two. Then it will go really cold. Wait another moment and continue the shower. Oh yes, no stopper in the sink. This happens often and it is a real pain if you need to keep water in the sink. (Okay, 3 complaints.) It could use a little maintenance but I don’t own it, so have no problem with defective piecesThe doormen were great. They were always a fresh start or end to our journeys out or in from the Manhattan streets. (I wanted to end on a good note).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here for three nights during a trip to NYC and it was a really good base to explore Manhattan and Brooklyn. Our room was on a floor in the 20s (27th I think) and although small it was really comfy (space in Manhattan is expensive I guess). Also, it's quiet and clean. A downside was the lift; it always took a rather long time to arrive and when it did it was always crowded. Staff were always very friendly and helpful, luggage storage on our departure day wasn't a problem and they also have a small gym (5 or so cardio machines). also, cookies and a bottle of water when you check in were a nice touch! The hotel is walking distance from Battery Park and the financial district as well as Brooklyn Bridge and there are two subway lines really close by so it's easy to reach the rest of Manhattan. Various restaurants and bars are in that area as well.
user_name:
Gesa J
