Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: For our weekend trip to NYC during the Christmas holiday, this hotel was adequate. If you want to be right next to the nightlife, this would not be your choice but it was fine for us. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We didn't have any issues with noise. But the rooms are a bit small, as well is the lobby and the restaurant for breakfast. Service, however, was impeccable. It clearly is an older building with only 3 elevators for 40 floors and the size of the rooms so not much can be done about that. But we barely spent any time there except to sleep anyway. Subway close by and the financial district is a nice area. Walk to Battery Park and 9/11 Memorial was very nice. Not sure if the hotel offers free wifi to all guests as being Hilton Honors Diamond, gets me free wifi.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a adequate hotel. The location is great for financial district proximity. A few challenges for some might be;- 3 elevators for 40 floors - long waits ensue- noisy rooms by the elevators as they ding on every floor- limited fitness center; 3 treadmills and 2 ellipticals.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Far below what I expected from a 4-star hotel at $200+ per night... especially a DoubleTree. Condition of room was poor (scratch and dent furniture, curtain pulled from bar, filthy windows, etc.) and the HVAC system squealed like a police siren all night. A room service tray in the hall remained untouched for 36 hours. Elevators are painfully slow, rooms are small, overall condition of hotel is far below expectations.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here on a weekend trip to the city. It is conveniently located near the subway. Parking was only a half block away and the validated it. Never tried the restraunt because I hate eating in the hotel. There are so many better places to eat. The staff was great, very friendly. The room was quiet and clean. Was very small but this is NYC and thats normal. Free water and cookies at check in was cool. The elevators are dead slow. We stayed on the 6th floor so we just took the stairs.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stay at the doubletree on occasion since its conveniently located a couple blocks from my office. Maybe I'm arriving at off-times but there's always been only 1-2 people working the front desk, nobody at the HHonors line, and 2-3 people ahead of me. The cookies and water at check in are a nice touch though and the breakfast as a diamond member in the restaurant is pretty decent. My problem is that the rooms are packed pretty closely together to the point where I can hear the doors slam closed from the adjoining rooms. Quite annoying if you have a lot of night owl neighbors and you have early morning meetings. Also, expect to wait a bit for the elevators, they always seem to run slow.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Certainly not a 4 star. Rooms are pokey. Carry your own bags. Wade over drunken revellers at the ground floor level to get to the lobby at the second floor. Can't eat in the in house restaurant - as for two nights in a row it has been closed for private parties. Hotel says they have no control over it - but their brochure ware describes it as 'our ' restaurant. This leaves you with no where but your room to eat. There is no bar or anything. Room service is rude, useless and takes over an hour to order. Two lifts service the hotel on over 40 floors this includes shifting food and housekeeping - chaos. Grimy unpleasant experience overall. Oh and so noisy!!!!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If you're on a biz trip in the financial district and you love cookies then this is the perfect hotel for you :) location wise it's pretty discreet and don't expect any fancy decorations etc. however the service was nice and the room pretty clean. As with most New York hotels the AC makes a lot of noise when you switch it on. I think coz it's just old. But if you're looking for a nice comfy bed to sleep in and do not want to walk far from your office assuming you work around the vicinity, then I would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed in December, not great value for money. small rooms which are in need of refreshment.service is good.there are only three lifts for a high-rise building so the wait can be long.good location for business and sightseeing.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for 5 days with my partner while on a multi stop trip across various countries. This was by far the nicest hotel we visited. On arrival at the hotel from JFK ( which was a set cost in an NYC Taxi - good value to anywhere in manhattan) we were greeted by the doorman who assisted with our luggage. Check in was quick and painless, and we were assigned a room on a high floor. The room was a fair size (not massive, but it is NYC) and was well equipped. Hairdryer, iron etc all in the room, good size flatscreen tv, lots of channels, powerful shower, nice bathoom. See attached for a map of the hotel floor (work from bottom right , clockwise, which is room XX01 through to XX10 where XX is your floor). the 01 - 06 rooms look North, 07-08 South, not sure about 09-10.The lifts focus heavily in previous reviews. We did not wait more than 5 minutes for a lift, and this was only on 2 occasions. Generally the lifts were on your floor within a minute. Usually there were hotel staff in the lifts, going about their business, Every one of them made an effort to say hello and have a conversation. Definitely the friendliest staff I've came across.The Whitehall St subway is at the end of the street, from which you can get a train straight uptown to Times Sq or 34th St to all the attractions. This takes no more than 15-20 minutes and passes every 12 mins or so. It is also easy to catch a taxi from the end of the street.A small irish pub underneath the hotel was great. extremely welcoming, serving great food. It's open until 4am, but we heard no noise. It is probably different if you are on the first few low floors at the front of the building however.There is a small market at the end of the street for the usual amenities, and a liquor store within a 5 minute walk. Very handy.The Staten island ferry is also a 5 minute walk away, which is well worth a visit.On leaving, the hotel arranged a town car for us to take us back to JFK. It was a flat rate of $65 and well worth it as the car was waiting for us 15 mins early to take us to the airport. saving the hassle of flagging a yellow cab.Overall, a great stay and I will return in future.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel was booked at the last minute for a spontaneous trip to NYC for a concert. It fit all our needs for the night, was in a great location that was easily accessible to the subway and tons of attractions, was very clean and the price was right.The staff, (as well as just about everyone we encountered in NYC), were extremely helpful, answering any questions you may have, and always in a good mood. We were given free in-room Wi-Fi, which was also a nice touch. The lobby has a bank of computers in-case you need to print out a boarding pass for the trip home. Disclaimer: The rooms are a bit smaller and the halls are definitely narrow, but what do you expect for a great price, in a great location, in lower Manhattan, New York City?If you are looking for a good stay at the right price in a nice hotel, this is your place. If you are looking for the lap of luxury, head uptown.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very tight - no room for a shaving kit in the bathroon. I had a noisy ventilation system somewhere above me. Elevators very slow because of use I suppose. Be very careful when booking - you may be surprised to see the rate double on the second night if you do not check carefully. Also, beware of the restaurant on the ground floor. They slap on a 20% service charge (for 4 people at breakfast) and then expect a tip. And, the food is not very good at all. I would not recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is difficult to find unless you map out and print exact directions prior to travelling. GPS is wonky in the general area due to tightly packed high rises and very narrow streets. No doorman upon arrival and a pull handle entrance door which is very difficult when you have luggage, HELLO, IT IS A HOTEL DOUBLETREE! Check in is on second floor through a tight entrance hall leading to 3 very small elevator. The check in staff are clueless but the lobby does have ample seating and wifi. Rooms are fair, clean but bathroom is obscenely miniscule and our shower stall leaked like an old Chevy. Room WiFi is an additional $9.95 per day and you have to purchase it online and not through your hotel booking. Beds are too soft but they are clean. Parking garage is convenient but expensive even for New York City standards and we stay in NYC at least 10 weekends+ a year for decades. This hotel is listed as 4 Star rating but is truly 3 to 3.5 at best and that would be on a good day. If you can get this hotel for less than $125.00 a night then it will be a good stay but more over that and you will wish you had stayed elsewhere. PS. If you do stay at this lesser Doubletree, please don't waste your time or money at the Nebraska Beef Steak House across the street. Horrid place, disgusting food, nasty staff and @180.00 for two people.
user_name:
Joseph S
Newport, Rhode Island USA

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is a terrific bet - whether you are staying one night or ten. We read the reviews before making a reservation and were a bit apprehensive because of some of the negative comments we found from travelers. We went anyway and are so glad we did. Yes, the room is a tad small so big deal! It was clean and fresh each and every day. The staff...every single one we had the pleasure to meet...were friendly and helpful. The wait for an elevator was longer than we'd have liked so we planned ahead for that and left a little earlier or later...no big deal. Honestly, this is a great hotel and does not deserve the badgering. You can't beat the price and I will guarantee if you walk in with a smile, you will walk out happy!!!
user_name:
Rita B
Chapel Hill, North Carolina

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: booked through Priceline.com - double checked with a friend about the area... Traveled to NY for a concert with friends. We checked in on Thanksgiving Day (afternoon) and check-in process was pretty easy. I didn't have my Hilton Honors # but they checked it for me & although my trip wouldn't count (booked through the 3rd party) - i was still able to get the perks. All associates that we met during the stay were very nice. The room was quite large especially for a NYC hotel. We had a King Bed and plenty of room to walk around. The hallways & elevators are of course smaller compared to what most people are used to but eh, why does that matter. They did only have 3 elevators which are used for service as well - so sometimes it took several minutes to get an elevator. Our room was cleaned well each day too. We chose a city view (at check-in) which gave us the Freedom Tower right there! We were close to Ellis Island Ferry, Wall Street, starbucks & dunkin donuts :) too. We didn't use any of the services only because we were doing to mid-town each day (also a pretty quick cab ride, about $18-$25 depending on where we went). Our doorman helped us get a vehicle to return to the airport (which was almost the same as a cab but it was ready & waiting). If i were staying in lower manhattan i would return to this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Everyone I came in contact with was wonderful, friendly and helpful, especially the front desk clerk, Damian. It was in a great location in the financial district, as a single girl traveling alone I felt very safe. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York.
user_name:
Amy Beth D
Redlands, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: great spot for financial district and well priced, but otherwise very very average. Ridiculous lift service long waits and tiny rooms and hallways.Food rough and front desk service patchy. I had to wait until 4 pm to have my room cleaned and then only got it after calling twice.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel rooms are extremely small. Two people cannot walk past each other in the hall ways. There are really long elevator wait times. The hotel only has a hand full of refrigerators available. (less than 10). They want to charge you to have a refrigerator if you are lucky enough to get one. When Double Tree had a restaurant downstairs it was actually good. Now that they let their restaurant go and the Italian restaurant across the street moved in, it is lacking. The breakfast buffet had fruit that had been cubed that had started to go bad and had the spoiled taste to it. The eggs were cold. The staff at the front counter are friendly. The cookies live up to the Double Tree standard and I have to get 4 of them when I check in. If it wasn't for the location and that my work has a direct bill set up with them, I would stay somewhere else. I would suggest that this place put refrigerators in every room, or buy more to hand out when requested. The wireless internet here is a joke and they make you pay for it. You should have retained wired internet or did a better implementation of your wireless network.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Although I know Manhattan is expensive, the hotel is somewhat below my expectation from the inside(at around US$ 240 per night). The room is very small(almost the same or even smaller than the Four Points SOHO I stayed earlier this year) , the corridor is narrow.The positive side is the location-- subway is within 5 mins walk. Front desk is also helpful.When I come back to Manhattan again I will try a different hotel. Maybe I will find a better one, or maybe I will realize how expensive Manhattan is.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have stayed at many DoubleTree hotels and this was by far the worst experience. Although the gentleman at the front desk was pleasant and helpful, the staff at the hotel was unresponsive. There were no information cards or menus in the room for the fitness facility or room service. When I called to request a in-room dining menu it took 45 minutes for the menu to arrive. However, the service attendant did not provide the right material and, despite my request, never circled back with the correct material. The room service attendant who (finally) delivered my meal left half the meal in the kitchen and had to go back to retrieve it. He was more interested in watching the news on my room TV and engaging in political discourse than responding to my questions about the remainder of the meal.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The Double Tree Hilton at Wall Street is an excellent hotel. I was deeply impressed with the quality of service; the state of the room, and the overall atmosphere. The front desk manager was exceptional in her assistance in various matters. I also complete the Bell Help for giving pointers on how to ride the subway in New York; thank you Chester. Definitely, if I had to choose again, it would be the DoubleTree Hiilton at Wall Street.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Overall experience was excellent. This hotel is very clean, the staff is attentive and helpful and the location is terrific. It takes under 5 minutes to walk to the train for site seeing or business - and you can be in mid-town in 15 minutes. For the price and value, this is an excellent hotel. Our only complaint would be the coffee in the lobby - it isn't very tastey. Would recommend this hotel to anyone with two thumbs up!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: As I have mentioned in other reviews, I travel to NYC at least twice per month on business and have done so for the last couple of years. As a result I have stayed at most of the financial district hotels.I had hoped that the Doubletree would be a good alternative when my favorite, the Andaz, was not available.It's really just OK. The rooms are decent enough. They were redone about two years ago. Unfortunately the building layout is not great. Each floor has just a handful of rooms and as a result all of them are close to the elevators. If you're sensitive to noise this can be a problem. Particularly if you check in late at night (as I usually do) and get the last-choice room directly in front of the elevator. No buffer, the door to this room is literally four feet from the elevator doors. Ding. Ding. Ding. All night long.Speaking of the elevators, they are the number one drawback for me. I have waited over 10 minutes for an elevator in the mornings. Too few elevators for the number of floors/guests and at least one of he elevators is usually out of service or in use for freight/ housekeeping only. Service is hit or miss. They have had a number of surly people working the front desk over the last few years. I think the staff are a little better now, but the culture is not super welcoming. Two stays ago, I could not get any hot water for a shower. I called the front desk to ask if there was a problem. The answer was : sometimes you have to wait for someone else to finish showering to get hot water. Yep.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel staff at this hotel may be one of the nicest, most attentive I’ve ever encounter in my travels. The rooms are clean but slightly small compared to others and very expensive but is in NYC…. My only issue is the cleaning staff using the elevators at peak times. Wait for it to stop at almost every floor while they get on and off is not fair to a customer. This needs to end or I won’t be back.
user_name:
William G
New York City, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stay in Hilton hotels whenever I am able for both work and pleasure. 9 out of 10 times they deliver excellent service and value for the price. This Doubletree was a big disappointment. It has not been well maintained.1) The shower stall seal was broken and the water flooded the floor 2) The shower changed temperature by it self from hot to ice cold and back to hot at random3) Bath room lighting was so dim it was impossible to put makeup on4) Window curtain was torn and hanging5) only 2 elevators and they were slow6) Only 2 people at the front desk and the wait to speak with them was always long- 10-15 minutes 7) room lock didn't have an operational safety lock8) Impossible to get a taxi in that neighborhoodNeedless to say, I will not be staying there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed four nights at the Doubletree NYC Financial District. We found the room nice and beds comfortable. One morning the elevators were extremely busy, we used the stairs from the 21st floor so we would not be late for a meeting. This was our only point of displeasure with the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms are the smallest ever. Cannot fit suitcase in closet. There are 3 small elevators for a 44 story hotel. No service elevator. 10-15 waits are common. There are only 2 people at the counter. Overall do not advise staying there.
user_name:
Harry S
Los Angeles, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: will bring family and stay services and rates are very affordable. Location is within reach of many attractions and business. Food selection is great and abundant. will bring family and stay services and rates are very affordable. Location is within reach of many attractions and business. Food selection is great and abundantwill bring family and stay services and rates are very affordable. Location is within reach of many attractions and business. Food selection is great and abundant
user_name:
Ayman A
sam jose, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Parking in front, subway within 5 min, wall street 5 min and always good price on the room. Battery park walking distance. Room are fine but not enough elevators. Pharmacie near and city tour at 5 min walk.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Overall it's a nice hotel for the price but I would have much rather paid a bit more to stay more central. I had never been to NYC before and was looking for a more lively neighborhood. Wall Street is a very boring place to stay. Guess it's because it caters to the 9-5'rs and after work drinks crowd. We wanted to get some food on a Saturday night and nothing was open except for McDonald. We thankfully found a bar that was still serving food at midnight: The Growler. Back e hotel: the elevators are brutally slow but thankfully we were on the 9h floor and could do the stairs if need be. The free wifi only works in the lobby and if you want it in your room you have to pay $10 per 24 hours.This is not ideal if you want to plan your day and have to go down to the lobby every time.The room was a decent size and the king bed was very comfortable.The staff were very friendly and helpful and the warm cookies at check in were a nice touch.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We chose this place for a weekend getaway mainly for price, it was the least expensive decent hotel with a king bed. We were pleasantly surprised by how nice the property is. It is on a small side street a few blocks from Wall St, Trinity Church, Fraunces Tavern and Battery Park. We were there on the weekend, and since the financial district pretty much is gone on the weekend it was nice and quiet. Staff were friendly and professional. I will echo prior comments regarding slow elevators and small rooms, but I found neither of these issues to be major problems. I'm used to small rooms from travelling in Europe, or being on cruise ships, and it really doesn't bother me. If you're the type that likes to "spread out" it could be an issue. We did not use the hotel associated with the restaurant, but it looked very nice.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here while running the NYC Marathon. Location was great as is it is a short walk to the Staten Island Ferry. The room was clean, not large, but fine for what we needed. The exercise room was well stocked with equipment and clean. Workers here were very friendly and courteous.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Arrived to an hour long check in line (in a supposed 4 star hotel) with only 1 desk clerk for most of the time. When finally received the clerk attired as a pirate but who turned out to be the manager brushed aside any suggestion of an upgrade. She then inadvertently (or punitively - not sure) gave us a room (3109) with an extra short bed (I am 6 feet tall) and other amenities (a mid door peephole) suggesting the room was specially equipped - just not for us. I fault Priceline for suggesting that this is in any way shape or form a 4 star place - the lobby on Friday night truly resembled a student hostel, the towels were Econolodge quality, etc. Undoubtedly it is different during the week- I cannot imagine the financial types putting up with this.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great place to stay if you're running in NYC Marathon. Easy access to Staten Island Ferry. Quiet on weekend for sleep before and after Marathon. Excellent restaurant in hotel. Staff at the door are friendly and extremely helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The service at this hotel was very poor. I was running the NYC marathon this past weekend. I woke up early on Sunday morning and found our coffee machine in the room was broken. When I called to have someone come up to replace it, it took well over 30 minutes! Also, I asked for an extra water bottle since are room wasn't ready at 3pm (like they said it would be) and they charged me for it on my bill! No coffee in the lobby the morning of the marathon. I've done several races and ALL hotels (ranging from 2 star to 5 star) have coffee early in the morning before a race, ESPECIALLY hotels right near the start (in this case 3 blocks from the Staten Island ferry). To add insult to injury, those cookies Doubletree is always talking about...I found a HAIR in my cookie! Not on top, actually cooked in the cookie. For almost $500 dollars a night, stay somewhere else!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Happened to find great price for the night. #129.00. Easy to get to on subway. Close access to many trains. Memorial and Brooklyn Bridge not very far. Hotel very nice and staff were all very helpful. nynynynynynnynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynynyny

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Elevators are slow and the room was a bit on the small and tired side so I'm not giving 4/5. Standard of room could have been better and a little bigger but nothing to complain about. I found the staff rather friendly. Would stay here again for sure.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We recently stayed here for a few days, a good hotel and good size rooms considering you are in New York City! The hotel was very well placed and the room had all the basic facilities required for an enjoyable stay. Only negative was the elevators, there just weren't enough for the number of guests in the building, especially if you are trying to get out around 8.50 in the morning alongside all the business travellers or at check-out time! I didn't think this was as big a deal as has been set out in other reviews but that was my experience. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a good value stay very close to battery park (for tour buses, statue of liberty and ellis island), ground zero and the rest of the financial district. Lots of metro lines connecting you to the whole city and also easy to get too on the metro from JFK. Really enjoyed our stay and only wish it could have been longer. We also had in-room wifi included but there was free wifi in the lobby if you don't get this and need to get online.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: "Welcome to the Doubletree!" I'm always greeted with a smile and handshake there! The hotel is a wonderful place to stay for me, because it is close to my usual business place and provides the amenities I desire. When I arrive, I always seem to run into the same employees, who greet me like an old friend. Check-in is simple and fast and I'm off to my comfy room in no time at all! The staff is very responsive to any issues that may arise. And, of course, the warm Doubletree cookie given to me at check-in easily can soothe the pains of travel! The breakfasts are satisfying and the staff always is ready to serve! You must stay here!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms a clean and beds are comfi. However don't plan to spend to much time in the rooms beside from sleeping. The rooms are extremely small, so make sure to go out early in the morning and don't come back before sleeping is the thing to do.Prepare to be patience with the elevators - they are extremely slow and the capacity is not sufficient.I found the location a bit boring as the Financial District is not that interesting..

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I want my review to be helpful to you, so I'll point out the good and the bad. The good: the room looked really nice. If you are driving there, a separate parking deck is directly across the street so you can park and then go to the hotel.The bad: The room is extremely small, the elevators are painfully slow, and I regret choosing the Financial District. The room is really nice looking, but you do feel like the room is so tiny that you wonder how it got a 4 star rating. There are three elevators and there are over 40 floors of rooms. You will sometimes wait a long time for an elevator to come. Seriously, the worst elevators I have used at hotel. On a location note (not to blame on the hotel), the Financial District was far from the things that I wanted to see. If you are looking to go all around New York City, I definitely recommend to stay anywhere north of the Financial District. I really felt that I was deeply out of my way and had to take a subway to go anywhere.One more note: You'll have to stay a lot higher than I did (24th floor) to actually get a decent view.I would recommend this hotel to you if 1) You specifically want to stay in the Financial District 2) You don't mind the room being small and 3) You accept ahead of time that the elevators are slow.Outside of those things, the employees were friendly, they give each guest a warm chocolate chip cookie, and the room was nice looking even though it was tiny.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was nice but because of our encounter with Juicy at the front counter we ended up leaving the Hotel. Never in my life have I been treated with such disrespect, unwillingness to help/remedy a situation and just plain ignorance.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Rooms are like any NYC hotel - small. Room was clean. Staff was friendly and ready to help (surprising in NYC !). Its close to Wall Street, so good for business travelers. Although its not in the middle of hustle bustle for vacationers, the locations isn't bad as its next to the Statue of Liberty Ferry, Battery Park and on the stop for several trains - 4,5, R (Bowling Green).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My stay at the DoubleTree in NYC was excellent as usual with the exception of two housekeeping issues. The first is when I walked in and found the previous occupants dental bridge in a cup in the bathroom and the soap was not replaced. The second was shower towels were left on the floor one day.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The elevator IS slow, but you're in the oldest part of New York, where space is at a premium and they're running a 40-something story hotel with three elevators. But the staff is nice, and the location - particularly if you have business in the area - can't be beat. Oh, and my room was spotless. If I was a leisure traveler, I would probably stay in Midtown since there's more going on in the evening, but this part of the city is highly underrated and kind of cool. We don't have a lot of "old" in the US - and the windy cobblestone streets and older buildings are a bit of fun local color in the big city.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very well located in lower Manhattan. Right on spot of the things you want to see in NYC. Reception is located on the 2nd floor, the 3 elevators are not enough to serve all 43 floors though. Wifi only free in the lobby. Rooms are clean, bathproducts are top quality!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is walking distance to Battery Park, and across the street from the subway. Compared to many hotels in NYC, the price was reasonable. The accommodations were very nice, although the bathroom was small, and we noticed some mildew in the shower tile. Plan ahead for taxi service, as there is not much parking space in front of the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here whilst at a conference at Convene, so very convenient location. Comfy bed, clean room, helpful staff (other than in the restaurant) and even though my room was opposite the elevator bank, it was quiet for the location. However, the elevators were unbelievably slow - there clearly aren't enough of them for the size of the building - and i sometimes had to wait up to five minutes just to get downstairs (and as I was on the 28th floor, didn't fancy the walk down - or more importantly, up!). The breakfast room was not particularly appealing and the waiter we had was particularly surly.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Came back to this Doubletree after two years, still was wonderful as last time. I didn't experience any elevator problem, but again, I was there on a weekend.Room upgrade and breakfast voucher were given for being elite member, I checked in at 1pm with no problem at all. Will be back for sure.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: At the south end of Manhattan, around the corner from Wall Straat and Battery Park, the location is good with two subway stations within a few minutes walking.The rooms are reasonably sized and nicely comfortable. The hotel is 40+ (?) floors high but there are only 3 elevators, which results in long waiting times at peak hours.Breakfast is an OK buffet but the staff seemed overworked with the manager only walking around looking - not taking any action or helping out. This resulted in a lack of clean tables, the taken coffee orders not delivered or glasses/cutlery not set up on the tables. We stayed for a week and this was the same all days.On the last day the hotel seemed to have major issue with hot water supply. This can happen, and I understand it can take some time to fix this (it was over Christmas to make things even more challenging). The way the problem was dealt with was poor though: information given by the operator was wrong or promises to be called back with an update were not kept. Only after I went down to reception (after having waited for over an hour) another room was made available to shower. When we came back in the evening to pick up our luggage before heading to the airport, the issue still seemed to be going on with loads of frustrated guests at the reception desk. As said: things like this can happen but the way you deal with it is what counts!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: A short walk from uptown subway and ferries at battery park. Clean, comfortable, only let down by lack of space in the bar. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Italian restaurant served good breakfast and delicious dinner.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: we arrived early but our room was ready at check-in 3pm. Ashley at main desk was amazing, running up 9 flights of stairs to make sure our room was completed and Luis who cared for our baggage was courteous and friendly. my only complaint was the slow, slow slow elevators. horrible !!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The DoubleTree Hotel in the biz district is a cozy rainy weekend getaway, especially if you can get the top floor city view. The long grey days and great company, the feeling like its just the two of you as you awaken to the sky...

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I needed a room with two beds for Saturday night over the Columbus holiday weekend. It was difficult to find anything under $400. I got a deal on a room at this hotel through a third party web booking site. I was a bit concerned about some of the reviews I read about overbooking and called the hotel and spoke with Asst. Manager Ashley Thavisin. She was very helpful and made sure there was a double room available as I was arriving late in the day. We were not in the room much at all but it was a fine room for a one night stay. The only problem we had (and everyone else!) was with the elevators. There are only three for the entire property and one was broken. There is no service elevator. This meant there were very long waits which got pretty frustrating at times.Otherwise, it was a nice location in the Financial District.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Unfortunately- I did not take the advice of previous reviewers and booked this hotel anyway. There are three main problems.1) The hotel elevators are VERY slow. There are only three of them and I only think one or two work. I am surprised that despite this repeated complaint on TripAdvisor- the hotel Management has done nothing to fix it. 2) The room is dirty. Our room felt like it was very lightly cleaned before our stay. There was hair in the bathroom, handprints on the headboard of the bed, used glasses left behind, etc.3) The restaurant for breakfast is terrible. They look annoyed when you show up. Especially when you have a breakfast coupon. The service is bad. They pack you into a tiny space, don't bring you silverware/coffee promptly and the selection of food is terrible. The location is good but I would not stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This facility has a good location (for me), but the rooms are small and the front desk and management seem disorganized. Every time I stay here there is a problem with my check-in, from giving my room away to not be able to figure out how to issues my keys. Seems to be lots of turn-over at this facility. Super slow elevators!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here recently for business. Had to walk down 14 flights of stairs each day as the elevators would not show up after 15 minute wait. There's 3 elevators, but only 2 for guests and they are really small. There are over 40 floors!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I travel 200+ days a year and I was very surprised at the condition of my bathroom when I woke up in the morning to take a shower. As you can see from the photos in the shower area, there is large spots of black mold on the ceiling. This is not something that grew overnight; this is a a pattern of mold that takes weeks to develop. So I can't imagine why the cleaning staff would not bring this to the hotel managers attention. If they skip over taking remedial action for black mold, what else is this hotel overlooking. The rest of the room was standard Westin experience but the elevators in this hotel are poor. We waited two times over 10 minutes to get an elevator. The noise outside at night was louder than I would have expected since the hotel is in the financial district, which is basically dead on a weeknight. With so many choices in New York City, unless you love black mold, I would book elsewhere.
user_name:
Brian P
Royal Palm Beach, Florida

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here for one night in order to see the 9/11 Memorial and museum. This is a great location close enough to walk easily to the memorial yet far enough away to stay out of the craziness. This hotel is also just a few blocks away from the waterfront of Battery park, which was also a nice place to walk around on a sunny warm Saturday. There are plenty of places to eat in various price categories close by, and a black car to La Guardia is only $45. The hotel has been updated and is in good shape overall, but rooms are predictably small, and the hallways are so small you must walk single file! The rooms have been redone in a more modern style wwhich was pleasant to stay in, and the bathrooms were more than adequate. Storage is limited to one freestanding armoire-type closet so pack lite! Overall we would return to this hotel and have no problem recommending it to others.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I've stayed at the hotel multiple times. The staff is always great. The rooms are small and the elevators are terrible. My issue is I was charged for a no show in a situation where my flight to NYC was cancelled. I called the hotel that evening, explained the situation, and was advised I would not be charged. However, I was chareged. I have inquired three times via calls and email and the management of the hotel does not have the common courtesy to return my call. I stay a total of 10 - 20 nights a year at this hotel. I'm sure there is another hotel in NYC that would be glad to have my business.Staff: ExcellentRooms: Clean, but very small.Location: Good.Restaruant: Good.Elevators: Terrible.Management: Whatever is worse than terrible!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I recommend this hotel highly and without reservation. Excellent location for sightseeing, financial business, and restaurants. Staff was very efficient, helpful and friendly. Check in and out was a breeze. Excellent car service to area airports. My room was very comfortable and well appointed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: "Remote" location.Clean hotel, friendly staff. The room was pretty. Didn't try the restaurant. There was construction at the time. This can be a catch when you book with Hotwire. Overall a good experience but nex time I will avoid the Financial district that is far from everything.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights in Sept 2014 on part of our honeymoon. The hotel is located in the Financial District which is very near to the 9/11 memorial site and the ferry for Liberty and Ellis Island. It is a long walk to places like Times Square and Central Park but there is a subway stop right outside the hotel so it doesnt matter!Our room was nice and clean, the staff were very good particularly the guys on the door who were very chatty and helpful. There is also an Irish pub just outside which is great for good, cheap food and drink plus watching sport.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Excellent service and location, near to all of the financial district. Very good to business. On a walking distance, is the famous Wall Street, the NYSE, the Federal Reserve of N.Y and private banks. Also, near the hotel there are pubs, very good restaurants, department stores, and the Museum of Indian Americans.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Arrived in the early hours of the morning following a transatlantic flight to commence a one week stay on business. Got off to a bad start when I was told the hotel was overbooked and they would transfer me to another location. Then went from bad to worse when told that alternative hotel was a Holiday Inn Express way up on 39th street. However, being too tired to remonstrate further took the cab (for which the hotel paid) and also recovered my return fare the next day when I resumed my pre-booked stay. All the comments from other reviews about the elevators are true - my longest wait was at the weekend when it took 12 minutes for one to arrive at my floor.Wifi was fine - mine was free by way of compensation - usually there is a charge unless you are a Hilton Honours member.Breakfast! Why is it that people readily accept poor quality and are too embarrassed to alert staff when things are wrong? Every item on the "hot" buffet was cold! OK food but I like mine hot. Reported it to the Maitre"D who, to his credit, went off to check immediately. On checking a couple of days later I found the same scenario so ordered an omelette (which was hot and very appetising). I can't complain about the room - it was very small (but then I had paid a very low rate so what did I expect).Warm cookies on arrival are a gimmick - better to stay somewhere else, pay a little more and have a better experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: No hot water the morning of my departure was the lowpoint. Missing a wakeup call was bad but not the end of the world. Lots of nice things about this hotel (nice gym, great location for my needs, friendly staff) but my two issues soured me.
user_name:
Rhett P
Panama City Beach, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was at the Double Tree Hilton in April 2014. I took a room that was supposed to be special, but the only special thing was that it was on one of the last floors. Beside that the room was tiny, the bathroom really small, the wardrobe could host 10 shirts, that's all. I think the Hotel is ok, but the rooms are too small for the price I paid. Location is good, not too far from the metro and wall street.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location of this hotel was perfect and very convenient for working in lower Manhatten. The rooms were modern and clean. My only complaints were very slow elevator service during peak traffic times, and a lack of hot water one of the two mornings I was there.
user_name:
Peter T
New Orleans, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for two nights. Spent one hour all toghether to wait for the lifts. Impossible to get on time to meetings if you are using lifts.When we tried to contact the recepion to make a later checkout, they started to communicate with you and then said "wait a minute" and it last 10 minutes and nothing happenned. We tried again, with the same result.I went down, waited in an incredible line, and it was not possible to check out because it my fied was waiting fot the lift, bringing the plug adapter, so I had to go back from the line.Now i am writing this post while waiting. At least democracy exists.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: At those prices, we should have had a refrigerator in our room. The reason given for its absence? the children play with the cord. Small, just adequate room. No hot water the first morning because "the boiler went down during the night." No offer of any compensation for the "inconvenience." Our room was opposite the elevator and some people tend to forget that other guests may be sleeping at night. Yes, the warm chocolate chip cookies at night are very nice.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I had a nice stay here and found the hotel to be good. For business travel it is perfect. The rooms are somewhat small as were the hallways (to be expected in NYC) but the furniture and fixtures in the rooms were very nice. Elevators are very slow, but that is common in NYC hotels. If you need to stay in the Financial District I would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Someone else put me up here, but I thought it was pretty expensive (but it is NYC). For the price, I thought I'd at least get free wifi in my room (nope), or a larger selection of TV channels. The room was smallish, but very clean and attractive. Safe neighborhood. Close to subways and Financial District. Staff was helpful and friendly.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is in a great location south of the WTC with proximity to several subway lines. The building is old with the usual issues, the most aggravating being the elevators. There are not enough, and there is no service elevator, which means that it's even slower with cleaning and maintenance people in and out on every floor on every trip. The restaurant bar on the ground floor is pleasant and the staff is nice there and throughout the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Can't beat the location for tourist activities in lower Manhattan...Statue of Liberty, 9/11 memorial, wall street, Brooklyn Bridge.Nice exercise gym and friendly staff.As may be common in NYC...rooms were tight and hotel was hamstrung with over burdened elevators (wait-times were extensive for guests and staff)...

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: So the cookie made my day after arriving after a 7 hour flight.However, the hotel was also good. Standard Hilton so everything was good quality. The location is what it is... i.e. fabulous for exploring the south of Manhattan. The tube links are really good so we saw the whole city easily.No free wifi but there are computers in the lobby for looking up restaurants etc.Lifts were a minor issue - the building is very tall and thin so always takes ages for them to stop. Especially in the mornings when everyone is getting up and heading out.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: In checking in, my friend and I each gave our names for our separate rooms. The agent charged one of our credit cards for both rooms, and listed both rooms under name. When I caught the mistake on the in-room receipt, I alerted the agent at the front desk to the error and requested he fix it. He changed the name on my receipt, but misspelled my name and the charge remained on my friends credit card. Not good.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I recently stayed at this hotel and the service was absolutely horrific! To start off, as soon as I walked in the lobby to check in, DAMIAN looked over at his co-workers multiple times (who were having a conversation) impying that they should help me. As he kept looking over, without even greeting me, he realized that he had no other choice but to help me since his collegues were occupied. He was very stand offish and rude in his english accent as he was forced to help me. If you want rude service and want someone to hang up on you - just call for room service. I was in absolute shock by the way we were treated when we called to order dessert. This lazy slob refused to help us and stated that if he were to bring us up our cookes, he would have to charge us $8.00 per cookie - what???!!! All in all, he said it because he didn't want to be bothered. The only positive is when we called the front desk, I think her name was Amy, she called us and apologized on behalf of her incompetent colleagues and arranged to have someone bring us up our milk and cookies. NEVER again will I stay at this hotel, the previous month I stayed at the hilton millenium hotel and the service was extraordinary. Lesson learned, I will NEVER book my room at the last minute ever again!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Near metro station,Battery Park for viziting Liberty Statue,Staten Island,9/11 Memorial,Wall Street.Medium conditions,not exactly Hilton. Very dirt and in bad condition courtain, the receptionist who was in duty in the morning of 31Aug very indifferent and cold,without any desire to help.Free wifi only in loby,paid in the rooms.
user_name:
Petroland
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here because of the wedding we were attending was walking distance. The location is great and the Staff was very courteous (the fresh baked cookies on arrival also helped). However, the rooms were tiny (although the view from our window was really nice) and the room never got cleaned. We had to call to get the room cleaned and when they did, they forgot to leave is toiletries. We ordered breakfast for room service and my juice was obviously expired and the rest of the food was not very tasty. Our sink broke and they didn't fix it entirely so we had a wet spot of carpet outside of our room that made the whole room smell like sewage/mold. We had a wonderful weekend in the city walking distance to lots of fun places; but I wouldn't stay in this hotel again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Neat and tidy hotel with compact rooms as is everywhere in manhattan. There are only 3 lifts which service 44 floors. This can get irritating especially during busier times and can take up to 10 minutes for a lift to arrive.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I normally don't leave reviews because this is time consuming and offers me no benefit. This place is just infuriating, I've stayed several times~10x with work (office across the street) and noted nothing but problems and poor customer service.I don't pay for these stays so its not about the $ - though I've got it on Hotwire for $244/night + taxes and our corporate rate is $259/night + taxes. Off peak its a $120/night hotel (you CAN get that in NY off peak)I do not consider this close to a 3 star hotel, though they call it 4 star - amenities are tight and 3 star like. Laundry service and other inquires are slow.A summary of my stays:1) 3405 had a cockroach - I mentioned it to management at checkin (next time) but didnt want to hold up the line - management never got back to me on this (good management should have called). I look like a business traveler, not some of their sketchier clients/tourists - and again I don't pay for this.2) There is a line at check in every time - its actually 2 lines. Here is how 3 elevators are at the street level and serve 44 floors - you wait a while (normally with smokey smelling eu travelers).Once you wait the line at ground floor you wait on floor 2 behind several people as only 2 people are ever present (normally new at their job too) to check you in. (to expedite things I suggest everyone have - ID and a credit card ready to hand to them at check in - this is also not the place for tourist questions. 3 elevators for 44 floors is unlikely to be upto NYC building code but was grandfathered in in this "historic" building - its not historic looking. 3) You are in the financial district which is rather dead (evenings)- from now on I rather stay up in midtown and take a 30min subway ride in every morning - this place is that annoying.4) This evening, I have a cold and asked for some water at the front desk which they hand to you at check in- presumably because 1) their water from the tap is bad or 2) they know you are upset about your wait. This time though wasn't checking in - but asked for one - they pointed me to their pantry. I was surprised because other times they just hand me the $0.25 bottles of water. Again not the $ thing, I'll just expense it. Explained to them I was not satisfied pointed to their satisfaction sign started to discuss other issues - went to elevator (preparing for my wait) by then they said i should just take some water....It was too late the elevator door was closed.5) On the elevators - look you will wait up to 5mins to get up or down sometimes both - though quite ill I walked 7 floors up the other day (trying a lower floor for the walking optionallity) its quite insane.6) Car service to Newark airport - last time I left for the airport I decided not to wait for a taxi (which is a long time at this hotel its not like the rest of NY). i asked for the price, $85 including taxes and tip. Asked again to confirm. Got to airport driver asked for a tip - told him I was told $85 was all in...he said it wasn't what a situation to be put in (again not about $ ...its expensed) just utterly annoying.My solution stay away from this one! I am staying around mid town and training it in from now on!While the occasional employee will go out of their way for you, ideally you avoid interactions because they are new to their job/unhelpful or there is a wait for their unhelpfulness.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I loved this hotel from the three gentlemen ( three!) who showed up to help me connect to wifi, to the room service that never took more than 15 minutes, to the bellman who walked me all the way to water street so I could get a cab at rush hour. Fantastic all around!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is a bit on the expensive side for the size of the rooms, I have stayed mid-town in bigger rooms for less. The location is convenient to the financial district and lower Manhattan with good access to the subway.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Rooms were quite nice for the price, staff friendly and helpful (under the circumstances) and good location for anything in the Battery or access to Ground Zero, plus a nice warm chocolate chip cookie upon registering, but we encountered one problem after another. First, one of the elevators went out of commission, leaving only two to service a busy weekend with wedding parties and busloads of tourists converging at once. Then a second went out on Sunday, leaving only one, which the hotel put on manual mode while posting signs on each floor asking us to phone the front desk to get it to stop at our floor (#29—a bit high to take the stairs with luggage). And the saga continues: After waiting a half hour for the elevator, I get to the desk and get a bill that includes $55 for valet parking upon arrival, a service we did not use. I produced my parking garage receipt and was told the charge would be taken off. It wasn't. I found it on my credit card bill the next day. Chase, responsive as always, took it off right away while the charge was contested, but Doubletree/Hilton took a week to do so with absurd back-and-forth emails before it disappeared.Two days later a new valet parking charge appeared for our departure! More emails before they discovered that the charge belonged on my wife's brother's bill (same last names). Really. Is my time worth anything?Apparently not. We got another email last last—two weeks into this—saying sorry it happened but glad it's resolved. No comp for anything, no incentive to ever come back. Stuff happens. I get that. But one question: is Hilton investing enough in maintenance to keep this operation up and running? And another, more important one: Are they investing enough in customer service to keep us coming back, despite such headaches? I think not.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: By "hidden," I mean that my driver had a hard time finding it! It's on Stone St, which is a smaller, quiet street and the frontage isn't screaming "DoubleTree Hotel!"However, I found the service to be efficient. The rooms are clean, new, and up to the DoubleTree/Hilton standard. Absolutely no complaints. The rooms are a bit on the small side, but this is Manhattan. The location is great for visiting lower Manhattan sites. A few minutes' walk to everything. I'd definitely stay here again on a future trip.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have some misgivings here. The lobby/reception is on the second floor, your entry is at street level on Stone Street. My problem was with the elevators. The building is 44 stories with 3 elevators. And that's not sufficient. When I stayed there, one of the elevators was out of service so the staff operated the elevators manually. I had to call the front desk to make a reservation to ride down. Took some 15 minutes. Some younger people walked the stairs down. But few, except those on lower floors, walked up. Moreover, ice machines are not on every floor. So this, too, is a problem whether or not you use the elevator. If the in-room Wi-Fi doesn't work well, try the lobby. there are also some stand alone desktops but they are generally hogged by families.I did have an in-room coffee maker and received a cookie at check-in. there's a sundry shop by the lobby desk. Since the lobby is on the second floor, I didn't return for any additional cookies or snacks. The neighborhood is wonderful for tourists. You walk easily to the Battery, South Street Seaport (which is still being reconstructed), Wall Street and the Trade Center site, and the Liberty Statue and Staten Island ferries. Fraunce's Tavern, with G. Washington memorabilia, is down the block but doesn't open 'til noon if you want to wait around. Bowling Green is the closest subway stop but several others are just a short walk away. As are the buses which terminate and begin at the Battery. Some nice pubs and eateries are on the surrounding streets with al fresco dining in nice weather. But you really don't need to stay in this hotel to do all those things. So it's basically for business people who get reimbursed. Or Europeans where the euro, pound, or Swiss franc is valued more than the dollar.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We were in room 4409 for a weekend visit. The room was spacious and clean and the rooms were quiet so sleeping was easy. Getting a high floor away from the city streets helped. Also the financial district is pretty calm on the weekends but still close to everything and lots to do and eat! This hotel was a nice stay and a great price for NYC!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Everyone at the hotel did a great job, the security guy Sam at the door was the best, he gave great advice for local eating and help save a few bucks parking for the weekend. Having him meet guests is the best thing the hotel ever did. We had a very pleasant stay with no problems and a very helpful staff. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying on the southern end of Manhattan.
user_name:
Jack G
Orange Park, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed 3 nites, I booked a suite which indicated that it had 2 rooms. It does not, so the mgr gave us 2 adjoining rooms, same price, great location close to subways, hiways, etc. We were in town for the US Open (our 2nd time at this hotel as well)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here to be closer to city hall but after cabs to midtown should have stayed in time square. The room was ok. The breakfast was ok but service lacking and not very friendly. Our room wasn't cleaned each day till almost 5 on and I don't think it was dusted at all. I think they need more help.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Service was not as prompt and accurate as we would have liked. The elevators were slow and even broken down during our 3-night stay. Our room was missed during normal housekeeping hours and was cleaned halfheartedly by an overworked housekeeper after I called upon return in the evening. I was also overcharged by a day for valet parking and had to wait several minutes for curbside help upon arrival back to the hotel with my car. These inconveniences were not terrible, but not quite up to par either. Considering the great rate I received via my daughter's college, though; I can't complain too much. The room was very clean and comfortable and the staff were all quite friendly and helpful!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is conveniently located in the centre of the financial district, just a few minutes walk from the subway. There is a nice area with many restaurants nearby. Did not try the hotel restaurant or the breakfast. I usually don't care about the room size, but the bathroom in my room was really, really small. There was no space for any toiletry next to the sink, and when the shower door was open, it was impossible to open or close the bathroom door. All the elevators were functional, but during the peak hours it still took a while to get up or down. The staff were friendly and helpful. Noise was not a problem (my room was on the 8th floor facing the street).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I would never stay at this hotel again. It was extremely expensive, and there was only 1 working elevator for a 42 floor hotel. Parking was 55 dollars a day, and this was never communicated to me. the door to the bathroom was a sliding door on a track and it got stuck The staff was fine, and I know they didn't have the power to fix any of the problems.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The room was on the small side for the price, but it was clean. The bathroom was even smaller and the shower door leaked . The staff was friendly and helpful. However I was a bit supprised to find the the standard Hilton breakfast cost me $40.00 for just the two of us! I would expect the breakfast to be complimentery or at most cost $5.00.
user_name:
Steven C
Charlotte Hall, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel particularly the 19th floor carpet needs some sprucing up. Elevator problems. Rooms are small and a little dark. In room refrigerator is essential. I remember the breakfast dining room being slow and overpriced. We ate at a good place nearby. Hotel personnel were good and location was great.
user_name:
John H
Alexandria VA, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel staff was some of he nicest I have ever encoutered. Every single employee I came across during my 5 day stay was pleasent, polite, and helpful! Great location in lower Manhatten and the room (small but not by NYC standards) was clean comfortable, and quiet. The HVAC system was loud and that is the only reason I did not give the hotel a top rating -- The weekend rate was only 199 -- very happy with this choice.
user_name:
janetetleyscott
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Enjoyed a weekend stay at the Doubletree. Financial district location is much quieter than Midtown but access is excellent with subway at the corner. Walking distance to many attractions. We were upgraded to a room on the top floor that had a spectacular view from the Hudson to World Trade site and all the way to the Empire State Building.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here with my husband December 26-29, 2013, our first time to New York. Great location, walking distance to several subway (metro) stops, right around the corner from the Wall Street Bull and Staten Island Ferry. Duane Read right downstairs on the corner, and quite a few restaurants and pubs a few minutes walk. We went to 'The Dead Rabbit', which is apparently one of the oldest bars in NYC, and George Washington himself enjoyed a pint or two there.Able to get to Madison Square Gardens, Time Square, Brooklyn Bridge, China Town, Little Italy and more within 20 minutes on the train. Staff were very friendly, the doormen gave recommendations of places in the area. Room was tiny but clean. Our first morning there was no hot water, but they were already working on it when we called the front desk, and it was resolved within half an hour. Would definitely recommend this hotel to people who don't mind being a bit away from all the 'hot spots' and tourist attractions - part of the fun for us was exploring NYC by walking and taking transit!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Like the title says, this Double Tree has a great location, friendly staff, and clean rooms. Staff provided warm cookies upon arrival, which was a nice treat. While my room was clean on the exterior we found somebody's old shirts in one of the dresser drawers and the safe was not functional. These were minor inconveniences and the staff made up for it with their friendly attitudes. I would definitely recommend this location if you're looking for reasonably priced, clean lodging in the heart of NYC's financial district. Oh, and the elevators are a pain to deal with as mentioned in nearly every review.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Convient location, very small rooms, elevators a slow ans smelly at times, check in on 2nd floor and long wait for the elevator, you may need to carry your luggage up the stairs, so be prepared. Staff is courteous and qucik to handle your check in process, location is in the heart of the city and convenient for business visits. Lot of options for food within walking distance.
user_name:
Ashish R
Elk Grove, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great value, comfortable, modern and very clean accommodations. Close to 911 Memorial Museum and Wall Street, Stock Exchange, Battery Park, Staten Island Ferry (free ride by the way) to see downtown NY from the water.
user_name:
Rosemarie W
New City, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Positives: Great location for lower Manhattan and Brooklyn activities, excellent buffet breakfast. Negatives: Painfully slow elevators, understaffed housekeeping department (twice, when returning to our rooms after 6pm, housekeeping had not yet serviced our floor). Understaffed front desk. However, management was very interested in making things right, and as compensation for the housekeeping failures, proffered a dining credit in the hotel restaurant.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: A 400+ room hotel on 44 floors has three smallish elevators. On two consecutive stays in two weeks, one of the 3 elevators was out-of-service. Even when all 3 are working, I have waited up to 20 minutes to leave in the morning or return in the evening. There may be little they can do now, but Hilton traded revenue (more rooms) for customer convenience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel was very good if you are a business person doing something in downtown NYC. It had a nice shower, comfortable king-size bed, a nice desk to do work on and everything in the room worked fine.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Have stayed here multiple times now with my wife. Here are the pros:--price, have paid well below $200 a night both times for weekend stays--location, downtown, not very crowded, easy access to major subway lines--clean, extremely clean on all visitsHere are the cons:--can be hard to find, small side street, no signage visible from ends of street--noise, you are staying in a major city, if street noise annoys you, why are you there? ice machine in hallway can be loud, air conditioner also seems to run loud. --elevators, the other reviews are true, the elevators here can be horrible. They are slow. In fact, they were broken this morning and people had to call front desk for an elevator so an employee can manually run it up to your floor. I rate this hotel very good because for me, location, price and cleanliness are most important. Noise doesn't bother us and while the elevators are annoying, the other factors are too good for us. If you are someone who wants absolute peace and quiet, a beautiful view and super-fast elevators, don't come here. If you are a little flexible and can roll with the punches, you will get a good deal on a well-located, clean hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is on a small quiet street, we stayed for two nights (fri-sat). The entrance is not obvious, walk past luggage area and then you have to immediately take elevator up to the lobby level. There is outdoor dining area that was always our land mark since the signs are hard to see when you are right there. We ran into quite delay checking in about 6 pm. I had booked directly with Doubletree and they said the room was not ready. We waited about 15 - 20 minutes, then they finished check in. The rate was to include night time water taxi however this caused great confusion. As we were now late for dinner, we agreed to have manager call us. Which he did, however it was not fully resolved until I went back down the next day. All was corrected with a credit because the water taxi was sold out. Just a bit of hassle with this booked on their corp site and they did not know about it. The room was 2 double beds, only on 19 facing other buildings. All fine, smaller but this is NYC and it was clean. Walk in shower which we liked and very modern sink/vanity. Ice / vending up one floor. Small closet and very little/no room for any large suitcase. We had backpack and small suitcase. AC unit was a bit noisy. Elevator was slow as mentioned by others here. Probably smallest hallways I have seen in NYC, but we weren't paying for those! Location was great - be sure to walk out and see the Fraunces Tavern, Dubliner and those area streets as they look like movie set from the early 1900's when that was Manhattan! Lots taverns in the area, walk easy to Battery Park and see Statue of Liberty. Easy walk over to WTC and also Wall Street. The streets are not laid out in a grid so be prepared to be a bit lost but it is generally safe and lots of people now live in the area due to all residential conversions. No more than 5 min walk to subway for 2 or 3 main lines. About 25 min subway ride up to Penn Station. R Subway line is nearby also.Would stay again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Please note that I did not say Hotel from hell. I have stayed at this hotel before and it was ok. This time however was a disaster. First night we discovered dirty linen and from there it went down hill. For 5 days it was one thing after another. Ac not working, mosquitoes a plenty, bathroom door handle off, toilet roll handle off. The straw that broke the camels back was when some of our items went missing. I love Doubletree hotels but never this one again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed for overnight after a Broadway show. We arrived late and left early. Truly didn't have much expectation after reading some of the reviews. Since we were on the eighth floor, we walked the stairs to avoid extra waiting time for the elevator. However, the bed was surprisingly comfortable; room has more space than the other hotel I stayed before. Location was quieter; parking was convenient. Will stay here again if I visit New York city again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was my first time trying Priceline.com and The Doubletree, 8 Stone Street, NY. I was a little nervous about both, that is, until check-in. My husband and I were greeted with a smile and a warm welcome. Check-in was extremely easy. We were told, "My name is Wanda; enjoy your stay. Let me know, if there is anything else you need." To top it off, we were handed two warm and yummy chocolate chip cookies. When we got to our room, it was nicer than expected, especially for the price. There was one problem...I looked out the window. I am afraid of heights, but asked for "the lowest floor with a view" trying to be brave. Wanda met my request, but I just couldn't stay that high. I was so embarrassed, but called and asked for Wanda and explained my issue. She and her supervisor took care of everything! They did so with understanding and kindness. Everyone we have encountered at this hotel from the front desk staff to the doormen, and even the maintenance men were very friendly. My husband and I will definitely stay here again and we will recommend this hotel to our friends.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed on a family visit to family that lives in the Financial District area. The hotel is very close to a lot of things including the World Trade Center area, the Pearl Street restaurant and nightlife scene, the Statue of Liberty, the Battery Park area, Brooklyn Bridge, etc.It's a 44 story building on a fairly quiet block (for manhattan) with about 10 rooms per floor, and 3 elevators. The elevators are fast, but the guests aren't, stopping up elevators to ride down, etc. We were on the 44th floor, but in no rush, but that said, we never waited longer than 4-5 minutes.Rooms were nice, but "cozy", very clean, quiet and very comfortable. Hey, it's Manhattan. Want opulence, the Ritz is within a few block for 3 times the price.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: All was well. Great location. Clean and modern rooms. Helpful employees. Delicious chocolate chip cookies. However, the elevator situation is terrible. We waited 14 minutes for an elevator Saturday night.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a decent, clean and relatively updated hotel that was perfect for a weekend getaway focusing on downtown attractions such as Battery Park City. I got a $99 deal for a Sunday, I was able to park for free til 7 the next am when I needed to leave, or pay for parking til I was ready to leave. The service was good, the room was normal sized for New York City. The linens were crisp and clean, an the king bed comfy. The shower with glass enclosure was nice, and the toiletries good quality. Nice to have the coffee maker as well.I would consider this an avg business hotel, but perfect for me for a weekend when I wanted to be near the water. The train stop "Whitehall St" on the "R" yellow line, is steps to the front door of the hotel. Goes right up to SoHo and other areas of interest. I did walk to TriBeCa at night in about 20 min, felt very safe. Took the train back. The restaurant at the hotel was decent. I got the Pasta Fagioli which was nice, and the service was above average. Overall it was a great little place to hang my hat for 2 days of biking downtown.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Positives: Good location, great breakfast served in hotel restaurant, beautiful views from upper floor rooms, friendly staff. Negatives: elevators painfully slow, understaffed housekeeping (at 6pm room still not made up two nights in a row, but Mgr Cinthia compensated with gift cert to hotel restaurant -- classy touch. But rate was low at $189, so it was an overall good value.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: First and foremost, I really enjoyed my stay at the Doubletree. This was my second visit to this hotel. I learned some good pointers from my first visit. Lobby is on second floor. As on my first trip, Doubletree staff were very friendly, attentive, and provided excellent service, they gave more than I expected! Rooms however are smaller, children maybe a challenge. Business traveler its fine. The hotel restaurant is great, even met the owner, had a drink and shared stories, you cant beat that kind of friendliness in NYC. I strongly suggest DO NOT BRING A CAR, I learned from my first visit, everything is within a very short walking distance, Wall Street, New Freedom Center (World Trade Center) Battery Park, many cafes and very good restaurants are everywhere and very short walks. Seeing NYC by foot and cab is the best. Not worth bringing a car to fight traffic, bad driving, tolls and high parking rates. Taxis are the best. A NYC state of mind see it by foot. I saw more, took better pictures, ate better food and really enjoyed it!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: A great hotel with a very good location, the hotel is very close to graound zero and wall street and a few minuites walk from the subway which will take you direct to main attractions. The rooms were very spacious and clean compared to alot of hotels in NYC.The only negatives were the service, when myself and 2 collegues arrived we were suprised to find that they only ahd 2 rooms booked although we had confimation for 3. They tried to charge us the top price for a room which we refused and in the end they charged us orginal price. As a gold hilton member I was offered nothing extra and no points for thej room booked on day.APrt from this a great hotel for a nice city break.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
