review_body: (Traveling as an employee of Hilton company with a discount) - I know space is limited in NYC but these rooms were ridiculously small. You could hear every little noise from the room next door and the hallway .Additionally the curtains were torn on the bottom and the dresser was "banged up". Also, their website was not accurate since it had advertised a restaurant on premise that was no longer there.(it has since been updated). When I wrote to Hilton regarding these issues, their response was ..."Talk to your hotel manager." Hilton standards are supposed to be so high. The hotel I work at in Tinton Falls, NJ would NEVER have these issues. Very disappointed.
user_name:
Maryanne C
Point Pleasant Beach, New Jersey

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great staff, restaurant excellent, and very conveniently located to all things on lower Broadway and World Trade Center. Restaurant staff are very friendly. Like visiting old friends. Great Italian food and wine.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel is clean and the staff friendly and efficient. My hotel room smelled kind of funny and there was construction happening outside my window. Once I bought some ear plugs I was able to sleep at night. The elevators are very busy and slow so give yourself an extra 5 minutes or you can take the stairs, which I did.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great hotel. Very friendly staff. Stayed for 1 week. 2 areas for improvement - staff who did rooms did not do very good job of taking stock or lack of stock - had to call for toilet paper twice as it was not restocked. Next - shower - hot water. It took really long for hot water to come on in shower. Don't know if this has anything to do with height of hotel and if hot water has to travel far. We were on 2rd floor of 44 floor hotel. So I found it wasteful to leave water running to get it to hot. Otherwise excellent stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Under a tight budget, I found the Double Tree had nice rooms for the price. The service was excellent. My recommendation is to stay on a high floor so you don't hear the traffic. Make sure you also ask for coupons for the breakfast buffet.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff at the Double Tree - Financial District were always pleasant and very accommodating.Yes, the elevators were sometimes slow but in fabulous NYC where everything seems rushed, you must remember you are on vacation so allow a little time to breathe while waiting for the elevator. Location for meeting the tour bus @ South Seaport stop was perfect and to our pleasant surprise there is a Tics on the Square not far from there! Loved my stay, thank you, HDT-FD staff. C:)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We booked this hotel on Hotwire and were a little concerned just having looked at some of the reviews and gloomy photos. We had low expectations, but when we arrived, we were immediately blown away. We were greeted by two bell-boys, with a big smile and a "Welcome!" then escorted to the elevator, told which way to go to the lobby, and shown little tricks for navigating along the way. When we arrived at the lobby, we were greeted by a really friendly, happy person, who checked us in quickly and of course (let's not kid ourselves -- this is the best part) we were given two warm, soft, chocolatey, walnut-y Doubletree cookies. The lobby itself is beautiful - modern, elegant, with a lounge style layout and feel. There is free Wifi in the lobby, if you need to look at funny pictures of cats on your phone before bed like I do. The in-room Wifi comes at a cost but is reasonably priced. The elevator runs on what I think is voodoo because it goes very very fast but doesn't feel like it at all. Our room itself was just the right size for the price - not too small, but just cozy enough. Everything looked new, clean, well -designed, and welcoming. The bed was basically the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on, a wonderful King sized pillow-top mattress which meant my boyfriend could practice his overnight karate all he wanted without me even realizing he was sleeping beside me. The bathroom was chic and modern, and even the soap was a pleasant tangy lemon flavor. Wait a second, I forgot about another amazing part.....the TV had all the best channels so that when we came back to our room every night, exhausted from exploring the city, there was always something exciting on. I've been to hundreds of hotels, and I can be hard to impress, but this hotel really left a great impression on me. As we were heading out one day, a bell-boy came up to us and said "A tip: get on the first five metro cars when you're taking the train back. That way you can ensure you get out at the right spot!" ....come on! Who volunteers help like that? This Doubletree was just splendid. However, I have to be fair, and mention two things that I would improve on if I were them: the first is that the air conditioner was extremely loud and woke us up every time it powered on in the middle of the night. It did work great though, but we couldn't even watch TV with it on. It was quite loud. The other thing is that the bathroom door was a sliding door that was suspended from the ceiling and wasn't actually closing the bathroom shut. That means you could hear everything that was going on inside. We took turns going to the washrooms on different floors for those...trickier situations. But aside from that, the hotel was amazing and is now our favorite hotel in NYC. Great location, great staff, great service, great layout, great cookies....you just can't go wrong. We will be recommending this hotel to everyone heading to NYC!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The restaurant on the ground floor is Outstanding, excellent service, delicious food. As far as the hotel goes....the rooms are okay, the elevators (only 3) for 44 floors are always breaking down and the rugs on each floor outside of the rooms are disgusting. Today I noticed that the elevator walls were full of dust. Hotel staff are great but the hotel needs some serious work on the elevators, carpets and general cleaning.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed at this hotel only because we were going to wedding and all out of town guest stayed there.When we arrived at hotel we had to wait 10 minutes just for the elevator to take us up to the lobby to check in. The room was very small and the shower was full of rust or mold. The carpeting in the hallway was in poor condition. All weekend we had to wait an unacceptable amount of time for the elevators. Breakfast buffet was mediocre. I would never stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have stayed several times in this hotel when I travel to NY for work but now actively look for alternative hotels that are part of my work travel policy rather than stay here. While the rooms themselves are ok, there are several things that make this hotel a very poor choice.- the reception check in is one of the worst I have experienced. I am a Hilton honours member and have stayed at this hotel for over a month this year so far, and this all accounts for nothing upon check in. The staff are typically rude and do not operate a fast track service for Hilton honours members. The last time I stayed there, while they were serving me several phone calls came in which the reception staff member immediately answered and responded to, while I was waiting (I checked in at about 1 am due to plane delays and was desperate to get to bed, so was not impressed with the constant phone interruptions). All the staff member said was that housekeeping was not there so she was answering the phones for them. On the plus side however they do provide warm cookies upon check in and a couple of bottles of water - although they forgot to tell one customer who was checking in when I was there that the cookies contained nuts, only for her to to find out after one bite that it did. Turned out she was allergic to them. Not good.- the last time I stayed there, the wifi connection in my room didn't work. Due to flight delays I ended up checking in at about 1am and only realised this after I had unpacked my bags. I called up reception and they told me that I had to change rooms immediately or I couldn't be guaranteed wifi or another room the next day as other people would be arriving. In other hotels on the rare occasion when I have had to change rooms, the hotel staff have been apologetic and changed my rooms for me such that when I next went out and subsequently returned, all my belongings had been transferred and the new room was ready and waiting for me. The staff at the doubletree insisted that I pack up my belongings at 2am and wait for their security staff to take me to the new room and let me in. I packed and lugged my bag to the new room on a different floor and then sat in the corridor waiting for them to arrive for 20 mins, before calling reception again and finally getting someone to let me into my new room. When I went into the new room, the safe was broken and they had to spend another 20 mins fixing it. By this time it was 3am and I had only a few hours before I needed to get up for work. I was not impressed!!!- a colleague of mine stayed in the hotel with me previously and had an expensive Michael Kors bag that she had just bought stolen from her room. The staff gave her the run around when she tried to report it, sending her to concierge, security, reception, house keeping etc. no one apologised or told her what to do about it. Finally after escalating it, they agreed to pay her the price of the bag if she showed her receipt. This happened about 8 weeks ago and she is still waiting for the cheque to arrive despite contacting them several times. Seems they "forgot to post the cheque".- there are only 3 lifts that are very slow. In peak hours a 20 minute wait for a lift is not uncommon this is particularly bad in the morning when everyone is leaving. On one occasion when I was there 1 of the lifts was broken for the whole week, which made the queues for the lifts and the wait even longer.- the hotel air conditioning is particularly loud which makes it hard to sleep.- breakfast is one of the worst offerings at a hotel that I have been to and is expensive for what it is. The selection is small and the service isn't great.On the plus side, the rooms are a reasonably size, the beds are comfortable and it's in a good location to Wall Street where I work. It also has a well equipped gym with good equipment which is open 24 hours, which I particularly liked.These pluses do not overcome the issues noted above however - particularly the theft (which I note in other feedback here is not an isolated incident), the poor service and the ridiculously slow lifts.I now look for other hotels when I travel to the NY office for work and would not recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is my second time travelling here for business in the last month. Last time it was o.k., but not great. This time my phone did not work, hence no wake up call. I told the front desk and they said they would fix it that day. Got back from work, still broken. Three visits from the handyman that night finally did the trick.Also you can request a fridge, which I did for this trip (and also my prior trip) but both times I never got one.The bed is very nice, and the staff is very friendly.
user_name:
Rick C
Saratoga Springs, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My wife and I experienced poor service during our stay at your hotel (8/1 to 8/3). Our room was on hour late and we had to wait for our luggage. The next day we were kept out of our room due to late maid service. We did not feel comfortable expressing our concerns at the time because the staff seemed to be overwhelmed.
user_name:
Fred O
Sugar Hill, Ga, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Friendly staff with good answers to area questions, near several subway stations and in the middle of the financial district. Room was clean, quiet and well appointed. No issues, everything worked the first time. Room was smaller as one expects in NYC. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is my 3rd time using this hotel, the staff is always friendly and the rooms are well kept. I signed up to be an HHonors member prior to booking and was given an upgrade on my room to the city view! I will be back.
user_name:
Patrick S
New York City, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: over 350 USD for old and crammed room, terrible breakfast (cost not included), ridiculous internet charge, there's better hotels ion the financial ditrict, wont be staying here again. Could not regulate AC/fan speed, it was so loud it prevented me from sleeping

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: For 200$ a night i think that hotel is fantastic. My room was not that big but I got I was looking for: A very nice bed, very clean room, clean bathroom with a great shower. Friendly staff, great location so I could not care less about the rest.If you want more, you will have to pay more.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The service at this hotel was excellent. There was always someone (usually 2 or more) at the entrance or front desk waiting to greet you , and ask if you needed any type of assistance. Someone actually, walked with me for a few blocks to find a specific restaurant.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was on business with 3 other couples and we all checked out early. Not only was there confusion with the reservations as to the check in- check out dates, everyone was passing the buck. Let me share with you the front desk scene. Some said it was Expedia's fault , although it wasn't booked through Expedia. Others said it was sold out so they had to charge for a no show. Finally the following day a night manager resolved the room charges, but, Hilton Honors means nothing, no breakfast, no water, no cookies and the place is filthy. The front desk people were lovely with no authority.
user_name:
Nancy K
palm coast, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was gone all day...left at 9:00 am returned at 5:00pm with new towels on the bed and old towels still on the floor of the bathroom, garbage cans not emptied and bed not made. Carpets in hallways look dirty. It isn't acceptable to have to wait over 15 minutes on a regular basis for an elevator. Unfortunately, I can't use stairs from the 39th floor. Have read response from management in other reviews saying he was sorry but obviously the problems still exist. Management doesn't need to respond with saying they are sorry...just take the time to manage and overhaul procedures and staff to provide better service. I have to stay for a meeting or I would find another hotel. I rather pay more and have the kind of service I expect.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good hotel great location for me as I was working in the financial district, room was a good size and all the amenities required.Nice touch with a warm cookie and water when I checked in. No complaints at all.Plenty of places close by for breakfast if not getting in the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: stayed here for a wedding. shower leaked, but never reported problem. room was very nice and comfortable, excellent hot water. inconvenient that lobby was on second floor and that there were only 3 elevators for 40+ floors. we always had to wait for elevator and they were very small for accomodating multiple guests and luggage. overall pretty nice though.
user_name:
Kelly L
Atlanta, Georgia, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I don't like this hotel but the group I work with have an agreement and I have to stay here. The rooms are very small, they are noisy, and the elevators are the worst in the city. I have had to wait 20 or more minutes to get down from the high floors. The wifi is terrible. I would never stay here if I had a choice. It is clean and well located--that I can give it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location ! Clean rooms.. Service was extremely poor. I tried to checkin early no rooms available, totally fine and understandable. Once my room ready I proceeded to checkin . There was a bit of issue with the reservation which was eventually fixed. I was extremely shock on how the front desk clerk handle it! She had a attitude the whole time as if she did not want to help me . After the issue was resolve she Threw my cookies on the desk and told me to have a nice day ! The only person that was nice was the bellman!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The Hotel was clean the people were friendly but employee stole my I pad out my room. I felt violated in every way. If you can't trust the people who work there who can you trust? The handling of my complaint is slow. Its been4 days I haven't heard from them. I am very disappointed with Doubletree and the way there handled this matter.
user_name:
Desiree T
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This property is only three (3) years old, and is VERY conveniently located to all you'd want to see and do in New York! I've booked this property for business and liked it so much I booked and/or stayed for personal time, as well.The staff at this Doubletree are exceptional--very friendly, helpful to answer any and all questions, knowledgable about the area, and best of all--sincere!The hotel's rooms are larger than any other hotel I've stay in at this price point in Manhattan; you actually can move around! The decor is simple, quality, usable and neutral. The beds are great and the showers all feature strong "rainshower" shower heads. The property has a fantastic restaurant that you'll actually want to eat at, and the Manager, Mike, is the best!This Doubletree is two blocks off the subway; you can hop on the train and easily get to anywhere you're trying to go in New York. There's even a CitiBike stall just outside the property's entrance. What I really like about being at this Doubletree in Lower Manhattan is that this part of the island is very historic and old. Many streets are still cobbled and the architecture is stunning. There's no feeling here of "gritty" New York--rather, the feeling that surrounds you is of historic, classy, formal, 'eras gone by' New York.You're also just steps from shopping and great food (and even though it's Lower Manhattan, more and more store and restaurants are staying open so there are great selections within blocks). You won't give up a thing by being down in this part of New York--as a matter of fact, I think you'll see all the benefits as soon as you check it out!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good location, nearby ferry to Liberty Island and three subway stations. Decent room but don't expect large size rooms for what you pay here. This is NYC- space is expensive. Staff serving breakfast was great. Thanks Mike for the banana on my way out for a run even though you weren't opened yet at the time!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was very nice. Obviously old but well-kept. The housekeeping was not as thorough as some places I have stayed (they skipped some cleaning altogether). What struck me the most is everyone I interacted with was extremely friendly. They made conversation and acted like I was the only guest there; that kind of service deserves amazing props.
user_name:
Ross L
New York, NY, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hall carpets on every floor are very dirty still showing winter grim! The room carpets are 80% black carpet and you know they're dirty also but you just can't see it! Very unhappy with the cleanliness...

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My stay at Doubletree on Stone street in New York was not very good. I found the room to be very small. Two double beds in the room I had was too much. The desk was not more than about 15 inches deep so there wasn't much room to do work. The carpet under the air conditioner was wet or damp most of the time making it difficult to look out the window without getting wet. The carpet in the hotel hallway was filthy dirty and disgusting. I realize I was in New York but the value of the room was poor given the size of the room and the cleanliness of the hotel. I will not stay at this hotel again.
user_name:
James C
Mattapoisett MA, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Have stayed here many times. This time, door key did not work properly, however I could not get the staff to address the problem. I even video recorded 40+ attempts to enter my room without attention. Not to mention being a HHonors member!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Room OK. Hall ways dirty. Remote missing from room and not rectified. Good location for tourism. In the hart of the financial district means that many restaurants in the area are closed in the week-end. Expensive but convenient parking opposite the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: May be a luxury hotel but i thnk is too expensive for a basic stay. We paid more than 100 euros per night but we had to pay for wi fi, and don't have breakfast. The furniture, bathroom and restroom is very good, but it was a door that was next to anther door that belonged to the next room, so we were listening all the other persons from the next room were doing, including the music at the morning. The cookie was the best cookie in my life, but i prefer have wi fi for free instead of a very good cookie... El hotel está muy bien, lujoso, pero es excesivamente caro para un viaje de normalidad. Pagamos más the 100 euros por noche y aun así debimos pagar por wi fi en la habitación y nuestra habitación tenía una puerta conectada con otra de la habitación de al lado a su vez, que hacía que oyésemos todo el ruido que hacía la gente de al lado, incluyendo la música por la mañana. La galleta fue la mejor de mi vida, pero yo prefiero tener wi fi gratis en la habitación a una buena galleta.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed for a business trip and it is the worse place ever. Light switches were dirty and black, mold in the showers, and toothpaste on the bathroom walls. We had to clean up behind housekeeping, whenever they emptied the trash they left part of it behind on the floor, we had 3 washcloths on day one, 0 on day two, and 1 on day 3, go figure. Our dishes from room service remained in the hall for almost a week. We were always picking up the strings they used to tie the sheets together when ever they made up our bed. The information books in the room said the front desk could help with directions for urgent care if the need arose, well it did, and you would've thought we were speaking french, they had no clue whatsoever. Thanks Hilton. UNDERCOVER Boss should definitely drop in.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I've been staying at Hilton brand properties my entire life, and never had an experience this bad. Staff was at best not accommodating, and occasionally downright rude. A/C was covered in dust (clearly hadn't been cleaned in months) and resulted in terrible allergies. I knew going in that the low price was due to the less ideal location, didn't realize I was also saving due to terrible service.
user_name:
Karl S
Baton Rouge, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Have stayed in NYC several times and this is a great value hotel downtown. Good location in the financial district close to several subway stops. Super friendly staff especially the staff downstairs at street level (front desk is on the 1st floor). Clean and comfortable rooms. Rooms are on the small side though for US standards, but that doesn't matter as you want to be enjoying the city!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed on July 23 to 26 for 3 night. Booked from web agent. Flight was delay and checked in midnight. Front desk assign my room with twin bed for 2 person. Room and bed are extremely small. I asked front desk to change room and she told me was sold out. She says she can change room tomorrow for guarantee and will noted to tomorrow's manger (I told them I will pay for upgrade). I trusted that word. Next day, front desk said never got information and room is sold out. This new front desk person told me she can change room tomorrow (same explanation from yesterday). I asked for written guarantee and finally she checked computer told me tomorrow is sold out again we can't change room. This hotel service are all lie and no hospitality. I will never staying at this hotel again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was the perfect hotel for meetings in the financial district, but I would also consider staying here for pleasure. It's not far from shopping and is a 10 min cab ride from Time Square or a 25 min train ride.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: From start to finish this was an amazing stay my husband and I were greeted by the bell person Abrahima he was very friendly and helpfull, checkin was smooth and quick special thanks to Justina, Cinthia and Kemisha who made us feel welcome right throughout our stay, this is a great location for seeing the sights in Ny city, such as 9/11 memorial the wall street bull etc great breakfast, VERY clean rooms, OHH the cookies WHAT A TREAT !! I could go on and on but I won"t lol most definately recommend this hotel.
user_name:
adanna f
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Not a bad location for Wall Street and access to The Statute of Liberty and Ellis Island as well as Federal Hall where George Washington was inaugurated as the first President of the United States. Also great open air restaurants close by on Stone Street.
user_name:
Craig W
Los Angeles, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Yes, the reviews are true - the elevators are slow, the front desk staff is less than enthusiastic to see you, and the views are really bad from lower floors. However, let me just say that the guys on the street were AMAZING! Upon our arrival they confirmed with me that the cab fare we were being charged was appropriate, and every time we needed directions, advice or even someone to complain to about the construction, they were there with expert (and accurate) information. I would definitely stay here again. The location can't be beat for lower Manhattan, and the attached restaurant is quite good (though service is pretty slow).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms are small but first it is NYC and hopefully your not there to stay in the room all day. Elevators took awhile but not a big deal. The only down fall was the shower took forever to drain but otherwise the stay was wonderful and definitely would stay there again. Awesome tavern right next door.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We were staying down in the Financial District because of a wedding that was a few blocks away. The hotel is very affordable, the rooms are clean, the parking across the street was nice, and the staff is generally friendly.All that said, the elevator situation is an absolute joke. It's a 44 story building with 3 half elevators. That means during busy times (see Sunday morning at 9am) I had to wait for 5 elevators to pass before there was one large enough for my wife and I (a combined 275lbs) to fit into. There were multiple instances of having to wait 7-9 minutes before a single elevator stopped at our floor. Adding to this issue is the fact that there does not appear to be a service elevator. That means all hotel employees must use these same 3 tiny elevators. I'm sorry, but it is not acceptable to have to wait that long just to get off your floor.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If you need a place to stay that's a decent price and near the office then its not a bad choice. The rooms are small but have everything you need. I haven't tried the food so I can't speak on the service or quality
user_name:
Alexander A
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel twice in the past year. Both times I felt that the overall value and location of the hotel are good. However, the quality of the food is lacking and the elevators are very slow. I will likely stay here again given its location, but it does not live up to what I have come to expect as someone who frequently stays at Hilton brand hotels.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is very conveniently located in the heart of the Financial District, great access to views of Statue of Liberty and still provided VERY easy subway access to Uptown/T-Sq. Good amenities with exercise facitlies... all in it was a great hotel, great value.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was pleasantly surprised with the Doubltetree Hilton when I stayed in June. It's close to my office and other amenities in the Wall Street area which is very handy. The rooms are standard size for this part of town, but are clean and you're quite well insulated from the street noise, and of course the higher up the better! The service was very good, the gym was well equipped, and I dined at the restaurant one night and had a very nice meal. So, I would stay here again. The only pain (which is quite minor) is that the reception area isn't on the ground floor, instead you have to get the lift for which there's sometimes an extended waiting period required.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: All was well at check-in: lovely free cookie. Room was small but tidy and nice. Good location- very close to subway and walking distance to statue of liberty cruises However, on the last day- came back to the hotel and wanted to take a shower before checking out at 3AM to catch a plane the next day but there was NO hot water. Rang reception who said will be fixed in 1 hour. 7 hours later- still no hot water. Ended up taking a cold shower and the staff were not particularly apologetic about it. Another issue was I booked a taxi the night before through reception to the airport. At 3AM, turned out my name was not in their taxi book where they order taxis. Luckily there was another taxi there for another room but they didn't arrive so we got on that taxi first. Not exactly the service I expect for their price.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I'd like to compliment one of the Bell staff members- Toni. Milliong thanks to Toni -for his help- during our arrival, during the rain on July 4th, and during our departure. We had wonderful three day stay. Will be definitely coming back to New York and staying at DT.
user_name:
Stefana D
Washington DC, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My only complaint about our stay last month was the elevator issue. We also had to wait up to 10 minutes a number of times and being on the 24th floor, stairs were not an option. On the other hand, the bell staff were very pleasant and greeted each of us upon entering and exiting the property. We ate breakfast in the restaurant each day and enjoyed the manager's personal attention and his helpfulness.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a great value for the location, especially for the weekend. My only complaint is that there are only 3 elevators, and you have to wait to get on one to check in (or take the stairs, since it's on the second floor).
user_name:
Steve F
Staten Island, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Many people complain about water temperature or slow elevators, but in my week there, I never had any problems. The water was always how I needed it, and I never waited more than a minute or so for an elevator. That may be because I got up a bit later and came back at night, I can well imagine it being more crowded early in the morning or in the after-business evening hours. Therefore, I would recommend this hotel for the leisure traveller who wants to go see the sights, and only for business travellers who need to be in the financial district, which is really close.Very friendly and helpful staff, clean room, space just fine, no reason to complain at all. Would go there again next time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Although we were there for a family trip the location was perfect for our stay, close to Battery Park, Subway, WTC, Wall Street and a drug store as well as a good bakery across the street. Of our 4 days in town we spent two of them there. Mostly King beds, beware if you are a family wanting multiple beds, they only have a few.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Issues with both rooms including no cleaning of the room. No towels and no shampoo. elevator also a disaster waiting forever to get one. No response after told I was getting a small fridge leading to spoiled food which was not removed. Breakfast also poor.
user_name:
Michael O
North Palm Beach, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My friends and I visited NYC in April and some of us, including myself, were in a pickle as we had no place to stay upon our arrival which was on a Thursday. I quickly jumped on Hotwire and was able to get a room for only $100 a night! We headed to the hotel which was a bit away from the tourist attractions but it wasn't a big deal considering the deal we landed. We checked in easily and asked for a double bed which wasn't available but we were upgraded to the Hilton honors floor, 40th floor with awesome views. The room is average per NYC standards. The shower did leak but I simply laid a towel on the floor and that resolved that issue. The room had no refrigerator but we called down and they sent one up! Bottom line, if there is something you want, ask for it! Also the elevators were a bit slow but not 20 minute wait like others are indicating more like 5-7 minutes.. The subway lines are a street away, you could get to Times Square within 15 minutes, although it took me much longer as I was learning the subway lines. Overall, a great place to stay if you do get a deal.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: rooms are very nice was last min booked and still a good price well worth it are room had a city view and faced the freedom tower, it was in walking distance drug store on corner was convenient and parking garage directly across was a good price also very satisfied andd they give you cookies when you check in

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Beds are comfortable, bathroom is very small. The 4 mornings we visited the dining room for breakfast the staff was not that helpful/friendly and flies around the tables and fresh fruit. At times we had to get p and call for the serves who, were in the front talking to each other.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a nice hotel overall and for New York, the value seems good. The rooms are small, but well appointed and clean. One day we were out all day and returned at about 5:30 to find we had no housekeeping of yet. Had to call desk twice before they finally came with clean towels. Said we would forego bed-making, etc., but they did it end up doing it after we left at about 6:30 PM. Dirty dishes sat outside a room close to the elevator for over 24 hrs. (this is hard to understand?) The staff were congenial and welcoming. The elevators were slow most of the time.
user_name:
Robert K
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: When I search the hotel to stay in NYC the price shocked me, then I use priceline.com . Lucky I get this doubletree deal , at rate USD 160 per night it definetely is a steal.Location is pretty good ( not really in central park or Fifth avenue area ) but all within reach by subway. The room is small though but I do not complain as it s in NYC :-) , room is clean n pretty good condition , if I can give the hotel input it will be the lift , waiting for the lift can be frustating Other than that this hotel is everything you can hope for to stay in NYC with low price

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: average hotel for big bucks ...No Pool ...decent restaurant small rooms ....the front desk staff was nice and the doorman greeted you but otherwise nothing special ...My work paid for the room so it was easier to swallow at 400 a night it should be awesome but was just a regular room

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We booked this off priceline (well that may have been our initial mistake). Upon arriving, they gave us single king bed because they were out of double beds. Then when my friend was half naked first night other guests entered our room. Upon calling the hotel front desk person Cynthia about the incident, first she denied that they had made any mistake. Then she blasted us that there had been a mistake in a threatening voice about sending security and told us we need to come down immediately because we were actually assigned to a different room and they had mistakenly given out keys to the room we already had keys to. We would need to move, she told us in quite a rude tone. We told her she needed to send security up and this was a serious breach of security. They did do this and the security was very nice. But all in all this is a serious breach of security and negligent on the hotel part. The consultation? 4 tickets to the breakfast buffet. Aside from this serious security breach, there is no pool here. We have not yet checked out the exercise room but was told it is very small. Luckily we we were on a rather low floor so did not have to put up with slow elevators (which seems to be a complaint on here).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel is near to R and 4 trains. That allowed me to take the bus/train from laguardia airport. Area is great for cheap street food during the week. On weekend less food vendors are in the area since offices are closed. I travel a lot on a budget so this was great. Nice walk to world trade memorial, south street seaport and very near to the charging bull sculpture. The rooms were clean and nice. The only problem is that the shower leaks so you need to put extra towels on the floor but staff was great with everything. Descent hotel for the price.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Pretty much this is an acceptable accommodation... However some annoying stuff...Rooms are small, however they are pretty updated and well appointed in the furnishingsBed, Sheets...clean and comfortable. 44 Floors, around 10 small rooms on each floor, very tight hallways and quarters. Noisy because I was near Elevators and House Keeping Closet. The Elevators have to be among the slowest in NYC, Waited five -ten minutes each time I used them. Did not eat at the hotel so cant help with that. Staff was courteous and friendly, but not exceptionally so... Would rate it a C+ or Solid B- . Would stay there again, but use it as a backup when better (more pricey) places are not vacant.This place is a good example of lower price means you should adjust your expectation.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Been staying here multiple weeks for a long-term project but am going to be switching - even if it means forgoing my Hilton Diamond status to stay at a Marriott. When this hotel was designed the architect clearly was in Lala Land. What other reason can you come up with for three really small elevators in a 44 story hotel? Waiting 15 minutes for an elevator only to have it be too full and need to wait another 10 for a second elevator is unacceptable. Sorry but I do not have the patience for that. Nothing can be done at his point but they are losing what could have been a frequent guest over the next two years.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel room was clean and comfortable and desk staff was polite, however a male staff member entered our room 5 minutes after we obviously went out for the evening. It just happened that my friend forgot her wallet and ran back up to the room. Of course the management lied and said our smoke detector was going off, and that the battery died. It just happened to die the second we walked out of the room. Super Creepy! Beware!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We spent three nights at the Doubletree and were very happy with the entire stay. I read all the previous comments and had some hesitation but all that was unfounded with out stay. For one, this is not a converted office building, it was built from the ground up as a Doubletree. The room were extremely clean and maintained everyday. There was no deposit that was required. The location was excellent. You are not near Times Square and all of the madness there but can get there very quickly on the subway that was less than a five minute walk from the front of the hotel. You can also easily walk to the Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island boats as well as the 9/11 Memorial/Museum. There are several places to eat nearby. The #1 part of our stay was the staff!!! Everyone we encountered, from the doormen, front desk staff, housekeepers and maintenance workers was friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Booked this hotel for a business and was literally seconds to the office. Great service, great location compared what others have mentioned about other hotels they were staying in. Great pubs and restaurants walking distance to this hotel. I walked from this hotel to little Italy in about 30 minutes.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Your staff is polite, cheerful and helpful. There are not enough elevators for the number of rooms when all of the rooms are full. I had a terrible time trying to get into my room Thursday evening. I would have thought that someone would have had the authority to offer me breakfast Friday morning. But nobody was authorized to do this. There was no air-conditioning late Friday night / Saturday morning. I reported it to the woman who checked me out Saturday. She did offer me breakfast, which was appreciated. Perhaps, more of your staff should be authorized to offer this small amenity to your customers.
user_name:
Kathleen M
Sterling, Virginia, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Only 3 small elevators for 44 floors. Plus, they're used by staff for room service, maintenance, etc. % minute wait time for elevator was the norm. Italian restaurant on first floor has excellent food at reasonable prices (for New York City).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms were clean and comfortable and the restaurant has an excellent reuptation (locals highly recommended it). However, the elevator did not work right and the staff refused to acknowledge the problem despite numerous complaints from different guests. Also, watch out for the Javits Center fee - no idea what it covers, but it was tacked on to my bill without any explanation.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The entire staff, particularly those at street level were very helpful with pointing out directions, getting a cab, recommending alternative travel, etc. Location very convenient to Wall Street and Lower Manhatten
user_name:
Jeff O
Valley Forge, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I won this hotel on Priceline and when I read the reviews I was a bit worried about staying there. The truth is that it's a fairly nice hotel. It's extremely clean and the staff was nice enough. This has to be one of the most space impaired hotels I've ever stayed at though. I'd compare it to a cruise. The hallways are so narrow that housekeeping can't even use a standard housekeeping cart, they use rolling luggage with their cleaning supplies. The rooms are also very small but I've stayed in NYC before and that's not very atypical. The smallness is not that big of a deal.My only real complaint is the elevators. These are the slowest elevators i've ever seen in a hotel. If you need to go somewhere leave yourself a half an hour to get to the lobby. The elevators are so slow that I decided to just use the emergency stairs because it would be quicker and unfortunately I stepped wrong, rolled my ankle and hurt my ankle really badly this morning. That wasn't really the way I wanted to end my trip to NYC.So, I wouldn't be afraid to stay here unless you are impatient and can't wait forever for the elevators to come.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We were in a standard suite for a weekend. The hotel is very nicely decorated and clean and the check in staff and bell boys, etc. were all very nice and helpful. The hotel is very tall and narrow, so there only a handful of rooms on each floor. The hallways are very narrow. The elevator is slow, and they only have 3 for over 40 something floors. Have to be patient. We did not eat in the restaurant, or do room service because the food was so expensive. I know...New York. There are so many places around the hotel, no need to spend the money. The rooms are like cruise ship size and the bed was only ok on comfort. The biggest complaint we have is that the bathroom has zero counter space, so it was very annoying for a couple to get ready to attend a wedding, and we had stuff lined on the floor. Again, tight typical NY space. Also the room air conditioning was so hard to control, it was either too hot or cold. There aren't a lot of hotel choices in that area, so I would recommend it for the proximity to the Stone Street restaurants and Battery Park....but for the price, the accommodations are tight (the king bed took up the whole room). I am not a frequent visitor to NY, so maybe that is how most typical hotel rooms are.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Overall the stay was good but I did find used panties and trash under and on the side of my bed upon arrival. The service was great for the most part except for our troubles with the bellman. The cookies were delicious. They were pretty fresh every time, except once.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed for 2 nights. The hotel is clean. Very strategically located. Less than 2 minute walk from the subway station. Ten minute walk to Wall Street. It is meant for the business traveler. Breakfast selection is very limited. Business center is couple of tables located in the "lobby" of the hotel. The "lobby" is few couches and is not meant to be utilized as a socialization place. Often times the elevators were very inefficient -I ended up waiting for over 10 minutes to catch the elevator. Make sure you get a nice view. Mine was looking at another building! This was not the best view.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Nice, clean hotel. Parking garage directly across the street. Walking distance to the entire financial district. Elevators took a long time to get to your floor during peak hours. I would have no issue staying here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: As a Hilton member I am typically finding great spots and great stays. This time around my usual places were sold out so I found this newer hotel (relatively speaking) close enought ot the office. I was a little put off by the front desk when I tried to check in early upon arrival. I know it was early but it could have perhaps been communicated a little nicer. In any event checked my bags and went to work. The hotel is real close to to downtown right in the Financial District. Easily walking. Checked in real late in the day and was put directly across from the elevator. My profile does say away from elevators so little surprised, especially since when I asked to move they obliged quite easily. Rooms are on the smaller size but done very nicely and clean, which as most travelers would agree, a must. I would stay again but only if my other options are not available.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel was great! Nice location; walking distance to Battery Park, Staten Island Ferry, Wall Street, Seaport and the hop on hop off bus stops. The room was kinda small but I think for NYC it's average size. Clean hotel, but the elevator is slow and there's only 3. The service was great! Someone at the entrance to greet you when you arrive and leave each day. Made the mistake of ordering rooms service! Ouch, it's expensive with all the extra fees and charges. We could have walked across the street to Chipotle.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Staff was very helpful checking in, welcomed me as an Honors member and made sure i had all I needed. Room was small (this is NYC) but very nice. Good bedding, clean, a/c worked well, good lighting, quiet. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: A good hotel for a business trip to the Financial District. Rooms are very small but clean. Employees were curteous and helpful. Price was a little on the high side for the size of the rooms, but about what you would expect to pay for any hotel in Manhattan.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Small rooms, inconvenient and small reception. Two lifts for all floors which results in long wait time in the mornings when everyone gets to work. Hilton Millenium is 10 minutes away and offers better quality and facilities for a slightly higher price.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very nice hotel, elevators were slow and rooms were cramped but overall thoroughly enjoyed my stay, the hotel and staff. Very knowledgeable, courteous and professional in every facet, especially my housekeeping agent.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Mid-week desk staff were pleasant and welcoming. Even by NYC standards, room was claustrophobia-inducing. In the bathroom, there was NO counter space. NONE. Even the toilet top could not be used, having a push button flush. An average height and weight adult will find the shower uncomfortable; elbow hits were unavoidable. After an all day rain, on the thirdly morning of my stay, I woke to a musty room smell. When I opened the shower door, I was so overwhelmed by a smell of mildew I nearly vomited. While I had been hesitant to change hotels due to discomfort, with significant mold allergies, relocation was a health issue now for me. I dressed and went to the lobby. The front desk clerk, upon hearing my room issue, was dismissive and told me this was impossible as it "is a new property." She would not make eye contact with me - rather than attempting to help, she dismissed me.I boarded an elevator to return to my room. Two staff members, security and maintenance, were there who observed I was upset. I recounted my desk experience and room problem. The security staff offered to intervene and see if another room would be better. I returned to my room and a few minutes later got a call from the front desk regarding an alternate room. She provided a room number and I was to meet security outside the potential new room right away. I went there immediately, where I waited nearly 15 minutes. The same empathetic security staff finally arrived - apologizing that he had been waiting for me on a different floor, having been given a different room number by the same front desk person whom I had encountered earlier.With the strong deodorizer scent in the room, I could not, in a matter of minutes, discern if this room was an improvement. But I needed to be out of the moldy room, and security kindly helped me relocate. I packed, and moved my things. I left for breakfast, hoping to be able to determine improvement upon return. Unfortunately, I could not. It was time to leave. I collected my belongings, returned to the lobby, and asked a different staffer if he could find a nearby hotel for me. He said he really couldn't do anything for me, offered to have the head of housekeeping checkout the prior room, and repeatedly asked what the room smelled like.With a nearly debilitating headache at this point, and a friend to help, I checked out. I had no replacement hotel but was relieved to be out.Let me be clear that there was no visible mold in this room. But given my severe allergic reaction. something seems going on in this building, and rainfall seems to exacerbate it. I am grateful to the security staff member who tried so hard to compensate for others' shortcomings. As bad as the mold problem was for me, the desk staff made the situation much much worse. This hotel's character in space, appointments, amenities, and staff do not meet Doubletree standards.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location if you need to be in the Financial District. Small hotel with TINY rooms. Was not welcomed as an Honors member nor provided with the perks. Very clean and very expensive. Restaurant is separate but not terrible. Better choices in the area.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We went there because I made a mistake thinking I was booking in an Hotel my girlfriend had been before. The one she was thinking about was inTime Square. Honestly the price was a lot better then the other one. You need to know your way around since this is the Financial district and the attractions are not that many in the area.Still you are at walking distance from Ground Zero and Battery Park, where youn can hope on a boat to see the statue. Also a walk to Brooklin bridge is an easy thing to do. But if you want to go to see other big attractions like Time Square or Central park, the subway is litterally a few feet away.Rooms are clean and modern, staff is courteous, and the bathroom was awsome.Great place at a very good price.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This Doubletree property is a solid 3 stars hotel in a great location in town. Very good transportation around the hotel and options of eating out. The rooms are small sized as New York always offer but I found the strongest point the service from concierge and front desk was very helpful with any needs. Would stay with them again in the future.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very comfortable hotel with river views on the higher floors - we were on the 34th. Excellent restaurant. All staff most helpful and obliging. Very close to Battery Park and American Indian museum (well worth a visit). Within walking distance of Ground Zero (new museum is a must). Discount shopping at Century 21 also nearby.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel room and accommodations were perfectly fine. They even give you free, warm cookies at check-in! That, I loved. I would recommend staying here, especially since it's affordable. Staying in the financial district on the weekend is nice too.
user_name:
Whitney S
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I checked in with family on a late Friday night when it was pouring and out of nowhere a young man comes and welcomes me to the hotel. I was immediately impressed with the service and check in and I loved my room. We stayed on the top 44th floor and I had the BEST view of the World Trade Center. I was however not impressed that there were only 3 elevators and that it took 5 minutes to get an elevator at busy time. My dad also liked the cookies that they had at the front desk.
user_name:
tstitcher
Church Hill, Maryland, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I've stayed at the Doubletree on Stone Street several times for business during the work week. It's in a very convenient location and the rooms and service are acceptable. The lobby is on the second floor, entrance is on the ground floor. There are three small elevators serving a 30-story building. Wait times in excess of 10 minutes are not uncommon, particularly if a large group is checking in our out. Rates are very unpredictable - plan ahead.
user_name:
John W
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Checked in for 2 nights. There was a heavy water leakage from the bathroom ceiling. It was scary as the water was gushing down pretty close to the electrical outlets. Room changed only after I insisted for a change. No apologies offered.Rooms are cramped. The room which was given to us advertising 'City View' had two huge buildings blocking our view of the city. Some view huh !We stayed on the 42nd floor and the elevators take forever to come up and then go down. I sometimes had to wait for 15 minutes for the elevator to come up to the 42nd floor. They need to have some express elevator for really high floors.The overall hotel has a very darkish, congested, claustrophobic feel.The only benefit of this hotel is it's location.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: i always love hilton's bed, so comfy with the "right" firmness.location was great if you plan to spend most of your time in the downtown, also a good choice if you're a business traveller. Room was clean, and spacious. didn't opt for the breakfast, so can't comment on it.receptionist was kind and polite. always think that the Doubletree's welcome cookie is a nice touch.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: As others have mentioned, this hotel is located in a relatively quiet area and in close proximity to Wall Street. Many restaurants in the immediate area as well. Rooms comfortable but slightly small and breakfast not too exciting. Staff was efficient and welcoming.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: For a Business Trip to the financial district, this is a great location. Walking distance to restaurants, Staten Island Ferry and subway stations. Hotel was clean, great workout facility, restaurant in hotel was pretty good. Room was small, but aren't most rooms in NYC small? Stayed a second time last week. Room was quiet, bed was very comfortable- great nights sleep. Great shower too.Will be my go-to htoel in the city because it is not in a congested area, not over-priced and was clean!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was conveniently located in the quiet neighborhood of the Financial District. The metro was very close as well as shopping, restaurants, and bars. The staff was very pleasant throughout. The rooms were clean and the air conditioner worked well. I found a random pill under the bed when I was looking for my shoes, but I don't really care. Sometimes little things are missed. The room was clean and I received service and clean towels everyday. My bed was comfortable and we had plenty of space. I would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Sarah K W
Charleston, South Carolina

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed in NYC for 5 days and chose this hotel based on location and price. It was an excellent choice. The rooms were clean and comfortable. They were slightly small, but that was expected given the location. The room worked very well for a couple. The view was excellent as was the service. Access to subway stations were less than a 5 minute walk. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We were in NYC to visit our daughter and son-in-law and decided to stay near the Financial district since they lived a few blocks away. We booked our room for a 3-night stay. We decided to use some of our HHonors points to upgrade to a room with a view of the Hudson River, which was awesome! The room was very nice with updated features; flat screen tv, iron with ironing board, safe, hair dryer and coffee maker. We were disappointed that there was not a refrigerator or microwave in the room. The bathroom was small, with little room to place toiletries. There is a restaurant on site, but no free buffet breakfast which we always find nice in most Hilton Hampton Inns, etc. The bed was very comfortable (King Size) and the room was quiet from street noise. However, their policy is to change linens on your third night's stay. We returned to our room late in the afternoon on our third day and our room had not been serviced. I notified the front desk and they did bring us fresh towels and toiletries and offered to make our room up for us, but at that point we felt we could just make the bed up and not worry with it. Needless to say, we were very disappointed that we were neglected on the third night of our stay. Was this just coincidence??????

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotels in Manhattan can be unreasonably expensive for the location for five star hotels, or lacking in amenities (i.e. shared bathrooms) in the two to three star range for cheaper hotels. Hilton Doubletree Financial District strikes an excellent balance of location, services, and price. Located just minutes away from the subway station, you can walk from the hotel to anywhere in Manhattan. Price wise the hotel is competitively priced with other four star hotels in the area. Services were excellent (though full disclaimer I happen to be Hilton Honor Gold and was upgraded to the second highest floor with a city view). The only downside is that the hotel is so popular, it had sold out the night before my stay which prevented an early check in. Other than this small detail, this is a fantastic hotel for the price, location, and services.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The room was clean, the beds were comfortable, the staff was pleasant but the elevators were slow to arrive. Located in the Financial District there great places to eat and walk around. Great views of lower Manhatten.
user_name:
Steven T
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: 1) Be aware even if you get 25th or 30th floor room all you can see will be other buildings no city view in Lower Manhattan2)Ask yourself why there us no picture showing bathtub or bathroom. In full view ? Because there is no bathtub and there is no shower cabin its just a curtain divides the bathroom in 2 pieces Big disappointment No bathtub no shower area properly made just shower curtain ? Come on !! You should've doing better than that right DoubleTree by Hilton ? Bathroom is a big turn off at this Hotel if you are not planing to take shower during your stay you have nothing to worry 3) You can park your car right across the street those Puerto Ricans will charge you 30 to 35 $ per day 4) Rooms and hallway too narrow It looks like they were trying to create as much room as they can on every floor It makes you feel like you are in a Student Dorm more than a hotel5) Staff is nice and friendly I think even They deserve to be in better Hotel 6) day time always traffic night time no attraction at all its your call to choose 7) wifi works perfectly but you need to ask for password it changes on a daily basis So be aware of these make your choice wisely and be happy

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was our second stay at the hotel. Your employees are all very nice and friendly. The front desk manager was also very nice and we had a couple of laughs in the elevator. The only problem is the elevator(s) - YOU NEED MORE - the wait, the size (small), very frustrating. I plan to request a lower floor next time - so we can walk up/down. Thank you.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: After researching hotels for a tourist visit to NY I chose this hotel because I got a great rate (AAA discount helps). I was a bit worries that staying in the financial district would be a bad location for sightseeing, etc, and about some of the reviews about no hot water, long elevator waits, etc, but gave it a shot.Check in was easy, given the hot cookie, up to the room which was the City View - as reviews here say, small but nicely done - the hotel felt modern and stylish, had everything needed, only issues were 1) to fit the room, the bed is short- we had to lay diagonal to fit (I'm 6' tall), 2) there was someone's dry cleaned shirt on our bed. No big deal, front desk came and got it, overall very happy, especially for the rate. View was ok, blocked somewhat by buildings but nice to be up high, saw 1 world trade center from the window, the river off to the left. AC is a bit noisy (somewhat of an issue), but hot water was fine.Location - this was outstanding. A couple blocks to the 4/5 express trains that can get you anywhere, but even better, easy walk to 9/11 Memorial, Statue of Liberty ferry/Battery Park, the Wall St bull is 2 blocks from the hotel, the NYSE an easy walk, the federal bldg (where George Washington took the first presidential oath is by the NYSE, Brooklyn Bridge (recommend the walk across it), then short train ride to times square, easy access to Little Italy (Angelo's was great), Greenwich Village, Central Park, a week pass for the trains is only $30 ride all you want). Also easy access to the riverfront - here's a tip, walk to South Street seaport area, there is a branch of the same discount tickets place TKTS that you will wait an hour at in Times Square - here it opens at 11 and no line, same discount tickets, times square doesnt evenopen until 2, so you get better choice and no wait.So was leaning toward high rating but on the second day we were awoken by the sound of dripping water. Looked and water was pouring down from the ceiling fan. Turns out toilet above supposedly overflowed, which means it was waste filled water. We called downstairs and engineering came right away but they said no available rooms to switch to, but called back in ten minutes with a room as people checked out (lucky it was AM when people leave and not middle of the night or we'd been stuck). We were moved a couple floors up and got a bigger room with a river view, so all in all they handled it about as well as possible, but combined with other reviews about hot water issues etc, i'd say the hotel is a bit like roulette - you're gambling that this retrofitted former office building's plumbing doesnt have issues. Also, the AC noise in the new room was pretty obnoxious, and any noise in the hall comes right in the room which happens too much in the AM.All in all it's too bad I can't give a higher rating. Hilton did decent design and I loved the location, and got a great deal, and niceish rooms, solid service - but toilet water through the ceiling, hall and AC noise, and elevator waits that weren't horrible but can be an issue make this simply an ok place. I would possibly stay here again if there was a good rate, but would be a bit nervous about these issues, and might opt to try something else rather than deal with the AC and hall noise and short beds and risk of plumbing issues. Too bad because otherwise promising.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was disappointed that on Sunday our room was never cleaned and three separate times I had to request towels be brought to the room. Also the printer was not functioning when we wanted to print out our boarding passes and there was no one to help fix the problem

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Wife and stayed two nights here. Very comfortable hotel. Rooms are very clean a bit small but doable for two adults. Staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. Returned to our room 2am after partying and the door man gave us menu to order out from a diner called Charley's. Food arrived within 15 minutes up to our room. Only negative comment was that the room had thin walls. Clearly heard the details of conversations and telephone calls from next door. Other than that it's a great location for a quick weekend or business trip.Tips: Request Higher floor with river view. Do not stay near elevator or ice room very loud especially with the thin walls.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: On a positive note, the hotel is located near two subway lines so access to other areas in NYC is easy. Also near to Battery Park and South Street Seaport. Unfortunately, there are many negative notes. Rooms are very small, cramped with no views even if you are on a high floor. Service is absolutely horrible. We stayed for three days and no one ever cleaned our room. Our tray of room service food remained outside our room for the entire stay. The staff are nice, but I'm afraid the management is incompetent. With so many good hotels in NYC, make a different choice.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel rooms are compact like most in new york but are clean and have the amenities you would expect for a business hotel.Location wise its a bit away from the offices, around 10-15 minute walk.Breakfast is very pricey for what you get and quite simple for a hilton. I only had it once in a 9night stay choosing to get breakfast on the way to work the other days.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is brutal. Sure it looks very nice but it is extremely poorly built. The hallways are extremely narrow and claustrophobic. They are about as wide as the walkway in an airplane. The rooms are tiny -- pretty much a bed and a small dresser. And worst of all the walls are paper thin. If the person in the room down the hall coughs or even opens his door It will wake you up.We spent the night here and only got 1 hour sleep despite checking in early and checking out late. Every time someone opens a door on your floor or walks down the hall you will hear it and it will wake up. The ac in the room is also extremely loud and sounds like a hurricane hitting every time it turns on.To make things even worse the hotel management is extremely rude and unaccomodating. They essentially told us all they can do is let us check out early if we don't like it and want to find another hotel. One women offered us breakfast and then when we went to get it the next day the other women said no.DO NOT STAY HERE UNDER ANY CONDITION!!!! IF YOU WANT A NICE HOTEL CHOOSE ONE OF THE MANY OTHER OPTIONS. IF YOU WANT A CHEAP HOTEL YOU ARE BETTER OFF SLEEPING ON YOUR FRIENDS COUCH. IF YOU MUST STAY HERE BRING A GOOD SET OF EARPLUGS!!!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Spent the weekend in NYC and the location and convenience of being able to get around couldn't be matched...The front desk staff was very pleasant...the lobby was small and crowded and the elevators were slow but overall experience was very pleased...
user_name:
Michael B
Palm Harbor, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at this hotel when my flight was canceled. It was on the list of approved hotels my company offered. The staff was extremely courteous and I got a great rate on the room even though I didn't have my corporate number on hand to book the company rate. Definitely a great value for the location. The room was clean, comfortable and had a nice view of the city. Would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Lloyd the doorman is the best helpful and polite. Elevators not so good. Location is excellent. Resturant in the lobby is expensive and subpar. Check in people were great and always accomodate request when possible. Prices expensive for what you get for the $. Overall will return due to the team that meets and greets you at the front door thanks for all your help in finding me cars, directions and food keep it up.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: go somewhere else for breakfast. Very limited choices. good general service, friendly staff, clean rooms. Nothing else to say. abc, abc, abc, abc, def, ghi, jkl, mno, pqrs. It is frustrating that you require 200 characters.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stay at this hotel a couple times each year for business travel in Lower Manhattan and it has proven consistent and a good value for the money. The rooms are nicely appointed and smaller than a standard hotel room, but not terribly small by NYC standards. I have also stayed at the Marriott near the the 911 Memorial in the same area, and the Marriott was probably a little nicer but is usually a couple hundred dollars more per night. If both hotels are around the same price, I usually pick the Marriott but given the price difference, the Doubletree is a better deal is just fine for my needs. It is great for business travel, close to Wall Street and Water Street, definitely meets all of my needs while saving some money for my company. The only negatives are that they never have walnut free cookies to accommodate people guests with walnut allergies and that the elevators sometimes take a REALLY long time to arrive.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This DoubleTree is in the Financial District but close to major subway lines with safe walks all times of the day. Fast food options close by and decent restaurant in hotel. Staff is friendly. Everything works and the area is quiet at night.
user_name:
Calien L
Cape Elizabeth, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Recently stayed at this hotel for a weekend getaway. I've stayed in many NYC hotels and this stay was one of the best. Quiet hotel with nice, updated rooms. The staff was very helpful at 3 AM when we arrived back to our room to discover the A/C unit was not operating. They replaced the entire unit right after we called. The location is great, though lower Manhattan can be far from some of the main tourist attractions, the Financial District has it's own charm and this hotel is only steps away from Battery Park, the South Street Seaport, and Wall Street. A number of subway lines are close by, so I don't agree with other reviewers commenting that this is too far away from what you'd want to do while visiting the greatest city in the world. Will definitely be back.
user_name:
Jeanne M
Albany, New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was quite nice although the bathroom had no place to put your toiletries. This required me to keep everything in my cosmetic bag and take items out only when I was using them. I was on the 25th floor and, as others mentioned, did have long waits for the elevator. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was clean and a bit small like most New York hotels.My only complaint is that the hotel is located at the extreme lower end of Manhattan. This isn't a complaint about the hotel itself. It is just a warning to others who want a convenient location for seeing the sights. It is convenient if you are doing business in the financial district but it made it difficult as a tourist. The subway station is close by so it is easy to get uptown but it does take extra time. I felt completely safe riding the subway even late at night. This is not the New York I remember from years ago. If you come to New York for the night life do not stay here. There are no places to wander around in the evening like there are in the trendier spots uptown.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: For $429 per night the Hilton failed to provide some basics: a mini fridge, complimentary water, kettle, slippers, robe, hot water. Disappointingly the manager didn't care for customer feedback and failed to understand the reason for my dissatisfaction!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: A lovely place to stay in lower Manhattan. The staff was very accommodating and professional. The room was delightful and quite comfortable. The bed provided me a restful night’s sleep. The hotel restaurant provided a nice dinner, quite flavorful. The restaurant staff was also very accommodating and professional. The lack of hot water did not have a terrible impact on the satisfaction of my stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Excellent service, comfortable beds, very clean and quiet. I really enjoyed my stay. My only complaint is the parking arrangements we spent almost $100 on parking for two days. If you come to town budget for parking within your expenses if you plan to drive.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Space is limited in New York and it shows in the hotel rooms. I had a king size bed and the rooms itself was large enough for one person. However, the bathroom was not designed for women. There was hardly any counter space to put my makeup and toiletries. Also, the building is super tall, over 40 floors and there are only 3 elevators. So be prepared to wait for several minutes for one, and hope that it's not full by the time it gets to your floor. The staff was friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is conveniently located in Downtown/Financial District. Restaurants, retail establishments and public transportation are all easily accessible. Comfortable rooms and great service! Nightlife is limited, but there are a few taverns in the neighborhood offering late night snacks/drinks.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: They ONLY 2 check-in staff members at this hotel is under a lot of pressure to check guests into the 400 rooms+, so no time for small talk or full sentences and forget about a smile. Upon arrival they informed us that the boiler broke and we might have only cold water for our entire 3-day stay! They did soften the blow by offering us each a hot choc-chip cookie and complimentary wifi. Thankfully, after only 6 hours, the warm water did come on!The hotel is near the subway, quite quiet, OK bedroom and nice bed, free printing of boarding pass in their business centre, friendly bell boy and maids, it's just the check-in staff that urgently needs a holiday.Only IF you can get a good deal on this hotel via Hotwire, etc, take it!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
