review_body: Doubletree hotel , great location but not that great hotel. We 've been staying there before Easter- it was so overprised ! We got deluxe king room - and it was massive dissapointment ! Room was so small we couldn' t move . Bathroom claustrophobic . No fridge in deluxe room!!!Quite a disgrace.We just still don' t understand how come that hotel has 4 stars ??!!! Not all reception staff helpful even.And we travel all the time in all world so we have a lot experience in hotels business. Well at least we paid for great view and top floor so we got one. Well I love NYC and go there often but definatelly not to Doubletree again!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is very near to our Corporate office, that is why I stayed here. Staff is very friendly and eager to help. Room was nice, but for the price was very small. However, living in NY I guess you shouldn't expect larger rooms.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: When I arrived at the hotel there was no running water (the lady who checked me in told me about the "no hot water" after she ran my credit card through), said it would be back on in 1 hr. When it finally came back on it was dark brown. The next morning still dark brown, I let the shower run for 20 min and because of the way the shower head was facing, it wet the entire bathroom floor. I figured I only had one more day there so I did not check out that morning but that evening I called the hotel from my office to find out if there was any water running and was told "yes, there is water but the hot water is out and probably will be back up around 10p". I went to the hotel got my things and checked out that evening. It felt disgusting!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The bathroom sink was cracked in several places. The spigot was hanging out of the wall and very loose. The shelf was leaning on an angle and I could not set anything on it. Space is a premium to begin with in those bathrroms. I did report it to the front desk. But I fell this room shouldn't have been occupied until it was repaired to it's original state. I make it a point to select Hilton properties. This was not a very good impression. Thanks
user_location: New York - Financial District, United States
user_name:
Greg S
New York - Financial District, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Located in the financial district, with a couple subway stations nearby. Very nice and clean and the beds were really comfy. The only con is that I always had to wait for a while for the elevator, but I guess it's normal in a hotel with so many floors.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is in a good location, not far from a subway stop and in a quiet neighborhood, if you don't want something as busy as Times Square. That's also a drawback in that there are fewer options during off hours for food or drink, and fewer 24 hour convenience stores. The hotel does have a small bar and restaurant, but other than that not many options. The rooms are standard, maybe on the small side, but well maintained. We did have a good view of the World Trade Center. Keep in mind during busy check in/out times, the elevators will get overcrowded and you may have a long wait, sometimes 10 minutes just to catch one. Overall, a good hotel, nothing exceptional, but average. For a little more, the Conrad, not far from there is a better option.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The Doubletree is in a great location for the Financial District. The front desk clerk obviously hated her job but the bellman was super. He saved us a lot of money by telling us we could park on the street outside the hotel for FREE all weekend! The elevators are tiny and take FOREVER to get up or down. The room was clean and comfortable and I even had a view of the East River (sort of).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for business in April 2014. It's clean, rooms small but comfortable, good location, good gym. The downsides were the elevators are slow, if you're on a high floor you need to budget 10 min. to get out of the building especially during morning rush. And the internet/wifi was difficult to get on (requiring your Hilton honors account login) and poor quality.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I had reservations for this upcoming June and called over a month in advance to request double beds. I was informed this was considered an "upgrade" and would be charged an additional $50 per night. I was also told my request could not be guaranteed. I explained that I was calling over a month in advance to make this request & was told again that there was no guarantee. No "we'll do our best to try to accomodate you". I also stated I was a HiltonHonors Rewards Member and they could care less about that as well. This obvious lack of hospitality & customer service left me with a bad taste in my mouth & a realization that if I got there and had any problems, the front desk staff would not be helpful or accommodating. With so many hotels to choose from in NYC, you would think they would go above & beyond (or at least try) to accomodate their guests & future guests holding reservations. No, not here. Instead, they read from a script in a flat & monotonous tone that there is nothing they can do to accomodate your request. I cancelled my reservation and will stay elsewhere. They lost my business.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Clean, comfy room and great staff. There are only 3 elevators for approximately 40 floors, however, and if one is out of service-good luck getting downstairs! I would stay here again, but I was not happy having to run down 14 flights of stairs with my luggage so as not to miss my ride to the airport!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was nice and clean, this is my third stay in Manhattan and I've tried a few hotels and this one is really nice compared to what you pay.Last time in was living fairly close to Times square, 37th 33W and payed twice as much for the same standard.The hotel was refurbished and clean.The breakfast was decent, i preferred walking across the street though.The pub next to the hotel has some nice fast food as well.I's close to battery park and of course downtown.I'd recommend it!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Lovely hotel in NYC financial district. Really quiet on the weekend, after all the business people had gone home. Extremely gracious and friendly staff. Rooms small but ok. Room cleaning was too later in the day though, so it was impossible to have that enjoyable afternoon snooze.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is ideally located close to the subway and a Starbucks and Chipotle, as well as a Duane Reade. The Bull, Battery Park, New York Stock Exchange, and Trinity Church are all within walking distance. The only issue we had was being close to the elevator, it was a bit noisy, with inconsiderate guests talking out loud past mid-night. There were 4 computers and a printer in the lobby, which were free to guests and very convenient. Another hotel in Times Square where we had spent a week in, advertised a business center....but they charged for using the computers in the center. If I needed a room in the financial district again, I would not hesitate to book this hotel again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: What seemed to be a great hotel based on reviews and first experience quickly turned sour. Clothes taken from the room, incompetent security, poor customer service and no ability by the staff to deem how serious this matter was. Still awaiting a reply on the matter even though it's nearly a month ago. Fearful to leave the room in case more stuff was taken, this shouldn't be how we remember our first trip to New York but alas it will be as the hotel did absolutely nothing to help ease our fears or get to the bottom of the matter, they simply reeled cliche after cliche off at us. When asked to speak to a manager we were fobbed off with more excuses, which was a disgrace. This hotel has ruined the Hilton brand for us and the lack of help or desire on their part to get the matter rectified has been a disgrace. Very poor experience would expect so much more from a four start hotel with a big brand name.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is on a quiet side street at the southern tip of Manhattan, very close to the subway, at the financial district. Rooms are well maintained but small, but hey, this is New York... The staff was very helpful and smiling. Breakfast is kinda expensive at their restaurant, so we headed down the street to "Flavors" and there's also another option called "Au Bon Pain" where one can get a decent breakfast for less than 1/2 the price.Only complaint was -- not enough elevators for such a big and tall hotel, but we managed....

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: A good option in NYC if you don't want to spend over $250 per night. The room was small but stylish and clean with a very comfortable bed. The location is great. Close to a number of subway stops and Wall Street. The staff are friendly and the cookie they give you at check-in is amazing.Best bit: The cookie on check-in. If you ask nicely they'll give you another one!Worst bit: Room was small

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We really like the location of this Doubletree as it is near the Staten Island Ferry and many subway entrances. You can get pretty much anywhere you want to go from here. The view from the rooms with a view isn't really inspiring, but will give you a birds eye view of the city if you are on one of the higher floors. I suggest getting a higher floor for not just the view but because the elevators can get pretty packed in the mornings and by the time it gets to your middle floor it may already be full. The complimentary breakfast that comes with being a Hilton Honors member is pretty basic with scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, fruit, cereal, pastries, etc. If you are a coffee drinker don't get your hopes up for refills. We've been to this hotel 3 times now and you pretty much need to tackle a waiter in order to get a refill. Basically, once you've been seated and they get you started you are on your own. The rooms are nice especially considering how tightly packed in they are. I haven't had problems with sound traveling all that much either. My only complaint would be to watch out in the shower becuase if someone in another room flushes you are going to get a quick scalding hot burst of water. Also, make sure to put the towel down in front of the shower because those door type showers are horrible at keeping water from leaking onto the floor.The check in staff are always very friendly, and we haven't had a problem with our bill on any of our visits.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good clean facilities and nice staff. Rooms are very small; there was no fridge in room; no movies available on television; and parking is off-site. Close to subway, restaurants and other amenities. Appears to have been an office building converted to a hotel. Halls are very narrow and lobby is on a different floor from hotel entrance.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Many NYC rooms are compact, and this king with City View was too, but very nicely appointed. Very Clean and comfortable. Staff was friendly. Once or twice had a wait for elevator, but overall a good experience with a clean and comfortable room
user_name:
Joel P
Knoxville, U.S. Virgin Islands

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Took full payment upon check in then after a problem with the ATM, I checked my cards at the desk and instead of checking a dollar, took the full amount again on two cards. One showed up as fraudulent, the other bounced for lack of funds. Spent 3 hours speaking with two fraud squads the next day and couldn't leave the hotel until I could resolve all this. Apology? You must be kidding. Apart from that, unimpressive and distinctly average.
user_name:
Simon W
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I picked the riverview room and paid an extra rate from the standard King room. After a long day of travel and work I was looking forward to relaxing and looking at the riverview. I opened my curtain and to my surprise there was a building blocking 90% of the view. I called down to the desk and was told, I was in the riverview room and all other rooms on the higher floors (with better views) where all booked. I cant say how disappointed I was and I wont stay there again, unless they move the building blocking the riverview. Oh and the bed took up most of the room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great hotel close to Wall Street. Friendly staff and clean rooms. Room service was very fast. Very comfy bed, and room layout was very efficient. NYC hotel rooms can be small, but this hotel made very good use of the space and I was comfortable being here a few days. Bathroom soap/shampoo was high quality (crabtree and evelyn), and warm cookie was delicious. Its these little details that make your stay go from good to great. Definitely recommend.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My review of this hotel may be clouded by my views on New York generally, where it is difficult to ever feel like you're getting your money's worth. So don't hold it against the Doubletree.Just back from a short stay here and have to say that the staff and service were wonderful. Nice people and very friendly.The design of the hotel is a bit awkward, since the ground floor entry is about the size of a mudroom in a normal person's house. You then take the elevator up to the 2nd floor, where there's a proper lobby and concierge.The floor plates are really small and they cram the rooms in - but my room design was great. Very well done, considering the small space and I had a good sleep.Breakfast in the morning was fine and no problems at all. This was one of the cheapest options I found online and for that I gave up a little bit on the "cool" factor, but saved about $100 per night. All told, this place is fine. No complaints, but will try another place next time. Will also do another neighborhood. For all it's recent revival, the financial district is still a pretty cold and quiet place at night. However, if you need to be close to Wall St. or the lower tip of the island, this is a good choice.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hole is located on a rather dark street, but do not let that distract you. We loved the location and had a great view of the river! The subway is just around the corner and can take you everywhere in just a short time. There are also plenty to see around the financial district area. Breakfast was also good! Staff very friendly - we would certainly stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed one night at this hotel during a business trip. It was located very close to my meeting at India House which was handy. The room was compact but very comfortable and clean. I found the service to be excellent. The concierge went well out of his way to find me a cab in the pouring rain. They were also able to arrange a car for my return to the airport. I did order room service prior to attending an event...just a salad which was ok...standard room service prices and again the service was good. One annoyance was that the halls were so narrow there was no where to put my tray outside so I had to put it right at my door....it stayed there all night and was a pain to step around when I was coming and going...I suppose I should have called to ask that it be picked up. In terms of this location for a vacation visit I thought it was pretty good...close to the subway and lots of things within easy walking distance. I would likely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I thought this was a pretty nice hotel. Our room was small but I already expected that and have stayed in smaller rooms. It was enough room for me and my husband who were only going to be in our room to sleep. The bed was not the most comfortable but it wasn't horrible either. The staff was extremely friendly, everyone we encountered smiled and asked us how our stay was. It's in a very convenient area, lots of subways nearby. My only complaint is about the elevators, they are slow. We only had a major issue when we were trying to check out. It took 10 minutes to get to the lobby from our floor and we had a car waiting on us. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Small rooms, but not atypical of NYC. The furnishings were worn but still serviceable. Room was clean. The only oddity of the room is the inconsistent water temperature -- it would occasionally go ice cold for a few seconds. But avoid the restaurant, food was terrible and even the coffee was poor. Wonder a block and find a deli. Plan ahead if you want to catch a cab from the hotel as it is not on a main street (or walk over to Water Street.)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed for 3 nights over Easter weekend and yes the location is good but is about the only thing going for this (what I as a HH Diamond would class as a 2 star) hotel. No feeling of being valued guests in this hotel, no upgrade, no privileges apart from free breakfast (which is standard all over for Diamonds). The public areas, corridors etc were worn, the elevators (as stated in other reviews were slow) and the room small.We have had some excellent breakfasts in Doubletrees in fact one of the best Hilton breakfasts we have ever had was in Tampa Doubletree. In this New York Doubletree the breakfast room was tiny but it was the complete mismanagement and poor selection and quality food that marked it for us. Tables were worn and dirty, only half set, the buffet was always empty and when you asked them to refill they did so begrudgingly! The restaurant Manager was abrupt and disinterested. We weren't the only guests unhappy!The hotel was by NY standards not expensive but I agree with the previous reviewer that this is likely the only reason they are still in business.Very disappointed Diamond Members. Thankfully our next 3 nights we are in a different Hilton!
user_name:
Elizabeth7
Kingston upon Thames, United Kingdom

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have stayed here many times, primarily since it is near my company office. The property is clean, staff is friendly/helpful, and the location is very near to multiple NYC subway lines. The facility is a small. Restaurant is average and affordable. Better than staying in Times Square!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Don't expect the Palace at this place but for a New York Hotel it's a good deal. Showers, not tubs, small rooms, prickly staff (waiter rolled his eyes when we ordered from the menu instead of the breakfast buffet, if you don't answer your door first thing then your room is not getting cleaned..) but hey, you can't beat the price. If they ever raise prices, they'll be out of business.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Do not stay here. House keeping rob your things, I had lots of clothes stolen and nothing done about it once reported. Staff are not helpful or friendly. They couldn't even take the time to write a report. No compensation just fobbed off every time I went to reception. Very unprofessional and disappointing for a hotel that is supposed to be a four star hilton. Terrible that you have to be worried that your clothes will be robbed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My experience at the Hilton New York/financial District was nothing less than excellent. The front desk staff was professional and warm. They were willing to help and supply all of our needs. I would most definitely recommend the Hilton Hotel New York/Financial District to my friends and family. This staff is to be commend for their integrity and dedication to duty.
user_name:
Shirley B
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The price to stay in the hotel was way too high. It was not worth the amount of money paid to stay there. The room was cramped and there was not enough space to put things. Also, the water pressure in the shower was horrible. There was also a lack of space in the bathroom. Outside noises could be heard easily in the room. This made sleeping quite difficult. The room was stuffy.
user_name:
Diana L
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Absolutely terrible elevators - will never stay here again. Waited over 15 minutes several times trying to go up or down and often when 1 of the 3 small elevators did finally arrive it was already packed and no one additional could squeeze in. Rooms were clean/decent, but exceptionally small even by NY standards. Never again.
user_name:
Christina B
New York City, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: For double tree, the hotel is of good value. Warm cookies upon arrival, friendly staff. The AC unit is very loud in the room when it kicks on. Had a crying baby in the room next to me all night, not DoubleTrees fault but walls are thin. Bed is very comfortable, when traveling for work this is all I usually care about - a good nights sleep. I was disappointed there was no bottle water in the room. I also had to let the sink run for 20 minutes as the water was milky and cloudy.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Close to the Bowling Green subway stop, the Double Tree is in a quiet area of the Financial District, a hop, skip and a jump from Battery Park, Wall Street and a plethora of restaurants, shops and Century 21. The hotel itself is nothing spectacular, so unmemorable that I can't even picture where we checked in or our room even though we stayed there just a few nights ago. We didn't visit the restaurant nor the gym so I can't comment to those. Small rooms and no counter space in the bathrooms...typical of a NYC room. But the staff was friendly and the location convenient.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very friendly staff - we arrived very late and the staff was ready to great us and get us checked in quickly. Time for a hotel upgrade - couch and chair were worn out, mold & mildew in the shower. Free breakfast was not very good - cereal and bagels were stale.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 1 overnight on 4/5/14. Our family was attending a wedding in lower Manhattan and this was one of the suggested hotels that would be nearby the reception. I had called earlier (a week prior to our scheduled stay) to confirm arrangements to have 2 hotel rooms set aside for us on the same floor. The man who answered the phone assured me that this could be done upon check-in day even though I was hesitant about waiting until then when more rooms at the hotel would be spoken for. Upon arrival, there was no attempt to accommodate my request, nor sincere apologies rendered. My 90 year old mother was staying with my family of 4 and I had worked hard to ensure she would be comfortable and at ease being near to all. A change in plans was made and my 21 year old daughter and I stayed with her in a double room. The double room was tight and cramped, lighting poor and the bathroom lacked any counter tops to place toiletries or keep a toothbrush on. Frankly, my experience was a poor one and I would not recommend this hotel to anyone staying in lower Manhattan.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Spent 4 nights at this hotel. The minuses were having to pay for w-fi in room, the infamous elevator situation was only bad on saturday morning when we had to wait 20 min. We were on 27th floor. Pluses: great employee service, quiet room. We were not near elevator or ice machine where it would have been noisier for sure. Our view was of other high rises, but no matter b/c we were not in room during the day. Walking distance ti battery park was easy. We spent most time there. The weather was fantastic, so it was great to b outdoors a lot. Leo's Bagels is very close for excellent NY bagels. We ate in Chinatown and Chelsea areas. The bed was comfy too. Small room but ok for price on hotwire.com

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If you are looking for a hotel with very small rooms and a maintenance crew that doesn't regard your need to sleep - this is the hotel for you. Had a crew hanging a mirror in the adjoining room at 10:30 pm - claimed they didn't know my room was occupied. Resumed work at 11:30 pm - btw slowest elevators in NYC too.
user_name:
Lori Beth H
Boston, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good location for visiting downtown Manhattan. The Wall St, 9/11 memorial, the charging bull, ferry station (to go to Staten Island or the Statue of Liberty) is all walking distance. Also subway is nearby. There's a Duanereade like half a block away but this is not a 24/7. Hotel rooms were comfortable, clean and modern given the small space and we got a good deal from Hotels.com, so I'm satisfied!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I would absolutely stay here again because I got an amazing rate for a NYC hotel on Priceline. However, Priceline puts this in the 4 star category which this hotel most definitely is not. The location is great in the Wall Street Area. Front desk and bellhop staff are all helpful. The room was comfortable with 2 exceptions (no firm pillows and NO BATHROOM PRIVACY). The room has modern decor and they make great use of the smallish space BUT...the stylish sliding door to the bathroom just doesn't work! There is a huge gap so others can see, hear (and smell) everything. This is UNACCEPTABLE for any bathroom. Door semed to work properly but just did not fit. I have no idea if this was unique to my room or is an issue throughout but lets just say it made using the bathroom too "open" for my comfort. I stayed 2 nights. After the first night, the room wasn't cleaned until close to 5 pm (weird). Day 2 (checkout, housekeeping came knocking bright and early at 9 am (ugh). They came knocking again 2 more times despite the do not disturb sign...very annoyinhg and unprofessional as we were in serious need of sleep. There were a few other oddities that just bring this hotel below a 4 star. One, there was no refridgerator available which I needed for medication. Had to go to a different floor for ice instead. Second, there are no rollaways available. It would have been a tight squeeze for a rollaway but there was a possibility of an extra person and we could have made it work. Also, the pillows were uncomfortably soft. No such thing as a firm or foam pillow to be found. If you have back or neck issues and are picky about pillows, bring your own. The hotel TRIED to help but they just don't have any variety of pillows so I used the throw pillow from the room chair. Another weird thing was the telephone. The receiver is just for show. Had to use the base and speaker phone to call front desk, roomservice, etc which is not great if someone else is asleep. I definitely appreciated decent room lighting, the comfortable bed, variety of outlets and extra USB charging station. Closet and drawer space were good for smallish NYC hotel rooms. Location is excellent and in good proximity to both hogh end and casual dining. The TV worked great and WIFI works well (there is a daily WIFI charge which we got waived for being Hilton Honors members-- no hotel should charge for Wifi these days but this one does). Room service food was so-so but it came fast enough. Breaskfast in the room was WAY overpriced ($19 for an omelet?) but the OJ was fresh squeezed. I would not pay a high price to stay here but would stay here again for a great deal. Just be aware this is a 3 or 3+ star hotel and not a 4. It lacks all the smoothness and elegance of a proper 4 star hotel plus those extras, like a fridge in the room, ice machine on every floor, better pillows, upscale and ample toiletries, and proper communication with housekeeping staff (and courtesty to not wake people up).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: From check in to check out everyone was very nice. Room was small but nice, hot water worked, elevators were not slow and we had top floor! I must say this is a great hotel and I travel often. I'd recommend getting a view room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel was terrible. Slow elevators. No hot water the first night and just dingy all around. It had the right location for where I was doing business but other than that, don't do it. The standard rooms were fairly small as well.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: No towel bars!? How can a bathroom not have towel bars. Only shelf is SMALL: 12 inches long and 3 inches wide--women have toiletries and make up and there is NO place to store these. Shower is huge, but there is no vanity!? Bathroom is so poorly laid out that there is no room for in bathroom tissues/holder. If you do not remember to take tissues into the bathroom from bedroom, you do without or risk disturbing other person sleeping. Beds were comfortable, though.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Friendly, courteous staff was extremely helpful. Very clean room and bath with comfortable beds and lots of comfy pillows. Requested extra towels which were in room at check in. Super easy check in and out.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I could not take a shower because the hot water heater was broke. The water was ice cold to the point where you would get hypothermia. I had to go to work dirty. Took 1/2 hour to get an elevator to my room as one of the other elevators were down. Aweful experience!
user_name:
Michelle F
Albany NY, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel was GREAT!!! Kadeem really made our stay very enjoyable. After a long drive to NYC, he made our arrival fun and exciting. He guided us to the right places and gave us tips on cool spots to shop at. We will definitely be back at this hotel just because Kadeem is the MAN!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Only 1 Elevator was working at check in & check out and no hot water was vaailble during stay... Took over 25 minutes to get to my room at check in and I had to walk down 22 flights of stairs with bagagge when leaving...
user_name:
Michael P
Delaware, Ohio, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My stay was during a tough evening at this hotel. Their hot water wasn't working and their 3rd elevator broke. I stay here a lot, and the people are super nice, but they had a bunch of mechanical difficulties. This hotel is always packed and I don't think they take enough care with maintenance.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: No hot water for three days - no warning either. Were told it was fixed find out the next morning its not. Two elevators working for 44 floors results in 20 minuted wait to get up and down. Was hung up on by the front desk when I called to ask about the hot water. Miserable three days. Did not seem like anyone really cared either. Would not have had the room compd had I not asked.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Everything was fine until I got out of the shower. The bathroom floor was full of water every time I took a shower. Needless to say I have to use the towels to clean the mess. At check out time, you have to wait at least 15 to 20 minutes for the elevator down.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Downtown location was perfect for customer visit. Very close to several good bars/pubs. Enter at street level, but must check-in on 2nd floor after elevator trip. Room was also a little trendy with bathroom sink. Had no place to put cosmetic bag on bathroom sink.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is an embarrassment to the Hilton brand. When I checked in there was no hot water all night. I could not take a shower when I checked in and could not take one when leaving in the morning. The staff was clueless about when the problem would be fixed. The elevators were slow and I had to wait for 20 mins each time to get on the elevators. Not an option to take stairs if you have to go up 20 flights with luggage. Rooms are narrow cramped and dated. Stay away from this place.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: On the whole my stay was fine. But I felt like the hotel was 'skimming' and this left a bad taste. Specifically: I hate paying for wifi, and the room service bill was $47 when I only ate and drank $30 worth of food and drink: $17 of tax, gratuity (not optional) and others. Oh - no bottle opener in the room so I cut my finger opening my beer.
user_name:
Justin B
Hong Kong, Hong Kong

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Terrible stay!! No complimentary water in rooms, rooms are noisy with aircon and extractor fans. The hotel is far from any good locations. They did not have any double adapters and told us to walk 5 blocks to buy 1 for $20. They also had NO HOT WATER in Freezing New York. They said there was a memo in the morning but we checked in late afternoon and never received anything!! They should have advised us when we checked in there would be no hot water the next day!! Cant wait to check out... All they said is they can give us a choc chip cookie!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We booked two rooms at the Doubletree for four nights via Hotwire. We wanted to stay in the Financial District because of its proximity to our son's college, Pace University. We also enjoy the historical sites and less touristy feel as compared with Times Square. This hotel is very conveniently located across the street from the Bowling Green subway station and a short walk from the Wall Street station. We enjoyed visiting the National Museum of the American Indian, Battery Park, and Trinity Church all very nearby. Our rooms were compact, like most in NYC, but clean and comfortable. The rooms were pretty quiet, there was some street noise but it is hard to avoid that in downtown NYC. The staff (and especially the bell staff, who we had the most contact with) were all very helpful and friendly. My only complaint would be that the wireless access was unreliable. Would recommend this location.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here in November 2013 and had a great time. One of my big pet peeves about visiting New York is how hard it is to find reasonably priced hotels that are clean and in a convenient location. My friends and I stayed here and loved it. It is incredibly clean and home to a very welcoming staff. Although people are still skiddish about staying in the financial district, it really is a great option. The advantages: hotels are a bit cheaper, there are always new restaurants to try, happy hours are quite lively, and its easy to get to a variety of subways. Right outside of this Doubletree hotel, there are 3 different subway lines within one block which makes it very easy to get to all parts of NYC. When it's too cold to venture out into the city, directly next door to this hotel is a quaint Irish Pub with fantastic service. And... just on the corner is a Duane Reed's which is good for stocking up on snacks or grabbing some needed over the counter medications. If you're really hungry but too tired to go out, you can always try the nice restaurant downstairs. I've stayed in NYC five times and of all my hotels, this is my favorite. I recommend this location for friend or family trips.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have been working in New York for three months and we just moved to a lower Wall Street office location. So I booked at this hotel very excited about the convenience. Previously, had stayed in a number of different NYC hotels in Midtown.Disappointed relative to the other NYC Hilton options. PRO: Great location on a small street. Only 2 blocks from my office. Decent breakfastCON: Very small rooms. They won't let me store a bag over the weekend in-between stays. I am a serial guest --- stay at same hotel for 2 - 5 weeks in a row. Keep a big bag at the hotel and a small carry-on over the weekend. This place will not let you store a bag -- they say it is because of "9-11". I have not encountered another property of any chain that has this same policy. When I asked for an alternative, they suggested a luggage storage location on 36th street -- which is only 45 blocks north!! Crazy. I have cancelled my remaining planned stays at this hotel. Hope they will consider changing this policy.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff was warm, friendly, welcoming and accommodating. Superb service. We were greeted with a warm cookie and a smile. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again. We had a great trip and look forward to coming back!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The location of this hotel is excellent . We walked to many of the places we wanted to visit . The value was great...especially in NYC.... for such a nice hotel. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat . The warm cookies upon arrival were a nice touch and made a great midnight snack.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: When I booked my room I was told that my rate included unlimited in/out privileges for valet parking, a free breakfast for children under 16 years old, my room would be quiet and not near an elevator, and that I would receive extra towels and stay on a Hilton Honors floor - absolutely none of which was accurate

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed this past weekend (March 14-15) at this hotel in the financial district. Arrived at about 8:00 pm on a Friday, received the cookie as promised, which was great. Check in smooth and waited for slow elevators. Staff is attune to elevator slowness and saw that I had waited a while and reversed an elevator from down to up, just for me.Got up to the room which was functional. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean. The bathroom is very compact. Nicely finished, but no room to put any toiletries as the one shelf contains the normal items like shampoo and conditioner. There were only two glasses in the room (2107) and both were made out of glass. Since there is no shelf space in the bathroom, I placed the glass on the back of the toilet. Well, that turned out to be a big mistake. What I did not realize is that the toilet in this room was not fully attached to the floor. Therefore, when the toilet was used, everything on the back of the toilet was thrown to the floor. The glass broke, and I had to deal with shards of glass on the floor. I did not have time to tell them at the front desk, but suggest that this problem be repaired before someone is hurt.Went to breakfast in the first floor restaurant, which is not owned by the hotel, but if you look at the website, you would never know that. The buffet and the menu are limited. I ended up with the buffet, which had eggs, sausage (which was terrible) bacon, potatoes and pancakes or waffles. There were two waiters who were also terrible, never came back to the table after I arrived and stood by the bar watching television. Someone who had a suit and tie on who looked like a manager saw my dishes on my table after I finished uncleared, and looked at them and kept going. Really bad service, better off leaving hotel and going to the nearby Burger King. Don't eat here.Finally, I asked about an early cab on Saturday night, and was told to come down and give the doormen 15 minutes to hail one. I did come down 15 minutes early, and was told to walk up the street and try and find one. In other words, "good luck!"The room was good, but would not stay here again, Also, financial district is like a ghost town on weekends, a long way from the hub bub of New York. Double tree, please bolt the toilet down!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have stayed at the DoubleTree by Hilton in NYC, Financial District (8 Stone St) from 8th of March till 15th of March. During my stay, I have been assigned a room right across from the lifts. The quality of the room was quite average - the ceiling in the bathroom was pealing, the wall paper was coming off in the bathroom and the bedlinen on more than one occassion was dirty and ripped in several spots. The worst thing that has happened was on the last day of my stay when I arrived back to the hotel - several of my personal items have been missing. I have asked to speak to the hotel manager and on two occassions have ended up speaking to the receptionist. Maybe I am not worthy of hotel manager's time or the theft is not a reason enough to see a client. After waiting for over a half an hour for someone to show up, the receptionist and security guy have rocked up. The security guy has taken some notes on what was missing from the room and has suggested that it may just be that the store I have purchased the stuff hasn't packed these items. Out of 4 items missing, 2 were purchased as separate items in separate stores. The other two items arrived with me in a suitcase. After clarifying that, they have advised me that they will investigate the matter and get back to me. All I have received is an email stating how they will contact general management to discuss the situation and they will advise me of the outcome. No email or phone call and it has been 3 days. If you are reading this, here is a hint - there is a camera in the hallway which could give you exactly the view of who has accessed my room while I was away. The camera is positioned right before the entrance into the lift and it gives you a view of my door and the lift across the road.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The check in experience was quick and friendly, which is what you need when you check in at midnight. The location is very convenient for my business in the financial district. The room was as expected, clean and functional. The internet, as with most American hotels was ridiculously expensive, but was quick. My biggest issues are: The wind noise in this hotel is terrible, it kept me awake from 2AM. The breakfast took 40 minutes for ham & eggs not to arrive and then I left. I will not stay in this hotel again and will probably go to mid-town and travel down.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is 40 stories, and has 3 unreliable elevators, and no freight elevator. No building in the financial center I've ever been in has so few. After waiting 10 minutes for an elevator on the 34th fl. I phoned reception to inquire whether the elevators were out of service. I was told that, no, there were just "an unusually large number of guests checking out." I.e. this happens regularly.There were other issues--room service dishes lying out in the narrow hallways for over 12 hours etc., but the above is for me a dealbreaker. Will not stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was very nice and guest services was very friendly however, I did appreciate room service knocking on my door at 9:15am and then again at 11am to clean my room. I wanted to relax but felt like I was being kicked out. The water in the bathroom took 10-15 mins to get warm so I was running a little late to an event I was attending.
user_name:
Natasha T
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My son and I just spent a couple of nights at this very nice Manhatton hotel in the Wall Streetdistrict (only 1 1/2 blocks from famous bull). The warm chocalote chip cookie given to us atcheckin was to die for. We had terrific steaks at the on premise restaurant. The rooms werefairly large and comfortable with my room having a terrific view of the Hudson River.I had lost my luggage so the front desk provided all the toiletries I needed gratis. Wifi wasalso gratis including the morning newspapers (both Wall Street Journal and USA Today).I highly recommend this property with the oly negative I can think of being fairly narrow hallways.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here three days. Hotel is very nice and up-to-date. Great atmosphere and great customer service. The hotel was close to everywhere we wanted to go. Right around the corner from wall street and many SHOPS! Our weekend getaway went smooth. You also get a delicious cookie when you check in. :)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have heard from many travelers that New York hotels are small and expensive. I was pleasantly surprised to find the room at the Hilton in the Financial District to have enough room and pricing reasonable. The staff, from the doorman, front desk and in between are extremely professional and friendly. I would recommend this location to my friends, family and coworkers- Wonderful experience!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location if you are doing business within the financial district of New York. Rooms were much smaller than I expected however, the cutomer service received at the front desk outweighed the size of the room. Very impressed with the professionalism; courtesy and assistance (answering questions about the metro; providing directions, etc.).
user_name:
Cheryl S
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We were thrilled by the overall service, courteousness, and thoughtfulness of Tony (bellman) and Sam (security). SPECIAL RECOGNITION must go to these two individuals for their amazing tact and service storing our personal items/luggage, their greeting and help. The front desk staff was wonderful also and accommodated our request of a high floor with a view of the city. A well appointed hotel with the DoubleTree touch of all guests receiving a freshly warmed cookie upon arrival!
user_name:
David A
Port Jefferson, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for two nights. Not much to do in the area, but the hotel room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The cookies at check in were great. The front desk staff was helpful getting me the information I needed to catch the train to Times Square.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: AT $250 a night and up, it's not affordable, but the staff are very very kind, and the hotel is clean. It's just not ideal, but perhaps nothing is in Manhattan. Noise from the hallway, a loud heating system, hot water is iffy.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Everyone at the Doubletree Hotel was wonderful! Very welcoming, helpful & respectful. Especially Sam (security), & Tony (Bellman) - they were fantastic when it was time for us to check out.And we LOVED the chocolate chip cookies!
user_name:
Laura K
Port Jefferson, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms are small, very small but clean. The location was great for a winter weekend. The area was dead compared to a weekday. We got to enjoy some of the nicer bars and restaurants in the area that weren't crowded at all. The room was also quite and the service was helpful. The bathroom was a little dingy, but sufficed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Just spent a couple of nights in this reasonably priced, nicely located hotel. The chocolate chipcookie they give you at checkin is to die for. The rooms were large enough and well appointedalthough the hallways were rather narrow. I had lost my luggage so they provided all theitems I needed gratis. There is an excellent restaurant on premises and a nice little Irish barright next door. Located just a block or two from Wall Street and a block from the "bull".

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed at this hotel this past weekend and I was very impressed! We did alot of research before choosing a hotel in NYC because of so many bed bug reports. We are happy to say that this hotel was clean, with a very comfortable bed, updated clean bathroom, great customer service, tasty fresh cookies on arrival and is completely free of bed bugs :) Only downside was that the room (especially the bathroom) was on the small side but that's to be expected in Manhattan! We will stay here again!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Although it's a little far from Midtown, the Subway is easily accessible from here. Checking in a little bit of a hassle as there is not much room on the street to pull up without being in the way of traffic. Elevators can be very slow, especially during daylight hours. Great modern decor in the rooms, fairly spacious for New York. Lots of dining within easy walking distance, and convenient to Battery Park and the Staten Island Ferry. Breakfast was all right, nothing special. Pretty good value for this brand & location.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very close to Bowling Green subway station and Staten Island ferry. Quiet part of the city but good place to stay if you need to work or visit FiDi. Typical small elevators and small rooms, but clean and safe. There are several restaurants within walking distance but many of them close fairly early. The small but nice Italian restaurant at the hotel stays open until 11 on week nights. You can usually find last minute deals during winter for $160 or so (much better than nearby hotels).
user_name:
TravelGrlCT
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Staff extremely helpful, friendly AND service needs are met "right away." Could tell staff is happy. Rooms sparkling clean and newly carpeted; room smelled fresh not sprayed; comfy beds; soft towels. Nice views. Great prices. Great location. Subway right across street. Fabulous restaurants all within walking distance. Would def stay here again while in NYC and recommend to all.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Gentleman at the counter at check in was SO great! Very accommodating. Rooms were clean, had a great view. Very small space, but to be expected in NYC. Ordered room service for breakfast, just ok. Overall a good stay. Would stay again!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Our family weekend in NYC was a great success and a lot of that had to due with the Doubletree Financial District and their dedicated, guest oriented staff. From check-in to check-out the staff did their best to make us feel welcome. The hotel was clean and well kept. The bell staff was wonderful, helping with directions and so accommodating storing our luggage after check-out so that we could continue touring. We would definitely recommend this hotel for business or leisure travel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Overall the stay was good. Here are a few issues I had: Room Service: At times the contacting room service can be an issue. The phone would ring and ring and no one would pick up. Street Noise: Not sure if anything can be done about this but street noise woke me up almost every night during my stay. Room temperature: The thermostat did seem to work correctly. Either you had to leave the heat running continuously or turn it off altogether.
user_location: New York - Financial District, United States
user_name:
Joseph D M
New York - Financial District, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: It was a great stay and a reasonable price. The only thing that did bother me was the fact that i found somebody else's socks underneath my bed which i checked the room prior to our stay. But the hospitality and warm cookie was great
user_name:
Janet W
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good hotel. Really liked the cookie on check in. The staff in the hotel were great, but the staff in the restaurant were a bit condescending. My pet hate is paying for wifi! My room was comfortable, but a colleague had a heating issue and her room was freezing. Good location for business.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Right in the heart of WallSt Alley and and steps away from the stock exchanges, this hotel offers all the amenities of a good business hotel but has the feel of a small boutique. The staff was friendly and helpful despite the fact that our large group checked in all at once. The room may feel small for those not staying in NYC hotels, but it is actually quite adequate. The rooms are modern, tastefully decorated. Bathrooms were clean and also well decorated. Bed soft and comfy. I highly recommend a stay if you need to be in the financial district.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: What a friendly crowd--in nyc, yet--from the door man to the bell hop to the reception staff. Rooms and halls are typically small new york, but updated, clean and comfortable. Decent lobby with business area computers including free b/w printing. The boutique-size restaurant is inviting; I did not happen to eat there. A king bedroom is lower priced than two queens, but get solid discounts from area businesses w/links to the hotel. Chocolate chip cookie when you register. A pleasant surprise in all--and thanks for noting if this was helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The DoubleTree hotel is conveniently located in the Financial District. Great for doing business. On a quite street with several restaurant choices near by. The rooms are clean and modern. Nice bar and restaurant on property, but they are very small.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel location is great. Being an older hotel it has issues. Hot water would work in sink and not shower and vice versa each day. Flip a coin. Half of the elevators were out on one day so wait time was 30 minutes for an elevator. The rooms were relatively spacious for being in NYC. Staff was terrific.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We have made weekend getaway trips to NYC previously, but have always stayed mid town. As our focus this time was Tribeca, SoHo and Greenwich Village, we found the Doubletree, Stone Street to be a reasonable location. Adjacent subway access allowed us to make good use of our time. As others have noted, the hotel has somewhat of a claustrophobic feel , the entranceway (two floors below) the lobby, the hallways and the rooms all being Lilliputian in scale. That said, our room was clean, the beds comfortable and the staff - from the security at street level to the front desk agents were courteous, friendly and helpful. We were satisfied with our weekend, but just didn't think the hotel, with it's quirky television system, limited lounge, food and toiletry shopping options, lack of included wireless, and modest appointments quite managed what we expect from a four star experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The double tree is located in stone street, fine if you are on business trip, still ok for city trip due to nearby metro. Room was very very small, double bedroom feels like a closet. With freezing temps outside, room was cold and windy. Bed very good though. Shower hot/cold. Staff on the other hand are very friendly and will do their very best to fix problems or arrange your trip. Taxi guys from the hotel are very nice. Irish pub nextdoor is good for a beer (or 2). Didn't have breakfast at hotel, enough nice places nearby.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: No executive lounge,not even a voucher for a drink just that stupid cookie and noisy people outside the room . Doorbanging and no soundproofing complete this terribble hotel. Got ann upgrade to 44 th floor for being hilton honors vip (haha) ....out of the probably 120 to 150 hilton and doubletrees i kow this was the worst. Really..... A no go !

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great hotel overall. I caught a few very cold and windy days in NY. Outside I was very, very cold. For some reason, beneath the heating system, there was a lot of cold air coming in. I had to cover the area with pillows to stop somehow the cold air from coming in. Rooms were very clean and nice, staff very helpful and friendly. Very pleasant stay just a bit chilly.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: When my reservation with another local Hotel didn't go as planned (Super owl weekend), I walked over to the Hilton on Stone street in tears, praying they had rooms available. The staff was extremely accommodating, and welcoming. Josh was able to book the room for me immediately. Although there was a slight hold up with paperwork, I was still able to check in, without any further delay. After the afternoon I'd had, I had such a migraine, I passed out immediately, to complete silence! It was a godsend. Hats off to the BEST Hotel staff in the financial district: Josh, Kamiesha, and Kadeem. Thank you for always making my stay so pleasurable, and thank you for the top notch customer service. You guys could teach the other hotels a thing or two about OUTSTANDING customer service. SN: The restaurant downstairs offers an AWESOME breakfast.
user_name:
Keisa J
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was overall very good experience. It was very reasonable and the room was very clean. The service was very good. The only aveager experience I had was breakfast in the morning. I would recommend this to any one. I trave alot and exceded my expectadtions based monthly rate.
user_name:
Josephanthony A
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel:So the Marriott was sold out and I decided to stay here as it was closer to my work site. Big mistake! The first room that I was given was directly out of the elevator. Because I didn't want to hear dings in my sleep, I asked to be moved and they did. The second room was very small but I was only going to stay until the end of the week and it was closer to my work site, I'll live. My colleague is a rewards member and he stated that his room was very roomy. Just what you want to hear. Also, the elevators (3) take very long to arrive.Room Service:I only ordered once, but the Penne More Monte from the infamous "Ancora" restaurant was not good . I probably should have eaten in, but the restaurant was very crowded and I just wanted to relax after a long day. My experience was as bad as going through the drive through at McDonald's. Cold Calamari, no marinara, bread no butter, and lettuce nothing more. No cucumbers which I specifically asked for.Small rooms, bad food, not what you want while traveling

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We arrived for an overnight stay (2/1/14-2/2/14) and arrived super early, 8:00 am because we had somewhere to be. The hotel was able to check us in! Sam & Lemi were super nice! Their delicious cookies weren't even ready yet so they told us to come back later.....and sure enough, we got them. The room was super clean and roomy for NYC. We were on the 42nd floor and it was very quiet. Thanks Doubletree!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Upon arrival the water was out in the entire hotel and I could not shower. There was also a large stain on the bedspread. The rate seemed reasonable for a Double tree BUT I will never return to this hotel!
user_name:
Bryan K
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: when we arrived we were given a nice warm cookie accompanied by a beautiful receptionist, and bottle water.the bell boy was great help us out with taxis, etc.. Loyld was simply brillant fellow out inthe cold wet weather , n recommend a couple of places to go and at the time where the city never sleeps haha ! the rooms were small and newly redecorated but the designer made it just right! nice going. most hotels in new York have no space at all the door hits the toilet etc. but this room ad it all figure it , wifi, restaurant, the only thing they were missing was a starbucks which was right down the block haha the service was excellent and the quest relations manager whom was pregnant ,oriental women was outstanding you just and couldn't ask for a better service kind smiling friendly n in a snow storm n all just a great stay thank u thank u thank u..

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: amazing and upscale hotel. treated with respect and class. I love the area and the rooms they offer. 10/10 by far! everything you need is around this hotel. Times Square is one train away and plenty of restaurants and bars around the area too. the views from the rooms are amazing too of the Hudson river.
user_name:
Scottie L
Silver Spring, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights late January and was given a room on the 33 rd floor. The room was not big but it was good one person. Heater worked well as it was critical during the height of winter albeit it being a bit noisy. In fact, noise was the only gripe I have but it was bearable. The door is thin and the hallway narrow, so I can hear people walking pass, pulling their bags and my neighbour's door opening and closing. Every morning, I was woken up by the creaking and gurgling noise of water(people using their showers upstairs). It happened pretty early, around 6.30 am. Just as well, I was jet lagged and fell asleep shortly after the ritual morning 'noise'.That aside, location is fantastic with several subway lines a stone's throw away. The Staten Island ferries is 2 short blocks away as well. During the weekdays, little cafés, good carts, restaurants and taverns provide a good choice for food options. After 7 pm and weekends, the place is dead. It was ok gorgeous me as I like to get away from the madding crowd in the evening.2 bottles of water were provided daily and wifi is complimentary if you are a Hilton a Honors member. Around the corner is a Duane Reade where you scab get drinks, snacks and any toiletries... All in all a good stay. I will return the next time I am in NYC.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have stayed here several times since it opened and I like it. The location is very convenient for all the subways and I prefer being away from the hustle and bustle of midtown when I get back to my hotel. The rooms are a little on the small side but that is NYC for you. I have stayed at many different times of the year and have found the air con a bit noisy. I would advise against some of the top floors if you are bothered by noise from the fans on the roof. The hotel is tall and thin ie there are not many rooms on each floor. One small niggle is that the elevators (lifts!) can take a long time to come especially at about 7:30 or 8am. I find the front desk staff very helpful and friendly. This hotel does not ooze luxury and sophistication but it is a very solid and comfortable business hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I came to NYC for a business trip and my purse was stolen with my ID, Phone and credit cards. The hotel security on duty offered to help me get to the police station to file a report, make sure I was able to get to the bank and assisted with replacing my cell phone. The concierge brought me waters and a breakfast voucher to make my stay better. They were so friendly and helpful and made such a huge difference in an otherwise very stressful day. I travel for business to the city often and will definitely return to this hotel because of my first experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a great hotel. Rooms are small but for a 1-2 night stay it works well. Rooms are nice and the location is perfect. Only issue is the bathroom. There is zero counter space. You have to use the back of the toilet for any of your toiletries. Even with this issue, I would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The entire staff was phenomenal! One employee in particular, Hopton constantly went out of his way for my wife, daughter and me and truly made our stay a remarkable one. In fact, we plan to visit NYC again in the summer and will be booking this same hotel again because he treated us so well. Also, the room was fantastic with a view of the Freedom Tower!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I love staying in the Financial District and I've stayed at a bunch of hotels there. I really enjoyed my stay at the Doubletree. The room was fine- no issues, plenty of drawer and counter space. There was an in room safe for my laptop and several electrical outlets for all my chargers. The bed was comfortable and had lots of pillows. Even in the bitter cold temps I am always too warm and the thermostat allowed good control of the room temp. We didn't have any issues waiting for elevators but it was the middle of January when it wasn't really that crowded.The check-in/check-out process was quick and efficient and I love that they have a little shop in the lobby that is open 24 hours. They call it a gift shop but it's really drinks and snacks. In all honesty, it's great when you wander back at 2 in the morning feeling a little tipsy to be able to buy a bottle or two of water right there for the morning when you wake up. And the front desk staff was always very nice. OH - and those warm cookies when you checkin!!! Best idea ever!!I would definitely stay here again - I really liked the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We needed a decent hotel room after seeing a show in Manhattan. We live in NJ, and the show ended too late for us to catch mass transit back home. I found this room on the Hilton Honors website, and it was conveniently located to subways. The hotel was clean, modern and comfortable, and the staff was very helpful. No complaints.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I can say I was not sure what to expect as some reviewers had hit this place a bit hard. I really enjoyed it. All that has been said here about room size is true, but the room is quite fine. It s well pointed despite it's size. My wife and I stayed in our room with a five year old, and we were all happy. The location is great with many subways to choose from within 2 blocks. You can get anywhere you need. The Staten Island ferry is right there, it is always good for a ride. The bar next door runs a decent little happy hour. There is a pharmacy two doors down for supplies. Overall, a great location, the staff was more than accommodating, and made my child feel like the most important guest in the place. I will always appreciate that. The only negative I would have is to say that as a parent with a child, I have to retrieve things from under the bed more than most. While not dirty, a better job could be done vacuuming under the bed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel during a business trip so I am unaware of the cost. However, I would it perfectly located in the heart of the financial district, close to several metro and ferry stops with plenty of places to eat and unwind. However, I did learn that the financial district becomes a ghost town during the weekend. The hotel room ad bathroom were small but enjoyable and clean. The room's decor and amenities seem updated (TV, stands, light, etc.). Wifi was slow and pillows too thin but nothing that a good 4G/LTE connection and pillow stacking cannot fix. Staff were courteous and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The entire staff of this Doubletree were very pleasant. I checked in to my room during the height of a NYC snow storm with very cold weather. When I got to my room a huge cold draft was pouring into the room. It was late and I just turned up the heat to counter act. On my way out the next morning I asked the staff to have someone resolve. When I got back to my room that night I found bathroom towels stuffed all around the heating unit and a bunch of drywall debris on the floor. I would expect this from a lesser cost chain, certainly not a Hilton property. I was there three nights and one morning there was only luke warm water. Again, I am not surprised when I encounter issues at lower cost chains but I get very irritated when it happens at a Hilton. The workout room is very nice and the staff were great but I know there are other chains in this area that are lower cost with a more functional room.
user_name:
Michael S D
Parker, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for 3 nights while in NYC on business. This is a nice business hotel in the Financial District. It has average sized rooms for a hotel in NYC. I'm more of a Marriott person, but would stay here again.
user_name:
Eric L
Millville, New Jersey, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was a perfectly adequate hotel for us. Despite a lot of reviews complaining about room size we found ours absolutely fine (double) and bathroom was adequate. A hook for the towels on the back of the door and a shelf above the basin would be beneficial but not really a big deal if staying for a couple of days only.There are a lot of rooms on each floor and as such we could hear everything from the TV to the conversations but then it was possible those guests were particularly noisy. The concierge was a bit rude and unhelpful to start with but she did follow up with our request and made sure we were happy with the reservation and transport so this was much a appreciated.Location was good, we really were doing mainly things in the financial/Soho area so suited us but we also went out further and it was no trouble at all.  Housekeeping was just OK, one day our room was not cleaned until after 4pm. Oh and the bed was so very comfortable. Unlike other reviews we had no problem with the lifts, never had to wait long and we were on the 29th floor.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was okay. the room was very small - I haven't stayed in a room this small in NY in a long time. I was on the 19th floor and had absolutely NO view. The bathroom was REALLY small and challenging to work around in. I stayed here during the big snow storm and the staff were very accommodating. They had their car service take me to the airport hotel in a blizzard. Much better than a cab!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Nice hotel, great location for world trade centre and easy to access subways to get to midtown, but if always going to midtown it can be annoying to factor in time and cost of catching subways. Could hear some noise from people on the streets overnight when on the lower levels, upper level was quiet. Beds were comfortable. Lift took 15 mins to stop at our level. There was also no hot water when we stayed there and it was freezing outside, however we were moved to an available room which did have hot water.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We've just returned from a 5 day stay & we were very impressed with this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The warm cookie was a nice touch after a long journey and being able to use the computers in the lobby to check-in online was extremely useful. Our room was very spacious and clean, with a huge, comfortable bed. We had no issues with the lifts despite being on the 37th floor and our showers were always hot. When we reported an issue with the safe in our room this was fixed within half an hour. Location wise this hotel couldn't be better, with easy access to all major subway lines. We would definitely stay here again and recommend to others.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Traveling from Philadelphia to NYC by car requires a hotel that offers cheap or free parking. In past visits, we stayed in Queens at a hotel that offered free parking. The accommodations weren't very attractive. This time, we traveled by Train into the City and left our car at home. This location was PERFECT for such a trip. There are several train stops within a VERY SHORT walk of the hotel that can take you into Times Square or down into Brooklyn. The 9/11 Memorial & entrance to the Brooklyn Bridge are nearby. If you stay here and want an INCREDIBLE NYC style bagel - go to Leo's! Pricey but AMAZING. Future NYC trips will have us staying at the Doubletree in the Financial District! Clean, Affordable, Nice rooms etc..

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel is very conveniently located in downtown Manhattan. Within 2 blocks of any subway you may need. The restaurant (Ancora) offers one of the best New York style Italian meals you will find in New York. The hotel staff is amazingly friendly and makes a point of greeting you and welcoming you, not just the front desk either. Great value, great location, and I am a local New Yorker!
user_name:
Bryan J
Port Washington, NY, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: First time in NYC with a friend. We knew rooms would be small but presently suprised that our room was quite decent and bed was comfy. Out bathroom was small but we managed. What we did struggle with was the lack of hot water. When we checked in we were told they had a problem, but it seemed as though it would be fixed by morning. My friend prefers to shower at night, and there was a short amount before turning cold. I showered in morning...no problems. The second night we were up until 2am waiting for hot water until finally they let my friend use an empty room to shower in. The next morning I had a cold shower as I couldn't be bothered waiting but on our last morning there was hot water again. It seems to be a big issue for this hotel, but they were very apologetic and helpful. Gave us breakfast vouchers each morning and compensated us one night of our stay. Hallways are noisy and elevators slow, but if the hot water problem was fixed, I would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stay here frequently. The hotel staff are wonderful. Helpful, gracious and professional. The rooms are comfortable. Cable is a little dicey every now and then and elevators are sometimes slow. In general, the hotel is a accommodating and a nice place to stay in lower Manhattan. The hotel restaurant was recently taken over by an italian restaurant across the street. The food is ok. Salmon was overcooked. Room service is very slow. Took almost 2 hours to get my dinner, even after calling twice. Thankfully, there are some great restaurants near by on Stone St.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I've stayed here multiple times for business and have enjoyed my stay each time. I've run into some issues with the hot water not working but that was many months ago and I think they were doing some work on the building that explained the issue. Check-in is always a breeze and you can't beat the DoubleTree cookies!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for 11 nights, from december 19 to december 30. We chose this hotel based on the prices, very good for the time, during the holidays, in New York City, it was almost too good to be true. I read some reviews on trip advisor, and should know what to expect - too many floors, slow and crowded elevators, small rooms... And some people talking about problems with hot water, that seemed to be a punctual problem, as explained in staff apologies. (Not a one time problem, it seems....)The rooms? Well, for me, then were very good! Spacious, good bed, tv, coffee machines... No fridge, but that wasn't a problem. No free wifi, something that seems essencial in any hotel this days, but I already knew that when we booked.The bathroom was clean, had a good shower, until.... Oh, yeah. We ran out of hot water. For four days. The last days on out trip!The first day, we got at the hotel by night, I took a hot shower, my boyfriend went after me and... Cold, freezing water. The next day, freezing water all day long. When we woke up, and when we came back in the night. We called the desk and the response was that in maybe half an hour it would be fixed. An hour later the water was cold, not freezing, but not ok for a bath - it was 2 degrees celsius outside, come on! With no other thing to do, cold shower it is...The following day the water was completely freezing, impossible to bait. The staff told us something was wrong with the pipes and the water pumping to higher floors (we were on the 29th floor), but they had people working on it, since it was december 29 and the hotel was full, we expected the problem to be solved. But that was not the case. We came home on a 8 hour flight without a proper bath on our last day in the city. Yikes. Cold-and-fast-almost-losing-my-fingers-as-they-freeze baths are not nice, people!Besides that, the hotel staff was always very nice, everyone was very attentious and friendly. The elevator was not that bigger deal... On "rush hours" it took a little more, but nothing to complain about that. The welcome cookie was yummy! The location was very good, near to numerous subway lines and good places to eat. It's a pity that a hotel that could be perfect had such a problem. A basic thing like the lack of hot water can ruin a whole experience.... :(

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
