review_body: I spend 8 nights (Dec 30 to Jan 7) at this DoubleTree with my friend and he’s family in two different rooms since we were a party of five,We had problems with the shower’s hot water twice, once in the morning and once in the night loosing that morning (2) hours of our day because the people in the front desk told my friend “let it run a couple minutes that it will warm up” it was a waste of water and of OUR time, we also had problems with the cleaning of our room the bathroom wasn’t clean after room service, and we found our PJ’s thrown in the floor. Also it took nearly 30 minutes the first day to use the elevator to go to the lobby, after that experience we decided to always climb down by stairs.Reviewing some opinions here, we now know that there is a policy of giving a warm cookie when you check in, that never happened to us, also they told us that the WiFi was only free in the lobby area, we look our devices in the room, and they had intermittent access to internet, also reviewing here we see that WiFi is Free, so what about that???We had a very bad experience at the Check Out time because the lady at front desk was very rude towards us, especially against my friend and he’s mother just because he ask for some sort of proof that the hotel will not charge he’s credit card because they charge him without telling him 300 USD “for incidental purposes” absurdly enough the RUDE front desk lady gave him a recipt for a local phone call that he already paid.As my friend already said here: WE never expected that we experienced such experiences in a Hotel of such category.Absolutely horrible, we do not recommend this hotel at all!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I spend with my family holidays in New York from Dec 30 to Jan 7 at the DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel New York City - Financial District. We did have a great time in NYC, but our experience in the DoubleTree, was rather sour, in which we stayed in two different rooms in two different floors (party of 5). First I must say that the hotel is very well located, near to a couple of subway stations and several landmarks, BUT, we had regrettable inconveniences at the Hotel.Lack of Hot water! We had a tight schedule to spend all the time we could in our activities, but on Jan 2 at 7:30 am there was no hot water in neither room or floor, the lady in the front desk first told me to “let it run a couple minutes” but after 20 mins and 3 different calls she send the engineer that didn’t do much difference 45 mins later and after all the other members of my family had to shower with cold water, they send me to an empty room to use the shower, in the 4th floor, the shower in this other room wasn’t clean ( I later inform it to front desk) and had not hot water, the same engineer of before went and after 15 mins. I could shower; we end up leaving the hotel at 9:30, losing two valuable hours. When we came back in the night, after the snow storm we wanted to get in the room and had a hot shower, again, no hot water, when I called front desk they told me to “let it run about 20 mins. full pressure in both the shower and the sink”, (what a waste of water). But I did, and only after 35 mins. there was hot water. Deplorable room service, in the 8 nights that we stayed we never had a really good room service cleaning, we found at night when we returned to the hotel that neither bathroom was really clean, room service only take the used towers, leave clean ones and spray some cleaning product a little bit around. Also we found our pajamas thrown in the floor like if they were rags or something when we actually leave it over the beds.The elevator thing is just plain wrong planning (44 floors and about 12 rooms per floor [approximated guess] and just 3 lifts??) during rush hours we rather climb down by stairs (we stayed in the 11 and 12 level) than to stay waiting more than 20 min to get to the lobby.But the worst of our experience at the DoubleTree was the HORRIBLE GUEST SERVICE by the hotel STAFF especially by the front desk staff,(but I feel obligated to say that the bell hops or doorman’s were really nice and help us out a lot). First, the lady that did our Check In didn’t told us that the hotel actually charge you 300 dollars PER room to cover “incidents”, usually, hotels around the world DO ask you to leave a voucher open with your credit card for incidental purposes but they never charge you (unless there IS an incident) and they tear it up if there is not incident at the moment you check out. I have a notification system from my bank that tells me whenever my card is charged, so after I saw the charge I confronted the people in the front desk but the lady that did my Check In wasn’t there, the response was that it was a hotel policy. Me and my party have travel many places, Europe, South America and many places in the USA and the Caribbean and we never had to deal with such policy.In other hand whenever we ask for something (information or when we complaint because of the lack of hot water or that the room’s phone didn’t work (that happened a lot also) )the response was in most cases unfriendly, hostile and in sometimes even aggressive. But the worst guest “service” happened the night we checked out, the lady that did our check out had the worst attitude toward us and he offended me and my family. My parents don´t speak much English but friendly people in service industries always finds a way to skip language barriers; my mom went to the front desk before the rest of us and ask the lady in the front desk to help her to find a taxi that drove us to the airport, she treat her with little or no respect and told her that SHE ONLY SPEAKS ENGLISH and that she couldn´t understand a thing my mother said; all of this in a very disrespectful tone that overpass the language barrier, then my mother ask her to do all the formalities for our Check Out, the hotel lady did understand that, and told her that we need to do nothing, because there was no incidents and everything was paid already (weird that she could understand that UHH?¡).When I went down my mother told me all that happen, and when I confront the lady she told me that she didn´t understand anything my mother said and that was all, I told her that I needed something that proves that we had no incidents and that if my money wasn´t returned to my credit card I could disputed, she told me that there was nothing she could give but a receipt of the payment that I did from local call I made from the room for 1 dollar and 70 cents, so I told her that it was very risky for us to leave the hotel and NY, without the money that they charge us in the Check In and no proof on NO incidents. She told me that it was a POLICY of EVERY hotel in the US to do such thing, and insisted that there was nothing else she could do, all of this in the most aggressive tone. I replied her that I worked years ago in a Hotel in the US and that they didn’t do that, her answer was “what hotel did you worked at” my answer was: that information is not important right now, but if you must know it was a golf resort in the middle east. Her answer was “ Well, a golf resort is quite different, and that’s our policy” I told her that she needed to dial down a notch and that this was not the way to treat guest’s.My mother told me that she would never return to that or any Hilton Hotel ever.All of the things that I just describe are ABSOLUTLY truth and I do NOT work or represent anything but myself and my family interests and we DO NOT belong to any Hotel or any competition , and I’m willing to back up my testimony to any Hilton representative if approach by them. We never expected that we experienced such experiences in a Hotel of such category.Absolutely horrible!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is a great steal for Manhattan. The hotel is tucked away, and the rooms are sized Parisian style - with about 2 feet on either side of the bed but I knew that coming here and we didn't travel to NYC to spend our time in the room. There was not a long wait for the elevators as previously reviewed. In fact the only complaint that I have is that one of our neighbors ordered room service the first night of our stay and the tray sat in the hallway until our last day (about 2 1/2 nights) but yet our rooms were attended each day. Just a minor oversight on the part of housekeeping. Also, I recommend purchasing tickets to the museums or other attractions from the concierge if able. We spoke to the concierge about our itinerary and they offered to purchase tickets for us there and we declined, only to stand in line for 40 minutes at the Museum of Natural History and then opt out of the 1 1/2 hour ticket line at the USS Intrepid.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Worst experience we've had with a Hilton Brand Hotel. Much of it to be blamed on the location. Parking is inconvenient and very expensive. Rooms were very small, but neat and clean. Ice Machine was extremely noisy during the night, didn't have time to report it. Restaurant experience was very bad. We never understood the problem. We were told they had problem and it would take an hour. After 90 minutes we walked out having never been offered a menu or refills on water and soft drinks or further explanation of the problem.
user_name:
Robert R
Newport News, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This room met all my expectations except for the drone of the heating system. It was very responsive to our temperature adjustments, which is great, but the the fan on the heater was more of a medium-loud drone rather than a low hum.
user_name:
Mary Jo K
Denver, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at the Doubletree on New Year's day and got a great price. The room was clean, but the television did not work. I called the front desk and he tried to talk me through fixing it. That didn't work and he did offer to come up, but it was late and I was already in my pjs, so I declined.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel did not have our suite available until 2 days later. They rented it to someone else. We did not have hot water, nor did other guests. The restaurant ran out of food everyday. The first day, we waited 45 mins to get into the restaurant. The reason, no clean tables. Servers were extremely rude. We wasted our vouchers since we couldn't eat there. The upstairs bathroom had a leak and dropped water on my 7 year old while she was using the bathroom. Elevators took too long and were always crowded. No waters left in the room nor a refrigerator. The noise from the other rooms and the hallways was unbearable. The housekeeping and the in-room dining staff were in the hallway at midnight and 3 am. Both times they woke us up, and both times we asked them to quiet down. Nether person spoke a word when addressed and the noise level continued for 30 more minutes. The small children in the room were awoken.
user_name:
Christopher W
Myrtle Beach, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The one thing about this hotel that was surprisingly good was the friendliness of the staff. Everybody was cheery and nice and I would add a half star to my overall rating if I could. Other than that it was a clean, quiet and comfortable room, about average for New York. Not luxury, but good enough. There are good restaurants nearby, and the hotel is a short walk from several subway stations. I don't usually drive to NYC, but had reasons to do so on this trip, and the parking garage where the hotel offers discounted parking was easy to get to and nearby. I would certainly stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Good value and great location for subway system. Significantly cheaper than mid-town hotels for a family weekend, yet with multiple subways within two blocks, it is very easy to get around NYC. Especially convenient to attend events at the Barclay Center in nearby Brooklyn.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Got a great deal on this hotel for $120 a night in December. The location is convenient to the Bowling Green Subway station and just a couple blocks from the Wall Street & Rector Street stations as well. It's in the heart of the financial district on a quiet side street. Staying here was an escape from all the hustle and bustle and I enjoyed it. Of course the rooms are modest in size, but very modern and in my opinion, nicer than a number of Hilton "name brand" properties I've stayed at. The staff was friendly and put me in a room with a fantastic view of the city. Warm cookie at check in is a nice touch. My only complaint was the elevators are very slow. But that's almost to be expected staying in a high-rise in Manhattan. Overall a fantastic experience and would stay again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We booked this hotel after finding a great deal on Booking.com (£441 for four nights) and it was worth every penny. I am speechless at some of the reviews on here so if you want a truthfull and honest review then read on. My husband and I are in our early thirties and have travelled the world, staying in both budget and luxury accommodation so I would say that we have enough experience to rate this hotel!Welcome - the lobby is located on the first floor - who cares! There is always a door man/member of staff on hand to point you in the right direction. The receptionist was quick and efficient and sent us on our way with a yummy, warm cookie.Room - we had a standard double (1510) and it was a perfect size, with a small wardrobe and plenty of other space to pop our belongings. The bathroom was more than adequate and for those who complained about the size of the shower.... you need to lose some weight! Both me and my husband could fit in! Great water pressure and the bed was ridiculously comfortable. Brilliant choice of channels on the TV and the heating could be tailored to your ideal temperature.Elevators/lift - I can only guess that it is the fatties again complaining about this! When we took the lift, you could bet a tenner that whoever was in it would be complaining about the wait and it got quite boring! The longest we waited was about 4 minutes and once you are in they are pretty quick. Unbelievable what frustrates some people.Location- perfect for us. So peaceful and Bowling Green and Whitehall subway stations are literally moments away. When you go from the hotel towards Whitehall stop off at the deli on the left hand side. I have no idea what it is called but they do the best roast beef sandwichs so grab one on your way to the train or the Staten Island ferry!New York is fabulous and if we go again we will book this hotel and also recommend to our friends!Whilst you are there go to Brooklyn Bridge followed by a pizza lunch at Grimaldis. Check out Toloache mexican for a gorgeous dinner before a show and Flex Mussells for a super yummy fishy treat complete with excellent wine! Enjoy!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Nice hotel with a very friendly and helpful staff. Unfortunately, during our stay (December), they were experiencing problems with their boiler -- thus hot water for showering was inconsistent at best. The bathroom looked great, but was not very practical -- it lacked flat surfaces to place toiletries on or hooks for hanging fresh clothes or towels. Having said that, the staff was exceptionally pleasant and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Doubletree on Stone Street in New York City offers a great location for exploring the beginnings of this great country and city as well as the natural beauty of the Battery Park walkways along the Bay and Hudson River. It's a full-service hotel, including a restaurant, with excellent facilities and rooms and a wonderful staff. This was our fourth stay, and we were pleased with the value and comfort offered by this hotel. It's close to the Smithsonian Museum of the American Indian NY branch in the old Customs House, Stone Street restaurants and bistros, subway stations, Wall Street, and the old Federal Hall.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: A wonderful experience, helpful, happy hotel staff, from the time the door opened to when I left. The room was clean and quiet. This hotel is close to the 9-11 memorial, Wall Street and within walking distance of Canal Street, where you can find just about anything you could want! I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed for an extended period over Christmas. From before we even arrived the staff, specifically Nardine, went above and beyond to assure our stay was comfortable! The location was actually excellent with many subway access points extremely close! Historic Stone Street is worth exploring. And for those that don't want to spend an arm and a leg for dinner, the staff recommended several places close by. (China Chalet was one of our favorites!) I can't say enough about the valet staff!! Every one was extremely friendly and helpful! But above all, Tony and my personal favorite, Barry truly made each encounter helpful and enjoyable!  Room was spacious enough for New York. Asked for a fridge and one was in our room almost instantly. Housekeeping staff were so good and conscientious, you could tell they took pride in their job. I would definitely stay again!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My boyfriend and I were looking forward to having a great few days in NYC. We did have an awesome trip, but our hotel stay was less than fabulous. The hotel rooms are smallish, though clean and modern. Elevators are very slow. On our first night, we attempted to turn on the heat, however, the room heating/cooling system began to immediately loudly rumble and would do so each time we tried to warm the room. So our first night was cool. After mentioning this to the front desk, they assured us that a service person would investigate and that there were no other rooms to be transferred to as the hotel was booked solid. When we returned much later that night, there was no hot water to be had and were transferred to another room(unusual as they stated that same morning that they were full? Hmmm)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have stayed at mid Manhattan 4**** hotels - Marriott, which had large/ normal room sizes. These were regular rooms, devided into 2 rooms. Barely had any walking sopace between the bed and the desk Rooms were noisy, and had to wait 10 minutes before the runnng water was hot prior to 10:00 PM After midnight no hot water at all , just warm. Not aceptable in the winter time. Metal noises opuside the window on 44th floor... due the pipes expending. The water tank was located on the roof. top. Stayed 8 days at the hotel over Christmas 2013. The room could be recommended fro 1 slim person , student, not a professional, business person. 2 rooms should be combined as one. Even low season pricing found via Hot Wire was $170 per night.. Exected much diferent standard! I was disappointed. EC

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I love this hotel, location and amenities. This is the top choice for my mother and I when she comes into town as it is right near where I work. Warm cookie at check in- how can you say no. The only problems we had this time around were with the room and with the free breakfast. I found stains on the pillow cases and on the duvet when we first got there. I pointed them out and when we kept coming up after our room was cleaned - stains were still on duvet and the pillows were just moved so I wouldn't see the stains. That worried me as I wondered what else was not properly cleaned. The breakfast in the mornings was under staffed. If it is going to be "wait for your seating" this place needed more staff as their staff were also taking room service orders up and there were times when there was no help in the dining room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here one year ago, after the Superstorm, and could hear generator trucks roaring outside the hotel day and night. This year the trucks are gone, but there was plenty of interior noise through the connecting door to our room, plus through the hallway door.Shower has a good rate of flow, but it floods the bathroom. Elevators can be slow. I think we'll look elsewhere for a future stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed @ Double Tree for a week on business. The appearance and staff were great. As well as location. But, be prepared to hear lots of noise from other guests and outside. The windows are old and cheap and wind blows through them making it difficult to warm the room. The room was the smallest room I have ever stayed in. I knew it would be smaller than normal since it's New York but this was ridiculously small. The other guests were extremely loud and I heard every move they made. The hallway on the floor was very narrow causing even more noise. My issues are with the hotel itself and not the staff. The staff were really nice and assisted with directions and other questions we had about getting around New York. If you are going to stay here during a business trip this may not be the best place due to the noise. I may have been able to tolerate it better if it was more of a personal/leisure trip and didn't have to be up at 5:30 every morning. I also found it odd that there was not a small refrigerator in the room for drinks. Overall, it wasn't a pleasant stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: OK, this seems trivial but I'm going to start by saying I'm not a cookie eater, but this hotel brags about giving guests a "warm cookie" upon check in. Neither Kadeem or Laciana gave us a cookie when we checked in. I asked when I saw other check-ins with them, and ended up going to pick them up after checking in, just on prinicple. Now to the more annoying issues. Checked in 12/25, checked out 12/27. NO HOT WATER 12/26 or 12/27. This was after spending the day out in the city with temperatures in the 20s and 30s. Finally reached Kamesha, Supervisor on 12/27. She was kind enough to comp us one night to compensate for the inconvenience. Kamesha was professional and customer oriented. The aforementioned staff made no effort, however, did repeatedly state that since the room was booked through a "third-party, hotwire.com and not directly with the hotel", there wasn't anything they could do. The room was ridiculously small, bed was relatively comfortable but took up 90% of the room. Bathroom only had a walk in shower. Good luck figuring out which way to turn the knobs for hot water--especially when there isn't any. In the past few months, I've stayed at Le Parker Meridien, The Time Hotel in Times Square, and The Milennium Hilton, all 4 star hotels. They are all far superior to the Doubletree Hilton on Stone St in the financial district. I don't know how this could be rated 4 stars, it's NOT accurate. Don't stay here if you want anything more than a place to crash, it's barebones, at best!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here over Christmas for a couple of nights because they offered a great rate (I guess people don't want to stay in FiDi for the holidays). I had a longish wait to check in because (they said) the computer had crashed and needed to be rebooted. One of the receptionists was open and was telling everyone in line ahead of me that they were being located to another hotel in another neighborhood due to "plumbing problems". Eek. I got lucky somehow, and when it was my turn I was able to check into a room (which had no plumbing problems). The room itself was fine... for the most part the hotel is very comfortable. They gave me free wifi and it worked very well. The furniture and bed were comfy enough, the bedding seemed very plush. The shower was good but on the small side (maybe 24" wide, a little awkward). People complain about the elevators and there are definitely times when it is slow. But I've never had a really bad wait, probably because I don't use the hotel on business and am not using "rush hour" elevators.Overall for the price I paid I was quite pleased.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The hotel was too far away from my business activities for the weekend. The restaurant had good food. It was cooked to order, so don't be in a rush to eat. The staff were all friendly. A lot of cold air came through the window. It was okay for two nights.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This was my first stay at this hotel. It's in a good location, very close to several subway lines which was important. The hotel is quite narrow and the rooms aren't particularly big, but it is NYC so that wasn't a big deal. The elevators are quite slow, so know that going in. You can walk to a few nice restaurants around the corner and there's a Starbuck's at the corner. Unlike other reveiwers, I didn't have any problems with water pressure and I thought the bathrooms were modern.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is located at 8 Stone street which is not that hard to find. Google maps took us right to it. Stone street is only one block long so if you are driving in it is not a real problem pulling up to the curb because of the lack of traffic. There is an independent underground parking lot directly across from the front door of the hotel that charges the same rate as the hotel of $35 per day. It opens at 7:30 so if you have a really early departure you will want to use the hotel lot which is located a block or two away. I opted for the hotel valet at $50 per day which came in handy because we departed at 5:30 a.m. We called the front desk and our car was at the curb when we came down. The bell hops are very helpful and friendly. We had a room with two double beds as I stayed with my son. The room was small but came with a desk and closet. There is an iron and ironing board in the closet which is helpful. There is no mini fridge or micro wave but had in room coffee (two cups). The bathroom is also very small with one sink, toilet, and stand up shower. There is limited space to lay out your toiletries. The beds are the best part. Very comfortable which is important to me and they come with four pillows each. The room was clean and the maid service came in every day and did a great job. We could not figure out how to operate the TV so we called the front desk who sent up the engineer (Luis) straight away. He got it working in short order and told us that Time Warner was experiencing some problems in the area. We had no further problems. The restaurant is on the ground floor and we had the breakfast buffet one morning. It was the typical buffet with scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, potatoes, cereals, and fruits. The wait staff is not overly friendly. It is convenient to the subway, ground zero, and battery park. There are a lot of different types of restaurants in the neighborhood with a pub right next door. I like the area because it is a lot more quiet than Times Square. I would stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location for the Financial District. Hotel and room were a bit of a disappointment. Found the room in need of some serious cleaning. Didn’t think that the bed was comfortable. The bathroom needed to be modernized and water pressure addressed. Rooms weren’t well insulated from outside sounds, especially compared to other NYC hotels. Staff was friendly and professional. Has possibilities but needs some upgrades.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel is clean and comfortable. One-half block from the R train (Whitehall stop - exit the rear of the train). Other subway trains close by. Staff helpful and friendly. My main gripe is that the hotel has 44 floors but only 3 elevators; wait times can become long. Bathrooms are a bit compact, but this is New York, where space is at a premium. Mostly quiet at night, and a short walk to battery park. Overall, a decent hotel if you get a good price on a room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Nice hotel. Staff are very polite and helpful. Also supports access for people in wheelchairs very easily. Hotel rooms are wheelchair friendly. Nice pub next doors with friendly staff and good pub food. Two blocks from Staten Island Ferry.
user_name:
Arnold V
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights and will stay again. Clean modern and very relaxing.Close to numerous restaurants and bars.For a hoot go to the Whitehorse tavern for cheap drinks and Fun then to Delmonicos for old style elegance and superior food ! Staff are nice, and knowageable at hotel. Just a enjoyable time for my birthday ! Marc & DeeS

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very Comfortable, well located in the heart of the World Financial District. the check in was not so smooth as I reached earlier and they do not accommodated me. Location is very nice lots of action of all sorts right in the area..food, shopping, sights. Welcome cookies as very nice. Lobby is small and not comfortable.Rooms are small but clean. Staff are very friendly.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Very comfortable, well located hotel in the heart of the financial district. The staff was very friendly, check in was a breeze and the warm welcome cookies were a nice touch. The clean room, though small, was nicely laid out with an extremely comfortable bed and linens. Perfect place to rest after a day of sightseeing. The hotel is near a subway, the WTC memorial, the Bull, a Starbucks, with a drugstore on the corner and an Irish pub right next door. Most likely on my next trip to NYC I will be staying there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location. Lots of action of all sorts right in the area..food, shopping, sights.Rooms clean and though not big (as with many NYC hotels) are laid out well and comfortable.Staff is great..helpful an friendly.Not a big lobby or bar, but because of all there is right outside, really do not need it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Everything as expected. Expensive in NYC in Dec, but staff was excellent. Door and front desk staff super. Very friendly staff on every encounter. Problem with TV, they had fixed within 8 minutes of phone call. Didn't dine here. Sleep quality good but always a bit noisy in NYC
user_name:
Nancy N
East Hampton, CT, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed two nights in December on a weekend. The bellhops were helpful, though were incredibly busy during Sunday morning check-out. The room was comfortable and clean, with nice linens, toiletries and furniture; though small, it was well-designed; and the heating and cooling system was easy to use. The hotel is located very close to a subway station as well as Wall St and the WTC Memorial. Additionally, there are a number of shops and restaurants just steps from the door. I'd be happy to stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My friend and I chose this hotel because of the location. The staff was friendly but there were a few problems with the room that were unacceptable. The hot water in the shower didn't work and it took a few people to solve the problem. Additionally the TV in the room didn't work when we checked in and we had to call someone to fix it. The rooms were noisy and we could hear people outside the room. Overall, the hotel was okay, but I would not stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Although the rooms are small (not unlike most other hotels in NYC); they are very comfortable and well equipped. I did have an issue with the Front Desk neglecting to make the wake-up call. Fortunately, the room had two electronic options for wake-up call and I used both as a backup. It is interesting, I would not have requested a wake-up call from the Front Desk had they not asked.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I found no security at all, it seems anyone could access any floor. I also found the room to be ery small room, poorly layed out and the bathroom impractical. One lift out for most of my stay and there was a sign that said you should allow 15-20 minutes for the lift. Also no hot water one day. I will not be returning.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is very comfy and clean. The bell hops were the BEST! Always friendly and extremely helpful. I didn't give 5 stars just because the elevator was annoying and I had an issue receiving my room service. It supposedly never arrived due to the elevator being slow. But those issues were minor and I would definitely stay there again because the bell hops were so great. There are lots of great places to eat (and drink) nearby. Subway is within a reasonable distance too. So just don't order room service and try taking the stairs and you will give it 5 stars.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel has terrific staff people! Friendly and courteous!!! I has a very tasty dinner in the hotel restaurant. Large comfortable bed! Perfect location right next to the 4 and R subways. Excellent Italian restaurant right across the street. All in all, a most pleasant stay, and at a great price.
user_name:
Benjamin S. A
Lynn. MA, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here for a quick trip to NYC. We got there before noon and they had an available room which was great so we could put our luggage upstairs and go back out right away. It was close to the subway and the hotel staff was very helpful with maps and directions. It was also only a few blocks from Battery Park. We expected the room to be small, but the room layout was well thought out and well designed to maximize the space. It was also very clean and comfortable. The front door guy always greeted us with a smile and was eager to help at all times, even when busy. Everything had a clean modern feel but it was not cold. We really appreciated the design of the bathroom door! It was a wall-mounted sliding door so it didn't interfere with the bathroom space.
user_name:
Jill B
Fairfax, Virginia, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Upon checking in we were greeted by Barry who took our car and bags. He was great! Helpful and friendly. The concierge and check in staff were also wonderful. Rooms were a good size and clean. The restaurant was awful and the low point of the hotel. would never go there again. The staff was surly and it took 10 minutes to get a cup of coffee at breakfast-and then we got it ourselves.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for the week of thanksgiving, and very much enjoyed the hotel. The rooms were compact, but standard for NYC, were clean and comfortable, and the staff were very friendly and always willing to help. The hotel is close to a number of subway stations, which made for easy transportation around the city. There is free wifi available in the lobby which we took advantage of to make bookings at local attractions such as the world trade centre memorial. My only gripe with the hotel is that the three elevators often means you have to wait around a long time just to get to your room or leave the hotel in the morning. It's a minor inconvenience, though there were a couple of days where one of the elevators was out of service, which resulted in it taking up to 20 minutes to leave the hotel at peak times! Overall, a very pleasant and friendly hotel in the financial district. You won't be in the hustle and bustle of midtown manhattan, but you're only ever a short metro ride away from that.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The elevator was broken and never notified when booking an expensive room. No hot water and the hotel didn't seem to care - never compensated us when promised that day. Not worth the money when there are so many hotels to choose from. I'm a Hilton honors member and feel duped.
user_name:
ambcz
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed in in this hotel for a week and it was nice and the staff was fantastic. The hotel can be proud for those guys. Kadeem was always fun to talk to and he always had a smile and time for you. The first night we needed assistance with a problem and jamillah kindly helped us Beyonde her regular duties!!!!!But the best part of the hotel ist Luis!!!! The doorman. He gave really nice tips and also helpful ones! Thank you for that!Negative about the hotel:There is a elevator problem! So if u don't mind the view, ask for a low floor, so that you can take the stairs.The breakfast room ist to small. When the hotel is full, be prepared for long waiting lines.....Still, I would not hesitate to come back to this hotel

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel several times. As usual it was a great experience. Please thank Gerald for being so helpful during check-in. His professional approach to customer service was excellent. I look forward to my next visit and I will again stay at this hotel.
user_name:
George S
New York/Financial Dist., United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: stayed here for 3 days in a double room with view on 44th floor. Room was a little small and annoying that the reception is on 2nd floor however a good hotel. Avoid the 'Nebraska steakhouse' over the road, Steak is average, waiters are annoying who generously tip themselves 20% and it's simply overpriced...

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: We, a middle aged couple stopped here from the UK for thanksgiving. We had little to do with the staff apart from being welcomed in and out.the room was spacious enough, with a view of the bins, but it is central NY.We were next to the on floor ice machine which was very loud but bearable.Location is quiet on the weekend, but only a short subway ride from the centre.One lift (elevator) was broken so made waiting longer, but not too bad.The only real problem came when getting transport to the airport. The busboy said that he would organise one of 'their' cars to take us for 65 USD flat fee. Which would be similar to the fee for a yellow cab with toll charges. When we got to the airport we handed the driver 70 USD, he said it was 115 as it was an SUV!!!!!We refused and the driver reacted angrily but ended up driving off without any money, as airport security arrived. This was not a pleasant experience, in a foreign country, trying to get home, and suspect that others have paid this 'extra'Please do not accept their OFFER and take the yellow cab.To the Hilton hotel, please stop your staff doing this.
user_name:
Bruce A
Leeds, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: My sister and I spent Thanksgiving week at the Double Tree by Hilton Financial District NY and had a pretty good experience overall; however there were some negatives. Breakfast is expensive and one morning they left out the fruit bowl that came with the meal. The next day the breakfast was delivered very late and very cold. It took so long for it to be replaced that we were no longer hungry but we were charged the full price anyway. One night we called for wine glasses and a wine bottle opener and had to call twice before being told they could not send someone and we would have to go to the restaurant ourselves to get it. The restaurant is open to the public on the ground floor and I had to leave my room and go downstairs in my sweats and flip flops to get 2 glasses and the bottle opened. There are also no shower caps in the bathrooms and i was told by the front desk that i should go to the Duane Reade on the corner to purchase, which i found odd. We also "upgraded" from a room with a King sized bed to a room with double beds - the first room was definitely roomier and more comfortable. The room with the double beds felt cramped, when the shower was turned on the whole bathroom got soaking wet (we eventually called maintenance who had to fix it), and the shower stall was so small you could barely move inside. But on the positive side, the hotel's location is absolutely perfect! The subway is right at the corner and there are several options for eating and light shopping nearby. The rooms were clean and comfortable for the most part. The shining star on our Double Tree stay was Barry the Bellboy who was exceptionally helpful and friendly. Barry greeted us and most guests like long lost friends who were staying at his home and made sure to tell us that we could ask him for advice on places to eat or travel options etc. He was also extremely helpful in getting us an affordable cab service to take us to our family's home in Queens when we checked out. I would definitely consider staying at this location again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I might be used to a firm mattress, however, what is the make up of the mattress that is the component for the Doubletree bed? I am used to a box spring mattress and this mattress felt like, when ever someone moved in the bed, the whole mattress shook violently. Perhaps I should reserve a double bed room next time, but I am wondering why so many people have noted that the bed was comfortable?

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I was quite dissatisfied with the strong cigarette smoke smell in our room and throughout the lobby, seeing as this hotel was supposedly a "smoke-free environment". We could hear everything guests in other rooms were saying, and it was difficult to sleep at night because of this. The elevators were not working either, which made getting to our room on the 27 floor quite difficult both in the morning and evening. Overall, I am dissatisfied with my stay. I will likely look for other places in Financial District to stay in the near future.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: From the minute I arrived to the minute I left I had a wonderful experience. The only reason I could not give an excellent was due to elevators; The day I was checking out, one of the elevators was not working. It was taking up to 30 minutes for some to get to the floor they were wanting. Fortunately, my wait wasn't as long as some, but there was one brief moment that I thought I might not get out in time to get to the airport to catch my flight( this was not the case and I made it in plenty of time!) The staff was friendly and very helpful. And I mean EVERYONE! The bed was comfortable, the room immaculate. I will stay here again. ( the warm cookie when I arrived was an added plus! ) For NYC the price was affordable.
user_name:
Linda T
New York, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Access to Brooklyn Heights is easy on the Metro (1 stop). Easy access to Penn Station & Grand Central as well. Three Metro lines are nearby. The breakfast is adequate but nothing special. The staff is helpful. The elevator is painfully slow. We walked up and down mostly.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I have stayed here several times and have not had any issues. You can get the rate with breakfast but there are many local and chain eatery's close by. Took the super shuttle from airport both ways and found it very reasonable. The hotel is close to Wall Street and World Trade Center. Taxi's are easy to get and subway is very close.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at this hotel after winning it on Priceline for what I thought was an extremely reasonable price for a last minute weekend in July. I think there might be better options if a traveler took the time and energy to look for a better deal, but I didn't really have any complaints about my experience. I would not make the effort to stay there again, but if I did Priceline and it popped up, I wouldn't complain.Without further adieu...Positives:- The staff was lovely. The lobby is actually on the second floor, and while I had very limited interactions with them (during check-in and checkout, mostly), they were lovely - I even got a couple of Doubletree cookies for my bus ride home upon checkout. The staff at the front door was always friendly and helpful if I had any questions about the area.- The room was a reasonable size, especially for New York - king size bed, a nice chair, reasonably sized desk, etc. I thought it was clean, comfortable and did not show significant wear and tear. - I will always point this out as a positive (even though I expect it), because the opposite frustrates me, but the flat-screen TV actually had full-HD service (and movie channels to boot). While I didn't spend much time in the room, it's nice to be able to catch a game and not feel like it was 1993-quality on a lovely TV. The hotel Wi-Fi was actually reasonable as well, and I was able to use the full internet rather than just basic functions like email, etc., without any trouble.Negatives:- Though the room itself was nice, the bathroom was very small. It only had a stand-up shower, and the door to the bathroom and the door to the shower could not be opened at the same time, so keep that in mind if you're more than just a solo traveler and people may need to use the bathroom.- Unless you are traveling specifically for the Financial District area, the location is going to be a negative for many. Many restaurants and stores close early (or even closed entirely on weekends), rather than the "Never Sleeps" approach of the rest of the city. For example, there is a great pizza place across from the hotel - that was closed on the weekend during my trip. There is a decent amount of subway access, but you are in neither Midtown nor Brooklyn, and on weekends, they were repairing lines so certain stations were closed or had limited service. I never felt unsafe, but it feels far more deserted than many parts of New York once all of the tourist attractions have closed, so be wary of that as well.- The elevators in the hotel were relatively slow and cramped, which can be a problem if you have a lot of luggage or are trying to get somewhere in a hurry.As I said, this hotel wasn't designed to meet my needs - leisure traveler on the weekend with activities spread out all over both Manhattan and Brooklyn, but I went into it with the correct expectations and wasn't disappointed. For a business traveler, it's a pretty easy recommendation due simply to the service. For leisure, be cognizant of the location issues and you should be fine.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: great check in, good room but room service was not good even though food was good. Orders were not complete and hotel did not have food that was published on the menu. Did not order late, tried to order pork chops around 6pm and they did not have it available. Bread pudding was never available but on room service menu?
user_name:
John G
Sherrills Ford, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Well we ended up at this hotel randomly assigned by Priceline, after horrifying experience at another, so it seemed like a palace after the other hotel... But having said this, the hotel is most certainly not four star. Rooms are cramped and tiny, even by NYC standards, but are clean and bedding is quite comfortable. Very basic however, with no special amenities.Staff are extremely helpful and friendly, esp. the front door bellmen. Perhaps one of the stars in this rating is for the kind staff. Location is one I always regret, too far from everything. Hard to get cabs, not my favorite subway connection, not an enjoyable area to take a walk in, especially after hours.But the worst part of it all was the elevator fiasco. Even up to 15 min waits, with one or other of the elevators breaking down on any given day, and every elevator jammed full even after these crazy waits... Very frustrating. Elevator situation truly abysmal.I would not stay here again by choice for a variety of reasons, but if I did not have a choice, it would do. Expect 2.5 to 3 star and you won't be as disappointed.
user_name:
Matars_Z
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel itself is in a great location, and the view from my room was breathtaking. But there were a few minor issues that will give me pause the next time I visit the area.Positives: Great views, clean rooms, good decor.As for the issues I experienced, I somehow was charged twice for internet service, the toiletries - lotion and shampoo specifically - were already opened and apparently used by the previous guest, and the toilet was not attached to the floor very well. Also and when I called today to request copy of my final bill for my company's expense report, I was transferred to the billing department who failed to answer and neglected to respond to my voicemail after 3 hours; I'm still waiting for a callback. Finally, I had breakfast in the ground-level restaurant and was disappointed when I had to ask twice to have coffee refilled and then had to flag down the manager to get the check.Again, these are all minor complaints. Hopefully it's just a series of flukes, but nearly all were preventable. I'll be travelling to this area more frequently now for work and I have to admit that I'll think twice about staying here. This isn't what I come to expect from Doubletree.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: From Gerald at the front desk who was so thoughtful at checkin, Luis, the maintenance man who came to fix our tv and then stood with my wife while I found a better parking spot on the street to the night time house man, who brought us our refrigerator but whose name escapes me. All were so helpful, thoughtful and professional. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.The one knock against the hotel is the breakfast buffet for gold/diamond Hilton members. Those employees just weren't up to the task of having food in the buffet. And really almost gave an attitude when asked for coffee, water, brown sugar, potatoes, eggs to be put out.I thought the elevators were just fine, btw.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here last night with my sister and her husband. It was dirty and breaking down. I do a lot of hotel booking for my job and I always expect a four star hotel to be clean and functioning...at the least. When we tried to check in the whole system was down. We waited for a long time eventually leaving so we wouldn't miss our ferry. When we got back that night the front desk representative seemed rude and extremely confused. We tried to purchase some water before heading up but now THAT system was down! When we got to our room the brochures and menu were covered in old food. DISGUSTING! Then the toilet wouldn't flush unless you pressed the button multiple times. The shower tiles were dirty with soap scum. While you were taking a shower the temperature would change, drastically, if the room beside us was flushing the toilet. (That shouldn't happen at a four star hotel!) We were pretty tired so we decided to just get in bed and ignore everything so far. Come to find out the tv is broken and we had to call up a tech! THEN when we pulled the covers over we found out both beds has NASTY stains all over the comforter. The stains looked like dried blood! Gross. I might have well stayed at a motel 6!When I told the front desk manager that morning he did nothing. Just jotted some notes and said they'd bring it up with the housekeeping manager. Very disappointed. That doesn't make my stay any less unpleasant.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The customer service at this hotel was excellent, however it was always a drag to have to wait up to 5 mins at times just to get an elevator. The location of the hotel was good for my one day trip into NYC, while I enjoyed being placed on one of the high honors floors with an excellent view of Freedom Tower, I begin to regret the honor of being a Hilton Diamond when I had to wait almost 5 min for the elevator on more than one occasion. And while I have stayed in my fair share of NYC "boutiquish" hotels, the rooms in this hotel made me a little claustrophobic.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Thats the tag line on the card in the room. 10 out of a 100 maybe on this showingI have never previously been moved to write a review whilst still staying at a hotel, but making an exception in this case. At the hotel for 4 nights for work, location is fine for where I need to be, but there are other options availableNY hotel rooms are small, this is no exception. However I would expect it to deliver the basics like a proper shower, hot running water and some form of temperature contol in the roomThe bathroom does not have a bath/shower, its a wet room / access set-up: I did not ask for it, maybe all the rooms are equipped that way, but odd.No hot water. there was a problem on Monday night when I arrived. problem again Thursday morning - called around 5am to ask why no hot water and told the 'boiler was out', fixed in 30 to 45 minutes. Not ideal, but opportunity to go for a run while issue is fixed. got back and still no hot water..after another 30 minutes waiting had to give up and have a freezing cold shower, shave and off to work. back after 12 hours and things don't appear to have been fixed. To make matters worse, no communication from management at least recognising the issue - a voice message or note under the door .. - nothing! They are either unaware or don't care, either way a poor show.Note on room service: 18% service charge included in bill, however if you dont add a gratuity to the bill, then expect a scowl and slam on the way out. also not all the menu is availabe, especially the sweet stuff.oh and the air conditioning system seems to have two modes only - off and cold or on and noisy and room too hot

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: we stayed here for the NYC marathon. the location was perfect. close to the staten island ferry for the start. also close to many of the attractions we wanted to see and close to the subway for the uptown attractions. They really raised the price of the hotel for the race weekend. but was one of the more reasonablly priced that weekend. I was really happy with our stay. Clean rooms, friendly and professional staff, and a great fitness center. we would stay here again. I just wish that every hotel in manhattan didn't double their prices for marathon weekend.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stay here because it's close to clients. Rooms are small, but that's true generally in NYC. Only major gripe is NOT ENOUGH ELEVATORS! But, that's not going to change. That's the way they built it. Lot of floors, small number of rooms per floor.
user_name:
Roger H G
new york city, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was good, the room was comfortable and if you leaned against the glass window on the 11th floor you could just see the water. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean. However, the hotel is in the financial district (I knew this when I booked) which means it is quite a walk if you want to go anywhere. Naturally there are taxis and the subway but the location did mean a lot more extra walking. If you are in the city for sightseeing then I would recommend staying in a more central location.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: If you wish to be in Battery Park, near Wall Street, Ferry's etc., this is a great location. Hotel is older but has charm. Cookies are great as usual. If there is not a Hilton nearby that meets your needs this is OK. My wife and I were there for the NYC marathon and it met our needs.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel lobby and rooms are nicely decorated and clean. Rooms are small as is typical in NYC. Staff is friendly. Subway stations very close. Quieter in the evenings but we found a great street festival the night we were there. Much less expensive than mid town. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for NYC Marathon weekend and had easy access to the ferry in the morning. ALL of the staff were extremely helpful during our entire stay, and we even got a third cookie for a friend who brought us to the hotel. It's close to the subway, making transportation a breeze.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for 2 nights. On my second night I noticed the TV did not work. Unrelated, the coffee maker had to be moved as some of the outlets on the wall did not work. The hotel is in a great location, but I was a little disappointed with the basic amenities. I may look elsewhere for future trips.
